reviews.review: Argentine Tango classes with Alejandro. We spent two hours learning some Argentine Tango with Alejandro. What a wonderful experience! We’re long time ballroom dancers and more recently west coast swing dancers who’ve previously been introduced to Argentine tango. It’s difficult to transition from the ballroom world of patterns to the intimate conversation between partners where communication is everything. We began with posture and feet position, learned about weight changes and how to walk. Sounds simple, but it’s not (for us anyway). Alejandro masterfully got us to understand what that means. The elements of lead and follow make a lot of sense when you think about them. The leader must “speak” to the follower with movement in a clear and timely manner. And the follower must “listen” to the leader’s movement, and feel the direction and speed. Each needs to be aware of his axis and also be in time with the music. As Argentine Tango has no set patterns and is “just walking” to music, the joy of the dance is the improvisation, which takes focus. Alejandro would dance as follower with me and as leader with my wife to illustrate what makes a lead clear and a follow intuitive. It’s fun when it starts to work for you! Alejandro then took us a bit further introducing us to slightly more advanced moves, again illustrating the concepts very clearly.Overall we enjoyed Alejandro’s teaching style and personality very much. And his hourly charge is quite reasonable. We would gladly take more classes with him if we had more time in Buenos Aires.

Best bit of my visit!. I did 2 lessons with Alejandro whilst in BA on business- clearly the best part of my trip! He is a super teacher, also very thoughtful and encouraging for the slightly nervous student- he put me at ease and I can't wait to do more when I get back home. The studio is central and easy to find- I travelled by subway alone and felt very safe. Thank you so much!

Tango Terrific. My fiance and I wanted to have a tango lesson before we left Buenos Aires and Alejandro cane highly recommended. Starting with the history of tango he took us through the basics and the class was paced well for our level.We had never danced before but he made us feel comfortable and made sure we understood each section before moving forward.We did a 2 hour lesson and this was a great start. I wouldn't start with anything less. Alejandro was prfoessional and clearly passionate which helped make our experience memorable.

Dancing at milongas after a month of lessons - and not badly either!. The decision to take lessons from Alejandro was influenced heavily by the reviews from everyone on tripadvisor. And BOY am I glad that we did, because my partner and I can't help but feel that we've completely been lucky finding Alejandro as our teacher, as dancers beginning tango from the very beginning. As everyone has said so far, Alejandro really really knows his stuff. The best thing about him is that he helps us understand WHY we have to do a certain thing at a certain time, and this will be applicable in every step/move that we will ever do in this dance, and in fact, any dance. The fundamentals have just opened up our eyes like no other teacher has ever done before, and we are able to realise our own steps, and experiment with moves using the fundamental formulas that Alejandro has taught us. Ultimately, if you want to be dancing well - socially - you can't have a teacher that teaches you a combo of moves because your progress will stop as soon as you stop taking classes with that teacher. Alejandro has equipped us to dance well and truly beyond our classes with him, but we love taking classes with him because he has such amazing energy to him that is contagious and is bottomless with knowledge AND passionate about the dance and its history. If you want to get a bang for your buck, and for your time (most importantly), Alejandro will definitely be your best bet. He may not appear to be the teacher of flashiest of moves, but if you take classes with him, you will soon understand that embellishments that you see in tango are the easiest to learn - what he will teach you will be the bread and butter that you will need to execute the prettiest and the flashiest of embellishments WELL.Like the title of my review, my partner and I, starting off from taking simple, walking steps for numerous hours to begin with, to now (a month later), we are dancing at milongas with other people, and being asked again by argentinos who appreciate our part in the dance. It's been truly a pleasant and fun experience, and we will definitely miss him and his classes when we return home at the end of next month. We have said that tango immersions will be a regular thing in our life ahead, and when we return to this amazing city, we will ask Alejandro to be our teacher time and time again.We are so thankful for your approach and sincerity in sharing your love for tango with us. We have come to love it so much, and your part in that has been more than you'll know. Thanks for being such an amazing teacher and a fond memory of our stay in Buenos Aires!! :)

Top experience. We had 4 hours of private teaching by Alejandro and are super excited! He is a great guy and an excellent teacher. We have been dancing tango for a couple of years in Holland and were looking to improve our technique and musicality. He started by looking at our dancing and then danced with both of us seperately. He observed and immediately was able to verbalize some pointers and what he would like to do in our lesson, based on what we wanted to learn. What we really liked was that he was able to explain in words what we should do or feel, and he made sure we had the tools to make it happen before switching to a new part. We learned A LOT and have a better understanding of the fundamentals of tango. We are super excited to put our lessons to practice! If you would like to learn tango or improve your skills, this is your guy! Thank you Alejandro :)

Excellent Tango lesson!. My 20 year old daughter and I took our first Tango lesson with Alejandro while visiting BA. Alejandro made us feel extremely comfortable and gave us precise instructions to help us understand and feel the music. I recommend at least 1 1/2 hrs to have a meaningful lesson. Alejandro is a wonderful teacher!

Can't stop taking lessons from Alejandro. You might ask yourself why can't I stop taking lessons from Alejandro. It's very simple, Alejandro is a brilliant tango teacher. I have discovered that I can get to the next level almost without realizing it. By nature, I like to be in control of a situation. Tango requires letting the leader take over, while the follower must actively participate. When we hear "it takes two to tango" we know it refers to two people equally sharing the responsibility. The leader leads, but the follower must be thoroughly engaged. Your mind and your emotions must be in perfect sink. It's so much more than technique and steps. Many teachers focus on technique without helping their students understand the true meaning of tango. That's what separates Alejandro from most tango instructors.

The very best. I've studied with Alejandro in January of this year, and when I knew I was coming back to Buenos Aires the first thing I did was set up more lessons with him. He's a phenomenal teacher, highly knowledgable about all of tango, but beyond that he's patient and knows how to give good critique in the most encouraging way. What I love about his teaching method is he doesn't believe in teaching you combinations of steps, but rather in giving you the building blocks you will need when it comes to improvising on the dance floor. It was an absolute pleasure working with Alejandro, and I know the next time I'm back in Buenos Aires I will be seeing him again.

Do not miss out!. Unfortunately I only had enough time for two private lessons with Alejandro, but, those two lessons gave me so much information about the functionalities of the movement, the history, the music and the confidence to dance in the Milonga's each night. I am a professional dancer from London and understand when a teacher really knows their stuff, Alejandro goes to great lengths to make you feel comfortable but pushes you so that you come away from each lesson with a new discovery. You will learn how to be precise, understand the musicality and explore yourself through Tango. Whilst doing all of this you will definitely laugh and although his teaching will certainly improve you as a Tango dancer, he will remind you along the way to ENJOY IT! See you soon Alejandro! Letitia

Thank you Alejando!!!!. Thank you Alejandro! I could write so much here but I know I rarely read a long review, so simply said he is the whole package. He can teach you how to follow and lead, he will teach you about the music and how it affects how you move and dance tango and he can teach you the body mechanics to help you with technique, balance, axis and learning those fancy steps. I am a physical therapist and a Pilates instructor, so it was music to my ears when he explained things in terminology that I use when teaching patients how to move again after an injury and say it in a way that anyone could understand. Did I mention a centrally located studio that has air-conditioning and he speaks excellent English?For some details if you are still with me. I took lessons last February and March and I am scheduled to do so again this February and March. I came to him as a so so beginner with group lessons, private lessons and several tango festivals under my belt. It is hard to sum up what I learned in the lessons I had with him, lets just say it was a lot. At the first lesson he asked me what I wanted to get from the lessons. I said my main goal was to become a better follower and that I did for sure! But I came away with so much more. The thing that surprise me the most was how much I learned about the music. I learn to identify the different orchestras, and how and why understanding and feeling the music from the inside as well as the outside not only makes you a better follower it makes you a better dancer. I also came away with the ability to connect better with my partner and with the music, thus I became a much better follower. Now when I dance I feel like I am playing with the music and it is oh so much fun!

Thank you, Alejandro!. I am very happy that me and my boyfriend met this wonderful guy! I have four arms made of cheese, really I can't dance at all! But Alejandro shows me that the most important thing in the dance is the connection between the dancers! Actually the connection between two souls makes the dance! Thank you, Alejandro! Now I want to love and dance for the love! Kisses from Bulgaria!Magdalena

Not to be missed when visiting Buenos Aires. Alejandro Puerta is not to be missed when visiting Buenos Aires, a day is just not long enough for this Journey with Alejandro. Our group of 15 started our trip in Argentina with our first night under the tutelage of Alejandro Puerta. Alejandro lesson not only provided us the philosophical connection to tango, but the embodiment one must have for the grace to dance. Our tour of Tango started with the rich history of Argentina and the role Tango played, to moving and gliding, feeling the beat and finally feeling the power of connection with your partner. We continued on this adventure with a true Milonga. The ladies in our group witnessed firsthand the art of the cabaceo (Gentlemen -you will need a lesson from Alejandro for this one). The welcoming joy felt by all; from our group of novices to the graceful practiced Argentinians, as we witnessed the art of tango in Argentina, truly amazing.The learning’s and soulful grace in which Alejandro teaches is for all ages and should be embraced by all.

Personal Touch. Wow, Alejandro really knows his stuff. From the genesis of tango to the present, his historical knowledge was engaging and helped us connect personally and physically to the sport. The time with Alejandro was our best whilst in Buenos Aires. Thank you!

The deepest approach to learning tango. I have had the pleasure to study with Alejandro for two months at the beginning of the year and as we can see from this review, like everyone that studies with him I absolutely loved it!I am a professional dancer but I had never danced tango before (only in my dreams) and Alejandro was a great discovery for my training.I found a very deep approach, knowledgeable about the body and its mechanics. The aesthetics of the movement were just a result of the functionality. I extremely recommend taking classes with him if you are interested in the real understanding of tango as movement language.Alejandro's classes will teach you not only combinations of steps that you will forget but the way to listen or to lead in the most open and clear way. His teachings will stay with you.His style as a partner is fun and versatile I loved dancing with him!

A magical and philosophical experience!. Alejandro exceeded all our expectations. The two-hour lesson my two friends and I took with him was by far our most meaningful and memorable experience in Buenos Aires. Alejandro is not just a tango teacher. He is a wise, conscientious, perceptive, and warm person who has developed a life philosophy that he expresses through dance. In his impeccable English, Alejandro explained the origins and cultural importance of tango. He then introduced the core movements one by one, endowing each with a higher meaning and significance. We had no experience in tango or in any formal dance, and we left with a deep appreciation for the dynamic of the tango partnership. Alejandro also made dancing feel very natural and instinctive -- almost meditative.We only wish we had more days in BA to continue our learning. Do not miss this chance to learn something about Argentina, and about yourself!

He has it all!. Alejandro is among the very best teachers of tango I've encountered. First of all, he is positive, affirming and supportive. Unlike many teachers who, for whatever reason, are full of 'no-thats not how it's done', Alejandro conveys the materials in a positive and constructive way. Research shows that affirmative teaching works the best and it does for me as well. Secondly, Alejandro can address whatever you wish to learn and is skilled and articulate (in English in my case) in conveying the materials. I wanted to work on posture, smooth walking, sacadas and musicality. Over the course of 2 solid weeks of classes I was very happy with my improvements. Lastly, he both leads and follows and can analyze you from either perspective and give feedback. He's also friendly and a nice guy! If you are looking for a tango instructor who listens and can help you improve, then he is the guy.

The most brilliant, supportive and kind teacher!. I traveled to Argentina all the way from Greece exclusively for two weeks of Alejandro’s classes and did not regret it. In fact, based on my previous experience of Alejandro’s classes, I have now booked for an entire month and I am really looking forward to it! Alejandro is an exceptional teacher, kind and soft spoken, as well as passionately devoted to his art, a combination of qualities not easily found. What truly impressed me is that even though Alejandro focuses on building technique with great attention to detail, he never loses sight of the true enjoyment of dancing. His approach is wholistic and never misses a chance to teach you about the philosophy and history of the tango, both of which he knows really well. Also, I believe that one of the things that distinguishes a gifted teacher is his ability to discern the root causes of a student’s weaknesses and focus on them, not in a negative but a constructive and inspiring way. I loved how my dancing technique radically improved without feeling pressured or stressed in any way and I loved loved loved the traditional milonga we visited, where I felt so privileged to be able to dance at such ease for the first time in my life, among milongueros with the support and encouragement of Alejandro.

Tango, Maestro..Please!. When visiting Buenos Aires, there is something you absolutely should not miss, that is to take a tango lesson with Alejandro! He will greet you in his pristine, parquet-floored, air-conditioned studio on Calle Boulogne sur Mer and will expertly and patiently guide you through the fundamental rules of this elegant dance.His perfect English (as well as Japanese! and of course, Spanish) makes his teaching easy to understand for everyone.From his training as a biologist (in his former life, he says jokingly), he has kept a scientific approach to the basic movements of tango. Whether you are a (male or female) leader or a follower, he commands both the knowledge and experience of the dance and will teach you how to smoothly glide on the floor to the sound of an extraordinarily varied and colorful music.... Well, learning to dance the tango doesn't come in 3 easy lessons!...but with Alejandro's guidance and patience , you will learn the essential elements if you are a beginner. If you already have some experience, he will correct your postural errors and will take you to a higher level.I met him last November and took about 10 hours of lessons with him. I made such progress that as soon as I returned to Europe, my mind was set on going back to Argentina for more!I have now returned from my 2nd trip: an exhilarating experience where I took intensive lessons every day for over 2 weeks....I gradually gained confidence, forgetting my unnerving self-consciousness, understanding the complexity of the silent dialogue that is tango, until I was finally able (although for a minute!) to feel connected to him and let myself be guided by his expert abrazo....Pure bliss! .I was only sorry that I had to leave!My experience with Alejandro has been so beneficial that I have no other word to say than: Go try it!He is the most courteous, talented and enjoyable person and a "magnifique" ambassador of his life's passion: the tango!

Absolutely wonderful . I'm so happy that I had the wonderful opportunity to take an amazing lesson with this great Tango dancer Communication prior was easy and informative and I couldn't wait to see him. Getting to his studio was easy right of the metro a few blocks and I was there.He greeted me warmly as we headed up to his studio. The studio was lovely and perfect and he began with history of tango and the importance of certain moved. Patient and kind I found myself ( a non dancer) easily moving across his dance floor with ease.This was the highlight of my trip to buenos Aires and I was so excited to get to a dance floor and show what I've learned. When back in BsAs I will be looking forward to increasing my knowledge of the dance.si amazing

Best Tango private lessons. Alejandro is a great instructor in tango. We have dance tango for 2 years and the lessons with him gave us a lot about technic, contact and understanding of the music. If going to Buenos Aires do your self a favour and book lessons with Alejandro.

A Honey Badger in Porteño Clothing. If you're looking for anything less than mind-blowing private tango lessons—look elsewhere. This was my second time taking private lessons from Alejandro (5 days a week for 4 weeks), and I'm afraid that I'm now completely ruined by him (in the best possible way). He is simply the best: knowledgeable, friendly, enthusiastic, generous, and down-to earth. There's now tourist-tailered facade or elitist B.S. with Alejandro: just connection, connection, connection. I'm already saving money to work with him the next time I return to Buenos Aires. Please, Alejandro: never stop teaching.

An inspriation. Loved, loved, loved learning tango in BA with Alejandro. Will continue as best I can in the UK & wish I had had time to take more lessons with him in BA. You are a very special person Alejandro - thank you!

Learning with Alejandro made all the difference.. If you're curious about tango, want to learn, or want to improve your skills go see Alejandro now! He's a phenomenal teacher. I spent two weeks taking classes from him and went from absolutely 0 to dancing comfortably at milongas all around the city. Alejandro really focuses on teaching you about the tango music, tradition, and philosophy - as well as the steps and technique. His teaching style is all about improvisation and following the music, not about learning combos to repeat over and over. Alejandro teaches you not just the correct footing, but how tango is danced all the way from the tips of your toes to the top of your head. He's a great teacher. Always encouraging, always kind, and always positive. He'll never put you down, but always helps you through correcting mistakes, or understanding what you're doing wrong. I couldn't recommend his classes enough to anyone.

A dance class with passion. My fiancé and I had our first dance class together with Alejandro, it was one of our best experience together!By explaining to us the history and background of tango, Alejandro demonstrated to us how to dance with passion. We could feel his strong dedication to tango and we were amazed by how dancing tango is a reflection of you relationship.My fiancé and I absolutely enjoyed our 1.5 hours with Alejandro and we really wish we had more time to do more.The key lesson we took home - "connection"!

How Tango and Alejandro's teachings impacted me and my friends. Alejandro, has developed an unconventional way to teach Tango. I say, he teaches more from naturally finding the steps and moves with unmistakable precision and style by being present and connected to our dance partner and the music.I believe this is authentic Argentinean Tango!Tango never pretended to be a choreographed or stipulated set of moves or steps out of which a dancer would be considered good or bad. Tango was born and exists out of the most deepest desire of human beings to be connected. Having only taken 3 classes with Alejandro, we were all able to enjoy dancing at Milongas. Among my friends I have seen people who came speaking in very soft voices, now speaking louder and in more assertive terms. Others came unable to be less than 18 in closer to another human being, now being able to dance in a very close embrace, chest to chest.Others clearly rediscovering their beauty, their passion, being able to move and speak in ways that have been hidden and suppressed for some time, even years and decades. We all definitely got in touch with ourselves. Thank you Buenos Aires, thank you Tango, THANK YOU ALEJANDRO!

Tango with Alejandro was a highlight of my three months in Buenos Aires. Alejandro doesn't teach gimmicky ways of memorizing sequences. Instead, he taught me to stay connected to him and to the music, to feel the sensuality of the dance. I never had to memorize anything, because he is such a fantastic leader it was easy to follow him. If you want to learn tango in Buenos Aires, Alejandro is your man!Gracias, Alejandro!
what a teacher !. His spirit and his professional way of teaching helped me a lot to discover the real life of a tango danser!

The 1 tango lesson than turned out to be one of my best travel experiences. What better place to learn tango than in Buenos Aires I thought when my trip was booked. I found Alejandro on trip advisor and noticed all the good reviews he had. I surely was not disappointed! It was a really really good lesson and experience! I can't believe how important he made me feel even though he knew I might only have that- or maybe one more lesson. I wish I could have more lessons,Very professional and good at his job!

An amazing teacher and person!. On a trip to BA three years ago, I decided to take a tango lesson through a tourism agency. That lesson with Alejandro was so amazing that I ended up taking lessons with him almost every single day for the rest of my three weeks in Buenos Aires. When I returned to BA this Christmas, the first thing I did was schedule several lessons with Ale again. Alejandro is fabulous teacher; he doesn't require you to memorize steps or patterns but rather teaches you how to be aware of your body and that of your partner so that you can actually dance in any context (rather than just in a lesson in which you've learned some routine). It doesn't matter how bad of a dancer you think you are, Alejandro can teach you. He is patient, kind, warm, and sensitive to his students, and not only do I consider him my great teacher but I consider him my great friend. A tango lesson with Alejandro will be the best thing you do during your time in BA, I promise.

Technique with Alejandro. Alejandro welcomed me into his sun-filled studio with a generous smile and an obvious joy for sharing his craft. After a year of learning tango in the U.S., my intention in taking these privates lessons was to re-visit some basics and to improve my technique. He really listened to what I was hoping to accomplish, and I loved my first hour-lesson so much, I immediately booked two more. I recommended him to three of my friends (all at various levels of dancing), and each of them came back gushing about his positivity, lovely partnering and all around greatness.p.s. I emailed Alejandro at my hometown airport on the way to Argentina, and by the time I had landed, we had already scheduled our first lesson. He is extremely prompt in his emails, which is always a plus when traveling internationally, when wifi is never guaranteed!

Tango Lessons with Alejandro. It was the best experience in Buenos Ares for us we recently visit on New Year 2016Alejandro is really good teacher , make you feel very comfortable even we never before dance tango or any other dance experience , we took two days classes ( is the best way to do it because one is not enough) with whole family 5 people I would highly recommended, Alejandro spend even more time with us at the end than he supposed to.

A great introduction to tango!. Being complete novices we turned up to Alejandro's studio a little nervous. However his relaxed and approachable teaching style quickly put us at ease. A 2hour lesson was just right. There is loads to take in and an hour would have felt too brief I think. I particularly appreciated that Alejandro taught us more than just the basic steps. He introduced us to the philosophy of tango, linked to its cultural origins and helped us to understand that dancing together is far more than a mechanical process. I never thought a beginner's tango lesson would be so interesting!Don't be concerned about footwear if you are a beginner - we danced in socks. The studio is easy to get to by subway and Alejandro was prompt and helpful in email communication prior to our lesson.Thank you for a memorable experience!

Returned to Buenos Aires to take more classes with Alejandro.. In my previous review, I titled my review, do yourself a favor and take tango lessons with Alejandro Puerta. Well, I returned to Buenos Aires in December and took more lessons, but this time with my boyfriend. So, now I have confirmed that Alejandro is able to teach a couple with as much success as one person. His talent to teach two individuals of different levels is extraordinary. I will continue to take classes with him. In other words, I am doing myself a favor. Buenos Aires, with Alejandro's lessons takes a new dimension.

Great experience. I had a wonderful time learning the very basics of Tango. Over an hour private lesson I was introduced to the history and basic theory of tango. Alejandro's enthusiasm was contagious and I went away with a strong desire to continue to improve my tango skills in future. Alejandro is respectful and friendly and a great teacher. I would definitely recommend anyone to have a lesson with Alejandro if you are in BA for a few days and want to learn about Tango. I've recommended to my sister who is planning a class for sometime in the next month.

the magic continues. This was my second visit to BA and I couldn't wait to continue my tango classes with Alejandro! (In Oct 2014, I had daily classes with Ale during my month in BA.) He continues to be an excellent teacher. Upbeat, focused, considerate and so very very knowledgeable and competent at explaining, demonstrating and encouraging. During my 5 week visit over Nov 2015, I had 90 minute private classes 3 times a week. That pattern worked very well for me --- allowing things to settle a bit, and giving an opportunity to get to the milongas. And so often, something reviewed in class was exactly what I needed at the milonga that evening. Ale's strength as a teacher lies not just in his ability to dance well (and he does!!) but to explain it in a way that the student can understand. I am not a young person --- I'm in my early 60's. And I find often elsewhere that things are done too quickly for me to catch on. (I am NOT slow, just not as quick as some others!!) Ale understands that different people learn in different ways at different speeds and he accommodates readily to the student's learning style. And to note: he speaks excellent English and has a great sense of humour. AND he is always open to questions, comments. I put my trust completely in Ale as a teacher. Apart from asking him to review something, I let him set the lesson plan. He knows my goal: to become a better dancer. And the only other "instruction" I give him is to not let me learn bad habits. Obviously, a good teacher is not all that is necessary --- the student has to focus, put in the effort, practice, and get out to the milongas and try it out. (What fun!) And I can say that with Ale's classes and guidance and getting out dancing, I did make significant improvements. All that and it is enjoyable. Having a class with Ale is better than the spa! Like at the spa --- one is attended to, given careful attention and allowed to relax and enjoy a pleasant time. With Ale, it is the sweet music and movement of tango. Ale never forgets that we are doing this for enjoyment, to improve, of course, but to enjoy the journey, the music and the connection. Thanks Ale for your teaching. I'll be back next year to continue. See you then!Stan

"honest tango" as he says possible only if you can feel "connected". I'm listening a great tango music right now and it's reminded to me my great tango lessons experience in BsAs with Alejandro Puerto.... First sorry for sharing feedback after months passed and 2nd thank you much for teaching me with your excellent technique how to feel the music, listen to my partner and connect to dance instinctively.- Even I'm a beginner- still it was great start to speak of a universal language with you.... There is nothing much more to say about your coaching skills after reading all very true and great comments all I can say is anyone can have a chance should try it once...

Most Wonderful!. I went to Buenos Aires because after taking tango lessons for over 2 years, I still didn't feel competent enough to enjoy it. I was lucky enough to find Alejandro and change that.A professional, fun, sensitive, encouraging, musical, gentle, brilliant teacher who understood my issues and worked with me on them. It was a true pleasure taking 9 private classes with this talented gentleman.I feel much more comfortable with my technique and my confidence is much improved. I learned about him from a much more advanced dancer who is also a teacher who was taking lessons from him while I was there.I enthusiastically recommend Alejandro to dancers of all levels!

A divine month of tango with Alejandro. I had a private tango lesson with Alejandro nearly every day for a month, and it was not only the highlight of my entire time in Buenos Aires, but also the highlight of every day. I learned SO much, and progressed beyond what I thought was possible. His teaching style is so clear and encouraging, and I loved the way he brought his science background to the training, dissecting movements and then putting it all together into a beautiful, passionate, authentic, artistic expression. Learning and dancing with Alejandro was such a profound experience. I can't wait to go back and study with him some more!

BA tango teacher. Alejandro is a top quality dance teacher. Wish we had time for more lessons. Take a 90 minute lesson, then go to milongo next 2 days then back for another 90 minute lesson if you have some dance experience.

Tango... A deep experience. Tango with Alejandro... That was a great experience. I came to Argentina to learn tango as I felt that dance had something else than ballroom. Something deeper, touching the soul, a kind a connection with yourself and the partner. My first plan was to take lessons with several teachers to have different views of tango. My first lesson was with Alejandro and after one hour, I didn't feel like seing an other teacher. "I had found a master ;-)".Alejandro taugh me the basic technic for tango so I could go to milongas and appreciate and take pleasure with the dance. The most important was for me to be able to dance with different partners at milongas, take pleasure and also that the partner enjoy to dance with me. And I can say that was a success. I start with no knowledge in tango and I left as a good beginner with good technics. Alejandro helped me to feel the dancer, to move my body accordingly to the dancer, to relax. So thank you very much Alejandro for sharing your passion and experience. He is patient, very pedagogue, has a very good english, a nice studio, good and different type of music, he a lovely person.Only one regret: he didn't fit in my bagpack and I wasn't able to bring him back home.Thank you very much Alejandro...Hope to see you again soon! :-)

Personalised tango lesson and service. My boyfriend and I booked a private 2 hr lesson which was tailored to our level, having been dancing tango for a year. Alejandro was patient and moved as fast/slow as we wanted him to. He then took us to a traditional milonga of c. 400 people where we were the tourists. Highly recommended

Fantastic Tango Lesson. I went to Alejandro as a beginner for a 2-hour private tango lesson and learnt so much in that time. As well as making the class very enjoyable, Alejandro pays very close attention to technique and the importance of musicality to dance, and I learnt so much more in that 2 hours than in the two previous tango lessons I had elsewhere in Buenos.Extremely good value for money - definitely go for a private lesson with Alejandro if you want to improve your technique very rapidly and enjoy tango-ing!

Perfect tango lessons. I wanted to spend a significant portion of my time in Buenos Aires learning to tango. I stumbled on Alejandro's website and decided to immediately set up an intro lesson. I went to his studio and was instantly hooked. Alejandro has an amazing charisma and incredible love for tango, which he emits through his teaching. I learned not individual steps, but how to think about tango - the reasons why it developed, improvising while dancing, reading the music, etc. Alejandro is very good at explaining and making you feel comfortable, so you will surely find yourself building your dancing confidence and making progress.I've been to several milongas since, and my partners have always commented on my potential. There is no-one else to thank than Alejandro!

Do your self a favor and take tango classes from Alejandro Puerta. Alejandro is a very gifted tango teacher. He is totally committed to you as a student. Tango is unlike any other dance, so it’s not a matter of executing steps by memory, but to feel what your partner does and to respond in turn with confidence and trust. Alejandro shares with you his love and passion for tango which allows the student to fall under the tango spell. I more than highly recommend Alejandro. You will miss not being in Buenos Aires, after experiencing his tango teachings.

Great learning experience... great guy!. Highly recommended by friends, my partner (advanced) and I (intermediate) took a series of privates and couple lessons with Alejandro. I could not recommend him more strongly. He was remarkably helpful in identifying respectively the areas we needed to work on while at the same, time integrating these into his well organized system of teaching. It was obvious that he has been teaching many years and knows how to build lesson by lesson towards solid usable skills for the social dance floor. After a month of 4 lessons per week I came away with a big step up in my technique and musicality. I also feel like I met a remarkable man who I am pleased to call a friend.On the more mundane side: every lesson was on time. fluent english ( my spanish is not good enough but he encouraged me to try try ) very accommodating with scheduling, high quality of teaching, very affordable. Robin HuttonVancouver B.C.

Tango and Therapy. My title is somewhat facetious, but not entirely. There is an area which lies in the balance between destroying someone's confidence, and catering to their ego. Alejandro does not merely inhabit this difficult area - he owns it. He is able to feel what your dance needs, create a program to work on it, execute the program, and nonetheless you leave aware that there is work to be done but not feeling destroyed in any way. He is, as one would expect from someone able to do this, a sensitive and extremely competent tango instructor. Alejandro is also quite generous with his time and does his best to be flexible around changing schedules. His primary studio is a lovely sunny space. When the typical Buenos Aires problems occur, i.e. sudden lack of electricity in a building, he is able to acquire alternate beautiful working spaces seemingly at a moment's notice.I have no hesitation recommending him and wish I could have worked longer with Alejandro.

Best Experience in Buenos Aires!. Alejandro is an excellent teacher, artist and magician. I say magician because Alejandro created a very comfortable and fun learning environment for my boyfriend and myself. My boyfriend who was at first hesitant to take tango lessons, immediately booked 5 more lessons after an hour in Alejandro's studio. Alejandro is a thorough instructor who translates his passion and love for tango through his instructions to his students. Reflecting on the 6 weeks spent in Buenos Aires, I would definitely say dance lessons with Alejandro were my favorite activity in the city.

Amazing teacher, a professional for tango. I am dancing tango since 5 years. Until I had lessons with Alejandro, milonga steps were a nightmare for me. He teached me the secrets of milonga steps in 4 lessons. I can tell you, he is an amazing teacher, a professional who takes his work to heart. I also had the opportunity to practice on musicality, embrace, and posture with him. I definitely recommend to have tango lessons with Alejandro during BA travel.

Excellent teacher with good english knowledge. I took 4 classes with Alejandro, it is a real pleasure to dance with him, because he is a real tango lover and he has a very nice way to teach... and my friends confirmed that even with 4 lessons my dancing changed...so he is the right person:-) Berna

True Love of Tango. Somehow I convinced my fiancé (who is a self-declared non-dancer) to take a tango class with Alejandro during the two weeks we were in Buenos Aires. Afterwards he mentioned more than once how Alejandro really was a great teacher. We were only able to take one class with him during our stay, but if we had stayed longer I would have wanted to take many more! I loved Alejandro's teaching philosophy and his belief about tango as freedom and creative expression. He teaches in a way that makes you appreciate tango on a deeper level and helps you grasp the foundation of tango so that even after one class we'd be able to practice and grow on our own. I highly recommend Alejandro even if you're in BA for a short while!

The very very excellent teacher. I took 3 classes with Alejandro during my stay in BsAs. And I can say it's one of the best classes I've ever taken. Alejandro is a very encouraging teacher. He never saved his compliment whenever I did well, but in the same time he always pointed out what I needed to work on.He pointed out something that my previous tango teacher and me never paid attention to. And he is very precise, which i really appreciated and which I think works for all level. What's more he not only taught me about some sequence, but also focused on how to dance elegantly. And I do think I improve! All the things i learn from him will benefit my dancing a lot a lot in both short and long term. Whenever I go back to Buenos Aires, I will take classes with Alejandro for sure.And he speaks very good English, so you won't have any problems communicating with him. Thank you so much Alejandro! See you soon!

Quick and efficient. In only an hour of time, Alejandro awoke all the few tango memories I had from years ago and gave me enough confidence to be able to practically dance. A very sensitive and comprehensive teacher who can adapt to his students and bring them to evolve. A must!

Alejandro Puerta is a First Class Tango Teacher. Whether you want to try tango for the first time, or if you're interested in progressing in your tango practice, this is the teacher for you. Taking tango lessons with Alejandro Puerta for two hours a day during my two week trip to in Buenos Aires was a beautiful experience. Alejandro's expertise as a dancer and teacher was perfect. He readily evaluated each of my movements and provided clear instruction about how to remediate each one, as needed, plus he taught me new moves at each lesson and practiced each one with me until I got it. Whenever I encountered a move that I found difficult, he was able to break it down into relatable chunks until I was able to grasp the movement as a whole. I practice several types of dance, and I feel that my lessons with Alejandro helped me to become a better technical dancer overall. He is a lovely man whose use of humor combined with a positive attitude made him a joy to work with. He is a proficient, versatile, professional teacher who is capable of helping leads and follows develop in the dance from any starting point. As a teacher myself, I'm picky about dance teachers, and in my opinion Alejandro is top notch. He is a gem whom I feel fortunate to have worked with, and I look forward to working with him again in the future. Tango with Alejandro is a must if you're passing through Buenos Aires. Highly recommend!!

A Dancer's Testimonial. If you travel to Buenos Aires and desire an Argentine Tango lesson, Alejandro Puerta must be on your agenda! Alejandro brought joy to me a well as a smile on my face. He has patience as well as the ability to show an Argentine Tango student specific dance steps whether it is visual or verbal.  Alejandro is a very charismatic and exemplary teacher with lessons. He is a positive role model for a student as myself to succeed. Not only does Alejandro exhibit creative choreography in his lessons but also I have found him an enjoyable individual. He approaches his dance lessons with exuberant enthusiasm and vigor. Alejandro creates an environment to inspire you to dance and dance and dance the Argentine Tango. My personal dance goals were beyond my expectations.He is tactful when relating to all age ranges. Not only does Alejandro contributes to one's self-confidence in learning my favorite dance…the Argentine Tango but also has alternatives and solutions when there are challenges. The culmanation of my lessons was having the opportunity to dance with Alejandro at a Malanga Club. It was a magical experience!Yes, those Argentine Tango dancing steps I learned from Alejandro parallels life's philosophy of taking 1 day at a time and keeping life simple!I can without reservation recommend Alejandro Puerta as a top-notch Argentine Tango dance instructor. I can't wait to return to Buenos Aires for more lessons with Alejandro Puerta! Marilyn (Overland Park, Kansas)

Super tango lesson in Buenos Aires !. What a delight ! Alejandro was exceptional . It is amazing to be able to make an appointment from halfway round the world and this man is the one. Great response ,easy to use website , good advice on travel. Alejandro pinpointed the areas that my partner and I could improve on in his lovely little stiudio and really we progressed an amazing amount in an hour ..wish I had booked 2 . Very supportive very positive great music choice. Tango is to a large extent about style and subtlety and I really enjoyed Alejandro's dance style and his inspiring teaching manner. Can't recommend this teacher highly enough for any level of tango dancing.Happy tangoing ! Theo

I loved my tango classes with Alejandro Puerta in Buenos Aires!. As a Tango lover, I did my homework before taking my trip to Buenos Aires and looked for a good Tango teacher in the area. I felt that there was no way that I would go there and not take Tango classes! I was already taking classes here in Toronto for some months, and would classify myself as an “enthusiastic beginner” :). I read some of the reviews here at TripAdvisor and couldn’t pass by the great reviews Alejandro has on this site. And now I can only confirm that they are all true! I had 15 hours of dancing tango with Alejandro over 5 days while I was there this July. I loved every minute of it! Alejandro is an excellent teacher, has a great relaxed approach and knows exactly how to work with an “anxious” dancer who has a strong personality and feels afraid to give away the lead :) I had a wonderful time talking “tango” and dancing. He made me feel like a “tangera verdadera”. I would recommend to anybody traveling to Buenos Aires and who would like to learn tango, or just fall in love with tango and learn a bit more about its origin, to book a lesson or more with this remarkable teacher.

A remarkable teacher. As someone who teaches for a living, I am exceptionally picky about how I am taught. Alejandro is truly outstanding as a dance instructor.There are far too many dance instructors who are good dancers and poor teachers. They can show you what to do and tell you if you're doing it wrong, but they cannot systematically diagnose errors and correct faults with appropriate cues and while making corrections in an order builds a skill set from the bottom up. Alejandro is remarkable because he truly understands how to help someone build a skill set. His lessons are adaptive and his cues are thoughtful. He will take you rapidly from wherever you are in your dancing to wherever you want to be.

We loved our private Tango class with Alejandro!. My boyfriend and I were so happy with our tango class experience. Alejandro taught us the foundation, history and connection of Argentinian Tango, it was complex and something we immediately went home and practiced more of. He was clear, informative and most of all enthusiastic about teaching! He's so attentive and can sense the nuanced communication between partners and gives incredible feedback. We would 100% keep coming back if we lived here! Alejandro is warm, generous, open, and makes you feel comfortable if you're nervous about starting Tango. We highly recommend him.

Excellent!. As a beginner to dancing tango, I really enjoyed Alejandro's private class. He was so informative and constructive when teaching, that it made learning so much easier! I also really liked the fact that he gave me a background history to Argentinian tango and explained to me why they do certain moves. He adapts to your learning style which is great so you can go at your own pace. It was a very enjoyable class and I would most definitely recommend him to anyone keen on learning!

For Argentine Tango....there is no one better than Alejandro. My partner and I are very experienced Ballroom dancers (smooth and latin). We decided it was time to add AT. We had several recommendations for instructors from fellow dancers but after reading Alejandro's reviews on Trip Advisor we contacted him. We did 2 lessons per day for 8 days straight and a milonga every night. Alejandro accompanied picked the milongas, met us at each, danced with my partner and took notes of our dancing to review with us the next day. Rather than repeating all the endorsements in the TA reviews...I can confirm every word in those reviews reflects exactly our experience. We have taken dance lesson for more than 35 years from literally hundreds of instructors. There is none better than Alejandro. We are going back in six months to take lessons from him again. Besides his extraordinary instructor skills...he was a pleasure to simply be with.

Such a Lovely Tango Experience!. Alejandro was an awesome instructor. I was nervous about taking a lesson because the tango seems so intimate but I was in Argentina where Tango rules-and so glad I did. I sent an email and received a quick response with very detailed instructions regarding the San Telmo location, contacting him upon arrival, fees, etc. I arrived early and was even able to peruse the antique market across the street. I loved the studio and the view from it. Alejandro made the whole experience relaxed and extremely comfortable from the beginning as a true instructor. He explains the connection of movement and communication between partners. I was even following his lead with my eyes closed to focus more accurately on movement and his lead. This saved me from tripping us up with my constant looking at down at feet. It was fabulous! I did an hour and half session and wish I had planned for 2hrs and more lessons, but I didn't have the time on this trip. I would definitely book this again!

Learning Tango by Connecting with Music and a Partner. Alejandro was an excellent instructor for a complete beginner (even to dance) like me, and he and seems to tailor his approach and instruction for each student.First, he provided some background information about the history of tango and the music, and early on we worked on just connecting with the music, then the connection with a partner. As the lesson progressed, and I learned some steps, Alejandro underscored the importance of the connection between partners (in part as it relates to communicating what movement the lead is asking the follow to make) and made it seem intuitive. Rather than simply explain with words, he also demonstrated how a lead might initiate steps differently, which showed how and why the connection and means of communicating through it is important.By the end of the lesson, I was sad to go, but excited about the prospect of more tango. Thank you for such a positive and friendly welcome to tango!

My great birthday gift ,a tango lesson from a high quality instructor of Buenos Aires,Alejandro Puerta. Our short but sweet visit last April 2015 to Buenos Aires was definitely not long enough after experiencing how great a tango teacher is Alejandro. I could have booked many hours of lesson from him if only we had enough time in Buenos Aires.I had been to many dance instructors and had been through so many years of dance training and competitions and I must say that Alejandro is on top of my list of excellent dance coach....You are truly the best in your ways of dealing with your students and present yourself very professionally...Well done Alejandro Puerta

What a terrific Tango experience!!!!. What an amazing time I spent with Alejandro teaching me Tango is hard to explain as it exceeded all of my expectations. I spent 5 days in BBAA and contacted Alejandro just when I arrived asking for Tango lessons for a bloody beginner as I was and also being on my own with no partner. I had a response within a few hours back answering all my questions - also the one on shoes as I only had sneakers with me which are not very Tango but they have been fine for my beginner lessons. His studio is very easy to find in the center of San Telmo - lessons take place in his beautiful studio which has AC and a big mirror.I very much appreciated his unique way to teach by combining in an excellent way the techniques and the required feeling/listening/ connection to the dance and partner thereby giving one the understanding for the essentials of Tango dancing. I had a terrific time, taking 3 lessons in total only but I felt talented and able to dance from the first minute on as he is a great teacher. He also explains about the required accuracy of the signals from a man to a woman and how the connection between a dancing couple works so you know what to dance and how to move.I learned so many things which will also help me with any future classes I will take for sure - thank you Alejandro!!I believe wether you are a beginner or already experienced Alejandro is an outstanding professional teacher who makes you fall in love with Tango and makes sure you get the most out of your lessons.

Great value tango lessons that made an immediate, noticeable difference. I contacted Alejandro on the recommendation of a friend and was very happy I did. You can easily pay 3 times as much for big name teachers, but I felt I got just as much out of my lessons with him, if not more. Alejandro has a deep understanding of the technical aspects of tango and an ability to explain and demonstrate clearly so you understand why you need to do something as well as how. He helped me make subtle, yet fundamental refinements to my technique which made an immediate and noticeable difference to my dancing. He is also very positive and encouraging which helps you to relax and feel confident. If/when I return to Buenos Aires I'll definitely be contacting him for more lessons.

A week as a tanguera. With no experience of tango whatsoever, I wanted to try one class per day for a week in order to get an introduction... and Alejandro was the best. He adapted the "program" to the schedule, making sure he wouldn't teach specific combination of steps or choreography but rather allow me to understand the "code" of being led and making me confortable to dance. He also based his approach on explaining tango's philosophy, music and expressing personal style... I'm a fan!

Tango Teaching that You Will Remember!. We were visiting Buenos Aires for just 3 short days, and wanted to find a Porteno (local) to teach us some real Tango. Alejandro responded our email promptly and spoke great English which is helpful when you are trying to take a class in learning something new! We are total beginners. Alejandro is an excellent Tango teacher. Having a science background, his teaching method is quiet scientific! He started with the broad idea and went step by step in teaching us the "basic elements" of tango. My boyfriend and I find this helps building a strong foundation for future more advanced classes.

Getting the right Tango feeling and connection was amazing!. Alejandro is an outstanding Tango teacher because his focus is on teaching the spirit, connections and feelings of Tango first. With them the techniques are learned much easier. We had 3 lessons with my friend together and we enjoyed it very much!

Such a great afternoon!. My husband and I absolutely loved working with Alejandro. He made tango very approachable and the lesson itself was very relaxed and comfortable. Alejandro gives you all of the tools you need to go out and try a milonga for yourself without ever making you feel like the amateur you probably are. We loved his studio which was very easy to find in San Telmo and had a blast working with him. We are already trying to figure out when we can get back to Buenos Aires and work with him again!

Hands down the best dance class I took in many years! Simply amazing!. I dance, from ballet to contemporary, jazz or salsa and I took many classes in my life in dance schools, in different countries. I can say that this experience was unlike any other. Alejandro has a very rare blend of qualities: he explains the why so you can get the meaning of what you are doing, he encourages you so you trust yourself, he makes you make progress while enjoying yourself and finally he transmits his passion for tango. I took 3 lessons in a row and wish I could do more! I highly recommend Alejandro for anyone, beginner or professional that wants to dance fast, have a better understanding of technique and simply to enjoy an amazing personal experience. Muchas gracias Alejandro!

Little things which made a big difference. I enjoyed a terrific lesson with Alejandro. We shared a delightful afternoon in his very cute studio. He was extremely observant and pointed out some small things in my technique that make a big difference on the dance floor. He also cared about my long term tango experience, helping to educate me on the music and providing range of information. The lesson was very easy to organise, even at short notice. Gracias Maestro!

A wonderful introduction to the art of tango. I booked a two hour session with Alejandro for my friend and I on arrival in Buenos Aires. After so many great trip advisor reviews we were expecting a great session and we were certainly not at all disappointed. Alejandro was very quick to respond to my enquiry and very flexible in arranging our booking. My friend and I had no experience of a tango but Alejandro made us feel so relaxed that by the end of our two hours we felt relatively confident to try out some basic moves in a milonga! His style is patience with passion but also allows you to find your own way into your own style without feeling like you're doing it wrong. His teaching is accompanied by a tango history lesson at the same time and so informative. I can guarantee a session with Alejandro will leave you bitten with the tango bug and a yearning to learn more. Fabulous!

Wow... Alejandro really is a top notch Tango teacher. Hire him!. I have had a lot of dance teachers, both private and in a group, and I can say without hesitation that Alejandro possesses the highest teaching skills. Not only does he knows his art inside and out and fully lives Tango, he knows how to convey it in a way that feels easy and fun regardless of your level. I was also really impressed with Alejandro's human qualities - always in a good mood, encouraging, humble, fun, passionate, and a really big heart. The kind of encounter that makes a significantly positive difference in your journey.

Tango Success: he will make you a dancer!. Alejandro made me love the tango and found the talent in me as a dancer. I have zero experience in dance, let alone tango, and by my third lesson I had moved from basics and ochos to flourishes and turns. He said I was truly a success story—but it was only possible because of him. Alejandro is a fabulous teacher who helps you connect to yourself so you can connect to the dance. Sensitive and smart, he figures out what works for you. I cannot say enough how I loved the experience. It was a life-affirming decision to meet and dance with him.I wish I could have squeezed in more lessons (originally I had two and he fit in a third before my flight). If possible, take a private lesson for an hour and a half so you have time to practice. The time in my lessons flew by because I was having so much fun.

Fun and professional!. I appreciated Alejandro's patience and professionalism. Great classes and I highly recommend his teaching style. I took lessons on my own and would have liked to stay longer in Buenos Aires to do more dancing.

Wonderful teacher and person. I spent ten weeks in Buenos Aires from October to December 2014. Luckily I discovered Alejandro in my second week there. From then on I took about three lessons a week. I was a total tango beginner when I went there and after only a few weeks I started going to milongas and I actually danced tango - thanks to Alejandro. He is a really exceptional teacher and a wonderful person: extremely kind, patient, motivating.... But what makes him and his lessons really special: He does not only teach you tango but helps you learn something about yourself and become a better person. And you can feel that he loves what he does, which is really inspiring. I am honestly thankful that I had the opportunity to take lessons with him, they were the best part of my stay in Argentina.

Magical, Rejuvenating, and Memorable!. I came to Buenos Aires to renew my passion for dancing but never expected to enjoy so many magical moments. Alejandro was a wonderful piece of that magic. He is an expert teacher with such style, patience, professionalism, and heart! Dancing with him was like butter... soft, smooth, and delicious!

A Tango lesson for the body and the soul!. I could not imagine a better tango experience than I had with Alejandro! I say "experience" because it is not just a "lesson;" Alejandro emphasizes and embraces so much more about the Tango that he passes on to all of his students. I had a group lesson and two private lessons, and during that time Alejandro patiently, warmly and enthusiastically taught many basic and stylistic moves, as well as making me feel very safe and comfortable while I was learning this new dance. I came to the lessons with a basic knowledge of tango, and he was able to build on the basics quickly and clearly--always giving helpful and encouraging advice along the way. Work with him!! Dance with him!! Learn from him!!

A rare and accomplished teacher.. I have been dancing tango for eight years and recently studied intensively for a month with Alejandro Puerta. Alejandro has a rare ability to deconstruct information and to impart it clearly and without fuss. He has an uncanny understanding of exactly what one needs to learn and how much can be absorbed in each lesson. I left each session a little more confident than when I’d walked in. And it was a confidence based on real work, real feedback, and real progress. His lessons are well organized and I knew each time what the intention and goal was. He is also a person of poetic sensitivity and mischievous humour and he takes a warm and positive approach to teaching. Dancing with him in the classes is an utter delight. If you want to improve your dancing for the real life of the milonga; if you want to understand how tango translates in your own body; and if you want to build mastery, then I highly recommend private classes with Alejandro.

What a wonderful teacher!. I took several lessons from Alejandro during my 2-week stay in Buenos Aires, and it was an amazing experience! Alejandro is a genuine and lovely person, fabulouls teacher and a delightful dancer! I have been dancing for over 3 years but I learnt a lot and I can already feel that my dancing improved dramatically! He is a very calm, patient and knowledgeable teacher and has this amazing aura about him that made me feel very comfortable and relaxed during the lessons! Most importantly, he has a gift for explaining things extremely well and very logically so the penny dropped quite a few times!Thank you so much Alejandro! I shall certainly be returning for some more lessons soon!

Look no further - you have found the best tango instructor in BA!. Alejandro is a wonderful and passionate tango teacher! I took two private lessons and one group lesson with him and I learned so much. I went to Buenos Aires knowing absolutely nothing about how to dance tango. The whole thing seemed impossible to me, but because Alejandro, I was dancing later that night in a milonga. It was so much fun and I never would have had the confidence or the ability to do that without those lessons. He teaches you how to actually feel the dance, the music and the movements so you can enjoy tango for what it is. He is super patient and knowledgeable and will have you dancing tango in no time!

>> it takes two to tango <<. Travelling through South America, I came to Buenos Aires for the main reason of learning to dance Tango. I am a Salsa dancer and had never tried Tango before, but a while ago I decided that I really wanted to learn it. So I was very excited to finally come to Buenos Aires, the home of real Tango!Although I had a recommendation for a different Tango teacher in Buenos Aires, I decided to try with Alejandro because I really liked his philosophy and his reviews. I can truly say that I had the best tango experience I could have ever wished for thanks to Alejandro! I did not expect to learn that much considering the little time that we had together! Coming from a salsa background, Tango was a very new concept for me. But Alejandro’s teaching is intuitive and everything is about the connection between the dancers (which actually also helps you to better understand other dances as well). Of course, as an absolute Tango beginner I still have a bit of a way to go to become a good dancer of tango. But with Alejandro’s help, I could already develop a very good basis to build upon and a great understanding of the tango music and the dance. I really cant wait to be back in Buenos Aires and take more classes with Alejandro! Everybody, who wants to learn real Tango (and not only a pattern of various steps) should go and take classes with Alejandro! Definitely one of the best dance teachers I’ve ever had! Muchisimas Gracias!

Experience Tango with an incredible instructor!. I spent one week in Buenos Aires and one of the best highlights of my experience were my tango classes with Alejandro. I came to BA with zero tango experience. Alejandro helped to guide me with my knowledge of tango in not only the steps but the culture as well. Following instruction with Alejandro I now have a much better knowledge and ability with my tango moves. I will definitely make plans with him on my next trip to take more classes, and I am going to return!

Wonderful teaching style! Patient, knowledgeable and passionate !. I just returned yesterday from a 2 1/2 week stay in Buenos Aires. I took 6 lessons with Alejandro and I honestly wish I could have taken 6 more!! When I walked in on the first lesson, I was a bit nervous, but he is super sweet and patient and completely radiates that calm yet passionate tango energy!I had taken a few hours of lessons back in San Francisco, so he suggested we dance for an assessment. From there we worked on musicality and getting the feel for how the lead gives cues to the follow (connectivity). Every lesson started with a dance where we would "review" what we had worked on previously but he would always throw in a few new steps! To my surprise, the work we did on recognizing where the weight of the lead and the direction of the torso was guiding me I actually got some of the steps without realizing it! From there, he helped me fine tune little details and add some flourishes to make it look prettier. Last night, I dreamt in Spanish and... I danced TANGO!!! Thanks, Alejandro! Looking forward to showing you my progress next year!!

When life gives you the chance to sit it out or dance, I hope you'll dance!. My partner and I have just returned from our first trip to Buenos Aires and had decided at the outset that we would like to tackle a few tango lessons whilst in the home of tango!I trawled the internet for an instructor and, largely due to recommendations that I saw on Trip Advisor, I settled on Alejandro Puerta and we are so glad (from both a male and female perspective) that we had the pleasure of dancing with him and I can only agree with all the other rave reviews that have been so eloquently expressed on this forum. Neither my partner nor I had danced Argentine Tango before, but we had done a little bit of social ballroom and Latin American dancing, so this was a new experience altogether.What a delight it turned out to be! Alejandro is an intuitive director of dance, who is able to gauge the requirements of both leader and follower and stresses the connection that is so essential in a shared experience such as a beautiful and fluid tango should be. The connection goes beyond the steps and is the true heart of the dance. I suspect that there are many levels to this dance and I also suspect that you can experience all, or any of them - depending on your own level of requirement - in Alejandro’s skilled hands.Above all, we had fun with Alejandro and learnt so much about the philosophy and passion of the dance and we couldn’t wait to return for each lesson. Take one lesson and I guarantee you will go back for more! If you have even a passing interest in dance, or just want a new experience, don’t miss a chance to have a lesson with Alejandro - he truly is the maestro of dancing in Buenos Aires!!

Bravissimo!! Excellent teacher. I had two Hours lessons tango with Alejandro, which was a fantastic experience . He is a true master teacher. His methodical and personalized approach improved my ability to dance.. I have changed different teacher but Alejandro is the best ,he radiates his love of tango and teaches from the heart. I recommend you go to him.

Wonderful!. My girlfriend and I just spent a week in Buenos Aires. We had no dance knowledge or background but figured it would be fun to have a tango lesson. Best decision of our trip. We ended up scheduling more lessons because Alejandro's instruction added so much to our understanding of tango culture and Buenos Aires itself. After just a few hours of instruction we were having fun dancing around Alejandro's studio, and subsequent trips to a milonga and tango show were far more interesting and rewarding. Alejandro does not just teach steps, he explains the passion and connectivity of the dance and how it expresses and relates to Buenos Aires culture. Great experience, highly recommended.

A Wonderful, Knowledgable Teacher. Having spent just over two weeks in Buenos Aires, I was lucky enough to take three classes with Alejandro - I wish I could have taken one every day I was there! Alejandro is an incredible teacher - full of patience and energy and joy. He radiates his love of tango and teaches from the heart in a way that is immediately understandable and relatable. I had never danced tango before arriving in BAs so I really had no idea what to expect. He made me feel completely relaxed - my self-consciousness at being brand new at tango dissipated with the lesson. As well as sharing some of the history, he also explained the connections that occur in tango - between the two dancers, with the music, and among the other dancers sharing the floor with you. (And his English is excellent so if you don't speak Spanish very well, don't worry!) It was a very interesting part of the lessons and integral to understanding tango itself. His dancing is smooth and fluid and his particular way of leading makes it easy to understand the basic steps as well as the connection in just a few lessons. He was quick to notice the things I was not picking up right away and adjust his movements and explanations to get me back on track. He even taught me a few flourishes to keep things fun! I learned more in those few lessons than I ever expected. It really was the best tango education experience during my whole stay. I hope to go back and study more with him someday. I highly encourage anyone with even the slightest interest to take classes with him - after all, tango is at the heart of the Buenos Aires experience!

Absolutely superb - and from guy's point of view too.... Alejandro came highly recommended and gives superb lessons in a lovely central air con place. My wife loved the experience but I wanted to add that from my point of view Alejandro actually made me really enjoy it when I was a bit unsure to begin with. We enjoyed it so much we booked another hour on the same day and are now warming up for a Milonga today. Planning to be good tourists, stay on the outside lane and not bump into anyone! Thanks Alejandro and I am sure we will be back

Fantastic Teacher. I spend several months a year in Buenos Aires and I’ve taken a variety of tango classes. I’ve learned the most from private classes like those offered by Alejandro Puerta. Alejandro is a Buenos Aires native who speaks fluent English. He has a very nice dance studio in his flat in San Telmo and his prices are reasonable. He is knowledgeable about all aspects of tango from the technical aspects of the dance to the culture and music. His classes are productive and fun and I plan to take more classes from him next time I am in Buenos Aires.

Opening The Door. Washing up on the shores of the Rio Plata, in the unique city of Buenos Aires, at an age when I could be forgiven for staying home and playing with my grandchildren, I had only one purpose.. bailar tango!Seduced here by a younger amiga, (who had become a true tango addict!) who promised that her teacher would help me reach my goal,I arrived at Alejandro's door on my 67th birthday! I had been expecting some intimidating dude with slicked back hair and a bad suit with an attitude to match, like dancers I had seen in tango shows, so you can imagine my delight when this lovely, hip looking man with a big smile, warm dark eyes, and long curling hair opened the ornate wooden door of his studio building. As he took me up the rickety old fashioned elevator, we began to talk, and before my first step of tango, I felt connected to the teacher. He lives the philosophy of tango. The connection...he establishes it right away and then teaches you how to do it in the dance. His slim body gives out the form and the signals that he wants you to understand. He never shows off, and he never throw something at you that you can't deal with.In that first lesson, I could not believe my ineptitude. My body did not connect with itself, much less with him. I realized that I had lost the natural instinct to revel in dancing that I recalled from my youth. But Alejandro did not make me feel bad. On the contrary, he patiently began to teach me the basics of tango, emphasizing the very things that were standing in my way. Step by step, I began to learn. For two months we persevered. Over time, I noticed my body begin to change. The problems that had devilled me for the past few years began to melt away. Most importantly, through his sensitive encouragement and determined teaching, I discovered the tango queen who lives inside me, and she began to take over the dance, and indeed my life. How can I thank this brilliant teacher? There is no way, except to hopefully encourage you to choose Alejandro Puerta when you come to Buenos Aires. And to tell you that if you are in Buenos Aires, you MUST tango!

Life Changing Experience. To say that Alejandro changed my life through tango is an understatement. I had spent a number of years working in difficult environments and had never danced any thing, let alone tango, when a friend suggested that I try a lesson with Alejandro. I walked into his studio, having little connection with my own body and little confidence that I could dance. After 1.5 months, I left dancing and more confidence and self-awareness than I have felt in years. Tango is a beautiful form of dance, but tango with Alejandro turned out to be a form of healing as well. His lessons effectively combine the theory and practice of tango, and felt therapeutic because of his attentive approach and fine capacity to observe his students and tailor his teaching to their needs - just like visiting a good doctor! Alejandro could see what I needed when I didn't even know. By teaching me that tango is about connection, with oneself as well as with dancing partners, he has given me a gift that has had effects throughout my entire life. Thanks Alejandro - can't wait for my next round of lessons when I return to Buenos Aires!

Highlight of our trip!. My boyfriend and I were in Buenos Aires for the first time and I suggested that we take a tango lesson. Although he was a little apprehensive at first, the overwhelmingly positive reviews on TripAdvisor helped me convince him to try a lesson with Alejandro! He responded very promptly to our email and we were very lucky that he had time for a lesson the next day.Alejandro has a beautiful tango studio within his apartment. As first time tango students, Alejandro put us at ease and not only taught us the steps but some of the history behind the dance. The passion he has for the art of tango (and life in general!) was apparent from the moment we met him. I only wish that we had time to take more than one lesson while we were there. After our lesson Alejandro even followed up with some music that we could practice with back at home.This is an experience like no other!

The best in Buenos Aires. I had one tango lesson (which was a fantastic experience) with a different instructor prior to my two one-hour lessons with Alejandro, and I must say that I greatly preferred Alejandro's teaching style. He is a true master who, through his friendly, approachable demeanor and vast knowledge - not only with respect to the tango, but also the human body itself - creates an environment and an experience for his students that is comfortable, yet challenging. His methodical and personalized approach improved not only my ability to dance, but also changed the way I think about seemingly simple things like balance and body language. Overall, my time with Alejandro was extremely rewarding, and I hope to learn more from him again one day when I return to Buenos Aires. Muchisimas gracias! -Safi

One of my favourite tango teachers!. Alejandro is an amazing teacher! Over the years, I have studied with more than 2 dozen different teachers (mostly from Argentina) and he truly stands out. He is able to articulate the intricacies of the dance in a superb way - not only because his English is excellent, but also because he is able to use language in a precise and powerful way to empower his student to embody the concepts being worked on. I gained a lot from the privates I took with Alejandro and feel that my dancing was impacted in many positive ways. I have recommended Alejandro to my tango friends and plan to work with him again next time I am in Buenos Aires. A sweet little side bonus is the studio space - for anyone who enjoys beautiful spaces as much as I do, Alejandro's gorgeous studio in San Telmo will be a treat!

A perfect way to start each day.. My boyfriend and I were looking to plan a trip where we learned something together so we decided to make tango in Buenos Aires our focus. We scheduled 7 two-hour lessons with Alejandro during our two weeks in San Telmo. At the end of our seventh lesson our only regret is that we didn't schedule more lessons. Alejandro has an uncanny ability to communicate the nuances of leading and following through connection. I know this sounds basic but once this subtle communication is tuned it's amazing what's possible on the floor and in life.Learning the tango with Alejandro was an invaluable and unforgettable experience. I highly recommend him to anyone planning a visit to Buenos Aires whether on their own, with a partner or with friends.And his studio is in one of the most beautiful buildings in San Telmo. The view of the city and the market is spectacular.

Sheer Delight. I will say this without a shred of hesitation-Alejandro Puerta is an articulate, educated and sensitive man with a passion for his art.He has a natural knack to pass on his knowledge precisely and analytically.A visit to Buenos Aires without the benefit of his wonderful lessons, would be a Total shame.GO GO and GO- I for one am going back to that Magic city and this highly TALENTED man.The few lessons I took with him (about 12) have improved my tango dancing no end.(last but not least: for the fine quality of teaching he provides he is UNDERcharging).

The man is a sensory genius.. I went along to Alejandro with a pretty open mind and and empty bag of talent.
