I had 7 lessons, more or less back to back amongst the 10 days that my girlfriend and i were in Buenos Aries. She can dance. I can't. Well couldn't.Day 1 was pretty cool as when you are working from a base of nothing, everything is new and interesting and we moved on quickly. Alejandro has a great way of establishing not just what your ability and potential might be but also tying any natural physical advantages or disadvantages to how you should progress. He doesn't have a cookie cutter approach. He'll quickly work out what works for you.Day 2, entirely due to me, sucked. I realized that I could not hear the music properly as tango has 'flourishes'. This sounds nice but when you are trying to move and using the music as a guide a flourish becomes a black hole. Your beat disappears if you are not focusing. And given i was trying to remember sequences, not stand all over my girlfriend, tapping a beat over in my head was a poor third on my list. And my natural inability as a male to multi-task, made we want to throw it all up in the air and learn to dance to something a bit more predictable.This for me was when Alejandro came into his own; he gave me really simple techniques to better bolt my tiny brain to my shoes.And these incidentally where bought from a guy he put us in touch with and saved us being otherwise shafted as tourist buying dance shoes. He gave us the best coffee venue to go to so when we finished a lesson, I could go and post analyze my inability whilst suitably wired on local stimulants.And to top it it off the dude is just a really nice guy. I would love to go back there and live one day. Older people in particular just look happier than anywhere i have been before. And when i do, he will be my mate because he's just the easiest guy to get on with and have a laugh.And for you Alejandro - my gift back to you. A useful education in return. Not of the same class or indeed can it be categorized as a life skill. However it will stop you getting yourself in strife again when you misuse what may appear very innocent terminology http://www.effingpot.com/slang.shtml

Fully endorse all previous positive reviews. Hardly know what to add to all glowing reviews. Perhaps to say that booking via Internet worked very well, Alejandro responded quickly and all arrangements were easily made. He has changed his studio which was not quite so convenient for me, but it was worth it. I am an OAP from UK and a beginner, but this was not a problem and after a short time actually felt as if I could possibly be able to do this. Whatever happens I can now say that I have danced the tango in Burnos Aires and for that I have Alejandro to thank. Thank you! Whoever you are, and whatever age or standard don't hesitate and book one or twenty lessons. You won't regret it, but be warned it is seriously addictive!

Great teacher who undercharges!. Alejandro should increase his rate by 50% at least because I think the value he provides as a tango teacher by far exeeds what he charges. His English is excellent so he could break it down for me to understand the muscle, body feel dynamic of Tango. In my opinion He should be increasing his rates by at least 50%. Highly recommend him to all my friends and people who dance tango.

Learn to dance like a porteno. Alejandro is a patient, thoughtful, and kind teacher. He quickly and precisely pinpoints the areas of your dance that need work. In each lesson he explains, then shows you, how to execute the movements, works with you to practice them, and also provides you with exercises to do on your own. Alejandro's scientific mind allows him to clearly explain body mechanics, while encouraging you to find your own "voice" to express yourself in the dance. Beginner to advanced dancers will benefit from Alejandro's masterful teaching.

"When the student is ready....". "When the student is ready the right teacher will appear" the Chinese say. This is very much the case with Alejandro. His passion, heart and knowledge of tango were evident in every lesson. I am an experienced tango dancer and Alejandro was very quickly able to identify specifics that needed work and attention as well as give me practical exercises to strengthen and really improve my dancing. He has a gentle kind manner and uses a variety of techniques to tailor a lesson to your individual needs. His lead is wonderfully light and super clear as really understands both male and female roles. After each class I couldn't wait to dance at the evening milonga! His dance studio is truly a beautiful oasis of calm and tranquility which contrasts with the "beautiful chaos" of Buenos Aires.Nicki

The BEST start to Tango!. Alejandro's enthusiasm for Tango is incredibly contagious, and his devotion to the dance is undeniable. Having had 3 lessons with him, sharing the first with my sister, we started not with the basic steps but with an understanding of the rhythm of the music and the historical context. We then learnt techniques and practised with a wide range of songs, all of different tempos. Alejandro was always encouraging and really built up our confidence. I'd love to continue learning it, it's a beautiful dance and Alejandro's passion for it has certainly spread! Although I wouldn't feel ready to dance in a milonga just yet, in only 3 hours I feel I've learnt a huge amount, and would recommend it to anyone wanting to give it a try! Thank you Alejandro.

when a scientist explains tango.... One of Alejandro's stand-out points is his ability to explain in detail and to help you put theory to practise. Of course, what do you expect from a scientist! Not all who can dance know how to teach it as well. Alejandro does that and he's got a great encouraging attitude that's really essential to the whole learning experience. For beginners to intermediate to refresher class- seekers, Alejandro will put you right on track!Another plus- the studio is gorgeous.

Amazing experience!. Taking a tango lesson with Alejandro was a wonderful experience. We had never taken tango lessons before but were really interested in learning some of the basics. Alejandro was very professional and knowledgable and put us completely at ease. We learned some beginners moves as well as gaining a deeper sense of the foundation, philosophy, and evolution of tango. Alejandro's studio is beautiful and has a great view over San Telmo, adding to the ambience. We loved it so much, we're thinking about taking lessons when we get back to New York. Thanks so much Alejandro!Harry & Marnie

You couldn't have a better intro to tango. Lessons with Alejandro were amongst the highlights of my trip to Argentina. I had never danced tango before and he gave a fantastic introduction. He is an excellent teacher and a great leader, meaning you really get to know the signals that allow you to follow. The studio is gorgeous and in an amazing block in the heart of San Telmo. Alejandro is friendly and warm and puts you at your ease. Overall, a wonderful experience.

A tremendous experience. Alejandro is a great teacher!. I write very few Trip Advisor reviews --- there is often so much one could say or not say. However, my experience with Alejandro Puerta was so special it deserves a review. There is much to say, and there is nothing to leave out --- everything about Ale’s teaching is so right. What he teaches, where he teaches and how he teaches all line up for a tremendous experience of tango. During my recent month in Buenos Aires, I had 18 private classes with Ale and each time he was ready to welcome me cheerfully to his studio, to fully share his expertise and he was prepared. Not once did I have a sense of him wondering what to do with me. He was prepared and ready --- he had a plan. What he teaches: I was learning to follow and I was so amazed at how, without teaching me sequences of steps, I was very quickly dancing much better at the milongas. It was about connection, walking, posture and responding to that connection. Of course we focussed on technique of these items and others – pivots, ochos etc, but it was not about set sequences. Where he teaches: as others have written, his studio is charming, welcoming and nicely located in San Telmo. It has air conditioning and a view and Alejandro himself.How he teaches: always positively! There was lots of good positive reinforcement, lots of constructive comment and lots of easy acceptance of mistakes. And when the particular lesson was too challenging, he easily and quickly took it down a notch to review, build and develop. And he explains why – never does he simply say: it is simply like that because.... He takes a very precise and detailed approach to explaining why the posture is like this, why the walk is like this etc --- and over the course of the month, these little pieces all came together to form a more complete picture for me. So for those of us with different learning styles he covered it all --- explanation, demonstration, and practice! Hear it, see it, do it! Very effective and while sometimes almost more info than one can absorb, one does absorb it. Did I mention patience? He is very patient and encouraging! And he turned up at a milonga he knew I was attending to have a dance or two and, as the professional he is, to quietly assess the progress I was making on the dance floor. How’s that for dedication? I had a great time in Buenos Aires and my time with Ale was the highlight. It was always so enjoyable to work with him, to be in the company of someone so passionate about what they are doing, to listen to all the ‘sweet’ music, and to be so well attended to --- not in a sugar-coated way, but in a very realistic and sensitive way that provided both encouragement and the appropriate guidance for correction and improvement. If you are seriously interested in learning tango or making improvements in your dance then I highly recommend Alejandro. Go ready to open yourself to his teaching and coaching. You won’t be disappointed and you will have fun too!Stan Holman, West Vancouver, BC, Canada.

An Expert Tango Teacher. If you want to learn Tango from a teacher who is not only an expert dancer but also a thoroughly lovely person, take lessons from Alejandro Puerta in his spacious high -ceiinged studio in San Telmo. . His passion for the music and the dance shine through as he teaches you technique, posture, timing and styling. He will tell you a little about tango history and culture too as you proceed. His empathy, sense of humour, his love for Tango and his expertise in teaching the art, make lessons with Alejandro a rewarding and memorable experience.

Trust these reviews; Trust the reputation. Alejandro is a fine teacher. I am a beginner and he gave a nice mix of beginning theory/understanding and practice.The lessons were in his apartment in a dance studio that is plenty spacious. The lessons were affordable and lasted about an hour.He was flexible and accommodating with the times.Most importantly he is a kind personality who knows how to teach tango. I appreciated the time with him greatly and highly recommend him as a teacher.

Renewed my love of Tango. Dance instruction + therapy is how I would describe my experience with Alejandro. He very nicely pointed out what was holding me back in learning tango, this is something that the group lessons I used to take back home could never do. He helped me to let go and loosen up, and this greatly improved my dancing. He is an excellent leader, and his instructions gave me an epiphany moment that I think will greatly improve my ability to follow. Not only that, but dancing with him is FUN, following while he plays with the music gave me a whole new appreciation for the tango. Practically speaking, the location is beautiful and easy to find apartment, the pricing is a great value, and he has a gorgeous cat that I wanted to steal. A wonderful experience in Buenos Aires!

Dance lessons. I have danced tango for four years and took advantage of the excellent exchange rates in Argentina to have some one to one tuition with Alejandro. He is an excellent teacher identifying and resolving a number of problem areas in my technique. I really helped me move up a level. His rates were very competitive and his lovely studio was a wonderful space in which to work.

Excellent Instructor. After 10 years of dancing Tango in the states I found an instructor who could do more than just say I was good (enough). He actually found the part of my dance that could make me a better dancer. I took it to the Milonga and proved him right! He did a wonderful job of acknowledging my talent and pin pointing my weakness with an excellent explanation of how to correct it with a vivid example of what was actually being done. I've already brought it back to the states to my students and have seen instant results. Amazing. I only wish I did more classes with him.

alejandro is a wonderful teacher.. Alejandro is a wonderful tango teacher. I have been dancing tango seriously for ten years. I have studied with some world famous teachers. Alejandro has taught me SO much! I have been to Buenos Aires seven times to dance tango. I wish I had found Ale the first time. He is a clear and understandable teacher. Very patient and very kind. My friend who is with me this trip has never danced tango. He can teach a total beginner and someone who has danced for years. My total beginner friend is already in love with tango because of Alejandro. I cannot say enough good things about him.

Great teacher. I had 2 hours of a morning to spare for some more tango and Alenjandro kindly fit me in at short notice. The lesson was at his charming apartment which had a nice dance space. Alejandro is a kind teacher and he communicates well and logically; his background as a scientist shows through when he eschews dogma for thinking through why a certain body position would be more optimal than another. I had a good time and learnt a few exercises to practice.

Buenos Aires magic. Alejandro was reccommended to me by one of his students. My first class had me in awe of a sunset scene looking over the wonderful san telmo and alejandro s introduction to the rational of tango and the more personal dimesnions of the dance style. Magic happened over my 5 private lessons.i smile as i write this because i now love tango and know i have begun another process to enhance my connection, my sense of self and my self expression. I knew instinctively that after years of cuban salsa, samba and fun in improvising and fast, exciting moves that tango was what i needed to balance my experiecne in dancing. im not a professional dancer, i dont do classes anymore but Alejandro treated me with such sensitivity, and skill, challenging me and pushing me to learn in the most exhilerating and wise manner. i absolutley pass on my reccommendation to others to be taught by him. put simply it was sooooo much fun, and yet it had profound dimensions.Beginners: take your first classes with alejandro, (and stay!) existing tango dacners: expand and deepen your understanding of tango with Alejandro

INCREDIBLE DANCE EXPERIENCE!. Alejandro gave us three private lessons in Argentine Tango at his studio in Buenos Aires on August . He is extremely knowledgeable, and taught us in a way that made the steps and character of the tango easily understandable. Our learning experience was totally enjoyable. Alejandro has the refinement of a professional and blends humor and reinforcement in his teaching style. His studio is pleasant, well, lit, clean and provides good mirrors to help the student improve.Alejandro’s knowledge of the culture and history of Argentina and the tango were truly impressive. His English was clear and easily understandable. Most important, however, was his patience. He even directed us to a milonga that was held at an opportune time. We attended it and found it very pleasurable. Our dance lessons with Alejandro EXCEEDED expectations. I highly recommend him to you. Thank you Alejandro for a life-time opportunity to learn the Argentine tango and to experience the culture of Argentina.Sincerely, Sandy Muirhead-Gould and Byron Berger, USA

No need to look further !!. What started as a call based on these trip advisor reviews, made my stay in Buenos Aires worth it. I learned tango from Alejandro for around 4 months, and I will say, that he is the best tango teacher I had so far in my life. He teaches tango not only as a dance but also as a philosophy. I am engineer and his scientist background also helped me understanding the language of tango in terms of art of science. What I liked the best, as any good teacher, you can feel his pride and happiness when you do the things right; for me its a sign that he puts more than his time in his teachings. My only problem - I am spoiled now, it will take a lot for my future tango teachers to meet his standards. Still, Highly Recommended..

One of the highlights of our trip. Alejandro is polite, friendly and makes the lessons very relaxed and enjoyable. The studio is bright and open and has beautiful views of San Telmo. We have never danced tango before and it can be pretty scary to dance in front of someone when you've no experience but it was actually very easy to dance with Alejandro there because he makes you feel totally at home and explains things in a very clear way. We had such a nice time at our lesson we booked another one! I recommend this to anyone who wants to see the beautiful, historical side to Buenos Aires' culture.

A Beautiful Experience from a Brilliant Teacher. I came to BA for a week with family and thought to take a couple of tango lessons while I was there-- I've never danced tango before. Alejandro has helped me fall in love with a new art form. He treated me not like a beginner but like a dancer. He introduced me to the main principles of tango-- connection, change of weight-- and encouraged me to listen to and feel the music we danced to. He also respected the questions I had. And we did a lot of actual dancing, which was the most fun!One thing I most appreciate about Alejandro is his philosophy that the follower has a job as important as the job of the leader. In his own dancing he is often the follower, and I really believe this allows him more empathy and a more effective way to teach followers-- he knows how subtle it is to be in that role, and unlike other teachers, he does not belittle the challenge of it. As a result I felt completely empowered as a dancer.I see now how learning tango can be a lifelong love. Alejandro gave me music to listen to and was able to recommend teachers back home, since I want to continue to dance. I highly recommend the experience of working with Alejandro, whether you just want a moment of dancing tango while you visit Argentina, or you are a serious student!
Yes!!!!. Alejandro is a great teacher and the tango lessons with him were the very highlight of my trip to BsAs! Yes, do it!!!

My favorite tango teacher in Buenos Aires. I organize a tango trip for the readers of my book Quirkyalone: A Manifesto for Uncompromising Romantics to teach them about tango (which I love very much) and the ways that tango can help us grow as people. I choose Alejandro to be the principal tango teacher for our group. He is both a fantastic tango teacher and a fantastic teacher of life. Learning tango with him is a way to learn a dance and about yourself at the same time. He is also a scientist who knows a lot about tango history. He is a gem, and if you are looking for an excellent tango teacher in Buenos Aires, look no further! Alejandro is your guy. The studio where he teaches is also gorgeous, and it is an aesthetic delight to go there, enjoy the colors, look out the windows, and enjoy the music and this fabulous experience of learning tango with Alejandro.

A lovely introduction to Tango. Buenos Aires has an intense tango scene. As a beginner it can be intimidating and there are lots of tango teachers competing for students. Alejandro rises above the crowd. He is an authentic and skilled teacher and taking lessons at his studio in historic San Telmo is a lovely experience. Alejandro does not just teach the step sequences or 'figures', rather he teaches the principles of leading and following. He taught me the 'how' of dancing tango, so that I would be able to follow any lead. He adapted the lessons to my questions and the bits of experience I had with other types of dance. This is a multi-talented teacher who will put you at ease no matter what your level of experience with tango!

A great teacher and a great time!. Alejandro is a great teacher! His studio is in a wonderful area of the city - San Telmo, and is gorgeous. He taught three of my friends and myself - none of us who had any understanding of even the basics of tango - an understanding and enjoyment of the dance. My only regret is that we didn't have more time to go back and take more classes!

A heartwarming experience. With no dance experience, my nerves were high before my first class - especially with the closeness of the tango. Alejandro set me at ease right away with his friendliness and enthusiasm... and his presence on the dance floor. After the second session, I had the confidence to accept offers to dance from complete strangers in the milongas. His teaching technique is miles above any public dance class. He teaches the method before the steps and I am so so grateful for finding him.

Studying tango with Alejandro is one of the most memorable & authentic experiences you can give yourself while in BA.. Before my first class with Alejandro, I had no previous experience with tango, or partner dancing. A clean slate.After our first session I immediately booked several more. I intuitively knew I had lucked out with a special teacher. However, I would not know exactly 'how' lucky I was until much later. I booked a class each day for the duration of my trip, which I would recommend to do if you are able.It has now been 5 months since my first class with Alejandro, and I am continuing to dance and take classes back in North America. It is interesting that almost every instructor has remarked on how strong my fundamentals are, and how well I have been taught. It has become very apparent that I have benefited greatly from learning with him.However I learned more than just technique and posture from Alejandro. More than just the tools to be stable, yet light, in my physical presence when dancing. Or how to be a considerate dance partner. Alejandro's gift in his teaching goes beyond those fundamentals.Last week I was given a message to pass on to Alejandro from a well known Argentine teacher that I studied with at a tango festival in Montreal, and I think this teacher's observation captures Alejandro's true strength very accurately. After the class, the teacher asked me to dance several times at the milonga afterwards. Later in the evening when we said goodbye, he politely apologized for asking me so often to dance, but he said that I am dancing an old style of tango that made him feel like he was back in Buenos Aires. He was very curious about how and where I learned to dance in such a traditional way. He said tango is not about knowing the most advanced steps, not about how 'pretty' it looks, but that tango is about the connection and presence, and how it feels. He asked who my teacher was, and had many questions about how I learned. He told me that he hoped I realized how fortunate I was to have been taught so well, and with such integrity. He made me promise to let Alejandro know that his teaching is appreciated, not just by me, but by him as well. He said that every teacher gives an essence of themselves to their student, and it was clear that Alejandro's was connection - true tango. He said that what I have been taught by Alejandro is more important than any step, which is the essence and heart of tango. You could not receive a greater gift to from a teacher.

Life changing!. I have just returned from Buenos Aires where I enjoyed the good fortune of learning tango over a number of weeks in the beautiful studio of Alejandro Puerta, an exceptionally gifted and inspirational teacher.Alejandro’s website had popped up during one of many online searches. After reading just the first page of his site I felt I had found the one and my instincts were encouraged by the faultless reviews I saw here on Tripadvisor. My experience proved the validity of everything I had read. On arrival I was an eager beginner. Not at zero, I had the basic idea, but poise, fluidity, balance and connection to either my partner or the music? Not at all! I was an excited head trying to remember steps but all that was to change under Alejandro’s expert tuition.From the first moment Alejandro put me at ease. There is something very light and peaceful about him that he consistently transmits through his eyes, his smile and his embrace: it fills the studio somehow and seeps into you. He explains everything articulately, suggesting images that help you grasp the ideas, planting the concepts as seeds that will surely mature and grow. His teaching is a perfect example of the self-fulfilling prophecy: he appeared to have no doubt in my ability at all and this belief managed to sweep away my own, rather stubborn and unhelpful self-doubt. The sure sign of a consummate professional, Alejandro never appeared to have an off day but was always 100% present and constantly giving his all. Each class was a richly packed experience that covered several aspects of tango. He praised, encouraged, demanded and challenged with a seemingly endless supply of patience and a brilliant sense of humour. His confidence in me, his infectious delight and excitement at any progress was utterly inspirational and spurred me on. For me, and without any hyperbole, the experience was simply life changing.Like so many city dwellers today with busy frantic lives juggling jobs, children, relationships etc., unknowingly, I had come to live mostly in my head. Somehow along the way an important part of me had closed down and I hadn’t really noticed. However, during those wonderful lessons something quiet yet profound was happening on a personal level, as slowly but surely the locks around my heart were sprung, liberating and dispelling old fears, doubts and anxieties enabling a freer flow of energy throughout my body which brought a deeper peace and a truer, more honest connection that not only transformed my dancing as I finally connected with my partner and the music but so much more. Alejandro taught me so much and I made great, deeply rooted progress. Of course there is still a good deal for me to learn and perfect but by subtly facilitating my ability to connect and giving me such a solid foundation I feel he thoroughly prepared me to face any and every new challenge and adventure in the wonderful world of tango. Wherever it takes me, I know it will be fun and life enhancing and for that I will be eternally grateful to him and to tango!

Sixteen lessons of awesomeness. I took a group of 8 teenagers from the U.S. to Buenos Aires for a month to learn tango and Spanish. I found Alejandro online, felt impressed by his website and TripAdvisor reviews, and contacted him to set up a month of private group lessons for our total group of 10.From the very beginning of our relationship, Alejandro acted with professionalism, expertise, humor, and an exquisite eye for service. Our initial conversation via Skype convinced me that he was the real deal—a tango instructor who focused on connection, not just looking good—and the rate he charged was extremely fair and competitively priced against other teachers I contacted. He went out of his way to find a rental studio near my group's apartment (even if it meant a subway commute for him) and additional leaders to balance out my group's leader-follower ratio. The lessons themselves were wonderful and perfectly paced for a group of young adult novices. By the second week our group had enough skills to start attending milongas, and by the fourth week we were ripping up the dance floors. (At least, by our standards!)Many of the members of our group (myself included) were so inspired by the group classes that they took multiple private lessons with Alejandro at his beautiful studio in San Telmo.I cannot recommend Alejandro enough for group private lessons, individual private lessons, and general awesomeness. He is the Argentine Honey Badger. Thanks Alejandro.

A Wonderful Experience. Alejandro has a wonderful way of putting you at ease. His ability to instruct is excellent and his love of tango is contagious. My husband and I had 2 two hour lessons and learned so much. With Alejandro's guidance we learned to feel the music and move with it, not just perform steps. A definite must when in Buenos Aires.

A "Must!". I couldn't come to Buenos Aires without trying to experience the soul of tango. My partner, on the other hand, had grave misgivings about the idea. Alejandro put all those to rest by providing enthusiasm, talented teaching and a quiet, beautiful space in which to practice. It's opened up a whole new world of music and posssibilities for us. Thank you so much Alejandro!Marie and Blair

Utterly unmissable . We are currently travelling the world and having got three quarters of the way around the globe have had no better or more fulfilling experience than we had learning the tango with Alejandro. Irrespective of your experience (this was our first dance lesson) Alejandro makes you feel comfortable and at ease and is a wonderful person and teacher. An incredibly memorable and authentic experience in the birthplace of tango. A privilege.

A highlight of our time in Buenos Aires. I cannot say enough about how wonderful our experience with Alejandro was. How lucky for us that he changed professions! Alejandro helped us to understand the language of tango and to connect with the music. He applauded our progress and pointed out the areas needing improvement. He gave us the insights needed to make sense of this beautiful but complex dance. If learning to dance tango is your goal, make an appointment with Alejandro!

The best, you'll never regret it!. We were two couples with some Tango lessons under our belt [acquired back home] who spent a week in Buenos Aires. At the beginning of our first two hour lesson, Alejandro saw what we could do [very little well] and then started us on the right path with steps and techniques that allowed us to actually tango well enough to joint the portenos at a milonga and feel and look totally comfortable. Before we left Buenos Aires, we took another two hour lesson that set us up even more. Alejandro is a super perceptive individual, a kind and very personable instructor who knows his stuff and teaches very very effectively in a charming salon in his apartment. Whatever level you are at in Tango, you will come away enriched with tango knowledge and further enriched by time spent in Alejandro's company.

Introduction to tango and partner dancing. We were in Buenos Aires for a month and caught the " tango" fever. We had only a week left. Alehandro offered us 5 lessons, one a day which was great. He guided us through the basic elements of partner dancing ( role of lead vs follower) the tango culture, history and of course a few moves. He was incredibly gentle but honest. We left everyday feeling closer, more in tune with our bodies and loving tango. He provides music to practice. His space is beatiful and his rates are very reasonable. We are going back next year for a month because he is THE teacher we want. We'll take a lesson a day.

Fantastic lessons!. Alejandro is an extremely good teacher, especially at explaining the technicality in each move and paying attention to the small details. The lessons are fun and enjoyable, and under Alejandro's guidance I learnt a lot in a short time. Alejandro's studio in San Telmo is very beautiful as well. I would definitely recommend taking tango lessons with Alejandro!

Excellent tango experience. One of our hopes in visiting Argentina was to experience the tango culture. We booked two tickets to Rojo Tango show (fabulous) but wanted to learn a little tango prior. For this rather uncoordinated couple, our time with Alejandro was perfection. He took the time to connect with both of us, explain the methodology and history of the tango, and slowly progress through the lesson. He's very patient, funny, and extremely kind. We felt very welcomed in his home and sensed love and dedication for his art. A month+ after our lesson, we find out selves tango-ing in our kitchen and think fondly of our lesson in BA. I also recommend a lesson prior to seeing a choreographed show -- it puts everyone in perspective. Thank you so much, Alejandro.

Brilliant Tango Lessons. I never thought that dancing would be fun for me, or that my husband and I could ever dance together, but in our tango lessons with Alejandro we learnt so much and it was really great. We are both somewhat uncoordinated and have never learnt any dancing before. However, A was so patient, observant and humorous but also with a technical skill that appealed to my engineer husband very much. We are only sorry that we did not have time for more lessons. We will continue with Tango, inspired by this super teacher who can get the best out of anyone.Thank you Alejandro.

The perfect tango experience!. Alejandro is a passionate and dedicated teacher, committed to helping people to connect with and experience the true essence of tango. If you are looking for an authentic experience, rather than memorising steps, then class(es) with Alejandro will leave you with the understand and skills you need to truly appreciate the dance. The first time I went (for 1 hour) with my boyfriend and a friend, and Alejandro was very accommodating of the group dynamics and we had a great time.We went back a second time, just the two of us, and enjoyed the class even more, as we had the time to really focus on our connection as a couple. Third lesson is this Sunday and needless to say it won't be our last! If you have time during your stay, I suggest booking in for at least two classes (as many as you can!). But if you only have time for 1, it will still be a very rewarding experience, so don't miss out. To top it all off, Alejandro is funny, warm hearted, and a real pleasure to spend time with!

Excellent tango lesson. We had a number of different tango lessons during our stay in Buenos Aires and Alejandro's teaching, suggestions, humour and approach were by far the best. His focus on technique as opposed to just teaching a few basic steps was much appreciated and helped us a lot when we danced at a milonga. His studio is a great place to learn and we left wanting to book more lessons. A real highlight of our stay. Anna and Simon
Great Tango teacher!. Kind, intelligent and Funny Person with a lots of experience in teaching Methods and in Tango. I learned a Lot! Thank you very much Alejandro!

Schedule As Many Lessons As You Can. I was visiting my brother in Buenos Aires and he was nice enough to set up lessons with Alejandro for me. I had basically no tango experience but Alejandro can work with anybody, at any level. He is patient, encouraging, observant and fun. Even if you don't think you love to dance, it is worth taking lessons from Alejandro because he is that rarest of things, an enormously gifted teacher. Of anything. He has lived in Japan and had a previous career as a molecular biologist, and it is a lucky thing for all of his students that he now applies his lively, intuitive mind to teaching tango. You'll want to schedule as many lessons with him as you can fit into your stay. They will be your favorite part of every day.

Amazing Teacher. Alejandro is more than a touristic highlight of Buenos Aires - the man is an amazing teacher, in dance and life, and beautifully blends lessons and analogies of both for a profound experience of what tango really can be. His passion, talent, patience and depth make him to be wonderful company and a wonderful teacher. He inspired in me a love for the dance, and I will always be grateful to him for that.

Fantastic teacher and amazing experience!. Taking tango classes with Alejandro was an amazing experience! I only spent a few days in Buenos Aires and left it almost until the end of my stay to book a class because, although I really wanted to learn some Tango basics, I was afraid it would end up being a frustrating or disappointing experience, as many other attempts at taking dance classes have been for me. But Alejandro’s classes were truly fantastic! I cannot recommend him highly enough! I was skeptical to say the very least, and I always struggled just letting go and believing I could do something when it came to dancing. Alejandro really knew how to get me out of that mindset, made me feel at easy and in the few hours of classes we had I felt like we achieved a lot. I walked out feeling confident and even liberated, with better posture and with a desire to learn more about tango. Alejandro is extremely good at assessing what kind of personality he has in front of him and, instead of just showing some basic steps, he really takes these personality traits into account when teaching and when showing that tango is more than just a dance. I actually changed my plans on the day I was flying out just to squeeze one more class in. I am sure I will go back to Argentina as soon as I get the chance, and I am certain I will go back for more tango classes!

The best part of our holiday!. We have been taking ballroom and Latin dance lessons now for 3 years and started learning the Argentine Tango around 6 months ago. We fell in love with it and immediately planned a trip to Buenos Aires to learn to dance the Tango by a local teacher. Taking lessons with Alejandro was the best part of our experience in this very interesting and beautiful city!We couldn't have been more fortunate in finding an instructor like Alejandro!When we messaged him, asking if he'll have time to give us 11 days of 2 hourly lessons, he immediately replied. We enjoyed the lessons so much that we squeezed in an extra day and had 12 2 hr lessons of the 14 days that we were there.Alejandro's studio is in San Telmo, a bohemian part of Buenos Aires. His studio is amazing, sunny and comfortable.From the moment we met Alejandro, he made us feel quite a home. He has a calm way about him and is very clear in explaining the different elements of the dance. He had a daily programme set for us and was extremely patient and informative. He taught us the etiquette of a Milonga and when visiting one, we felt like locals!When we arrived back in Johannesburg, our teacher was amazed at our improvement and had only positive complements for Alejandro!Alejandro, we achieved what we set out to do and more, to learn to dance from a Argentine teacher and what we got was an excellent instructor and a new friend!We highly recommend that you get in contact with Alejandro Puerta for the greatest Argentine Tango experience!

Great Intro to Tango!. I had a wonderful time learning the basics of Tango with Alejandro! His studio is tranquil and located in San Telmo so there is plenty to do before and after. I was able to take a bus (the #152 from Palermo) and walk right up Estados Unidos to his apartment, very easy to find. Alejandro speaks English fluently, so if you are not a Spanish speaker, don't worry. I've taken dance lessons before (Salsa, Jazz, Ballet) and so I've had my fair share of good, and not so good, teachers; I would categorize Alejandro with the good :-) He is an absolute gentleman and a professional, which matters because I have taken lessons as a single woman and had a teacher make inappropriate passes, very uncomfortable feeling, but not so with Alejandro! He is very patient, gives tips and correction and makes you feel at ease and comfortable making mistakes. I would certainly recommend a lesson, and you can do a walking tour of Plaza de Mayo or see a Tango Show, before or after because both are very close. This lesson was a highlight in my BA trip.

Arguably the best part of my trip to BA. First, Alejandro was prompt in responding to emails and was extremely flexible with my schedule of sightseeing. His studio, right in the middle of San Telmo and a stone's throw away from the market is in a great location and the studio is sunny and beautiful.I'd warned Alejandro that I wasn't a very good dancer, but his method of teaching: of connecting and being present took away all my doubts and fears about being able to tango. In just three lessons we were dancing using several different dance movements. He is a remarkable teacher. Extremely supportive (I lived for the little "muy bien!"s I received when I followed him correctly, or when he tried new things and I was able to navigate them) and kind and open. It would not be an exaggeration to say that I changed as a person after taking lessons from Alejandro. Learning to tango, while difficult for me because I tend to be a stressed out, over-thinker, was liberating for me. It allowed me to focus just on the dancing, and how the dancing felt. I loved every second of it.Taking three lessons from Alejandro wasn't enough. I wish I'd had enough time for 5 or 6 lessons, but I think that wouldn't have been enough either. Cannot recommend this enough.

Alejandro-"Muy, muy bien!". I call Alejandro my tango therapist and guru. After some not so good teaching experiences I had pretty much considered myself a lover of the music but not one able to participate in the dance. A friend recommended Alejandro enthusiastically and I thought "Ok, yeah, why not". The very first lesson had me understanding the dance and my place in the duo. After my 6th lesson I was very comfortable and dancing!!! Alejandro is calm, intelligent and caring. His teaching style is clear. He is passionate about tango and teaching his students the joy of the dance. Tango can be a metaphor for life. Be there, be sensitive, know the boundaries, flow and be happy. Have fun! Alejandro will welcome you into his beautiful studio and you will leave a more informed and better tango dancer. Go...learn ...from this wonderful teacher.

Wonderful teacher. A must-do in BsAs. Alejandro is a WONDERFUL teacher. My husband and I loved every minute of our lessons and learned so much from him. He was extremely patient and kind -- he is more than fluent in English, too -- and the hour(s) passed by so fast. He was so generous with his time and understanding when we had to cancel one of lessons. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend him to any visitor or local. We let go so much and communicated in new ways! Go tango!

Terrific tango teacher!. Confirming all the other glowing reviews here: Alejandro is an enthusiastic, highly skilled teacher of tango and (needless to say) an excellent dancer himself. His teaching style is encouraging, sensitive, and subtle, and I learned an enormous amount in five days of lessons. Also enjoyed the two milongas we went to. Besides his fantastic teaching, Alejandro is an admirable and responsive person, who struck me as exemplifying the best of Buenos Aires style and attitude. His studio is open and welcoming, with beautiful views out over San Telmo. (He also graciously offers touristic and restaurant recommendations if you're interested in those.) My lessons with Alejandro helped me to improve my tango dancing quickly and markedly, and I would love to go back sometime for more. I strongly recommend this fantastic tango teacher, whether for beginners or more advanced students.

A brilliant teacher. I contacted Alejandro on a Friday afternoon asking whether he could possibly fit me in for a lesson in the next couple of days and by 9am on Saturday I was having my first ever tango lesson. And I'm so glad it was with Alejandro, I can't recommend him highly enough! I had so much fun and the class flew by. As soon as it was over I immediately booked myself in for another lesson two days later and only wish I'd been staying in Buenos Aires for longer so I could have had more.Alejandro is a great teacher and I understood what he meant when he described tango as a meditative, spiritual experience. My lessons with him were honestly one of my favourite things of my four month travels around South America.

Tango Therapy. Although not proud to admit it, I am a middle-aged control freakess from Istanbul. Add to that tone deafness, I was shying away from tango classes. however, the last three days of my stay in Buenos Aires, not wanting to leave the city without even trying what I love watching, I asked Alejandro if he could be patient enough with me for me to try...that and much more, he gave me a gift of a great experience. I could put aside my urge to control for three hours and trust him to lead me through the steps. It is no easy job that he did. I thank him from the deepest corner of my heart for this condensed therapy! My only regret is not daring to start classes as soon as I arrived. Alejandro, muchas gracias por ser vos, y compartir tu pasión por tango y por la vida con tu alumna! Seguramente voy a volver a Buenos Aires un dia pronto para tomar mas clases!

Open your soul!. I took one hour each on three consecutive days while on a business trip in BA. I had taken some Tango classes 10 years or so back in Europe but really was a beginner. (Well, still am but a different one.) In those three hours Alejandro has opened my soul to the music and the rhythm of Tango, and scared away the damons inside who want you to learn Tango as something mechanical. Alejandro has the passion of a great dancer and the charisma of a great teacher. The spirit was high at any moment. I have got much more in three hours with Alejandro than in many, many more hours before (with teachers from Argentina). I truly confirm all the praise from the other reviewers and recommend classes with Alejandro.

"Life Changing Experience". When I walked into Alejandro's studio for the first time I didn't know what to expect. I was immediately struck by his authenticity. He truly loves what he does. Alejandro taught me that Tango is more than just a dance, it is an experience and a way of living. I have learned to listen more, to be more patient with others and myself, to trust myself and to follow my heart. Tango is a journey and thank you, Alejandro for showing me the way. Can;'t wait to return.

Terrific tango teacher. We were thrilled when found Alejandro for tango lessons (we took lessons as a couple). We had tried group lessons, where we hadn't made any progress and weren't connecting to tango. That all changed when we started dancing with Alejandro. He's an encouraging teacher, who gave us confidence as dancers even as beginners. He's a skilled dancer, a perceptive teacher and a fantastic all-around person. We always looked forward to our lessons and recommend him wholeheartedly to anyone wanting to learn tango. It was one of the best experiences from our time in Buenos Aires.

Total tango. Alejandro is a sensitive, intuitive person who connects really well with people. He is also an expert tango dancer. As a result he is a superb teacher. The combination of that and his fabulous studio gives you the best possible tango lessons in Buenos Aires. More than just learning steps you learn to "feel" the tango music and movement. He also explains "tango culture". In just one week of lessons with Alejandro I learnt so much about every aspect of tango as well as how to dance it. I am returning later this year for more lessons!

Best part of our trip!. We were 3 couples traveling together and our rental home owner suggested we try a tango lesson with Alejandro. It turned out to be a fantastic suggestion. Alejandro was willing to adjust schedules so we could quickly book 2 lessons for all 6 of us together. We were a larger group for Alejandro but that was no problem and we all felt very comfortable and really enjoyed the experience. To me, Alejandro teaches the "Zen" of tango. He wants you to feel the music and get in touch with yourself and figure out how to move to the music. We had all taken ballroom dancing lessons in the past and thought that what we learned from Alejandro was more significant than ever before. When we return to BA we will be visiting Alejandro for more tango.

A great way to connect with tango. It’s very easy for me to recommend Alejandro, as he’s a terrific teacher who has helped me start to understand what makes tango tick. Without him, I’d still be outside the music, appreciative but distant. Thanks to our classes, I’m starting to really feel a connection with tango.I know that Ale has students of all levels, but this review will focus on how well he guides beginners, since that’s me all over. I spend a lot of time in Buenos Aires and had always appreciated tango music, but had never danced a step.Ale teaches from a bright and cheerful studio in San Telmo, where he creates an atmosphere that is welcoming, relaxed, and non-judgmental. Now, tango is not something you master in a few classes, but right from the start, Ale was able to help me understand the “why” of tango rather than just the “how.” He never gave me steps to simply mimic. Instead, he gradually explained the key concepts of balance, posture, connection, and musicality. Tango is really a philosophy as much as it is a dance, and I’ve barely scratched the surface, but I’m so glad that I started here, with Alejandro, rather than in a class (like a couple I’ve since tried in New York) where the focus is on learning steps and intricate patterns, rather than understanding what you’re doing and why you’re doing it. Like all good teachers, Ale is extremely sensitive to his student’s strengths and weakness. He has a strong intuitive sense of when to push and when to praise. If you’re even a little bit curious about dancing tango, I can’t imagine a better introduction.

A Superb Intro to Tango. During a short 5 day visit to Argentina recently,my wife and I, along with our female friend who was travelling with us, decided that being in Buenos Aires, it would make sense to experience in some small way the unique cultural experience that is tango. After browsing Tripadvisor and determining that spending big pesos to see a splashy show wasn't our thing, we came across the idea of trying to arrange a lesson, followed by a trip to observe at a Milonga, where tango is pursued by locals who love it.The manager of the vacation rental where we were staying happened to know of an instructor in the San Telmo area, which is how we were referred to AlejandroNow, being one of the worst dancers I know, you might question my ability to judge who is, and who is not, a great instructor. That's probably a fair comment, but what I can say is that Alejandro was very patient and understanding, and managed in a very short time to teach us enough of the basics, as well as the unique etiquette involved in being at a Milonga, to give us at least a start in appreciating this fascinating area of dance.Plus, he never laughed at me once, something I can't say of my wife that evening. And all of this at a cost that was a small fraction of what we could have paid at the splashy show.All of us agreed that our evening with Alejandro was time and money well spent.

a teacher with more of an coach. Having lessons with Alejandro in Tango was very intense, both in meaning of physical and knowledge terms. He just adapdet everything to my personal needs, for example the time of the lesson, the duration, the procession and the speed. With his professional instructions i always felt highly motivated and so increased a lot during our shared time. The place and atmosphere are beautiful as his character is and I will miss both of them.

Amazing teacher, amazing experience. I spent a few weeks in Buenos Aires earlier this year. I decided to take a lesson with Alejandro on the recommendation of another woman I met in my neighborhood; little did I know that I would end up taking lessons almost daily from Alejandro over the course of my stay. I cannot recommend him enough. I really feel like I learned to tango fairly well and to understand the spirit of tango (it's better than therapy!). Alejandro is such a wonderful, kind, respectful person that I immediately felt comfortable with him. Truly, my days spent taking classes with Alejandro are among some of the best of my life.

Soul of Tango. For those who want, even in a short period of time, to probe the depth and complexity of tango, Alejandro's classes are the answer. We only had time for two classes, but in them we came to understand something of the music of tango and, most importantly, the posture, the grace of movement and depth of emotion that makes the dance what it is. "Be honest with me!" Alejandro insists. And while I didn't feel that I yet knew enough about what I was doing to be either honest or dishonest, I understood that what he was trying to convey was the expressive soul of the dance.  In addition to lessons, I highly recommend taking Alejandro along for a guide when going to your first milonga. He accompanied us to an early evening event at the Galician community center, a remarkable experience we would never have managed on our own. Here, the women sit on one side and men on the other, and, as Alejandro explained, exchange coded signals before the man advances to the women's side, she stands, and they grip each other in what appears to be the most passionate of embraces. Then, as Alejandro explained, protocol required that the partners stay together through the stages of the dance, stopping to chat amiably between numbers. Though I had seen a lot of tango movies and so had not entirely believed Alejandro when he told us somewhat firmly, "It's not about sex," I came to feel that what he said was true; the dancers were experiencing some other kind of connection that I still don't quite grasp, but that, without Alejandro, I would never have even glimpsed.

Superb tango experience - instruction, history, music and dancing. I moved to Buenos Aires to live for 5 months last year. Being a salsa dancer, it was high on my agenda to learn tango to gain an appreciation for this dance that is so entwined with the history of Buenos Aires. I sought out and tried several recommended instructors in the city. Alejandro stood head and shoulders beyond any other instructor that I met. His teaching methodology, his elegant dancing ability, his love of the music and history, his ability to get you dancing gracefully and confidently in a seemingly short amount of time amazed not only me, but the numerous other people to whom I had recommended Alejandro. I was also able to attend a few milongas with Alejandro during my time there during which he introduced me to the culture and etiquette of tango, something that many instructors don't bother teaching or even mentioning. For me, this was an intriguing part of the immersion into the past and present of the dance and its history in this grand city. Whether you are a complete beginner at tango, an aficionado or an advanced dancer, I would highly recommend taking classes with Alejandro. He is fluent in English, Spanish, Japanese and all things tango-related. Don't miss the chance to experience a major part of the history and culture of Buenos Aires. Take some tango lessons and go to a practica or milonga where beginners are welcomed. Buena suerte!

The perfect city escape!. This was my 2nd time doing Argentina Polo Day and it won't be my last. I couldn't imagine a better way to spend a day outside of the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires... endless grounds to explore and cups of wine to drink, one of the most amazing asados served at one big table where everyone sits together like family, top of the line polo fields and equipment, and of course the beautiful horses and other animals running around (there were puppies this time)! I took a couple friends who were visiting me in BA. They absolutely loved it and we actually ran into a couple other folks there that were recommended Argentina Polo Day by a friend who had visited me and gone before. Word travels fast when so worthwhile :) I highly recommend Argentina Polo Day to anyone visiting BA or who wants to get some fresh air con buena onda!

Beautiful time in a Private Polo Club. I booked this last minute, the night before, not sure if this was a tourist trap or not. I got fast and complete reply and it is not a trap! It's a beautiful experience. Our guide Pablo was fun and smart, the day is well organized with a good pace. The food was incredible, the wine was good and in generous quantity. Horses are well trained, it's easy to learn, but beware the aches the day after lol! The location is beautiful. So glad I booked this!

Amazing. Once again Ruben and his crew made out a great day for us. I went with two of my friends and, despite a rainy day, we hand a great Asado, and had the chance to try Polo. "La carona" is a lovely place where you can breathe "campo". I highly recomend this program.

Great experience for third time. I visited Ruben and Celia already the third time. 3,5 years ago on the old camp it was just incredible, now on the new one its hardly to top. Organization, food, camp, friendliness are perfect. Will definetly come back and can recommend a day or more there to everyone who would like to escape from big city life, get to learn polo and enjoy some great food in a friendly atmosphere.Markus

Great vacation. This was the best vacation experience I have ever had. Celia and Rubin are incredible hosts and make you feel like part of their family when you visit. You have an incredible snack and wine on arrival, you watch a fun polo match and learn the rules, then you have a beautiful lunch with the family and then play polo. Everyone was wonderful and welcoming. I will absolutely go back.

MUST DO IN BUENOS AIRES. What an amazing day! This is an absolute must for anyone coming to Buenos Aires. Pablo picked us up from where we were staying in BA to bring us to the beautiful ranch where we were immediately served empanadas and wine. This was followed by first watching/learning about polo, an asada, and then us actually playing polo! I can't say enough about this experience and will do again anytime I'm in BA!

Such an awesome day!. We had such an incredible time not only learning to ride a horse for the first time, but to actually play polo was something we didn't even think would be possible. Pablo was an amazing host. He was prompt in picking us up from our hotel was a very patient teacher and returned us home in one piece with beaming smiles in our faces. The property was beautifully maintained and the staff were super helpful. This day out was the absolute highlight of our 5 week trip to South America and we have been raving about it to anybody who'll listen.If you are considering Argentinian Polo Day and are unsure due to lack of experience on a horse we highly recommend that you give it a go. You'll absolutely love it.
Amazing polo experience to recommend!. Perfect organization, nice people and excellent food. An amazing day when we could experience real Argentinian polo!

GLAD I FINALLY DID IT. I want to express my gratitude for the great experience of finally going to the Polo Grounds in Argentina. Being there numerous times over the years is one highlight that I have not encountered.The weather was perfect. You could not have asked for anything better.The service from the inception of arriving till the time we departed was exceptional. Everybody was friendly, hospitable, attentive and welcome you like family.The wine was plentiful and the food was delicious.Being there at the polo grounds was a treat as I had never personally been. I enjoyed it immensely and had the opportunity to learn how to play and participate later in the afternoon.If you think POLO is easy to play, guess again. It is more challenging and you need the horse to be your best friend.You need to make this a must on your trip as I will be back the next time I come there.Michael

Trip highlight. We deliberated over booking this due to the price but it was absolutely worth it. The setting is amazing, the BBQ was enormous and very tasty but the highlight was the polo lesson and game afterwards. Pablo and the stable hands are excellent with the horses and had us all working up a sweat which was much more than we expected.

never expected i would do this in this life!. the people of argentina polo day made it possible to actually play a game of polo on a real horse with the real equipment. on top of that they serve you a marvellous meal in a peaceful beautiful surrounding.

Must-Do in Argentina. This was one of the best experiences in my whole life. Something completely out of the ordinary to say the least. We were greeted with some delicious wine and empanadas and the barbecue lunch was beyond delicious. Still drool when I think of it. Second half of the day played polo for a couple hours and it was blast. Overall, this is not something to miss.

Must-Do. The day we spent at this ranch was the highlight of our BA trip. The hosts were so nice and the grounds were beautiful. It would have been a highlight if we hadn't gotten to ride horses. The food and wine were spectacular. It was such a relaxing and enjoyable experience. But riding horses and playing a little polo and learning about the sport were really amazing. I highly recommend this trip; our vacation would have been lacking if we hadn't made the investment to spend the day here.

A 'must do'! Put this on your 'short list'!. So - after making your list for BA - Recoleta, Teatro Colon, Ateneo, Fuerza Bruta, MALBA, historical sites, parques, maybe tango...lots of food, you need to add Argentina Polo Day! This was SO MUCH FUN! I love visiting BA, but wanted to break up our week with a trip to the country. I had to choose between a trip to an estancia or Argentina Polo Day. I chose Argentina Polo Day because of the great reviews and because I felt it would be nice to actually "do" something as opposed to walking and sitting and eating. What a great choice! I still get kudos from the fam. I am in my 50's traveling with my husband and 19-year-old son. Together, we've been on horses - maybe 6 times, so we are novices. The experience was delightful. We were driven to a polo club in the country where we learned about polo - who knew? and actually rode horses and actually played polo (albeit in a smaller area!) The wine flowed freely. The food was delicious. The teaching was excellent. Every interaction was upbeat and friendly. So, we learned something new, we got some exercise, we enjoyed meeting new people and we got to share this experience as a family.As you can see, I cannot recommend this highly enough. So, go ahead a sign up! On another note - it was refreshing to work with a company that was friendly and accommodating. (As you will see, or may soon know, the concept of 'customer service' is inconsistently applied in Argentina.) With so much trip planning, I messed up with respect to payment options and Argentina Polo Day figured out a solution and was very kind and everything worked out.

Best day in Buenos Aires!. Ruben and Celia have created a beautiful, well maintained polo club and are extremely gracious hosts with close attention to every detail of our visit. Poly did a great job explaining the game and patiently coaching a novice rider. I was pleasantly surprised to actually hit the ball with the mallot and stay on the horse! The entire staff was very accommodating and the lunch and empanadas were excellent (best beef we had in Argentina). Truly the most memorable day of the stay in Buenos Aires!! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a new experience with friendly, fun people.

Yihaaaaa!! . That was simply amazing! Loved everything about it. We were welcomed with open arms and treated like kings. We couldn't have asked for anymore drink or food and the entire day (despite raining) was great fun. Pablo was really upbeat and a great host and even the polo payers that joined us for lunch were chatty and good fun.The nicest thing about it was that regardless of ability they were able to cater the day to suit all. There was 4 of us (plus an Argentinian polo groom on each team). 1 of us couldn't ride at all, 2 could bob about and then we had one experienced rider. In order to cater for us all they helped the non rider and blocked the good rider to enable it to be an even playing field.When I come back to BA I will definitely be returning to Argentina Polo Day!

Such a unique, cool experience learning everything there is about Polo!. We had the BEST day at Argentina Polo day! Our transfer to and from the ranch, instructors on the day - Poly & Stefan were LEGENDS! As soon as we arrive, we were sipping on wine and eating empanadas. We watched a polo match in action and learnt the history and rules of Polo, getting a little hands on during breaks. We were introduced to the horses and riders then headed for a BEAUTIFUL lunch 'Asado'. Some of the best BBQ we had in South America! Although we didn't speak Spanish, lunch was served with some of the players and family on the ranch which was so welcoming and nice! After lunch and more wine :) we took to the polo field with Horses ourselves. The instructors were wonderful helping me along every bit of the way. My partner was very comfortable on horses, where as this was my second time - Stefan was patient and positive in his approach with me learning. I walked away so happy with my efforts but couldn't have done it without the help on the day from the team! THanks for a truly amazing and unique experience!

A great experience. We had a really fun day out with Argentina polo day. They picked us up & then it was about a 45minute - 1 hour drive away. On the way we watched a video all about polo, how to play, history etc. Once we arrived we got to watch a polo match & then practise our skills & technique. After this, we had a delicious lunch, a huge Argentinian BBQ & wine then we were able to get the chance to play polo ourselves. Despite having never played polo & rarely having ridden a horse, we had lots of fun. We then finished the day with a horse ride around the vast property. We had a great day & I would highly recommend this experience.

I don't like horses, but this was an AMAZING day!. My wife and I are in Argentina on a year-long traveling honeymoon and we decided on a whim to spend a day learning to play polo. To be honest, I've never liked horses, they're like the Kardashians: they are beautiful but they scare me. But I have to say this was one of the most fun days I've ever had (and I used to jump out of planes for a living). The Argentina Polo Day team are AMAZING, they walk you through everything until you're comfortable, and in no time you're on a horse charging down a field toward your wife waving a big stick at her: awesome! The food was great, the people were genuinely lovely, and whilst I'm still battered and bruised from falling off my horse (my own fault, I wanted to beat my wife, not with the stick, just to score another goal), I'd absolutely do it again tomorrow (if the bruises fade and I can walk by then). Highly recommend this!

Great experience. We had a wonderful time with Argentina Polo Day. We had very little experience with horses but our host Agostina was very kind and helpful. Lunch was delicious and the polo match was great fun, despite the wet weather. We were also able to go on a trail ride around the property, which was beautiful. Would highly recommend as a day trip while in Buenos Aires.
Awesome day. It's a beautifull place to stay, lovely hostess and great wine and food. But of all an awesome experience to practise Polo!!!

Wonderful Argentina Polo Day. A very professional and well organized trip from start to finish. An opportunity to watch, learn and play polo in a safe environment and on a beautiful Polo estate about an hour from Buena Aires. We enjoyed wonderful food and wine to! There was nothing not to like on this trip and would highly recommend it to others!

Fun filled day.. Polo day was one of the highlights of my trip to Argentina. The ranch is situated about one and a half hours outside BuenosAires and is definitely worth the trip.The entire experience is well planned and enjoyable. The atmosphere is very homely and a lovely meal awaits on Arrival along with an endless supply of wine. You then get to watch a polo match with short walking lessons between rounds. There after you a treated to a hearty lunch and then your off to mount some horses and get involved in a polo game of your own. It's really a once in a life time experience to ride such well trained horses and partake in such a great sport.They are very accommodating of food preferences however their main dishes are beef, so alternates should be requested earlier.The guides are energetic and helpful and contribute to enhancing your entire experience.Photographs are taken through the day of your different activities which are then posted to Facebook where you can then access them.I loved this day trip and would definitely recommend it to other travelers.

Fun and Fantastic-Even if you have never been on a horse!. This was the highlight of our trip to Argentina! Having no experience with horses, our hosts were fantastic and made us feel very comfortable and safe. The setting, food and company made this a wonderful day and because of this experience we are looking to attend polo matches in our area.

Great experience!. Definitively an amazing experience! Kids friendly, good food, relaxing , fun and amazing staff!!! If you can spend time, I would recommend to stay over night to really enjoy everything the place has to offer!

Wet day at Polo. All though the weather wasn't the best, we still had a good time at the polo, got to watch a match, learn how the game was played, the barbecue they cooked up for lunch was amazing, so much food, so i would suggest not eating a big breakfast. plenty of wine too. we got to head out on horses and play a game ourselves, such a hard sport, defiantly worth a day trip..

Great experience. We attending the full polo day in August 2016 and thoroughly enjoyed it! As a group of 8 we had different level of experience as riders, from confident and competent to complete beginner, they catered for all levels and every single member of the group played and enjoyed polo. From the moment we arrived they were great hosts, food was AMAZING (BBQ is a experience within itself!!) and our wine glass was always full. If you have a day free in BA I would fully recommend, its great to be out of the city and they pick you up and drop off at your hotel so hassle free!! ENJOY
Lovely day. We had a beautiful day at the argentina polo. Lovely place, delicious lunch and excellent service. The game with the horses was fun!

amazing experience . If you're in the area, this is a must do!! It was probably my favorite day in Argentina and one of my favorite of all time. Great value for money, beautiful place, and they treat you like royalty!

Best day of Argentina. This place is AMAZING. It is an absolute MUST do. And despite not being cheap, the value for money is incredible. The place is gorgeous, the horses are incredibly well trained, and the day is meticulously well planned. You'll drink plenty of wine, eat delicious food (the best empanadas I've had in Argentina - and that's saying a lot!) watch an amazing game (it's SO spectacular in person) and shock yourself with the fact that you actually CAN play polo. This day is 100% worth it - i recommend it to anyone thinking of more than a couple days in Buenos Aires! It's a perfect way to break up the city time and see the "provincia," get the classic "campo" experience, learn about the culture, and get some exercise. Enjoy!!

100% worth it. Our group of six were definitely skeptical going in to this, but Argentina polo day was the best part of our stay in Buenos Aires.Wine is close at hand during all parts of the trip. The ranch is gorgeous. The food is excellent and plentiful. Pablo and the other instructors are extremely nice and make you feel like a pro even though you have no clue what you're doing. Believe the reviews. This is awesome.

ABIERTO DE PALERMO / BUENOS AIRES. The best experience you can have in Buenos Aires if you come between September till December, You have 3 opens with the best players in the world 10 Handicap. Open Tortugas, Open Hurlingham and Open Palermo. At the 3 get to watch No.1 polo player in the World Adolfo Cambiaso-La Dolfina..you cannot miss watching him play and his team La Dolfina. Awesome, out of this world. I am Argentine so I spend those months watching polo.

Great Day out even if you don't ride. My 14 year year old and I had a great time. We haven't ridden much but this was not a problem at all. After arriving and eating a traditional pie baked on a wonderful BBQ we watched a match to get the feel for how it is done. Then after a great lunch El Campo style it was our turn. The horses were fantastic despite our lack of knowledge we all managed to play and even score goals. Highly recommended.

Fun polo day. I took part in this activity in May and had so much fun. We drove about 1,5 from Buenos Aires to the countryside. Our guide explained about the sport and we got to see how the professionals play. After a lovely asado lunch with wine it was time to give a go ourselves. It was so much fun, i don't know exactly for how long we played but it felt too short!! I would recommend this activity for everyone even though it's a bit on the expensive side. Was definitely one of the highlights of my Argentina trip.

Consistently amazing!. I live in Argentina now and recommend Argentina Polo Day to all of my friends that come to visit. Every time it is a huge success and a highlight that we talk about endlessly afterward! This is truly an all-in-one experience: authenticity, culture, tradition, activity, a beautiful part of the suburbs few tourists get to see, and in true Argentine fashion, a delicious asado with vino. Cannot say enough good things about Argentina Polo Day!
Contiki Argentina Polo Day. Absolutely fabulous - great people, great food and wine, and fun times. The drive there from Buenos Aires was a bit long but definitely worth it.

Best Activity in Argentina. This was an extraordinary activity, one that my family and I have never done before, it was completely different from any others and was an activity we enjoyed since it started. I would definitely tell you to buy your tickets for this Argentina Polo Day, so you get to know what you do in the best activity in argentina.

Argentina Polo Day - Fantastic experience. Went to the polo farm today and enjoyed every minute of it! The staff is very warm, welcoming and attentive. Food was great and the polo really good fun! Can only highly recommend it.

Fantastic!. One of the best days ever. Superb hosts, delicious food (and so much of it), and beautiful venue and surroundings.Watching the match was great...and then playing polo (when I'm new to horses) was a complete blast. Do it!

Full fun day!. We had a great day at the polo club! It was the off season so it was a little different playing polo on the dirt but very cool that even in the off season they can still accommodate you and they still have members of the club playing in polo matches everyday, (which is something not ever polo place has) Upon arrival we were greeted with wine! And more wine! Then a fabulous lunch with an endless amount of asado! Then you go out and engaged in a polo match yourself! Very cool. It's not like the pros.... Your not galloping around by any means... But still very fun and challenging! We had a fabulous time and highly recommend this activity. It is a very long day and you will be exhausted by the end of it!

Amazing day!. This was one of my favorite days in Argentina! HIGHLY RECOMMEND! My friend and I were picked up by a driver at 10am with two other ladies in the car. We drove out to the ranch and were greeted with wine and empanadas! After having a snack we headed outside to watch a polo game! We got to throw the ball onto the field to start the game, ring the bell to end it, meet the horses and players, and learn about the rules of polo. After the game, we went inside for an amazing lunch. Lunch consisted of more wine (because wine not?), grilled vegetables and lots of different grilled meats including sausage and steak. After lunch we learned how to play polo! I had never ridden a horse before, but the instructor was great at showing me how to ride and then eventually actually hit the balls! By the end we were playing an actual polo match! In the summertime, you can relax by the pool after polo, but I was there in the winter so we went back inside by the fire and ate some dessert. This really was a perfect day!

A lovely day!. This was such a fun day! We were picked up at our hotel in Buenos Aires and driven out to the polo ranch. In the bus we were asked in anyone is a vegetarian or gluten free. This thrilled me as I am gluten free.Upon arrival at the ranch were were served snacks (special gluten free ones for me) and wine then thought the basics of polo and watched a game. From there were served a delicious and plentiful lunch then on to learn how to play! The gradient in which we were taught was so perfect I think that even people who don't ride horses could learn.The ranch was beautiful, the food delicious, and the polo so much fun!

Great day!. Great day out learning to play polo!We were picked up at our hotel in BA and within an hour arrived at the beautiful polo ranch where we were offered empanadas and malbec. We then watched a polo match, whilst learning the rules and practicing with the stick in between chukkas. After a fantastic bbq lunch we mounted our horses and practiced with the polo members. We then played a match amongst ourselves and afterwards walked the horses around the ranch. I was very suprised at how much fun it is to play a polo match!! After dessert and more red wine we were returned to our BA hotel. All in all it was a great day and a memory to cherish!!!

Argentina Polo Day great for families!. Argentina Polo Day was a great experience for everyone in our family. My wife and I, her sister, and our two children, ages 9 and 11 all had an experience we will remember for years to come. Well worth the cost and time. It was an all day event where we all learned the game of Polo by not only watching club members play the game, but also had instruction on the basics. When we arrived they met us with wine, coffee and empanadas, I think I ate 8 empanadas. We then watched a very good game of Polo played by the club members. Most notable was that along with the five of us, there was one other person on the trip that day and the organizers were able to get all of us on horses after an INCREDIBLE lunch and play a game of Polo. I have not been on a horse since I was 10 (I'm 44 now) and my kids had not rode before either. We all had a great time. The staff that runs the place were all friendly and extremely gracious.I've been fortunate to travel to many places with my family and we've done some great adventures. Argentina Polo Day stands as one of the most memorable, best organized events we've ever participated in on a family vacation.

Amazing Experience. This was the greatest experience! They catered to a large group of us and were very attentive. The empanadas were amazing and the wine was superb! I loved playing polo for the first time and learning more about the game. I'd absolutely recommend!
