You Must Do This!. Trust that you will not fall off the horse, that you CAN play polo and that you will have an experience you'll be talking about for years! This is the most fun you can have in one day. Just do it!

Brilliant day out at the polo. . The polo day was the highlight of my stay in Buenos Aires, it was so much funPicked up around 10, we were taken with 4 other guests to a ranch about an hour outside of the city. On arrival, we were told to relax by the lovely fire in the lounge (it was a cold day) and offered empanadas and red wine.Then we were taken to a small polo field to watch a game between some players to get an understanding of the game and a brief introduction to the rules. At breaks in the game we were shown how to hold the mallet, hit the ball and taken to see some of the horses taking part.A delicious lunch followed (either meat or veggie), more red wine and coffee and then it was time to put theory into action as we donned our polo gear and played a game. The guys are in the arena with you to help and you get plenty of practice on the horse before the game starts.We all had a terrific time, getting a great sense of accomplishment when hitting the ball! After the match we stayed on the horses for a trot around the grounds followed by a scrumptious dessert (and more wine).Highly recommended no matter if you've never ridden a horse before. They'll take care of you.

Fun outdoors day. I was born and raised in buenos Aires and came to visit with my boyfriend, who had never been. Wanted to have a fun day in the countryside and Ruben and Celia really nailed it putting together this wonderful experience! We not only felt like at home but it was fun and very authentic. You might be able to go to other places that are just put together for the "tourist crew". This ain't it. This was real. Great job!! A must to visit for everybody!!

Excellent Experience!!! . First time ever playing polo and very little experience horseback riding but I had an amazing time! Thanks to the great and professional teacher. All the other staff members were very nice too! Great food and unlimited wine made the day complete. I highly recommend this to everyone. It's also a nice way of escaping from the city centre. I will do it again next time I'm around.

Great experience. The entire experience was so fancy and adventurous at the same time. Watching the players and then actually playing the game was super exciting. Overall an unforgettable fun time from the beginning until the end.

So. Much. Fun!. This was one of the best things we did in Argentina! The experience feels uniquely Argentinian (as another reviewer said), and is so much fun! We did the complete day tour. Our pick-up was on time, clean and comfortable; transfer was about an hour. The estancia, which doubles as polo club and small hotel, is absolutely gorgeous. It feels like a completely different world just a skip away from the city. Upon arrival we were greeted with hot meat empanadas fresh off the grill and a healthy glass of Malbec. Pablo, our guide/polo instructor, was fantastic. He was funny and informative and totally knew how to calm me down when my horse got a little “excited” during our polo match later in the afternoon.The overall program… We spent the morning sipping Malbec and listening to Pablo explain the tradition of polo in Argentina and the rules of the game, all while watching members of the Corona Polo Club play a friendly game of four chukkers. We also hit a few practice balls (off horse) to get ready for the game in the afternoon. We then had a lovely asado (lunch) with the players, Pablo, the owner and horsehands; all of whom were very warm, welcoming and friendly. After lunch we then had a chance to play ourselves. Tito was my practice partner who patiently continued the ball for me when I would miss it completely or grow a little weary in the wrist. After a bit of practice we all played a short game which really made my husband and I appreciate the skill of the game. (We were terrible.) We then ended the afternoon more glasses of Malbec, a delicious tiramisu and transfer back to Buenos Aires. It really was a lovely day and something you will not really experience anywhere else. A must if you are in Buenos Aires!

Great experience, would do it again!. This was a unique and wonderful experience. The staff were very friendly and the location was beautiful. They actually let you get on a horse and play polo! I was unsure of how much action we would see, but it was the real deal. After some instruction, they put you on a real polo pony and let you play just like you were a member. From galloping after the ball to scoring goals and bumping other players. It was so much fun! The food and wine were also great.

Conitki Polo Day - April 2016. Had such a great time watching, learning, and playing polo!That along with the unlimited wine and steady flow of empanadas and steak was amazing!Highly recommend for a fun day in Argentina.
Great full day polo experience with private lessons. Fantastic day with pickup at hotel in Buenos Aires, polo lessons, great food and people. Will definitely come back
Polo Country. Had a really great time; great food, fun & weather. Our "group" was only three and we got along well. Though the horse didn't always do what I wanted it to do - we got along too!

Argentina Polo Day. My husband and I had a fantastic time at the polo day. Please see my review below.Positives: - The owner was extremely fast on all responses to my emails (much appreciated)- My husband had never been on a horse before but they were great with teaching him how to ride and placing him on an older horse- The food was delicious along with the wine (and quite a lot of options as well with the meat (the food kept coming at lunch)- The horses are rather old and easy to learn polo while riding (for sure a beginner activity). Recommendations- I recommend going with a smaller group if possible. We were there with two other ladies and it was perfect. - I recommend wearing/bringing rain boots to ride with (or boots you do not care about). We went when it was pouring down rain and very muddy). Despite the rain we still had a good time. Areas to improve:- The car that collected us was a 2 door car for 5 people (the driver, +me and my husband, +2 other individuals). It was a very small and could have been very awkward. Luckily we were with 2 other great people, but still very tight for over and hour to the facility and over an hour back. All around we had a great day and one of our highlights from the trip!

Awesome Affair. Every moment of this day was well worth it. From pick up to drop off. The host was awesome, the food and the day itself. I have a whole new respect for Polo. I loved the history behind it and the farm we got to watch and play polo on. The people were very nice and accommodating. Beautiful horses and a dog to play around with. Before I came here I was only a white wine fan. I actually walked away with a favorite red wine, who would have thought. Would do this again.

Amazing Day in Argentina. We spent a full Saturday outside of Buenos Aires learning how to ride horses, play polo, drinking wine and eating fantastic food. The estancia is beautiful, and the staff was wonderful. We were greeted upon arrival with wine and empanadas, and then got to watch a polo match. After the match, we had a multi-course lunch in the patio area, and then headed out to ride horses for the afternoon. Having never been on a horse before, the staff was extremely helpful and taught us everything that some of us needed to know. We played a pretend polo game and then rode the horses out into the beautiful fields. I loved this day and would highly recommend Argentina Polo Day for anyone looking for an unforgettable day trip outside of the city.
Amazing!. We had an amazing day! If you go to Argentina this is a must. Out in the country, with great wine, great food and can't say enough about the hospitality.

Perfect day on the countryside. Where to begin?We truly did not know what to expect when the bus came to pick us up at the hotel in the morning...but our friend who recommended this excursion deemed it a "MUST" - and we now absolutely agree! Wow, what a day.Connie, our amazing guide, picked us up in a bus and we took a nice drive to the country. Once we arrived, we were immediately handed a glass of Malbec and a warm empanada fresh off the parrilla (I had two and half of my father's...they were so delicious!). We then walked out to the polo field area on the sprawling green estate that had a little resident dog that was so friendly. Ruben, one of the owners of the estate kindly lent me a sweater because I was a little chilly.We were seated on the bleachers facing the polo field, offered more wine and refreshments, and Connie explained the game of polo to us. The players came out on the field, and we were able to watch a match and knock the ball around ourselves in between each chukker. After the game ended, our group suited up, got on the horses and played a polo game! Not easy! But the horses were sweet, and each team had a pro to assist in moving the game along.By the end, we were exhausted, laughing and HUNGRY.Of course the parrilla was already fired up, and they served us an amazing meal with more wine, amazing Argentinian meat, grilled vegetables, and chocolate cake because it was someone's birthday! At that point, the group felt comfortable and relaxed and it was truly nice to celebrate someone - as a friend, not just a stranger.As we ate outside under a roof, it started to drizzle ever so slightly, and it became such a perfect moment. It was like out of a dream. Ruben and Celia, the owners, collect artifacts that outfit their beautiful and rustic home there. It was very cool to see some Argentinian history as well.At the end, we were sad to leave. Back on the buses we went, back to our lives.I most certainly would love to return, and even do an extended stay.Connie and others took so many photos throughout and they send you a link on Facebook afterwards, which is amazing so you can look back on the incredible day with new friends.I cannot recommend Argentina Polo Day enough. It was complete, perfect, and so memorable. Very grateful for the experience.

Best BA Day Trip!. This was a perfect day excursion for the family. Well organized, the empanadas to start were delicious, the lunch off the parilla was excellent, and learning and playing polo was so unique and fun!
I highly recommend!
Fantastic experience. Great food, great people and fantastic experience playing polo. Highly recommended, no experience needed either.

Best Argentine Parilla!. The best thing about polo day is the food. When you arrive they great you with a glass of wine and empanadas fresh off the grill. These are the best empanadas I have ever tasted. They must be homemade by Ruben himself! The traditional Argentine barbecue is slow cooking on a wood grill right in front of you when you arrive. They serve several excellent cuts of "tiro de asado", "lomo," and "chorizo." You can select as many cuts as you like. All accompanied with grilled vegetables, fresh salads, and all the Malbec you can drink!

Unforgettable Day!. My wife and I went to Buenos Aires on our honeymoon and were told by friends not to miss out on this experience. We could not have been happier with the Argentina Polo Day team! They picked us up from our AirBnb in the city, drove us along with 3 other couples out to the ranch, treated us to empanadas, wine, a polo match, an incredible lunch of grilled meats and veggies and then we got to play real polo! Even though I didn't have a ton of experience with horses, these polo ponies are so well trained they make it easy. I had a blast and would absolutely recommend this to anyone!

A fabulous day, whether you ride or not!. A beautiful setting, fantastic food, lovely and friendly family. We watched a match and learned the basics, had lunch and then my daughter and I had a go playing polo whilst my husband and my son (allergic to horses) chilled by the pool / had a glass of wine. We rode around the club, met other players and guests and it was a great day out and a real experience. The family could not have been more welcoming and this was the experience of a lifetime!

Fancy a chukka. Fabulous day out, the weather wasn't the best, but still had an amazing amount of fun.Met some really cool people, all the staff were great, you must do this if you visit Buenos Aires.The polo is amazing fun, and you realise how hard after watching the real players, but anyone can have a go. Add the fabulous food, wine, and other really good fun people. Don't think about it just book!They even helped sorting some other events out for us too, like tickets at the BOCA.

Expensive but worth every penny!. Our full day of polo with Argentina Polo Day is one of the highlights of our two week trip through Argentina! The price was a bit shocking to us at first, but you truly get a lot for your money - transportation to and from your hotel in Buenos Aires, a full day of watching and playing polo, empanadas upon arrival, unlimited wine all day, and a lunch feast. The staff at Argentina Polo Day was extremely warm and welcoming, and they clearly had experience dealing with first time polo players of all abilities. My husband took quickly to riding the polo horse, bumping, and hooking, but I was much more apprehensive as it was my first time riding a horse. One of the staff members continually checked on me and gave me advice to relax and enjoy the experience. Argentina Polo Day is truly a gem and a great opportunity to experience the beautiful nature Argentina has to offer just a short trip outside of the city.

Perfect day in the countryside!. If you have the time, you HAVE to join Celia and her team at Argentina Polo Day! We were in BA on our honeymoon and friends recommended this place to us -- so happy we went! It was one our honeymoon highlights. They conveniently pick you up where you're staying in the city, you arrive to wine and empanadas, you're on a beautiful countryside property watching a polo match, you learn about polo and the horses, drink more wine, have a delicious asada bbq on a long table overlooking the green landscape, and then you're on the horses, getting comfortable with riding and play a 'kiddie version' of polo with other attendees. If the weather is nice, you can hop in their pool after the match! So much fun. Great instruction. Celia and her family and staff are so warm and welcoming! Full disclosure, I've never been too comfortable on a horse and my husband doesn't have much riding experience, but we had so much fun and everyone was able to take their time on the horses at their own speed -- I really appreciated this. The horses are so well trained and really responsive, and the Polo Day team is riding alongside the group helping everyone out and taking photos of your day. Do this. It will surely be a highlight of your time in BA!

Great Day. My wife and I had been in BsAs (Palermo SoHo) for 4 days, and we were looking for something different to do before the end of the trip. We stumbled on Polo Day, and boy were we lucky. It is a fantastic day. I am a cattle rancher, and assumed Polo Day would be like riding a pony at the carnival. It is not. They feed you a great meal, they explain the game, gladly answer all questions, watch a game. Then you hop on a horse. Get on the field. They throw out a bunch of balls. Practice for an hour. Then we played a 30 min game. The pros playing with us were great help and a ton of fun. YOU HAVE TO GO TO POLO DAY IF YOU ARE IN BsAs!!

Best Activity We Did in Argentina. I have never written a review before, but my family loved this activity so much that I wanted to share. I went with my husband and 2 daughters - ages 16 and 13. Hands down we all voted this outing our favorite day on vacation. The property is beautiful and the day is spaced quite well: snack, explanation of the game, watch a game, practice in between periods, lunch, and then play yourself. The lunch was fantastic - beef, red wine, grilled veggies - so fresh and just the best! I didn't think we'd all be able to manage playing on horses, but the fact that we all did and loved it speaks for itself. Our guide (Pablo) was wonderful and witty and our group was small - just our family and 2 other couples. Plan for a full day - the drive was about 1 hour from where we stayed in Palermo; we got picked up around 10am and returned at 7:30pm.

great day!. polo day was one of my favorite days in Buenos Aires! Upon arrival, they had the BEST empanadas ready for us to eat! Next we watched a polo game, then had lunch (very good!!), and played our own game of polo! Some of the people we were with had no experience on horses, and all went well! At the end of the day, you are welcome to use their pool. They have changing rooms and showers available as well. Also, they have rooms available if you wish to stay over night! I wish I would have known that prior to booking because I would have loved to have stayed! The only thing we didn't really like was that we were picked up at our hotel in a very small vehicle. We were traveling with 2 large American men, so it made for an uncomfortable start and end to our day.

So much fun!!. I had a marvelous time- the place is not too far from the city- lovely polo ranch- we watched a real polo match, had a great barbecue with lots of wine and the best came when we actually rode and learnt how to play polo! Had not had so much fun in a long time! Celia and Ruben the owners were very friendly and Pablo our host was very nice and knowledgeable- do not miss this day out in the Pampas and riding horses!!

Nice day. I love riding and horses and am always happy to be around them. There's like 200 horses at the farm so I was in heaven. It was nice to be introduced to polo and I scored a goal in our match :P The parilla was really good, I was worried that I wasnt gonna have much to eat since I am a vegan but I was happily surprised and very full after the lunch. The owner and his wife are very friendly and so was our guide.
Great Day of Polo!. I had a wonderful experience! The farm was so beautiful and relaxing, they thought of everything. I only wish I stayed longer!!!

Super day!. This was the best day in BsAs. Great to escape the city for a day, the weather was beautiful, the scenery amazing. Most surprising of all, I never drove a horse and still was able to play a game of polo! The horses are very well trained, they respond immediately. And if you don't hit the ball, the horse may kick it with its leg. Special thanks to the nice organization. Celia and her husband are trying to create an easy access and fun polo club, a very refreshing spirit in the world of polo. Many thanks for the nice experience.

Great day in Buenos Aires. This was a blast! Hour ride outside of downtown Buenos Aires, they picked us up at the hotel and took us to the polo farm. The place is spectacular - beautiful farm, three polo pitches and dozens of magnificent horses. You watch a match, then get a lesson - and have the finest lunch we had in Buenos Aires. Could not recommend this more!

I scored a goal ! . I visited Buenos Aires in December 2015 with my boyfriend. We were interested in seeing a polo match and I came across the polo day experience. I booked online through the website a day in advance. We were staying at an Air BNB in Palermo Soho and were picked up at a nearby hotel for the 40ish minute ride. This whole process was seamless. There were solo travelers, couples and groups. We arrived to the beautiful grounds and were immediately handed glasses of wine and parrilla before walking over to the field. The whole day was very organized. Our "leader" Fabio was extremely knowledgable and kind. After learning the rules of the game, watching a match, eating, drinking more and practicing we got on our horses. The horses were so well kept and easy to ride. I think I had the most fun just trotting around the field. The game was fun and I scored a goal but the mallet got very heavy after a while (I'm a 130 pound female). This was the type of day I didn't want to end and definitely the highlight of our 11 day trip in Buenos Aires.

Fantastic Day an Hour from Buenos Aires!. Comfortable trip[[great Polo grounds--Wonderful drinks and empanadas then watching a Polo match and learning to play. Given equipment then get up on a horse and practice for an hour before actually playing a polo match! Great papilla lunch and then swimming in a pool and relaxing before heading back to BA. Perfect day

Truly Amazing!!!!. First thing I would like to highlight is how much everyone wants to make you feel at home, far from a canned experience that you would expect from a group tour. Most gracious hosts, lovely healthy well kept horses and the staff really made you understand the basics without being overbearing. They have structured the event well so from an beginner to expert has something for them - our group had people who had never sat on a horse to novices and even sr. retirees. The steaks and chorizo served for lunch were as good as any steakhouse. We also toured the grounds and the guesthouse with exceptional antigues.
Excellent time at Argentina Polo Day. We all had a great time. It was a unique experience that I highly recommend. Got to play polo even though I had limited experience riding horses.

Tip-top Day!. Absolutely brilliant day out, smiles all day; will never forget it. I am really looking forward to visiting again.
Richard

The polo day was a lot of fun!. The polo day that was set up by Celia and Alfie was a lot of fun! The barbecued food was really good. It was really neat to watch an actual polo match and then actually attempt to play polo. My only disappointment was that we didn't get to play on the grass field. I would highly recommend it for anybody it was a really fun day!

Best day tour we have ever done.. We new it would be great but it exceeded our expectations.Actually played polo in a safe and fun environment.Got 2 goals and 1 assist. My wife got 1 goal and 1 assist. Gorgeous property, awesome lunch, wine, great team and 11 out of 10 for value.We would do this again many times if we could.

One of the best things we did in South America. We did this the day before our return home after three months travelling around Latin America. It was a great day out - the staff were excellent, the food was fantastic and the setting was beautiful. The whole day was done at a really nice pace and it was a shame when it was over. Highly recommend.

A fantastic day in Argentina's countryside.. We were picked up by a car from our hotel in Buenos Aires. The trip to the Polo field takes about one hour. On arrival we greeted by the hostess Augustine, a delightful young lady, who greeted my wife and I with a glass of Argentinian wine, a great wined too and some empanadas. She introduced us to the owner Reuben who welcomed us in the typical Argentinian friendly way. After finishing the great lunch we were introduced to the game of Polo. We practised at hitting the ball, and then we watched a real game played by some of club's sporting members. After this came the exciting time for us when we were taken to the mounting yar. ds and then started our own game. A truly fantastic day. Highly recommended as a full day of new experiences and enjoyment.
Great Experience!. Four friends and I took part in the full day experience and found it very enjoyable. The food and wine were phenomenal as were the lessons and the match. Would highly recommend!
Awesome time. Polo day was great. The staff was very friendly and the grounds are beautiful. Empanadas to start were delicious.

the best polo day !!!!!. As soon as you arrive to Argentina Polo Day ' s place you already feel that something great is going to happenAnd I was right! I had the best experience in my lifeThe food is very good Classic Argentina The horses are very well trained and I enjoyed a lot learning and playing with the instructors, other visitors and the owner!You won't believe how hard the owner Ruben works every day to make it every day a perfect dayI had the chance to talk to him. He is such a unique person! Love his horses, love polo, love what he doesAnd you feel that all the time in every detailAfter my first day here that although it rained at the end we had a fantastic time, I decided to come back and stay more daysI highly and truly recommend this place, horse lovers, outdoor lovers, everyone should come and try This beautiful experience!!!!!

What an amazing experience- A little gem! . A friend had mentioned this as a possible day trip for us, and when I ran it past a friend living in Buenos Aires- he was super positive about the day and completely recommend it. I ended up going alone and had a great day. You are given freshly baked empanadas and good wine when you arrive, you get to watch the Gauchos play a game of Polo, while our host Celia explained the rules, the history and tips we could practice before we got on the horses ourselves. Lunch was what seemed like a never ending Asado- which was truly scrumptious. And getting to play polo was the best part of a pretty awesome day- it was great to be apart of the experience. I've never ridden a horse before, but Celia and co's help made it a positive and enjoyable experience.If recommend this day to everyone who wants to do something that's a bit different, but very authentic.Thanks Celia for a great day!

Argentina Polo Day. Argentina Polo Day was an awesome experience! Well worth the price. We were picked up at our hotel by friendly staff. The drive out of the city was scenic and pleasant. Upon arriving at the estancia, we were treated as special guests. The estancia buildings and grounds are beautifully maintained. It was fun to watch the Argentines play polo first and then to actually saddle up, get lessons and practice, and to play ourselves. Swimming in the pool is offered as a cool down after the polo for no extra charge.The meal of wine, juice, roasted beef, potatoes, and vegetables was delicious and seemed never ending. Gracious owners and staff made this a top notch day.

best polo in argentina!!!!. As soon as you arrive to Argentina Polo Day ' s place you already feel that something great is going to happenAnd I was right! I had the best experience in my lifeThe food is very good Classic Argentina The horses are very well trained and I enjoyed a lot learning and playing with the instructors, other visitors and the owner!You won't believe how hard the owner Ruben works every day to make it every day a perfect dayI had the chance to talk to him. He is such a unique person! Love his horses, love polo, love what he doesAnd you feel that all the time in every detailAfter my first day here that although it rained at the end we had a fantastic time, I decided to come back and stay more daysI highly and truly recommend this place, horse lovers, outdoor lovers, everyone should come and try This beautiful experience
Fabulous!. Highly recommended. Stunning location, fabulous hosts and instructors, the swimming pool was definitely a highlight on a hot February day. Loved it!

cant wait to do it again. great way to experience the sport of polo...the horses were willing and tolerant even in the unusual heat. The food was plentiful and delicious, the staff tireless in their efforts

Perfect Day of Polo. From the moment you are collected from your hotel the treatment and experience is nothing less than first class. Have and will continue to recommend this one day unforgettable experience to all.

We felt like special guests.. What a great trip. Wine ,Lunch , swimming pool Watched a polo match and at 54 years old rode a horse for the first time. The staff were very good at getting me thru this great experience...We felt like special guests at the ranch. Dont miss this one

Best day of our trip. Warm weather, sun, red wine, amazing food, horses, polo, swimming, sangria! What more could you want!This was such an amazing day - the grounds were beautiful and peaceful, the staff were so helpful and made our day fun and exciting. Could not recommend this polo day anymore. Loved it!!

Tourist Trap - irresponsible. We were really loooking forward to our stay at the polo Farm. Especially as we spent the day before at an estancia nearby - which was awsome (family atmosphere, well kept horses, wonderful experience) Unfortunately the polo day was the absolute opposite. We spent a long time at the mediocre lunch although it already looked like Rain. When we finally startet riding the weather got really bad, and we had a Lot of beginners Who did not feel Safe on the horses. The horses were standing still trying to avoid facing the heavy rain but still nobody from the farm reacted to bring us in but they startet to Hit the horses with the polo stick while my friend, A beginner, was still sitting on the horse.Then we were heading under some trees to Cover from the Rain. All the beginners had to make their own way - on some spooked horses, because our guide was already under the trees seeking shelter from the heavy rain. We were absolutely not taken good care of and felt not save. Not even the experienced riders in our Group.We can just recommend to save your money and time and better spent some time with well kept and better treated horses on an estancia that is a bit more individual, not Mass-market-tourist-trap Kind of activity.

Highlight of our trip. What a great day—from the facilities to the food, to the excitement of watching a polo match, and then the unforgettable experience of getting on the horses and trying it ourselves!
What s day!. Lovely family run business, professional, welcoming, warm and fun. An unforgettable time. Thank you Celia

Polo day. We had the most amazing day learning about polo and playing the game our 14 year son had never ridden but he was well looked after and even scored the winning goal in our chukka. After polo playing we them has a lovely cool swim lunch was amazing Argentina beef and great wines.

The highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. We saw a polo match in the morning (it was extremely hot - 95 degrees) were fed a great lunch with wineThen the be at part we rode polo horses and played a game.I had never ridden before but these horses are awesome and when they think you know what you are doing - you will have an amazing time

Better than ever!!!. I came back to Argentina Polo Day again after a couple of years and it is even better than ever! They have really created a demand for an innovative and fun travel experience. The facilities and programs have expanded from the last time I was there but Polo Day maintains an authentic family run atmosphere. Ruben and Celia are ever present and ensure every guest is attended. If you want to experience the real Argentine country lifestyle around polo and barbecue Pollo Day is well worth it!Cheers!

Exciting, relaxing, unique - a good BA escape. I had a few days in Buenos Aires, but after a couple of days of tours and eating an excessive amount of steak, I was looking for something a bit unique. Polo Day scratched that itch.Not only can you not do something like this in the States, the setting is beautiful, the food is excellent, and it's really just a fun time. A great way to relax, perhaps at the end of a trip.Quick heads up/tips & tricks when booking:- Book by messaging them on WhatsApp, they're very responsive- Don't be freaked out when they ask to meet at a random hotel and you're picked up in an unmarked van, with no explanation in the van of what's going to happen (sidenote to Polo Day: You may want to do an intro/overview when you start driving to explain the day and how long the ride will be)- The ride takes about an hour- You're back in BA ~7pm, which is perfect for cleaning up and going back out (you'll sleep on the ride back)Everyone here was extremely friendly and I'm still in shock that they get people who've never been on a horse before playing low level Polo. Tons of fun. Would definitely do again.

Something else!. There are so many places to visit and there is so much to do in the region of Buenos Aires. But before I got here I didn't know what joy it would be to visit a Polo ranch. We were warmly welcomed and served with drinks, tasty wine and the best empanada I've had so far.The history about Polo and the introduction in Polo was as much fun as to watch the game of the professionales. After a rich and marvelouse asado, accompanied by fresh salads and tasty vegetables from the grill, we got to ride the well trained horses and to play polo. What an experience! And the best is, you don't have to know how to ride horses. They help you with everything. However, it is exhausting. Though it's great that we got to relax at the poolside afterwards, where they served us more drinks and fresh fruits.Great fun, fantastic food, nice people, new experience. Something else!

Best place to try Polo. I tried many different places, but this is the best place to try Polo: Organisation is great, Amenities and food are incredible and the place is beautiful!!!!Not to be missed...

Fun day on the polo ranch. I had a wonderful time on this day trip. We ate good food, learned about polo, played a game ourselves, and then relaxed by the pool. Although it was an hour outside of Buenos Aires, it was a fun and enjoyable experience for our entire group.
Great day of Polo. Had a blast learning the sport and its history and getting some playing time in! Accompanies by endless wine, a great meal, and some time at the pool.

Great first time experience!. Had a really good time here. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Was very easy to book and the pick up was on time. One of the best barbecues you will find in Argentina. As a first time rider it wasn't easy getting to grips with the horses but the staff were very patient and happy to help in anyway possible. All in all well worth it

Relaxing Day in Amazing Argentinian Countryside. We had a lovely day at the polo club, the host and staff were all very welcoming and helpful. Upon arrival we had the best empanadas we had tasted since arriving in Argentina. The whole day was very informal and relaxed. There was no pressure to do anything you weren't happy with however a love of horses does help as you do get the chance to spend a good hour or so riding. The horses are very well trained and we felt safe. our only negative thoughts were that we were picked up in the morning in a very dilapidated minivan and the journey wasn't particularly comfortable as most of the seats appeared to be broken and I don't think there was any suspension whatsoever! The ride back was in a different van and was much better. The information we received indicated we would be back at hotel by 7pm but we didn't arrive back until 8pm so don't make any dinner reservations just in case! The wine was free flowing as was the food and all in all it was a great opportunity to experience something different away from the city.
Great day out. Great tour which combines fun, hospitality and information on Polo. it isn't cheap but if you can afford it its definitely worth it!

Learn about polo and play it yourself. Since our travel agent booked this trip we never expected to 'play' polo ourselves. We got the full gear, the instruction, the horses and the game but can we call this 'playing'? Yes we can because we enjoyed it very mum and discovered that hitting a ball on a horse at full speed takes some skills. Anyhow, good fun! All other details you can find in the other reviews.

Polo by professionals, incredible experience. Absolutely gorgeous experience that I strongly recommend. Extremely nice team, carefull pick up at hotel, great spot, delicious barbecue, amazing horses, incredible professional players teaching you about this sport....and last but not least: you really ride a horse and play polo in the end!!!! I absolutely recommend.

THE BEST EXCURSION EVER!!!!. Where to begin with this amazing excursion……. How amazing is it to learn how to play Polo in Argentina, AMAZING. My day started off with being the first passenger picked up at my hotel by Pablo Fazzari ( an Argentinian hunk!). He was enthused and energetic which was infectious so I started becoming more and more excited about the Polo excursion. We picked up about 6 more passengers and then headed to the countryside of Pilar, which is about a 45 minutes commute from Buenos Aires. Once we arrived on the property you could tell how manicured and beautiful the ranch is. They treated us so well when we arrived that it almost felt as if we arrived to a family friends house. Pablo took us to the field and started teaching us about Polo. He was charismatic and funny as he went over all the details. He had the whole group laughing. Our wine glass were never empty and they made it a point to make sure we all were comfortable and having the best time. After seeing a few matches, we went on the field to practice hitting the ball. We played a game to see who could hit the ball with the bell, we all had fun. The day was just beginning! We went back to the picnic area to have lunch. WHAT A FEAST!!! More delicious food kept coming and coming. You will not starve in their presence, elite hospitality. After our food digested it was time to play Polo!! The horses are very sweet and very trained. I didn’t feel scared or worried. Everyone there are professionals and are attentive to you at all times. We jumped on our horses and attempted to play Polo. I have such respect for the game now, it is not easy but it was exciting to do. We played for awhile. It is an experience I will never forgot and as a matter of fact, I want to do it again in the city I live (Los Angeles). After a workout with the Polo match we all changed and jumped inside this beautiful pool they have on the property. Like I said, it felt as if I was at a friends house. While we are all swimming, we were pleasantly surprised with some delicious Sangria and a bowl of fresh fruit. Life was tough, HA! After our nice swim we headed back to Buenos Aires. I could go on and on about this experience. This by far is one of the most memorable excursion I have ever experience. Pablo took so many pictures of us to capture our moments. He went above and beyond in making this a wonderful experience for the group. I do not believe anyone else could have done it better than Pablo! The Polo players were great too. We got to meet and interact with all of them. Such delightful people. I was very impressed with the female Polo player, Tete; she is just as good or better than the men! Very encouraging. I am want to thank Celia Alfie, from team Argentina Polo Day, who was so diligent with getting our photos up on the website as fast as she did. Thank you, Pablo and Team Argentina Polo Day, for an incredible experience. A++++++++++++++++++Your very grateful passenger (January 15, 2016)Christina Mendez, Los Angeles, California

Amazing way to spend a day. Would definitely go back. Great StaffGreat program of eventsEasy goingFun & EducationalDelicious Food and Great wineWere at first hesitant about the price but ended up being worth every penny. It is cash only

Outstanding Day!. There are so many good things to say about this day, but the best thing is that we actually played polo!!! To be fair we were not galloping around, for most of the group the horses were walking and sometimes trotting, but it was enormous fun, especially when we got competitive. And we really got to understand the game so much better. But I should start at the beginning. We were picked up from our apartment at 10:00 by Cony and driven to the polo ground near Pilar. She was great fun and full of information about Buenos Aires, Argentina and polo. At the polo ground we had empanadas and drinks and then went to watch a real game and learn the rules and try playing on foot. Then we had lunch. The food was fantastic. Grilled steak and vegetables, the best we had had. And wine, of course. Then we got kitted out (they gave us chaps, helmets, mallets) and got our horses. There were only three people in the tour and each of us had someone on a horse behind us hitting the ball into position for us to hit. Once we got the hang of it we played the competitive game in half a field. What a buzz! We played with Manuel who had played with Prince Harry - star struck! After the game, hot and sweaty, we had a swim and sangria to cool off. We got home around 7:00 pm. Tips: book direct with Celia - it is cheaper. Cash only. Bring jeans, covered shoes, swimwear and towel.

Brilliant. Argentina Polo Day was magnificent. We arrived to entrees and wine, followed by an introduction to the game. We then watched members of the club play a match while we continued to eat, drink and meet the other members sharing our experience. We indulged in a barbecue lunch which was beautiful, then were selected ponies for our own attempt at polo. Despite having prior horse riding experience, it was quite a challenge but so much fun! We then cooled off by the pool, drank sangria and ate fruit. It was such a wonderful day, worth every penny!

Polo trip. We had an amazing and educational day! What a wonderful way of learning this beautiful, exiting sport! The trip includes Transportation, free drinks included alcohol, wonderful snacks,food and BBQ, full personal attention, high quality, well trained horses, 1 hour polo lesson, 1/2 hour match, watch a training of the proffesional polo riders. It is all given on a beautiful location just an hour outside of Buenos Aires. There is a pool to chill out after the match! Just winderful. An amazing lifetime experience! Special thanks to Cony our tourguide who is a beautiful, enthusiastic and fun woman who is a polo rider herself too!

What a great day !. Very nice experience. It's not a fake : you really play polo !! The staff is very kind and the place very lovely.I really recommend if you want to spend a pleasant day with a new experience.
Excellent day outside the city!. Beautiful scenery with delicious food and wine, and the most hospitable hosts you could hope for. Absolutely recommend!!

Polo Day- Buenos Aires. My wife, daughter and I went to an all day Polo Day and much to my surprise, it exceeded my expectations. Everyone welcomed us and our host Paolo made sure each of us were enjoying the experience. We learned about the game, observed a match, ate delightful grilled meats and a very nice lunch, and then even had the opportunity to try our luck at playing this beautiful and challenging game. All in all, a most delightful day- I would recommend it to all ages!

An unexpecetd gem on the doorstep of Buenas Aires.... Argentina Polo Day is a lovely, family run, estancia with tons of character. The accomodation is luxurious but comfortable and the polo facilities are impressive. We were made to feel at home straightaway and felt free to roam the property and use the facilities, at our leisure. The food was marvelous and the atmosphere both welcoming and relaxing. Ideal for a romantic weekend and equally for a social or corporate event..

Great stressfree polo day. After a pick-up at the hotel, we were welcomed by the owner and enjoyed some drinks and empanadas. We got some instructions and watched a polomatch. After a tasty mid-day lunch we then had our own polo training, followed by a match.Great experience and I will definately return! Thanks Pablo, Thanks Celia, Thanks Ruben!

One of the best days of our Patagonian trip. If you like horses you can't go to Argentina without being aware of the great polo players that originate in this country. This applied to my partner and myself so I did some investigating and found this particular estancia highly rated. WOW! It wasn't overstated at all.Everyone involved was incredibly friendly and accommodating. The location is beautiful and everything is done to ensure your enjoyment and safety. The lunch was fabulous, polo match exciting and then you get on a horse and play a match! I have been riding all my life and my partner just a few times. We both equally enjoyed the match, as did the others that came out this day. After your polo match you are taken to an absolutely beautiful pool where you get to cool down and relax. The day couldn't have ended more perfectly. The only requirements are long pants and proper footwear (sandals aren't a good idea). Sunscreen is a must during their summer months as you are out there in the brilliant sunshine and it is impossible not to get warm while trying to score goals for your team.

Fun day. I went on Dec 31 with a small group of total 8 people for the full day polo tour. Pablo was our coordinator. He did a great job explaining polo in a nutshell and taught us how to hit the ball. The welcoming snacks- empanadas were AMAZING, the best I ever had in Argentina. After a meaty lunch, we started to get on the horse and practiced a little bit. Because of our small group size, we have 1 on 1 coach shadowing us on the practice. (+100 points on this. You learned quicker with someone at your side.) Then we did the competition. It was really fun. Highly recommend it. Celia was responsive throughout the booking and communicating the logistics. There's nothing I'd complain about. Purely incredible.

Incredible experience. The place is fantastic: every detail is taken care of. The organisation is even better: you are collected at your hotel in the morning, spend a full day in the middle of the Argentinian countryside watching and playing Polo and are left, in the evening, in front of your hotel!!!Wether you already know how to ride a horse or you have never been on one, the Polo (for beginners) experience is really amazing!!! You would never believe it would be possible to try Polo for such a price. You can then relax at the pool.And this is not all: the food is amazing. All you can eat: grilled meat and fresh vegetables with local wine.I highly recommend it.

Top of my list for Buenos Aires!. This is the best day trip that you can make from Buenos Aires! Celia made the arrangements so easy, so quickly. The hotel pickup was as planned. Our guide, Pablo (aka Poli) for the day was not only engaging, he was a very good horseman/polo player. Our fellow travelers were a fun, energetic, and adventurous group. The facility is absolutely gorgeous, clean, well organized. We were greeted with freshly baked empanadas from an open fire oven. We were educated about the game and its rules. We watched an exhibition match of experienced players. We practiced hitting balls on the ground. Then a beautiful lunch of grilled meats and vegetables was served with fresh salad and good red wine. Next we suited up and chose teams with jerseys and protection provided by the staff. Feeling brave and determined we mounted our horses, we were each given a ball with which to practice. Our horses were very well trained, responding quickly to each command. After practice we played a mini match on a reduced size field. We wore ear to ear smiles all day. I'm still amazed at this organization's ability to take 14 complete beginners, and within a few hours, have them on horseback actually playing the game. I say..don't hesitate, DO THIS!!!!
A highlight of our trip. Nice to try something different. Very competently organised and got everyone of different riding abilities confident

Awesome way to spend then day.. This was well worth the money. Pick up and drop off at your hotel. Late morning empanadas, orange juice and/or wine. Watch a game and learn how to play. Lunch was parrilla (vegetarian available) with wine. Then suit up and play a beginners polo game. Finish the day sitting at the pool with sangria. The grounds are beautiful. Host Pablo was very accommodating and knowledgeable. All around a great time.

Amazing experience, but too many people in the group. Overall experience was very good. The hosts and the guide were super nice and welcoming, the food was good and the atmosphere was amazing. The only thing I was bothered with was the number of people in the group the day we went. When we actually played the polo match there were way too many people on the field for the game to be enjoyable. That's the only thing I'd would change- Less people in each group.

Amazing experience. After reading the reviews on this site we came with pretty high hopes. We we not disappointed! This was the highlight of our trip. Started the day being picked up at our hotel and driven into the beautiful country side to the polo ranch. We were greeted by all the employees and served delicious empanadas, fresh orange juice, water and, of course, wine in the beautiful covered patio. We then we're walked to the polo field where we were taught a little about the game and its history. We then watched a few chukkas and learned the basics. After a lunch that would be worth the money itself we got on the horses to play! The horses were very gentle and well trained. No one looked uncomfortable or uneasy on the horses. It was an unforgettable experience! Cannot recommend highly enough!
Best day in Argentina!. Great way to spend a day! Great wine, great food, and the polo was unbelievable! Would recommend this to anyone traveling to buenos Aires.
Great, great fun. A must do in BA. An experience hard to get anywhere else. Outstanding instructors! Good food and wine.
Great Time. The facility was great. We drank a lot of wine and ate a lot of meat. Which were both great. Our instructor for the day Pablo was the best.

Best part of my trip. This is my first TripAdvisor review, and I wanted to write it for Argentina Polo Day because it was easily the best part of my trip. The horses are beautiful, as is the scenery, and Celia takes excellent care of the guests. The best part of polo day is its interactivity. You are not just a spectator -- you are given the freedom to learn and play. It has been a long time since I've felt anything as exhilarating as galloping on a horse on the open polo field, mallet in hand, ready to strike the ball. I look forward to doing it again.Highly recommended.

A highlight of our trip. My husband and I had an awesome day. It was perfectly organised from start to finish and sooo much fun! Our host was friendly and entertaining, the lunch was delicious and the horses a pleasure to ride even for beginners. I cannot recommend this experience highly enough. Make sure you go for the full day even if you have never ridden a horse.

Give it a try you will be surprised. Awesome day which was very relaxing. Consider something different if you have had a busy agenda on your holiday. The half day is a relaxing way to spend the day but the full day would add a bit of adventure if you are into that.

Something new and amazing!. Me and some friends got the oportunity to visit Argentina Polo Day and it was trully amazing. The owners are great people, kind and kilarious. They have such a dedication for the polo program and they really know how to make you feel like home. The place, the horses, the polo game, the swimming pool, the barbacue and the wine.. oh my god! We also had the chance to make some good friends there. 10/10 experience, i loved it and for sure you'll do too.

Who knew???. Polo, we knew absolutely nothing about it...now we have a pretty good understanding. Such a fabulous day. It takes about an hour to drive from Buenos Aries to the ranch, they organised a transfer for us to & from. Unfortunately we only had time for a 1/2 day tour, I would recommend a full day tour or if you have time they can accommodate overnight stays, it's such an idyllic setting I would have loved to stay longer. We were greeted with delicious empanadas, for me they had chorizo sausage & fresh herbed tomato (gluten free). Which I loved. The drinks, wine, juice, water flowed freely all day. They cooked a BBQ for those who were staying the full day. They are small groups, we had only 7. There's a pool right next to the polo field, change rooms, with showers and toilets are there as well.It was a terrific day we learnt and watched a sport we had no experience or knowledge about. Of course our 12 year old now wants to live on a ranch & play polo! This was a really relaxing way to spend the day.

I can't stop going back!. Third time at Polo Day. This time with summer in full swing. No comparison... beautiful day, amazing food, fun group of people, incredible trainers, great horses, and an impeccably organized day. This day is so special because the staff really takes care of the little details, like picking you up from your hotel with an English speaking guide, refilling your wine glass every time you take a sip, and having professionals follow your horse around and pass you every ball you miss. The game at the end is insanely fun and you feel like a pro by the end of the day - not to mention get a great workout in and learn about a beautiful sport! 100% recommend this day to anyone who wants to get out of the city for a day. Even if you're not an athlete, the "campo" is absolutely stunning, the pool is the perfect temperature, and you are free to go at your own pace. Amazing day.
Highlight of my Trip. Polo day was a very fun, fantastic and unique experience. I loved it and highly recommend it to anyone staying in or aorund BA for more than a couple days.

Highlight of our holiday. Myself and my husband had an awesome time doing this day trip. My husband was a bit nervous as he has no horse experience and was doubtful on how we would fill the day without him getting bored. But he throughly enjoyed himself as well as myself. We were picked up and driven about an hour to the ranch, the ranch is spectacular it is so peaceful, and the surroundings magnificent. We were treated to so much wine and it was a lovely drop. We watched a polo match, had a delicious lunch with so much food and more wine with a great bunch of people and most had no horse experience. First we got to practice with our feet firmly on the ground and learnt a bit about the sport then it was time to mount up! We got to practice and get to know our ponies then it was time for a game it was so much fun and everyone was having a great time and at no point did I feel unsafe or scared of my horse. Once we finished our game we were straight into the pool, fed more and more drinks. It was a full day we left at 9.30am and got back to the hotel about 8.30pm. The trip is well worth the money and I can not recommend enough. Pablo is a great host and funny as well. I hope you get to experience this tour

Great day in countryside. Last week, my husband and I went to play Polo for the day. When we were picked up from our place, it turned out we would only be 3, which we weren't sure would be fun. However, it turned out to be perfect and not only because there were just 3 of us. - the whole day is organised perfectly (pick up, drop off, food, drinks, explanations, practice, relaxation, etc)- there's plenty of food and drinks all the time- the estancia is just stunning- Poly is very knowledgeable and funny- polo is an amazing sports to play- there's a perfect balance between doing, watching and relaxation (drinks and empanadas when you get there, fantastic lunch - BBQ, swimming in the pool at the end of the afternoon)We were lucky to meet the owner of the estancia (Ruben) who had quite some friends over and we all had lunch together. Great people, great fun!I would recommend this to any one.
So much fun!. This was a great day and a fabulous intro to polo. A lesson in the morning and a mini tournament in the afternoon made it really special.

Best day in Argentina. Today was by far the best day I have spent in Argentina yet. Everything was well organized, from the pickup locations to the polo gear we used. Pablo, our guide, was great because he was extremely personable, funny, and informative. (He deserves a raise!) Starting the day with red wine and empanadas and ending with a swim in the pool after playing polo, I had fun the entire time. Traveling alone can be hard sometimes but this excursion was fantastic and is for everyone, whether you're alone, with your family or a group of friends. Highly recommend this company.

Tradition and Excellence!. This trip was exactly what we were looking for after a couple of days in downtown Buenos Aires. From the time we arrived and throughout, we were treated to not only an introduction to polo, but to the countryside and tradition of rural Argentina. The hosts created an atmosphere in which observing the sport played by club members, enjoying exquisite food, participating in an introductory lesson, and wine at every turn combined to leave us at the end of the day fully satisfied. We had the opportunity to meet the owner who was gracious and our guide Pablo was energetic, knowledgeable, fun, and obviously had a passion for the sport, the way of life, and Argentina itself. The best part of our visit to Buenos Aires!

One of the best days of my life!. We booked the polo tour because of all the excellent reviews at tripadvisor. This is the thing to do in Buenos Aires, you will get out of country side and see more than just the city itself. First we were greeted with wine and empanadas, then we got to see the real polo match by club members. Afterward we had lunch with four different kind of meet and grilled vegetables, more wine of course and then back to polo. We got to ride on horses and play polo! This is third time on the horse but it was just fine. Had so much fun! Afterward we jumped into pool. The owner is very friendly and greets you once you get there. Our tour guide and polo instructor Pablo was an excellent. He is very personable and fun! He is the greatest asset of the Polo Club and needs raise in salary! Kadi (Estonia)
A must do!!. A perfect day!!Nice people, good food, lovely horses and a beautiful hacienda!!I absolutely recommend to be a polo player for a day @ Argentina Polo Day!

This is a MUST!!!!. Since Argentina is known for its polo, we wanted to experience polo to its fullest. This was the BEST part of our trip to Buenos Aires!! We were picked up right on time and taken to these beautiful polo fields. Wine and empanadas were handed to us immediately. Learning about the game, watching an actual match and actually playing the game ourselves was such, such fun! Plus, the absolutely delicious asado under the trees on such a beautiful day was FANTASTIC! My sister, 21 year old nephew and I enjoyed the experience with a group from all over the world and it made for great and hilarious conversation. The host, Pablo, was the BEST, being very knowledgeable with an awesome sense of humor!! I can not recommend this experience enough!!!
Polo Experience. Excellent all-day activity. Private lessons in-between a fascinating exhibition match. Staff kept the Malbec and Empanadas flowing.

A Polo clinic worth the trip! . I came to Argentina Polo Day a novice polo player, new to the game but not to riding. After spending a week at La Carona with Ruben, Celia and their team, playing daily with polo pro Jose Lezcano, I was playing four full chukkars! The polo team took great care to match me with the right horses and played to my ability while also elevating my game. I had the chance to meet and play with different members of the polo club and loved sitting down to daily huge lunches of steak and wine with everyone after the games. And perhaps the best part of the experience was waking up everyday on the farm, ready to play. Truly an exceptional experience and I really look forward to a return trip.

Argentina polo day. This was one of our very best days in Buenos Aires. The grounds were beautiful, the horses were excellent and our guide Pablo was bar none! This bully exceeded our expectations and I would recommend it to anyone.

What a wonderful way to learn about the Argentinian countryside and the sport of Polo!!!. My husband and I are no where near horse experts but this was the best way to learn and incorporate some fun competition. You could take the experience as fast or slow as you needed and the guide Paulo aka. the Brad Pitt of Latin America :-) was kind, caring, fun, informative. All of the staff was so accommodating you didn't want to leave. AND...the food...O...the food!!!! One of the best meals in the country. The empanadas were my favorite of the whole trip and they placed such a beautiful spread for lunch we were definitely spoiled by the end. If you do anything in the Argentinian countryside choose this...it's a once and lifetime experience.

Amazing experience. The staff were so friendly, fun and greatNo experience needed, horses all perfectly trained. Really great value for money, the perfect polo experience and amazing food and wine ! A must do when in Argentina
Best day in Buenos Aires! . This was hands down the best day in BA for me! Beautiful estate, fantastic Polo ponies, and guide. Thanks Pablo! This is a must do!

Don't miss out on Polo. Fantastic day! This is a must do for anyone visiting Buenos Aires. Pablo was a great host, the horses were increadbly well behaved and easy to ride, the food was excellent and the grounds were beautiful.

Great fun day. After an initial problem that was resolved by Celia, we had a wonderful day of polo related activities. The setting is amazing, the staff are so friendly and the food and wine seemed endless. I had hardly been on a horse in my life but at the age of 64 felt confident to ride which is a testament to the quality and behavior of the horses. I took to it with ease and scored three goals feeling I could go on all day!! They also make sure that a set of photos are taken and posted online so you can just enjoy yourself.I would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone who likes a fun day.

A fantastic day out of the city !. My wife and I did the Polo day activity. Everything is very well planned : from the moment they pick you up in the hotel in town a very decent vehicles, the day is a pleasant mix of food, wine, sport and elegance. The estancia where we were received was a stylish oasis in the middle of polo fields, horses and great people!Our guide "Poly" (Pablo's nickname) was absolutely great! He taught us a great deal about Polo and was always really positive and patient with us! They even takes pictures for you so you can focus on enjoying the day and learning/playing polo.People in the Polo club are passionate about Polo and you can see and feel it. Ruben, Polo and Celia were great!It was honestly a fantastic day out and a great value for money!

Amazing Day Learning Polo, And Eating. With a few days left over in Buenos Aires, me and two friends looked for fun and different activities to do. We found Argentina Polo Day and it was the best decision we could have made. We were picked up right on time from our apartment rental in Palermo Hollywood and taken to the countryside. On the drive we made great conversation and upon our arrival were fed delicious empanadas and explained the basics of polo as well as our day's agenda. From there we went to the Polo fields which were incredible to see. Watching members play was thrilling, especially since there were some former professional players among them. We were involved as spectators and learning how to swing on the sidelines. The asada for lunch was one of the best meals we had in all of Argentina. Finally came our turn to get on horses which is when the real fun started. As 3 Americans who have barely ridden horses, that was the main challenge. After a half hour or so, we got the hang of it and played a small game. This was thrilling and exciting (trying not to fall off the horse) at the same time, an incredible experience I wouldn't change at all. After tiring ourselves out we were taken back to the "clubhouse" for coffee and desert. Here we were treated like family. Overall it was an incredible experience and the service, instruction and amenities were top class. Highly recommended.

Even better than I imagined!. An authentic Argentine polo experience complete with empanadas, vino, y asado! What more could you ask for? Even with the rain that came halfway through the day, I had an amazing time. The grounds are about 45 minutes outside of BA, but so worth the drive! The place is stunning and the agenda well executed. We were welcomed with a warm fire, wine, and snack. The food the whole day was delicious and we were never left wanting. The people there were all wonderful and made us feel at home. Everyone ate together family style at lunch, and as I went alone, I really appreciated the sense of community. I also had no prior polo experience but was completely at ease all day. The instructors were very effective in describing the history of the sport, rules, and tips. And I loved that we were able to watch a game first and then play in one ourselves! Overall, an incredible experience. I highly recommend this activity to anyone traveling to BA!

Great experience. Pickup on time. Very smooth introduction to the game before a very good lunch. A lot of playing afterwards. Friendly, helpful and relaxed people. The area is amazing! Worth every peso

Best part of our trip to Buenos Aires!. Best day ever! Smooth transportation to and from our hotel in BA to La Carona. Upon arrival to the property we were greeted with amazing empanadas and local wine prior to watching a Polo match by local club members. During the game you learn the basics about the history, equipment, etc. After the match we enjoyed an incredible meal of traditional Argentinian BBQ and more with other guests, Polo players and staff. Then on the horse we went! I had minimal horse back riding experience compared to my boyfriend who grew up on horses - and we both had the greatest time!The staff is what really set this experience a part. We travel all over the world, and this experience places at the top! The people there are what made this experience so authentic. We arrived as guests and left as friends. We can't wait to go back. Thank you, Poly!

Second time and just as good. My husband and I love travelling to this part of the world and we went to Argentina Polo Day awhile ago. We have since tried a couple other places and we came back here! It was just as good as our first experience, if not better.I would highly recommend this place, it is great with a group of friends, for couples and also with kids. Very family friendly. The owners adorable little daughter is often around and it is very family friendly as well.We like this place the most out of a couple of places. The horses at Argentina Polo Day are beautiful and very well cared for. The people all are extremely knowledgeable and are very willing to teach and show you the ropes. They are very patient with new comers to the sport and old hands alike. They take pleasure in answering all your questions and really teaching you.The excellent food and wine are pretty much icing on the cake. Definitely try this place, you'll be very happy you did!

Live Polo as a Pro. Argentina Polo Day has the best Polo experience in the whole world!! Been there several times and I couldn't have picked a better place to practice my polo. Awesome food and exclusive wine options. Love the horses, they are so beautiful. Book and have fun! You won't regret!

The Best Polo Adventure. People are so kind! They have lovely horses, and you can even play every day of the year. We had the chance to eat an awesome barbacue with the best wine eveeeerr!!! jajaja!! Had a fantastic experience learning and playing polo. Loved the place. Argentina Polo Day rocks!!

Fun day. We had a n awesome day with Pablo and the guys despite the rain. The food and wine was yum and everyone was super friendly.My only tip is that it is time to upgrade the pick up truck as it is a long drive from Buenos Aries to La Carona.Thanks guys for the experience.
Great day trip!. Awesome time - had a blast playing polo and asado was fantastic. Pablo is the man - would recommend to anyone visiting BA

Queen for a Day. My husband and I were the only people signed up but the tour proceeded--we joked that we were royalty for a day. Poly was a charming, informative and interesting guide. The club is lovely, think Ralph Lauren ad come to life. I will never again have 8 men assemble to play a polo match for me, but it was fun while it lasted. Good wine, good food, and a nice change of pace from the urban delights of Buenos Aires.
Amazing Day !!!. Wonderful place, comfortable, friendly, lovely, I´ll never forget this experience. The Argentinian Steak is Excellent! Bon apetit!

Best Polo experience. Incredibly well organised.They pick you up at your hotel... Even if you are on your own. The place is magnificent: in the middle of the Argentinian countryside, not far from Pilar (world capital of Polo).The place is beautiful, with horses everywhere and a professional restaurant/barbecue.You see a professional Polo game with someone to explain the rules and details!Then a marvellous Argentinian Parrilla (Barbecue) with all you can eat and drink...In the afternoon you can ride for a while or have a Polo initiation (they give you all the gear!)... Incredible and wonderful. We had so much fun!We then rested a while around the pool with a drink.Unique expérience! Not to be missed.Thank you very much.
The best group activity!. An amazing experience, beautiful place with friendly staff and the best asado ever!Is a great experience to share with friends!
Amazing taste of Argentina. A great experience..Great hosts,good fun and a great way to get a feel of true Argentina hospitality.

Lovely Day in Argentina. Great experience, lovely staff, beautiful landscape, amazing food and you can learn polo game and play with your family or friends. At the end of the day, you can take wonderful sunset pictures. Enjoy!
Great experience in Argentina!. Great experience. Friendly staff, good food and beautiful place. Even for those who never have ridden horses, the polo activity is really nice.

Beautiful landscape and experience, owners are very welcoming and take care of every detail.. We visited with colleagues during a team building activity. It was amazing! The place is very well taken care of and the staff helps everyone when riding the horses and explaining basics about polo. The "asado" was absolutely delicious.

Enjoyable day playing polo. My husband and I had never played polo and had very limited horse riding experience, but we playing the game on horseback by the end of our experience. We enjoyed ourselves and our guide (Paulo) was very friendly and entertaining. This was a unique Argentinian experience that I would highly recommend.

A must do if you are in Argentina!. This is a great experience to do while in Argentina. Celia, Ruben and the whole team are great hosts, and help everyone to feel comfortable on this polo experience, even if is the first time on a horse. Kudos to everyone!

SUCH a fun day!!. Way more fun (and easy!) than expected. They have this program down pat - the entire team was friendly, open, and very dedicated to making sure the day was perfect! Food and wine was delicious, horses made me feel like I knew what I was doing, and without really understanding how somehow I was actually playing polo! Amazing place - so beautiful - and great team to make you feel welcome. Dying to go back!!! Highly recommend to anyone no matter age or fitness level, you can't go wrong!

Polo Day thrill. Summary: if you like active and sports and want to improve your riding skills this is a great day trip outside the city life of BAWhile in planning a trip to buenos aires I was referred to this place by a friend. He praised this experience highly and now I do to. On all trips I like to do something out of my normal comfort zone of sightseeing and being a lover of all sports I chose this as my activity for the trip. The staff is incredibly attentive and helpful. I was taught how to ride a horse while it was galloping. Which I hadn't done before because most of my horse experiences have been on group tours that are very touristy. It is an immersion of polo culture in Argentina which is huge. Since our trip was in September it was cold so the pool part wasn't really feasible but we were so tired from polo we just chatted with some wine by the fireplace and it was great!!!
Fun for everyone. Great experience from beginning to end -thank you. We enjoyed every part of a well planned day Perhaps update your vehicle - wasn't particularly safe

Day trip out of the city into the country. Such a great day trip out of the concrete jungle into the beautiful country side….Learned a lot about polo, was entertained by Pablo, had a magnificent lunch in the sunshine, had endless amounts of wine, had the opportunity to get onto the horses and "play" polo and the best part was we had so many great laughs with new friends from around the world!
Make your polo dreams come true!. Had the most fabulous day fulfilling my dream to play polo in Buenos Aires, wonderful players, ponies and company. I can't wait to come back!

Loved it!. I came back after 5 years and all I can say is WOW!!! Celia and Pablo have done an amazing job and it is a great, great day out.
Food was amazing, polo was fun and hosts were unbelievable. Definitely worth coming back. I don't know what they have to do next time to beat the experience...

Fantastic!. We had such a great time in the past that we had to go back!
It is so much fun! I highly recommend this experience!
No doubt best polo experience you'll ever have!

Highlight of Buenos Aires. Had a wonderful day learning the in's and out's of polo whilst sipping on Malbec and empanadas, of course! Pablo was informative and engaging. The bbq lunch was fantastic. The polo game was fun. Definitely recommended for a day out of the hustle and bustle of the city. Very enjoyable.
Fun filled day of Polo. This is a MUST do on your list when in Buenos Aires. From the moment Pablo picked us up the day was fun, exciting & a great experience, cheers guys :-)
Great day of polo! . Everything was organized so well through Celia, and Pablo was an excellent host. We were royalty for a day- very fun. We also met other travelers. We highly recommend!

Book it today!. Argentina Polo Day is organized, fun, and the best experience you will have in Buenos Aires. Pick up and drop off at the hotel, followed by a viewing of the sport, delicious food, and instruction in the play before heading to the field for a supervised game of your own. An amazing and unforgettable experience!

Amazing and unique experience. Argentina Polo Day was one of the highlights of our 2 weeks in Argentina. The food was delicious and the polo was fun. Learned a lot and enjoyed playing polo for the first time.

Amazing . Guide picks you up at hotel. In 45 min. you enter a whole new world. Amazing ranch in very quit green neighbourhood the horses are waiting for you. I have had the worlds best empenadas en wine while everything is explained about the game of polo.For lunch a tipical Argentinian BBQ was cooked.We have been riding whole afternoon practicing our moved for the game at the end.A wonderfull experience if you like horses, outdoor and great food.

Beautiful day experiencing the game of polo outside of Buenos Aires. From making initial enquiries to the end of the day itself, Juan, Celia and the rest of the team were amazing and created what turned out to be a highlight of my entire trip. You get picked up from your hotel and driven about 1 hour outside of BA to their stunning polo ranch, and are immediately greeted with wine and empanadas. After learning a bit about the game, we were able to watch a match of 4 chukkas with some ex-pro players. Juan makes sure to keep you involved at every stage, by ringing the bell, or throwing in the ball. In between in chukka you practise with the mallet and get to know the horses. Afterwards we had a really good lunch (typical Argentine grill) and some more wine, after which you definitely feel more confident about playing polo yourself! Once matched up with your horse, you first spend some time riding, then practise with a mallet and a ball and a mounted helper (one of the players) who will follow behind you and feed you balls. The horses were all fantastic and incredibly responsive. Then we got to play our own match with some of the players which was great fun. Afterwards, I was allowed to continue to ride for a while, before we headed back to the city. The team were all so friendly and welcoming throughout the entire day and it was evident how much they all enjoy running the operation. The only thing I would say is that although they say that you don't need any riding experience, unless you are really confident I would suggest that you wouldn't get as much out of the day compared to someone who was a more experienced rider. A lack of polo experience really is not an issue however. All in all it was a fantastic day out of BA and I would urge anyone remotely interested to sign up!

Great introduction to Polo. I really enjoyed the Argentina Polo Day experience and would highly recommend it to anyone who has an interest in this fun game or in participating in a unique experience. The owner Ruben and team are super friendly and helpful; the day's activities are varied, fun, and give a great overview and hands-on experience in the game; the empanadas and asado were tasty; the facilities were great; and the horses superb. I am seriously considering following-up with a 1-week clinic next time I am in Buenos Aires.

Great flavour of Argentinian polo playing life; essential part of your stay in BA!. I could not have asked for more from Ruben, Celia, Pauli and all the grooms who looked after us so perfectly and made us feel completely at home on the idyllic farm. Highlights include DELICIOUS food and wine from the outset, best meal I've had in Argentina hands down! Great to watch a polo game how it should be done and then plenty of time for us to have a go ourselves and play our own chukkas. The teachers were so helpful and we basically had a helper each- so ideal! What a day, desperate to come straight back!

Amazing Polo experience for the family. They picked us up from the hotel, during the trip we watched a video with an introduction to polo game and basic rules. When we got there we were welcomed with wine and empanadas, while a professional polo player demonstrated the equipment and gear for the horse and the player. We watched a game played by professional player, talk to the players and took pictures with them and the horses during the intermissions. After the game we enjoyed an amazing asado while tasting excellent red wines. After lunch we got a polo lesson, did stick and ball and were able to get on the horses and play a game. I’ll recommend Argentina Polo Day to anyone interested in having the real Argentinean Polo Experience… looking forward to go back next time we visit Argentina.

Polo for everyone.. still amazing. I visited Argentina Polo Day a couple of years ago and really enjoyed it so I decided to come back again on my recent stay.Celia tried to make everything possible from the start and replied really fast which made booking and everything really easy. On the farm all of the staff was very welcoming and the food was great! What I enjoyed most was first watching the polo match and then to actually try it myself. Since I am riding at home too, it was so much fun.. and I am thinking about an extended stay on the farm to learn more. Ruben and all the others have been great hosts and it was worth every penny to go there again.

Fantastic Day Out; Not to be missed if you're in BA!. What a great day this is!
