Quality. Second time on a horse and absolutely loved it! Great teacher & great food! It's obvious that the horses are very well kept and the estancia is 5 star!

We loved #polowithpablo !. I cannot say enough great things about the polo outing-- it was definitely the highlight of our time spent in Buenos Aires! At first we were hesitant about committing a full day when we only had 3 to spend in BA, but it was absolutely worth it. We were greeted with delicious empanadas and enjoyed wine (and more wine) throughout the day. Pablo, the instructor, made the day an absolute blast. He is an excellent teacher -- very informative and made learning to play polo very fun and approachable. The traditional Argentine lunch was wonderful as well.. We had time to relax and indulge in all the meat and wine one could ever ask for before mounting a horse. Overall, we LOVED #polowithpablo and would highly recommend it to everyone!
Wonderful day with wonderful people and horses!. It doesn't matter if you do know how to ride a horse or not. A unique way to spend a day, way beyond my expectations!

What a spectacular day!. Don't miss this experience. It's a full day of wonderful activities --- from basic polo lessons, to a polo game to a fabulous lunch with the polo players ... and then ... we got on polo ponies and practiced using the mallet and scoring goals. What a GREAT day! Well worth the money. Don't miss this Argentine experience. I plan to come back and bring an entire entourage of horse people to experience the essence of Argentina: red wine, steak, tango and polo! It's truly magnificent.! Best once in a lifetime experience!
A Must Do!. Argentina Polo Day is a must do!From the time I was picked up to the time I was dropped home the team was fantastic! Funny, informative, scary it was an experiance I truly recommend.
Amazing. We did the Polo Day as an optional tour through Contiki. It was so much fun! Drinking wine all day, an amazing bbq for lunch and learning to play Polo with lovely horses.

Fun filled day and genuine experience. They pick you up from your hotelDrive you to the fields while watching an instructional video on the basics (great time saver)you arrive to #1 rule, Drink wineGet more lessons, watch club members play, eat an amazing steak dinner, then play polo.Best day of our trip

Highly recommended. If you like horse riding (or even if you don't) this day is great fun. Before you know it you'll be on the horse learning to play, that's after having watched a match by the pros and learning basic technique. Great barbecue provided and also a chance to canter in the fields afterwards. Great fun!
A must!!. Amazing!! Had such a fantastic day, greeted with red wine and the tastiest empanadas in all South America! Was fun, educational and highly recommend :)

Amazing Day. This place was the best! I recommend! Unlimited wine, gorgeous horses and mouth watering food. The hosts were so helpful and lovely and catered to your every need.This was an Amazing day with friends and worth the money.

Fantastic day. This place is so much fun - i highly recommend it! THey are really nice, attentive, and helpful to no end... We watched a Polo game, ate lunch (YUM!) and played polo which was a blast. Plenty of instruction, and afterwards we went to see the wild horses, a beautiful sight! Definitely should be on the top of your list when thinking of a visit to buenos aires or argentina.

Totally worth it!. This place is awesome! Spent the day drinking wine (my glass was never empty), learning the game of polo, watching polo, PLAYING POLO, and most important eating DELICIOUS food. The next day I couldn't move a muscle and spent half the day in bed from being so sore. Totally worth it! I was ready to hobble back and jump on a horse despite the pain:) The staff was best and made our day even more pleasant. Poly. I would have gladly listen to him talk about polo all day. And Stephane was a wonderful teacher/coach. Thank you for everything! We had a blast! Best day of our vacation for sure:)

Best Day of Our Trip!. My Dad & I were met at our hotel lobby by a friendly and informative guide/polo professional who drove us to the ranch about an hour outside of Buenos Aires. In the car journey, we learned the basics of the game of polo, polo horses, etc, and then met the rest of the team. It had rained the day before, but the game carried on dispite the wet conditions. We enjoyed wine, empanadas and many laughs on the side line as we watched the polo match. We tried our hand hitting the ball with a polo mallet both on the ground and on horseback (those willing!!). It was a fabulous day, one I would recommend to anyone wanting to learn more about an amazingly competitive and graceful sport. On our way back into town, ee visited a property where guests can stay for several days/weeks to learn more about the sport and refine their game. That's next on my bucket list!! Thank you to everyone at Argentina Polo Day for an amazing day!!

Awesome day!. This was one of the best things we did while in Argentina! The whole day was well organised from as soon as they pick you up to the time they drop you off. It's not even an hour drive to get there and once there they feed you wine and empanadas and get you settled in. The host was great, as were all the staff there from the volunteers to the polo players and even the guys cooking the bbq. The bbq was great, so much wine and food! After lunch is the actual playing and it's just so much fun! And they make it really easy so wouldn't matter if you'd never been on a horse. Would highly recommend this day to anyone. Even the booking process is made so simple.

Excellent Polo once again at Argentina Polo Day. This is my third time visiting Argentina Polo Day. It is a most to do activity when traveling to Argentina. Ruben and his team make you fill at home while enjoying a great polo atmosphere. From the time you get out of the car and they hand you a great empanada and a good wine cup you will be involved in polo and Argentine customs. Great food, great polo and great people.

Polo Day = Amazing!. Polo Day was such a fun, exciting and unique experience. The group's hospitality was wonderful providing us with great food, wine, laughs, and polo knowledge. We had the oportunity to do quite a bit of riding on the horses and played an actual game. Although none of us were avid riders it was totally fine and we had a blast. Afterwards we got to enjoy the pool and the amazing view. I would strongly recommend this trip; seriously Polo Day is a must!

Awesome day!. I am a fanatic rider (mainly dressage) and in Holland it is almost impossible to play polo. When I came to Argentina, I was hoping for a possibility to see a match - it didn't even occur to me that it would be a possibility to actually play polo myself. This was actually my boyfriend's idea, whose riding experience is non-existent (okay, to be fair he has sat on a mule once...). We looked into several places but Argentina Polo Day made the best first impression. When we sent them an e-mail we immediately got a very enthusiastic mail back from Celia, and she also said that my boyfriend's lack of riding experience wouldn't be a problem (which was something I was quite worried about). Her response made us even more excited and sure that we were coming to the right place. We got picked up in the morning and on the way to the ranch we watched an instruction video. When we arrived we were greeted by the most playful and happy dogs I have ever met (I'm more of a cat person) and we were handed some drinks. After some more instruction, we got to watch a training game and instructor Poly immediately got us involved in it, a.o. practicing with the ball and stick during the breaks. After the match we had a lovely asado lunch in which some of the riders also joined.Then it was finally time to ride! We had some practice time for about 45 minutes to get used to the horses and to practice with the ball and stick. Of course to hit the ball from on top of the horse is not so easy but the horses were very good about it. After that we played a low-speed game and it was absolutely awesome. Everyone got totally into it and I felt the game was relatively fair in the sense that everybody got enough time with the ball (more or less). I even got to hit the ball from a slow canter a few times which I thought was very cool. After that we were exhausted, so we took a jump in the pool before going home.I would definitely recommend this trip. Your stay in Argentina is not complete without it!

Amayzing unique experience @ Argentina Polo Day. The unique experience of Argentina Polo Day is unforgettable.Our visit was on Sunday Feb 2, 2104, it was a rainy morning, but that does not stop usand that was the right decision (the rain stopped around noon)!We highly recommend you to see the premises, ride the horses and to learn to play the polowith very friendly staff, to eat the delicious steaks and to degustate a high quality red wine.Eduard and Valentyna from Toronto, Canada

Great experience. The Argentina polo day is something you must do in when you visit buenos aires. Pablo picked us up by the hotel and drove us quick and safely to the ranch. Everybody was very friendly and we felt extremely welcome. Our glasses where never empty, and the BBQ was excellent. The horses are well trained and the staff is very helpful. I am very afraid of horses but they made me felt very comfortable and walked with me the entire time. Pablo explained the game very clearly in an enthusiastic way he made it a memorable day which we will never forget. We will definitely coming back!

Anyone for Polo?. No tourist visit to Argentina could be complete without a day at a Polo Club. That's what we thought as we came towards the end of our holiday and having spent a day with Ruben and his team we are absolutely convinced of this. Neither my wife and I are "horsey" but we now have an appreciation and respect of the game of Polo, the people who play it and the animals that make it such an exciting event. Good food, good company, good fun ( and the wine's not bad either!) . . . .we've got some great photos and even better memories.

It's an absolute must in BA!. I couldn't recommend this experience more.. To anyone considering it, do it! You won't regret it. I had a lovely day out here, so much fun, great friendly staff and something you'll remember from your time in BA forever.

A fun filled day even if it did pour rain!. It was the last day of our vacation and certainly the highlight for me. Empanadas were great! Learned a lot about the game of polo, rules, equipment, etiquette, etc. Enjoyed watching the game. The field was really muddy after a heavy rainfall but it did not diminish our enjoyment. Then actually playing polo for non horse riders was a real high! Excellent value and I would recommend it to anyone!

One of the best days of our 3 week trip. Okay, I must first preface this comment by saying my husband and I do not normally sign up for 'touristy' experiences. I was a bit dubious to take a day out of our trip to do something like this. But it was of the most special, unique and wonderful days we had on our trip, and memories we will cherish for a life time. I would recommend to anyone to talk the time to spend with them.There are many positive things to say, you can read the other reviews to see what I mean, but there is one particular point I want to pass on. The people that run the ranch, our host for the day, and the members of the club who play polo- are all truly genuinely happy to have you there. I felt like part of the family for the day, not just a tourist.The food is amazing and the ranch beautiful, so even if you're not a horse person go there for the lunch and day outside the city.As another note, my husband and I are not easily fussed, like all food and are fairly athletic and we had a blast. However a few of the other people in our group had a range of dietary restrictions, were uneasy about playing the game and had particular scheduled to keep - they also had a blast. Everyone was catered to, and the hosts were very genuinely concerned that we had what we need, and we enjoying our day.

The polo was great, the rest… not so much!. So, I'll start with the good: The polo - actually playing - was amazing. Also, the empanadas were great. I wouldn't change either and if this day was only polo and empanadas then it would have been 5 stars. However, there were some awful elements.We were told it was 45 minutes from pickup to the ranch. It was 2 hours. Two hours!!!! We drove around BA picking up other people and 2 hours later we were there, dripping in sweat as we weren't allowed to open the windows in the car because of dust but the AC only worked for the two people in the front. On the car - THIS WAS REALLY DANGEROUS - we were picked up in a car that fit 6 people, with 6 seat belts. However, 7 people were put in. So one person had no seatbelt and there were three people jammed in a seat for 2 people… for 2 hours. Uncomfortable and unsafe. Continuing with the car - It shut off, completely, whilst we were driving - TWICE! Yeah! So not only did we not have seats or seat belts but we were in a car that stopped working whilst it was in use. Awesome.The wine was nice, but they ply you with wine before putting you on a horse. This is weird. And dangerous. A bit off.The lunch was disgusting. The "steak" was inedible. You couldn't cut it with a knife. They should've just served empanadas again. Every person was taking the meat and throwing it on the ground for the dogs. Inedible.Then there's the toilet. The toilet with no water. The one and only toilet that had poop in it that I had to go pee on top of. Twice. As did everyone else.Not sure if I'd do this again or recommend it. It had great parts but the safety issues paired with toilet issues was a bit too much. If I'm paying that much money I'd like to at least have safe transportation and a clean toilet. Oh - lastly - heading back was again 2 hours. We were told that we'd be back no later than 7pm. We were dropped off at 8:40 pm and missed our dinner reservations.

Totally Unique and Amazing Experience!. The Argentina Polo Day was not even on the radar for my girlfriend and I before visiting Buenos Aires. We had so many other things planned, but when we saw the reviews, we had to give it a try. Despite being cash-only, the day was absolutely incredible. We were picked up by Poly at our hotel, driven to the club, and served wine and empanadas immediately (early and often!). We learned the rules of polo, watched a match, asked questions, drank a TON of wine, and then had a great Argentinian BBQ lunch. After lunch, it was time to gear up and mount up for some polo! We played for over 90 minutes, and although my horse was a pain in the rump, it was a great experience. It truly made you appreciate how talented the REAL players are. We took a dip in the pool and were driven back to our hotel. It was really a unique and unforgettable experience. DO IT!

Totally a MUST do!. I must confess I am happily surprised with this experience! Went totally BEYOND my expectations! Everything went great! Wasn't my first time horse riding, but it's been a while since last time, and this beautiful horses plus the amazing staff made me feel confident and really enjoy every minute of it.Watching a real Polo game, and the actually playing it, made me feel like a Pro!And words are useless to describe how delightful luch was. We had an Asado, with a colorful Side Salad and an amazing Malbec Wine. I was expecting fun and spending my afternoon nicely, but here I had a blast!!! Met intresting people from everywhere, laughed until I cried, and really learn something I never though was this unique, trendy an cool. Special thanks for the host Pablo, how took his time to explain us everything over and over again, answering every question with a smile (and some funny jokes too.) I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!

Best day of our holiday. Without a doubt the best part of our 2 week holiday was Argentina Polo Day. The day was perfect, we were very lucky in terms of weather; although it was warm and sunny there was a nice breeze which helps with this activity. Don’t be put off this if you have never ridden before as there were many people in our group that had not and picked it up very quickly. The horses are great and are use to novice riders. When we arrived we were given wine and empanadas, which were lovely and you are supplied with wine the whole day which is brilliant. The lunch is also great and there was a great selection and plenty of food for our big group. The staff are amazing, so friendly and welcoming and go out their way to accommodate everyone’s needs. The day is also informative as well as a lot of fun. My only regret is not doing the polo day at the beginning of our holiday so I could have done it again! I would recommend this to everyone, great day and brilliant value for money.

Best day out!. This is one of the highlights of our 6 month trip in South America! For backpackers it was a bit on the pricey side for us but it was worth every penny! From private pick up, to yummy welcoming empanadas, to bottomless wine and beer, friendly staff, great guide, polo match and explanation, amazing BBQ and finally getting to play polo ourselves then chilling by the pool afterwards. Everything was perfect and so much fun, even if we did struggle to hit the ball.Don't hesitate, if you're in any way interested at all you'll love this. I love horses but my boyfriend has never ridden before and he enjoyed it more then I did!

Horsing around in BA. Even a bit of rain could not keep us away from the Argentina Polo Day. Luckily the rain cleared in time for our warmly greeted arrival and we were treated to the most amazing day! My highlight was Pablo our gorgeous guide who knew everything, answered every question and never let our wine glasses become empty (which is very difficult with 5 Australian girls!) The horses on the ranch were beautiful and friendly and they clearly enjoyed the game of polo. The match was very fun to watch and the games in between were great and hilarious with my now tipsy girlfriends. The food throughout the day was the best I had in Argentina. The empandas were the best I have ever had! Pablo can I please have the recipe!? The lunchtime BBQ was so good and more wine and great company made it even better. I loved getting on a horse and riding around trying to play polo. My horse was very smart - it would stop close to the ball to let me hit it! They know when the tourists are hiding them!After a fun game of polo we decided to cool off in the swimming pool with more wine and banter. It was truly one of the best activity days I've ever done during all of my travels and highly recommend it to everyone! Now when I go to the Polo in Australia I will actually know what I'm watching and how hard it is to play!

Everything was just amazing!. I loved the food, the activities, the people helping us, the place, the horses, the price. Everything was just great.It was great to experience Buenos Aires country side. It was just a fantastic day.

A memorable highlight to our time in Buenos Aires. This was the perfect compliment to our time in Buenos Aires. The guides were friendly and very helpful, the food even better. The day started with wine and ended with everyone on a horse involved in a group polo match (and more wine). If you're looking for a memorable, interactive experience, look no further.

just amazing!. loved it! such a perfect, relaxing day in the fields, learning, watching and even playing polo. they recieve you as you get off the bus with awesome "empanadas" and wine and then a very argentinian "asado" (bbq).the guides know everything you need to know, and they are happy to answer any kind of question you might have.pablo was the guide when i did it, and he makes you feel as a part of their family!i highly recomend this tour!

Best Part of Our Trip. Outstanding experience!! The staff is VERY kind, the horses are beautiful and well cared for, and the fields look like a postcard. Great adventure even if you have no horse riding experience. It was the most memorable part of our two weeks in Argentina. How many people can say they played polo in Argentina? I can...

Laughing the whole time. This was a truly great day. From all the good food, wine, fun games, and great instruction, I was laughing (or shouting to my "team") the whole time. The price in pesos is a bit stiff, but things with horses are always in pricey. If you have cash USD it is an excellent deal. Aside from learning a ton about the game from absolutely ground zero, our group of mixed experience was playing a full-on game by the afternoon. I loved that more experienced players joined us, to help pass to us when we were first starting, then to act as defense when we were playing, to show what kinds of things you have to watch out for in a real game. They were really good about making sure everyone was getting a chance to touch the ball or score.

Favorite activity EVER!!!. We have travelled a fare amount and done a lot of different things but this was by far the most fun I have ever had in a single day!! My husband, 21 yr old son and I were only in Buenos Aires for 1 days (in port on a cruise) and we wanted to do something memorable so we contacted Argentina Polo Day. Stefan picked us up at a hotel not far from the port and drove us 45 minutes to the ranch. We were greeted warmly then joined another group who had come out to spend the day. We were given instructions on the rules of polo then took our seats next to the field to watch a match. We got to participate by throwing in the ball and ringing the bell between chuckers (periods). While the riders were switching horses (they do this every 7 or 8 minutes) we were given shorter mallets to practice hitting the ball. This was lots of fun. We also got to talk to the players and ask them questions about their horses. The match was very competitive and exciting. Afterwards, we walked over to a several long tables that were set with platters of food down the middle. We were treated to a royal Argentine BBQ with a large variety of meats and vegetables. Since we had to leave earlier than the rest of the party to get back to our ship, Stefan came and got us suited up in our polo gear so we could start riding. Each of us was given a mount suitable to our skill level and size. For those who had not ridden before they were given instructions and time to practice. If we had ridden, we were given a mallet and sent out on the field to practice hitting balls. I love riding horses and was surprised to find that hitting a ball made it even more fun. My son, who had never ridden, had no trouble maneuvering his horse to steal my balls. Before long we had divided into teams and were playing a match. We would all very sad when the time came for us to dismount and head back to the cruise ship.  Celia was wonderful to work with. Stefan let me ride one of his own polo ponies, La Colorada. He was a delightful instructor. Pablo our guide was charming and very informative. I highly recommend this adventure to anyone headed to the Buenos Aires area. You will not be disappointed!

If you do nothing else in Buenos Aires, do the Argentine Polo Day!. The highlight of my trip to South America was the Argentina Polo Day with Celia and the rest of the staff. When I booked, I expected a relatively impersonal polo match, followed by a quick how-to for polo playing - was I ever wrong!! As soon as we arrived, we were greeted like friends, given a glass of wine and the best empanadas I've ever had. The atmosphere was warm and friendly, Celia and Pablo made us feel like family and introduced us to life in BA. After watching a fantastic polo match from the sidelines and meeting the polo players, we enjoyed a delicious BBQ with them and the staff, followed by an intro to polo playing. They gave us each a horse with a guide (if you needed one) and we spent about an hour riding around the luscious grounds getting comfortable with our horse and a mallet. Since there were only 4 'guests', they split us into 2 teams mixed in with polo players and guides and we played an actual polo match for close to an hour. I can't say enough about what a fantastic day this was...there is absolutely nothing I would change!! The food, the people, the guides, the polo playing...this will forever be one of the highlights of all my travels. If you like the outdoors, being active and seeing authentic polo playing, this is definitely a must-see and worth every penny!!Enjoy and say hi to Celia for me!Sonia Faucher (Canada)

Fun Day away from the city. We wanted to leave the city for the day and this was recommended by our concierge. We were picked up at our hotel by a car and driver (at about 11 am). I had thought it would be a bus, but it was a private car! The drive was about 45 minutes outside of Buenos Aires, up the highway, down a road and then down a dirt road! Where were we headed? There was a house where we left our stuff and met the other participants. The day was run by the English speaking manager. First there was wine/Coke and homemade empanadas. They were delicious and plentiful. He gave us some basic tips about the game of polo. We walked out to the polo field where there were chairs set up for us to watch a game and see the horses. More empanadas, more drinks! Lunch was served back by the house. All grilled-- short ribs, onions, zucchini-- all delicious. After lunch was time for us to mount the horses and try our hand at a game of polo. Fun, fun, fun! It was a warm day back to the house and there was a swimming pool. Everyone had fun. Our driver picked us up and we returned to the city (at about 7pm).If you know some Spanish try talking to the owner, Ruben. He sat under an awning drinking a beer and watching what was going on. I had a nice conversation with him, he is delightful but does not speak English.

A highlight of 3 month trip. Did it with my boyfriend, although a bit out of our travelling budget it was well worth it and great fun (1st glass of wine by 12pm :)).Pablo was a great guide, really energetic and enthusiastic and happy to give advice on other activities etc in BA. Empanadas are great. BBQ tasty but not the best steak in BA.
Nils. Best experiance so far in argentina in activites!Traveled all the way from sweden and the guide was the best around, everything was organized and good food.

Must See - Must Do Event By Buenos Aires. My son and I were in Buenos Aires for holiday and experienced Argentine Polo Day. They picked us up at our hotel in BA and took us to the farm about 45 minutes out of the city. We watched a polo match, ate, drank and then received a tremendous and unique experience of actually playing polo. After we ate some more, drank some more and swam. It was the best, must do experience in visiting BA. Yes, we were very sore the next day, but worth it. Our host, Pablo Fazzari was simply the best. A gracious host who was patient yet ensured we went away with knowledge of the King of Sports and the Sport of Kings. In the summer months remember your swim suits its a great way to recharge. 100% MUST DO!

This day made my whole holiday. What a brilliant day. Wine, wonderful people and a chance to learn polo. This day trip made my whole holiday. It was on a whim that I went and ended up having so much fun.

The surprise highlight of our trip!. My 3 girlfriends and I booked this day trip with no expectations. 2 of them were a little skeptical of the program but once we reached the "farm", we had no doubts we were going to have a great time!Before I continue about the day itself, I should mention and recognize Cecila - my contact at Argentina Polo Day. I researched and started corresponding with her several weeks before the trip and she was always prompt, courteous and concise. Her follow up was pleasant and never pushy. . . The booking process was very smooth and they delivered on every promise - Very grateful for that since not every booking experience from afar is answered or efficient!About the day. . . they picked us up from our home at precisely the time they said they would. The ride out to La Carona was nice and the countryside was a nice departure from the hustle and bustle of BA. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by the gorgeous Pablo and offered a glass of wine. We felt instantly relaxed, safe and at home!The colours and décor of the main house and surrounding farm was stunning. In the back of the house, there were tangerine trees brimming with fruit, a barbeque pit with colourful vegetables roasting and a nice long table set up for lunch. On the day we were there, there were 15 others from all over North America and it was great to meet fellow travellers!With a glass of wine in hand, we were seated and the origins and rules of Polo were explained. After this, we walked to the polo field and watched a very exciting polo match (while drinking even more wine!) Everyone really got into the game! Even though I didn't start the day as a fan of horse or polo, believe me when I say I have a huge amount of respect and love for both now!After a superb lunch of barbequed meats and vegetables and conversations with new friends, we actually got on the horses, worked on drills, and later had our own polo match (OK - so we THOUGHT we were having a match) Wow, what a work out but so much FUN! Most of us had not been on horses in decades but yet, we managed to hit the balls with our mallets and stay on the beautiful beasts! It was sad when our day ended. . . Many thanks to Pablo, a most handsome and charming facilitator! Thanks to everyone that took care of us - we know that there were many people in the background making sure every detail was perfect.If you are in BA, you must book Argentina Polo Day - You will have a great time! We are considering taking a trip back to Argentina so we can take a clinic there!

It was a nice birthday present!!!. Even I am from Argentina, our polo day at La Carona on 02Dic2013 was wonderful! It was a nice birthday present!!! It was possible to enjoy silence, landscape, food and hospitality. At the same time we have also learned and practiced polo. Being in touch with these lovely horses was special experience! The asado and all vegetables were simply delicious. All personal was very kind and always giving useful advices and taken some photos (sent later) to remember this colorful polo day close to the big city BsAs! Silvana.

Best Horse Vacation Ever. I recently participated in an intensive eight day Polo Clinic at the La Carona Polo Club where daily guest participate in an extremely popular Polo Day event. Im an avid horseman and Endurance (long distance, multi-day) competitor residing in Washington State, USA. My long held desire was to travel to Argentina, the epicenter of world class Polo, and have my first experience in the sport be with the worlds best. A friend who attended Polo Day and subsequent clinics provided rave reviews and even insisted on attending with me. I can only say every expectation was exceeded! The accommodations were first class in the new club house, the food and wine were exquisite and ever so plentiful, the service superb and oh the Polo! I was assigned the head groom as my instructor and he was amazing. Manuel was patient as a saint with incredible horse and mallet skills. He paired me with the most sensational, well trained horses I have had the privilege to ride. My favorite, La Pintada, was a completely reliable, safe and beautiful painted Corollia with a silky smooth canter and gallop. She allowed me to ride at speed while concentrating on ball and mallet skills. All the horses were similarly well trained with lots of go. Every day included intense "one on one" training followed by interaction with the day guest in a fun, easy going match. They came from all over the world and most transformed from apprehensive doubters to enthusiastic participants as the day evolved. Everyone enjoyed themselves emensly. On the next to last day I noticed the owner, Ruben, observing me as I moved the ball up and down the field during my training session. To my never ending delight and consternation, he invited me to play in the club member match the following day. My stomach was churning as I worried about making a fool of myself or worse at speed with those quality players. Going for broke, I accepted and had one of the most marvelous experiences of my life. Although my ball handling skills were lacking, I was able to keep pace with the group an play some defense and even bump and grind as I went for the ball. ( I believe Polo is the only horse to horse contact sport). I could go on forever about this once in a lifetime experience. I'm sure I learned more in eight days than I would in a year of lessons back home. I plan to be back next year for a more advanced session and will practice, practice, practice in between!

Best time spent. My wife and I were traveling in Argentina last month and we went to polo for a day expecting to have a great time. Polo day passed our expectations with flying colors! You literally live like a king or queen while you are there. Lots of food and drinks none stop, beautiful countryside, and lots of horses and polo. They teach you how to ride, the rules of the game, and provide everything you need. This was probably our best adventure and time spent in Buenos Aires.

"Amazing" "Maravilhoso". Polo Day was an unforgetable experience during my trip to Argentina. The staff is really warm, the horses are well trainned and the atmosphere is very pleasant. No matter how old you are it's a definetly enjoyable. You can talk to Pablo, Ruben and Celia. I'd surely go back.

South American Highlight. Polo Day was one of the highlights of our South American trip. The hospitality we were shown was excellent, and we couldn't ask for more.  The horses were very well trained and good quality. They dealt very well with a wide range of horse experience, and let us set our own pace. We had our own horses all our lives (we're in our late 70's), but learned new things from the encouraging crew.

A Unique and memoreable Experience. From the very beginning, Celia and the team at Argentina Polo Day were really easy to work with. They were super responsive to email and to some of our group's time constraints. The day itself was great, with demonstrations of Polo, interactions with the horses and the players, as well as basically unlimited wine and delicious traditional Argentinian BBQ. The highlight is definitely going from knowing basically nothing about polo and having never ridden a horse to getting on a horse and playing (not very well but still...) polo. The horses all appear really well taken care of and well trained and everyone in our group had a great time. The guides speak great English as well if that is an issue.

Outstanding!!. My husaband and I went out for the polo day not really knowing what to expect. We both have ridden quite a bit but knew nothing about polo. I am 60 and my husband 65. It was awesome! The food and wine outstanding....especially those delicious empanadas. The staff was attentive and engaging with a great sense of humor. Watching the polo match, then practicing different techniques from the ground, then practicing mounted on our horses, then a game of polo....it was educational and so much fun! Lots of good laughs and so much great food. I would go back in a heartbeat. Worth every penny!

Fantastic time. Had a wonderful day out whilst visiting B.A. The team, food, wine and team were top notch and provided an excellent experience which is definitely worth a try if you're into horses, Polo or just a great day out.Thanks guys!

A must do in Buenos Aires. What a wonderful day for anyone visiting BA!! I am travelling on my own and this was definitely one of the highlights of my trip. Getting picked up from your hotel is always a great start and the trip out to the farm was pleasant. Upon arrival to the beautiful farm you are stocked up with red wine and incredibly delicious empanadas. Next you get to watch a game and learn some rules and techniques. Then it's back to the house for a huge BBQ lunch with delicious meats, salads and vegetables.. And more wine!!! Finally it's time to ride and play polo. It doesn't matter if you've ridden before or not, the horses are well trained and assigned according to your ability. I've done lots of riding before and was given a great pony. It was such a fun day and I definitely cannot recommend it enough for anyone looking for a great and entertaining day out. Oh yeah, Paulo is hot! Haha, and he didn't tell me to write that!!

Great day!. The Polo Day Team are amazing at delivering a great day of fun, good food, education, and hospitality. You are truly treated as their special guests. The entire day was fantastic. Special thanks to Raul and Poly for making the day one of our trip highlights.

Trip Highlight!. I had amazing time at the ranch! We ate so much great good and wine, the people were friendly, and we were picked up and dropped off at our apartments at the beginning and end of the day. First you watch a game of Polo to understand the rules. They will gauge your experience on a horse (mine was almost none) and choose a horse accordingly. Once everyone is saddled up they teach you the basics of riding before you start practicing hitting the ball and playing at a walking or trotting pace. Very easy for everyone. For those with more experience who wanted to ride faster a group broke off and also had a great time battling it out. I'm actually quite sporty and had no problem hitting the ball and one of the workers traded his horse for mine and I was in full gallop before you knew it. It was truly one of the highlights of my trip and I'm seriously considering going back and spending a week there for their intensive session.

Buenos Aires MUST DO!. Worth every dime. The day was complete and awesome. Helped that we had good weather, but regardless, what an experience! The food was some of the best I had while in Argentina (actually, it was the best). Our day guide was super awesome. The horses were beautiful and super well trained.Everyone made us feel really welcome... lots and lots of wine. Nice pool. Simply a must.

A great day out!. From the moment we were picked up from our hotel, the Argentina Polo Day team was so very hospitable. After arriving at the farm, we were plied with food and drink and were encouraged to relax and enjoy ourselves. It really was a day of good food, good wine and great company. I’d highly recommend Argentina Polo Day! No horse-riding experience necessary; the guys will take good care of you.

Great experience, great hospitality, great empanadas. We had an excellent day. We were picked up at our hotel by one of the members of the club. The trip to Pilar was around 1h15. We were greated with the best empanadas I have ever eaten and some wine to wash them down. After it was time to watch some members play while we are taught some of the basic rules. Before we start our polo game we are served an asado. Finally it is time for two hours on the back of the horse of which one is the actual game. I am not accustomed to horses but I found the horse easy to run and lets face it, chasing a ball and trying to score is always great fun.

One of the Best Days in Buenos Aires. I highly recommend an afternoon at the Polo Day. Everything was punctual and perfect from the wine and BBQ to the weather. The horses were so beautiful and very well trained. My group had an enjoyable time with the fun yet professional Pablo, Manuel and the rest of the staff.We would definitely do it again.

A fun filled day!. Our family loved every part of this day...the property, the staff, the food, the activities, and of course, the horses! The staff really go out of their way to make you feel welcome from the moment you arrive, and throughout the day. We had our 2 very young children with us, but they made sure that we did not miss out on any of the days activities. Food was delicious and plentiful and our wine glasses were literally never empty. And the staff was wonderful at bringing all the guests together and creating a very family friendly experience. Would highly recommend Argentina Polo Day to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!
An unforgettable experience!. This was one of my best days out in Buenos Aires! Had a fantaaastic time and highly recommend this to everyone for a little taste of Argentine culture.

100% Recommendable!. I had the most amazing day!! highly recommendded... horses were well trained which alows you to get easy on the activity....even you are terrified (Which I was!! jaja).. food and wine were awesome...special thanks to Pablo for being so kind and helpfull, he really tried his best for making us feel comfortable and had great fun :) .... Would do it again!
I loved!. I was in Buenos Aires, and I loved the Polo day!!... Staff is very professional, place is wonderful and the game was a lot of fun. Kudos for Pablo, he's great! For sure I will back!

What a fun day.... When else are you going to have a chance to watch and play polo??What a fun time learning about polo and Argentinian culture! Although we went on a rainy day, it was still super fun! Wine, food and company were all great, and it was so nice to just relax for a day... An afternoon of horse riding and polo lessons from the morning's players was a great introduction to the game and everyone in our group from us, in our late twenty's, to the seventy year old couple that earlier swore they would never get on a horse (they both ended up on horseback by the end of the day) had a blast. Thanks to all the staff who made it a day to remember!

Best day of the trip. Spent a week in Buenos Aires, and certainly the Polo day was the highlight of the trip... Staff is very professional, place is beautiful and the game was a lot of fun. Kudos for Pablo, he's great!

Just Do This!. ... It will be the highlight of your trip! I hadn't been on a horse in years and have always been intrigued with the game of pollo. Our excellent host, Pablo picked us up, at our apt and just a 45 min drive to the pollo fields. We were greeted by a warm and friendly staff, and a glass of wine. While we sipped, Pablo explained the history of the sport in Argentina. Once the players were ready, we headed over to the field to watch the match. We participated in tossing the ball in and got to see all the pollo rules in action. After the match we were treated to an awesome Argentinian BBQ while enjoying great company and conversation. And then, yes, we mounted well trained ponies and got play pollo! Not too worry if you haven't been on a horse. The horses and staff are top shelf and will help you have a fun and safe experience. If you are looking for genuine Argentinian experience, this is it. The countryside is beautiful, and the people are amazing hosts who enjoy sharing their way of life with others. Just DO this, you won't regret it!

Best Day in BA. We didn´t know what exactly to expect with this tour and were blown away by our experience. My sister and I wanted to see more about the Argentinan culture and thought what better way then to do something new. We had never played or watched a polo match before and couldn´t wait to see what it was all about. Everything was more then we expected. Our guide, Pablo, arrived on time and was a fantastic source of humor and imformation the entire day. We were greated with fantastic empandadas once arriving to the fields with unlimited wine and beverages. We watched a polo match, learned about the sport and practiced. Lunch was an AMAZING parrilla which included several types of meat, salad, sides and again more wine. You will not be dissapointed with this lunch. Ever. Afterwards, we were able to pratice the sport with our own horses and teachers.This was our favorite part of the day. The staff could not have been more helpful or accomodating.Enough with this review...just take the tour and you will not regret it.

Polo day, me encanta. Polo day, me encanta! I was a little bit scared at the beginning, but my horse was well-trained and we became amigos quickly. Thanks to Pablo for being such a great and patient host, fantastic hospitality.
Loved the BBQ and home made empanadas. I just arrived in BA but love it already. When will polo be a hit in Holland?

Fantastic and Fun Day.. Best day in BA!!
very very very fun!!!! Everything was perfect, the best BBQ we had during this trip!
Horses are awesome!!!. Great hospitality. 
Special thanks to Pablo and all the crew!!!! 
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Perfecto!. Incredible Polo day in Argentina ...I'd highly recommend this to people looking for an authentic experience- the horses, the bbq, empanadas, and the staff were out of this world!! Very hospitable, friendly, charming and passionate people. Cheers from Aus to Pablo and the crew! Hope to come back again for some more fun!!

Fantastic day with the horses!!!. It's not a visit to Argentina without riding a horse!!! But make sure it's a polo horse! The day is well organized from start to finish with very friendly staff who are immensely patient and attentive no matter what level of rider you are. The venue is first class with good food, good horses and flowing wine. Our host, Pablo, made all the guests feel special and nothing was too much trouble to ensure that everyone had a perfect day. This is one must do activity in Argentina and we feel that there would not be a better venue to do it! Vegetarian meals are a possibility just make sure you mention it when you book with Celia.

Amazing day. If you are looking for a truely Argentinian experience during your stay then look no further. I had an amazing day with Argentina Polo Day! Everything is taken care of from the moment Pablo picks you up from your hotel until you are returned at the end. The empanadas, barbeque and wine were incredible. Every person gets to play polo and it is great fun to practice what you learn. We played for over an hour and it was fantastic. I would recommend it to anyone - go and have fun!!

Did not disappoint!!! Highlight of our trip. My husband booked this polo day for us during our BA trip, and I'm so glad he did. It was the highlight!!! Celia and the rest of the staff made us feel so welcome and at home. She did not like kept filling our wine glasses and the food was delicious (amazing empanadas!). I was a little nervous about getting on a horse, but they made sure I was with an experienced polo player - I felt safe. And when we played a polo match, I just kept pinching myself because it was such a great and unique experience. Such an amazing day and great memory that I will remember always.

Best day in BA. This was a fantastic day from start to finish. Lovely hosts treated us to wine and food all day. Excellent lunch, and great fun to have a go on a polo on a pony that knows what it is doing!

Highlight of Buenos Aires!. Definitely a MUST when you're in BA. Amazing wine, food (especially the empanadas), polo lesson and great company. Celia and her staff are an absolutely delight and made us feel right at home. No review can describe the incredible day we had. Our only regret is that we wish we booked this for more than one day. Would definitely make a trip back to Buenos Aires just to experience this again.

Argentina polo day. Thorough enjoyed the whole day, was never without a full glass or an empty plate! The BBQ lunch was really yummy. Enjoyed watching a game of polo, I'd never watched before. Did feel a bit apprehensive getting on the horse with little to no experience and after a couple glasses of wine, however enjoyed myself none the less.

One of the highlights of our trip :o). Fantastic experience!"We have two rules - your glass is never empty of wine and your hand is never empty of an empanada!" - that was the opening line as we walked in to the Argentina Polo Day grounds!Neither of us had ever been on a horse before but Celia, Ruben and friends coached us all of the way through.

Unforgettable Experience!!!. Argentina Polo Day was nothing but fabulous from amazing lunch to horseback riding to sipping on some incredible red wine! Celia and her amazing team made us feel very welcome and kept the excitement going. My friends and I had a fabulous time playing polo even playing with the new puppies they had running around. THIS IS ONE HIGHLY RECOMMENDED THING TO DO IN BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT! We still talk about it to this day.

Amazing day of polo, food and fun!. This was one of the best days we spent in Buenos Aires. Everything was perfect, plus, the best "asado" we had during this trip! Thank you Celia, Ruben, friends and staff to make our day perfect! See you on our next trip to Buenos Aires! :)Natalia & Amardeep.
Argentina Polo Day. Had a brilliant day, fun, relaxed, excellent food and hospitality. A very memorable day enjoyed by whole group. YOU CAN"T COME TO ARGENTINA WITHOUT TRYING THIS!
Ripper day!. Would highly recommend. Easy enough even if you've never been on a horse. Great hospitality and good mix of events for the day. Safety is a bit lax.

Amazing Time. We had a great time with Celia and Ruben at Argentina Polo Day. Well organised, super friendly and what an experience. I have never been on a horse before and we were playing for 2 hours in the afternoon plus watching the match in the morning was a fantastic experience. I can just recommend this to anyone who wants to discover the sport and this side of Argentina.

A fantastic experience and amazing people ! DO IT !!!. During a visit to BA, as a group of 8 we looked for something to do together. We were picked up from the hotel, 45 min drive out to the polo fields, very informative brief / video during the trip. On arrival, super friendly owners and staff, constantly flowing wine and beers, BBQ making delicious steaks. Watched a polo match , full sit down BBQ, then it was our turn to try. Fantastic experience , even the non-enthusiastic horse people had a blast. Delivered back to our hotel ! A whole day out. Overall, I can't credit this enough. 10 stars if I could. The people are so welcoming, friendly and enthusiastic. A real pleasure to meet. A brilliant "must do" experience. Will certainly go agian if I am in BA !

Amazing Experience!. Argentina Polo Day was an incredible experience not to be missed if you are in the Buenos Aires Area! I just returned from an around the world trip and this was one of my favorite experiences on all five continents! It is a family owned facility, and they put their heart and soul into the business. I was picked up at the hotel on time and brought to the farm about 45 minutes outside of Buenos Aires. There was plenty of empanadas and wine when we arrived. I was paired with another couple and a woman from Australia who were a pure joy. We were explained the rules of the game and then were able to watch a polo match in the morning. The members playing were passionate, fun and enticing. There was a healthy competition to the game which made it exciting to watch and made me eager to learn. At lunch we were served an authentic BBQ with plenty of steak, vegetables, wine...and healthy conversation! In the afternoon we practice some strategies and were able to mount the horses. The horses are well cared for and groomed-true polo ponies with zest and vigor for the game. The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and safe on and off the horses. They even lined me up for a goal or two! It was open of the most exhilarating experiences I have had in a long time. I could not stop smiling and laughing. It was pure joy! I would definitely recommend this experience to anyone interested in an amazing day. You do not need experience riding or with polo to enjoy yourself. Thank you again!!! This is not to be missed!!!!
BEST TIME!!!. Had such an amazing day. I was traveling for just over 4 and a half months and this was DEFINITELY one of the stand out highlights.

Amazing experience! I want to go back. Argentine Polo Day was the highlight of my travels through Argentina! I grew up competing in equestrian sports but had never tried polo, or seen a game. And even though it was not the official polo season whilst we were there, I was still able to experience this wonderful game because of Argentine Polo Day. And it was incredible! Fantastic hospitality, delicious food and wine, very informative and thrilling. The ponies were beautifully trained and an dream to ride, i wanted to take mine home with me! The staff were a lot of fun, supportive and helpful, but competitive too! I could definitely see myself getting into this sport!

Something for everyone. My coworker (Carol), mom and I all went to the Argentina Polo Day, with different expectations and desires for the day, but each of us left thinking that day was the very best of the trip. Carol, is allergic to horses, and even without being about to ride or touch the horses she said that the ability to watch and understand the game plus the gracious hosts made the day completely worth doing. Carol also loved sitting out of the city, getting some fresh air, while sipping on a delicious Malbec :). My mom, is afraid of horses, but she was able to go at a speed that made her comfortable and confident on the horse. They had a man walking directly with her the whole time she was on the horse, giving her tips and helping her feel safe. I love horses, but I'm not much of a rider. I wasn't afraid to try though, and the Polo day gave me a long private riding instruction. By the end of the day I was galloping and actually contributing to the game of Polo I was playing in. Seriously, the best day of my year!Yes the food is good/the wine is tasty, yes the scene is lovely, but more than any of that, the group of people at the field tailor the experience to you and make sure everyone leaves as happy as can be. How could you go wrong with an experience like that?! This is 100% a must do if visiting Buenos Aires!!

This is a must do while in Argentina!. We went on a cold and rainy day so our expectations weren't high for an outdoor excursion, but we couldn't have been more wrong. What a fun and amazing day! The staff were so friendly and informative. The food and wine was phenomenal and nonstop. I opted out of riding and enjoyed the fire and company of Celia and Valentina. My friends that went riding said that they had a blast too. We were so sad to go. If I'm ever in Argentina again, I'll definitely be back. A must do experience!

Polo Perfecto!!!. Please, even if you are in Argentina for only a few days (like I was) and any time of the year (I was there July-winter/off season) be sure to dedicate one day to Argentina Polo Day!! Ruben and Celia were wonderful hosts! We were picked up at our hotels in the morning and whisked off to the ranch. We were greeted with wine and cheese and the crew, Maggie, Felipe and Alicia talked to us about the basics of Polo - of which I knew nothing! There was a fire pit to keep us warm on the chilly winter day and the crew even provided us with jackets and blankets to watch the match. Each of us got a turn tossing the ball into play. The crew then directed us in playing warm up games on the field with the ball and mallet before we mounted the horses. Being a novice horseback rider the crew was so helpful in giving me explicit directions on how to 'drive'. I even managed to hit the ball a few times!!! We then went inside for an authentic Argentinian BBQ - and the food and wine flowed. Chorizo, steak, delish vegetables - I rolled out of there!!! It was truly a thrilling experience - one that will make me smile when I look back upon it.
Great day out. A great fun filled day, very friendly crew, excellent food. Professional riding advice. Highly recommended.

Best Day in Buenos Aires. I highly recommend the Argentina Polo Day trip. From start to finish the team did everything they could to make our day perfect. I had not been on a horse in years but Maggie, Felipe, and Alicia did their best to help. They were all extremely welcoming and served up a terrific lunch (with lots of great wine). Since it was a cold day when I was there, they also did their best with blankets, a fire, even jackets to keep us warm but by the time we got the horse we forgot about the cold. I am so glad I booked this day trip as it was definitely the best day we had in Buenos Aires!

Highlight of Buenos Aires. I could not recommend Argentina Polo Day more highly! Celia and her crew do an incredible job making you feel right at home amongst the beautiful surrounds of their property...we were visiting BA for my cousin's wedding and our family (group of 15) went along to Argentina Polo Day together. All different ages and riding levels were accomodated and everything was explained in clear English. A must-do while you are in BA!
Something to remember!. Excellent way to approach Polo. Really something for everybody no matter ages or horse skills.A day I will really remember my whole life.

Brilliant day thanks to an amazing and well organized team. Did the full day experience as part of a two week visit to Argentina. From start to finish all the team did everything they could to make the experience a great day. I had never been on a Horse before so was a bit unsure about if I would enjoy the day, but the person who taught me spoke great English and the Horses where so calm I never once felt worried once I was there. The food and wine throughout the day was very good and almost relentless - should I return to Buenos Aires I would go as far as to say I would probably do the whole day again.

Exceeded expectations. I am a 47 year old business man traveling thru Buenos Aires from Florida and decided to take a couple days of personal time to enjoy the world of Argentine Polo firsthand. I did my research and decided to book a 2 day Polo clinic this June at the El Camino Polo Club and Ranch in beautiful Pilar, Argentina just outside of Buenos Aires. Here, owner, polo player, coach, chef, and sommelier Ruben and his lovely wife Celia also operate their year-round "Argentina Polo Day" operations available to anyone living or visiting Buenos Aires. I really appreciate their love of polo and genuine interest to share this passion with those interested regardless of riding or playing experience. I haven't ridden in 4 years and after just a couple hours was feeling very confident and comfortable enough to accept the invitation to play 4 chukkas on my second day. Yes, Ruben threw me into the "fire" :-) and I loved it. I even made my first GOAL at that game and also found the other players to be very courteous and gracious to the "new guy". Ruben gives you lots of personal attention and he along with his instructors do a great job of helping develop riding and playing skills. You basically ride as much as you can handle or desire while there is daylight. Totally awesome ! Ruben has 3 polo fields with 2 more in a few weeks, over 60 horses and those I road were wonderful. Accommodations are available right inside the ranch or Celia can arrange for very luxurious accommodations nearby. I slept at the guest house at the ranch just steps from the polo field. The food is Fabulous!! and "Don David winemaker" is one of El Camino's sponsors, so his delicious wines are available at every meal. Ruben, Celia, the club members, and staff will make you feel like part of the family and I can honestly say my experience exceeded my expectations in all areas. It is a sincere pleasure to write this review and I look forward to my next visit.

One of my favourite days out in South America.. I spent a few months in South America, but this by far was one of the best days. Amazing value. The whole day is run so well, by amazing people. With unlimited red wine and an amazing BBQ for lunch. This was the first time I had experienced Polo and because of this day, I am hoping to carry on playing. You get to see a live Polo game and then you are able to play in your own live game whilst learning tips from experienced players. If you can only pick one thing to do in Argentina, I would recommend this for sure! I would not have a single negative thing to say about this day even if I tried! Such a nice and relaxing day for all people!

A fantastic experience. A really fun day out. The whole experience was really well organised and professional. The horses were obviously well cared for, the food delicious and the staff really helpful. As a non horse rider this was stlll great fun and I highly recommend it!

My 50th birthday celebration. I booked the Polo Day for my group of 12 (all women ages 30s thru 70s) during my 50th b-day celebration in Buenos Aires! Oh my God! The polo day was fantastic and fabulous! From our arrival in the beautiful Argentine countryside and warm and welcoming greetings from the staff with wine and delicious empanadas to the educational experience of learning about polo and then seeing the Polo Game, prepping and getting a bit of fun exercise and then a wonderful, delicious "asado" feast at a beautifully decorated table outdoors under blue skies (with more wine) and ultimately riding the horses and playing polo, it was one of our best days in Argentina! Even those in my group who don't ride loved the Polo Day and took pics on a dedicated picture horse! I do ride and learning polo and then running the horses across the polo field was thrilling. The staff was top-notch, friendly, warm and helpful throughout the day. If you go to BA, you should deifnitely spend a day at Argentina Polo. I had thought about the ranch but they were less responsive so I am positive we made the right choice! The cost is worth the experience!

The only way to experience Argentinian Polo!. When my husband and I booked in to do the polo we didn't realise just how much we would get out of it!The day is full of activities at a very relaxed pace. We learnt all about the game snacking on incredible empanadas (the best we had in Argentina!), wine kep flowing throughout the day, watched a game, had an absolute feast for lunch, then when the food subsided got on and gave Polo a go ourselves.We never felt rushed and the hospitality shown by Reuben and the team made a feel like we could stick around all day.Polo is a must in Argentina and this is the best way to experience it! Thank you all!

Must-do activity for Buenos Aires (for ALL travelers). Even if you are here for a quick trip regardless of time of year - do not miss out on Polo Day Argentina because they are open year-round! You will not regret it. It was my first time in BA and after emailing back and forth with Celia, who was FANTASTIC, responsive, patient and provided great information and details, we booked this activity for two people. I recommend for ALL travelers, frequent or first timers. The ranch is beautiful, Ruben and his staff are so wonderful and make you feel so comfortable, they explain the game very well, you get to watch an awesome game of polo, delicious asado and we got to experience horse-riding and some polo - for all level of experience. Don't be intimidated if you've never heard of polo, or if you are a pro - this is for you too! There is definitely a family feel to it and did not feel touristy. Such a great experience, and we loved it!

A Great Experience. I've just come back from a two day polo clinic with an overnight stay. It was one of the greatest things I've ever done! From the first minute I felt at home and well looked after. A great mix between learning and playing polo, having a good time with friends and enjoying the countryside. If you already know how to ride and like fast sports you will return with a huge smile on your face that lasts for days (ok, and a sore wrist too ;-)). But knowing how to ride is not necessary. You'll love it!

Best day in Buenos Aires. Our Argentina Polo Day was GREAT. My boyfriend and me enjoyed learning how to ride a horse and also how to play Polo. The wine and the food that we was served was awesome, and I really recommend this attraction if you are going to spend some days in Buenos Aires!! Two thumbs up!! Don't miss out on this experience!!

Return to ArgentinaPoloDay. Since my birthday trip last year I longed to come back, especially since we now have our own polo club: Finca los Tigres Polo, in Andalucia, Spain. This time I brought my husband and we stayes overnight. It was fantastic: we started with a welcome drink over a romantic blazing fire, then slept in the most comfortable accommodation right there in the Club House. The next morning Ruben gave us a copious breakfast, after which we had a wonderful ride out along the estancia's grounds and beyond. Lunch was a fantastic as I remembered it and then it was time for the polo match. We brought our own Finca los Tigres Polo Team shirts with us and Ruben kitted out half of his men in our colours! Imagine our delight when "we"won!! After this uplifting experience my husband and I mounted our polo ponies and had a good time playing stick and ball, with exeprienced instructors who enjoyed teaching us yet that bit more! Sadly, we only had that day and left with many polo plans for the future. ArgentinaPoloDay is a superb way of getting to know polo and we thoroughly advise it!

Loved it!. You Must do Argentina Polo day!!! Not only because the Polo experience and the Argentinian meal including all you can eat typical local meat and vine was exceptional but also because the people that work or/and play polo are the nicest people you'll ever meet. They cared so much about people.They even set up us after that day with all kind of others activities in the country that we wanted to do throughout our trip and it would of not been the same without their help. Thanks for everythingMarc

Fun for all. Great experience and very nice hosts.It doesn't matter if you've never ridden a horse before or already know how to handle a horse and a mallet, it's just a wondeful day with an amazing atmosphere and pleasant people.

Best polo experience in Argentina. The pepople at Argentina Polo Day is dedicated, experience and very friendly. I strongly recomend it for your next trip in Argentina.Celia, Ruben and the whole APD crew will make you at home.

Amazing day!. Went to Argentina Polo day with a few friends, definitely one of the best days of our whole trip!!! We got as much food as drink as we wanted, both of which were delicious! They polo match was amazing to watch and after having a go ourselves really respected how good the members are. The highlight of the day was the riding in the afternoon, the horses are so good and they are prepared for all standards of riding. Really felt like we had a proper chance to have a go at polo and no one wanted to leave when the day was over and very good value for money when you take into consideration everything that is included! Would highly recommend it to everyone from families, to couples and to people travelling on their own! Will definitely be going back if I'm back in Argentina!!!

Best day I've ever had on a holiday!!!. Argentina polo day was the best experience I've had in a long time! The food and wine were great and the polo match was great to watch. My aim was to simply hit the ball when it was my turn but to all the groups surprise they quickly got us up to even playing a little mini game. I'm determined to play again some day! What you get for your money is incredible value for money and I would highly recommend the day to anyone!

Argetina Polo Day, a lot of fun!!!. Absolutely amazing trip! Not only is Argentina a beautiful country, my husband and my personal favorite was learning polo at Argentina Polo Day! An amazing day! We were actually playing polo at the end of the day. We watched an incredible and fast polo match, they were pros! Lunch with the locals talking about horses and the tasty barbecue were a bonus! Thanks so much Celia, Ruben and Argentina Polo Day! We will be back soon!xoxo

Definite must do activity in Argentina. One of the most fun activity to do in Argentina. A definite must do. You will be in awe of the skills by the polo demo/practice/game on display. You will then be given a chance to learn and play the game of polo at your own pace. Polo day also includes lunch where you will taste the best empanada in Argentina (I have not been able to find any better yet) and all you can eat BBQ. Ruben, Celia and the rest of the crew are the most down to earth host as well.

You can play polo too. We spent the day learning about polo, watching polo and playing polo. It was probably the best day of our trip to Argentina. The food was good quality and plentiful. The wine was poured freely. You do not even need to know how to ride a horse to take an active part in playing. I do caution you: no credit cards. This is cash only regardless of what else you may be told. With that exception it is a great way to spend a day outdoors and active.

Mindblowingly awesome!. This was definitely the highlight of my stay in Argentina!! An amazing experience, from start ti finish. I want to start playing polo regularly now! (and I've never been on a horse before... they are that good :))

Argentinian Polo Day. Great experience to watch, learn and play a little polo. The day in general was fantastic with a good Parrilla lunch and plenty of liquid courage for getting onto the horses in the afternoon.

Incredible Experience!. Celia and Ruben were great hosts and instructors. I will never forget an amazing day eating fantastic food, tasting phenomenal wine and playing polo. If you are visiting Argentina do not hesitate, go straight to Argentina Polo Day. Experience is priceless. Thank you Federico polizzi for bringing us there. Best tour guide ever!!!!

A Polo Day To Remember. We decided to come to Argentina Polo Day after it came highly recommended from our tour leader-he was right, what a fun experience! Celia, Ruben and the team were so friendly and took us in like we were part of their family. It was great to see the Polo match and then get to try our own luck at the game. They catered to all levels and were very attentive to everyone's needs. We also got a great BBQ and an endless supply of red wine and laughter. This is an experience that I will always remember! Thank you guys for everything!!

A once in a lifetime experience. Was in BA with a group of family/friends in March and included a 'Day of Polo' in our trip. We had so much fun, so many laughs and not one single injury. The staff were all friendly and eager to help us not only have fun but feel comfortable enough to get on a horse and have a go - which we almost all did. The food was fantastic and more than we could possibly eat and the drinks flowed freely. The Empanadas were to die for - the best we found in all of South America by a long shot and the day was one of the most memorable of our entire trip. To Celia, Ruben and the staff - thankyou for providing an amazing, once in a lifetime experience with great service and convenience. Booking was simple and the pick up and return to hotels safe and comfortable and on time. Definitely an activity not to be missed.

A perfect day. Pick up: perfectPlace: perfectHorses: perfectTeacher and assistants: perfectFood and wine: perfectAll the "hard" elements of the experience were perfect, but that was only the beginning. Truely we have been guests of Ruben, the owner. He is really passionate of his job and he does it greatly!It was a superb day, everything was perfect.Next time i'll do the 3 days clinic, he has a guest house, simple but very nice. Spending a couple of nights there with some friends will be a great experience.jack

An absolutely incredible experience!!. My family from Australia were over in Bs As for a wedding and had organised a day at Argenina Polo Fay as something to do all together. There were 12 of us plus another few couples and I cannot tell you how much we loved it! The booking process was super easy; they picked us up and dropped us back at the hotel - Celia is incredibly well organised - and more importantly, the experience is one I will never ever forget. The day stated off with the most delish empanadas we had anywhere on South America, wines and a quick explanation of the rules, Steph, Alex and Alex were such a joy. And the slight language barrier between us and Ruben did not curb his enthusiasm in demonstrating a range of essential skills. Brilliant! Following this, more wine while watching a professional polo match right there on the ranch. The game was fast and furious and of a very high standard, the young kid absolutely killed it! It was truly brilliant. Our lunch cooked on site all in their parrilla was absolutely delish. And as much as you could eat... Brontosaurus ribs we were calling them! And then...it was our turn, to mount the professionally trained polo ponies for some practice followed by a game against each other. Hilarious yto play, i cannot even begin to imagine how funny we were to watch. Luckily the horses knew what they were doing, such amazing animals. And the puppies on the farm...we absolutelu wanted to take Nandomhome with us!! The Argentina Polo Day was undoubtedly one of the absolute highlights of my South American trip, and a at I will never forget. I can only hope that one day I got a chance to return and experience this incredible opportunity again. Wines, delish authentic Argentinian food and Polo...what more could you ask for on a day out in the outskirts of Buenos Aires?! Thank you Celia, Ruben and your team for your wonderful hospitality and for making this a day that when I look back on, I will laugh and smile as one as the best days I've ever had on a holiday.

Hormiga. Polo Day- everyone was so hospitable, and I appreciated the attentiveness and kindness everyone gave so freely. I was looking forward to spending some time with the horses, and I rode a sweetheart called Hormiga! The time I spent playing Polo was really Hormiga doing most of the work for me :0) I'm now inspired to continue playing polo here in Victoria, Canada ;0) Big smiles, and would love to come visit again!

A Pleasant Surprise!. This wasn't something we planned to do before we arrived in BA- there was an add for it on the the local tourist map so we decided to take a punt. Well, we felt like royalty! These people certainly know how to make visitors feel special. It helped to have the hosts from the UK to explain to us what was happening in English, as we had zero knowledge of the intricacies of the sport. Having the opportunity to have a ride after the game (when we had never been on a horse before) was an unexpected bonus!

Highlight of 10 day Argentina Trip. Before my trip, I was astounded by the reviews online and decided to try this out. My husband and I have had limited experience on horses, but all the people were so helpful and friendly (probably the nicest people you'll meet in Argentina). I also LOVED the horses - they were smart, fast, and responsive. I really enjoyed both seeing and trying out the game. I was extra impressed with the polo players in the game we watched once we saw for ourselves how difficult it was. It is not an easy sport (the mallet is somewhat heavy), but the basics are learnable. I would definitely recommend checking this out.

Fantastic afternoon on the field. Upon our arrival at the site, we were greeted by two friendly girls who worked at the club. Their native English (one from England, the other from Germany) and easy hospitality put us right at home. After finding us somewhere to leave our bags, they quickly had us sitting down in the sunshine enjoying cold beer and homecooked empanadas - perfect after the hustle and bustle of the Buenos Aires streets! After a quick explanation of the rules, we headed over to the pitch to watch out first polo match. After a few more glasses and some more empanadas, we enjoyed a few basic lessons in 'horseless polo' in between rounds, and then after the match (thrilling in itself) we got up on the horses and had a go at hitting the ball and riding around, all under the careful supervision of the club members. The beautiful weather helped, but all in all this was a stunning afternoon, and a great break from the city. Highly recommended!

Awesome day best thing I have done on holiday so far!. I was lucky enough to do a half day on my own. The girls Alex and Steph were really friendly and I got a great horse and personal service and training to give it a go. Empanadas were yum and after the game it was a very nice place to chill out and have a beer definitely recommend polo day!

Best thing I did in BA. Argentina Polo Day was the highlight of my trip to BA! At first I was a bit sceptical because although I have ridden horses all my life and watched polo I had never played it so wasnt sure whether I would a) be able to actually get involved and have a go - expected to watch from the sidelines b) the price would be worth it as it is not cheap. However, I loved every minute I was there. The owner and his staff were so welcoming, the place was beautiful and relaxing, the BBQ and wine was delish (and lots of it!), the horses were phenomenally trained, and within a few hours I had not only learned lots about the sport but also was playing a game and practicing my technique with a lovely gentleman could Philipe - one of the members of the club who was so helpful. I didn't want the day to end and actually the staff were happy for us to stay as long as we wanted, into the early eve actually, just lounging by pool and chilling out. WhenI broke down the cost, the standard of the offering they provide is exceptional and worth every penny. Highly recommend giving this a go!

Bueno!!. 5 star day with great people & great horses. Only pity there is not a 6* rating cause I would've have given it. Words cannot do justice how how much of a complete all round great day from pick up to drop off...thank you.

A great way to spend a day. I rang Celia at the very last moment and amazingly she had everything organised for our party of 5 with a car at our hotel door within 30 minutes.From the moment we stepped in the car the fun began with a video introducing us to the finer points of polo. On arrival we were greeted by Steph Alex and Ruben and feasted on the best empanadas and local beer. After with beer in hand we settled down to watch our first polo match with Steph and Alex explaining the finer points.After the game,many photos and more drinks we were driven back to our hotel. We all agreed it had been a superb day.

Awesome fun bring USD or get raped by Ruben's exchange rate. I would have given this a 4 or 5 rating however I had Argentine currency and it ended up costing me almost another $100 USD for my wife and I! I had an app on my phone which showed the up to date currency exchange however he had his own "real" exchange rate. Other than getting bent over on the Ruben Peso it was a blast! The drive up was beautiful, the property was amazing, it was green and had the feel of a rustic farm. Ruben was grilling when we arrived and it smelt so good! We first had some of Ruben's empenadas (best we have ever had to this day) and handled the mallets and balls. Second we watched a match which was very impressive. We had lunch and it was great. Ruben is a very nice guy and there was a gal from Germany that was very fun too. The blood sausage was under cooked and two of our group become very ill however we cannot for sure it was the sausage as we ate a lot of other food.
