After lunch we saddled up and played our own "match" it was a lot of fun however we were new to horses and polo so it was probably more fun to watch us than the match we were playing. After the game we took the horses and rode around the property which was nice. The end came and we ended up paying more than we ought to have. I know Ruben could discern our disappointment at his currency exchange so he gave us some mustard and two polo mallets ( chiliean airport police took them from us :( ) We had a great time and i would do it again however i know to bring cash or better yet, Ruben, if you are reading this, invest in a credit card machine!

Amazing Experience - A must do when in BA. We read such amazing reviews and the day we landed in BA, I contacted Ruben via email and within minutes received a reply from Celia who does a great deal of the bookings and coorespondance. She was amazing! She had us booked, confirmed with details and let us know what to expect. She was extremely professional and the experience started on such a positive note. We were picked up on schedule, the journey to El Camino Polo Club was wonderful and we were greated by Ruben, Stef, Merle and Alex and it started with delicious empanadas! We watched a game, were given instruction on the etiquitte of the game and that followed a wonderful lunch with fresh vegatables and a terrific selection of BBQ meats and ample choice of drinks. Then we had the opportunity of actually playing a game of polo. It was such an amazing day that we highly recommend it. The staff is so attentive to all your needs and it's an experience that should not be missed (for experienced and non-experienced riders). We enjoyed the horses and the dogs, especially the little puppy Nando. Thank you for a great day, it was the highlight of our entire trip.

A definite must do!. What an amazing day. We were picked up at our apartment and driven out to the beautiful El Camino Polo Club. The morning started with (apart from meeting our wonderful hosts and instructors, Ruben, Stef, Merle and Alex) delish empanadas and Vino Tinto .. we knew we were in for a GREAT day .... that it was and so much more. The polo match was interesting and entertaining to watch with the girls explaining what was happening .. then after the match, more delicious food for lunch (and a few more wines) then it was our turn. Trepidation about my riding ability is an understatement ... having not ridden a horse since my Uni days (a long LONG time ago) and I was terrible back then ... again with the wonderful instruction, assistance and encouragement of Stef, Merle and Alex I was not only on a horse I was trotting, cantering and ... yes galloping AND hitting the polo ball .. well occasionally anyway. Truly this is a must do whilst you are in BA!

Game of Kings. Had a great experience yesterday with the polo day staff. Driver was on time, polite, clean comfortable car with a drop down TV with video that explained the rules, technic/skills of polo (kind of cool since it allowed for something productive for the 45 min drive to Pillar). Was welcomed by Stef and Alex, volunteers from England who were helping out the Polo day group. Very courteous, who genuinely wanted us to have a great experience. Reuben the owner is a really nice guy who really wants to open up his farmhouse/business to guests and make them feel at home. From the moment we arrived (it was 2 of us, I was a solo guest and there was another solo guest that day) we were offered wine, empanadas and the volunteers/staff ensured that our glasses/plates were not empty. We watched a polo game, got to take a group picture with the players. After the bbq we got to play and that was definitely the highlight. I really had to focus in the beginning so I could get the most out of the experience since I was new to riding. But the volunteers were awesome teachers and extremely supportive. I was galloping, trotting along with my mallot in no time (disclaimer: learning curve for everyone is different). It was a great workout, really have respect for these horses that are very disciplined (My hosre Torito was very disciplined, I just was confusing him since I was newbie rider...all in all fun). Overall this actvity is a must experience (if I had to write a book of the top 100 experiences to do in your life, this would be on it). It was both formal and informal at times with just the right amount of structured activity to make the experience fun.

Highly recommanded. You defenetly have to put Argentina Polo Day on the top of your to-do-list. You won't regret!I just spent a wonderful day with Ruben and his team on his farm and learned so much about polo, the poloponys and even played a few chukkers by myself. It was so much fun.Everybody was so nice and the BBQ was great. They even offered a vegetarian option for me.Thanks alot!

Awesome experience, so much fun!. Great Day out, starting with a glass of wine (or two) while the rules of the game were explained and then watching a polo match with some ground practice swinging the mallet in between Chukkas followed by a brilliant asado lunch (no I cannot possibly eat any more!) After lunch the real fun began when we got on the horses and headed for the polo pitch. Would definitely recommend it to both experienced riders and beginners as they catered for both very well. The horses were well cared for, tack in good condition, beautiful setting and all up a great day out trying something new.

Perfect Argentinian experience from start to finish!. Two friends and I went along to the Argentina polo day yesterday, we've been travelling around the world for 5 months now and we all agreed this comes very close if not top of our favourite days! We could all ride before but some of the others in the group didn't have experience but with horses to suit every level everybody seemed confident by the end! The food and unlimited wine throughout the day was incredible! Ruben, Alex, Steff, Merlo (sorry, spelling?!) and all the other guys there were really fun, welcoming and knowledgable! The ponies looked great and enjoyed their job and all the dogs (especially nando!) were very cute and friendly! Will definitely be recommending this fantastic day out!

Polo for everyone!. such an amazing day to go with friends, meet new people, learn a new sport and practice your Spanish. All of the staff were so welcoming, hospitable and easy to talk to. I had such a great day, from never having played polo in my life to being able to take part in a game (albeit a much slower version) made me fall in love with the game and have a whole new appreciation for the game of polo. The volunteers there were really interesting and more like very knowledgeable friends. This has inspired me to return as one of the hosts! Cant wait to come back for all the fun, great wine and delicious food! I cant recommend Polo day any higher.

Lovely day out. A great day out of Buenos Aires and a really unique experience! After a pick up at our hotel, we drove to the polo ranch, while being entertained with a video on polo. Really useful as well, since we all didn't know anything about this sport!We were welcomed with nice drinks and great empanadas (some of the best of our whole journey) and afterwards enjoyed a polo match. While watching everything seemed easy, this was not quite the case when trying it ourselves in the afternoon. Nevertheless, without any previous horse-riding experience, it definitely was a lot of fun!Don't forget to bring suncream, swimming outfit (there's a pool too!) and something easy to wear on a horse, preferably covering all of your legs :-)

Highly Recommended - Truly an Unique Experience. My friend and I love travelling the world and trying new things and this is indeed a unique experience that introduces you to a classic sport of Argentina! Ruben and Celia have designed a fun-fill day to introduce beginners to polo - not just watching a match, but also giving us the opportunity to play the sport. Very professionally run and geared to encourage the most novice of players (and riders) with one-on-one coaching from getting comfortable with riding a horse to teaching us the skills required in playing a real match. They also keep you well fed - the welcome empanadas and bbq lunch (asado) were delicious as well as the unlimited wine and refreshments. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip!

Thumbs up. My family and I had an amazing time. We were very well taken care of from the start to the end during this attraction. Highly recommended for those who are into polo and/or horses. A true experience accompanied with great food & wine.

Best Day Out in Buenos Aries. As horse lovers, my friend and I decided to try Polo in Buenos Aries as Argentina is at the top of the world for this sport. We had the best day ever. The hosts were great fun and very generous and welcoming. The food was delicious. It was money very well spent! Being able to watch a real polo match was so fun and then trying it ourselves made our whole trip! Lots of fun and even the people who had never ridden a horse were able to join in our match as all the horses are suited to the experience of the rider and well behaved. Would have done it twice if we had the time!

A Must-Do in Buenos Aires!. My wife and I just returned from Buenos Aires last week. We had a great time and had a chance to do a lot of fun and interesting things (Cemetery Tour, Closed-Door Restaurant, Tango Class, Tango Show, Tigre-Delta Boat Ride, Day-Trip to Uruguay). That said, the Argentina Polo Day was without a doubt the highlight of the entire vacation and an experience we will cherish for a very long time. Our interactions with all involved were incredibly positive. Celia was very helpful with taking our reservation and getting us set-up in advance. The on-site volunteers (Alex, Steph and Potter (sp?)) were so much fun and both helpful and informative in educating us to the sport of Polo and horse-riding. Finally, Reuben (the owner) was the ultimate host, wearing many hats (literally!) as host, cook and Polo player! The entire experience was first-class from the pick-up at our hotel to the drop-off at the airport. The ranch itself is so large there is more than enough room to ride for both the novice rider to the most experienced. The BBQ lunch was incredibly tasty and filling. For those who don't eat beef, the staff was gracious enough to provide alternatives to the menu to accommodate our dietary restrictions. For those who don't speak Spanish, no need to worry as everyone on hand speaks English as well. If you do only one thing during your time in BA, this is an experience you must not pass up. Needless to say, we will be telling all our friends about it. The only negative was that it had to eventually end!

Hands Down, The Best Experience I've had in Buenos Aires. I travel to Buenos Aires once a year for business and this past December I was looking to try something new and outside of the city, and with the Polo Open that weekend, Polo fever was in the air. Only going off of other Trip Advisor recommendations, I signed up for Polo Day, having no idea what to expect and with zero polo or horse riding experience. Let me say this, and I will say this one time: Best. Travel. Experience. Ever. Celia and her husband Ruben were the most gracious hosts when we first arrived, everything exceeded expectations. We saw a great match, ate amazing food (best empanadias I had during my trip) and met some new friends. On this particular day a freak rainstorm came through and unfortunately the afternoon lessons were postponed. Any other tourist operation might have just said, well sorry! Nothing we can do. Not Ruben. Instead, he created a warm place for us to wait out the rain, and when it became clear the fields were too dangerous for the horses, we were all invited back at no extra charge. When I came back a few days later, I ended up getting a private lesson to make up for the rain. I was actually happy the circumstances turned out the way it did! To sum it up, I hate tourist stuff. Argentina Polo Day is as real and authentic as it gets. You can tell the passion and love Celia, Ruben and their staff have for the sport, the animals and sharing that with others. I can't wait to come back in October or November!

Great for families- a must do in BA!. I am a little tardy in writing this review... we attended the Polo day in early January 2013. From the very beginning the visit co-ordination was professionally handled and executed. We were picked up early from our hotel in BA and transported to the estancia. We were greeted by English speaking staff and fed delicious empanadas and wine (and plenty of both!) There was plenty of room for the kids (10 and 8) to run around, see the horses, and play with the dogs. We then watched a polo game ... the kids got to throw the ball in more than once, and my son got to ride on a pony with a player! Then it was time for lunch (asado), which was plentiful and delicious! They did have veg. options if needed. We all changed after lunch and got ready to ride and "play" polo. We were on the horses for almost 2 hours and had tons of instruction. My husband had never been on a horse, but he was able to gallop at the end of the day! After about 7 hours, we were ready to head home after a FANTASTIC day. The only negative was that the pool, which my kids would have used, was filthy. Excellent service, and great value! We would visit again if we ever have the chance to get back to BA!

Fantastic day!. We only had one full day in Buenos Aires and were so glad we chose to do the polo day! The food was fantastic, the service was excellent, the wine and beers kept flowing and the polo was an experience different to anything else we had done on our travels!It was a really hot day, so relaxing in the pool afterwards was a great end to the day.The horses were beautiful and exceptionally well behaved, my boyfriend and I felt very safe on them.All in all, an amazing day, would thoroughly recommend it!

A great way to spend a day in BA!. We prebooked a lot of tours In South America from Trip Advisor advice, and all turned out very well, but in terms of customer service, no one can beat Claudia at Polo Day. She provided excellent information via lots of emails, and was very flexible in organizing our pick up and return to the port in time to meet our cruise ship deadline. She even emailed us after the trip to make sure we were satisfied and to wish us a Happy New Year. The day itself was blisteringly hot but Claudia and the team looked after us so well that it barely mattered. Lots of fine food including fantastic empanadas and Argentinian steak BBQ, drinks, wine and really good instruction in the basics of polo. We got to watch a full game, try out the strokes on the ground, and then give it a go on horseback. I set my standards low not being a horserider and achieved my goal of actually hitting a ball from the saddle. It was a really fun day and gave us great insight into this particular area of Argentinian culture.

So much fun!. I did the full polo day here and it was fantastic. The way Celia and Ruben have set things up here is perfect. You are greeted with wine and delicious empanadas before watching a real polo game and getting some ground practice with the tacones. Lunch is an asado with wine, which is also delicious. Everything is done so tastefully without being over the top or pretentious. The owners and staff are all laid back and friendly, and many of them will come and chat over lunch. After lunch you get a chance to play polo. The horses were all well cared for and well behaved. We were a group of four, two very experienced with horses, two who had never ridden. You are able to ride as fast as you like, and by the end of the day one of the girls who had never ridden was cantering comfortably on her horse.I had a fantastic day here and honestly couldn't recommend it more highly. Thank you Ruben, Celia, and team!

Wonderful day!!. It is a really nice day where you will discover as well the culinary and the sport culture of Argentina. At the beginning I thought we could maybe have a short ride and shoot one or two balls. At the end we played a real match and we could discover how intense and enthralling Polo is. It is of course better to have some basics of riding but even a complete beginner (there were 3 in our group of 5) can have fun. The horses are very calm and won't freak out in a stressful situation. The day fulfilled the expectations and I think the price is adequate to what you get. Bbq, wine, Beer, water (all you can eat and drink) and wonderful horses.

Great opportunity to try this exlusive sport!. Going to Buenos Aires being a horse person, polo was a definite must do! I was looking into how to see a real polo game in an arena and stumbled over this, try polo yourself! I was hooked! It was a bit on the pricey side but I know how unique this experience is so I convinced my boyfriend to come and play polo with me, he is NOT a experienced rider. The layout of the day was perfect. Pick up from your hotel, wine and yummy empanadas for a welcome snack. Nice English speaking guides taught us the basics of the sport when the club members had a game. I must say this is high action! Players and horses chase that ball as if there is no tomorrow, really cool to see. During the pauses we practised hitting the ball from the ground.After the game we had a great asado lunch. With our bellies full, maybe too full, we got our horse for the day. We got help from the polo guys to manoeuvre our horses and hit the ball. As an experienced rider I had hoped that the horse was a bit more eager to run. She didn't want to canter unless one of the guides rushed her on. (The horses know who's the boss). But we got it going and with some help from the guide I managed to get a few swings on the ball in gallop and it was so much fun and soo exhausting! I just wished I had better endurance so I could have lasted longer! My boyfriend also had a great time. Having a club and a ball to focus on made him forget that he can't ride so he was chasing the ball like a pro ;). When we couldn't swing our clubs any more and hardly stay on the horse it was time to regretfully dismount. Thank the horses and hand them over to the horse keepers. As the finale we had drinks and chit chat in the shade until we wanted to leave the ranch. No rush from a stressed out driver which was very appreciated.So why am I only giving this an average rating? It's because I want Argentina Polo Day to improve on three things:1: Clean the pool! Would have rated this very good if it was nice and clean.2: Some of the horses was unnecessary skinny. I'm aware that these hoses work hard and are not spoiled pet horses. I also know that there are differences in horse keeping in different countries. But it would have given a way better impression if all the horses looked more well fed, at least to us horse lovers. So less ribs would have got an excellent. 3: Being a safety concerned Swede I think that helmets should have been offered. Even if the horses are nice they are still living creatures that can do unpredictable things and a polo ball is really hard. For our comfort there could also have been gloves to lend.For the price we are paying I expected more in these departments, but I would still definitely recommend this to people looking for a really unique experience in Buenos Aires! ... Just remember to stretch afterwards... ;)

Great Experience for the whole family!. We did this with our group of 12 people including kids. It was so unique and fun for the whole family. We had kids ranging from 8 to 15. The food and wine is great and plentiful. The polo is fun to watch and learn a lot. They have great English speaking guides as well. We tried learing polo which was fun but it is really difficult. Some of the kids got scared and decided just to run around and help chase balls which was fine because they weren't used to horses. It was a truly unique day and I recommend it. It is pricey but I think you will remember this experience forever. Our visitors voted this the best day of their trip!

Awesome Experience!. Highly recommend going here while visiting Buenos Aires! All of the people who work at the club are extremely friendly and very helpful. You don't have to be experienced in riding horses either, they teach you and make you feel comfortable.

Great Experience in a great place with great people. Was on a pre-New Years trip with 5 other friends and we planned this for our last day in Buenos Aires.....they went above and beyond my expectations and took us to the airport at the end of the day.....had a blast....even my friend who was very nervous about riding a horse was galloping up and down the field by the end of the day. Thanks Argentina Polo Day!!

Amazing Day, Amazing Staff, Learned quite a bit!. Our hotel was about 45 min away and we had a flight to catch later that night and the staff not only picked us up, but took us straight to the airport after our day.I had never ridden a horse and was timid, but the staff was very patient and got me galloping in no time. The polo game we watched between the professionals was fun and I gained much appreciation for the spot.And the food! The food was great and it was 110% authentic south american BBQ. They served more food than we could handle! They were very very fun, great personalities and I recommend this to people of any age group.

Perfect Polo Day. I love BA an have been there several times. This time we took our son, a travel writer, Triphackr.com. and his wife. Our son found the Argentina Polo Day and said we have to do this - he was right. What a great day with such wonderful Argentines! I love horses, but even if you haven't ever been on a horse this will be a great day. The greeting upon arrival with wine and empanadas, learning about polo, watching a live match, learning how to play was incredible. I am ready to find a older persons polo team back home in New England. This is an absolutely "must do" for all people visiting Argentina. Ruben and his staff are so warm so helpful.

Best day of our trip!. The day begins with welcome empanadas and wine which keeps coming throughout the afternoon. After meeting the staff and volunteers, you head over to the field to watch a live match and learn some of the basic polo techniques on foot. Then you enjoy a traditional BBQ lunch with some of the players and staff served family style. Once you've gotten your fill of steak and wine and more steak and more wine, it's time to mount up and play some polo. With the help of the stable hands and volunteers, anyone can feel like a polo star! This tour is the best way to spend a day away from the big city! You get so much for your money!

Once in a Lifetime. I was in Buenos Aires studying abroad this past May-July. In all my six weeks there, this was among the best things I ever did in the area. The staff was so friendly, personable, understanding, and fun-loving. They helped me expand my comfort zone and do things on and off the polo field I never would have imagined I'd do. Overall, this experience is FANTASTIC and totally worth the money. Do the full day! You will enjoy the best of what Buenos Aires has to offer (food, drink, and great company).

Must-do experience. An incredible day. Got greeted with glasses of red wine as we got off the bus. Had a brief lesson of how to play the game and then chilled and watched the pro's play. The lunch they served us was beautiful. Polo game that we played was good fun and was my first time on a horse. Would have liked to of fed the horse there. Our bus was more than 2 hours late to pick us up which was a blessing in disguise - the lovely staff kept serving us wine and we sat in the beautiful farm enjoying the sunset. 10/10

Polo Experience for Everyone. What an amazing experience. We were picked up by Lucas - the very gracious driver, and two volunteers, James and Celena, who were the instructors/interpreters for the day. Both from Washington State, USA and both with extensive horse experience.Upon arrival we were met by the exuberant owner, Ruben, and were handed a glass of wine and home made empanades. The best we have had in Buenos Aires - Ruben's secret recipe!!After a tutorial about the horses, gear, and the game, we watched a game consisting of four chukkas. If you want to know what a chukka is you need to book your polo day.The game was followed by a tasty asado (BBQ) and drinks. Then it was time to try your hand and riding skills at playing polo. Not as easy as it looks but a lot of fun. You really appreciate the professionals. I would definitley recommend Argentina Polo Day. If you do not have any "horse" experience? No worries, you will be taken care off.

I would have never thought polo was so much fun!. Celia and Rubens have put together an excellent idea which should be tried if you are up for something 'different'! I would not recommend it for first time horse riders, but you don't need too much experience either. There is very good BBQ before going to the game.

A perfect day in a beautiful place. Everything was great! The pick up at the hotel was on time, the location is beautiful...the driveway was breathtaking..lined with trees and green!! The sky is so blue and the whole place just screamed relaxation! I loved how the owner Ruben gave us a explanation of the game before we watched the professionals. It was a bit windy on the day that we went but the polo game was great! Loved sitting on the side lines...;)The owner is from Banfield were my father is from so I felt an instant connection to the place... The horses were so beautiful and the table set up for the argentine asado was great! The food was very appetizing and from a girl who has a father that is a argentine chef who regularly cooks argentine asado, that is a very big compliment! The best part of the day is getting on the horses and playing the game of polo! Such a difficult sport but so much fun!! We loved relaxing by the pool with a beer and cuddling up with a little puppy they had..all the dogs are very friendly and loving but the tiny puppy was adorable!! The whole experience was wonderful and we will def do again and tell people about it! I would recommend doing the full day tour!Thank you Ruben and Celia for making this tour possible!Ruben....Vamos Banfield!!! Yay!!! Gracias,Michelle Fonseca

I already want to go back!. Three of us did the Argentina Polo Day yesterday and the first thing I thought about when I woke up this morning was that I wanted to go back and spend another day there!!! There is a reason why this get's almost all 5 star ratings -- because it deserves 5 star ratings. The day was flawless, from our pick up in the morning (not too early, which was great because Buenos Aires is a late night town) through the return drive back to the apartment we are renting. (We were back in time to get cleaned up for dinner -- not that we were very hungry after all the wonderful food we got. The empanadas are spectacular and the chorizo during lunch the best during my trip.) The hosts keep the groups small, but we were extra lucky in that we were the only 3 there this time. It made us feel very special to have an entire polo game played just for us as we sat in the shade sipping wine and snacking on more empanadas. Celia and her staff answered all our questions and we had a delightful time getting to know them. If I am fortunate enough to return to BA, I will absolutely do this again. It was tremendous fun, with delightful people and a great value for the money.

Unexpected Birthday Fun!!!. I was part of the group day reviewed by Gill B below. Her review describes the experience exactly but for me the Argentina Polo Day was even more special. When I booked I let Celia know I would be alone on my birthday far away from husband and friends, and she immediately got into the spirit. So my welcome by her husband and owner of the Polo Club, Ruben and his team of hosts was as ebullient and warm as if we had known each other for years.Moreover, when we were treated to welcome drinks and later a BBQ lunch with wonderful Argentinian wines, the winemaker from Mendoza whose wines are featured during the day, was sitting next to me, explaining the finer details of his wines. My birthday feeling got even better!In the morning we had viewed a 4 chukka polo game, with helpful explanatory commentary from the hosts and after this, we were given short sticks and balls and fell about laughing (literally), trying to hit the ball and not the divots. But after lunch it was our time to get onboard our ponies with our individual instructors.This is a very strong point of Argentina Polo Day: I am a somewhat nervous older rider trying to learn to play polo. My instructor remained flexible and patient when at first I did not easily get into the steady canter and in the end I cantered around with confidence. I even managed to hit the ball with a stick while mounted, a real breakthrough for me! A true birthday present.As a director of a horse riding holiday business in Andalucia (Aguamarga Riding Adventures and The Writing Horse) I also can the Polo Club is run well, with proper gear and attention to safety and the well-being of the horses and clients.And the willingness of the owner and hosts to stay behind, hang out with the guests (by now:friends) and talk over the events of the day is amazingly dedicated.I have booked my return already and this time my husband is coming with me. So Celia and Ruben, get those empanadas grilling, that Mendoza wine flowing and my lovely pony saddled up!! See you in January!

the coolest tour ever!. This was really the coolest tour I ever did. By subscribing for the tour I was first exceptionally fast and nicely treated by Celia, Rubens wife/girlfriend (?). She gave all the information I needed and assured me that it was fine to do this alone without any horsebackriding experience (which was indeed the case). Furthermore the day was perfectly organized with excellent food, extremely friendly staff and an opportunity to see a polo match and to practice the polo game yourself. For all activities enough time was scheduled. For me personally this was the first time on a horse, which already made it an amazing experience, but the combination with the polo game really made it supercool! I would highly recommend this (and furthermore I would advise to do the whole day tour, since half a day is, in my opinion too short and too much traveling)

Just horsing around!. We had a great time at the AR polo day. The driver picked us up promptly at 11am in a nice comfortable minibus and off we went on a little over 1 hr drive to the polo fields near Pilar. The grounds were nice and the staff we were treated by exceptionally friendly staff. Reuben started us off with some tasty empanadas and a glass of vino! Great way to start the day if you ask me.Then we got a crash course in polo and its basic rules (I must admit that I knew almost nothing about polo going into this). Afterward ou crash course we got to watch the pros go at it for about an hour. They made it look so easy! (Our host provided sun screen and bug repellent which was helpful). Next we had a delicious as ado lunch and got to know the other folks joining us for the day. Great food and conversation. After lunch it was our turn to mount up and play a match! I have to say, polo is way way way harder than it looks. There's a great deal of skill involved. Getting the horse to go where you want, trying to hit a small not so round ball while moving on a 500 lb animal with a 5 ft long stick. Yea, way harder than I imagined. But, even though I pretty much stink at polo, we had an absolute blast doing it! After our mini match, we took a short ride and rounded up some other horses from a field, which was fun too! Capped it all off with a quick dip in the pool to cool off (it was a pretty hot day).The ride back to BA was a bit longer on the way back due to traffic, stopping for fuel, and we were the last passengers to be dropped off. Nevertheless, we got to nap a bit on the ride back which was good.Definitely recommend this if you are looking for something different to do outside of BA.

fantastic day out. I had a short trip to Buenas Aires, being a horse lover decided to get out of the city and spend the day in the country. I couldn't have asked for a better place to spend it. We watched a polo match, then learned the tricks of the trade. Followed by a lovely BBQ lunch with some lovely Argentinian wine. The horses were fantastic to ride very calm but responsive. We had two beginner level riders in the group and they enjoyed the riding as much as the more experienced riders. We were taught how to hold the polo sticks and have a go on the horse with the ball control and excellent tuition. The friendliness and warmth of the leaders and polo players made it a very special day. Can't wait to visit again !

Amazing day trip from Buenos Aires. If you have a spare day in Buenos Aires and want to do something really different, authentic, and fun, then look no further.So, if you're anything like me, this is your checklist. 1) You're in Argentina and you want to experience polo: tick. The first thing you get is a pretty competitive looking game played by a mixture of keen, expert amateurs and a few ex-pros. 2) You want to understand polo: tick. You have hosts talking you through the game and the rules so you know what's going on. 3) You want to understand a bit about the culture and the players: tick. The players were incredibly generous with their time after the game and talked to us about their background, the polo circuit, and their experiences playing in different countries. 4) You want to be well fed and watered while all this is going on, after all you're in Argentina, right? Tick. Greeted with some amazing empanadas straight off the grill, followed by quality red wine, soft drinks, and the amazing parilla - that was actually some of the tastiest meat I had on my trip. Finally, 5) you want to play polo. No, really, you do. Big tick. Even if you haven't been on a horse for twenty years, even if you've never been on a horse before, you can come here and try a game. This was one of the best things I've done. Reading the reviews, I thought that maybe 'playing polo' would involve trying to hit the ball while sat on a horse. Wrong - it's much more competitive. The ponies are fantastic and suitable for all levels. Tori and two of the grooms played with us and made an effort to make sure we were all involved in the game - apart from Juan, who was just massively competitive, which made it all the sweeter when our 'girls' team scored! It's a little way out of the city - a couple of hours drive from the centre of Buenos Aires. We got picked up from our hotel, the driver was there on time, and the route is on pretty smooth main roads.Celia took care of booking and was a pleasure to deal with - very prompt, attentive, she made it easy to book even while we were travelling. Ruben is your host for the day and his enthusiasm and love for the sport inspires and sets the tone for the whole experience. Tori and Louise were our guides and they were very friendly and knowledgeable. Thank you to everyone!

On the polo field in Argentina...... It was surreal. This excursion was the perfect compliment to our week long stay in the city of Buenos Aires. For this animal lover this outing was much appreciated and truly surpassed any expectation I ever had when I decided to visit BA. When we got out of the van the first kisses we got were from 2 adorable and sweet ranch dogs. Not only was the host and hostesses warm, funny, and always ready to fill your glass and plates with yumminess, but we played polo! On real Argentine Polo ponies! I wish we had video taped our session. (Remember to do that!) The soundtrack of our game was filled with laughter and broken spanish. The horses were amazing to ride. We were amazed at how they turned "on a dime" and would willingly gallop towards the trees if asked. The horses and guests are treated with respect and affection. What's not to love?Ruben and Celia, thank you! I didn't want to leave. ;)

One amazing POLO Day!. I always wanted to try Polo and there is no better place then trying it in the country where it is played most with people who have the passion for the horses and riding. We were recommended to the Polo Day by a friend and after a few emails with Celia we could not wait to go. The horses are fantastic and are truly lovely with all level of riders. My partner has only be sitting on a horse once before and he loved it and enjoyed as much as I did. It is honestly suitable to every level of riding. In between watching the guys playing a proper polo match, we had our first go with the ball and stick before lunch. The amazing Asado was unforgettable and the wine just went with it. And then it was our turn to have a go on horseback. After an initial introduction we played our first game and it was thrilling. We also had the choice for a ride through the enclosed fields, which were still party flooded due to heavier rains earlier. The gallops were amazing!!!!We enjoyed every second and if we would have had an extra day in Buenos Aires we would have gone again. I truly can recommend the Polo Day! The horses, the people, the food and the surroundings are just perfect.

Very neat experience. This was a very fun experience, once you get there. Like the other reviewers said, the moment you get there, you are very warmly welcomed, the food and wine are flowing, you watch a professional polo match, and then you get to go yourself. It is all very low-key and fun. We really had a great time. The only thing you should expect is a long ride there and back. It took us close to 2 hours in a pretty cramped van driving from central Buenos Aires to the hacienda. It also took 1.5 hours to drive from there to the airport (and we had no traffic). Just brace yourself for that; it's completely worth while, though.

A real polo experience. My initial impressions of the day were very positive based upon Celia's prompt replies to my inquiries. She answered all my questions very promptly and this enabled me to entice a couple of friends to join me. It was wonderful to have the details of the day in someone else's hand and they delivered all they promised. We were greeted promptly at the polo club with delicious empanadas and yummy wine and Ruben & Tory proceeded to explain the details of the game. We watched a "condensed" version of a polo match (due to muddy conditions of the larger fields) however, the players played as hard a game as I have seen. The wine flowed freely as we practiced our polo swings with short mallets on the ground which was a snapshot of the real game. The BBQ lunch was delicious and then it was our turn to play! From the beginning it was an adjustment to swing a mallet alongside the patient horse I rode, but after a little time, everyone's confidence built and we had a blast. I highly recommend this as a fabulous day trip from BA into the country. It is well organized, very comprehensive, and most importantly, exactly what you hope the day will be!! Enjoy!

Great unexpected fun. We did not know what to expect when we first arrived at the polo field in the middle of no where; based on the muddy conditions and remote feeling of the place we did not expect much. The day ended up being the most fun filled day I experienced in many many years. Being polo fans from the U.S. we were excited to see polo played by an entire team of expert players from the worlds capital of polo, Argentina. Unfortunately because of extensive rains the polo match was played on a much smaller than regulation polo field which was still filled with many large muddy sections. Still is was great to see the players ability to quickly maneuver their polo ponies and the polo ball like they were puppets on strings. After the match we had an enjoyable BBQ lunch, not great food but great people. After lunch we all mounted the polo ponies and attempted to play a game of polo. We all looked like we were moving in slow motion compared to the expert players. After a few minutes we actually were able to attempt playing a very simple game of polo, it felt like riding the bumpers cars in an amusement park. It was a complete blast, I would recommend it to anybody.

Authentical experience!. I've been there in September and it was great. It's an experience you shouldn't miss!The most impressive thing was for me that it was so authentical. The owner is playing Polo himself and he knows a lot of it! He always has some fun facts and loves to make jokes. Because of that the atmosphere there is really personal. The polo-match was great and the barbeque is spectacular. Real argentinian barbeque! But for me the most impressive thing was that you are actually able to get on the horse and practice Polo yourself. After that you are even more impressed by the Polo match =)Thanks so much to Argentina Polo Day for a great time!

Amazing experience!. From the beginning, Celia was very quick to respond to my inquiry emails and answered all of my questions within hours. She was very helpful and ensured I would have a fantastic day. Upon arriving at the estancia, we were greeted by both Rubin and Tori and had empanadas and wine in our hands immediately (the empanadas were amazing!). Tori helped explain the game and then we proceeded to watch a real match (and drink more wine of course!). After the match, we broke for lunch...which was again, amazing! Then, it was time for us to get on our horse and play the game ourselves! Tori and Ruben were fantastic and extremely helpful in answering our questions throughout the day. This was honestly one of the best "excursion" type things I've ever done while traveling. It is very well organized and everyone you meet is extremely polite and super helpful AND the food was absolutely terrific! Definitely a must if you are planning to visit Buenos Aires.

Despite the weather, great experience!. Went on a half-day polo with 2 friends. It rained a lot the night before, so getting there was not as fast as planned. From a certain point the horses were the only means of transport able to get to the rancho. But - wine and hot right from the grill amazing empanadas (3 at least must eat while the rules of the game are being explained!) - fixed it all! Very friendly and fun guys, let you throw the ball to start the game, explain what's happening during the game, let you go on the horse and try to hit the ball yourself (wine and empanadas throughout the game as well!). All in a nice open field, outside of BA (transfers can be arranged) at a small local polo rancho! Full day polo includes dinner as well as some more polo playing - if we had more time in BA, would definitely have done a full day.

Great fun, nice people, food and wine but muddy. In the country side, 45 mins away from the city of Buenos Aires, a friendly guide Celia explains the history and rules of the polo game. Food and drinks are served and overall the ambiance is relaxing. Our only negative experience was a very muddy road (it rained for 3 days) we had to walk ~200m to get from the bus parking place to the actual polo pitch and back, not sure I'll be able to cleanup the shoes. Other than the mud, it would have been an outstanding team building event.

Fantasic Day Trip from Buenos Aires. If you are visiting Buenos Aires and want to spend a day outside the city doing something authentically Argentine this is a great trip. I really liked the great food plus being outside and doing something active. This is a real polo club used by professionals and the facilities and horses are top notch. I have experience riding and wanted to try something new. The horses are very easy to ride and well trained – they know how to play the game even if you don’t !... so if you have not ridden before it is not a problem as the lessons and play are appropriate to each person’s skill level. If you want you can “go for it” or just take it easy learning the basics. They also have a trail where you can just ride around on the horses too. The food is excellent: Argentine barbeque “parrilla” and empanadas cooked over an open fire in the outdoor patio and plenty of local wines. When you consider food, drinks, transportation, watching a polo match, lessons and use of the horses are all included is a great value and experience.
Great group of hostess!. I like everything starting with the people that receive us to the food we share with other visitors. Great experience!
Polo. Had a fantastic afternoon at the polo, highly recommend. I had never been to a polo match before but thoroughly enjoyed the experience
It was a great time. From learning about polo to practicing it - the day was well organized and VERY well catered - was great to get out of BA, and fun to learn.

Polo Day Rain or Shine. I was traveling solo while in BA and they accomodated me the best they could. I went to BA in kind of an off/transition season so putting me with a full day group was a challenge because there were spotty reservations. My stay was nearing an end so they picked me up privately early in the morning and let me join in at the ranch riding and being around the polo players and horses. A group who had booked a half day arrived later and we all enjoyed eating empenadas and drinkning wine while watching the match. It was really windy and then it rained, but we all bundled up and still enjoyed the day. Thank you for putting together something just for me while I was in BA.

Loved it! Great Family Day out!. We were looking for something distinctly Argentinian to do, that would also work for our young kids (ages 5 and 6) and we found it for sure in our Argentina Polo Day. Everything from the welcome reception of wine and empanadas to the the adorable dogs the boys loved playing with, to the game itself and the horse ridding exeprience- superb! Highly Highly Recommended!

So much fun. This ranch is so beautiful and the day was great. We got a quick lesson on the rules of polo from an english speaking polo player. We then watched a 4 quarter match while drinking wine and soda on the sidelines. In between we had a opportunity to swing the mallets around. Following was a FULL Argentinian BBQ. Lots of meat and delicious. Afterwards we rode the horses and were given a mallet to learn how to play polo. Overall a great experience I will never be able to do again.

The perfect day trip from Buenos Aires!. I can't say enough good things about Polo Day! Most polo clubs in Argentina are pretty exclusive and virtually closed to non-members, so the mere chance to get to visit one is a rare opportunity. The fact that you not only get to visit this polo club and watch a match up-close, but also get to get on a horse yourself and try playing is just wonderful! The English-speaking hosts also do a great job of answering questions and explaining polo, so if you're new to the sport (as I was, on my first visit here), then it's a great introduction.Drivers from the club pick you up right at your hotel in Buenos Aires, and then it's a 45-minute drive out of the city to the pretty estancia. If you're visiting BsAs for a few days, this is a great chance to escape the chaos of the capital, get some fresh air, and see another side of Argentina.They welcome you at the farm with fresh-made empanadas and wine and beer, then provide a nice introduction to polo. After that, you get to watch a polo match played by the club members. It's really exciting to get to sit right next to the field, with the horses running so close! After that, there's a wonderful asado—or traditional Argentine barbecue—with all kinds of steak, sausages, and other meat. They also make great grilled vegetables and salads. It's terrific! The lunch alone is nearly worth the admission price. Even at the best restaurants in Buenos Aires, you don't get to actually see a traditional parilla (or grill) like this one, which resembles an outdoor fireplace. It's cool to see. After that, you get a chance to get on horseback and try playing polo yourself. Typically, after about a half hour of getting used to your horse, the staffers will come and play with you. The whole day culminates in a scrimmage between staffers and guests. It's really thrilling! I'm from the U.S. but have been living in Buenos Aires for about a year. I've had a lot of friends and family members come to visit me during this time, and I've taken almost all of them to Polo Day. Again and again, they've told me it's been a major highlight of their trip, and I jump at the chance, each time, to get to go experience this wonderful outing again! Highly, highly recommended!

What a great experience!. My friends and I didn't know what we were getting ourselves into when we signed up to go play polo.... I hadn't ridden a horse is over 10 years!!! but when you get the opportunity to play polo in Argentina you do it! haha When we got there were greeted by Mile who was sooo nice! We had a little wine and some REALLY YUMMY empanadas before heading over to watch a polo match. We even got to ring the time bell and throw in the balls after each set. After an AMAZING Asado we headed over to the horses and started our game. A bit nervous at first, but everyone put us at ease and we had such a fun time! The grounds are so serene… we didn’t want to leave!It is definitely a must go while in Buenos Aires! I will definitely be going back when I’m in Argentina again!

Great!. Fun day! Mile was awesome and the food too...everyone was very nice. It was rainy, so if that happens-bring your galoshes!! My kids played happily with the dogs and in the cabin-while we played. The food, the wine, the people, it was a fun day.

So much fun!. It was a rainy day and the traffic was stuck in downtown BSAS... Therefor the pickup at the hotel was late. But you know this South America and we got already used to that. During the fast ride out of the city, I thought to myself, how I actually don't like to ride a horse, why polo... The last ride in Salta was no succes, as the horse didn't listen to me at all. Hilarious scenes off me being parked under/in a tree with really sharp thorns, and me desparetly trying to move the horse, whicht off course didn't happen... After 45 min we arrived at the beautifull estate, and were greeted by the wonderfull crew, off course with wine! And the best empanades we had in argentina...maybe, just maybe, the horseriding will be ok today. We watched a game and got an explanation. It turned out that polo is quite rough and very fast! Off course there were only people in our group who could barely ride a horse, so we had no hope off actually hitting the ball or playing a game. After a great lunch we got on the horses. The horses were great as the reacted actually! No dumb following the leader, but actual riding! After 20 minutes off practising we all got the hang off it and decided to play a game. Boys against girls, it was so much fun! Everybody could ride trout or even galop! This was awesome, nobody noticed that it rained harder and harder... Everbody just loved: great crew, great fun and a great day!

A great day out. Great fun and a fascinating chance to both watch and try polo. We were well-looked after from hotel pick-up to drop-off, with an English-speaking guide/instructor, plenty of Argentinian wine and a great asado. While no prior experience is needed, as regular riders we found our ponies well-looked after, well-mannered and fun. Would recommend to everyone.

Must Do!. This was the best experience. We were just looking to fill one more day and get out of the city before heading home. It was FABULOUS! The feast is amazing. You get to watch a real live Polo game and then play your own game. I would totally do this over and over again! Worth it.

You have to experience polo!. We had a half day at this polo ranch on the outskirts of the city. As soon as we arrived we were given freshly cooked empanadas from the asado and wine/beer/coke. Our hostess Mile could not have been more welcoming. She took the time to explain the rules of the game to us and encouraged us to feel at home on the ranch. We watched a practice game and although we didn't get a chance to play an actual game(because we didn't have time) we all had the chance to ride if we wanted to and had fun trying to hit with the polo mallets.I thought this might be a bit of a gimmicky thing to do but we all absolutely loved it and it was also a chance to see the outskirts of the city. So glad that we experienced this and thank you Ruben & Mile for making us feel so welcome.

A must-do in Argentina!. I recently traveled to Argentina and was bummed out that I had missed both soccer season and polo season....My mother was flying down to spend a few weeks with me and visit wineries in Salta and Mendoza (must-do's also) but we were going to be in BA for a week before that without anything planned. We are both horse lovers and from Montana so I really wanted to either watch polo or just see the stables. After frantically e-mailing Ruben about my quest, I received a response saying that his company offers the opportunity to both PLAY and WATCH polo everyday of the year! I had my doubts and thought it might be a tourist trap.....But when we payed less than $200 for transportation from BA to Pilar (about 45 minutes), a beautiful lunch of empanadas, asado, endless malbec, and vegetables, plus 2 hours of riding and actually playing polo, and watching a real game, it was worth every penny. My mom loved it and we had a blast. Thank you Ruben, Mile, and everyone else involved in creating such a wonderful Argentine experience!

Great day out at the polo!. This was such a great day out, we were made to feel at home and greeted with wine and empanadas from the asado - what a treat!Then we were able to watch a polo game, and even had a go with the mallets (we did a half day, so we didn´t get to play, unfortunately).The only thing was that the driver who came to collect us from our apartment in Buenos Aires didn´t know where he was going...so we arrived late! Make sure you have the address with you before you leave.I would highly recommend Argentina Polo Day.

Simply Amazing. We booked this on the back of other reviews and to be honest it was booked as a treat for my wife.We have been travelling for 6 months and this has to be one of the best things we have done. It takes a while to get there if you are the first collection like we were, but when you are greeted with hot empanadas and lovely red wine by the very happy host Mile, you soon forget the drive.It was so much fun and was great to learn more about Polo, which is a great game and certainly lots of fun when playing.To sum up, everything about this day was great - watching polo, playing polo, eating amazing food, drinking lovely wine and being hosted by such lovely and fun people.You can see more on our blog - http://aandbworldtour.blogspot.com.ar/2012/06/day-of-polo.html?spref=fb

Fondest and Unforgettable Experience Ever. We gave our "highest" recommendation for Argentina Polo Day with Ruben and his team for everyone of all ages and experiences. We are a family of 5, parents and 3 young girls (7, 5, and 2) from USA with no horse or polo experience. We had searched and compared all top 3 horse activities ranked from Trip Advisor and decided to go with Ruben. He and his team (Mile, Celia, Omar, etc) were the most passionate people!! They treated us like their own family and there was definitely "no commercial business involved". They just want to make sure we had the best experience of a life time and WE DID. It was a "full day" activity with Authentic Argentinean BBQ lunch and it was worth every single penny (7 and 5 kids were half price)! We were picked up right in front of our apartment, arrived at the Polo club which was located in the beautiful countryside, were greeted with Ruben with the Best Homemade Empanadas we have ever eaten in our lives!! We just kept eating and eating. Ruben could not speak English so Mile, his assistant, was our personal tour guide. She was sooooo gooood with us and the kids (we wanted to take her back to US with us!). There were also 3 small dogs that our kids could not take their hand off them. We were then taken to the field to see professional polo play. We helped Ruben move the bird eggs out of the field. The kids got to throw the balls to start the polo game. Then, we had wonderful lunch and dessert, practiced polo, and the best part was to ride the horses. First, we thought there would be small horses for our girls but no, they all were big horses. We were scared at first but Ruben and Mile reassured us that the horses were tame and the safety was their most priority. Our 7 and 5 year olds rode the horses with Mile and another gentleman. My 2 year old did not want to ride with anyone but me, mom. Oh no, I was so scared but decided to do it as this would be once in a life time experience. They took us for about an hour ride. We went everywhere including the shallow swamp on the field. Mile and Ruben always kept an eye on us to make sure our safety was at the highest. It was the best! My 2 years old slept on the horse. So, we dropped her off. My girls decided to go on their own with no adult with them on 2 separate horses for another hour. My husband had a blast as he got to play polo on the horse. Once again, no one in our family has ridden horse or play polo before whatsoever. The girls did not want to get off the horses. And, Mile made sure that they could ride as long as they want. They would never ever rush us to end the day. Around 6pm, we all decided that we had enough. The hardest part was to say goodbye as we felt so attach to everyone. We were dropped off by Omar around 7pm right in front of our apartment. The girls said they wanted to come back to visit Ruben, Mile, and Omar again. Sure, if we come back to Buenos Aires, first thing we will definitely do is to visit our friends at Argentina Polo Day!!

What a great day !!. This is a must when in Buenos Aires, a fantastic day. Everyone was very friendly, made us feel really at home & patient with teaching us the fine art of how to play polo. I have a new found admiration for the sport as it not easy to do at 70km/h.The BBQ was also really lovely an got a chance to taste Mate, the traditional Argentinian teaThanks for a great day and will thoroughly recommend to everyone

Unique experience!. We decided to offer an unique experience in Argentina, for a group of colleagues from work. When we arrived there, we had some really taste empanadas. The best ones I ever tasted. Then we watched a really interesting polo game and learned a about its techniques and rules. After the game, it was time for an authentic barbecue, with a beautiful country scenario behind us. The braves from the team, rided a horse and had a lot of fun trying to play polo. The place is very beautiful and the people very hospitable. If you want to try something different and learn a bit more about POLO, it is an experience that you must try!
Once in lifetime experience. If you have not ever jumped on a horse...it does not matter. Great hospitality and just great fun. Must do in BA. Must, must, must.

Fantastic experience!!. Thanks so much for a fantastic day! Everyone was so welcoming and friendly, I thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience and would recommend to all! No need for extensive horsemanship, all very patient with teaching and wanting us to enjoy ourselves, which we did!!

Don't need to be a pro horse rider to have fun here!!. No words can describe how wonderful this experience was. It is a must in Buenos Aires. The people who run the ranch are really really friendly & funny & make your day delightful. I watched a polo game & got to ring the bell & throw the ball in so it was interactive & I got a photo with the teams. It was fun watching the professionally & enjoyed it with some cheese, wine & mate :) when I had my chance I quickly gained such respect for them requires strength & coordination, but it was incredibly fun to try & see what it's like. The lunch is also amazing!!! Lovely Mile who looked after us ladies for the day was so sweet & I hope to do it again one day.

Great day. Highly recommended.. A fun filled day recommended to all. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The food and wine were delicious, and the polo game was fantastic. The game is harder than it looks but the staff were there to assist you in order for you to get the most out of your experience.

Argentina Polo Match. I have definitely found my new found sport. I now see why the elite of Europeans indulge in this sport so much. It is a very thrilling and interesting sport and one that I will indulge in.

Such a unique experience!. Looking forward to getting out of the city for the day, we did Argentina Polo Day a few weeks ago as part of an extended stay in Buenos Aires / Argentina. The pick-up in the city was in a comfortable van and on time (and not until about 10:30am, to let us sleep in after a Friday night out!). It was refreshing to get out of the van at polo club in the "campo" - about an hour outside the city, and everyone there was super friendly and helpful, and a ton of fun. The two hosts did a great job integrating our group, which was 6 backpackers and a family of 4, and it was great to meet and the share the experience with other travelers. It felt very "authentic" to drink mate while watching a game of polo at the polo club, then relax for an asado lunch. The highlight, though, was definitely the chance to play a "real" game of a polo with the rest of the group, the two hosts, and one of the guys from the club – although I personally couldn't go too fast on my horse (I'd only ridden about 5 times ever before), the game was much "realer" than I expected! Highly recommend the experience overall – one-of-a-kind if you're spending any time in Buenos Aires and / or Argentina!

GREATEST day!!!. We have been traveling through Brazil and Argentina for the past three weeks and I can confidently say that our day playing Polo was a definite highlight! We were a bit apprehensive to go as the weather looked quite grey but it turned out perfectly. We were picked up from our hotel and met the other polo-ers who were all amazing. Once we arrived we were greeting by the AMAZING staff. We got a brief on the game and all of the rules while sipping on Malbec and eating baguette, cheese and meats. We were then escorted to the field to watch professionals play. Between each chucker, we practiced hitting the ball with mini mallets. After the game we were treated to a real authentic Argentinan barbecue - WHAT A TREAT! I have never seen so much meat in my life! After lunch we warmed up over some hot coffee and made our way back to the field. We had a very brief lesson on how to ride the horses and hold our mallets properly and then we were off! I don't remember laughing and smiling as much as I did on that field! A great day for anyone who likes a little adventure!

The polo experience. I went to Argentina polo day a few weeks ago. It was quite the experience. They picked us up from out hotel in the morning around 10:30 and we drove for about 45 minutes. The place is located outside Buenos Aires, so it's nice see green fields and empty spaces for a change. It's a beautiful place with polo fields, a guest house, a pool, a barbecue, all very well kept. We started with some amazing homemade empanadas and some delicious wine while watching a polo match. Afterwards, we had some incredible Argentinian ¨asado¨. After lunch it was our time to play polo. You don´t need previous experience on riding horses. They will make sure you experience some polo playing. Last, we had some snacks and cold beers before departuring back to Buenos Aires. It´s a very nice experience, specially if you´re craving for something different and unusual.

Fantastic Polo Experience. An amazing, relaxing, invigorating day out of the city! We were greeted with THE BEST empanadas of our entire trip, hot off the grill. After watching a full polo game while learning the key points, we filled our bellies with grilled meats and wine. Then we worked it all off while playing our own game of polo; it's a lot harder than it looks!The staff is excellent and accommodating. An experience not to be missed.Important information for anyone who doesn't handle car rides well - I would caution that the drive is far and if you are one of the first people to be picked up/dropped off at your hotel, you might be in the car for a few hours before arriving at the destination.

fun, alternative way to spend a day near Buenos Aires. This is a refreshing new activity that you can´t miss if you are in Buenos Aires. On one hand you spend time in the beautiful country side in the outskirts of the city, which you rarely get to see if you just stay in the traditional turistic areas. it is also a grat way to meet other visitors to the city in a fun setting, while learning about Polo and actually living the experience of playing Polo. The staff was very professional and friendly. Don´t miss it in your next trip with friends or while on business in Buenos Aires

An amazing experience, host and day!!. This is definetly a must do when you are in Buenos Aires!! The organisation is excellent (pick up at your hotel/place) welcom drink, ect. All the staff is great (from the driver, to Ruben the owner and the pads). The horses are great and they know well enough the horses so that you have fun what ever your level in horse ridding is! You first watch a game and then it is your turn for at least one hour! And the bbq La parilla is just amazing! SO you must surely go and enjoy a day like this!

Do not miss this! Even if you only have >5 days!. This was the most amazing experience I had in BA. I only had 4 days in BA, so I was hesitant about spending an entire day outside of the city, but I am so incredibly happy I went! Celia, from the Polo club was so easy to communicate via email and was really quick at responses. My boyfriend and I had several questions and Celia couldn’t have been better to communicate with. Don’t miss this experience!!!Recap of the day: You are picked up in the morning right from your apartment/hotel and then off to the ranch which is about an hour drive. They keep the group of people relatively small and we met great people, so that was a great bonus. You arrive at the ranch and you are greeted by everyone who is part of the Polo Club ran there and handed wine and empanadas (pretty much the best ones I had in Argentina). Then you watch the club members play a match (continue to drink wine). Beware there are LOTS of mosquitoes. I was eaten alive!! Wear thick jeans even if it’s hot. They have bug spray there. After watching the game you are lead to the large tables outside to eat carne asado style. It’s delicious and the guy cooking is a former chef. There so much to eat you will be stuffed. After all of this you have the chance to play polo yourself. There were a few people who had never been on a horse including my boyfriend, but don’t worry, there are several people to give you advise and quick lessons on how to ride and play. There are also several horses and they will change your horse if you need a better one. After an hour or two riding you are done for the day (drink more wine if you want) and then you return tired and fully satisfied to BA.

Great 2 days of polo. My husband and I had a 2 day trip to Argentina Polo Day. We booked quite last minute and Celia was very helpful! We had just finished a 10 day horse trek and so we were feeling very confident on horse back. Ruben, therefore, kindly let us join in the match on the second day and we played a few 2-on-2 matches as well. There were beginners in our group too though and they were given much more help on the horses which were all safe and well-trained. Ruben and Mile are HYSTERICAL and made the 2 days such fun and a great Argentinian memory for me and my husband. The food was also amazing - Ruben does the best asados!My only suggestion would be 'Don't book a tango lesson after 2 days of polo' - you may need an evening off to soothe your muscles...Ruben and Celia - we will be back next time we're in Argentina!

Best of Argentina. My daughter and I took a day trip to the club. Native of Israel, it was our first encounter with Polo. It soon became the highlight of our trip. The owner Roven and his crew, were so hospitable, BBQ ing fine steaks, Empanada's and variety of fresh vegetable, wonderful salads, bread, fine wine...anyway a real feast. we learned how to play the game, we watched a match and had a joys day.Thank you so much Roven and all his staff, we really had a memorable day.

What a day!. This was probably a once in a lifetime experience for our group of friends. None of us had ever had the opportunity to play polo, and none of us were experienced riders (total beginners actually). I won't repeat all of the positive reviews that are already posted about this great opportunity, but I do agree with them all! I would highly recommend planning this day into your vacation. It was very reasonably priced, and from beginning to end the hospitality was incredible.Although most of our group failed miserably at actually playing polo (it's very hard IMHO), we were offered the opportunity to just ride free around the property with our horses and the staff made sure we got our money-worth! I arrived a total beginner and had my horse cantering by the end of the day!Tip: Dress accordingly for the weather, you'll be outside most of the day so bring warm clothes if it's a bit cool.... or just drink more wine, the bottles are bottomless!By the way, we had our 4-month old baby along and all of the staff were very accommodating.

Polo Day Buenos Aires. We enjoyed our Polo Day very much!
The game, the riding, the barbeque and very much the good mood and the great
pampas.

Fabulous Experience. Having never even watched a Polo Match we were not exactly sure what we had signed up for - we could not have had a better experience.From making our reservation through Celia, who answered every question and explained our options, to being picked up at our apartment in Buenos Aires in a very comfortable Van and driven to the Ranch and returned to our apartment in the evening, everything was a fabulous experience.When we arrived we watched a club Polo Match while dining on fresh Empanadas with beverages. We then sat down to a fabulous Argentine BBQ and more beverages. Later we took instruction on Polo and played a polo match of our own making.Loads of laughter, conversation and new friends were made.When we return to Buenos Aires we will definitely signup for another experience with Argentina Polo Day. Thank you Celia and Ruben.PS: Polo looks far easier than it is; I have huge respect for the athleticism of Polo players.

Not for beginners; inaccurately advertised.. Pick up from our hotel was great - on arrival the facilities were at best basic, with insufficient equipment to go round (my wife wasn't offered boots despite two other girls who already had appropriate footwear being given some - same went for actual polo mallet later). We were grouped into those who had and had not ever ridden before, although I'm not sure why - the distinction meant nothing within 5 minutes. The horses were spirited polo ponies and were not suited to beginners AT ALL. Safety was given scant regard - there were not enough helmets to go around and so a good few of us (me included) had to go without. Given that one fall from a horse can break your neck, this wasn't reassuring. The lunch was pretty low quality and the pool at the ranch was not the one on the advert...in fact it was full of debris and looked at first glance like a drinking pond for the horses. I could go on.Interesting day, but not recommended unless you can ride.

A Golden Opportunity on Four Feet!. This is something to tell your family and friends about, that made your trip special, unique, and so much fun. It’s not every day one gets to play polo (people look at you in awe when you tell them you did). You “play” at your own pace, yet offered a challenge in the mix. Staff is right there to guide and reassure you all the time. Horses were well behaved, well trained, and responded so wonderfully. It was quite an experience from the first glass of wine of welcome/ to the departing hugs from owner and staff, Ruben & Kirsteen. There was a continuous circle of bonding throughout the day... staff, guests, horses, drop-in friends of the ranch, all connecting and exchanging positive energy. A "must do" when in BsAs. And oh those empanadas they served at the barbecue and throughout the day... perfecto! BTW, they even offered me a bed in the upstairs loft in the main house for a quick catnap while a few rain clouds passed by. And indeed I did. Within 3 shakes of a “cat’s” tail I was up, refreshed, and greeted with the sun making a silver lining and bidding those clouds farewell. My only wish is that I could have had pictures taken in all that equestrian garb with stick in hand, but I was riding my horse at the time! Guess I‘ll just have to come back :) Trish, USA

Amazing Polo Experience. In advance of my trip to Argentina I made a lot of research as I wanted to find a place where I could learn Polo at the quickest possible pace and there were loads of places that offered just that. The million Dollar question was whether those places were able to deliver what was written on the tin. To be honest, my dealings with Celia over e-mail were the decisive factor that leaned the balance towards Argentina Polo Day over all the other offerings. Celia was very good and answered all my questions. I decided to pay the place a little visit for a day as I was quite sceptical at first, but once I got there the friendliness and knowledge of everyone was what made me return three days! Ruben, the grooms (petiseros) and all the other members were awesome! If you like quality Argentinian bbq's, great wine, friendly atmosphere and lots of Polo knowledge, then look no more. You found the place...

Amazing, once in a lifetime experience. This was a truly wonderful trip. It was a full day experience with delicious food, a gracious host, a knowledgeable and entertaining guide, and great fun with the horses.

Best possible way to learn polo and the most fun you can have. My wife and I are keen riders and love polo so staying at Polo Day was a no-brainer for us.It is quite simply the best experience you could possibly wish for. Celia was fantastic in terms of booking our stay and Ruben is so passionate about the sport that it makes it a trip to remember. Although most people seem to do this as a day trip, we stayed 2 nights on site and really soaked up the atmosphere. Our riding and polo improved so much and we still talk about the incredible Asada that Ruben cooked (especially the spatchcock chicken!). Emphasis is on learning by doing which is a nice change from the stuffiness of learning in the UK and far more effective. You will learn so much so quickly and will walk away with polo in your blood and wanting to ride forever!It is a true Argentinian experience and Ruben makes you feel so very welcome. My and wife and I will definitely be back and you would be crazy not to make this part of your trip whether you are a beginner or expert horse rider or whether spending a day or for a couple of nights. A true experience to remember forever.

A fantastic Argentine experience. From start to finish, a wonderful day. The staff at Argentina Polo Day were all extremely friendly, courteous, and accomodating. They picked us up at our hotel, drove us to the "estancia" (ranch), and upon arrival, met us with a glass of wine and empanadas that had been freshly cooked in their outdoor brick oven (the best empanadas we've had in Argentina). The explanation of the sport while we watched the first game was thorough and tailored to our knowledge and familiarity. The parrilla lunch was exquisite with Ruben, the owner (he made us feel like family). After lunch, the highlight was climbing on the horses and learning to play with some fantastic instruction.I would definitely recommend taking the day for this uniquely Argentine experience.

great escape from the city for a day!. The whole day is planned really well. I was picked up from my hostel with the transfer and got to meet other guests in the transfer that I would be spending the day with. When we arrived we were given an really good enpanada that was done on the grill, much better than the ones I had tasted in Buenos Aires! This was followed by some good wine. We then watched a polo game between some of the club members and the grooms. It was really fun to watch. After that we had a really good parisia, ( argentinian barbeque). The meat was cooked to perfection and there was so much variety! Definitely a top meal whilst in Argentina! I also enjoyed the never ending flow of wine :) After we had eaten as much as we could we had a quick introduction to polo and a chance to play . The ponies were great and very easy to ride. I have ridden a lot before but there were some guests who had never ridden before but managed fine.All in all a great day to escape from the city!

Exceeded expectations. We were a group of four (4) college friends (males) looking at our options of things to do (football game or polo). We decided on polo based on the reviews and our expectations were met and then some. We were picked up on time, shuttled to the site where we were welcomed with empanadas and wine. Everything throughout the day was well orchestrated and centered around its participants. I would highly recommend this day long event!

Excellent day out, fun and good value. 160USD per person included round trip transfer, barbeque, empanadas, unlimited wine and soft drinks, watching a match with professionals, and an hour on the horse learning to play yourself.My partner and I have some horse riding experience and I feel we benefitted more from the day than others in our group who were complete beginners as there isn't really any tuition involved apart fromHow to hold the stick once on the horse. We had a great time there is definately an experience to remember and you get a lot for your money!

Polo player for a day. What an amazing experience. While my friend and I were researching our trip to Buenos Aires, we wanted it to include seeing a Polo match. We came across Argentina Polo Day and thought it sounded too good to be true. When we checked the reviews on Tripadvisor and they were all great, we booked immediately.We were picked up from our hotel in BA and were driven to the ranch, which is about 45 minutes outside the city. We arrived and were welcomed by an english speaking guide and the owner of the club. We got a tour of the house and grounds and were brought to the field were we sat under the sun and drank wine and watched the 3 groomsmen play against 2 club member and the owner. It was my first time seeing a polo match and it was amazing. Each guest got to throw in the ball to start the match. After the game, which lasted about an hour, we went back to the house and enjoyed a bbq outside. I am a vegetarian and they were very accomodating. After the meal, we got to get on horses and play our own game of Polo. I was nervous about how I would be on the horse but they were very gentle. We practiced hitting the ball and then proceeded to play a game. It was so much fun!
