There is a pool but we were so busy with the horses, we didn't use it.Definitely one of the highlights of my trip.

Awesome Experience. A Must Do in BA.. I traveled to BA in February, 2012 and came across the opportunity to learn/play a little polo through Argentina Polo Cay. I wasn't sure what to expect. It ended up being the highlight of my trip! The club is located about 40 minutes outside of town. They picked me up at my hotel. On arrival, an English-speaking guide met us and we (there were three guests that day) were given the opportunity to wander around the grounds. There is an asado area were lunch was being set up. A "club" area with a living area, restroom, and some beds upstairs for overnight guests, and of course, area for the horses kept on site.After we were given drinks (It was a bit too early for the wine offered, and I wanted to be able to stay upright on my horse later.), we were led to the smaller of the two polo fields maintained there. A table and chairs were set up and waiting. Two teams assembled, and we watched a polo match. I knew nothing about polo, so it was as educational as it was entertaining. Our guide explained the rules as the game went on. Polo is much more intense than I ever imagined!After the game, we had a wonderful asado cooked by the proprietor. It was great. Then the wine flowed. (I needed a little confidence for what was coming.) After lunch, we were given instruction on how to hold the mallets and generally the basics of playing the game, saddled up and went back to the field. Some balls were thrown into the field, and we started learning to play the game. (It's not nearly as easy as the veterans made it look, but not so hard that you couldn't whack a ball occasionally.)After a half hour or so of getting use to swinging a mallet from the back of a horse, we divided into teams and played a game. Each team was filled out with experienced players. It wasn't a particularly competitive game (other than to Diego, who felt obligated to prevent my from striking the ball every time I seemed to have an opening!) from a scoring standpoint. We chased the ball up and down the field and occasionally, goals were scored. It was simply amazing. I had never ridden a horse in such a manner, and when combined with the coordination it requires to hit the ball or prevent your opponent from doing so (defense plays a huge part in the game), I was completely absorbed. I played aggressively (I had Diego to contend with) to make up for my lack of skill. The experienced players toyed with me, but it was all in good fun. I had a ridden horses quite a bit, but that's not required. You play at your own pace. If you don't want to mix it up with the experienced players, you certainly don't have to.After an hour or so of playing, we went back to the club for refreshments. Depending on how you play, the game can be pretty demanding. (And think about the horse!) Anyway, it was an absolute blast. I would have gone back the next day.This is truly a don't miss experience. Argentina is the epicenter of world polo. This opportunity to learn and actually play a sport that is played in so few places in the world is really a treat.
We had a ball time here!. Highly recommended! If you're into Polo, or not, you'll enjoy it. The lunch time feast is awesome!!!

truly a fun Polo Experience...... I have to say this was one of the funnest days I spent in my 10 day trip to Argentina with my husband. It was truly amazing how nice and hospitable Ruben and his staff were to make our day memorable. A bit skeptical that this was going to be a tourist trap but to be honest it was far from that it was a day to remember. The reality was that this was a great way to learn about Argentina and its love for Polo. After weeks of research I selected this company because of the opportunity not only to play Polo but to see a game of Polo.The day started off by Ruben( the owner) sharing with our group the facts and basics of Polo and of course a few glasses or wine and oven baked empanadas. This is always a great way to welcome any guest with food and wine!After our warm welcome our group was seated on the sidelines of the Polo field to watch the Polo match with more wine and empanadas. It was so much fun, and amazing to see a a game in full action as it was my first time and I had front row seats. More than the front row seats I gained an appreciation for the players and the horses as this is truly a difficult sport.After the Polo game we celebrated with a fabulous lunch with the players and Ruben. Not sure why other people have said that the lunch was not great because that is far from the truth the food and wine was a great typical Argentina parillada ( BBQ). Loved it!!After Lunch and wine, we all got geared up to play Polo. Wow Polo is a difficult sport that requires strength and endurance especially in 90 degree weather. I truly appreciated the sport after playing it I am only 30 years old and in good shape and it kicked my butt. Thanks to everyone at Argentina Polo day you were all amazing !!!!Thus, I truly recommend Ruben and his company to anyone visiting Argentina. It is worth the time and money I promise you will not regret.

Highlight of our time in B.A. This is a great way to spend a day in Argentina. I was expecting it to be a bit touristy and not really a challenge for me, an experienced rider, but boy was I wrong. After amazing empanadas, a demo game and a delicious barbecue with delicious wine we played a full on game with the other guest, Ruben and his wonderful staff. It was fast and fun and full of adrenalin, definitely an experience I will remember for a very long time.

Fantastic window onto Argentine heritage. Ruben, Celia and their team are friendly, knowledgeable hosts who provide a great introduction to so many of the best-loved aspects of Argentine culture: polo; delicious asado (bbq), wine, and empanadas; and leisurely afternoons in the sun. I have been living in Buenos Aires for several months and this is one of the most interesting things I've done - not least for the opportunity to get on a horse and take a crack at playing polo. The Polo Day site is less than an hour from Buenos Aires, but worlds away with lots of green, fresh air, and quiet. It's a really unique and authentic experience - the whole team is Argentine and everyone grew up with horses and polo - definitely a worthwhile break from the crush of the city (and they will arrange transport!)

Great Polo Experience Close to BA. We had an absolutely wonderful time at Argentina Polo Day!! We were greeted by an incredibly friendly Ruben and Rosie. Ruben was cheerfully tending to the grill, heating up the best empanadas we've had on our trip and Rosie was a gracious and welcoming hostess (her father Robert should be very proud!). We were provided with lots of information about Polo, got to see a great match despite the fact that it was the off season, met some really kind tourists also visiting and had a great time trying our hand at hitting the ball. It wasn't easy, but encouraging cheers from Ruben and Rosie (Vamos!) were welcome and fun.Would absolutely recommend this to anyone visiting BA, at any experience level.

By far, the best of Buenos Aires. If you go to Buenos Aires you can´t miss Polo Day. It is a complete day of fun that Ruben, the owner, and his staff will complement with exelent service. They pick you up by your hotel and 50 minutes later you are in a small farm receiving polo lessons, eating a complete " parrilada argentina", wachting a real polo game and then comes the best part, you play polo with the rest of the group, in our case for 45min. But thats not all, you rest at a pool before you head back to the hotel. Again, it is the most complete and exciting day in Buenos Aires and if you have herd about golf fever forgert about it, you get out of there with extreme polo fever and my sons are already planning our next trip.

Welcoming, engaging adventure with excellent customer service. Went here with my teenage daughters, and we all had a fun and relaxing day watching a polo match and experiencing the thrill of riding our own polo ponies. The ride out was a little nerve wracking as the driver looked too sleepy to be driving, But after we arrived, we were greeted with wine and a light snack of meats and cheeses. The lunch was amazing, the hosts gracious. The polo lesson was a little loose, it would have been helpful to get a few more specific tips instead of running about and trying to keep up with the best horsemen and the "real" polo players. Still, it was great fun. The customer service experience before and after was excellent--a rapid fast response to my initial email, and a willingness to refund prepaid fees for a last minute cancellation. Great experience all around.

A MUST Do in Buenos Aires. My two friends and I did this activity, and I can say it was one of the more exciting things I've done in my life. The whole concept and day activity was memorable. This is a whole day activity. Also, feel free to bring your swimsuit to take advantage of the pool.The day starts with being picked up from your hotel and driven about 45 minutes out to a ranch. At the ranch you are greeted with wine, sodas, and small meat snacks that were fire-grilled. You're introduced to a few of the polo players and you go to the polo field to watch a pick-up game, and even get to participate by throwing in the polo ball. After this is done, you go back to eat a lunch. This was my main and ONLY complaint of the day. I am a healthy eater, but the food that was served, that primarily consisted of many different meats was some of the FATTIEST meats I've ever seen. It literally is barely edible unless you want to eat pure fat. I would recommend to the owners to serve higher quality meats. But there are enough other things to eat to fill up a stomach and as much wine as you can consume. After lunch, you suit up with polo gear (Helmet and shin guards, and polo stick), and mount your trusty steed to play your own pick up game with the others that were a part of the group for the day. We were probably playing somewhere around an hour, enough that the horse gets tired before you, so the time playing was PLENTY adequate.Overall, I would unhesitatingly recommend this activity to do while in BA. There's not too many places where you can participate in such an elite sport. It's a MUST DO!

Fun in the Country. This is a great family activity if you want a day out of the city. The driver picked us up at our hotel (though he was a new driver and got lost getting there...thank you, iPad). This is a private polo club with about a dozen members who play polo while you watch. Ruben cooks up a mean BBQ lunch, you drink a little wine, and then put on the chaps, grab a mallet, and hop on a pony to play polo! It is really quite fun...I have never been on a horse before and I managed to get up to a weak trot and hit the ball around a little. The club members and ranch hands help out and keep things moving. There's a small pool if you want to take a swim. We all had a lot of fun and the staff were great hosts.

What a great day !!. The journey was very good, it ins't very far from buenos aires ! We went there with a beautiful sun. When we arrived, Ruben gived us some really good empanadas and some drinks (lots of wine !). Then Rosie explained us the rules of polo and then we had a chance to watch a real game with again wine and foods. Then we had lunch again very good meat and argentinan's food! Then it was our turn to do polo. It was really funny and even though some person didn't know how to horse riding, horses were very nice ! This was really funny and we had a good time ! Then we went in the pool after the effort, it was really pleasant !This journey was really good and we were in the heart avec argentian sport ! I recommended it if you want to try it it's a really good experience ! The ranch is very nice and every polistas were very nice to us !!

Fantastic Day - Must Do. I went with my boyfriend, and this was one of our favorite days in Argentina! Upon arriving at the ranch, we were immediately given absolutely amazing empanadas and wine. We chatted with the other visitors for a while and then moved our eating/drinking out to an open field where we sat under umbrellas (in the shade thankfully!) to watch a polo game. Following a BBQ after the game, we played polo and had a blast! Finally, we took a dip in the pool to cool off after a full day of polo. We were probably gone from our apartment for 11 hours in total. What I appreciated most about this experience was that it was authentic (not touristy). The business is family-run, so we were able to talk and eat with several local Argentines throughout our day. I would definitely recommend polo day!

Unique Day. Along with Argentina's great beef the Argentines are also known for polo. We thought we'd try this for a day trip. This is a must do! With the prompt customer service response and explaination we knew it was the right decision. As planned pick up was at 10:15 prompt. After 3 other pick ups we were there by 11:30. All 12 of us were greeted with wine or soda, dried sausage and cheese , and empanadas. Then it was polo time.(more wine). The game was explained by Rosie,an accomplished equestrian from England. After the game we had lunch under a covered patio with steaks(excellent) and sausages(also excellent) , grilled and perfectly seasoned vegetables,a tossed salad , fresh bread along with more wine. Loved the grilled eggplant.  After lunch it was horse time for the rest of us. I hadn't been on a horse since I was thrown from one years ago. I did manage to get on and feel somewhat confident about that thanks to Janie another great rider who works there.Some of our group were very good riders and had ridden and played before but most of us hadn't. The horses were very docile. After our "polo" game we returned to the main house to cool off in the inground pool. If you are looking for a fun day spent on a beautiful estancia, try this for a memorable and fun experience.

Great fun, great food, worth a try. I did the polo day with my girlfriend. We were in a small group - just us and one other woman. We were picked up at 11am. It was a good 50 minute drive out to the polo club. When we arrived we were greeted by Rosie who is an English girl working there. She can speak several languages so deals with the guests as the owner of the club can only speak Spanish. She was excellent, really friendly and full of chat. She gave us some wine and empanadas and we sat down to watch a game of polo between club members. This was a good chance to relax and learn the rules. Rosie was able to answer all of our questions on the rules etc.After the game we sat down for lunch which was a BBQ of various Argentinian meats - steak, sausages, chorizo, black pudding. It was really nice. This was served with salads and more wine.Then in the afternoon we had a mini game of polo ourselves. All the gear is provided. You should just be sure to wear jeans and not shorts. We were novice riders so we started with basic riding tips and then practising hitting the ball. Then we had a short game. You won't be turning pro after it but the club members and Rosie make it fun for everyone no matter what your level of riding.I would really recommend trying this activity. It was one of our favourite things from a month of travelling around Argentina.

Incredible experience - fun activities, ok food. Argentina polo day was a great experience - We had a lot of fun. When we first arrived, we met Rosie and instantly got wine and empanadas. For the first hour we really didn't do much but eat drink and look at the horses. We then went to watch the polo match. We felt pretty posh eating and drinking wine while watching the match. It was very cool to watch experts. Afterwards we had lunch. To be honest the lunch wasn't very good. It consisted of a very simple salad, a few sausages and very fatty ribs. We were hoping for a little more especially with how much we paid. But we quickly forgot about it when we got on the horses. Playing polo was amazing although a little more instruction before getting on the horse would have been beneficial. We ended up having a blast and had a great day. Keep in mind they only take cash which was a little inconvenient. And it's definitely better to pay in American dollars. I would definitely recommend this to everyone!! Have fun!

Play polo. Must do! This was a great day: you get out of the city to a wonderful rural location, you see a very exciting polo match, learn the rules, have a great lunch (Asado), then mount up and practice riding and hitting the ball (harder than it looks), then you play a match. A fun day and a great cultural experience. Make sure to bring your camera. They will pick you up at your hotel and drop you off at the end of the day for no additional fee. Cost was $160 USD which is a bargain for transport, lunch, watching a match, lessons and playing in a match.

Highlight of My Buenos Aires Trip. Argentine Polo Day tour is the highlight of my Buenos Aires Trip. i got picked up around 10 in the morning, arrive at their polo club to start with some Wine and Cheese. Then we went up to the field to see a polo match between their club teams. At the same time sampled more Malbec and really tasty Empanadas. Then we have a very nice outdoor Asaso (BBQ) which is amazing. Eating outdoor in Argentina just like the way it shows in the travel show "No Reservation" when Tony went to an Argentine Farm. At the end we have a great session for Polo lessons and played a quick 3 on 3 Polo match. I have no prior horse riding experience and enjoyed the game and lesson so much. Rubin and the British lady who helped him out and all the staff are wonderful.

Hockey on Horseback and Argentine Asado, what a day out!. One of the most common questions I'm asked when I meet someone here is: De donde es? (Where are you from?) To which I reply: Soy de Nueva Zelandia and normally their face lights up and the next word they say is: Rugby!! Well rugby is to New Zealand what Polo is to Argentina. They are the best polo players in the universe and their national team has not lost a championship since... wait for it... 1932.Traditionally, polo is practised on the family estancias (ranches) all over the country so you can imagine my excitement when I had the opportunity to visit Argentina Polo Day at "El Camino", a 20 acre farm located in Pilar (Buenos Aires Province) last Wednesday to learn to play polo.On arrival, I meet the owner Ruben, a friendly and polo-passionate character who looks like he's just stepped out of a Ralph Lauren advertisement. The first thing he put in my hand after shaking it was a glass of Malbec Argentine wine and then an empanada, freshly from the coal fire bbq. He explained the format of the day, firstly a snack and refreshment, followed by watching an exhibition polo game and then anasado (traditional Argentine bbq) for lunch and finally it would be our turn to get on a horse and whack mallets.As we sat on a shady spot on the side of the pitch, one of the English speaking hosts, Rosie explained the rules to me. Imagine playing hockey on horseback and you've got a pretty good picture of what polo is like. But it's much harder than hockey because there's no goalie and only three or four players per team. Plus there's the fact you're trying to convince a four-legged animal to chase a ball and risk a mallet in the head for their efforts. (Even the horses wear shinguards.) The outdoor polo field is 274 metres long and 182 metres wide, the largest field in organised sport. The game I watched involved three people per team team and four periods, called chukkers of ten minutes each. They have to swap the horse every chukker so that means for six people you need 24 horses, no wonder it's a game for the rich and famous! Players are given handicaps like in Golf and they range from -3 (beginner) to 10 (pro). I was at 'El Camino' with a lovely French family on their holidays and while it was their first time playing polo, they have horses back home that they regularly ride. Watching the players hurtling towards each other, mallet weapons flying, I began wondering if playing the dangerous sport of polo would be covered by my travel and health insurance!? My fear was sidetracked by a delicious asado of barbecued ribs, chorizo sausage, salad, slow-roasted veges and of course, Malbec vino. It's a beautiful outdoor dining setting and after a leisurely lunch we kitted up for the game ahead.The French family and I lined up for a team photo, leaning on our bamboo mallets and the next thing I knew I had mounted a horse and was on the field. We started with some stick-and-ball where you repeatedly practice trying to hit the ball along the ground. The coordination necessary to get your horse at the right distance from a moving target, leaning down, making contact with ball and not falling off the horse is quite immense. However after 10 minutes of gentle hitting (and missing!) the game begun and the groomsmen all joined in and showed us the ropes and reins of how to play. I'd like to say I was a pro instantly but like other high-skill sports like golf or surfing, there's a steep learning curve. However, the best bit for me was that even as a complete novice I was able to trot around the place, making occasional ball contact and enjoying the thrill of the game. The horses are incredibly well trained and after half an hour I wasn't even thinking about the riding part of it, just the chasing and hitting.The Argentina Polo day crew love polo, they live and breathe it every day and are happy to share their passion and expertise with novices like me. The food, the exhibition match and the game we played made me feel a part of their world for a day. But never fear Meg (my bicycle), I'm not quite ready to swap my two wheels for four legs just yet!

Definitely the best day of our trip in Buenos Aires. We decided to do Argentina Polo Day because we had an extra day in Buenos Aires and wanted to escape the congestion of the city. We searched TripAdvisor and saw it highly recommended, so even though neither of us have ever played polo and have rarely ridden horses, we contacted them and fortunately were able to go the next day. We were so glad we did it! This was right up our alley, getting to experience something that is popular and unique to the country, while having a great activity but is not a typical "touristy" thing. Just like all of the other reviews state, you don't have to be worried if you've never ridden horses before. From enjoying the beautiful outdoors, yummy empanadas and bbq on the grill. We would definitely do this again and you will be glad you did too!

Uniquely perfect.... What a fantastic way to spend a day outside of Buenos Aires! Never having experienced polo in my life, this was a great introduction to the sport that gave me a newfound respect for the athleticism it requires. And what better way to find this out than by giving it a try yourself - believe me, the pros make it look easy. The couple that operates this company could not have been more welcoming and gracious to their guests - because it is a small operation, the personalized service and attention cannot be duplicated by larger, more touristy events. This was the best tour I did while in Buenos Aires, and the price is right on the money...
Great day watching Polo!. It was a great place to see the Argentinian Polo Tournament. Great atmosphere and the people were great spectators. So lively compared to the matches in LaQunta, CA.

Most memorable experience!. What a great day! Being polo fans but having never played this was a great introduction to how it's done. Fun day, amazing horses, perfect weather, delicious food, great company, simply ... the best experience of the holiday! We would have signed up for another day had it not been the day before we had to leave. Thanks Ruben and Celia! Greetings from London, Diana and Cristian

Great true polo experience. Our Polo experience was great. We traveled with 7 adults and 3 kids. Some of us with some riding experience but most with no experience at all. This is a simple place with a lot of passion for the game. If you are looking for the whole "show", (dancing, big lunch with 100 people, etc), this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a hands on Polo experience, with great horses, amazing lunch, and super friendly/passionate people, this place is amazing. Thank you Ruben for opening the doors to your polo club. We will be back next year. Luis

Fantastic experience!. It was a great day. We where welcomed by Rosie with a nice glass of wine! It was fun and interesting to watch a polo game. The BBQ was one of the best ever! Then it was time to play our own game. Hard to hit the ball, but really a lot of fun! Great horses.

Great day and amazing activity. I was invited by two friends to do A POLO DAY activity in Pilar (25 km) away from Buenos Aires city, I did not what to expect but I acknowledge that Polo is a big sport in Argentina.So I decided to accept my friends´ invitation, Once we got there we were welcomed by Ruben (the owner), such a great guy and very friendly dude, he welcomed us with some Empanadas and a glas of Malbec (best wine), he is short of English but he employs Rosy from England, she is great and gave us some info about the HAcienda and a lot of info about POLO sport.. it turned out to be a great and amazing day, we had a Polo lesson, watched a Polo game, played a Polo game and had great Argentine Barbecue plus a lot of wine... the staff is great, very friendly.. Polo is an expensive sport so for what we paid it, we had amazing deal.. it costed only 160 U$ for the day but it is worthy, I would totally recomend this activity even if you are not big fan of Polo, I warrant it, You will a great day and have a lot of fun... So if you are in Buenos Aires and want to have a great and unique Polo experience, do not hesitate to contact this guys... www.argentinapoloday.com.arPepe.

Best experience! Funnest day of our stay in Argentina!. Polo day was quite possibly the best day of our week long vacation in Argentina. For us it started with the super-friendly and helpful driver that picked us up at our apartment in BA. We picked up one other couple at a nearby hotel then hit the highway for a short 45min drive to the polo ranch/club. We arrived and are immediately welcomed like family at your uncle’s ranch. We’re greeted by the owner and a handful of the club members. We’re handed a bottomless glass of wine and sit on the sidelines to enjoy a friendly little game of polo with an assortment of meats and cheeses, and more wine. After the game we sit around a table by the grill and have some of the most wonderful food for lunch; and more wine. Afterwards, we head out to the stables, grab a mallet and a helmet, pick our horse and head back out to the field to learn some polo; first hand. The time flew by so fast, before we knew it the sun had begun to set. We hop off our horses and sat on the patio for some refreshing beverages… and more wine. We then, reluctantly, say our goodbyes, thank our hosts, and hop in the car for the driver to take us back to our doorstep in the city. It was absolutely a fantastic experience; fun, relaxing, comfortable. Highly recommend. Three things one shouldn’t miss when visiting Argentina: the vineyards of Mendoza, the glaciers of Patagonia, and Polo Day.

Best way to learn playing polo. In my opinion this place is the perfect way to learn playing polo. I used to be a show jumper in the Netherlands and I would like to learn how to play polo during my time in Argentina. Well, I could say that this place is the perfect place to do so! Ruben (the owner of the club) and the others are very professional teachers. I stayed at their place for two days, got trainings, played small matches (calle baby-chacka's) and I even brought 20 horses from the pampa to their stables riding on another horse. Together with the great meals, swiming pool, sleeping facilities and the members of the polo club (who are hanging around the club during the day and are really interesting people) makes these two days an unforgetable experience!

A Must-Do for your trip to Buenos Aires !!. Dear Travelers,This is a great idea and loads of fun, especially if you only have limited time in Buenos Aires. You learn about Polo from a wonderful couple (a real Argentinian Polo player & his very nice and smart MBA wife). They welcome you to their little horse ranch, 45 min outside the city. You watch a Polo match, have a hearty bbq, try your hand at the game and meet some interesting people along the way! It doesn't matter if you don't know how to ride a horse, they will help you. If you do know how to ride, all the better! If you're already a novice player, you can sign up for their extend stays offers.All in all, for the price, convenience and the great pictures... I would highly recommend it for those who have limited time but want to experience all things Argentinian!Enjoy!

Best Polo experience you could find close to BA. Ruben and Celia are a charming couple who took a wonderful care of us during our four days in their farm. The place is only 40min from BA but you feel in a different world surrounded by horses and and green fields. Every day Ruben made me play non-stop, I tried different horses and could go stick and ball as much as I wanted. Ruben is an ex-chef so he served us very good meals and amazing asados after each game of course!For polo players this is definitely the right place to play and progress outside of BA, in a friendly athmosphere. We lived with my wife the real gaucho experience with an argentinian family in love with polo, horses, food and good wine! A must...

Highlight of our trip to argentina!!. I can't recommend this enough. We booked the day of polo but when we got there and realised you can stay overnight at the camp we wished had done that. Reuben and celia, the couple who run the camp (along with their cute little daughter), were so friendly and welcoming. We were made to feel at ease as soon as we arrived with a welcome of wine and juicy empanadas. The wonderful Rosie, who is the jewel in their crown at the moment (a young English girl who has lots of experience with horses and plays polo as well as any argentinian male), explained everything to us and helped us learn the rules of the game while watching a match between some club players which was a pretty full on passionate affair. As two girls with little or no horse riding experience it was encouraging to have rosie there to help feel less daunted by the prospect of playing polo!! Over lunch - a stream of barbecued meats and veg with plentiful wine - we got to know the family and some of their polo playing friends better and relaxed in the gorgeous surroundings. Afterwards we got kitted out ourselves and got straight on to the horses. Having never ridden in my life, Rosie made me feel totally at ease. I was initially disappointed that there were only 3 people in the group one of whom was my friend. But we got lots of attention and one of the polo players even took my camera and took lots of photos of us playing polo. We got a little instruction as to how to ride the horse but the animals are so well trained, within a few minutes we were being shown how to hit the ball. It was so much fun, although we played a limited game as my friend and I could barely get the horses to trot while the other guest was a show jumper. He was staying for 2 days to learn polo and improve his Spanish. All in all we got a bit of everything: a day out of the city, eating great food, learning about Argentinian life, watched a bit of polo and played some ourselves. Oh and all in the company of wonderful warm Argentinian people (and Rosie). We highly recommend this day!! Ps oh and if you don't want to get involved you can chill out by the pool so bring your swimming stuff!

Great day, fun yet relaxing. Really enjoyed our day, staff were really friendly and the polo was entertaining but I'm far from an expert! You can have a go yourself in the afternoon if you wish or just chill out by the pool. My husband loves steak and really enjoyed the BBQ but I'm a veggie and there wasn't much of an option for me at lunch, they could do with working on an easy veg option as it's not a cheap day!

Then do it!. A must! Best thing to do in BA and the only people in BA that didn't try to rip us off. Lots of tricky people in that town. Let's get back to the polo day. They picked myself and two friends from our hostel, we picked up other people along the way. I was a little worried that it would be lame because they picked up some unathletic types. It's about an hour outside the city. We arrived to a polo field greeted with best empanads I've eaten down in Argentina. The wine was legit too. As much as you could eat and drink. We watch a polo match, the rules were explained to us in English, but we were to busy stuffing our faces and drinking. Rueben, the owner, road over to us and said hello. He was playing in the match. After the match we went over to the farm house for an argentine BBQ. Here my friends and I ate like a fat kids in the candy store. Food was great! Talked and laughed. Chilled out for 20 min after the BBQ, then we suited up for Polo. I was wondering how it was going to go. The game or match was intense when we watched it. We are all athletic but have zero horse experience. Plus the other people that came had even less by the looks of it. They took us to a field after a short instruction on how to ride a horse, like a 30 sec on how to do it. We played with rueben and the other polo players. They helped us and played to everyone's level. I laughed so hard it hurt. Rueben is hillarious and cheats like crazy. I scored 3 goals, no big deal. Even the people that were really out of their element had a great time. One person did everything but played and she loved watching us. We played for almost 2 hours. I was tired and ready for some schlep. If I ever go back, it's a definite. The things I would do differently are bring a glove for your dominant hand that you swing the polo stick with. Like a batting glove or golf glove, wear jeans although my buddy wore board shorts, and if your have boots with a heel like cowboy boots. I wore sneakers and it worked. Just would've made riding the horse easier. The have gear but it's limited and plus it doesn't fit 3 meat head guys that well. It was awesome and well worth it. Plus I won't feel like a poser when I wear a polo shirt next time.

Great Experience. I was in town for business and decided to experience one of the famous sports of Buenos Aires during a free day....I'm so glad I did! First off, I'm afraid of horses and have never ridden one but I'm so glad I decided to do this. Everyone at the company is super nice and offered us wine/empanadas as soon as we arrived at the ranch. The next hour consisted of us watching them play competitive game of polo while teaching us rookies about the rules. The following BBQ lunch was delicious and it was fun to be able to kick back and learn more about the Argentinian culture from some true locals. We spent the last hour or so actually riding the horses and playing a "game" which must have looked ridiculous to an outsider since most of our horses were walking -- only because they knew we were beginers. The instructors were great! They were helping everyone individually and by the end of the session I was much more comforatable on a horse and really having fun. I recommend this for anyone with a spare day in Buenos Aires!!!

My Favorite Activity of my Entire Trip to Argentina. Hard to say enough good things about this....HIGHLY recommend to anyone traveling in the Buenos Aires area. The cost is $160 (at October 2011, the owners say they have to re-price things often due to persistent inflation in Argentina) which includes transportation to and from your hotel, all you want food & drinks/wine, private polo match as a spectator, one-on-one polo instruction and horse/equipment rental. They pick you up right at your hotel and the drive is about 45-60 mins with a friendly driver (if you speak a little Spanish). I knew right off the bat this was a very family-centric small business as one of our passengers was the driver's daughter. You're greeted with homemade empanadas right off the grill and a nice glass of Malbec, and after quick introductions and an explanation of the basic rules you watch a polo match between two amateur teams. The owners explain that they basically run this as a side business solely to cover the costs of team travel and caring for the horses - these guys are super passionate about polo and don't run this for a profit, just enough to allow them to keep doing what they love. After the match you have a terrific asado (grill-out/barbeque) which they try to keep feeding you until you beg them to stop. Some of the neighbors and polo players from the match joined us for lunch as well and were very friendly and happy to answer questions about polo and their country in general. After lunch you put on your equipment and get some instruction on how to ride / steer the horses and proper swinging technique. Then you're basically let loose to practice hitting the ball on the run as well as getting a good feel for your horse (its remarkably intuitive after just a few minutes, the horses are incredibly well-trained...and understanding of beginner riders). The instructors and staff ride alongside you giving tips, hitting the ball to you, etc. After about a half hour of practice you get to play your very own match on a shortened field with a mix of staff and pupils on each team. Incredibly fun and our match got pretty heated quickly, I hadn't ridden a horse in probably 10 years or ever attempted to play or watch polo and yet I got caught up in the game and immediately understood why the owners love it so much. They also run a week-long polo camp where you stay on-site which I would be sorely tempted to do if I can ever make it back for a long period of time (it also sounds like this doubles as an immersive Spanish course for those looking to improve their language skills). At the end of the day you're driven right back to your hotel....and I have been thinking about this experience ever since.
Perfect mix of relaxation, good food and wine and activity. Really great experience and absolutely worth doing!!!

Without Doubt the BEST thing to do in Buenos Aires. We were so looking forward to this most unusal experience and we were not disappointed. It was the best part of our time in Buenos Aires. We were picked up from our hotel and driven into the country. On arrival we were greeted with empanadas and drinks (the red wine was great). We then walked over to the field where chairs and unbrellas had been set up with more wine to watch a full on game of polo. The game was explained so we understood what was happening. The lack of spanish on our part and the limited english proving not to be a handicap.On completion of the game the players joined us for a great BBQ lunch. It was like having a family get together.After lunch our horses were saddled, we were padded up, handed our polo sticks and give some instructions before taking the field for our first attempts at polo. I say first because I would plan a trip to Buenos Aires just to do this day again.I would recommend anyone going to Buenos Aires to spend the day with these guys. It is absolutely brillant.

Argentinan Polo Day. This was without doubt the highlight of our stay in Buenos Aires. Collect from our hotel for an hour drive to the ranch greeted with the best red wine and meat pasties. Then sitting in the shade of unbrella watched a game of polo with our drinks and eats. This was then followed by a BBQ lunch with the players. Again brillant. After lunch it was our turn to "play" our horses were saddled and off we went for at least an hour up and down the field with a lot of help. Retruned back to the hotel. Not the cheapest activity in BA but by far the best. Although we spoke no Spainish we were mde to feel like friends not guests. Do take the insect repellent.Would certainly do this again cannot recommend highly enough

Do yourself a favour and book this if travelling to Buenos Aires. An absolutely amazing day. A friend found this a few months we visited Buenos Aires and we both held high hopes for the day. And the day didn't disappoint.Costs around USD$160 p/person for the day. This includes return transfers to your hotel, welcome glass or wine on arrival, empanadas. You meet the guys and make your way over the the polo field to watch them play some chukka's. From there you head back and have a Argentinian BBQ (a meat lovers dream) along with salad/vegetables. If like me you dont eat red meat you're in trouble however within reason email the guys and let them know any requests Im sure they will adapt if needed.After lunch you get a chance to mount a horse and under guidance they will teach you how to play polo. Im not the best person on a horse but they are really patient and give you about an hour to master the skills, and surpringsly not the hard to eventually hit the ball when on horseback.Contact Ruben who is really helpful. Google argentina polo day to find the details

An Absolute Must For A Trip to Argentina. Argentina Polo Day was by far the best experience I had during my two month stay in Buenos Aires. I had never ridden a horse before, but wanted to join some friends to travel outside of the city. We were recommended Argentina Polo Day, which ultimately surpassed all of my expectations. Travel was provided to and from the polo field, which is less than an hour from the heart of Buenos Aires. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the owners with wine and all-you-can-eat traditional Argentine empanadas. As we sipped on wine and delicious food, we listened to an introduction about the game of polo. It was not long until I was able to get on my own horse, ride her around, and then add in the polo stick to begin playing!! Having no prior experience with horses, I had never expected to be able to play. The horses were very calm and we had great instruction. After a few hours of getting acquainted, we took a long break to enjoy a classic Argentina barbecue ("asado"). It was absolutely delicious, and gave us the opportunity to get to know the rest of the group. The rest of the day consisted of more polo and horseback riding, chatting with other people in the group and the owners of Argentina Polo Day (who made the day a laid back, comfortable experience), and watching a live match! When our car arrived to pick us up in the evening, I did not want to leave! I would highly recommend this adventure to anyone visiting the greater BA area. It is an opportunity not to be missed.

Amazing authentic and unique Argentinian Experience!. Argentina Polo Day was incredible! It was one of my most memorable experiences in Argentina -- it combined polo, horseback riding, asado (BBQ), history, and a fresh breath of relief from the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires. My friends and I went on perfect Saturday. In the morning, Celia at Argentina Polo had helped arrange transportation for us from Buenos Aires to the estancia (ranch) which is about 50 minutes away from the BA city center.Once at the estancia, we were greeted personally by Celia and Ruben, the owners of the estanica. The welcomed us with freshly baked empanadas and delicious red wine and took us on a tour of their beautiful property. It was so picturesque - there were dogs, a little girl, a swimming pool, BBQ pit, and green pastures / clear blue sky...the air felt so much crisper and cleaner!!After an introduction to polo, we were soon on wards to our ridding lesson. We each got on a horse without much delay. There was a mix of different ridding levels in our group, but Ruben and his team made sure that we all felt comfortable on our horses (which were gorgeous!). They gave us tips on how to handle the horses and we were soon on our way to riding around the campo with our polo sticks. After our lesson, we headed back to the main house where an asado (BBQ) was being cooked for us on the outdoor grill. It smelled and tasted delicious! For the vegetarians in our group, there was also a great salad and freshly grilled vegetables.Overall, it was not only an incredibly relaxing day, but also one where I also felt that I learned something and did something truly unique "Argentinian". I would wholeheartedly recommend this, and have already been doing so with all my friends who are going to BA!

Great atmosphere and one of the must do things in Argentina. I read recommendation on Trip Advisor and took the advice. There were 4 of us visiting the ranch and it was great. A loot of very good food, we got an opportunity to watch British team play with Argentinians which was fun. Trying to play stick-and-ball was very cool too. I would have liked it to last longer to be fair but we spent all the day at the ranch anyway;-)Just one notice - if there are any vegetarians amongst you, make sure you communicate it very clearly, so that they are not presented with only meat options;-)

I had no idea Polo could be so interesting! - An alternative a regular picnic. During a recent business trip to Buenos Aires, I decided to stay one extra week-end to travel a bit outside the city (there are just so many times you can visit the same spots). A friend who is knowledgeable about Polo invited me to the Argentina Polo Day. It was a GREAT experience.... I am no connoisseur of Polo, so I wouldn't know how this compares to other places, but the opportunity to learn about the sport, have a great day on the outdoors and really have no pressure or rush. Plus the food ("asado") is to die for!I knew Argentina had interest in Polo, but I had no idea about the importance it has or the passions it creates among Argentinians. It is definitely embedded in their culture.At the end of the day, riding a horse around the fields and enjoying "La Pampa" is just great!

Great way to learn Spanish in Buenos Aires. I spent 5 weeks at Vamos in Buenos Aires before a 6 months trip around South America and it's been a great choice. The team is very professional and fun and I met a lot of great people there. Many thanks to Charo, Meaghan, Benjamin, Mercedes, Agustina, Luke and Maddy for everything. Highly recommended !

Lovely people and great learning experience. My boyfriend has been going to Vamos for 12 weeks now. Since he started he has made huge progress and he is now very confident when speaking in Spanish, which he found difficult before. Through the school we have also met many people and made new friends with whom we often hang out with and do fun activities during the week. Vamos has been great to him, and to me as well, he always enjoys going to class and now we can speak in Spanish to each other, which is awesome.

8 Weeks at Vamos. I expected a lot of progress after 160 hours of Spanish class in a Spanish-speaking country, but the end results far surpassed what I imagined. The school is very professional but also welcoming; I enjoyed going to class each day. My teacher for the eight weeks was Lara, and she was absolutely incredible. I also had the pleasure of spending the eight weeks with the top intern Luke, a fantastic guy. I learned an incredible amount and had a great time doing so. I highly recommend Vamos to anyone who wants to significantly improve their Spanish while in Buenos Aires.

Fantastic Experience at Vamos. for me the location was ideal, just a few mins walk from the subway. I have been with the school for 5 weeks now and all students are teachers have been excellent. All classes are tailored to your experience. I always feel challenged but never overwhelmed. I would recommend to anyone looking to improve or to begin learning Spanish.

Fantastic school, great teachers, and an awesome place to meet amazing people. I've been studying at Vamos Spanish for 2 months so far and I can honestly say it's been the best place to help me find my feet in Buenos Aires! The classes are a positive challenge, the teachers make lessons fun, the interns organise great local & cultural activities throughout the week, and the overall atmosphere is relaxed and friendly - making it an all round positive learning experience. I'm excited to see how much more I can learn in the next 4 weeks that I'm here and am glad to have met so many amazing people. Most likely will return for another few months next year. In short: highly recommend it!

Great learning experience. Thank you very much to my teacher Mechi and also to Benjamin that helped me so much during my time at the school. I really enjoyed the social activities with other students and the conversation workshops!

Great Location in Palermo + Fantastic teachers. I would highly recommend Vamos Spanish Academy to people of all ages and cultures. The staff have been really friendly and helpful from the very start (specially Benja and Meaghan) and the teachers are warm and welcoming.

Friendly staff and excellent professor. A great experience that helped to boost my all around Spanish skills, especially at a conversational level. The school has a comfortable and welcoming environment for students and provided a personal assessment during the enrollment process. The Profesora was helpful and patient with any and all questions and especially for specific skills that needed improvement. A very highly recommended place to learn or practice Spanish in Buenos Aires!

Excellent Spanish School!. I´ve been studying at Vamos Spanish Academy for three weeks now and I really have to say that my spanish has become much better in a little while. Even though I've been studying spanish for three years now, I forgot a lot of the use of grammar which I now could repeat once again. The teachers are very helpful and try to make efforts for everybody. Due to the fact that the classes are very small (2-6 people) it is possible to learn a lot in a very short amount of time. The academic director always tries to fit the students´needs which is why people of (nearly) the same level are put together in one course. Apart from grammar sessions we are talking a lot together during classes to learn new vocabulary and also to get used to the culture of Buenos Aires and Argentina. There is a common area in the school where all people can meet during their breaks to get to know each other and to make new friends from all over the world while drinking free coffee or tea. What´s more is that there are several social events or workshops during the week where students can go to and enjoy there afternoons/evenings together. All in all there is nothing I miss at the school which is why I really can recommend it to everybody. I would definitely take courses once again at Vamos Spanish Academy!

The full package - I couldn't recommend Vamos more.. I have been studying Spanish at Vamos for the past 8 weeks. Although I have been self teaching myself the language for the past two years, the progress I have made during just these 8 weeks has been astounding by comparison.Recently moving to Buenos Aires from the UK, Vamos has helped me develop meaningful friendships and the school has a real community environment. They have many socials and workshops to always keep people involved and engaged.Lara has been an excellent teacher during this time and classes are always enjoyable. With small group sizes between 2 and 4 people during my time, there is plenty of attention and also the opportunity to speak in a natural and conversational way.Would recommend without hesitation.

Good Spanish school. I studied for 9 weeks at Vamos and I loved it. My teacher, Fabiana was excellent; very patient and when I didn't understand something she thought of many different ways of explaining without just falling into an explanation in English. The classes were run in Spanish, so by the end of 4 hours each day, my head was spinning, but the classes were an excellent mixture of speaking, grammar, exercises and games. The placement test was great as I was put into a class that suited my level. I always felt stretched and sometimes felt that learning Spanish was beyond me, but that is the point of learning. It turns out, learning the language was not beyond me!Vamos is not the cheapest Spanish school, but I felt I got my monies worth. For me it was a great investment of both time and money. It's located in Palermo so is very accessible on public transport, or even better, walking if you live close by. I would definitely recommend Vamos.

Just what I was looking for. I did 3 weeks at Vamos to speed up my Spanish learning experience here in Ba. I signed up for group classes but due to the timing, I ended up being by myself each week. I had a different teacher each week and all were very helpful, friendly, and competent. The classes are all in Spanish but they can tell you in English if you can't understand what they're saying in Spanish after several tries. The non-teaching staff were all also very helpful and they offer activities outside of class at least once a week so you can meet other students and become more familiar with the city.

Excellent teaching. I spent 4 days at the academy learning Spanish with my girlfriend. We were in a class with just one other which made for a very interactive experience. We started with the basics as we had no previous Spanish between us. Our teacher - Lara, who was absolutely brilliant - progressed us quickly but always made sure the lessons were pitched at an appropriate level.Very reasonable price, extremely friendly staff and a good place to meet people when you first arrive in the city. Highly recommended.

Review for 3 months of lessons. My experience was absolutely amazing, i don't usually love lessons that are so intense but these classes didn't feel like they were a class, my teacher Guillermo was really relaxed and made the class a fun learning experience. The 4 hours a day flew by and the long break was a really good reset so you don't get burnt out. Everyone i met and all the staff were very nice everyone makes it feel like one community. Overall my experience was fantastic and if i get the chance, i will be returning.

Great school and staff; very challenging learning Spanish as a beginner in group lessons. My experience learning Spanish at VAMOS Spanish Academy as a beginner was mixed: pleased and happy with the staff and registration process, but frustrating and challenging as a beginner's speaker taking "beginner's" group lessons with those who were much more advanced than me. I heard similar experiences and frustrations from other beginner's speakers at VAMOS as well. My experience became less frustrating and challenging once I switched to private lessons, which I wish I had done earlier! There was another beginner's speaker in my class who dropped out of group lessons in my class, because it was too advanced as well so I know I was not alone in this experience.If you want to take Spanish lessons as a beginner (meaning you have ZERO Spanish / Latin / romance language experience and knowledge) at VAMOS academy, then know your goals and expectations and convey those clearly to Meaghan Rowland (the school administrator) before signing up. For example: do you want to learn how to read and write perfect Spanish grammar? Or do you want to learn basic Spanish phrases that will help you get around Buenos Aires and Latin America? There is a clear difference learning how to read and write Spanish grammar on paper, and learning how to speak basic Spanish.As a beginner's Spanish speaker, I first signed up for the beginner's group class and was placed in Profesora Paula's group class. As a beginner I thought we would go over the basics such as introductions, ordering food at restaurants, buying things at shops and grocery stores, and asking for directions. But I was surprised to find that we jumped right into Spanish grammar and conjugations, and even the instructions on paper were written all in Spanish with no English translations. Profesora Paula was diligent and professional, and focused her teachings on Spanish grammar with some conversational group exercises. It was intimidating for me to be in a class full of Europeans who were fluent in other romance languages (French, Italian) and a couple of of the students in my class spoke 4 - 5 other languages. They seemed to pick up Spanish conjugations and grammar quickly, and I was surprised they were placed in a "beginner's" class. More than half of the time, I felt lost and was embarrassed to speak up in class. At one point I even dreaded going to class because I couldn't keep up with the other "beginner's".I switched to private lessons after realizing after 1 week of Spanish grammar lessons, that I still could not have basic conversations around town in Buenos Aires but knew how to read and write Spanish conjugations. Thankfully, my private lessons with Profesor Guillermo made a huge difference and helped me improve basic conversational Spanish drastically. Profesor Guillermo was enthusiastic, patient, fun, and fantastic overall. He understood that I wanted to learn basic Spanish conversational skills without perfecting the grammar and conjugations, that would help me get around Buenos Aires and Latin America. My only regret was not switching to private lessons with Profesor Guillermo early on and speaking up earlier! Meaghan Rowland, the school administrator, was good to work with as well. She was professional, friendly, and fast at responding to emails and inquiries. I appreciated her help with registration, set up, and follow up. My recommendation for VAMOS is to separate "beginner's" Spanish speakers into 2 groups:1. Beginner's Spanish speakers who have Latin / romance language experiences, and can pick up Spanish must faster than others. Especially Europeans who already speak 4-5 languages. 2. Beginner's Spanish speakers (typically from the US, UK, Australia, etc.) who have ZERO Latin / romance language experiences. They move at a much slower pace and need patient teachers, compared to teaching multi-lingual Europeans who pick up languages much faster.

Great Spanish school with great evironemt!!. I recent completed 4 weeks intensive Spanish study at Vamos and I was thoroughly impressed. The staff was incredible and the environment was very friendly. I looked forward to attending every morning. My teacher Lara was amazing and I learned a lot from her. I really enjoyed my time with my classmates and other students at the academy. If you have the opportunity to attend classes I would highly recommend attending the social events as well. It is a great way to make friends and make the most out of your time in BA. This is a fantastic academy and if you are looking to improve your Spanish or learn from scratch you can't go wrong with Vamos.

Great Spanish learning experience. My husband and I have been taking Spanish lessons at Vamos Spanish Academy for 3 weeks. We were complete beginners without much prior knowledge of Spanish. We took group classes and classes were as promised always a max of 6 people, all our weekly classes were 4-5 people which is small enough to guarantee a good learning experience for everyone. Our teacher Rosario was great, we made lots of progress and she focused on giving us enough time to practice talking, while not forgetting basic grammar. Location of school is great, very close to the popular Palermo neighborhood. School premises are dated but charming that way, so don't expect any luxury or great facilities. The staff more than made up for any shortcomings in that area, great activities on offer after school without pressure to participate, and a very helpful business manager - thanks ben for all your help and tips. Much recommended school for its fun and informal atmosphere with students of all ages and from all over the world.

Greatest Spanish school!. I did 4 weeks of Spanish at Vamos and I'm so happy I chose this school! Everything was very professional and my teacher, Guillermo, was amazing! He made it fun learning Spanish and I really improved! The classes are small, I had a maximum of 4 people in my class, which makes it so much easier to learn a new language. The interns at Vamos arrange a few weekly activities which is a great opportunity to meet new people from all over the world. I would recommend Vamos and Buenos Aires to everybody who wants to learn or improve their Spanish!

Learning Spanish with friends. We really enjoyed our one week beginners course at Vamos. Our teacher Paola was always helpful and encouraging. The course was good for beginners, but they divide the students based on level so there are advanced courses as well. It is Spanish immersion so when asking questions and receiving answers it will all be in Spanish. Probably the best way to learn quickly.

Phantastic language school. I am so happy that I've choosen to stay at Vamos Spanish! It is one of the few language schools that is located in beautiful Palermo and is therefore not only located in a safe area but also in the middle of the district with the best bars, clubs and shops so that you have everything you need.From the very beginning I felt very comfortable, the team is really funny and caring and the most important thing: they are really professional! I didn't expect it to be so organised and structured, but you really feel that they want to learn you something! I had two amazing teachers who were more than patient with us all but forced us all the time to talk, talk, talk. The big focus on conversation was what I loved the most, because within a very short periode of time we were all able to talk, comunicate and have conversations with locals. The level was perfect for me, never too easy, never too difficult. Despite of that we had all a lot of fun, did some social activities together and the free coffee safed our all lives. Thank you so much for your amazing help. After only 4 weeks with you I can have conversations with locals for more than 6 hours and they are all asking mehow I was able to learn Spanish within such a short time. That's just crazy!!! I would ALWAYS come back to your school again and will definitely recommend you to everyone!! Thank you sooooooo much for everything, you guys are awesome!!!! ¡Suerte!

Great 1 week crash course in Spanish. My wife and I had a great week of classes with the team at Vamos. Our teacher was great, the class work was the right amount and right speed and our fellow students were a friendly and interesting set of folks from around the world. We stayed in Palermo and had a beautiful 25min walk to class each morning. Buenos Aires is such an interesting city. We both wished we stay for another week of class.

Great small groups and nice staff. I spent 2 weeks at Vamos Spanish, I was very happy with the small class sizes and the assessment they ask you to complete before commencing to ensure you are put into the right level class. The speed of teaching also is great, not too slow and not too fast, I learned a lot.

Great Spanish teachers and friendly atmosphere. I was in Buenos Aires for 2 months and took about 5-6 weeks of Spanish classes with Vamos. I tried group classes for 2 weeks and did 1:1 classes for the remaining weeks. My Spanish definitely improved from the lessons. I had 4 different instructors during my time and they were all great. They have a good balance of pushing the students while also keeping it fun. The staff has created a wonderful atmosphere at Vamos. It's not just a place that gives Spanish classes but a community for travelers. The staff plans weekly happy hours for the students, offers advice on getting around Buenos Aires, and I enjoyed getting to know them. That Arielle is a real treat! I highly recommend taking Spanish lessons at Vamos.

Amazing! . I cannot say enough great things about this school. From the moment I arrived, the staff went out of their way to make sure they knew me and each other student by name. I was greeted each morning and they made sure I wasn't only enjoying my time at school, but my time in Argentina as well. They helped me with bus and tour information and helped me find a money exchange. The registration was extremely easy as well. The school is close to everything and very easy to find. The time in class sped by and I had endless opportunities to practice conversation and improve my language skills. I will definitely be back soon for more lessons!!!

Had a great time!. School is in a good location, and all the staff are super friendly and helpful.The main classes were good value, and there was the right amount of students:teacher ration I think.We had a nice teacher, and I definitely improved throughout the week.They placed me in the appropriate level for my competency.Overall I would recommend this place :)

Excellent value at an excellent location. If you are looking for a good quality spanish school in small groups in an excellent location in Buenos Aires (Palermo) then look no further. This school is run by a young dynamic team who know what they are doing. They are also organizing various social activities (optional).In the 2nd week I ended up alone in the class with no extra charge. My teacher was excellent, graduated from UBA (Universidad de Buenos Aires).Highly recommended.

Good but not comprehensive for long term study. On the plus side Vamos is in a good location, comparatively priced with other Spanish schools in BA and they accept payment in Pesos. The class sizes are capped at 6 which means you get a lot of attention and time to adk questions.The major downfall of this school is that while my teacher was extremely nice and knowledgeable, the school does not teach past and future tense leaving you with limited spanish when it comes to the real world. Had they covered these tenses even briefly in the first 2 or 3 weeks of school I could recommend them but I cannot, unless your goal is to only studst for 1 week or so and achieve very basic spanish.I hope they change the syllabus, if they did, I could recommend Vamos.

Fine, not amazing. I went to a great Spanish school in a different country a month ago, and I know it's unfair to compare the two, but mentally I can't help myself. The other school did such a good job of changing up the pedagogy and engaging different parts of your brain, I couldn't help but notice that this was lacking here. The format at Vamos was 95% direct instruction (ie lecture). Even though my instructor was super clear and super nice, nobody can keep your attention for four hours when they're limited to direct instruction. On the other hand, she was a great teacher, I was placed well, and I did advance in my Spanish!

Really helpful and flexible. I wanted some intensive Catellano classes whilst in Buenos Aires. Vamos did a great job over the couple of months that I was there. They are a most friendly bunch of people and are enthusiastic in what they do. They were also very flexible in tailoring classes so that I could still get the best out of things as my circumstances changed.

Excellent experience all round. We signed up for two weeks of the Spanish for busy travellers course at Vamos Language Academy and had a great time doing the classes while finding them an excellent start to picking up the local language. We had completed 20 hours of Spanish lessons before arriving in Buenos Aires, that provided a baseline for comparison, and found that the Vamos approach was more informative, providing a better introduction to the language and was definitely much more fun.Benjamin and Arielle were very helpful in providing us with their local knowledge, the weekly social nights out were a bit hit and our teachers were both knowledgeable, enthusiastic and very friendly.I have no hesitation in recommending this school to others.

Great Spanish School!. Went to Vamos to kick start my Spanish for my months here in Buenos Aires and I'm so happy that I chose this school! I had a fantastic teacher which I had private lessons with the first week and then some other people joined in the second week and that was good too because we became friends. The groups are small and the staff super friendly. I warmly recommend Vamos if you want to learn Spanish in BA!

Great place to learn all the Catellano you need for your travels in Argentina. In Nov and Dec, both my husband and I took classes at Vamos (beginner and intermediate). We chose this school for it's price (quite low) and location (Palermo). It turned out to be a great choice. - The material is very practical. It focusses on providing you as much useful knowledge and information as possible in a short period of time, so everyone can go off on their own. It's not very professional, but I don't think you can expect that for this amount of money. The one thing I did really like was their quick reference card for verbs.- They're very flexible. It's best to take a few weeks in a row, but due to our travels, we always had a week in between, and we would de ide at the last minute if we would return the following week, which was no problem.- Both teachers I had were very good (Guillermo and Agustina), knowing to set the right pace, deferring from the programme when called for and making sure you're as active as possible.- They are very helpful with any other questions you have and they organise may extra curricular activities.- The atmosphere in school is great and they serve coffee/tea all day long.Would definitely recommend.

Vamos! - The Best Choice in Buenos Aires. My partner and I attended about ten weeks of classes and it was amazing! We started in the low season in August with only a few other students there and left as the high season was starting in October. Either way, the classes are kept very small/intimate and the teachers are extremely qualified and helpful. The teachers are flexible enough and know Mexican Spanish as well so it wasn't a problem to use "tu" versus "vos". Material was thought provoking and up to date. It was easy to form a community of friends at the school and the staff was so kind and attended weekly happy hours with all the students. Our Spanish improved tremendously and we made our closest friends in BA there. Great experience! Thanks Vamos! Also, we liked the page on Facebook for our "daily dose of spanish" to keep on practicing.

Lovely people, good education. Massive thanks to Vamos Academy! My girlfriend and I took a lot away from our all-too-brief fortnight at the school. The classes were fast and effective, the teachers knowledgeable and the staff generally friendly and responsive.I highly recommend Vamos if you're thinking about learning Spanish in BA.

Great place to pick up some practical Spanish in BA. I attended the school for 3 weeks in October before travelling around more of South America. Having only done a Duolingo course beforehand, it became abundantly clear as soon as I arrived that my level of Spanish was not going to cut it in the real world. Having just finished, I have noticed that my Spanish has genuinely improved and I feel more comfortable both speaking and hearing the language now, although I'm aware that it's still at a basic level. The staff and other students here were very friendly, the building was lovely and the work was practical and created locally. Moreover, all group classes are completely in Spanish. My reading ability has improved dramatically because of this.I can also recommend highly the home stay feature of the course. I stayed with an Argentinian in the next suburb who only spoke Spanish, but who was very patient with me as I improved. It was very pleasant and greatly improved my ability to understand the unique accent of the people of Buenos Aires.I think with more time I could have expected a great deal more improvement, but if you're pressed for time this is still a fantastic choice.

Great experience!. I attended two weeks of classes and loved it!!! I noticed a huge improvement in my Spanish as well as in my confidence in speaking. It is amazing how much you learn each day! I really appreciated the effort this school makes to place you in the appropriate level based on an online test and a brief oral test. I felt that I was placed in the right level for me. The whole experience was well worth the money. I strongly recommend this school to anyone traveling in the area who is interested in improving their language skills!

Perfect decision. I have taken 3 weeks of Spanish courses at Vamos and really enjoyed my time there! The school is in a nice old building in an interesting part of Buenos Aires. Everyone is nice and helpful. Good teacher, helpful staff and lots of interesting people taking classes at the Academy. It was a perfect decision, I really had a very good time there and can only recommend the school to everyone taking Spanish classes in BsAs!

Best language school I have ever seen!. Due to a lack of time I had on my travels I was only here for a week to refresh my Spanish. However, I advise everyone to visit this school for at least 3-4 weeks.I was allocated into small intimate groups. 4 hours of lessons a day. Patient and super friendly teachers. Great location and unbeatable value for money. Group activities during the week which is great for people who are travelling alone as you get to meet many people. The staff was very helpful and friendly regardless of what.

Excellent experience. My wife and I completed three weeks of daily classes at Vamos. The staff were helpful, friendly and worked to make sure we were in the right class. The process started with a written evaluation followed by an oral interview for class placement. Both our professors were great, and our proficiency significantly improved during our time there. We also met others travelers and developed good friendships.

Great and friendly school. Vamos is an excellent school for those looking to learn Spanish whether you're in Buenos Aires for a few weeks or a few months. The staff and teachers are very friendly, patient, and really want you to succeed in learning Spanish and have fun while doing it. The staff are also a great resource for finding out about Argentine culture and giving tips about restaurants and events to try. Definitely would recommend!

an excellent school. We intended on studying at Vamos for just a week prior to backpacking around South America. However, we enjoyed studying at the school so much we decided to stay for 2 weeks. The school provides excellent learning materials that allow you to implement what you are taught. Both teachers we had were highly organised and enthusiastic. Vamos also provides an opportunity to learn about Argentinian culture and social events, should you wish to do so. The staff are very friendly and are willing to provide you with information about Buenos Aires and Argentina.

Comfortable setting, wonderful professors. The curriculum at Vamos is wonderful...teacher clearly have many resources from the administration...but classes are generally flexible enough for those "what about (fill the the blank)??" discussions. Another pro. about this school is its social atmosphere--its easy to make friends, from all over the world!

Definitely the best way to learn spanish in buenos aires. Basically I spent two weeks in buenos aires and Vamos Spanish was the best choice to learn the language in a fast way. A very nice place, cool people and lots of fun. Then I felt ready to move on to patagonia. I highly recommend it ;)

Fantastic. I only spent a week here and took the introductory lessons. It's really an excellent school with incredibly nice staff and teachers and also an easy-going feel. I was very late for my first class but the office checked up on me and the instructor stayed back to make up for my tardiness. One morning I had to leave early and the school again accommodated my request. I came in with zero language skills but started to enjoy it as the week went on. I only wish I had more than a quick week to spend at Vamos.They also organize social gatherings which are great fun. Everyone is super nice, very friendly, and very professional. The school is in an excellent area with shops and cafes all around. And of course, they offer excellent value for your buck. Totally recommended!!!

Good school to study spanish in Buenos Aires. We have studied spanish for 4 weeks at Vamosh and really enjoyed our time there! The shool is in a nice old building in one of the best neighbourhoods of Buenos Aires. The staff is nice and helpfull and offer free after class workshops and a weekly social night. The teacher we had was lovely and very good, we learned a lot during our time at Vamos. Overall a very good experience!

Nice place to learn spanish in Buenos Aires. I took two weeks of Spanish lessons with Vamos and enjoyed my time there. I chose the school based on it's location in a very nice part of Buenos Aires, as well it's competitive rates for the course and the fact that they didn't charge any enrolment or additional course fees. The teachers and the admin staff were great, and I felt that my spanish skills improved a lot in my time there. If I had more time to spend in Buenos Aires I would have continued my classes at Vamos.

Very flexible and professional. I only spent one week at the school and took private classes to get most out of my time. The school was very accommodating. I could start right away and they also let me take classes in the mornings, although usually that's when all rooms and teachers are busy with group lessons. The classes improved my Spanish a lot, even though I only had little time. The teacher adapted perfectly to my needs and made this entire week a great experience.

Great school!. We really enjoyed our 2 weeks at Vamos. The classes were well organised and the materials useful.Everyone at the school was very friendly and there were plenty of after class activities to get involved in (workshops, weekly drinks). There was even free tea/coffee/water provided!We will recommend Vamos to our friends.
Perfect start!. I can't imagine better place to begin my adventure with spanish than Vamos! I enjoyed classes and workshops. The location is perfect and I love the antique Vamos Academy building :)

Amazing School, Far Better Than Exspanish. I really enjoyed my time here taking advanced Spanish classes on an individual basis with teachers Fabiana and Mara. Both were excellent! After feeling completely disillusioned with my experience at Exspanish, where I had just finished spending a month attending some pretty disorganized classes, I was hesitant to try another language school. But from my first impression to my last, I realized Vamos Spanish is far superior to other language schools in Buenos Aires. Here´s why:- They provide a level test (not just a worksheet where you conjugate verbs, but an actual test) that is supplemented with an in-person interview to gauge your appropriate level (A1-C1). This level assessment is less important at the earlier stages of second language acquisition but becomes increasingly important as you spend more time learning a language, as you can easily be misplaced (as had happened to me at Exspanish) at a lower or higher level than your actual level. Which as you might imagine would be a frustrating experience for everyone involved. - At Vamos, they use this level assessment to decide where to place their students. At the time I enrolled there were no other students available with a higher than B2 language level.
