So instead of group classes I was offered individual classes and though individual classes are more expensive than group, because they could not find a group at my level, they honored the group rate while offering me individual classes. This was VERY important! Because at Exspanish I ran into the same situation and was told I would have to pay the difference of the cost between group and individual classes (over 200 USD a week), which had left me feeling burned because it was their fault they couldn’t offer something they advertised. At Vamos, by contrast, I was quickly paired with an individual teacher and not charged the individual rate. - What’s more, whereas at Exspanish and other Spanish language schools they use materials published in Spain and do not adapt them for Argentinian use, Vamos makes all of their materials in house. Moreover, their curriculum materials – worksheets, etc.- covers the full range of language difficulty. I spent part of my time practicing C1-C2 exercises (oral, written, and reading) for the CELU and DELE (Spanish language certification exams in Argentina and Spain, respectively). Because the materials were designed by Vamos for Vamos students in Argentina, I found they were more relevant to living in Argentina and gave me the opportunity to be familiar with both conversational and academic contexts of the Spanish language. - In addition to using their own materials, Vamos met with me before the start of classes to design a curriculum of what I wanted to cover during my stay. Something that Exspanish never did. For example, they asked which parts of grammar (5 types of se), advanced periphrasis, etc., I would like to focus on and worked with the teachers to have those materials available. Moreover, knowing that I am a student in a psychology doctoral program they chose several language texts (including academic articles) that were relevant to my field (clinical psychology) for conversation practice and vocabulary development. I cannot overstate how much this personalized attention increased the quality of language instruction and this was something I did not receive elsewhere (Exspanish). - $$$ WAIT, THERE’S MORE. You would think receiving individualized as opposed to group language classes with materials made in house would cost way more, but actually I did the math and saved at least 400 dollars by choosing Vamos over Exspanish. I was able to take that savings and buy more individual tutoring hours on top of the 10 a week I originally signed up for. And I increased the number of hours at Vamos because the teachers obviously knew what they were doing and I found the classes fun and challenging. I want to close this review by saying I also really enjoyed working with the administrative staff at Vamos. Maybe because it isn’t a mammoth school like Exspanish or the others, they actually take the time to remember who you are and treat you like a human being. They also provide a lounge with free coffee and water (Exspanish charged their students for cups of coffee :(). I really enjoyed how personable and friendly everyone at the school was. Especially being a more introverted student, the staff encourages students to attend their after class activities. There aren’t as many students at Vamos as compared to Exspanish so the atmosphere is more personalized and collegial. And I might add, living in Palermo, I enjoyed being able to walk or take the subte to school, rather than being stuck in an overcrowded subte at 7am to then walk through the microcenter. I am returning to Argentina for a couple of weeks in December 2015 and will be signing up for Vamos’ classes once again.

Muy bien !. The way the courses as well as the school in itself were organized were very well done ! 3h30 hours of class: 30 mins between to eat a fruit in the fruitshop next to the school or a "postre" in the bakery just in front of were details but those details made the difference. What's more, everyday Vamos spanish offered us cafe, the, milk which was very pleasant ! The staff were always nice, my teacher was very good as well ! It had a good balance between theory, practice and games so that the hours of course could pass away very quickly without noticing them.Another detail that was for me really important: the fact that the class couldn't exceed 6 people ! During 2 weeks out of 8, I was lucky to be only with someone (Mothiii) in the class !This school is very good :-D

Profesional classes in a friendly school. For 3 years in a row I took classes at Vamos Spanish; I love this school. It's location is perfectly in the middle of all barrios of BA, The staff is super friendly and the teachers are really good. Because of the variety of exercises I really learned a lot and we practised speaking a lot too which I needed because I have friend in BA who do not speak English at all...so I have to speak Spanish. For sure I recommend this school!

A great place to study Spanish. I took private lessons at Vamos from a couple of different teachers over the course of about four months, and I was delighted with everything about the place. The teachers are terrific, the staff is incredibly nice and helpful, and the other students whom I met were interesting and fun. Excellent location, good price, I totally recommend Vamos. Yay Vamos!

Welcoming Spanish School in Buenos Aires. I had a great time doing 2 weeks of Spanish classes at Vamos Institute in Buenos Aires (20 hours per week). The group was small (4 students) and the teachers were really friendly. In just two weeks I felt I progressed a lot. The atmosphere at Vamos was always welcoming and I would definitely go back.

Great school. I had a great time learning at Vamos for a month. The teacher I had was fantastic and was very encouraging from the start. The number of students in my class varied from week to week with six the maximum. Not sure how it compares to other schools but I was happy with the materials and pace of learning. I would not hesistate to return. Muchas gracias Vamos

muy simpatico. have been taking classes at Vamos for two weeks. Good location, nice people, lots of other students from all over the world and above al, great classes! Learnd a lot.La profesora was muy simpatico and patience with us, asking a lot of questions. Besides the classes, very helpfull with getting around in BA with tips en places to eat, going out and just things you have to see!conclusion, go to Vamos if you want to learn spanish !!

Great Spanish School!. I only studied at Vamos for one week, but I really enjoyed my experience. The staff were very caring and helpful. It was easy to make friends with the students, and there was a nice community atmosphere. The school is conveniently located in a beautiful area, and the school is in a charming,old houseI learned a lot of helpful grammar, and foundations of the language that will definitely help me out as I continue to learn Spanish. However, since it was a beginners class, it would have liked to have learned more practical info, such as how to ask for directions, basic phrases, etc. They do offer a crash course for this though, which I'm sure would be more helpful in this sense. My only other suggestion would be to offer afternoon classes as well as morning classes. I would recommend Vamos heartily though, and would have loved to have stayed longer!

Excellent!. In the six weeks I studied at Vamos Spanish Academy, the number of people in my vlass never exceeded 5. This is one of the many solutions of Vamos that made it such a good experience, others include free coffee and tea and an incredibly kind and helpful staff. The quality of the classes was very high, they provide all materials and can teach at all levels. I personally started as a beginner. The building is kinda old, which is charming and the classrooms are comfortable. The teachers I had during my stay were all excellent - Mercedes, Nicolas and Eliana. There is an informal and friendly vibe in the place, both between teachers, staff and students. All in all I highly recommend this school!

Best place to kick-start your Spanish. I have just finished four weeks of group classes and starting from scratch I think I have already come a long way in getting a basic grasp of the language. I'm left with the feeling that my learning experience was really important to the school staff. For instance, in my first week I was the only student without prior knowledge of Spanish, but instead of putting me in another class where I would have struggled to keep up with the others, I was offered one-to-one lessons (without extra charge, of course). Furthermore, classes comprise few students and you sit around a table which makes it easier to feel comfortable.Also, my teacher, Nicolás, was fantastic in creating an atmosphere in class that was relaxed, fun and serious at the same time. No question was too stupid or basic and he encouraged us to speak as much as possible in class. You could tell that he was "geeky" about Spanish and that excitement really spilled over. The staff make you feel welcome and at home from day one and are eager to give you tips on what to do outside of class and they arrange some nice social activities.All in all, I'm happy about my choice of school and it's certainly good value for money.

Great experience!. I recently completed 4 weeks of group classes at Vamos. The classes were excellent, and my teacher, Mercedes, was very motivated to help me learn. The classes are smaller so you really have a chance to practice and talk. They did a great job of putting me in a class with other students at the same level. And just as important to me, as I was travelling alone, the staff did a great job of setting up activities outside of the classroom, such as workshops related to navigating around BA (such as how to use public transport, and how to interpret Argentinian hand gestures) and social nights. I met so many great people and really loved my experience at Vamos and in Buenos Aires.

Excellent school. I studied at Vamos spanish for 2.5 weeks and I am very happy with the experience. I had 3 different teachers who were all great and the administration staff is super-nice and flexible. For example they allowed me to start mid-week and then ad an extra week with only a day's notice. We were 2-3 students in the groups the first weeks, and the final week I had a private tutor (2 hours/day instead of 4 hours/day) since there were no other students on my level. I really improved my spanish during these weeks and wish I could have stayed longer. /Julia

Good value. I've thoroughly enjoyed my lessons at Vamos Spanish. I could change class after my first day, to a group in which the people were speaking more than studying grammar, the former which I preferred. That flexibility really characterizes Vamos Spanish, the staff as well as the teachers adapt to your needs regarding your Spanish skills. Also, it is a nice place to get to know people, as the school also organizes and informs you about social and cultural activities.All in all, if you're looking for a good time in Buenos Aires while learning Spanish, Vamos Spanish is the way to go!

An Excellent School. I took private lessons at the Vamos Spanish Academy for about a month and a half. My teacher, Celeste, was remarkably competent and motivated. She enjoys the logic of the language; she enjoys teaching the grammar. She has an explanation for every linguistic idiosyncrasy. She is also a deep thinker, a philosopher. So as my Spanish was getting better, we were able to discuss abstract matters ever more often.The school is run most efficiently. Rescheduling (my private) classes has never been a problem. Sometimes when I reschedule, I would have different instructors if Celeste was not available.The school is rather well located. It was about a twenty-minute walk from where I was staying. The walk was through Villa Freud, a quiet neighbourhood with some cafes and restaurants, where I was able to have lunch before my classes. If I were to stay in Buenos Aires again, I would continue taking classes at this school.

Best choice to learn Spanish in Buenos Aires!. I found this school through researching online and the reviews were absolutely right: Vamos is one of the best Spanish schools in Buenos Aires! It`s located in a beautiful old building in a great spot in Palermo, the most popular area in BA. It's close to the Alto Palermo shopping centre, close to the subway and in walking distance to many nice restaurants & bars. The staff was really fun & charming, went to social evenings with us students and helped us with everything we needed. There are lots of free social activities after classes, including workshops to learn the local customs:-) The school is very flexible, uncomplicated and the mail- communication was great too. I learned a lot in classes (which had an ideal size of 2-5 people), my teacher did a fantastic job and also, the material was fit to our needs. For me, clearly the best choice in BA!!

Great Spanish School. I had an excellent experience studying Spanish for four weeks at Vamos. I attended both the group and individual classes. I was very impressed with the course structure and the fantastic teachers. Every teacher I studied with was extremely knowledgeable and worked hard to make the courses fun. Group discussions were lively and the teachers did a great job of encouraging participation of all students. Elianna, Brenda, and Celeste were all wonderful. The admin staff was very nice and helpful. They were flexible and accommodated my schedule for private lessons. They also went out of their way to give me restaurant and activity recommendations while in Buenos Aires. In conclusion, I would highly recommend Vamos for anyone hoping to learn Spanish in a fun and relaxed environment while in Buenos Aires.

Excellent School. I went to Vamos Spanish for about three weeks this summer. I've been to other Spanish schools before, and Vamos was easily my favorite. The staff was great: they were all extremely helpful and flexible. The classes were also excellent. I did both group and private classes and worked with Elianna, Celeste, and Brenda. They were all wonderful. I improved significantly and really enjoyed being in class. I highly recommend Vamos!

Fantastic School. I attended Vamos Spanish Academy for three months, and my Spanish proficiency grew exponentially. I took the private classes, which allowed me to learn at my own pace. I had the opportunity to have Mercedes and Daniela as my teachers, and both were excellent. The staff was also terrific to work with. Also, they organize happy hours where you have a chance to meet other students. If you are looking for a place in Buenos Aires to learn Spanish, I highly recommend Vamos Spanish Academy.

Top Spanish School. I attended Vamos Spanish Academy for 4 weeks, my first attempt at the language. I only have positive things to say about the school - helpful admin staff, excellent tutors (thank you Daniela) and a positive friendly atmosphere. The course was intense but thoroughly enjoyable, I was sorry when it ended. Thoroughly recommended.

Great School. I visited Vamos Spanish for about 10 weeks. Great school. The teachers are very competent and the staff is very helpful. I enjoyed my visit and learned a lot in the little time I was there.

great school!. I did a lot of research on schools and am so happy I picked this one. I wasn't there for very long but felt I learned a lot with Mercedes. I did group classes and thought they fit really well! The school also organizes social events and the staff is great at recommending other things happening around BA. There is also free coffee, which was very welcome and good! During breaks there is enough time to run downstairs and get some snacks also

I was very happy at Vamos Spanish. From the moment I walked into Vamos, I felt really welcomed. It only got better when I started classes, and I realised how good the teaching staff was - they were intelligent, approachable, kind and eager to help the students as much as possible, and in a way the students could understand - even if they didn't speak spanish very well. Both of these things really inspired me to apply myself, improve my Spanish and get the most out of my time there. The other things I enjoyed about Vamos were the intimate class sizes, the programs and events the school offered every week to enhance our experience and introduce us to new people, and the admin team who were always happy and quick to help. I really enjoyed my time at Vamos and will most definitely return when I go back to Buenos Aires.

Great school. I was at the school for 6 weeks of my 7 in buenos aires and found it really helpful as well as enjoyable. The staff are very friendly and there is an organised drinks session every week. This helps the students get to know each other and I made many friends through the school. I chose to do group classes which consisted of four hours of lessons in the morning Monday to Friday. On my first day the academic director had a quick chat to me and placed me in my class level. I thought this was well done especially as I considered myself a beginner but had had some Spanish practice prior. I actually had the same teacher for the whole 6 weeks and she was excellent. The lessons were all interesting and although grammar based, there was still a lot of Spanish conversation. Big love to you Mercedes! I would definitely recommend the school and hope to be back one day. :)

Vamos to Vamos!. I went to Vamos for most of the three months I was in BA. I did about six weeks of group lessons (4 hrs/day) and six weeks of one-on-one instruction (2 hrs/day). The teachers, staff, and students were great. The lessons are tailored to individual or group student needs (rather than being set in a textbook). The instructors are friendly, professional, and patient. The staff does a great job making sure you feel welcome, and they organize weekly happy hours to help students get to know each other. Overall, the school made me feel comfortable in BA and was a good value for the money. I enthusaistically recommend Vamos to anyone wanting to get a start in Spanish or to develop their language skills, regardless of their level. I wish I could still be taking classes there, as my abilities have withered a bit since returning to Seattle. Hopefully I can return soon to beautiful BA, and when I do, I'll definitely return to Vamos. Thanks for everything, chicos, and sorry for this belated review!!Mike Atkins

Muy bueno!. I took 10 hours of private Spanish lessons at Vamos Spanish with Martín and Mercedes. Both were excellent teachers and I really felt like I progressed a lot after my time there.I also have to commend Ben and Jere (yes, really!) for being very friendly, helpful, and welcoming. They organize social events, class schedule and anything else to get you settled and practising Spanish outside of the school.The building itself is centrally located at the edge of Palermo and had free tea/coffee, Internet-connected machines, a nice common room with a TV and a selection of books, etc.Would highly recommend Vamos Spanish!

Great spanish school!. I spent three weeks at the school and really enjoyed everything about it.As others have pointed out,the atmosphere is really nice,friendly and personal,the management does a really good job about making you feel at home! My class was very small (we were only two students) and I had a great teacher,so I got to learn a lot quickly. Also the location in Palermo is very nice. Would highly recommend it to everyone!

Great experience at Vamos. I am a 60-something with a one-semester Spanish class back in college. Now that I'm retired and can travel, I'm spending 5 months in Agrentina. The first two months were in Buenos Aires and, after reviewing several schools I chose Vamos. I took the placement exam and ended up in just the right class. I took four weeks of group classes (four hours a day) and then after a week when family came to visit, I took two more. Now I'm ready to see the rest of Argentina and I have no doubts that I will get along very well with the language. My first question will never again be, "Do you speak English?"I had my own apartment in BA so I didn't need to use their home placement service.Every week the class size changed as people came and went. My biggest class was 6 for a week and my smallest was 3. One of the things I enjoyed most was the "extracurricular" program (the social nights, the workshops and the "what is going on in Buenos Aires this week" announcements). I even arranged a trip to Iguazu Falls over a long holiday weekend through the school.In summary, if I'm ever in BA again and need to brush up on my Spanish, Vamos is where I'll go!

Fantastic Language School. After 4 weeks at Expanish I decided to change schools. Expanish is one of BAs biggest schools and was for me a bit unpersonal, besides around 50% of the students were from Switzerland. Therefore I switched to Vamos Spanish where I spent 5 weeks, took group lessons as well as private lessons:- small, very personal school- excellent location in Palermo- excellent quality of teaching- The management is doing a great job, always asking if your happy about the classes and answering every question- easy online booking process- social program every Wednesday where not only the students but also the Management is going to- Good mixture of people from all over the world

Such a great Spanish School. The staff are friendly and very welcoming. I had tried a few schools out before Vamos but this was by far the best. Beautiful building and great location too. Would definitely recommend.

I'll Be Back. I spent 3 weeks here studying in Jan and Feb 2014, and stayed in Palermo Soho (I arranged my own accomodations) about 20 minutes walk from the school. I liked everything about the place from the teachers to the office staff. My teacher was Brenda she was amazing and the office staff (Benjamin, Ingrid and Jerry) were very welcoming and friendly and followed up on any requests I had. I did the group lessons from 9:30-1:30 and found it met my needs well. Palermo is an excellent neighborhood for restaurants, cafes and nightlife. Peter, from Canada

Great language school. I enjoyed learning spanish in Vamos very much. It has very friendly staff and all the arragements of the classes and courses were easy going. The teachers are also good, but most of them are students, with little experience in teaching, so it could be sometimes cumbersome.

Great place to study spanish!!. I spent almost 10 weeks taking spanish classes at Vamos, and highly recommend it! The staff was always extremely accommodating in making sure the classes fit my goals, and learned a tremendous amount. I can't say enough great things about the instructor I worked with, Brenda. The classes were always fun, and she was extremely knowledgeable in linguistics. The location of the school is great, and Vamos maintains the lowest prices for spanish classes I have found in BA. Loved my time there and I will be back! *Prices are high for pre-arranged accommodation. Lower cost options, but with a little less ease, can be found on craigslist, airbnb, or with hostels.

Great value...great team. Like all these language schools I have no comparison but can gladly say that Vamos was fantastic. No registration fee. Friendly staff. Great teachers who in my case was from BA. Great location.I researched other venues and these guys won hands down from reviews and price and couldn't agree more. There were 2 in my class so felt that personal touch I am sure other classes can't offer. Also being for foreigners other non-study workshops on Mate, film and drinking also proved useful to meet other students. My only issue is after a week I thought I could survive in SA!

Great place to study in BA. Highly recommended.. We spent 5 weeks at Vamos Spanish Academy in BA and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a place to learn Spanish in BA. We were complete Spanish beginners coming into the classes and felt they went at a good pace while keeping us engaged each day with a mix of writing, reading and games that encouraged conversations. We had two great teachers in our time at Vamos and extended our time at the school twice.Outside the classroom we also enjoyed the workshops which provided insights into Argentina and BA and had lots of fun on the social nights the school organised. If you're coming to BA and looking to study Spanish than Vamos is the perfect place. Also great location in Palermo!

Two months very well spent. In the time I spent at Vamos I went from having very little Spanish to holding conversations in the language with most of my Argentine friends as well as my host family. In addition to helping me achieve that goal, Vamos introduced me to scores of like-minded travellers, many of whom I hope to stay in touch with for the foreseeable future. The staff are attentive and helpful, the classes small and fast-paced and the teachers skilled and friendly. When I leave Argentina I will probably look back at the time spent here as the best investment of all made here.

Valuable Experience. I recently took 4 weeks of group classes at Vamos Spanish and I whole heartedly recommend this school to anyone.The administration and organization was excellent. I was blown away by how helpful and knowledgeable the staff were. I probably got some of my best recommendation through the school.Time in class was used efficiently and effectively. We split our time between conversations, listening activities, writing and reading. It was very easy to ask questions and get extra help when needed.The students, staff and teachers are wonderful and friendly. I found the workshops to be worthwhile and the social events a lot of fun.So I guess I had a good time :)

Great place to learn Spanish, and fun too.. Most of the reviews are in Spanish. Going to write this in English, considering you may not know any Spanish if you're looking for a Spanish school...Anyway, my fiance and I spent a month at Vamos Spanish, and it was an excellent experience. The staff and teachers are great. Small classes. And a great place to meet like minded travellers. Lot's of advice on the city as well through workshops and knowledgeable staff. Social aspect was great, at least one organized night a week with both staff and students. There is an entrance exam and you can let them know how many hours you've studied so you don't need to start from scratch (but that is an option too). Classes are full immersion, but teachers generally speak some English if you're really, really stuck. What we did was take some beginner classes at home taught in English, which provided us with a good base, and then we started in week 3 or 4 at Vamos in full immersion classes. It worked out quite well, I'd recommend doing the same if you are able to. As a complete beginner dropped into immersion classes it would definitely be tough, but certainly possible.What else...Palermo is a very nice area of Buenos Aires. Definitely recommend staying in the neighbourhood and studying at Vamos.

"Best choice". After taking classes at Vamos Spanish for almost 3 months, I can say that it was the best decision I could have made to go there. The staff and teachers are very friendly and welcoming. The academic level you will be starting from depends on a small test but especially for me it was important to take classes on the topics that I needed and wanted to learn - so classes are flexible. Learning in groups makes more fun and learning is easier but private classes definitely have some advantages, as you can go more into detail in the topics you are interested in.During the breaks one gets in touch with other students from all over the world an can share opinions and advises. Vamos Spanish also helps you to understand Buenos Aires and Argentina better. After class there are several free courses offered, helping you to e.g. understand the local accent of Buenos Aires or how to get around the city using public transportation. To sum it up - Vamos Spanish is an excellent way to study spanish as well as to learn something about the city and make new friends.

Worth It. We spent 4 weeks at Vamos and enjoyed our time immensely. We had two great teachers in that time (Daniella and Celeste) both were knowledgeable, friendly and enthusiastic. Kat and the staff are very helpful, recommending things to do and giving advice as to how to explore the city. It's a great way to make some friends and learn the languageSteve y Leonie

Excelente!. We took private lessons with Mercedes who was brilliant, so patient and generous. The course material was great and we enjoyed doing homework! A couple of complete beginners, we wanted to be able to get around, communicate in taxis, restaurants, bars and with the friendly folk of BsAs. The school offered us everything we needed. The classrooms are a little rustic but it all adds to the charm. Kat was brilliant at fitting us in, around our other plans and we couldn't recommend it highly enough.

Welcoming and exciting. Over my past 4 weeks, I have excelled far beyond what I thought I would achieve. Having learn past, present and future, I feel prepared and confident to actively (try to!) engage with the locals and will take my new skills throughout South America.

Highly recommended. The overall experience has been excellent. The school is well run, and the class is fun and engaging. I enjoy the variety of teaching methods and having a porteña to speak with. I would have preferred that the group class went faster, but ''eso lo es''. I will be back when I know more vocabulary.

Top-notch classes!. The school is in a really charming old building, but what I really liked about this place was the quality of the classes. I'm an ESL teacher so I would go so far as to say that I'm an expert on teaching foreign languages, and I was really impressed with the academic director and the materials used in the school. The academic director prepared all of the materials herself, so you're not just working page-by-page out of a textbook, and they use a lot of games, audio and video activities, and the teachers keep you interested and engaged in the class, it's not just lecture and notetaking. I took the group classes and they limit the classes to 6 people, but there were just 3 other students in my class (4 in total). I really felt that even though some of us had different strengths and weaknesses (some people could speak with greater ease, other got the grammar more quickly), we were all at the same level and needed to be working on the same topics. It was a great experience and I would definitely return.

Friendly Environment to Learn Spanish in Bs As. What can I say about Vamos? My boyfriend and I took 12 weeks of classes here in early 2013. Our goal was simple: we wanted to learn Spanish living in South America. After 3 months of 20-hours a week group classes we are now very confident in our ability to read, write, speak and, for the most part, understand (Argentines have a very peculiar accent!). The best part about Vamos, from a student point of view, is the teaching staff. Most of the teachers are University of Buenos Aires students. All of them are very bright, many study linguistics and literature, and every one is good at, well, teaching. I had 4 teachers in my 12 weeks and each one was excellent. For a few weeks I was the only student at my level so they put me into one-on-one lessons with an instructor; the teachers are great at teaching both group and private lessons. With all my time there I met more than a few students who tried out other schools and were disappointed with the teachers. Every last one of them was thrilled with the teachers here, as I was.From an academic point of view, the material is exceptionally helpful and conducive to learning. Vamos does not use a textbook; you get a looseleaf sheet for every topic. The material is assembled by the academic director who makes a specific lesson plan each week for each group. Do people in the class have issues with pronouns? imperfect vs. indicative? The teacher will focus on that topic for you, with supporting material. At a more advanced level I asked to go over the various uses of "se" in Spanish, a tricky topic. The academic director put together a lesson plan and we spent a whole day on it. Also, though I took classes in the busy summer months I never had a class with more than 4 students in it.Last, but certainly not least, the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Kat and Ingrid were life savers in many occasions, answering all the necessary beginners questions when living in a new city. They also organize weekly movies and workshops, like how to drink mate, how to spot fake money, and how to use the bus sytem, which were invaluable and interesting! Not only that, they alert you to cultural events. They informed us of a international polo match going on, which several of us went to (for the first time) and had a blast! If you're going to study Spanish in Bs As, study at Vamos. Not a single person I met who studied at Vamos and was interested in seriously learning Spanish was dissatisfied. If I wasn't moving on to another country I would still be there taking classes. It was the highlight of my 4-month experience in Argentina.

Just Awesome!. Although it was only two weeks, I thoroughly enjoyed taking Spanish classes at Vomas Spanish. The small size classroom (4-5 students in my case) encouraged the interaction between the teacher and the students, making the learning experience more personal and adapted to the needs of the individual students. The highlight for me is without a doubt the awesome administration staff. They were very attentive to the student's needs and generous with their time, which made me feel immediately at home. Overall I had a great experience and most importantly, learned a lot and wouldn't hesitate to take more classes if I would be in the area in the future. Miss you guys!

The way to learn Spanish. Yes, I could have written this review in Spanish, but since you probably want to learn it - you'd end up looking up the words. I spent two weeks and three days doing private classes here for two hours a day. It was perfect. I learned a lot about structure, which I desperately needed - and about the history of this very interesting, proud country. I only wish I had more time in Buenos Aires to learn more. Thank you, Vamos - for making my adventure well worthwhile.

A great place to learn Spanish in BsAs. I did a lot of research online for Spanish schools in Buenos Aires prior to personally visiting Vamos and eventually booking 5 weeks of lessons there. My wife and I were pretty much total beginners and five weeks later ... I won't say we're anywhere near fluent but we've made great progress definitely. We feel confident communicating, albeit not perfectly, with locals during our stay in Buenos Aires. We will be travelling for another few months in South America and can put our newfound knowledge to the test.Our teacher, Luciana, was very enthusiastic and cheerful and that made lessons fun. I think that to get the most out of the lessons (and indeed, anything in life!), you have to make an active effort in learning, and knowing what you want to achieve by the end of your study period, be it 1 week or 3 months. Communicate your goals to the study director and she can tailor your lessons accordingly. We've made good friends with our classmates and are very sad to be leaving.Kat and Ingrid who handle the non teaching admin are very helpful with everyday life in the city, from finding your way around the bus guides, to identifying fake currency, and things to do etc, they are always helpful.If you're considering studying Spanish in BsAs, definitely consider Vamos.

Best Experience!. I couldn't have asked for more. I originally intended to take 2-3 weeks of classes but ended up staying for 5! During my time at Vamos Spanish, I had 3 different instructors and each of them was terrific. Each of them was very knowledgeable, friendly, engaging and helpful.I had studied Spanish prior to my trip and opted for the private classes which were reasonably priced and tailored exactly to my needs. As an example, during class if it became clear that I was having difficulty with a specific topic, they would literally step out of class for a minute and return with materials to review and drill the specific topic. My goal was to improve my conversational skills and we spent the majority of classes speaking.The class materials were professional, helpful and fun.The office staff was also REALLY helpful and friendly. They not only helped me with issues pertaining to the school, but also helped with suggestions and assistance for activities in Bs As (not just the usual touristy things) and recommendations for travel outside of the city. They also had a daily calendar of extracurricular activities which included everything from practical informational sessions for navigating the city (how to understand the VERY complicated bus system to common tourist scams) to wine tastings, bike tours, etc...I was staying in Palermo SOHO (awesome neighborhood) so the location couldn't have been better, but it's also 2 blocks from the D line Bulnes Subte station so it's very accessible from many parts of the city. (and easy to jump on the Subte after class to get to other neighborhoods for site seeing)I would highly recommend Vamos Spanish to anyone considering Spanish lessons in Bs As.

Enjoyable learning experience for all levels and ages.. My time at Vamos Spanish was a rewarding experience, invaluable for the rest of my trip. Had I known it was going to be so wonderful I may have booked months of classes instead of only two weeks. Still, I got a good step up on the language thanks to knowledgeable teachers and interesting class styles. The staff was also very helpful, first with their after class workshops, and later when I asked for help catching a bus out of the city. Finally, I booked accommodation through the school that I thoroughly enjoyed, although I can only speak for one homestay.
This place is amazing!!!!!!!. people are nice and they have very good teachers.Also the materials are so great to learn spanish in a short term.

Somos todos peatones. The "Vamos" group offers an interesting melange of talent matched only by an equally interesting group of students. I can't speak about any teacher other than my own and the staff in general ( who were incredibly tolerant). Brenda was young, energetic and found a way to pay attention evenly in the class when it was obvious that I was the wayward child. My classmate, a beauty from Norway, didn't mind when Brenda had to coddle her oldest along the way (I could be her grandfather). My partner and I travel to Argentina almost every winter and he suggested that we take Spanish lessons. I was all up for him to do that but not me. He went ahead and made the arrangements and then let me know that I was enrolled the night we arrived in BsAs. And I am glad he did. I think I will do it again next year.

Great place to learn Spanish and get to know the REAL Buenos Aires. Teachers are energetic, carry a positive attitude, and accomodate the different learning styles of each student.
The staff at Vamos does an excellent job of providing activities and opportunities to enjoy all that Buenos Aires and Argentina has to offer!

good school. I agree the school itself is very good, the teaching techniques, materials, very friendly younger teachers, the booking process, knowledgeable advisers, the building itself, location. I was very happy to attend this school, The only reason I did not rate it full 5 is because a lot of times students attending such establishments are looking also for social aspect. Many of the students are alone in the city and hope to have more options to do things together with other students. There is a calendar of weekly seminars - usually one a week workshop of some sort - like how to prepare mate, or how to talk slang, which are very nice. There is a Argentinian movie afternoon in the school. Besides that there is event board where weekend trips are posted, or some local events with sign up sheet, but this is not heavily promoted, also many times not reasonably priced, and not many students sign up for the events. Having experience from other spanish schools I missed student life after school. In different school I had weekly "cafe social" in the evening, where students had excuse to meet for a drink or coffee and speak only Spanish. Many times students had such good experience that fiesta would continue to dance clubs :), but this also made people closer and a lot of times more weekend activities would be spend together.

Great school!. This should probably be in Spanish (I say nay, I am very much a beginner), but I can best convey my thoughts in my native tongue. My boyfriend and I took an Crash course for travelers and ended up enjoying it so much we signed up for semi-private classes the next week. Our first teacher was very patient with us, especially considering we were on different levels (challenging for any teacher). Our second teacher, Florencia, was absolutely amazing! She was very patient and often stopped her lesson to answer the myriad of questions I had for her, Castellano and cultural questions alike. I almost enjoyed learning more about their culture then the class lessons (hehe, isn't that how school always is?), but honestly it was a great way to learn with her speaking in Castellano (almost all the time) and forcing our brains to catch up and wrap our heads around what she was saying. As I said, we only had a week of classes, but I felt I made leaps and bounds for only one week. I haven't had any Spanish in over 10 years, and my boyfriend had taken a college course recently back in the US, and he said our 3-hour crash course was his entire semester of class! Also, aside from our teacher, the rest of the staff were really great! They were very helpful and accomodating and were also wonderful resources for where to eat or how to get around in Buenos Aires! Ingrid and Kat were great ambassadors for Vamos, and I would highly recommend your language learning to begin here! Also, if staying in Palermo or neighboring barrios, the location is excellent, a few blocks of the subway!

Excellent experience!. I took 20 hours of intermediate level, semi-private lessons at Vamos. It was a fantastic experience and I would highly recommend the school! The school is in an old, restored building with plenty of character. The staff were welcoming, professional, and responsive. Best of all, our teacher was fabulous! I've had lots of Spanish teachers over the years (and am myself a teacher) so believe me when I say that our teacher, Analia, was an exceptionally effective and talented teacher. She was always well-prepared with a smart, creative lesson that pushed forward our knowledge quickly. At our request, she focused primarily on conversation, but her flexible teaching style and depth of knowledge about grammar were truly impressive. Vamos also offers a variety of services (e.g. free workshops, info about organized trips/experiences) that are especially nice for folks new to BA. I'd certainly recommend this school to others... and would return again in the future!

Great school, great staff, great location. I took group classes and private one-on-one classes for five weeks each in high summer. The courses were great, the weather not so much. Thankfully, they have powerful air conditioning and the school was located close to my apartment in Palermo, which is nice because the other schools are located more towards the busy and dirty center of the city. Vamos is one of the only spanish schools near the hip neighborhood of Palermo with all the restaurants and bars and clubs. Big plus.The free afternoon workshops are great, too. They're about practical things like making/drinking mate (everybody does it here), navigating the bus system (Guia T is your friend), and talking like a local (slang words and useful phrases for getting to really know the locals, if you know what I mean). It's all in good fun and moreover the workshops really enhance your understanding of the local language and culture.But the real kicker is the staff. They're very professional, friendly and knowledgeable about the Buenos Aires and Argentina. They can help you with anything from where to buy good coffee beans in the city to what to do in, say, Bariloche in Patagonia. Just try to stump them with a question; it's well nigh impossible.Highly recommended!

Great school and teachers - small classes. If you want to learn Spanish in a relax environment, a good location and most importantly in a small class, this is your choice. The maximum class size is 6, which is much smaller than most other school. For me that was an important factor as I wanted to have the chance to speak during the classes. The admin staff is very friendly, the material used is appropriate, and the teaching method was flexible and adapted to student needs.Age range of student is 20 to 60 with the majority being late 20s (my guess anyway).I was at the school for four consecutive weeks and I got a small discount (5%).I recommend!

Vamos: Our home base in BA!. I went with a friend to Buenos Aires for the 1st time in late March-early April. We took classes at Vamos for the 2 weeks we were there and it became our home base, our anchor in a city we knew very little about. The staff was incredibly helpful in terms of helping us to navigate in the city and find fun things to do (i.e.: a gorgeous day trip to Tigre with swimming, soccer and a barbecue). My teacher was fantastic. Although I was still pretty much a beginner, we spoke in spanish pretty much the whole time which really challenged me to step up my game! The classes were small which allowed us all to get adequate attention and feedback. One more plug for Vamos...I did a stand up comedy show down in BA. They graciously posted info about the show in the school and about 10 people showed up to cheer me on in what was a memorable night. Go Vamos! I miss you already!

Want to go back! Highly recommended. Most of the class was spent practing speaking. Topics depended on what we were learning as well as the people in the class. It was a fun way to learn Spanish and make friends. If you want a lot of organized activities this won't be it. But the people in the class generally organized their own informal get togethers.

A satisfying and rewarding experience. I spent a total of five weeks at Vamos and would recommend the school to anyone. The location is excellent and the facilities more than adequate. The teaching is well structured and classes are very enjoyable. My Spanish improved significantly during my time at Vamos, particularly my confidence in speaking. The method of teaching, in using whiteboards to illustrate speaking errors, was extremely educational, and all of the teachers made the lessons very interesting.

A fun place to learn Spanish for young travelers. I keep forgetting to write this, but another friend's going to BA soon and reminded me... I was in BA visiting a friend who recently moved there. We took the group class together and it was really fun. I've had private language lessons before and I've taken French in college, where a few of us would read and talk only in French. This was a bit like that in the sense that very little English is used. The class was just me, my friend, a Brit, and a couple from Sydney. It wasn't easy and could be frustrating not to be able to speak in your native tongue (the couple seemed to struggle quite a bit with this in the beginning...). I did learn more than I expected and it was nice to start to understand and communicate with the locals. I also really liked the tours they were affiliated with - the bike graffiti tour was AWESOME. Management is pretty young and chill. They teach you the yerba mate rituals and can suggest fun bars to go out to. The building is beautiful and in a great location, not far from my friend's place in Palermo. There's also the cutest fruit stand (not a part of the school) right outside of it. I'd go back for the private lessons next time in BA.

Great Experience. Highly recommended!. I heard about Vamos from a friend of a friend. I decided to take some beginners classes when I visited BA because of his raving reviews. I'm glad I did! Not only did I learn enough spanish to get around after a week,I also got to learn about the city and the culture. I especially enjoyed the bike tours. The classes were fun and the professor was very nice. The staff were great. My friends I came with took the more intermediate classes and they all had a great experience. Gracias Vamos!

An average school. I attended the school for a couple of weeks. The school is in a nice buidling and has friendly adminsitrative and teaching staff. Whilst I enjoyed the classes, I thought more could have been acheived in the time allocated. However, the teaching was good and the teaching materials were clear. I thought that the school could possibly have had more organised activities for students in the afternoons.

Small classes (1-6 people) and awesome teachers!. I only wish I would have come here my first week in BA instead of my last! Classes are 9:30-1:30 Monday- Friday and in a great location right off Bulnes subway stop.The teachers we so patient with me and my horrible Spanish that I felt free to just go ahead and try to speak the language in class, even with errors and everything. They correct you but don't make you feel dumb, and that was awesome! By the end of the week I was so much more confident in my speaking and was speaking to people everywhere in BA, from groceries to restaurants. I had taken many years of spanish before but mainly memorized nouns and verb tenses for a test versus having a conversation. VAMOS helped me take that knowledge, build on it, and use it to learn how to speak Spanish. If you are a beginner, don't worry, they walk you through everything and really try to make you feel comfortable. You WILL do a lot of speaking, which is difficult but really the best way to learn. I'd reccomend this school to anyone in Buenos Aires, even if you only have a few weeks- you will learn so much.

Great profesoras, awesome activities and an overall excellent experience. From the first moment, Vamos Spanish made me feel quite welcome with their Monday morning breakfast and orientation. My profesora was super helpful and had a lot of patience since I am rather slow at picking up español. Even though, I thought I knew Spanish before coming here, I quickly realized upon arriving to Argentina that I didn't know 'castellano.' Within three weeks I was picking it back up again. The extra-curricular activities and workshops also helped me immensely in adapting to Argentine culture. After a month of classes here, not only had my Spanish improved but I felt much more comfortable with my decision to move here. Gracias Vamos Spanish for helping me get accustomed to my new home! Highly recommended.

Cooking with Saul. Saul was knowledgeable about Argentinian cuisine and really fun to work with. I really enjoyed learning techniques to make authentic empanadas and the dessert was to die for. Because the class was in Saul's home it felt very cozy and personal. Do yourself a favor and take this class!

Not your cookie cutter cooking class. Cooking with Saul was an amazing experience. My husband was reluctant to do a cooking class, but after the experience he was so glad he joined me. The experience was very personal from the planning ahead on what we wanted to cook, to the class and finally to the shared photos and messages after the class. We made pasta (ravioli, spaghetti cut with pasta maker and by hand) two pasta sauces and a dulce de leche dessert. Saul provided delicious homemade appetizers, great wine and wonderful conversation. I am a former teacher and really appreciated Saul's advance planning, but also his flexibility to vary off his plan if need be. I imagine that no two classes are exactly the same. If you want to take a cooking class (which I would highly recommend) while in Buenos Aires, cook with Saul at El Arte de Amasar! We love, love, loved it! Thanks, Saul. PS: I've made pasta at home with great success.

Delicioso. I went to a business trip to Buenos Aires but since this was my third trip there I didn't want to do a city tour. So I went to travelocity to find something different to do. I love cooking and bumbped into this cooking class and after reading great reviews of Saul and lots of pictures I didn't hesitate to book it. I had a blast!!!! Saul was very nice and very knowledgeable. He not only taught me the recepies but also taught me cooking techniques. The result was delicious!!!!!Thanks Saul for such wonderfull experience. Next time I go to Buenos Aires I will have to take another class with you!

Best meal of my life. My husband and I had a private cooking class with Saul in his home during our honeymoon in Argentina. I initially wanted to learn a traditional Argentinian dish (like empanadas) but ended up choosing the pasta-making class because of my husband's interest in pasta. I was more than satisfied with this choice: I learned that Argentina has a large Italian population and is a fantastic place to learn the art of Italian cooking! We made hand-made ravioli and hand-made spaghetti with two sauces: a traditional spaghetti sauce and pesto. I seriously doubt I will ever eat pasta that good in the rest of my life. My husband and I both woke up the next morning dreaming about it. We also enjoyed Argentinian Malbec and a dessert Saul had prepared in advance. Saul is clearly an expert at what he does and is making a living off his passion. My husband and I loved his cooking tips and his company (his English is quite good). He arranged for transportation for us to and from our hotel. Overall this class was one of the highlights of our trip (it is worth the price!) and we look forward to taking another class from Saul on our next trip to Buenos Aires.

Amazing experience.. I felt at home since the moment we arrived.We had a very pleasant time while cooking , learning and talking about our life experiences. Saul definitely cares about creating a custom experience for his guests and he totally did it for us. I strongly recommend El Arte de Amasar <3

Top-notch cooking. Saul is an excellent chef and knows his way around food. Saul teaches you not only how to cook Argentinean food but also various cooking techniques, from kneading to chopping to frying. The class is very hands on, so you actually try everything you learn there and then. Saul experiments with flavors and comes up with fantastic recipes. He also encourages you to try different things and understand the concepts of cooking better. He also has a very well equipped kitchen and a nice dining area. The end result was fantastic - I haven't had better empanadas ever!

Lasagna con Saul. Impecable atención! Propuesta super creativa para ir a divertirse y aprender de cocina. Un must en Buenos Aires! Excellent attention! This is a super creative proposal to have fun and learn about cooking. It is a must to go while visiting Buenos Aires!

Great experience. Top recommended. I was visiting Buenos Aires alone, and after having seen various cooking classes being offered, I thought, joining a cooking class would be more interesting than just going to a restaurant, and Saul had a lot of positive feedback, so I signed up with him, and I was not disappointed. We made Empanadas, Veal Stew and a great Dessert. Top recommended.

Personalized cooking experience brings Argentina into focus. Saul's class is completely hands-on: you will knead, chop, stir, roll and fill your own empanadas. He's an encouraging teacher and will offer gentle instruction as he reassures your own practice. Most of all, Saul is a warm, hospitable host who brings the heart of Argentine cooking to your experience. Like a painter with a palette of color, he approaches ingredients and cooking with the precision of an economist and the soul of a tango dancer. Even the snacks are homemade; from the first bite you'll know you're in the hands of a pro.

Awesome class. We were recently in Buenos Aires for vacation and I booked a cooking class with Saul. I am lactose and gluten intolerant which posed quite the challenge for Saul, but he came through with flying colors! His communication prior to our class was excellent. During the class he made us feel right at home and was a pure joy to learn from! Not only did I learn some new recipes, but a lot of new techniques that I will use daily. Thank you so much Saul! We will always remember your great class!

Wonderful cooking class. My wife and I had a wonderful cooking class with Saul. We learnt 3 brilliant dishes that we chose and really wanted to cook (not the standard menu that most places offer) - The dises were fantastic - squid ink crepes with prawns, mushroom rissotto, dulce de leche parfait. Saul is a great teacher. Saul was fantastic explaining the concepts, tricks and helping us understand the different steps / techniques. More importantly, Saul generously shared his personal experiences and we learnt alot about Argentina / Buenos Aires. We would highly recommend the cooking classes with Saul. Our only regret was that we did not have time to learn tango from Saul!We look forward to learning more dishes from Saul's repertoire on our next visit to Argentina. Thanks Saul!

A fantastic mother-daughter activity. My two daughters (8 and 10) went to Saul's Arte de Amasar for an empanada class. We had a great time and the girls are still talking about it. Saul tailor made the class so that both the girls and I had fun and learned, We made the dough from scratch and the filling of the empanadas, then we learned how to do the repulgue (closing the empandas). Almost 4 hours went by without noticing it. Saul made the girls feel at ease, they really loved the experience. They are now ready to make empandas at home! Saul will make each class different depending on who is going. Thi is what makes these classes special apart from Saul who is really personable and interesting. This is not a run of the mill impersonal class. If you are in Buenos Aires this is a great activity to do as a family or as we did a mother-daughter activity. Highly highly recommended. We had the class in Spanish but Saul speaks perfect English.

Excellent cooking class. We had a lovely evening cooking empanadas and stew with Saul. He uses the best quality ingredients and is an excellent instructor. I can't wait to practice my empanada-making when I return home! In addition to wonderful food, Saul is personable and knowledgeable and we equally enjoyed sharing the meal with him over a very nice bottle of Malbec. Overall, this experience was a highlight of our trip. Only small word of advice is to plan enough time to travel to his cooking studio (which is top-notch). Saul also gave us recommendations for local restaurants and tango spots.

Made our trip. Saul was amazing! My girlfriend and I took a cooking class from him on our first night in Buenos Aires, his lesson was incredibly educational, then after the meal he invited us to join him and his girlfriend at a Tango club. We're planning on taking more classes from him when we come back to Buenos Aires, I can't recommend him enough.

Better Call Saul, Indeed.... Full disclosure time: Saul is a friend of a friend and we met him over (a very enjoyable) dinner a few nights before we did the course. However, while that probably makes us pre-disposed to a five star, glowing review, I feel it would be the same without that degree of nepotism. In my line of work, I've done a few cookery courses and, inevitably, they're a mixed bag. Mixed ability classes often mean it's real lowest common denominator stuff - I remember one in the US where basically all I got to do was throw already prepared vegetables into a saucepan and stir them a while! - but Saul has a far better judgement when it comes to such things. This was very hands on, and Saul's patience and knowledge and calm teaching practices make this one of the best cooking classes I've attended anywhere. While empanadas were the focus, the conversation moved around baking in general, with many useful tips for all sorts of things that my wife and I regularly make at home. Four-and-a-bit hours whizzed by and we left happy, full - healthily so, Saul's speciality is lighter, healthier food, even when making typically fatty snacks such as these - and bursting with new found knowledge and enthusiasm. It's also a lovely setting in a leafy suburb of BA, that gives the impression of popping around to someone's house for lunch. Which, in effect it is: you just get to make it all yourself, under a very smart and pleasant watchful eye. Absolutely recommended.

Fabulous empanada cookery class. Saul's calm and clear teaching style made my first empanada cooking lesson fun even as I kept making classic 'rookie' errors trying to seal and finish them ready for the oven. it was a great reason to visit a quiet leafy neighbourhood of Buenos Aires that we probably would not have ventured into for any other reason. Maybe next time we'll learn how to make pizzas and tiramisu from this lovely man.

Fantastic cooking class!. We absolutely loved our cooking class! Saul gave so many helpful tips and taught techniques that we didn't know and we've been to many cooking schools! I would recommend this to anyone wanting to learn authentic Argentinian cooking. Great experience!

Cooking Class with Saul. We had an awesome time with Saul. We cooked a Veal stew, empanadas, and a Dulce de leche desert. Tastes were amazing! He was extremely nice and very helpful in teaching us how to cook. It was a wonderful experience and I would recommend it to anybody!

Good man Saul. I cannot cook to save my life and I had an enjoyable time. Saul is a man with a passion for what he does.We were in BA for a few days before we boarded our Antarctica cruise. I emailed Saul for a private lesson with my wife and I wanted to do a lasagna and empanada.Saul responded quickly and we booked our time with him a couple of weeks prior. He offered to send a car/taxi to the Hotel to pick us up, but our hotel said they could arrange a ride easily so we took that. On hindsight, Saul's ride would have been a better choice as he is located in a residential area and there were a few road constructions underway making finding our way there a wee bit difficult.I wish I wasn't so jet-lagged as it was just my 2nd day in BA. Saul spent time explaining various techniques and variations in cooking the dishes which made the lesson much more interesting. Everything was made from scratch, pasta, filling, empanada shell, the whole lot! Despite my clumsiness, Saul was encouraging and we cooked heaps! To my surprise, the empanadas were good, yes, even the ones out out of my hands..... The lasagna was very tasty too. The real test is whether well be able to reproduce this at home ; )Thanks Saul for a lovely fun evening!

El Arte De Amasar. My daughter and I spent a lovely evening with Saul who taught us the authentic ways to prepare empanadas and a hearty veal stew. Saul is a very warm and welcoming individual who immediately puts you at ease in the kitchen regardless of your culinary skill level.I would recommend this activity for anyone who would like to experience a relaxed and fun evening in an actual Argentinian home. Our experience took outside the "normal" tourist venues and created an evening we will long remember.

Saul is the BEST!. Our family of 6 spent an afternoon with Saul in his home, making empanadas, a meat stew, and a dulce de leche dessert. He quickly assessed our family dynamic, put everyone at ease, and had all of us laughing and drinking in no time. He asked about our interests and what we've already done in Buenos Aires and then quickly came up with a perfect itinerary for the rest of our time in the city to ensure we saw everything we needed to see. He even arranged a table for us at a milonga that night. We can't thank him enough for giving us a glimpse into Argentinean life and culture. Saul, if you are ever in the States, you know you have a home in Washington, DC, Chicago, or Utah! We'd love to return the hospitality.

Better Call Saul. If you want to experience real life in Buenos Aries, then book a cooking class with Saul. Saul is passionate about cooking and displayed great patience with our family of 5. We walked in with almost no cooking experience, and Saul deftly made it all seem so simple to whip up delicious food from scratch. Of our many great experiences in the city, this one was right at the top!

Good food and learning about life as a local. As a college student it was nice to learn how to cook some meals from scratch even though some were very complex. We made empanadas, pasta, and flan. My personal favourite was the pasta. It is worth noting that Saul does most of the cooking at the beginning and shows you how to do things rather than you doing all of the cooking entirely on your ownAdditionally, Saul's kitchen/apartment is very nice and well equipped for all types of cooking and he is extremely willing to answer any other questions related to cooking or about life in Argentina over the past few decades. Overall, the experience was positive, the best part was the taste of the food and the interesting discussions with Saul

Great night and fantastic food!. We booked quite late, but Saul was very accommodating to our family of 7 (all adults). Really hospitable and relaxing atmosphere. The menu was exciting and we have all cooked the dishes again at home! A lot of really useful tips and techniques and good balance between hands on vs teaching. We made yummy empanadas, a great stew and Saul's own dessert. Was great to have some time to enjoy dinner afterwards, with a good glass of Malbec! Would definitely recommend this to people visiting Buenos Aires

One of the highlights of our trip. If I could give our cooking experience more stars, I would. Our evening with Saul and Sol was so wonderful that we did not want to leave for our scheduled tango demonstration. Thank you for your gracious hospitality and an amazing evening, Saul!! Karen and Kate

Fantastic evening in BA. We visited El Arte de Amasar on our honeymoon and had an absolutely fantastic evening. Not only did we learn how to make empanadas, a skill which we will definitely be using now that we're home, but we also had a really lovely evening learning more about Buenos Aires and Argentina. Saul was incredibly welcoming and the food we enjoyed was delicious. Highly recommended!

A fabulous day for the whole family. We thoroughly enjoyed our day of 'Argentine Immersion' with Saúl. Our group of 8 consisted of 4 adults and 4 teens ranging in age from 11 to 15, one family originally from NY and one from Buenos Aires. We started the day with an hour-long tango demonstration and lesson. Learning about tango culture and trying out the basic steps was lots of fun for everyone, even those who were initially put off by the idea. We then moved to the kitchen to make a simple but delicious dessert featuring dulce de leche. Our main project was learning to make two kinds of empanadas (meat and corn) from scratch, with special attention to working the dough. The empanadas were absolutely delicious and we enjoyed them together around a large table in Saúl's bright and modern dining area. A special treat was a tasting of three different Malbecs and a discussion of Argentine wines. All in all, a great cultural and culinary experience led by a gracious and charismatic host. Highly recommended!

Better call Saul!!!. Do you want to learn how to make the most delicious three-course dinner from scratch?!Do you want to feel like a true "Porteño/a" spending a casual evening at your comfortable home in Buenos Aires?!Do you want to become friends with one of the most interesting, intelligent, talented, charming, relaxed, and welcoming chefs ever?!Well... Better call Saul!!!

A night to remember. During our recent trip to Buenos Aires my boyfriend and I had a great night at Saul's house. We learned how to cook pasta from scratch and had so much fun and terrific dinner. His place is contemporary, beautiful and very Buenos Aires. He is an excellent host and chef and made it so much fun for both of us.We would highly recommend this for anyone who is looking for something different, not your typical touristy experience . Thank you Saul!!!

Great night! Super recomended!. Last night my boyfriend and I lived an incredible expirience at Saul'sbeautiful house! We made some delicious pizzas, drunk some wine, and enjoyed a lovely evening.I trully recommend you to live this experience by yourself with friends, family or your partner! Enjoy!!!!

Beyond Expectations!. We have really enjoyed this experience. Highly recommended for those who are looking for something different and fun!We cooked our own dinner guided by Saul ( very passionate charismathic and interesting guy) The appetizer main course and dessert was just delicious!We cant wait to return and have a new experience at El Arte de Amasar.Thanks Saul!Chers!

One of a kind place to go enjoy and learn at the same time!. I went to have dinner with my boyfriend for our year anniversary. We were treated incredibly great. Saul taught us how to cook an amazing seafood meal. We felt as if we were home and even better. I really suggest people not to miss this wondeful experience.

Wonderful afternoon.. What a fantastic, informative and deliscious way to leisurely spend a few hours in Buenos Aires at "El Arte de Amasar". My daughter and I were very well taken care of in this cooking class with Saul. We learned new techniques, laughed, and ate well.Thank you so much for the great time.
Best cooking lessons!!. Coking lessons with Saul is much more than that, means a great teacher, a very nice atmosphere, tremendous food and a wonderful time!!!

One of the best kept secrets in Buenos Aires. We heard about Saul and his cooking lessons from a couple of Israeli friends that went to Buenos Aires. Our experience was simply outstanding! We thought we went to see how he cooks and afterwards eat the food. But we were surprised by the fact that Saul just explained each step and we ourselves prepared everything. We choose a "pasta night". We learn how to prepare a pasta from the best beginning, since you mix the flour and the eggs, passing through the sauce preparation ( a delicious filleto sauce) and including a superb dessert: dulce de leche parfait.Everything accompanied by excellent argentinian wines and the finalpearl: the dinner that was so tasty!We deeply recommend it!Enjoy it the way we didMarcos and Debora Israel;

To be continue! Wonderfull experience!. Saul is an excellent cook, and even when we have no skills in the kitchen, he mastered us! I'll probably take another class as soon as I have time to do so. Awesome food, wine, place. Thanks a lot!

Customized delicious local food. My boyfriend and I love cooking, and we thoroughly enjoyed learning from Saul. We were able to choose our menu the night before by browsing his website and discussing different menu choices via email. We ended up cooking a prawn salad, a terragon summer squash soup, and a meat stew made from local ingredients. The semifreddo dessert was to die for. He calls it a shot of dulche with crema and rum. After cooking, we then sat down for a delightful meal with Saul over some wine. We highly recommend this experience!

Wonderful, delicious and unique experience in Buenos Aires. I travel quite a bit and have taken cooking classes in a number of far flung cities, but no other experience compares to the wonderful evening my boyfriend and I spent at El Arte de Amasar. What set this experience apart was Saul himself and the total personalization of the class. We had a number of email exchanges to plan a menu -- modern Argentine cuisine, dishes we wouldn't experience at home -- and discussed what we wanted to get out of the experience, our experience level, etc. Once we had agreed upon a menu, Saul went out of his way to provide other helpful tips in advance of our visit (advice on changing money, securing local soccer tickets, beating rush hour traffic). He even arranged for a tango teacher to meet us before the cooking class to show us a few moves. For the cooking class, we went shopping together, picked out meat for our empanadas and stew, bought some lovely wine and then got to prepping an incredible meal. Beginning with tasty pickled eggplant, cubes of cheese and homemade bread, Saul shared core cooking techniques alongside a regionally specific lesson. The evening that unfolded was easily our favorite of our stay and we left feeling more confident in the kitchen and feeling as though we had just left a fabulous dinner party and made a new lifelong friend. Book a class! Tell your friends! The bang for the buck is beyond calculation.

beyond this world!. How is this possible? Someone has ALL excellent reviews? It sounded fishy at least. I went there with my wife and two difficult teens that think everything you do with dad is boring. They were surprised big time. First of all, Saul, our host (our friend after that night) arranged a tango class for my wife. Superb!. Then we spent about 4 hours of learning things about food, wine, desserts and life with a wonderful person like Saul. Per our conversation earlier, he made sure we discuss the right menu, dessert etc. He picked up the perfect wine for me. The price was more than reasonable. He went beyond to treat us like kings. Thank you Saul for everything!!

Amazing experience, great food, and a fun night!. Looking for a fun alternative to celebrate our Anniversary, we came across Saul's personalized class; and we definitely made the right choice!We decided for a menu beforehand, and when we arrived he already had everything ready for the class. The instructions were great, and he was very patient we our many questions. The food was deeeeeliiicious! We can't wait to recreate that guisado de ternera in our home... or the souffle... or the semi-freddo!Thank you so much for making our celebration something unforgettable!

Tasty, funny and interesting. It was totally worth it. We arranged a private class to be held after the final of a football game (the whole country is moved by such event and so we did). Saul (the cheff-teacher) was waiting for us with some delicious snacks, all from Middle East (for this ocassion). I have tried this type of food many times in my life and Saul’s recipe was as tasty as a good restaurant in Cairo or Jerusalem. Cooking a Mushroom/oyster Risotto together was fun and there were plenty of tips to cook with ease. Right away, Saul seemed as one more friend to us. With humor and charm, while drinking good wine, we cooked and laugh, we ate and celebrated our time. Thanks Saul, we’ll come back!
A great night!!. Warm and friendly, Saul delighted us with a delicious meal, good music and more than one trick for cooking!!!

Hot Pizzas!!!. Hi everybody! just wanted to share my experience at "El Arte de Amasar". I had gone once a year ago for a class and wrote a review about it. This time i went back withe the specific idea or learning how to make pizza since i knew, by reading his blog, that it was one of Saul´s, the owner, specialties. Also because its such a handy thing to have in the freezer for a quick dinner and finally because...i just love pizza ;)!The experience was wonderful. Saul was again a fun, funny, cool and full of knowledge teacher. We prepared the dough, salsa and toppings and created around 6 different pizzas that were (forgive me here if i exagerate but it felt that way , maybe the wine helped ;) the best pizzas i had ever had! the experience was great, not only the food but the whole thing, so much fun. I really recommend to try specifically the pizzas´class since i feel they are not "ordinary" pizzas and make the most out of Saul´s experience (eventhough last year´s experience was great too!)So my rating is 5 stars and trust me and treat yourself with a night at El Arte de Amasar during your trip!So, as his logo says: Better Call Saul!!! ja!Gabriel

Empanada class. My brother and I learned a lot at Saul's empanada class. We went through all of the steps from dough, sautéing, rolling and shaping the empanada. Very nice guy and speaks English very well. We will be back on our next visit to Buenos Aires.

A unique night in BA. I took my Mom while she was in Buenos Aires to visit and had a great time with Saul. We spent four hours making two different kinds of empenadas and an amazing desert that was a creation of Saul's. Buenos Aires can be an overwhelming city where the night life and the people overwhelm you. Saul's kitchen is a welcome respite where you can learn a lot about the country and the food. ,

A great & unique experience!. We chose Saul's cooking class as we loved the fact that we could choose the dishes we could make. We made soufflé, meat stew and semi fredo, all of which turned out brilliantly. Saul also provided us with copies of the recipes so we can try the dishes when we return home. Saul is a great teacher and gave us many helpful tips. He is also a very interesting person to chat to and gave us advice re travelling in Argentina. We thoroughly enjoyed our evening and would recommend to anyone looking for a personal and memorable experience!

You won't regret the experience!. I'm living alone and most of the times don't have the desire to cook for myself, just calling a delivery service or going to a restaurant nearby instead. During my visit to Buenos Aires I spent more than 4 hours cooking & eating with Saul and learned many new tricks in short time. Now I have a big desire to cook as soon as I go back home. That's why I started contacting my friends and invite them for lunch or dinner.On top of that I've enjoyed the talk and friendship of Saul so I'm looking forward for another experience with him soon. Thank you Saul for re-awakening my desires of cooking.

The best, and most unique experience we had in Buenos Aires. Saul is a chef, a great chef. but he is also a teacher, an excellent teacher! but most of all he is probably the nicest man we've met in Argentina.My wife and i came to Saul for a cooking class to learn how to make fresh pasta and ravioli. the classes takes place at his house, in a quiet Buenos Aires neighborhood. The kitchen is well equipped and spacious and fun to cook in,Saul has a lot of knowledge in cooking and he teaches it in a very calm way and with a lot of patience. we learnt all the stages of making pasta, starting with the dough, and then making the actual pasta and the sauce. and then of course eating it which is the best part!We had an excellent and romantic experience and next time in Buenos Aires we Will definitely do it again.so if you want something a little different and fun in your vacation in Argentina i highly recommend a visit to "El arte de amasar".

The best atmosphere, the best food with the best teacher!. From the moment you step into Saul's house, you feel like home. and the moment you step into the kitchen you know you came to the right place :)It was our first time we learn to make pasta, and we had the best teacher for it.We started with preparing a simple, sweet and amazing dessert - that waited for us to the end of the meal.Then we started to make the dough to our first very fresh Pasta and Ravioli.
