Saul was very friendly and kind and explained everything very clear and with alot patience.The food was delightful and the company was great. We recommend to whoever likes to cook or just want a litte unordinary food experience, to meet Saul and his art de amasar. You'd better call saul :)

Pleasant, non-touristy area culinary walking tour And cooking class. We spent a wonderful four hours with Saul on the fifth anniversary of El Arte de Amasar. We started with a walking tour of specialty culinary shops, one of the appealing features of Buenos Aires. we walked through a leafy neighborhood of beautiful homes and parks. Our class, based on our preferences, was well taught and we felt very welcome.

Something Different to do in Buenos Aires. If you fancy doing something different when you are in Buenos Aires try an afternoon with El Are Di Amassa. I don't know the difference between a rolling pin and and a saucepan,but the brilliant Saul Gerson taught me to make ravioli and tagliatelle in one afternoon.He is patient and kind, not like Gordon Ramsey and I enjoyed myself immensely. It really is a fun way to spend some time and you get to appreciate the art and pleasure that goes into the Argentinian cuisine that you have been enjoying.

Cooking Lesson in BA. I had an absolutely wonderful time on my private cooking lesson in Buenos Aires in Feb this year. I was on holiday in Argentina and wanted to learn to cook some of the foods I'd been seeing on my travels. My lesson was custom made for what I wanted to learn which was fantastic as I cook at home and didn't want to be shown the basics. Saúl was extremely knowledgeable and gave lots of detail as we cooked. He's English is perfect and all the recipes I made he had kindly translated in to English prior to my arrival so that I didn't have to write lots of notes in the lesson. One of my best memories for my holiday so thank you Saúl.

Back once again for more. And the Empenadas we made were worth it alone. Once again we returned to Saul Gerson's excellent and instructive cookery classes. It's a short trip from the centre of town but once you arrive at Saul's apartment you're in good hands and great surroundings. Saul's beautifully equipped professional kitchen has everything you need and the master is on hand to guide you through step by step from providing and preparing ingredients to the baking the finished article. Five hours just flew by and we even had time to stop three quarters of the way through for a refreshing glass of Quilmes Red. It was such fun and the best day of our trip so far. In the taxi back to our apartment we offered our driver one of the freshly baked and still warm empenadas. He gave them the local Argentine seal of approval and we look forward to making them for friends on our return to England.

One of the best experiences in Buenos Aires. My wife, son and I had a wonderful four-hour fresh pasta session yesterday with Saul in his relaxing kitchen. He is a really focused teacher with a huge amount of enthusiasm and technical knowledge. We learned loads and it was all really practical stuff that you can apply to your everyday cooking and eating. You can request any type of food you'd like to learn to cook. He treated us like guests and we will keep in touch.

so much fun, you gotta do this!. yesterday we went to my first ever cooking class with my partner and another friend, Saul was so great in teaching us every detail concerning the process of making pasta from scratch, we made pasta and ravioli, overall it was a lot of fun, we cooked, had an awesome time, and we ate our amazing recently made pasta! what else is there to do?

Great Experience. Yesterday we had a wonderful time at El Arte de Amasar, learning how to prepare "Pizza a la piedra". Saul is very welcoming and his explanations were easy to understand, giving us the necessary backgound knowledge and lots of practical advice. We had great fun preparing the dough and experimenting with various toppings - the one with Zucchini and blue cheese was the winner of the evening, absolutely delicious!The place is situated in a quiet and safe neighborhood in Buenos Aires, and is spacious and warmly decorated. Whether you would like to prepare some typical Argentinian food or any other dish, Saul will make sure that you learn a lot and have fun at the same time. Highly recommended.

Twice is better than once! :-) . I had two great cooking lessons with Saul, and one beginner's tango lesson. The first cooking class focused on Empanadas, and the second, upon request, on pasta. I am very interested in cooking, and I learnt alot during both classes. Saul is truly passionate about cooking and his profession. He also adopts the classes to fit your level of knowledge and interest. In addition to great and we'll prepared lessons, we had great conversation during cooking and the following dinner. And, of course it tured out delicious. :-) I can highly recommend these classes.

A must in Buenos. My girlfriend and I had one of the most memorable nights of our trip with Saul. Before we even met him, he was going out of his way to help us, offering us advice about Buenos Aires and Argentina. As well, he was very accommodating...we told him what we wanted to learn to cook and he prepared a recipe for something he had never taught before (which came out delicious of course).I told Saul that we were very interested in going to see a tango show or take a tango lesson. Saul went out of his way to set up a private lesson for us with a teacher at his home before the cooking class. The tango lesson was so much fun, and the teacher invited us to a milonga the next night!After dancing tango for an hour or so, my girlfriend and I had worked up an appetite so we sat down for some mate and alfajores that we would be learning to make. We got better acquainted with our host and then began to cook. Saul really wants his students to understand the technique that goes into making a successful dish, and spends time to make sure you take those lessons with you after you leave his class. We learned how to make empandas and alfajores...all came out delicious. It was a great hands-on experience, with plenty of time to practice making the food, as well as drink wine and enjoy munching on our creations afterwards. Since Saul's class I have a new appreciation for Argentinian cuisine and I will definitely call him for another when I visit Buenos Aires next time. Saul is such a warm person and he offers a very unique cooking session. Worth every peso.

Very attentive. Saul is attentive and goes above and beyond to teach you what you are most interested in learning. What's more, Saul answers questions and helps with other parts of your visit too, such as dancing classes. I would certainly recommend Saul for a cooking course. Just a small suggestion: budget plenty of time to get there/back and for the cooking.

Exellent. Honestly these classes (they were several) have really helped me in my journey as a business man and have paved the way for my future business. Saul is a great teacher and is versatile to meet your needs as a student. Whether your serious about cooking or simply want to have a good time. After a long search i can say el arte de amasar is the best thing out there in the Buenos aires area. Saul I hope we meet again very soon :)
Great experience in BA!. A fantastic way to meet a great argentine local in Saul and learn to cook some delicious local food including empanada!
Perfecta!. Ben & I were keen to learn how to cook some fantastic empanadas. Saul delivered & some - we loved it, would recommend to anyone visiting BA esp those desiring a local vibe.

Incredible experience!. Taking classes with Saul @ El Arte de Amasar is not only about the technic itself, it is also about the love and passion involved in making every single dish. He is both an incredibly talented chef and a super creative person that helps you explore and experiment with new foods and flavors. If you want to get a real glimpse of what argentine home made cooking has to offer, I highly recommend Saul's classes, which are fun and flavorful! :)

the perfect date!. when i half jokingly brought up the idea of learning how to make empanadas to my girlfriend as a great date idea while traveling through B.A., I pictured being in small quaint kitchen, in a warm environment, with fresh ingredients, music, and someone patiently showing me each step. i guess thats what Saul was thinking too!The parts I loved the most were that he makes this attainable for people on a budget.Also, no matter what skill you have, you will leave feeling like you can replicate this at home (which we already have)! lastly he absolutely loves what he's doing and it is palpable through his patience with people and quality of work. Thanks Saul!

MUY BUENO. I want to leave my comment in English so people from other places can came to this place and meet people like Saul.I went with my girlfriend and we had a great time, we eat and we have really interesting talks with Saul. I firmly recommend this place if you want to know the flavors of Argentina. Its a great opportunity to have a great time, eat incredible and know the Argentinian culture with Saul that is not only a great chef but a wonderful person too.5 stars for me. The best part is that after that great moment I went to my home knowing how to cook what I ate!

Cooking Feast. I really enjoy cooking as a hobby, and after a class with Saul I learned there is much more than meets the eye when preparing a dish. I had an amazing experience in the Arte de Amasar, where some of the secreats of cooking are revealed with Saul. I recomend, hands down, the experience for everybody.
My lesson with Saul (El Arte de Amasar). My wife and I took the class and not only was it educational but the food we produced was delicious. I would recommend these lessons to any one.

Cooking lessons in Argentina. Just want to share my experience and totally recommend "El Arte de Amasar" cooking lessons. Saul, the owner is great, amazing cook and better teacher and really fun to be around. And most of all, very generous in every sense. You can let him pick the menu or you can give him an idea of what would you like to learn, being Argentinian traditional food to old school Italian dishes (which he is great at), to more complex french dishes.You will have a great time!Hope this helps!Gabriel K

Porteño Cuisine.. It helps that Saul speaks very good English and can provide clear explanations of how to make his excellent specialties. These include many different types of empanadas, breads and custom pizzas which are all tasty and healthy. His studio kitchen is well equipped to cater to groups or couples with space to sit and savor the results of our efforts. An engaging alternate opportunity to experience local colour.

Amazing experience, a full inmersion into Argentina flavors smells and textures. Taking lessons from Saul is a great investment, you will not Just learn a recipe, you will get fullly in touch with los aromas y sabores argentinos. He rprepares a taylor made class for you needs.Worth every penny!!

Great teachers - thank you. We had a great time with Lucia and Gerry - they are very patient and relaxed us both. Would recommend for a complete beginner and you get to see a very local and authentic piece of BA.

Somehow Made Me Like Dancing. Gerry and Lucia were both great - full of energy and enthusiasm. We only scheduled an hour class because we had dinner reservations but enjoyed our time with them. We did a private class for 8 people. Affordable and they even sent us pictures afterwards with some follow-ups.
Ben, Drew, Sean, Molly, Krista and Allie

Very good, fun class and teachers. Lucia and Gerry were great instructors. We had an hour long lesson and had a lot of fun. It was mine and my girlfriends very first time doing anything tango, and we left after an hour knowing the basics and even also learned a dance move. I'm american and my girlfriend argentine, and they were able to instruct us in both spanish and english which was nice. Definitely recommend.

Group lesson, beginner, and night at Milonga. What a fantastic experience! We thoroughly enjoyed the whole night with Gerry and Lucia, who are obviously passionate about tango. They were very patient with us plodding Kiwis. The trip to the Milonga and dancing, the live band and singer, the demo dance by 2 amazing locals - absolutely priceless! Couldn't recommend highly enough - a must do even if you have 2 left feet.

The best experience in Buenos Aires. Gerry and Lucia are full of energy and enthusiasm, and they are spectacular tango teachers. Last month I traveled to Buenos Aires with my wife to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The booking for the class was very easily done by e-mail and they are very responsive. They teach at Taconeando, a local restaurant and show place. The classroom is comfortable and Gerry and Lucia make you feel at ease right away. There is an introduction to basic steps, and they take the time to correct each person and teach them the right steps. They are fun and patient. Both of them speak English, which is a plus ( I am bilingual so for me it is not such a big issue, but if you happen to speak Spanish, Lucia is a lot of fun and a potential comedian...). After the 1.5 hour class we walked to a "Milonga", a place were locals intermingle with beginners. The staff at the Milonga are very friendly, and the experienced dancers are very accommodating of the beginners. We truly enjoyed the night, and Gerry and Lucia were very attentive to the group's needs. I would certainly rate them as the best experience we had in Buenos Aires, and I would highly recommend travelers to spend at least a night with them, learning the mistery and beauty of tango. We will certainly visit them next time we go to Buenos Aires.

FANTASTIC way to experience tango in BA. Last minute my husband and I were able to squeeze into one of Lucia and Gerry's tango nights and we were so glad that we did! We had wanted to do a tango show but felt hesitant based on the reviews we had read on some of the tango shows (over priced, tacky etc) and then we ran into some fellow travels who recommended Lucia and Gerry. I emailed them right away and Lucia responded within the day letting me know of their availability. It was a great price for a fantastic experience! We had an hour long tango class starting at 9:30pm with 3 other couples in their studio before heading out to a milangre (where the locals dance tango) and the whole night was a blast! The dance lesson was just enough of a taste of tango to get excited and learn some basics

Private lesson (beginner). Extremely enjoyable class with Lucia and Gerry. Being a complete beginner they were extremely patient and very helpful and by the end of the hour I had a good understanding of many moves and understood what tango was all about.They took some great photos as well and will let me know when I can visit a Milonga which is over and above the lesson. All in all it was a pleasure meeting this amazing couple, an as an English visiting it was great to have someone who could speak English tooI can only recommend Lucia and Gerry to you!!!

Fun, friendly, fantastic tango lesson. We arranged a 1 hour private tango lesson with Lucia and Gerry. Having never danced Tango before Lucia and Gerry were quick to put us at ease. To help teach us the steps they used a combination of dancing together and individually with us which worked really well. We had so much fun; Lucia and Gerry are very friendly, fantastic dancers and great teachers! After the lesson they invited us back to watch their newly launched Gaucho show - the first of its kind in Buenos Aires - an excellent performance full of high energy entertainment! We highly recommend Lucia and Gerry to anyone looking for a true taste of Argentinean Tango and traditional Gaucho experience. Thank you!

Good Fun and Wonderful Instructors, we must go back!. My friend Malcolm and I took 5 Tango lessons from Lucia and Gerry in September, 2016. We were on a boys trip to Argentina and Brazil and felt we should at least try something cultural. Our teachers, a lovely couple with patience and tango skills. Believe me they needed the patience and lots of it. Did we make progress? I believe we did and hopefully, I will come back with my wife and have another go. In addition we spent several nights with them and some of their guests and students at the Milonga Matilde, a great evening out and an amazing orchestra. Thank you both!

A tango class adventure for the first time. Having no experience with dancing in general this was a beautiful and interesting lesson. Where else can you have a better tango lesson then in Buenos Aires? Both Lucia and Gerry are patient teachers even when you have never danced tango before! Luckely for us they explained everything in english.

An inspiring experience. I took 2 private lessons and a group lesson/milonga night out with Gerry and Lucia and it was such a fun and nice experience. Lucia and Gerry are very friendly, down to earth and at the same time attentive, professional in their teaching. The milonga was also a very great night out with a skillful orchestra and great singer. The ambiance there made you feel like you could go there every night to enjoy the music and the dancing. A few lessons were of course not enough to master the tango dancing skill, which could take years, but at least it inspired me to continue taking lessons in my own country and to come back to Buenos Aires to do more lessons and seeing more tango shows.

Great instructors!. Gerry and Lucia are the kindest people, and helped me drastically improve my form over my three lessons with them. They gave helpful feedback, and you can tell that they love what they do. I'll definitely book more private lessons when I come back to Buenos Aires!

Night to remember!. A tango lesson and tango night out with Lucia and Gerry is a must. Learned the tango within an hour. Lucia and Gerry created a relaxed, friendly and professional environment. Night out to a milonga and the orgestra was fantastic!!

Awesome Private Tango Lesson. I didn't really know what to expect but I had an random day off in Buenos Aires and what better thing to do than Tango. My email was responded to quickly and within 24 hours I was at my lesson which was within walking distance of my hotel. They are amazing teachers, and they really focused on the technical parts of the dance instead of just the foot work. I am very impressed and would highly recommend. Plus I love the pictures they took as well during the lesson.

Great value and great experience. We were two travellers in Buenos Aires who wanted to try tango while in Argentina. After searching a lot online we found reviews of Lucia & Gerry's classes and emailed to book. The group classes had finished so we had a private class but it was reasonably priced and turned out to be great value for a private lesson! Lucia & Gerry are both so friendly and speak great English and do well to make you feel comfortable in what is a very close type of dance & could be embarrassing for beginners as we were! They took photos also and sent them to us which was great to show friends/family after. If you want a one off lesson or series of lessons we can highly recommend Lucia & Gerry!

Tango class with heart. We had a wonderful beginners class with Lucía & Gerry. We decided to do a class in the spur of the moment, and they replied so quickly to my query and went out of their way to fit us in for the next day. We received such a warm welcome and they taught us some good basics, adapting the learning to our abilities. I am so glad that we did the class, it is definitely one for the bucket list. And less than a week later we received some lovely pics that Lucía took of us, as well as some tips and steps to practice. Thank you so much Lucía & Gerry for everything! If we ever come back to Buenos Aires we will be sure to look you up again.

Wow. Do it, especially if you can't dance!. We spent 5 days in Buenos Aires and this was far and away the highlight of our stay. We booked the day before on recommendation of a couple who were staying in the same hotel as us. My husband NEVER dances and when it came to it was terrified. Lucia and Gerry were amazing. Kind, patient and they made it enormous fun. All practicalities worked well and the price included the taxi between studios and club and a drink which turned out to be a bottle of wine! After the lesson they took us by taxi to a melonga (tango club) which was packed full of locals, even though it was mid-week. They had reserved a table and although we were the only students for the lesson we were joined by some of their other students which was great fun. The club was so amazing. A live band, a short exhibition dance were great. But the highlight was dancing. Lucia and Gerry make it possible to get up there with them and have a go. It was nerve racking but an amazing feeling to have done it. We have tangoed in Buenos Aires and to experience an authentic melonga and be able to take part was great. Oh and they take photos throughout the evening and email them to you afterwards which was fab.Thank you both. We will never forget our tango night!

Amazing teachers!. Had a really nice tango class with Lucia and Gerry! And they helped us out as we were filming for TV; lent us clothes and shoes and suggested a milonga to visit. Best teachers you can think of!

A wonderful introduction to this beautiful dance. I went with a group of 5 friends for a group lesson with Lucia and Gerry while in town on business for a couple of days. It was quite a last minute decision but Lucia and Gerry really went out of their way to fit us in to their schedule and we were all delighted to find ourselves in the dance studio later that same day. Right from the outset Lucia and Gerry were patient, friendly and informative and their passion for the dance form shone through. Between the 6 of us who took the lesson we had 12 left feet but our patient instructors managed to teach us a few basics of the dance to the point where we were able to navigate the dance floor without danger of hospitalising each other and with more grace than any of us have ever mustered before. The potential for awkwardness was quite high with a group of 6 english guys but Lucia and Gerry have a lovely way about them and put us all at ease and we all had a thoroughly enjoyable time and all left smiling. Added bonuses to the experience were the photos taken during the session which were sent shortly after and also the invitation to a milonga the following evening which several of us attended and were awestruck at the talent and grace of the dancers there... we even got to try out some of our newfound skills on the dancefloor! I cannot recommend Lucia and Gerry highly enough and will definitely be booking another session next time I'm in town.

Patient and helpful tango teachers. Lucia and Gerry are great instructors. They were patient and helpful for first time tango learners. We met them at a studio in San Telmo and took a 1.5 hour lesson. They taught us 3 basic steps and we had a fun time.

Awesome Dancing Classes/Photoshoot by a fun pair. Lucia and Gerry are awesome. Just like Tango, they flow as instructors. My fiance and I had so much fun during our first class that we booked them for a second class. It wasn't just about dancing. Somehow tango makes your relationship flow. They showed my fiance that he needs to learn to wait for me and showed me that I need to wait for my fiance to lead. It was amazing that this class can summarize your relationship and you end up learning how to improve your relationship as a result. Call it couples therapy with dance therapy. Plus the ease of the steps make you feel so sophisticated. We ended up dancing on the streets of Boca after our lessons. Lucia & Gerry were great. This is a must try for anyone visiting Buenes Aires or in a relationship. Much love goes out to Gerry & Lucia.

Tango Night Out Tour. Advised by a friend, a few girl friends and I signed up for the Tango Out Night Tour. The overall experience exceeded our expectations. The instructors were too kind, and their hospitality was beyond necessary! We had a great time during the class. They then took us to a milonga (night club), where they treated us to a couple of bottle of champagnes. The band playing came and introduced them as they were friends of the instructor. This was by far the best night we had in Buenos Aires – we highly recommend this tour!

Zero to tango in one hour. First time in Buenos Aires. It made sense to have a tango lesson. Spotted L&G's website. Met at a Tango house, which in itself is noteworthy. Impressively they got me progressing straight out of the blocks. And were skilled enough to work within my God-given constraints. A great experience. Would strongly recommend!

Awesome experience . My fiancé and I wanted an introduction to Tango and most importantly to visit a Tango club and understand the culture and traditions. Lucia and Gerry were brilliant. Funny, informative, professional and easy to learn from. The club experience was amazing with dancers of all levels. We got up and danced too! But no pressure to if you didn't want to. The orchestra was phenomenal and everyone so passionate. Lucia and Gerry were very generous with drinks at the club also. Definitely recommend.

Excellent intro to Tango. Lucia and Gerry were excellent and very professional. We had never tried tango, or dancing really at all and they were great at making us feel comfortable in the studio and introducing us to the world of tango. Our Spanish wasn't very good, but fortunately Gerry and Lucia speak very good English, which helped. We are going to try to take up tango when we go home, as we enjoyed our lesson when visiting Buenos Aires. Thank you so much for the lesson and showing us such a great dance. I recommend this to anyone thinking of giving tango a go in Buenos Aires.

Great Lessons for both Beginner and Intermediate Tango Dancers!. My girlfriend and I are visiting BA from Los Angeles, and we were recommended to Lucia y Gerry by a friend in LA. I am an intermediate Tango dancer; my girlfriend is a beginner. We took a total of four lessons from Lucia y Gerry and we both learned a lot! Both of us are significantly better Tango dancers now. I am very happy with their Tango lessons and recommend them wholeheartedly. The added benefit--if you do not speak Spanish--is that Lucia speaks fluent Spanish while Gerry speaks both Spanish and English very well. We were never "lost in translation" during the lessons. Very nice and friendly people and very good Tango teachers!

An authentic porteño night out. I had to convince my boyfriend to come with me since he normally hates dancing, in the end he was very happy he decided to come as it was a truly amazing night. Gerry and Lucia are so nice and friendly, they make you feel comfortable straight away, and they also make you believe that you can actually learn to dance a bit of tango in only one hour and a bit! The drinks at the Milonga after were so much fun too, locals dancing tango each in their own unique way, it's hypnotic to watch, authentic and so much better than a tango show. We met great people and are very grateful to Lucia and Gerry for an amazing night that we won't forget. It's a must do in Buenos Aires, book it now!

Tango night out with Lucia & Gerry. Absolutely amazing night with Lucia & Gerry. Luckily for me, I was the only person who booked for the night so had an hour long private dance lesson followed by an evening at a local milonga. The live music was incredible and they taught me about the tango culture and etiquette. There was an exhibition dance as well. Great experience in Buenos Aires. Highly recommended for anyone who wants to get a taste of real living culture.

Tango with Lucia and Jerry. We did so enjoy the tango evening with Lucia and Jerry. They had a first class operation. Both of them were so kind and accommodating. The evening started with a tango lesson at the dance studio in their home which was lots of fun and informative. We then went to a Milango (tango dance club) with Lucia and Jerry, along with others in our class. We had a great time watching local people dance, and Jerry was gracious enough to dance with me amid all the real tango dancers! It was also wonderful watching Lucia and Jerry dance along with all the other "real" tango dancers.  You should not miss the opportunity for a wonderful experience with Lucia, Jerry, and the tango. I hope they continue to have great success with their business. Thanks for the great memories.

Unforgettable Tango experience. I trained in dance many years ago but never tried Tango. I was initially nervous at going alone to class and to a Miloga, but there is no need to be nervous with Gerry and Lucia. They are fantastic teachers and a lovely couple who go out of their way to make the whole Tango experience really enjoyable and unforgettable. Also very organised and professional, fast email replies with clear instructions, which I found really helpful. After class on the first week they took me to a Milonga it was amazing. I went to several private,group classes and Milonga's over the following weeks, it was the most enjoyable thing I've done in years. Honestly I can not recommend Gerry and Lucia more highly, they made my trip to Buenos Aires unforgettable and introduced me to the wonderful world of Tango.

An authentic and unforgettable experience. My wife and I had a fantastic time with Gerry and Lucia. They are both fantastic and patient teachers. We learned more in our two lessons with them in BA than we had practising for months back home. We really enjoyed their lessons and the evening at a Milonga really topped everything off. An unforgettable experience.

Fun night and a local milonga. Four of us had about a 90 minute class with Gerry and Lucia who gave us the basics of tango and were patient despite our obvious dancing frailties!We then went in to a local Milonga where we had a chance to put our new skills to the test on the dance floor. Everyone else was much better but no-one minded our clumsiness or same sex couple dancing. Argentina is very progressive on such issues!We had a couple of bottles of wine, watched a band perform some passionate tango songs and watch a couple give an exhibition of fast and skilful tango.

Excellent introduction to the Tango. Lucia and Gerry were very friendly and patient. As one who hasn't danced it before, they were very encouraging and created a very friendly yet professional atmosphere.The package I did included the dance lesson as well as attending at a Tango club to experience a Milonga.If you are in Buenos Aires, I highly, highly recommend taking part in this!

Perfect introduction to Tango. Lucia and Gerry made our tango experience in BA relaxed and fun. We were pretty hopeless at Tango, but they were both very patient and great teachers. The milonga was an awesome experience and I am really glad that we experienced it with Lucia and Gerry as we wouldn’t have had the confidence to get up and have a dance without the lesson and background info about how it all works. A few days after our lesson we received some photos from the night via email which was unexpected but a great touch. Overall this was great value and a fantastic experience. I would definitely recommend it.

Expert. The two of them, work so well together and they clearly love teaching Tango. If you are an English or Spanish (and maybe othe languages) speaker, then language is not an issue. Clear, prompt instructions on how to get to the studio. Great value for money and the time invested. We will return!

Very skilled dancers and amazing instructors. My partner and me come to BA last January and signed up for some private classes with Lucia and Gerry. We were very happy about how they taught us Tango Argentino - they noticed in our first lesson that we already had some dancing experience, so they actually encouraged us to learn a lot of different moves which was very challenging and a lot fun. Like this we did not only learn the basic but could also test our skills on a few advanced moves. We had a great time and will definitely try to continue dancing tango back home.

Best Tango Lessons in Buenos Aires. I'm an absolute novice, as was my partner and Lucia and Gerry had us dancing like the pros! Well maybe not that good, but you get the picture. Not only that, it was great, great fun too, we had a wonderful evening, would definitely be back!

Very authentic and great teachers. We had a large group of Americans (most only spoke english) and they handled us very well and with patience. We got a great deal from them and the lessons were authentic and easy to follow/ learn on the spot. Though the moves look much more complex than they are in the beginning, so follow along and practice a few times and it comes easy! They take you out to a real tango club right after the lesson (our lesson was an hour and a half) and you get to dance with real Argentinians and watch some people who clearly know what they are doing. Highly recommend for a night of fun!

Tango . We were the only two students and had a great time learning the basics, which was perfect for us as beginners. We went to a Milonga after with Lucía and Gerry that was amazing. The band was phenomenal and we enjoyed watching the dancers. I would recommend Lucía and Gerry as instructors.

the best. my husband and I came to BAs to learn tango. I scouted through TA for classes and I felt that Lucía and Gerry can teach us the best. and I'm so glad I followed my instinct. they are not only good instructors but they are nice couple. they will not let you go to the next move until you get it right. they genuinely want you to learn the dance and they will help you execute it right. we communicated by email. they were fast, brief, and exact in their communication. the tango night out was a whale of experience also. we got the chance to practice what we learned on the dance floor. and the show was one of a kind. I can't wait to come back to BAs.

Wonderful experience!. Learning to tango with Lucia and Gerry was a great experience! I originally planned to do just one lesson (just to say I'd been there, done that) but had so much fun that I continued with several more classes. Lucia and Gerry are patient and perceptive teachers, and are great for people new to tango. I'd highly recommend them to anyone looking to get a taste of tango in Buenos Aires.

What a great moment !!. What a Great moment I had with Lucia and Gerry in their Studio this afternoon. They told me about the Tango and its origin, the Milonga, the attitude and the rules. They were such great teachers that i was able to "dance" without noticing it :). I loved it. Seing them dancing is just magical, the passion, the way they move is just magical. As Lucia told me dancing Tango is like 2 persons being 1. A must do on your next trip to Buenos Aires, book your private lesson with them.

Mom + 2 Tween Kids. The crowning finish to a 2-week vacation in Buenos Aires!! My 12 year old son who never danced before and my 11 year old daughter, a seasoned ballerina, plus their mama had a grand time with Lucia and Gerry, who were very instructive in a very pleasant manner. We followed this tango class with a Tango Show at the Centro Cultural Borges, after which we all agreed to take tango classes as a family.

Excellent instruction. Our private lesson with Lucia and Gerry could not have been better. They were very patient with us and never got frustrated when we struggled. Both are amazing dancers but even more so they are incredible teachers! I highly recommend to everyone, zero dance experience required.

A great class!. We took a one-hour tango class with Lucia and Gerry and it was a real highlight of our honeymoon. The class was really fun and the steps were not difficult to learn. It was also very nice that Lucia and Gerry took pictures of us and even made a video of us dancing, so we could share our great experience with family and friends afterwards. Muchas gracias!

Fantastic lesson . Three of us booked a lesson with Lucia and Gerry. Non of us are dancers and certainly hadn't ever tried the Tango before but we had a great time. We were made to feel very welcome and relaxed and the time flew by. They also recommended ( and reserved for us) a place at a local milonga. It was a fascinating experience. I can't wait to have another go!

Such a fun family experience. We had a quick visit to Buenos Aires before we got on a cruise. Learning to tango (at least a little bit) was at the top of the list. My family of four (myself, husband and two daughters -- 13 and 16) had a great private lesson as well as a group lesson with Lucia and Gerry. Such nice people, a beautiful studio. They are very patient teachers. Highly recommend this as a fun experience!

Fun to do :D. My husband and I had never been to any ballroom/tango lessons before and had no experience of the tango - Gerry and Lucia were lovely - very welcoming, patient and also gave us a great background to tango with their love and passion for the dance =) I think it's a really fun activity to do especially for couples and Argentina is the place to do this! Unfortunately we weren't there for enough days to go to the night out with them to milongas as I'm sure it would have been extremely interesting!

Step outside your comfort zone and have fun doing it!!. Though experienced ballroom dancers, we wanted to do something different in BA. This is the place to do it. Lucia and Gerry are great. They want you to have fun and to experience something other than the typical jaded tango shows most tourists go to. NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY. Argentine tango is quite different from American tango, but you will have fun learning the basics. And by all means, DO NOT miss the "Tango Night Out." It's truly a slice of Argentine life. You can see the standard things in BA, but leave room for an unforgettable experience.

Great way to feel the Argentina tango. The tango night out tour with Lucia & Gerry was great! We were a little nervous but within a minute Lucy and Gerry made as feel very comfortable. They are really nice, kind and funny. They have a lot lot lot of patience. We were just with 2 couples this evening so a lot of attention. It was a great experience. They want you to learn a few basics of the tango and make it your own. They have there own way of teaching which we liked. And having fun was also a very important thing. The milango after the lesson was a great experience. We will never had visit it by ourself. Dancing up the stage was a little scary but fun and Gerry and Lucia made sure everybody danced once at the floor. It was a great great night. And because of the pictures they made of us we have a even bigger memory of this evening.

Quality class with great teachers. I took some private classes with Lucia and Gerry recently and was very impressed with their teaching methods. I had previously taken private classes with individual instructors but I enjoyed the range of observations on my dance provided by both of them. I am not very experienced in tango and am a slow learner. Lucia and Gerry very quickly focussed in on the specific areas which were problematic for me and had endless patience in helping me understand and practice the intricacies of this wonderful dance. I would highly recommend them and their Milonga tour night for an authentic and very enjoyable experience of tango in Buenos Aires.

Great night in Buenos Aires. My husband and I participated in the "Tango Night Out" with Lucia and Gerry and had a great time! Our hope was to do something a little more participatory than just a tango show (which was fabulous, too.) The night did not disappoint. We had never taken a dance lesson in our lives, and our performance showed it, but that just increased our admiration for the art. Don't worry if you are also inexperienced, you'll have a great time! The band at the milonga was one of the best I've seen. A great, traditional night in BA!

Great fun night. No tango experience and two left feet didn't stop us from having a great time with Lucia and Gerry. They are very patient and taught a few basic steps really well. It was wonderful to put this into practice at the Milonga. Try it...you will have a ball!!

A whole lot of fun. At the age of 82 and 75 we were apprehensive about doing this. But we figured if you are in Argentina you have to give the Tango a try. We sure are glad we did. We first took a private lesson with Lucia & Garry. They were great and made us feel really comfortable. We did manage to learn a few steps. Later we met again for a class with 3 other couples and a single man. Again it was fun and we almost looked like we knew what we were doing. After the class Lucia & Garry put us in cabs and took us to a Tango Club where they bought us drinks while we sat and watched couples doing the tango. Garry and Lucia got up and gave us all a show on how it should be done. Then Garry took each of the ladies out on the floor and they did a dance. What a trip to see my partner with a big smile on her face doing the tango with the teacher. Then Lucia got up and did the same thing with the men. We left there around midnight. What a great experience. This is something everyone who visits Argentina should do.I have to add, that while we were there, Lucia took pictures of us. She then sent us the pictures on email. It was great to see them

Perfect for beginners. My brother and his wife bought me some tango lessons with Lucia and Gerry as a present. I am spending three months in Buenos Aires, so knew I had to give tango a try. I was a little apprehensive to say the least, particularly as I am here on my own, but Lucia and Gerry put me at ease and created a lovely atmosphere in the class. I did a group class which included a milonga tour, and Lucia managed to persuade me to get up and dance at the milonga (sober). The milonga tour was a genuine, authentic event, and much more worthwhile than a touristy dinner and tango show. I took a 1.5 hour private lesson after that, and managed to put together a few steps. It was a lot of fun, and I found them just the right blend between being fun and personable, but giving you input where needed.This was a perfect introduction to tango for me, and I would thoroughly recommend them to anyone looking to give it a go. The whole experience was great fun.

Give it a try, you won't forget it. We have taken many hours of classes with Lucia and Gerry and gone to the Milonga tour with them. We visit them over the last 3 years and are planning to return. Their classes have taught us the real Tango of Buenos Aires. We have had a lot of fun with them. If you visit Buenos Aires make sure you take some classes or their Milonga Tour. You will not regret it. I cannot recommend them highly enough.

great time with a wonerful couple. we had a private lesson with Lucia & Gerry, a further lesson with another couple, then we all went off to a Milonga a short stroll away. Had a Fab time with great company. The warmth & Kindness from these two with the Patience they have makes for a very memorable experience. Recommended 10/10 & 5 stars

Great evening, don't miss it!. We booked the tango night out with an hour extra for a private lesson. The group was only 6 people, because of that there was a lot of time for learning tango. We're both not good dancers. Lucia & Gerry were patient and did not mind to explain it again. The rest of the night in the club was so nice. If you wanted to dance you could, if not you could just enjoy the rest of the dancers. Thank you so much Lucia & Gerry, we loved it!!!!

An authentic Argentine Tango experience.. If you're interested in experiencing the Argentine Tango, then this is the real deal. This is your chance to learn the tango in Buenos Aires & dance with the locals in a genuine melonga dance hall - totally unmissable and all in the space of one evening!Gerry & Lucia are great tango teachers - friendly, relaxed & excellent communicators. They offer a group melonga experience and/or 1-2-1 tuition. We were one of 4 couples for our melonga evening, which is in 2 parts - the first hour is spent in their air-conditioned dance studio, learning some basic steps and the etiquette of a genuine melonga dance hall. The second part of the evening is spent in a local melonga dance-hall.It was a Monday evening, but the dance hall was packed with local people and a live band was performing. The standard of the dancing was exceptional, and we could have spent all evening just watching the locals. This was completely different to a "tango dinner show" - these were real couples of all ages dancing with genuine intimacy. Many danced with the same precision and skill as the professionals we've seen, but there was a smouldering passion between some couples that lifted their dancing to a different level.But the evening was about participating as well as spectating. One of the couples from our group were sufficiently confident to get onto the dance floor and join the locals. The rest of us were more hesitant, but Lucia & Gerry gave each of us the opportunity to partner with then so they could guide us around the floor. By the end of the evening everyone had been on the floor for at least one dance.We were also nervous that, as 2 Brits in Argentina, we might get into trouble going back to our hotel after midnight. We needn't have worried because, when each couple was ready to leave, Gerry & Lucia made sure they got safely into a taxi and the driver had clear directions with the meter running.This was a memorable evening that's given us an insight into how the tango is alive and well in the dance-halls of Buenos Aires. You really shouldn't miss this experience.

Easy going, friendly but attention to detail, and amazing local Tango Club not to be missed!. I chose the tango tour as i was a solo traveller. i was made very welcome and at ease with Gerry and Lucia .. they are both very friendly. There were another two couples so it made the evening most enjoyable. After the lesson which i found very easy to follow - though i am not the best dancer we went onto the Milongi (tango club). I recommend you do this tour more than just a lesson as you can see first hand how the argentines dance. It was a wonderful intimate club with orchestra at one point and lots of enthusiastic dancers. i cannot recommend it highly enough.

The best teachers anyone could ever ask for!!!!!!. Where do I even begin expressing my gratitude for my tango lesson with Lucia and Gerry! To provide context, leading up to my trip, my life and work has been extremely stressful. I planned a trip to Buenos Aires by myself for a few days until my friends came to join me. At first, I was hesitant to sign up for a tango lesson by myself, but figured it would not hurt to ask. Keep in mind, I've also been to many countries and cities all over the world; so the issue wasn't being by myself, and I'm actually a pretty good dancer as it is if I don't say so myself! But I have never done anything like Tango. Upon sending an email to Gerry and Lucia, they responded to within less than 24 hours. They were extremely accommodating and encouraging and so I decided to sign up as a single student for a lesson. Step one was complete!Step two: getting through the lesson! Allow me to first acknowledge that people, especially Americans, myself included generally do not have appreciation for the history of tango, the movement, style and the methodology. My goodness, not only did I learn the basics to the best of my capabilities, but with Gerry and Lucia's help, I realized that tango could be quite relaxing and therapeutic if I let it be. It was an activity that I needed at that very moment in my life, and for that I am extremely grateful. They are true professionals, but their genuine humanity and kindness transcends anything one would expect from a 1-hour tango lesson. I highly recommend this class to anyone - couples, singles, whomever...you'll want to sign up again and again, and if you're like me, you'll make sure to book your next class the second you visit Buenos Aires :-)

Fun experience, Great teachers. We'd had no experience trying the tango before, but Lucia and Gerry were patient and wonderfully helpful. Felt like we'd really accomplished something in the one-hour class and would happily do it again.

Fantastic tango teachers in Buenos Aires!. We have been dancing tango some years now and signed up for lessons with Lucia and Gerry. A great experience! Best possible teachers both for beginners and for us. We took eight lessons altogether of tango and tango wals and learned more than ever before in just two weeks! They are very kind, have great skills and patience with whatever mistakes you do.We recommand Lucia&Gerry with all our heart for anyone who Is a beginner or who want to go further in their tango life!Fantastic teachers!!!Kajsa and Berndt

Skip tango show, do this instead! . Gerry & Lucia run a great tango school. What we liked most was the chance to learn practical tango steps in the studio before heading to a melonga to try it out ourselves. At the melonga you see people of different levels, some amazing dancers but also one or two who are learning. You also see a few professional performances which are spectacular. Don't go to the tango show for a mediocre meal & vegas-style show. Go here for a real tango experience.

Great tango lesson & night out.... I was so excited about visiting Argentina to take a real tango lesson & Lucia & Gerry didn't disappoint. I took a lesson in the morning & then went back with my husband & friends for a class & night out at a Milonga. I booked last minute but they were very accommodating & managed to fit 5 of us in for the evening lesson. They were very patient & despite a mixed ability class they made us all feel welcome & went at a good pace. We then walked to the Milonga, although they did offer a cab if any of us needed one. There was a live orchestra which really added to the atmosphere! Gerry & Lucia partnered each of us which meant I got to dance at the Milonga which really was a dream come true. They also took pictures for us & have emailed them to me with a suggested music play list - a lovely touch after a great evening out! I would definitely recommend the private lessons & the night out to anyone at any ability! Thank you both for a brilliant experience!

A great dance, teached by great teachers. We had a wonderful night out with Gerry and Lucia. They are very nice people and good and patient teachers. Visiting the Milonga after the class and sipping a glass of champagne was fun. We recommend this experience to everyone visiting BsAs

The best way to enjoy tango and milonga is to participate it!. My husband and I had a 2 hours beginner class before going with Lucia and Gerry and a group of others. We expected to be the spectators in the milonga because we were clueless, but we actually danced in the milonga in the end! The best way to enjoy tango is to actually be part of it! Lucia and Gerry are great instructors in the class, and when they turned up in the milonga they turned into this amazing pair of tango dancers. Very inspiring!

A Taste of Tango. Gerry and Lucia were amazing hosts and met us in person as they ne e ded to make a change to the location of the c lass due to a localized power outage in th e studio they had reserved for the lesson. They were true professionals and made sure we all made it by cab to the new studio. My husband and I had never danced Argentine Tango and they were patient and encouraging. We had an hours lesson with an introduction to what we would experience at the Milonga, and then we were taken to a Milonga (Yira Yira)...what fun! This was a true Tango experience that was the highlight of our time in Buenos Aires. So if you want the real deal give Gerry and Lucia a call!

Totally recommended!. Spending more than 5 weeks in Buenos Aires, I decided I would try to do something with my "tango project". Having taking some lessons years ago, it kind of never got going, so for the last 5 weeks I have had 3 lessons every week. It is such a luxury me both Gerry and Lucia as teachers. They are warm and supporting all the way, and they have well thought way of teaching where they adapt to your pace and progress. Having had some bad experiences at other courses years ago, I was a bit nervous at the start. I didn't have to be. They strongly recommended to join them for milongas which I did 3 times. Even if you haven't chance to take classes, if you can join them for a milonga - do it! These milongas are not show, but a real Argentinian experience with real people dancing to live music. Now it is up to me to continue my tango travel when I come home to Norway! Sorry I couldn't take them with me!

Fantastic lesson and night out. My partner and I had a great lesson with Lucia and Gerry to learn some tango steps before heading out for a night out in one of the local Milongas. Lucia and Gerry were excellent teachers in the class and made a great effort to ensure that everyone was enjoying the night out. Thanks for the dance at the Milonga on stage as well. We highly recommend this experience if travelling to Buenos Aires to see another aspect of the great Argentinian culture. Thanks again!

Tango class. We spent a great hour-and-a-half with Lucia and Gerry who couldn't have made us more welcome. We learnt a number of moves and had time to practise our steps too. It was a fascinating insight into the tango and its rhythms. Very much recommended.

Great fun and learned a lot with Lucia and Gerry. If you are interested in a fun evening out at a milonga club after a basic immersion class to the tango, do not hesitate to sign up with Lucia and Gerry. We also opted to take one extra lesson and felt it really helped. We knew absolutely nothing before our first lesson, and we still have a long wait to Go, but Lucia and Gerry make it all a really entertaining and enriching cultural event, besides being great and patient teachers. We highly recommend them. Nola and Sal Lara. Grams98

A very memorable experience!. We arrived at this studio with no expectations! But we had the most wonderful experience and great memories of trying to learn the Tango in an authentic Argentinian studio with two very patient teachers! Lucia and Gerry have the patience of saints when they were teaching us but we still managed to learn a couple of "moves" in the hour that the class lasted.We were then taken by Lucia and Gerry in a taxi to a local milonga where we had our own table and witnessed the most incredible tango dancing by local people. The band were fantastic on the night, full of Argentinian passion! I didn't make it onto the floor but my companions did and they thoroughly enjoyed trying this amazing dance.It was a most memorable night made all the more so by the professional and easy-going way we were treated by our teachers Lucia & Gerry. I would recommend this lovely experience to everyone without a doubt!

Experience the real tango. We have been learning Tango for some years in our home town we decided to visit BsAs and take some lessons there. We found Lucia and Gerry on TripAdvisor and took some classes with them. Their classes went so well for us that we have returned to train with them 4 times in the last 3 years. Now we use what we have learned from them more than from any where else in our dancing. We also went with them to the milongas, their Tango night out tour is excellent. We highly recommend them for both experienced and beginner dancers. They will take very good care of you.

So much fun!. We couldn't leave Buenos Aires without trying our hand at the Tango and after seeing the amazing reviews here we decided to go with Lucia and Gerry. They didn't disappoint, we had never done any sort of dancing and they were very patient with us. My partner and I had lots of fun and learnt a lot about the Tango, not just the steps. Lucia took lots of photos which they emailed us along with a couple of videos for us to help with our practice. We only booked for an hour session (which was ARS$500) and when our class went for almost an hour and a half they still only charged us for an hour which was great. They both speak really good English too! If we had longer in BA we would have gone for more classes. Definitely recommend!

Totally exceeded our expectations !!. My husband and I went. My previous efforts to learn ballroom-type dance with him had not been successful but he came along to make me happy. It was unbelievable what we ended up learning and we were so proud of ourselves. In the space of a couple of hours we were doing some of the spins and leg kick things that you see professionals doing! (I forget the names tho they did tell us)Luci and Gerry are gentle, encouraging teachers who are clearly brilliant dancers. We started with a private lesson and then joined the group ( just one other couple) for another lesson, then we all went to the milonga which was amazing The band was great ( I had never seen accordions played with such passion) the people on the dance floor were impressive to watch and the evening ended with an exhibition that blew me away. Best of all my husband and I danced with the locals and did quite well. It was such fun!!!One little tip: the studio is at Balcarce 725 in the San Telmo region. When we got there we found a big locked wooden door. We buzzed the intercom and said "Lucia y Gerry" and someone came down to let us in and show us to the studio. The milonga is a four block walk from the studio.

These guys are pros!. Lucia and Gerry did an incredible job of teaching us the tango and putting us at ease. We took two fun-filled lessons and managed to get out on the dance floor. The live band and dancers at the milonga were fantastic. Gerry and Lucia took care of everything, and were so fun to be around! It was our favorite night in Buenos Aires and gave us a real feel for the city!!!

You too CAN dance!. We would never call ourselves dancers, but we knew our trip to Buenos Aires wouldn't be complete without at least trying to learn a little tango. Lucia and Gerry's excellent instruction is designed to build confidence. Plus, it's just plain fun to spend time with them! Our group of four friends signed up not only for their tango night, but for an additional private lesson as well (definitely recommended!) We were far from their star students but we couldn't have enjoyed ourselves more at the milonga. The musicians and other dancers were fantastic, and having "locals" guide us through the evening turned it into a genuine cultural experience. Lucia took lots of photos during our lessons and at the milonga, so we can treasure our tango memories for years to come.

Luccia & Gerry will have you on the dance floor!. Lucia and Gerry were so much fun. We took two lessons from them and learned a handful of steps to get us on the dance floor. The milonga they took us too was very exciting, loaded with great live musicians and fabulous tango! If you are going to Buenos Aires you must join them. Book your spot early. They are busy.

Best night in BA. We spent our last night in BA with Lucia and Gerry and it was the most fun we had. 1.5 hours is probably not enough to be comfortable dancing in the milonga, but it is fun to try once and then watch everyone else. Everything is taken care of, from the cab rides to the tables to the drinks. Definitely recommend!

Authentic milonga experience for tango beginners!!. Be sure to book early and secure your spot with these terrific teachers! Gerry and Lucia have a fabulous sense of humor -- they are welcoming, patient, and a joy to be around. The "Tango Night Out" tour includes a tango lesson followed by a trip to a local milonga. With the perfect mix of beginners and local dancers we felt like we were able to get an "authentic" milonga experience. We recommend this for any individual or couple with a passion for dance and an interest in trying something new. Fair warning - Gerry and Lucia WILL take you out on the dance floor at the milonga to strut your stuff! When in Buenos Aires...!

Lucia & Gerry are great teachers!. My boyfriend and I decided to join their Tango Night Out Tour which included an hour of class before heading out the milonga, the entry fee and drinks at the milonga. We were worried one, one hour lesson wouldn't be enough since it was our first time learning Argentine Tango so we decided to take a one hour lesson beforehand. Lucia & Gerry were very patient with us and very helpful. I loved how they made sure we felt comfortable at the milonga. They captured great photos of us at our class and also at the milonga. I wish I had more time in Buenos Aires to take more lessons with them. Their prices are also very affordable! Try at least one lesson!

Greatly improved my Tango leading. This was the 2nd time I took private lessons from them. I went solo but I know many couples take lessons from them. While dancing with Lucia, Gerry keeps a constructive eye so he can clearly provide constructive suggestions. I took 5 classes, 90 minute each, which allowed me to reinforce everything I was taught the previous day. They are fun and teach in a non threatening way. You will have a blast. Note they have moved to: BALCARCE 725, San Telmo. It is directly between the Green and Blue Subte (subway) and les than a 10 minute walk.

5 Star Experience - Great class for beginning tango dancers!. From the first email interaction, Gerry & Lucia exuded warmth and excellence. The dance studio is charming and in the heart of San Telmo. Their instruction was a perfect blend of encouragement, patience, precision and challenge. They absolutely love "tango," and their passion for this dance form is contagious. They used every minute of our private lesson and we felt we were given a firm foundation and a vision for what to work on and what to work towards. In addition to an inspirational teaching style, they took pictures of us so that we can treasure this memory. We are very grateful that we had the chance to taste a bit of tango and we could not have been in better hands!

So much fun!. My girlfriend and I met Lucia and Gerry at 6 PM on a Sunday night. They met with us for a private lesson that lasted an hour. They gave great instruction and were very detailed to make sure we understood each dance move. I would highly recommend for anyone that is coming to BA to learn Tango with Lucia and Gerry! One of the highlights of our trip.

Great local experience!. We had a great time with Gerry & Lucia. They are great teachers, have a lot of patient and made us feel great dancing Tango (even though we had no experience!). The experience at the Milonga was also amazing - we really felt we were experiencing the local culture in the best possible way.

Our Best Experience in Buenos Aires. There are many things my wife and I experienced in Buenos Aires, but this was the highlight. I have little interest in learning ballroom dancing, and mainly did the class because: 1. I knew my wife would enjoy it; 2. When in Buenos Aires ...Despite this, I loved it, and consider the class one of the best I've taken on any trip, in any country. Lucia and Gerry are the perfect blend of instructive, warm, and supportive. They're the kind of instructors you wish there had been more of when you went to school.The tango club they took us to afterward was a great experience, and they were sure to take the time to help everyone feel comfortable, confident, and successful on the dance floor.If I could give this ten stars I would!

The best night we had in Buenos Aires!. We had such a great time with Lucia and Gerry. They are wonderful instructors who clearly love the dance and love teaching it to others. We thoroughly enjoyed our lesson and, because they are such great, patient teachers, we even learned something. The lesson flew by. The experience at the molonga was unforgettable. Thank you so much for one of the best nights we had during our month long trip to South America.

A lot of fun!. Gerry was very patient teaching me the basics of Argentine tango and Lucia was great at encouraging me! They are both fabulous teachers and I'm looking forward to doing more dancing on my next trip to Buenos Aires!

amazing instructors!!. It was our first time visiting BA and of course we had to take a tango class! I emailed Lucia and Gerry via their contact info here on tripadvisor and they were prompt and detailed with their reply. After booking the class, I was so nervous because my hubby and I are not great dancers. I have two left feet and I felt like it might be awkward. However, lucia and gerry really made us comfortable! They were nice, gave us great constructive criticism, and just let us have some fun while teaching us this beautiful dance. We walked to the dance loft, and Gerry even stood outside to make sure we didn't pass their address as it can be slightly hidden. The whole experience was wonderful. Lucia and Gerry even take pictures and video along the way so that you can have some memories of the day. Can't recommend them more! We took a private lesson and the dance loft we were in was plenty spacious and had great big windows that let in the natural light. I would definitely recommend to couples who are looking to learn something new!

Perfect beginner lesson!. Couldn't have asked for any more for a taste of tango in Buenos Aires. Lucía and Gerry are delightfully friendly and got us going for our very first experience of dancing the tango. Highly recommended.

Great fun. Lucia and Gerry are great teachers who have lots of patience. It was me and my partner's first time dancing the tango ever and they were great with both of us as well as some others in the class who picked it up a bit faster. We went for their tango experience evening which included a lesson with 2 other couples before visiting a local tango club to put our moves into practice on the dance floor. The band at the club were great and we had a really fun night! Gerry is from Ireland so speaks fluent English. A drink at the tango club was included and they even took some pictures of the whole evening and sent them to us afterwards. All you need are comfy shoes for dancing!

A must-do. Amazing. Considering this? Sign up now. We've never danced together before and it was the right pace, vibe, and atmosphere. Gerry and Lucia are friendly, fun, and knowledgable, experienced teachers. Great and eclectic fellow students, too. The milonga was fantastic. We walked away ready to do it all again the next night (after being a little hesitant going into the whole evening, too).Will be insisting that all friends who travel to BsAs in the future do this (our friend did the same and bought the class for us as a gift - so glad she did)!
Taaaaaaaaaango. Great venue, lovely teachers, first class and then over to a local buenos aires tango club.We really enjoyed it. Definitely recommend it.

Great night out and learnt some tango. We did the tango experience, which includes one hour lesson then a visit to the local tango evening. There were four couples in our group and Lucia and Gerry were fantastic at demonstrating and teaching and clearly have a love for the dance. The local tango evening is great way to see how the dance is meant to be done and we even got on the dance floor ourselves at some stages. Not touristy and feel like you are getting a more authentic experience. Very highly recommend.

Tango night out. What a fabulous night! We are on our honeymoon in BA and decided to book a last minute tango class. Lucia & Jerry came back to us by email quickly and set out the programme for the evening clearly. So what does tango night involve? Well a group dance class for an hour, taxi to the milonga , entrance fee and a drink. Good value for the price we paid approx 700peso.We arrived at the class in San Telmo for a class with three other couples. All of different ages/nationalities and all beginner tango dancers. The class was great fun and L & J explained the steps and took us through some basics. They made the class fun for us and were extremely patient. We had a group camaraderie by the end of the lesson. Most of us were still two left feet by the end but we didn't care - some picked up the steps really well. That was down to ability rather than teaching. After the class it was off to the milonga (tango club) - we jumped into pre organised taxis and swiftly entered the club. Now this is not a flashy big production club. It had much more of an informal local feel which created a fantastic atmosphere. The energy from the band really made it. We sat down, had some drinks and stared in awe at the dancers. Then L & J got up to get us involved taking each of us for a dance on the floor. So much fun! Sad for the night to end - but what a memorable experience. J also ensured we got in our taxi ok all the way back to Palermo.If you do one thing in BA it's tango with L & J.

Fun night. We did the tango tour and it was so much fun. We spent the first 60-90 minutes learning to tango and then we all went to a real tango club, where we each tried our new moves. The beginners dance in the middle of the floor (ie no one can see you), so it was less pressure. The best part was the live band and there was a profession couple who danced - they were amazing. Thank you Lucia and Gerry!!

Truly therapeutical experience!!. We spent 2 wonderful weeks in Argentina visiting BA and north-western corner of the country. One of the reasons for our trip was to learn tango in the cradle of this fabulous dance while experiencing its unique aura and mystery. In our travels we visited many tango schools and had different teachers. The individual classes we had with Lucia & Gerry were unique in the sense of attention to technical detail, developing better feel and understanding for each other. Through both individual and joint instructions we felt we gained way more from those classes learning not only about our own perspective as a leader or follower but also the view of the other side.While doing that we also had some unexpected aha moments about ourselves, which made it feel very therapeutical.Lucia & Gerry were also gracious to take us to a few milongas in the evenings where we could test our skills in a real world of tango dancing.This was an unforgettable experience which we highly recommend to individuals and couples like ourselves.Ania & WojtekPoland

Very worth it . The tango lesson was both harder and more fun than I thought it would be! Lucia and Gerry are truly lovely, sweet people and that makes all the difference. As far as the lesson, my only complaint was that I felt an hour wasn't as long as I would like, particularly when the instructors have to divide their attention among a group of people. The highlight of my night was the milonga. It was a real treat to see the live band and locals dancing the "real" way. The short professional exhibition was the cherry on top-- and not tacky or touristy at all. You simply can't beat the experience for such a reasonable price.Thank you, Lucia and Gerry, for a memorable evening. Only one thing about the night left a bad taste in my mouth, but it's not something that was Lucia and Gerry's fault. There was one couple among us who seemed to care more about documenting their experience than actually enjoying it! At the milonga they would occasionally glance away from their phones, and the rest of the time they were too busy taking and editing pictures and videos, as well as catching up on social media. You came half way across the world for THAT? Why not just stay home and watch something similar on YouTube? One of the staff even came over and very politely told them that they might "miss something beautiful" if they don't look up. They nodded and smiled and proceeded to ignore his advice as soon as he walked away. Sometimes I just don't understand my species. As a tip for anyone in the future, the place we went to is NOT a tourist attraction. I think it was rude and awkward to film the locals dancing--- if you must do it, please do it discretely. Fortunately I didn't notice any nasty looks.

Highlight of Visiting Buenos Aires. This was the highlight of our time in Buenos Aires - we did the one hour lesson where we learnt a surprising amount for beginners, followed by a trip to a local milonga in San Telmo full of locals dancing. The live orchestra was incredible and the tango exhibition was just stunning. We had a go as well, both with Gerry and Lucia and by ourselves and it was so much fun. They were fantastic teachers and it was such a great way to learn and appreciate the tango. We also went to the tango show at Cafe Tortoni and this was so much better!!

Best time in BA. Truly the highlight of our vacation. With a trip filled with underwhelming travel delays and plazas this was one of the best things we did in BA. Lucia and Gerry could not be nicer people and if they can teach me to Tango they must be wizards. I laughed harder than I have laughed in a long time trying to get these moves down and at the end I have video proof that my wife and I can do some basic Tango. My only regret was not being able to take more classes. Book it, do the lesson and then go out for a nice dinner later at one of the many awesome restaurants in BA, and you will have one of the most memorable vacation days ever. Plus you will leave the lesson with two new genuine friends.

Tango classes with Lucia & Gerry. My boyfriend and I wanted to experience a milonga and have a tango class whilst in BA for a week. We picked Lucia and Gerry's classes based on the reviews on tripadviser and we are so glad we did! We are both beginners (and not natural dancers by any means!) but Lucia and Gerry spent lots of time with each of us patiently helping us learn the steps. They made the class great fun and took photos for us. After the class, we went to a milonga with a fantastic live band and Lucia and Gerry each took us one at a time to dance. We then had the confidence to dance on the milonga floor together ourselves. The whole experience was brilliant and we highly recommend it to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

Incredible experience. We decided to have a tango night out with Lucia and Gerry based on TA reviews, and all the positive comments are absolutely accurate. From the very first email exchange a few days before the lesson, Lucia and Gerry were helpful and generous. Gerry was waiting for us on the curb to welcome us when our taxi pulled up to their studio in San Telmo (the studio is in a charming traditional building). The one-hour lesson was wonderful. There were five people in total, so Lucia and Gerry had plenty of time to spend with each of us. The teaching was patient, thoughtful and lots of fun. Afterwards we went to an amazing milonga (taxi and drinks were included) and Lucia and Gerry took each of us up to dance. The live band was incredible. It was a fabulous night; I cannot recommend Lucia and Gerry enough.

Really neat experience and great people. My wife and I learned much more than we thought we would on tango, and the night was a blast! They take you to a tango club after the dance lesson and you really get a raw experience! Its a must do if you go to BA!

Tailor Made, Fun Classes. Lucia and Gerry were really great. Patient, fun, and easily adaptable, they can adapt to any learner's speed. In two classes, I had a few basic steps down -- no mean feat given I'm not exactly Gene Kelly. An added bonus is that these folks truly care about tango, and are generous with sharing the cultural aspects and origin of the wonderful dance style.Highly recommended is their tango tour, a class followed by a visit to a truly charming milonga. Do yourself a favour and book a class with them. You won't regret it.

Personal Tango lesson for our group. What an amazing night it turned out to be. We were 5 couples yet got personal attention which was appreciated by all. The finale of the night was at the Milonga for us to try out what we learned. It was just pure joy to get an authentic experience and to see people of all ages so engrossed in the dance. Lucia and Gerry really enjoy teaching and it shows. Further, they accommodated our request to give us a lesson and take us to a Milonga on a night when this is not part of the schedule, so thank you very much. Our friends and we highly recommend them.

Superb Tango classes / Great people. We booked classes with Lucia & Gerry on our honeymoon as we wanted to learn Tango (where else to go than BA?) and we certainly were happy with our choice. Having danced Salsa for a long time, it took quite a bit of tweaking to get us in the right direction but they did so in a relaxed atmosphere and showed us the Milonga sights afterwards on teh "Tango Night Out". Highly recommended!

Great Tango experience. Thoroughly enjoyed our experience with Lucia and Gerry. Excellent and prompt communication via email, patient and clear with instruction during the class. Answered all questions about tango and buenos aires in general well and provided an excellent evening out in the Milonga. For a more authentic tango experience this is the one to beat. Be prepared to take the floor!

"Tango Night Out" - great fun!. We had a great evening in Buenos Aires. The one hour introduction into Tango and the following Milonga was so much fun - it's just a "must do" in BsAs! Thanks Lucia & Gerry!

Tango Night Out - Did not disappoint. I booked this after reading reviews and didn't really research anything else. Luckily, I didn't need to. Lucia and Gerry provided a wonderful experience. Our class had every level of dancer, including my girlfriend and me who had never danced or really experienced tango before. I'm also not much of a dancer, but Lucia and Gerry made me feel incredibly comfortable and I REALLY enjoyed the evening. They both speak great English and were really easy to deal with. I really couldn't imagine a better experience. All of the reviews are true and this is definitely worth doing when in BA. An added bonus; we saw the milonga we visited in the airplane magazine on our flight back. We were mindlessly flipping through and recognized the band that played during our Tang Night Out. Don't see a show; experience the tango with Lucia and Gerry.

Great tango class in Buenos Aires. We had a really nice evening in Buenos Aires. We took a tango class with Lucia & Gerry. They showed us how to do the basic steps, tried to comfort everyone in class, respected everyone's own pace. There are really passionate about tango which makes the class a unique experience!After the class, they took us to a Milonga where we could admire real professionals and people spending a nice Saturday evening. We could even put what we learned into practice.

Tango evening with Lucia & Gerry in BA! . My friend and I had such an enjoyable evening with our Tango hosts Lucia and Gerry whilst in BA. Started off with a Tango lesson in a beautiful dance studio, as Lucia and Gerry guided us through the basic steps. After an hour of lessons we went to a local Tango club to enjoy live music and watch other Tango performers whilst enjoying a Malbec or two and an empanada.Throughout the tour both Lucia and Gerry were very hospitable, friendly and made sure you were enjoying yourself and were very accommodating. They took fabulous photos of the evening which were sent through the next day. A lovely keepsake. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting BA.
