It was great way to immerse ourselves in the culture of Argentina.

Fantastic evening out! . My partner and I had a 2hr private lesson followed by the milonga night out. At first we were a little unsure because we (myself more then my partner) had no experience with dancing but Lucia and Gerry's relaxed attitude and great personalities made it a fun filled evening. The milonga had a brilliant live orchestra and the professional tango exhibition was amazing. Lucia and Gerry made sure we were well looked after and sorted a taxi for us for our ride home. Highly recommended and a must do in BA. Thanks again Lucia and Gerry. Dave and Tess.

A very interesting learning. I came on my first tango classes with a little bit of concern because I'm not a dancer and I cannot move like one.So I was very skeptical that I'm going to learn any moves.Turn out after 1 hour and a half that I was not exactly right about me and they could teach me more than I could expect. The place is close enough to the center, close to subway station.I also received recommendation from them about a tango store from where I could by some shoes.Many thanks Lucia and Gerry and hope to see you soon !

Tango in Buenos Aires. Stuck in BA for a few months due to a stolen passport, we decided to indulge ourselves in tango classes! The both of us not very graceful creatures, we weren't feeling terribly confident however Lucia and Jerry really made it light hearted and fun! A very professional couple who are dedicated to ensuring you learn to tango (to the best of your own personal limitations). If I was in BA I would definitely give them a call,the milonga that they take you to is just a wonderful evening of Argentine tango, the tango symphony is sensational!

A must when in Buenos Aires. All the local people of Buenos Aires will say they do not know how to Tango but I believe that it is a must when in this dynamic city! Gerry and Lucinda make you feel comfortable and like you really can dance the tango from the moment you arrive! They are sooooo friendly, encouraging, engaging, attentive, etcetc!! We participated in the Wednesday class where we went to the Milonga afterwards which makes the experience complete. You will not be disappointed if you participate in a tango class with Gerry and Lucinda when traveling through BA.

Terrific evening. Both Gerry and Lucia and wonderful instructors and made the four of us enjoy the evening from beginning to end. The milonga after the lesson is exceptional and a great time was had by all - greatly recommend!

Excellent. Highly recommend . Lovely teachers. Very patient and made you feel like you could dance very well. The studio was in an amazing historic building. But the best part was the local club after. Where people of all standards were dancing. The live band was amazing!!!!

Great people, great experience. I led a group of 25 business school students to Buenos Aires as part of an orientation trip. We decided to do a group tango lesson with Lucia and Gerry to mix it up a bit. I could not have been happier with the experience. Lucia and Gerry are amazing dancers and incredibly kind and funny people. We had a wonderful time learning the basics and joking around with each other. We even went to a milonga as part of the lesson. (Watching Lucia and Gerry on the dance floor was one of the highlights!)Lucia and Gerry really went above and beyond for our unique group, which is indicative of who they are and the business they run. If you're at all interested in taking a tango lesson, do it with Lucia and Gerry!

Tango night . We had a great evening!! You learn the basic moves of a very professional couple and it's just perfect. They respect you. Meanwhile they take pictures so that's nice too have afterwards! Afterwards in the milonga they made it so comfortable, with wine and empanadas. We had seats on the first line to see the live orchestra, what's impressive. They gave us information how we get to the airport,.. and they told us how to get to Luna Park for the world Championship, also an amazing experience! Thanks a lot for this experience! This is worth it!! Lieven & jolijn

Argentine Tango Experience Like No Other - Well Worth the Price!. Lucia and Gerry managed to create a great atmosphere both inside and outside the class setting. We took a private class prior to the tango experience package and were introduced to the basics. Gerry and Lucia worked great together and complemented each other perfectly as the night progressed. After the lesson, we took cabs to Melonga (the cab, the entrance fee and the drinks were already included in the price!). The live band and several professional couples at the Melonga really made the unforgettable tango experience. The next day, G+L even sent us the pictures of the entire night and tons of useful resources to continue with our effort to learn tango. Highly recommended!

My First Trip Advisor Review. The REASON I decided to write my first review on tripadvisor was because of Gerry & Lucia. They are so patient, kind, and very knowledgable. My wife and I decided to wine taste before our 9pm class with Lucia and Gerry. After wine tasting, we decided to take a nap before our class and well... we overslept and woke up at 9pm. Still, Gerry emailed me and insisted that we show up. We didn't get there til 9:45pm. They did a 15-minute power session and took us to a Milonga (tango club). But the shocking part was, even though it was completely our fault for arriving late, without asking- they insisted on us returning the next day for a one-hour FREE private class; they wanted us to get a full session- since we showed up late. We couldn't believe their kindness. Such a great couple, such an awesome night. The Milonga club was so cool, and we were able to dance tango with them in front of the live band, even after the 15-minute power session. To spend time with Lucia & Gerry is a MUST if you plan on visiting this wonderful city.

An unforgettable evening!. We LOVED our evening with Lucia and Gerry!! They put us at our ease straight away and we learned a lot more than we expected to in our lesson and had lots of fun too!After the lesson we went to a local milonga (tango club). This was really amazing! We got to really get a feel of local tango in BA. There was a live orchestra (who were fantastic!), lots of local people dancing and at the end some professional dancers arrived to perform (also amazing!) Also Gerry and Lucia took us up to dance during the night and encouraged us to dance ourselves.We had a fantastic time on our night out with Gerry and Lucia and would highly recommend this to anyone looking to get a real feel for tango in Buenos Aires!!

A must in buenos aires . Wonderful instructors , easy to follow and VERY patient. They somehow managed to teach two very uncoordinated people how to tango. We highly recommend Gerry & Lucia to anyone visiting Buenos Aires. In spite of our lack of experience and coordination on the dance floor this was a highlight of our trip.

So much fun we went back for more!!. Our adult children gave us a private tango lesson as a gift with Gerry and Lucia. Gerry and Lucia are fun, patient, and really good teachers. They helped us laugh at our "left feet" and by the time we left the first 90 minute lesson, we actually had learned several different tango steps. We liked it so much that we signed up for Gerry and Lucia's Tango Night Out. There was 1 other younger couple with us for the hour lesson that came with the Tango Night Out, then we hopped in a cab and went to Maldita Malonga in Buenos Aires. This Milonga had a live tango band, a variety of levels of dancers on the dance floor, and later in the evening, a professional dance couple. Gerry and Lucia each took us out for a dance at the Milonga; Lucia took lots of photos from both lessons which will make lasting memories. Everyone wants to Tango while in Buenos Aires; take a class with Gerry and Lucia. You'll be glad you did.

One of our favorite experiences in Argentina!. Who doesn't want to try Tango in Argentina?! We booked a Tango Night Out with Gerry and Lucia and weren't disappointed. We arrived at the hotel where the lessons took place with a small group of six total. Lucia and Gerry are patient, kind and fun-loving, making our hour lesson fun and a good introduction for the rest of the evening. We followed up by heading to their local Milonga in San Telmo. This was truly the highlight! A full orchestra performed while the locals took turns on the dance floor. What an incredible sight to see! We felt like we were a part of this exclusive club and wonderful dance community. We had a reserved table and enjoyed champagne and very good empanadas. Gerry and Lucia took turns guiding each of us around the dancefloor. The evening lasted well into the morning as a local professional couple gave a brief tango showcase. We left around 2:30 am knowing we had experienced something really special. Not just to learn more about Tango, but to feel how the Tango community keeps this tradition alive. What a treat to spend the evening with Lucia and Gerry!

A Must Do in Buenos Aires. I spent some time in Buenos Aires recently and was looking to really get a feel for the culture and the city. Naturally an introduction to the tango is as essential part of this experience and I couldn't have picked better people to show me the way than Lucia and Gerry. I did the Tango Night Out and liked it so much that I signed up for another private lesson later in the week. They are both extremely knowledgeable and friendly and will put you at ease right away. I enjoyed both the quality of the lessons and the time I spent at the milonga with them to test my new found tango skills was probably the best night that I had while I was in Argentina. I highly recommend taking a tango lesson with Lucia and Gerry if you have the time. I promise it is an experience you will not regret. An absolute must do in Buenos Aires.

Fantastic, easy-to-follow and FUN!. It was our first trip to Argentina and the number thing that I wanted to do was take a tango class (when in Rome, right?). My husband was not crazy about the idea but ended up giving in and came along with me, grumbling the whole way of course.The studio is upstairs, flooded with natural sunlight and mirrors on one side so you could always see your steps (although my eyes were usually on my feet) - a perfect setting. Jerry and Lucía made learning the steps for complete beginners extremely easy to understand, and by the end of the class we had done more than just laughing our way through it - we'd learnt a routine! With a little more at-home practice, I would feel confident going out and knowing a few basic steps. Even my husband, who refuses to ever dance, enjoyed himself thoroughly. Jerry and Lucía are definitely great teachers, making the class fun and well as informative, and also were a wealth of information for all things Buenos Aires. Truly the highlight of our stay while we were there!

Very kind and friendly teachers. Went here with my big family of 3 generations. There were 1 older couples, 2 younger couples, and 3 kids of 3 - 7 - 9 years. The 3 year-old did not enjoy the dancing, but she enjoyed watching. Gerry and Lucia were very attentive and caring. We can feel that even for only 1 introductory session. Taking Tango class when visiting Argentine is a must, it is the memory that lasts.

Great Introduction to Tango. Lucia and Gerry introduced me to tango in two friendly and incredibly helpful private lessons (and a milonga, which they kindly invited me to the night of my first lesson). They taught several steps, with a focus on proper form and explanations of the how and why throughout. I would highly recommend them for beginners like myself, who are interested in exploring how much fun tango can be. If you can, definitely go for the tango night out with the milonga!

Tango the night away- A must do in Buenos Aires!. My husband and I booked this class as a fun activity for us to do, and really try out tango instead of just watching it. Lucia & Gerry are absolutely amazing, funny and very talented. After a great time learning basic tango steps, they took us to a night bar for Milonga. We both despite being in our early 30s would not have been able to find this place on our own. It was amazing to see locals do tango and musicians play live band. We also got a chance to see some other experts perform and do exhibition on the dance floor which was no less than a tango show. Well worth the money, and what a fun way to learn the culture and dance. Lucia & Gerry also took many pics and videos of us dancing together which makes for an amazing memory. Thank you for making our evening so special.

Great time in Argentina - Tango Class. This was a wonderful introduction to Tango by dedicated instructors. They made the class both instructional and fun at a very reasonable price. I hope to see them again someday and take more advanced classes! I recommend highly.

Great tango class for first-timers!. My wife and I joined Lucia and Gerry for a tango class on a Sunday night in BA. The class is hosted at a non-descript building in San Telmo, which we almost missed, but once we found it Lucia came warmly down to meet us. The class lasted well past the hour allotted (90+ minutes), and throughout Lucia and Gerry effortlessly mixed demonstrating to us the basics with walking us through the steps. By the end of the class we had 3-4 solid “moves” to get us started. Further, we then took those moves right to the dance floor, as they brought us to a local milonga where there is nightly tango. The live band was fantastic, and we were able to further pick up some moves from the locals and others who were dancing throughout the night. Though my wife and I were a bit challenged to put all those moves we had just developed into practice when the lights came on, we enjoyed the chance to both try it out ourselves and sit back and watch the masters. A great night for sure, and would recommend it to others as an accessible way to try out tango.

Take Your First Tango Steps Here !. We booked these classes having read the reviews on Trip Advisor and we had a great evening.There were 4 of us (2 couples) and Lucia and Gerry were great teachers, providing a good mix of theory and practice. The style you will learn is the 'informal' style so not like you will see on "Strictly" which is more formal. It was great to see Lucia and Gerry do their demos as this gave an idea of how things should be done properly!The lesson was just over an hour and whilst you learn a lot, it's not really enough to feel confident in a Milonga. In fact, if you wish to dance at a Milonga or feel confident yourself, you will need to be realistic and book yourself a few lessons first!Having said that, it's a great introduction and going to the Milonga was a real bonus. Whilst we wanted to have fun and we did, it was still quite intense and scary seeing the locals sway and glide so easily around the floor and then try to recall what we had learned an hour before! This is probably more to do with our personalities than the teaching! There was a 5-piece orchestra, live singer, tango exhibition, and much theatrics generally allround .... fabulous!Lucia and Gerry have a great connection to each other and to the dance - you will be looked after very well. They also organised photos of the dance lesson and the Milonga so you can focus on learning and having fun and not worry about taking snaps!Our only criticism was of the last minute venue change, luckily we had email access. The venue was changed from a central location to a less central area (Tacuari). This was due to unforeseen circumstances beyond their control - it would have been great to have stayed in a more central area.If you are looking for a safe and fun way to experience Tango and a Milonga then look no further, we would definitely recommend Lucia and Gerry to you!
best tango class. Lucia and Gary helped me to organise a surprice birthday present for my friend -a tango class.Everything was organised perfect.I recomned their lessons from my heart.Thank you!

Great fun and great teachers. I surprised my girlfriend with the Tango Night Out and it was excellent. It starts in a mirrored classroom, 4 couples none of whom had any prior experience. Gerry and Lucia are very friendly and relaxed everyone straight away. We went through some basic steps whilst they used their easy to understand teaching techniques on us, occasionally jumping in to demonstrate with individuals. in an hour or so i think it'd be hard to nail this dance :) but by the end of the class we were all at least confident enough to try our hand once in the Milonga. The Milonga was in an atmospheric room with some real professionals there, mixed with begginers just like us. There was no stigma to us being there or partaking. Nice wine and beer was provided by Gerry and Lucia and a great band and singer played. We all had a go dancing with either Gerry or Lucia. And some of us went up as couples too, great fun even if we didn't have the moves down just yet!Gerry and Lucia took lots of photos throughout the eve and sent them all to us on an email which was a great touch. Thanks guys for a brilliant evening and keep sharing your love of the dance!Ben

The Icing on the Cake on our BA visit. I planned a Night of Tango as a surprise for my parents during our 4 days in BA. They were clueless until we walked into the room and lessons were going on. My mom's eyes lit up, while my dad had to make an effort to put on a happy face but was soon enjoying himself as he and my mom learned the basics. Gerry and Lucia have perfected this evening in demonstration as well as instruction and time for practice. But the visit at the milongue really helps to enhance the experience. No need to shop around... Take lessons with the best!

Lovely tango class in Buenos Aires. I came across Lucia and Gerry here on Tripadvisor. I took a private 1.5hr lesson with both of them where I would basically dance with Gerry and Lucia would correct my steps and both would give me feedback..it was very good and useful! I hope to return in a year or two and stay in the city for a month. Would go to them again!Muchas gracias!

"The" BA experience . Gerry and Lucia are clearly passionate about tango. They made learning fun and It was not intimating at all. They were very patient (and I natively dance like a total white guy). The lessons are in an older house that is now a hostel. It was a little hot and not air conditioned, kind of small, a bit rough around the edges. We both were a bit sweaty. All in all, it was the perfect place to dance the tango. I wouldn't have wanted it any other way!We did private lessons and the group night out too. The milonga we went to was a place we would have never have gone to. It was full of locals. Awesome experience.

a fun experience!. Our trip to Argentina was definitely packed with lots of traveling, sites to see, and amazing restaurants. It truly felt complete by taking a tango class with Lucia and Gerry! Our days were pretty busy, but my boyfriend and I did a 1.5 hour lesson with them. Gerry and Lucia are so patient and kind. They showed us the basic steps and practiced with us individually and together. They even took photos and video of us. It was totally worth the experience!

A night to remember !!. On our recent visit to Buenos Aires our daughter surprised us with a dance lesson with Gerry and Lucia! They were most welcoming and gracious in making us feel comfortable and excited about learning the tango . Professional , friendly , and attentive in every detail of the night. They escorted us to a Melange club after the class to introduce the flavor and culture of the dance to foreigners..Gerry even danced me around the floor among the many seasoned dancers. With his strong lead I thoroughly enjoyed! He hailed a cab for us at the end of our night..a thoughtful detail. I highly recommend them if you want an experience of tango no matter if you've never danced a step of this dance before..a memorable evening! Thank you Gerry and Lucia!! Shelley W

quite enjoyable, personable. Lucia and Gerry couldn't have been more helpful. We loved our tango lesson experience with them in their beautiful city. A lovely couple ready to please and quite patient.

It is not Argentina without the tango.... We were planning to include a tango lesson (or more) into our trip to Buenos Aires - and my wife, who was in charge for this part of the programs, decided to go with Lucia and Gerry.Although we do some ball room dancing at home, the "real feel" of the original Argentine Tango you can get only at the source. In all our travels we firmly believe in the principle of exploring what the locals do best; e.g. order pasta in Italy, not in America, and eat seefood in Atlantic Canada, not in a landlocked space... etc.We agreed on a package that included one private lesson, a group lesson and a trip to a milonga (transport, admission and drinks included) - in this way they offered even some discount on the private lesson's price. Lucia and Gerry are great and patient teachers and take away the mystery of the "fancy" tango moves and steps. Everything seems simple and easy to understand... although they give you the fair warning that every one hour lesson with the instructors should be topped up with ten hours of practice. (But we already knew that from our ballroom experience.)We enjoyed every minute of the lessons, both when in private and and with the quite small group. Probably, not ready yet for a competition dancing but we definitely learned the basics :)The outing to the Bendita/Maldita Milonga was a very pleasant surprise: the orchestra was excellent and Lucia and Gerry took care of the beginners' biggest fear as well - they took us out there on the dance floor, busting our confidence to be able to stand up and dance on our own as well!(the friendly chat with Gerry in the cab on our way to the milonga was just the icing on the cake: exchanging our views about the state of affairs in the world resulted in a nice bonding)Summary: Don't miss this opportunity to learn tango in Buenos Aires!

Fantastic!. This is a long over due review! Learning tango in buenos aires has been on my bucket list for 14 years and I'm really glad that Lucia and Gerry help check it off with 5 stars! I found them on trip advisor and did the Tango night out with them. You get a 1hour lesson to learn the absolute basics of Tango - walking! I had to go back for more lessons. I spent around 5 hours with them during the time that I was in Buenos Aires. They are an awesome pair: very professional, they explained everything so clearly and focuses on techniques. They kept it fun, honest, to the point and extremely encouraging when I screw up and got frustrated with myself. They helped ignite my passion for dance and I've made Tango my artistic focus for this year. I've been dancing for the last 3 months and can't wait to go back and see them soon. Don't look anywhere else. This is the pair that you want to go to for an enjoyable Tango class.

I can't imagine any other Tango teachers in Buenos Aires. I found Lucia and Gerry on Trip Advisor and they were simply FABULOUS!! Everything about them. First of all, they are the most patient, positive teachers. They are expert dancers, but understand the frustration of the beginning student. I took 5 lessons with them and only wish I had the time for more. Their studio in a charming hotel was just lovely. They took me to what had to be the best milonga in BA twice and it was such a treat. They are well know in the tango community and you feel special just being with them. Iguazu Falls were spectacular...Lucia and Jerry were equally. Moe in Cincinnati

Great teachers. Not being a dancer myself (and that's an understatement…) I absolutely loved this evening with Lucia and Gerry. We had a private lesson first. They were great. Make you feel very relaxed straight away. And have a great deal of patience. And they very wisely made me take of my shoes ;) we both really enjoyed the dance class. Afterwards we visited a Milonga. Again very enjoyable. great to see all the locals just dancing and enjoying themselves. And you can participate if you're up for it. It's an experience I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Add tango to your trip. So, you are on a short trip to Buenos Aires and would like to learn to dance Argentine tango? Lucia and Gerry are the perfect tango hosts. Fluent in English, honest and charming, with a flair for making the task of learning tango really accessible, Lucia and Gerry are perfect teachers, taking the stress out of tango. Another massive benefit, never to be underestimated, is the way that they take care of you during your visit - milongas, shopping and the little problems that can crop up if you don't speak Castillano. It is like having two special and supportive friends in Buenos Aires. Highly recommended!

Intention!. Gerry y Lucia are just such skilled teacher. They have a sharp focus, instructional clarity and lovely sense of humour. They shaped our two left feet stumbles into something that seemed like -- or could seem like with a bit of practice - grace. We had so much fun with our 6-person group we went back for a private lesson later in our trip. Mucha gracias.

Fun tango night out. Lucia and Gerry make learning tango fun and accessible. We spent an hour or so learning the basics in their studio, then went off to a milonga to put what we'd learnt into practice.They are great teachers - very patient and practical - and we managed to 'master' a few moves in a very short time. The milonga was great - very down to earth and relaxed, which gave us the confidence to get out on the dance-floor and have a twirl. Great fun and an experience not to be missed in BsAs.

Tango Night Out was an amazing experience!. Lucia and Gerry taught me and my boyfriend in just 1 hr how amazing the tango is and confident enough to even dance the tango in a milonga the same night! This experience is surely one you can't miss. The two work so well together and it is wonderful that they dance with you so you can feel and know what you should be doing.

Tango ..listen feel and move.. Lucia and Gerry made our tango lessons exciting and gave us a spirit of being able to learn the tango and actually go out and dance at a milonga. Patient and watchful they truly have a passion and desire to teach everyone that is blessed to take lessons from them. Make this a stop in your travels. Tango night out is entertaining and breathtaking.

Wonderful intro to tango!. We had the pleasure of going to Lucia and Gerry's tango class last week as part of Tango Night Out -- couldn't recommend it more! We were three women who had never danced the tango, and they made it so accessible and fun! We couldn't believe that within 10-15 minutes we were actually doing real steps! They went out of their way to bring in a solo male dancer so we would have a partner to work with (the others in the group were couples). After an hour or so of dancing we were off to a milonga in San telmo, worth visiting on its own! The "maldita milonga" had an amazing live tango orchestra with 4 accordions and 3 violins and an amazing singer. We got to listen and watch the tango experts on the floor...and dance with Lucia and Gerry ourselves! It was a perfect introduction to tango and the tango culture...with the milonga being the "insider's" icing on the cake. Thank you!!

Super, amazing, awesome!. Lucia and Gerry are patient, kind, fun and relaxed. We had a private lesson at Rooneys Boutique Hotel, which is a beautiful spot. Neither myself or my boyfriend have ever danced, both have 2 left feet and are completely lacking any coordination, but that didn't matter. They took their time with us, explained everything (several times) and made the hour thoroughly enjoyable. Not expensive, great value and something I'd recommend to anyone visiting BA. Thanks guys for a really great experience. Beks&Niall

Great way to experience tango in BA. Tango lessons with Lucía and Gerry were a fun way to experience Buenos Aires’ famous pastime. I took three lessons and went to the “Tango Night Out” with them over the course of a week and am really pleased with how much they taught me in that time. They are both very friendly and patient. I appreciated them taking the time to explain different steps and how to make corrections. I especially recommend attending the Tango Night Out as a preview to your lessons. There was a live band and all the regulars out dancing – simply a cool way to glimpse the scene and join in yourself. And they make it very easy, setting up taxis to the venue following the initial group lesson and hailing a cab afterwards to get you back safely to wherever you are staying. All in all, it was a memorable part of my visit to Buenos Aires. They even sent me pictures from the lessons and milonga afterwards as a bonus souvenir. Big thanks to Lucía and Gerry!

Tango classes. We happened to find Lucia and Gerry on Tripadvisor. We only had two days to try and get some Tango lessons, before our flight back home, so after reading all the good reviews, we decided to give them a try.Lucia and Gerry are very professional, honest and their ultimate goal is to teach Tango. They worked around our schedule and even switched studios to accommodate us. We only wish we had more time for classes and the Milongas. If we decide to go back to Buenos Aires, we will definitely take more classes from Lucia and Gerry.

Tango lessons for the first timer. My wife and I visited Buenos Aires and thought we take a tango lesson as a fun activity. If you're like us, you'll be anxious about having 6 left feet when going to learn a serious dance from experts. Our guide arranged the lesson and we arrived just in time to a room reserved in a hotel. Gerry and Lucia immediately put us at ease with their calm competent demeanor. They quickly got us walking together and then began to teach us the basics of walking when doing the tango. They have a perfect balance of being professional and demanding while at the same time being light in spirit and attitude. Before long they had us appreciating the basics of the dance and, and moreso, insights into what made Tango such as personal experience. We enjoyed the session so much, that we have decided to continue lessons when we return to the states. My wife is extremely happy. I encourage anyone who wants to get exposure to this dance and appreciate what and why it continues to be dance of two people melded into one, this is the couple to go to.

Fun with Lucia & Gerry. The reviews don't lie - this was worth it. We did tango night out: learned a few moves and went to the milonga. The only thing that was a surprise was how good the band was at the milonga. Lucia and Gerry are great people who are very professional, fun, and personable all at the same time. Enjoy.

See and feel tango from an Argentine's point of view.. Gerry and Lucia were a delight, so sweet and good teachers! They showed us some tango moves, took us to an incredible milonga in Buenos Aires in the San Telmo area, and gave us a taste of tango we're not going to soon forget. Lovely experience, we highly recommend it!

Nice local experience. We hoped for a local tango experience instead of a touristic show and with the one hour tango lesson and the visit to the milonga, all our expectations were met! Lucia and Gerry were really flexible in arranging the time and date of the activity (we could let it know on the same day as we were in doubt whether we would have a jetlag or not) and are very good teachers! The milonga was interesting and we danced a tango as well with the help of Lucia and Gerry :-) The milonga night ended with a beautiful show (although at 01.00 am), definitely worth to wait for!!

An authentic Tango Experience. Unfortunately I was only able to take one private lesson with Lucia and Gerry, but it was without a doubt one of the best things I did during my time in Buenos Aires. Both are expert instructors who have a very organic teaching style, so no matter what your skill level you will always feel comfortable, yet at the same time challenged. My hour with them flew by, and that night I also attended a milonga with them and a few other students. This was also a fantastic experience, as it allowed me to get a better sense of how regular people dance tango and of the contexts in which they do. By the end of it all, despite my limited exposure, I truly felt like a had a sense of what makes the tango such a special and important part of Argentine culture. If there is one thing you do in Buenos Aires, I recommend a class with Lucia and Gerry. It was an unforgettable and inspiring experience, and I hope to see them again one day when I return to Buenos Aires.

Great Teachers, and Fun Experience. Lucia and Gerry are great teachers, and very patient! My husband and I are not at all dancers, but we managed to learn a few basic Tango steps in our private lesson. It was really fun and a great activity while you're in Buenos Aires! It was in a vintage looking dance studio in San Telmo which made the experience feel even more authentic. Highly recommend!

Great experience. Lucia and Gerry are great teachers and make learning tango great fun. We had an hour private lesson and then a lesson before the tango night out. It was a really special occasion going to the milonga and actually dancing.

Fabulous. Bypass the Tango Shows. We enjoyed 3 days in Buenos Aires and on the evening of day one, went to a Tango Show. It was entertaining.On the evening of day two, we took a tango class with Gerry & Lucia - a program they called a Tango Night Out. In a word - fabulous.Why see professionals perform routines which are not necessarily "the Tango" when with Lucia & Gerry's support, you can do it yourself. First , the lessons. Great fun. Patient, positive, supportive tutors. Then the culmination. Off to a Molongo to actually dance the tango. The night we were there, 10 piece live band plus tango demonstrations at the highest level - on a suburban dance floor. Next time we are in Buenos Aires, it will be two lessons and no professional theatre. Gerry, your patience was exemplary. Lucia, to dance the tango with you was the highlight of my holiday. You are, fortunately, so forgiving.But I can now say, I went to Buenos Aires and danced The Tango.Gerry, Lucia - my thanks. MM (Australia)

A must do in BA!. We had the most amazing evening with Lucia & Gerry. They were both so friendly and welcoming and immediately made us all feel welcome as tango first timers.There instruction was easy to follow and they took the time to explain why we were doing things, not just where to put our feet which helps you develop an understanding of what it's to dance Tango. Needless to say, with their expert guidance, in an hour we were dancing our first Tango steps.We opted for the Tango Night Out which we strongly recommend. It gives you a great taste of true tango culture, along with a fantastic orchestral performance. Although we were nervous and not all that confident in our abilities, Lucía and Gerry got us up on the Milonga floor dancing which we were very thankful for.All in all, one of the highlights of our trip so far.Thanks Lucia and Gerry!
Fun evening, great teachers. We tried the Tango night with Gerry & Lucia and thought they were very welcoming, excellent teachers and created a lovely BA tango experience. Highly recommended

Not to be missed. Lucia and Jerry were thoughtful and patient teachers who obviously love what they do. For a really fun authentic evening I highly recommend their class followed by the field experience of a milongo. It inspired us to want to learn this when we go home.

Fun & authentic!. So, we chose Lucia & Gerry because my partner and I speak limited Spanish, and thought it would be best to learn tango from two English-speakers. Even so, I was worried it might be a tourist trap. Not so! Lucia & Gerry are amazingly kind and funny, and very good teachers. We did the Tango Night Out, and they took us to an authentic milonga that you would absolutely have to be a native to even know about. The night we went was a special event, when the world champion of tango dancing was in town, and we got to dance right next to him on the floor! Luckily all eyes were on him and not us bumblers ;) So much fun, you have to have this Argentinian experience!

Tango Lessons with Gerry and Lucia. We took a few lessons from Gerry and Lucia in Buenos Aries on December 2014. They are excellent teachers and we were very pleased with the lessons. Gerry and Lucia not only gave us lessons but were also excellent tour guides. They took us to a great milonga with live music , and gave us great advise every day regarding where to go for milonga and what to see. We are very grateful to them for the amazing time we had.

Nice to learn the Tango from Caring Instructors. I took 5 lessons with Lucía y Gerry while in Buenos Aires. I had planned just to take two but I was learning so much that I decided to take lessons for the week. The lessons were 90 minutes. The location was easy to get to since the subway is only 1 street away. They are located on a sleepy street in historic San Telmo barrio -- which is the home of tango dancing. Gerry is Irish and Lucia is a local but speaks excellent English.They are excellent instructors and helped me get the complexities of the dance. I will see them when I return next year.

Not to be missed! Our favorite memories in BA were with Gerry and Lucia!. My mom and I just got home from a great trip to Buenos Aires. We loved the dynamism and charisma of the city. Definitely our most special memories of our time in BA were with Lucia and Gerry. Patient, kind, and gentle teachers, Lucia and Gerry taught us about the art, culture, and history of tango. Their demonstrated and infectious passion for tango got my mom and myself hooked! :)We took three tango lessons with the two of them and learned quite a bit. And they took us to the milonga where we got to practice our moves. Our night at the milonga with Gerry and Lucia was definitely my favorite evening in Buenos Aires, and quite possibly the highlight of my whole 30-day trip! And their pricing is a steal! With their expertise, passion, and experience, they could easily be charging 2-3 times the amount they do! If there is one thing you do in Buenos Aires, taking classes and going to the milonga with these two wonderful people should be it! :)

The best!!!. As a beginner I was happy to have such a great teachers as Lucia and Gerry for a bit more than a week in Buenos Aires. They opened my eyes for many details what tango has and worked with me and my partner very patiently and all of that great experience made us definitely come back to Buenos Aires and to Lucia and Gerry!!! They took us to see the best band and we took part of the best milongas....our trip changed totally after we met this great couple- Lucia and Gerry!!!!

36 hours in Argentina and one amazing night!. Gerry and Lucia are absolutely, hands down the best to take tango lessons with. We arrived in San Telmo for our class on a Monday evening. It was also the end of a small tango festival. Gerry and Lucia were very quick on email replies and super helpful in any questions we had for them. Both my girlfriend and myself were beginners but they took the time to teach us individually despite me being the problem child. Afterwards we arrived at the milonga to see the worlds best dancers, live band, food and spirits. Lucia and Gerry truly made this a trip to remember. Their knowledge of the city, dancing and good times was impeccable. We look forward to dancing again with them soon! If your in Buenos Aires, this is absolutely a must for your trip!

Missing part in Buenos Aires experience. I spent a week in Buenos Aires going on tours and just walking around the city. Enjoyed it a lot. But my experience would be definitely not complete if have missed the tango class with Lucia & Gerry followed by the night at the melonga place. This was definitely the highpoint of the trip. Unfortunately it was the last day of my stay. But I will have to return and do it again...

Ever wonder how this is the #1 attraction in Buenos Aires???. The answer is simple: It is because of sincerity and authenticity! Lucia and Gerry introduce you to a culture and style which has been long forgotten in today's day and age. My family of 8, a few adults and a few clowns participated in learning to tango with Lucia and Gerry. To appreciate tango, is to appreciate the pull and push of life, the ebbing and flow of the universe. It is to give oneself over, and at the same time take control. When I first booked this trip, I never realized the impact it would have on me and my family. It was not only the lesson of the tango, but it was the discussion and relaxed atmosphere that surrounded the Milango that one is transported into times past. This is not an exhibition of modern dance, nor is it a gluttoness feast for one's belly, but rather it is an exhibition into the working dynamics of a society and rich culture. Go and enjoy this, whether you have 2 left feet as do I, or are an experienced dancer. You will only be richer for having done so.
Very patient teachers!. A great introduction to the tango! Worked at our pace, very clear instructions ably demonstrated. Very friendly and helpful about aspects of Buenos Aires life!

Best Experience in Buenos Aires. A friend and I were headed to Buenos Aires for a week and more than anything else, we wanted to learn to dance some real Argentinian Tango. We decided to give Gerry and Lucia a try based on the great TripAdvisor reviews and we are so glad we did.First of all, I would highly recommend if you have even a passing interest in learning this dance - or enough of an adventurous spirit to want to enrich your time in B.A. with a truly unique experience - that you book one or two private lessons and then arrange to attend the Tango Night Out with Gerry and Lucia. To be clear, if your time is short, then the one hour class ahead of the Tango Night Out is enough to learn the basics and the Milonga experience is so amazing that you will enjoy it whether you dance or not. But if you have more time, the extra classes will be worth it and Gerry and Lucia are such good teachers that you will have enough confidence to give the dance floor a try at the Milonga.The lessons are fun and completely not intimidating. These two are able to accommodate anyone. I went with another good female friend and they taught us enough to deal with invitations to dance at the Milonga! Both Gerry and Lucia speak English and are very patient with slow learners!The Tango Night Out is not to be missed...no matter your feelings about dancing. They took us to a Milonga we would have never found on our own. We had a table right in front of the band and the dance floor. We watched the most amazing live band I have ever seen and then were treated to an amazing tango dancing exhibition. It was my absolute favorite night in Buenos Aires. Furthermore, when it was obvious that my friend and I enjoyed the milonga so much, Gerry and Lucia e-mailed us with other options for attending milongas later in the week. We felt like we had made real friends in these two by the time we left!The prices are extremely reasonable and the memories are priceless! Don't give this a second thought if you are considering it!!!

Fun and friendly tango in Buenos Aires. Lucia and Gerry provided us with a great one hour tango lesson in San Telmo. One lesson is not enough, but it was very entertaining for us!We then joined them and other tango students at a milonga in San Telmo and thoroughly enjoyed the 10 piece orchestra and watching locals dance the tango.Lucia and Gerry provide a friendly and very professional service from start to finish.Highly recommended whether you are looking for just one or multiple tango lessons, or an insight into Argentina's favorite dance.

Great fun with great people. We loved this because it was great fun but most importantly genuine. Lucia and Gerry took us out to a Milonga which was one of the highlights of our time in Buenos Aires. The music was incredible and getting a chance to have a go at tango on the dance floor was a once in a lifetime experience for dance-phobic people like us! To top it off they took heaps of photos for us which they emailed through for free. We highly recommend this!

Tango!. What a great night - my fiancé and I booked in for their tango night out class (def worth it!) an hours lesson and then a night out to a real tango club with a 10 piece orchestra band, some food, drinks (beer and champagne) and cover charge were all included. Lucia and Gerry are both great teachers and great people. I'd recommend this to anyone.

Thank you Lucia & Gerry!. What a wonderful session. My husband and I are not very good at dancing - and we had so much fun! Lucia & Gerry are great teachers. It was also very easy to set up the lesson, which we appreciated. Plus, they sent us photos afterward - how nice! Highly recommended.

We simply love Lucia and Gerry!. My husband and I enjoyed several private lessons and some classes with Lucia and Gerry. They are very generous with their focused attention and instruction giving us the help we need. Both are fluent in English and Spanish making instruction easy to follow. The studio is located in San Telmo, close to where we were staying. We are so grateful to them both and look forward to next time.

Perfect Tango night out. Lucia and Jerry are truly tango lovers ;-) they are very flexible patient and enthusiasts.With only the 1 hour lesson they give us we were able to appreciate fully the beauty of tango dancers at the melonga (dedicated tango night club) and even dance a few steps without looking too ridiculous! After they send us the photo they took for us during the night. Muchas gracias por este maravilloso momento !

A perfect Tango experience!. I have taken many classes in the past but my time with Lucia and Gerry was by far the most thorough and enjoyable. I came away really feeling like I had improved and actually looking forward to showing off my new skills once I came back home. They were extremely patient with me and my two left feet, and I highly recommend them to anyone learning the lovely dance.

Review of Class. We really enjoyed our class with Lucia and Gerry. We did the one and a half hour class. They were very funny and made the class go by so quickly. They were also so patient with my husband and I as we both have two left feet. It was a great way to learn the tango!

Excellent Instructors. Lucia and Gerry were wonderful teachers. They are very patient, encouraging and were just great to be around. This was my wife and my first Tango lesson and we were grateful for what we learned and are excited to continue learning. Overall A+. Much Thanks.

Bravo Lucia and Gerry!. A true Buenos Aires experience, if you want to avoid the tourist trap tango scene, this is the real deal. The lesson is great fun and Lucia and Gerry are excellent teachers, even with 2 left feet we learnt some tango steps. The Milonga was a wonderful experience, fantastic live music and great tango, we would never have found a place like this by ourselves it was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Argentina. Lucia and Gerry are genuinely warm and great fun. We highly recommend it and felt it was it was well worth the price.
Great teachers. Had 1 hour private lesson. Very patient. Managed to iron out some of my bad habits! Gerry is Irish so don't worry if you don't speak Spanish. Would be good for complete novices.
Super tango class and Milonga visit. Lucia & Gerry combine a warm, personal approach with great professionalism. If you want to learn Tango at any level, seek no further!

A wonderful tango night. This was one of our best nights in Buenos Aires.A huge thank you to Lucia and Gerry who were absolutely wonderful and managed to make us feel brave enhough to step on the drance floor and try to tango after only one lesson. In our case, it might take a bit more than that to turn us into experts, but it was a great experience and we've really enjoyed ourselves. If you hesitate, I can only say that this is nothing like a standard impersonal dance lesson: the explanations and the atmosphere were great, and the night at the Milonga felt like a true Argentinian experience. If we're ever back in Buenos Aires, we're definitely trying it again.

This is real Argentine tango!! We loved it!!. First, we wanted to go to a tango show which are offered in Buenos Aires, because we wanted to get to know something about tango - you cannot leave the world capital of tango without having watched it. But we heard that the shows are not the money worth and in the end it is only a show and not real. So, we decided to take lessons from professional teachers and we found here the recommendations for Lucía and Gerry - so, we tried it and it was just really great and so much fun! We booked the "Tango Night Out" which include a 1 h lesson before they take you to a real (!) Argentine milonga where you can see, listen and feel real Argentine tango, the atmosphere on the dancefloor and the great live music! But in order to be able to dance a little bit tango in the milonga, we recommend to take extra lessons before the "Tango Night Out" so that you can learn a few more combinations of steps. We really enjoyed the time with Lucía and Gerry who are very patient teachers and lovely persons! If we are in Buenos Aires again, we will definitely come back and take further lessons with them so that we can go again to a real milonga and enjoy the real Argentine tango.

Spend your tango time with Gerry and Lucia!. We were determined to take a tango class while in Buenos Aires and were also interested in attending a milonga. Gerry and Lucia's "Tango Night Out" was a perfect evening for us. We had a one hour lesson - just enough to begin to comprehend the complexities and the psychology of the tango! - before heading out with them to a milonga for the balance of the evening. The whole experience was one we won't soon forget - our best evening in Buenos Aires! We're determined to find a teacher and keep up with the tango once we're home, so that we can come back and be one of those couples in the milonga whom we so admired!Gerry and Lucia were great teachers - endlessly patient! - and fun to spend the evening with as well!

Loved it!. Lucia & Gerry are very warm and professional teachers, and above all very supportive and patient! We had just one lesson but it was fun, informative and it felt like a true Argentinean experience :) I can recommend this to anyone who considers to take a lesson, just for the fun of it or to really learn the essence of tango.
Awesome experience!. Loved this!! Don't miss this experience! Lucia and Gerry are nice, professional, easy going and fun amazing dancers and teachers!!

The most fun I had in a YEAR in Buenos Aires!. We lived in Argentina for over a year and had been to a few tango shows and milongas (but just to watch). The week before flying back to the U.S. I decided I really wanted to take at least 1 tango class, just to learn the basics and get a feel for it. My husband was a good sport in agreeing to go with me. We searched for Tango classes in English and found Lucia & Jerry. We decided to go for a 1 1/2 hour class. I couldn’t believe how much we learned to do in such a short time. Lucia & Jerry were amazing to work with. They would demonstrate the steps, work with us separately, put us together to practice, and then give us instructive feedback. (They both speak English and Spanish, so there were no language barriers.) They were both so patient with us, always giving us helpful tips and demonstrations. The time flew by. My husband (the one I dragged there) suggested taking a second class the next night. We also ended up joining the Sunday night group class for extra practice. So, be careful! You’ll have so much fun and get hooked!If you are going to be in BA for several nights, I highly recommend at least two 1 1/2 hour classes. You’ll feel the steps really cement and come together the second class, and you’ll be ready to go to a milonga to dance the night away. Lucia & Jerry have great recommendations for milongas to go to. There’s truly no better way to spend a night in BA than dancing tango! Go for it! As an added bonus, while you're practicing, Lucia takes pictures and video of you. You leave Buenos Aires with 2 souvenirs: great pictures and the ability to tango!
Tango lesson and visit to Milonga. Had wonderful time!Lucia and Gerry were extremely helpful and inviting. We would recommend them to anyone wanting a fun person Argentina Tango lesson.

Brilliant Tango Evening with Gerry and Lucia!. Had a brilliant evening with Gerry and Lucia! First was our Tango Lesson where we were guided through our first tango steps. Later Gerry and Lucia brought us  to the milonga ( where you dance tango), there was a Live Tango Orchestra playing, it was amazing.! We danced with Gerry and Lucia and had a great evening. If this is your first trip to Buenos Aires, be sure to book a tango tour with Gerry and Lucia. They are fantastic hosts and give an insight into the real tango world of Buenos Aires. Don't miss out on this experience....
Tango- made it easy. Tango is not easy to learn, but Gerry and Lucia make the learning a lot eaiser. They are also very encouraging and nurturing. I highly recommend their lessons.

Lovely and fun tango night out. Myself and my wife did the tango night out which involves an hour lesson and a few hours at a Tango club after the class. I am a terrible dancer, but Lucia and Gerry were very patient teachers and very positive throughout the whole class. The class was much more fun than I expected and Lucia / Gerry took photos during the class and emailed them to you the next day. This was very convenient as it helped you focus on learning the steps. After the class we went to a tango club a few minutes away with locals and live music. Needless to say the other dancers were much better than us, but it was great to be there with Lucia and Gerry as we would not have been brave enough to go to a club like this ourselves. Would recommend this for any couple looking for a fun night out and an insiders look into the Tango culture of BA!

Fantastic tango experience. Lucia and Gerry were the perfect teachers - humorous, patient and able to explain the steps in simple, easy-to understand instructions. We thoroughly enjoyed our lesson with them and were extremely impressed with the experience at the milonga. We experienced the amazing sounds of a live tango orchestra, watched amazingly talented locals dance the tango and braved the crowd to practice a few simple steps. Would highly recommend this experience to anyone who wants a taste of tango with easy-going,knowledgeable locals who know their stuff!

Great Entry to Tango World (YM). Although it was only one lesson, Gerry and Lucia have given me great opportunity and experience to the Tango World. Not only the lessons, they were giving me where to go for Milonga and Tango shows. Even if you a solo traveller dont be afraid. They will give you wonderful intro to Tango. I was solo traveller and zero experience in Tango.

Great lesson for beginners!. Let me tell you this, IT WAS REALLY FUN! My husband and I are not dancers whatsoever.. But, we are open to trying out new things. I finally was able to convince my husband to do Tango lesson, especially if you are in Buenos Aires, Tango Capital! This being said, Lucia and Gerry gave us a wonderful introduction to Tango. They are experts in breaking down the moves in a way that we (amateurs) understand and actually get. At the end of our one and a half lesson, we were able to learn the basics. I mean, we're still not pro's but, man, my husband and I never knew we can learn a few tricks in the dance floor fairly quick. I was so surprised that even my husband enjoyed the entire length of the lesson. He was showing off his learned skills dayyysss after. LOL. If we had more time in BA, we would definitely want to do more lessons with L&G. Great experience, great value, and you will learn how to Tango! I mean, just go for it.. The experience will truly put a smile on your face!

The perfect introduction to Tango in BA. Lucia and Gerry gave us expert Tango tuition, and their local knowledge made our Tango experience in Buenos Aires so much more authentic.We visited BA for 5 days, with the intention of experiencing some Tango, but no firm plans for how to do this. We got in contact with Gerry y Lucia and soon had three private lessons booked over the course of the next three days. We got four hours for the price of three, though I actually think we got closer to five hours by the time we were done.We learned a lot in our lessons. We had done a few lessons previously, so they evaluated what we knew so far and then set about refining our technique, teaching us some more compact ways of doing things for the crowded BA milongas, and then giving us a handful of new moves and ways to combine them. Gerry's native English was very helpful at times for explaining some of the finer points, and having both Gerry and Lucia there meant that we were fully engaged with learning the whole time.After our second lesson they encouraged us to go to a milonga. They even booked us a table which helped us to not chicken out. They also told us how to get to the Tango World Championships, which were on at the time, and where best to buy Tango shoes.Finally, they sent us photos of us during our lessons, and a video to remind us of everything we learned in our lessons. Truly great value!

Excellent lesson, great people, very patient. My husband (not a dancer) and I (love it, but not so good at it) took an hour and a half lesson with Gerry and Lucia. They were both very patient and helpful with us, we learnt quite a few steps and learnt that is all you really need to know in order to dance the tango. They took photographs throughout and a video as proof that we actually did it. If we had more time, I would live to do more as I think once I switch my mind off and just feel it, I will enjoy it a lot more. They are both quite relaxed too, and are positive which makes the experience all the more enjoyable. If you have an interest in tango, you should definitely try it.

Tango trip to Buenos Aires. My wife and I and another couple just returned from a 4 day trip to Buenos Aires, Argentina. My wife is a big fan of Tango, and, frankly, I had some making up to her to do. So, I researched tango schools on Tripadvisor and other sites, and chose Lucia and Gerry. We could not be happier with our choice. Lucia and Gerry were cool, relaxed, and great, great instructors. In just 4 lessons, we gained a whole new appreciation for Tango, and are totally into getting more lessons and dancing close to home. The prices were very reasonable as well ($110 for each 2 hr lesson for both couples). We will definitely plan to come back and take more lessons with Lucia and Gerry in the future and have recommended them to our friends.

Tango lessons with Lucia and Gerry. Lucia and Gerry went above and beyond our tango expectations. Not only were they excellent instructors, but they also suggested the best restaurants to visit and places to go in the city. They gave us the name of a milonga to go to and made arrangements for us to sit with their friends to watch tango. If you are looking for Argentine tango classes in Buenos Aires, then you need to take classes from Lucia and Gerry.

Highlight of our visit to Buenos Aires. We had a wonderful night learning the beautiful and captivating basics of Tango. Gerry and Lucia are fabulous instructors whose talent for and love of the dance are evident. With humor as well as genuine instructional skill, they took two people who knew nothing about Tango and gave us a taste of a hobby for years to come. Thank you so much for such an incredible way to learn about the culture unique to Buenos Aires.

Excellent introduction to tango. Had to convince my partner to do a tango lesson and we were both complete beginners. He ended up really enjoying himself and wants to come back for more... Lucia and Gerry were very patient and friendly and we felt like we learnt a lot in only an hour and a half! Good value for money too. Would definetly recommend :)

Tango y más!!. With only 7 days in BA, my husband and I wanted to pack in as much as possible to get a well-rounded Argentinian experience. Little did we know that finding Lucía and Gerry's class would be a highlight of our entire trip! Not only did we learn the basic steps to the tango (both of us with no experience at all with tango and not big dancers), but also we had the opportunity to go to a legitimate milonga where there was live music (which was incredible) and we met new friends and even danced on the dance floor! It was unforgettable experience and we can't wait to come back to take more classes!

Great first introduction to tango!. With one of us really looking forward to our 1 hour private lesson, and the other slighty less...:) we ended up having a great experience. Both never danced the tango before and we felt this was a must during our stay in Buenos Aires. We learned so much more than expected and if we had more time in the city, would definately take a few extra classes. Lucia & Gerry, you are both great, thanks again!

Lucia and Gerry Tango treat. If you are a beginner at Tango Lucia and Gerry are the best. We had such fun and they made it a great experience as well as a lesson. Warm and friendly and very professional. Great value for money and the offer of a Milonga Club after the lesson. This was a double highlight, the club is non touristy and the band was fantastic. Photos of our lesson and the club were emailed the next day.Awesome experience. Erika and Steve from London August 2014

An injection of happiness!. Lucia and Gerry's tango classes have been one of the highlights of our stay in BA together with the Argentine Experience. We booked 2 private lessons and attended also an open class and a local milonga with them which was far better than the commercial Tango show we went to in BA. Lucia and Gerry, the Argentine volcano and the Irish perfect gentleman have succeded in making us learn a few tango steps in only three hours, making it fun and easy and giving us confidence we can improve. We bought tango shoes and decided to pursue the dancing at home. The milonga they took us to had a very talented band, 100 times better than the professional shows and the people dancing in the milonga were sensual, dedicated and very absorbed. It was an experience not to be missed. The only downpart was that it was too short. If we would have lived in BA, we would have been in their studio every week. Don't miss out, it will improve your stay tenfold! Thank you Lucia for the nice fotos, thank you Gerry for the music list and thanks to both of you for your gentle and fun way to help us with our starting steps! You have great teaching skills!

Great experience with great people. Both Lucia and Gerry are, apart from excellent teachers, the sweetest persons you could think of. They know how to share their passion of tango, while being very efficient in the way they teach. In my case, although being a dreadful dancer, I was able to to some moves with my wife after a few minutes!We wish we could go to a milonga with them later on but had to get back to the airport. Next time for sure!Thanks for everything and hope to see u soon!

Authentic way to experience tango. We went on a tango tour with Lucia and Gerry and enjoyed ourselves. We visited an authentic miolonga dance hall to see locals dancing tango, and learned about the history of the dance and the culture around it.
Excellente. We had a really nice evening at the Tangolesson and the milonga with Lucia and Gerry. We can recomand it absolutely.
Great intro with intimate lesson. Great intro to tango lesson - very helpful and patient. We also went to the milonga with them as well after and had a great time!!

Such a great night.. Having never taken a tango lesson before we found ourselves in great hands. With a wealth of experience Lucia and Gerry were able to provide us with direction and confidence and have inspired us to take tango lessons when we return home to Australia. After the lesson we ventured to a Milonga which was truly a great experience and highly recommended. A great night with great company.A must do when in BA.

Nice intro to tango. Our intro tango class with Gerry and Lucia was a nice experience. The teachers spoke great English, knew how to teach beginners, and we walked away knowing about the history and culture of the dance.

Excellent class. We contacted Gerry and Lucia the night before in the hopes of organising a last minute tango lesson for our group and they were so accommodating. We were able to arrange our lesson and they were very kind and patient and covered a lot in the hour and a half that they were with us. They are very passionate about what they are teaching so it never felt like they were just going through the motions and our group loved the whole expeience. Reasonably priced and great intstructors, would definitely recommend!

My first class of Argentinian tango. Beautiful experience, Loved it and more in love with this.Gerry and Lucia were excellent teachers/ dancers. All my life I watched and wished to learn tango, authentic tango, going to Buenos Aires and doing this was my best experience, which topped it with going to Milonga Sunday night.They are great dancers and great teachers. Dream come true for me. I will do it again.

Fantastic surprise!. My husband sent a very last minute email to Lucia and Gerry, desperately trying to organise some things for my birthday. They responded almost immediately, willing to help with a private Tango lesson. They are both extremely patient and technical teachers. They were humorous and made the session very relaxed and I would highly recommend them. It's a shame that we only did the Tango on the last day, and I would highly recommend doing not only doing some private classes, but also their group sessions also! Thanks again Lucia and Gerry!

Fantastic intro to Tango!. We just returned from a visit to Buenos Aires and had the pleasure of learning the ABC's of this sensual dance from Lucia and Gerry. They were extremely accommodating, very patient with us, and besides the dance lesson, offered a lot of additional information about their beloved city.Two days later, they invited us to a local Milonga, where we got to experience an amazing 10 piece band performing live, as well as a demonstration from a couple of local professionals. Amazing experience overall and I would recommend them in a heartbeat!Muchas gracias, Lucia & Gerry!

Amazing tango experience. wonderful tutors and very patient. We enjoyed it very much and will definitely come back during our next visit. We also joined the group class and the milonga with them. The live band was stunning and we had a lot of fun!Thank you for the lovely pictures!!

relaxed but exciting. Lucia and Gerry are a delightful Argentinian/Irish couple, both natural teachers - even for bumbling aging novices like me who had never really learnt to dance. In 3 hours they had given me the confidence and ability to begin to enjoy dancing tango and to keep dancing with my far more dance-talented partner. So thank you L&G for setting us on a new road!Michael, Sydney AU.

Totally worth it. I'm a terrible dancer, but Lucia and Gerry were fantastic teachers. While I will never be a world class tango dancer, we really enjoyed this lesson. Great instruction, lots of patience, and very attentive teaching. I would highly recommend this for anyone who would like to try to learn the tango... even if you aren't good at dancing!

Great class!. Gerry and Lucia are two really great teachers. We had never danced tango before and we really like the experience. If you can, you should go to the milanga afterward, it's defiantly worth a visit!

THE Highlight of an Amazing trip. My girlfriend and I thought it'd be fun and romantic to learn the Tango. She warned me it might be a little difficult, and I thought I'd give it a solid try - as long as the instructor wasnt barking condescending orders at me in spanish. Enter Lucia and Gerry - and all our fears were put to rest. Was it a challenge - yes - but such a fun one that brought us closer than ever. And as for the instructors - we left there feeling as though we'd made friends. There are a lot of other instructors out there - and we saw a few of them at other parts of the city, sadly I wouldn't have stuck with it after one lesson if thats how my classes were being taught.With Gerry & Lucia, you have a Husband-Wife team who are genuinely wonderful people who love the Tango. Additionally your class is in a beautiful mirrored studio in an old Tango School. Vaulted ceilings and wide marble floors await you as you enter, and then each 1-1/2 hour class is set with beautiful classic tango music. We did museums, we did sight seeing, we went to Parillas and La Boca, none of it compared to the Sunday evening we spent at the Milonga with Gerry and Lucia after our group class. In the end we ended up taking 3 classes, 2 privates and 1 small group, saw a dynamite show at the milonga, and had the time of our lives doing it...all for under $120 !!!!! Sunday group classes and the milonga can be had for about $20-30 with a bottle of wine and some snacks... best deal in the city

awesome tango experience. i didn't expect having such a wonderful time here.....they two are gorgeous, patient and gave us the amazing tango entry class. We will come again when next time we are here!

best tango teachers so far. I'm living in Buenos Aires for a while and very into tango-lessons. I've tried many teachers and I've learn that a good dancer doesn't necessarily mean a good teacher. Gerry and Lucia are outstanding as teachers: they have patience, are very friendly and positive. They do their work with love and that's special. No matter if you're a beginner or advanced, they transmit you the right things to dance tango. Another good thing of their lessons: they don't stick to certain rules, pass one, two or three but encourage you to improvise, that's the best way of learning tango, by heart.

Inspiring teachers. I count myself so lucky to have had my first tango lesson with Lucia and Gerry, they are both brilliant teachers and their enthusiasm is infectious. Whether you are a beginner or hoping to improve, their classes have such a welcoming atmosphere. Not only will you learn a lot, Lucia and Gerry will introduce you to to the unique world of tango music and the Milonga and help give you the confidence to dance there. Now I'm back in London, all that's left is to plan the next trip to Argentina..

It takes these two to tango!. What a wonderful way to enjoy Buenos Aires! We had a tango class of one hour, and although of course it was just a taste, Gerry and Lucia made sure that we understood the basic steps, and challenged us with some more fancy and difficult moves. Very patient and charming. Afterwards they emailed us wonderful photos of the taken class! Their milonga night on sunday is also very much recommended.

Must do in Buenos Aires!!. This has to be one of our favorite experiences while honeymooning in Argentina. Lucia & Gerry are superb teachers and the class was so fun and intimate (only 6 people of all levels). After the lesson we all headed to a local milonga to try out our new found skills, such a cool place with a great orchestra "El Afronte" where the local instructors and students can show off their moves. Thank you for an amazingTango experience

Excellent Instructors. One of our highlights in Argentina was the tango lesson we took with Gerry and Lucia. They both are great instructors and were very patient with rookies like us. They are talented enough to help the most basic or advance dancer learn a step or two. We really had a great time and enjoyed the time learning some tango! We highly recommend Gerry and Lucia to anybody with or without dance experience. Thanks Gerry and Lucia for the excellent day.

Tango with Lucia and Gerry:). I have been meaning to write this review for ages. Four of my colleagues were en route to Antarctica and had the chance to have a tango lesson. Someone at work had recommended Gerry and Lucia and they were spot on.Both were extremely accommodating and friendly which helped a lot since one or two of us had two left feet. The building was old and really had a lovely authentic feel about it.If you are ever in that neck of the woods myself and four colleagues would definitely recommend a tango lesson with them both. The only drawback was when they danced together, it left you in awe as they glided across the room effortlessly and made you more than want to take up lessons on your return.Thanks Lucia and Gerry, you guys are the best! xx
Excellent teachers. We were lucky to find this couple who taught us how can we improve our tango steps,we had an great time with them

Wonderful teachers. One of the highlights of our time in Buenos Aires were the Tango lessons we took with Lucia and Gerry. Excellent instructors and very patient. If you are visiting Buenos Aires you must do some tango and these two will make you feel at home and comfortable larning your way around the dance floor.

Full Range Tango Classes. I'm a Yankee, and I visited Argentina in 2010 for 2 years, and in that time I took many classes from Lucia and Gerry. They can teach all the basics very well and they are themselves phenomenal dancers so any student that sticks around them will have room to grow. They explained techniques very well and then there was a Milonga afterwards to practice at when I felt I was good enough. I plan on going back and continuing classes with them. Watching professionals and getting their individual advice for how your body is and should be moving was key for my quick adaptation to the better way to be dancing. For example, posture is a very specific thing that often can be taken for granted, and they give good insight for development. Very satisfied.

Wonderful teachers and wonderful people. I don't write many reviews on tripadvisor but I just had to for this as it has been one of the highlights of my round the world trip so far.I've always wanted to learn the tango but always put it of because I have no rhythm whatsoever. I can't dance to save my life but like many I'm a big Strictly Come dancing fan and the Argentine tango is one of my favourites. Lucia and Gerry work absolutely perfectly together. They explain everything so you can understand it and they compliment each other perfectly. They never talk over each other and are such fun to be around. They made the whole experience so much fun and in the process they taught me how to dance. The group lessons and Milonga are also amazing so make sure you do those as well. The orchestra is one of the best I've seen and you will get to see Lucia and Gerry in action as well. Wonderfully kind people and I will miss them greatly. Five stars all round! X

Buenos Aires highlight. My husband and I were on a 3-week trip to celebrate my 50th birthday. Our first stop was Buenos Aires and, in exchange for a trip to a football match, my husband agreed to tango classes. We booked 2 90-minute lessons and I am so pleased that we did as it was a really unique experience. My husband and I don't really dance together, ever (not even for our wedding), and so this was a daunting prospect for us. Lucia and Gerry, however, were incredibly patient in the face of our total incompetence and even managed to get a few moves out of us in our time with them. I would say that one lesson would not have been enough and, time allowing, we ideally would have preferred to fit more lessons in with them. If we ever manage to revisit it will be top of the 'to do' list. We also really appreciated their invitation to join them at a milonga and thought it was a highlight of our trip. The live musicians were incredible, the dancing amazing and it was a great opportunity to meet other people and share experiences. To top it all off, Lucia and Gerry sent us through a selection of photos so that we have a lovely reminder of our time with them. Our tango faces are terrible, I don't think we're about to set the dancing world alight but we'd sign up tomorrow given the chance.

The perfect Balance. For most people Tango is part of the Buenos Aires experience. So it was for me. Even so I never attended a dance lesson I wanted to learn at least the first steps of Tango. Luckily a friend of mine wanted to do the same and so he organised private Tango classes for us together with Lucia & Gerry... and I'm so grateful that he did that. Lucia and Gerry are very good, talented and patient teachers. Both, me and my friend were absolute beginners and these two managed to teach us in only 5 lessons a good start for Tango. Time flies when you have fun, so I was really sorry when my time with these two were over. I can absolutely recommend to take classes with Lucia and Gerry. Both balance and complete each other during the lesson which gives the student the most profit. With these two, you are not just one of many! And I think especially for couples learning with them is perfect, as you have all options for learning techniques that are possible.A big thanks again for the nice time x

Argentine tango first timers - a must do. Whilst Roy and I had been dancing (ballroom and Latin) for quite a while, we were completely unprepared for the complexity of the Argentine version of the tango. However we should not have worried because Lucia and Gerry made it such fun and in just a few private lessons we felt that we had come a long way. They were so patient and professional. We dont speak any Spanish so that problem was overcome as they both communicate in English. Thanks to you both for stimulating our interest in this lovely dance which we would like to continue now we are back home.

Tango lessons highly recommended!. I had three lessons with Lucia and Gerry and came away feeling as though I had progressed more than in my previous experience of Tango tuition. They helped to polish a few of my steps and worked on techniques I wish I'd known about years ago.They also brought me along to a milonga which was a great experience. There was a live ten piece orchestra playing - that good, I bought two of their CDs.Meeting Gerry and Lucia was the icing on the cake during my stay in Buenos Aires.

Great teachers!. Lucia and Gerry were really friendly, showed me the true way to dance tango, even had my first dance at the Milonga with Gerry! Even better they also spoke English, as my spanish isn't very good. :)Overall happy with experience.

Great intro to tango. My husband and I were in Argentina for our honeymoon, and taking a tango class was at the top of our list of to-do's for the trip. Lucia and Gerry provided a great intro to tango during a private, 1.5 hour class, and were very patient with our very uncoordinated dancing! We walked away with a much greater appreciation for tango since we now know how hard those steps really are, though experienced/professional dancers make it look so easy. I think it was also super helpful that they spoke English.
