While my comprehension of Spanish would have been decent enough to probably understand what our instructors were saying, we were having a little bit of Spanish fatigue by the end of our 2 1/2 week trip. All in all, we walked away from the end of the class still not feeling quite like we could repeat the steps without their coaching, but it was certainly a very fun intro and probably the best way to do it for extreme beginners and English-speakers. If we had more time in the city, I would have wanted to take a second class. One of the nice pluses of the class is that they take pictures for you on their camera and actually send them to you afterwards via email (and promptly)!

A dream come true. We had always wanted to have a tango lesson in Buenos Aires and chose Gerry and Lucia after reading about them on trip advisor. We organised the lessons by email from home and their studio was not far from our hotel. They were wonderfully patient with two rank beginners. We had only done some salsa and a little ballroom at home. We had the 3 hour package over two mornings and really enjoyed it. It was fantastic value and more than we ever hoped for. It was a wonderful experience and we would recommend Gerry and Lucia to everyone. Our dream did come true. James & Margaret

Such fun, we learned a lot, don't miss it!!!. This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Buenos Aires!!! Neither my partner nor I had ever taken lessons of tango, and after just 3 hours we had a repertoire of moves, and so much fun!! Lucia and Gerry have a great way of teaching tango, they are patient and very helpful, and if we didn't have to shorten our trip due to an emergency, we would have definitely taken more courses!!! We warmly recommend the Tango Classes with Lucia and Gerry to anyone!

A wonderful tango experience. We had 3 hours of private lessons with Lucia and Gerry and loved the relaxed and friendly approach that was well paced. Attending the milonga with Lucia, Gerry and other students was a great way to round off our tango experience in Buenos Aires.

Great introduction to Tango. My husband and I took the short private class. It was great!I thought it was well priced - not too expensive at all. We found the venue ok and the studio space was great.We were really, really nervous about our lesson. I had done some salsa before but not for a long time and my husband doesn't really dance so we'd never danced together. I was amazed at how quickly we improved. I thought we learned quite a few little steps considering it was such a short class.I thoroughly recommend the short class but I also think I would have enjoyed doing more with Gerry and Lucia as it was really fun and easy to enjoy.

Simply wonderful. If you are thinking of taking Tango lesson, I would highly recommend Lucia and Gerry. Immediately they put you ease, it is fun and they clearly have a passion for teaching and sharing their knowledge of Tango. A treat for us was visiting a local restaurant and milonga they recommended. The experience was great. Thank you Lucia and Gerry!

Lucia (La Divina) and Gerry brilliant Tango Teachers. A genuinely charming couple. If you come to Buenos Aires (and you should) and you want to take Tango lessons (which you really should) then you really, really should go to Lucia and Gerry. We initially took a group class, then we went to a Milonga with the most amazing ten piece Tango Orchestra and then we took private lessons. They were so patient and kind, and we learned such a lot. It's great to have the bilingual aspect to the classes with Gerry's gentle Irish lilt and Lucia's passion for the dance. I can't recommend them highly enough. Oh, and ladies - if you want Tango shoes, ask Lucia!

Excellent. If you come to Buenos Aires it is absolutely essential you take some tango lessons and check out a Milonga a traditional tango club. Only then can you sample the culture and get into the vibe of the city. I stumbled across Gerry and Lucia's tango lessons here on Trip Advisor. I was having some difficulty finding lessons in English, the previous classes I had attended were all in Spanish and I found it difficult to follow. The lessons given by Gerry and Lucia were excellent and lots of fun. They had a real knack of demonstrating some of the finer details of the expression of tango. I attended several milongas with Gerry and Lucia and built up a good friendship with them. I would highly recommend checking them out if you are in Buenos Aires and want a taste of the tango culture.Top notch and lovely people! Enjoy.

A perfect introduction to Tango at all levels and the Milonga scene in B.A.. What do you expect from excellent Tango teachers? Of couse, a) they should be really good Tango dancers, there are lot of them in B.A.; b) they should speak, if needed, your language, that means in most cases english, this becomes more seldom if you expect a really understandable communication, here you get a perfect bilingual training; c) they should have a didactical concept: how to train best the students, not by just only demonstrating and then criticising, but to get the competence step-by-step to the students, this you will find very seldom in B.A.; d) to address you individually and guide you on your Tango ladder further and further, e) to have a nice studio; and f) to give you access to the best milongas in town, if you want to participate. This combination of all factors is indeed very, very seldom in B.A. But, Lucia & Gerry do deliver! If you want to learn to dance or to improve - this is the place you are looking for.

Tango Lessons...don't look anywhere else!. My partner surprised me by booking us private lessons with Gerry and Lucia over 2 days - what a lovely experience that was. They are such a warm friendly couple with so much patience. No language barriers either which was fantastic. Our visit to BA also included a lesson and Milonga evening, of dancing with the locals to a 12 piece live band. That would take some beating. We learnt more than we thought in the given time. We would happily recommend Gerry and Lucia's classes in their lovely dance studio of faded grandeur - can't wait to go back.Thank you both for making our whole trip so memorable.

Great classes and an incredible milonga evening. We had the pleasure of attending 2 group classes with Gerry and Lucia. At each class (held in a beautiful old dance studio) there were no more than 4-5 students so we had lots of attention and support, which was helpful as we were both total beginners. Both G and L were friendly and patient which made the lessons really enjoyable, The true highlight for us (in fact one of the highlights of our entire trip through South America) was the milonga we attended with G and L on Sunday evening. We had a tango class beforehand, followed by dancing to (and watching the experts dance to) a 10 piece traditional orchestra. The atmosphere was fantastic and overall was a wonderful experience in BA.Thoroughly recommended.

A MUST in BA!. My husband and I visited BA for the first time in January and stayed for a total of 5 days. One of the biggest mistakes we made was not booking Lucia + Jerry for earlier during our stay, so that we could follow up with a 2nd or 3rd lesson. They are so sweet, kind, friendly and helpful, and though it was a sweltering afternoon, we LOVED learning tango. It was definitely one of the best moments of our trip. They also set us up with a table at a milonga the next day, where we spent hours listening and watching to a truly local BA experience. It was incredible. Thank you Lucia y Jerry!

You couldn`t learn more!. We took two private classes for three women (my mother, my sister and me). In those two hours they taught us so much, it was amazing. Lucia and Gerry are really warm and friendly and showed us with patient how to do it. We would recommend them anytime. It is really worth it.

Tango in Buenos Aires. Absolutely wonderful people. My wife and I went to Argentine to learn to tango, and, thanks to these two, we did. I would highly recommend Lucia and Gerry to anyone who wants to experience this wonderful taste of Argentina.

They are the ones who had to work!. I booked three x one hour lessons with Lucia and Gerry and they had their work cut out for them. I had grown up doing classical dance and dabbled in ballroom style Tango, but this Tango is more of the Milonga, street style Tango - so everything I knew from the past I had to throw out the window. I learned that Tango is an earthy and sultry dance and so your feet should be nailed to the floor - not up on your toes. This is why they had their work cut out for them because I went up on my toes each time. However, Gerry was very patient with me and with Lucia giving excellent instruction on best positions, hand movements (even the simplest hand movement can mean something) and feet positions and I felt comfortable advancing through all the dance moves they wanted to teach me. They are very calm yet passionate teachers who love what they do and this was a fantastic experience during my two weeks in BA. If you can manage more than one hour I recommend it as you learn so much more about this fabulous dance and appreciate how hard it is when you see the professionals making it look so easy. They also invited me, along with about 20 other students, to a Wednesday night Milonga with a great band. If you get the chance to do this with Gerry and Lucia, do it. I highly recommend this experience.

So much fun!. This was the first Tango lesson I had and it was so much fun. My fiancé and another couple went to the class together, and could not stop talking about it for our entire trip. Lucia & Gerry were patient and made sure we were all comfortable with the steps by the time the class ended. They invited us to a Milonga that featured live music. The four of us went and sat at their table that they reserved. We all danced, laughed, and enjoyed each others company. Tango is a new hobby of mine and I want to continue taking lessons in the US. If you're in Buenos Aires, definitely stop by and see Lucia & Gerry and catch a Milonga, it will be so much fun!

Fantastic Private Instruction. I took a 2 hour private tango lesson with Lucia and Gerry. They were a great team and led me through simple to complex improvisational movements. They taught me the dance steps and the difference between dancing at a Milonga and other styles of Tango. They were simply perfect and I learned a lot. They even sent me pictures. If you like to dance, don´t miss this opportunity.

Best hour you will spend!. One of the funnest experiences we had in Buenos Aires. Lucia and Gerry are super easy to work with and put you at ease. This was our first Tango experience and made us thirsty for more! Well worth your money and time, PLUS they send you awesome pictures afterwards.

Opened my eyes for the first mysteries of tango. My first tango lesson with Lucía and Gerry was a very pedagogic and informative hour that I warmly recommend everyone that comes to Buenos Aires and would like to learn basic useful tango! Best wishes,Anders Isaksson Sweden

Learn to Tango in Buenos Aires!. After attending a dinner tango show and seeing tango dancers of all ages in the street fairs, we decided to explore tango dance further with a private tango lesson with Lucia and Gerry. As we were complete beginners, we were so impressed with how Lucia and Gerry patiently guided us through a number of tango steps. We left with a better understanding of tango and resolved to follow up with more lessons and a date at a Milonga! A nice surprise were the photos that were taken during our lesson and arrived by email the same day. Thanks to Lucia and Gerry for a wonderful introduction to Tango!

Great tango/milonga experience!. Eager to learn something about the tango---and not as a tourist, from the outside looking in---my husband and I did some research and found great reviews of a milonga run by Gerry and Lucia. I wrote them for reservations and received back the sad news that they were temporarily without a location . . . but (!), they added, they would be happy to include us in their small group of friends/students attending another milonga during our visit. Thoroughly impressed by the kindness of their invitation, we met them at the milonga and had a terrific time. While we consider ourselves decent dancers, a quick (and embarassing!) tour of the dance floor revealed just how out of our element we were, and we asked Gerry and Lucia if they could squeeze in a lesson in our remaining day there, which they did, despite leaving that day for their own vacation. We spent a wonderful hour with them in their private studio, learning enough tango to hold our own . . . and they could not have been more pleasant, patient (!), and clear in their instruction. They even let me video their moves, so we could practice at home! For anyone interested in great, and forgiving/unitimidating, instruction of the dance that is an inextricable part of Buenos Aires history and culture, Gerry and Lucia are tops! One of our favorite memories of the trip by far!

Experience Tango with the best!. This was our first visit to Buenos Aires and we wanted to experience Tango. The individualized lesson with Gerry and Lucia before going to the Milonga was simply amazing! They are patient and fun teachers and attentive, sensitive guides the world of Tango. If you book one tour in Buenos Aires - do this!

Great introduction to tango!. My husband and I took a private lesson with Lucia and Gerry during our stay in BA. We did not know what to expect since we never took a tango lesson before. Both Lucia and Gerry were very patient with us and helped us learn some of the basics. Their studio is in San Telmo and they offer either a group class or you can arrange a private lesson as we did. They can also recommend tango shows in the city that offer a more local experience. Thanks again Gerry and Lucia!

Great lessons, whatever your ability. If you go to Buenos Aires you must have a tango lesson with Gerry and Lucia. Having never danced the tango before, we decided to have an hour of private tuition. They were very patient with us and at the end of the session we were dancing around the room. During the lesson they took lots of photos of us and sent them to us as a memento of the day. They also invited us to a milonga which they go to. It was a great night and we even managed to show off some of our new dance moves. We visited Buenos Aires over New Year. We asked Gerry and Lucia for recommendations on what to do. In the end we decided to book a tango show they recommended, which they also helped us book. They provided us with lots of helpful tips for our visit. On arrival they even sent us an email welcoming us to Buenos Aires. They really made us feel at home and couldn’t do enough for us.

Individualized Attention Makes for Great Experience!. Lucia and Gerry were absolutely fantastic teachers. They were hands-on (literally!), patient, and very passionate about their craft. My girlfriend picked it up immediately - she danced for many years - but even though I was slowing our progress, I never felt rushed or flustered. No prior experience necessary. It was such a unique thing to do - learning tango in a private studio in a Buenos Aires neighborhood - that you have to try it when visiting. They even made a reservation for an exclusive club for us that night! Great people and great experience!

Great Group Tango Lesson. My girlfriend and I went to BA for vacation, and I wanted to treat her to a tango lesson (I don't like to dance). Lucia and Gerry were absolutely awesome!!! We attended a group lesson that had about 7 couples which is on the larger side of their classes. There were varying levels of expertise among the class, and Lucia and Gerry were quick to identify the beginners and separated us from the "experts." They could then focus on the separate groups and provide a lesson that appealed to both groups. The have a passion for tango, and you can't help but get swept up by it. They are very patient and great teachers. I highly recommend that you contact them for at least a group lesson if not some private lessons.

Great beginners lesson. If you have no tango experience and only a short time in Buenos Aires, this is a great, affordable way to pick up a few of the basics and enjoy a memorable experience.We were 4 in our group and Lucia and Gerry's experience was shared around perfectly. Highly recommend.

The go to team for Tango lessons. If you're in Buenos Aires you have to learn to Tango, no? Gerry and Lucia are definitely the people to go to. My wife and I booked 4 private lessons and attended one of their (free) group lessons. Gerry (being of Irish descent) is a native English speaker which helps if you're Spanish is not up to much. Their teaching is clear, sensitive and they had enormous patience with two complete novices. Read the other reviews below, look at their scores and you can see that you're going to get a great experience. From a standing start they gave us enough technique, and more importantly confidence, to go to several Milongas and have a really good time. Highly recommended.

They Make Tango Fun !. The Argentine Tango can be intense and they teach it well and have you smiling. Gerry is an attentive partner and Lucia has eagle eyes and picks up in everything. They also go the extra effort and help you with shoes, restaurants and Milongas.

Tango w/ Lucia and Gerry. We booked a single class while on vacation in Buenos Aires. We booked last minute, and Lucia and Gerry were accommodating, and easy to coordinate with.We had a great time, learned the basics of the tango in a private class that was fun, not intimidating.I'd recommend Lucia and Gerry to anyone who is looking for a first time tango experience that will make them want to learn more!

Thank you very much!. We were in Buenos Aires for the first time and, like everybody, we associated the city with TANGO.I am a ballet teacher, but my husband didn't want ever to take lessons on any kind of dance. I am very grateful to Lucia and Jerry because they were so good teachers and they convinced my husband not to take one, but 3 lessons of tango.They know and they have the patience to explain you everything, and (very important) they choose the steps very carefully, so when you go from them you know a little dance. Of course that it's not possible in 3 lessons to know tango, but you know enough to dance one song. I think this is marvelous!They also took us to a real milonga, where we saw the local people dancing and an excellent band - absolutely fantastic!It was one of the best experiences we had in Buenos Aires!

Highlight of the trip!. My finace, Alex, and I were traveling to Buenos Aires for vacation and he suggested we take some tango lessons. We are getting married in June and thought, what a great dance to lead into after our traditional "first dance". In advance, Alex contacted Gerry and Lucia to schedule two private 1.5 hour classes with a group class in between. Alex and I already had chosen the song, so when scheduling the classes, we also indicated we wanted to dance to the song in "Scent of a Woman" : Por una cabeza (Carlos Gardel / Alfredo Le Pera). Gerry and Lucia in advance of our lessons thought about the dance and what moves we could learn in a short period and be able to replicate. Gerry and Lucia were always very quick to respond and the scheduling was one of the easiest that we experienced in Buenos Aires. We felt that the prices were reasonable, especially when you consider the individual attention you are receiving. The group class is extremely affordable and a great chance to dance with other tourists and locals alike. At first we were both a little nervous that we would not be advanced enough to participate in the group class as we had only had one lesson prior. However, the other students were of varying levels and beginners were welcome. In by no means are we now experts, but the tutelage from Jerry and Lucia was top notch. It was great because not only did I work with my finace on learning the moves, but since both Gerry and Lucia taught us, we were able to also work 1:1 with the experts. We purposely had the same song repeat so that we could really feel comfortable with the music and a few specific dance moves. Not only were Gerry and Lucia great teachers but at the end of our last session, they videoed them and us doing our dance with our song. Throughout all of the private classes they took photos of us. Now we will have pictures of our memories! We plan to practice with the video so that we don't forget our steps. The only slight negative that I have is that while we were in Buenos Aires during their summer (December 26-Jan. 2nd), it was extremely hot. Since it was also vacation (new year), where Gerry and Lucia normally teach was closed and we practiced in an old house in San Telmo with no air conditioning. They did bring a fan, which was very helpful, and provided cold water. Like many houses we saw, the studio was in a house that at one time was owned by someone very wealthy. The moulding on the outside and in was absolutely beautiful, coupled with gorgeous the marble staircase. Unfortunately, it is now a hostel so besides the room where we practiced, it was in need of some tender loving care (TLC). Looking back though, being in this environment gave me a true view into the lives of argentineans and if anything, the heat was something we all overcame. Besides learning how to tango, Gerry and Lucia invited us see Argentineans dance the Marengo at a local bar/ club. The night started off with an incredible 11 piece orchestra with 4 accordionists! Honestly, it was one of the best musical performances I have seen. Gerry and Lucia had reserved 2 large tables for their students and friends. While the musicians played, people danced on the floor in the center of the room. The club was packed so luckily we grabbed two big beers before we stat down. We sat at the table for about an hour and we were both completely mesmerized by the skill of the people on the floor. We have Gerry and Lucia to thank for such a memorable experience and it was definitely one of the best things we did on the trip!! We hope to see you next time we are back in Buenos Aires.

Great, relaxed tango dancing environment. Lucia and Gerry will tailor the class to you. They asked us what we wanted via email and when we got there, tailored it to our needs. We are klutzes, but still managed to learn a few moves in one hour. They spent time dancing with each of us individually as well so we could see what it felt like to really dance tango. Recommended!

Great Teachers. While staying in Buenos Aires I had been trying to find a good Tango teacher. Luckily through word of mouth I managed to find Lucia and Gerry's class. From day one I felt at ease, at home and welcomed into their Tango world. Lucia and Gerry are very enthusiastic and patient, they give you a lot of attention, they really want you to succeed. I wasn't just looking to learn a set of steps, but really learn how to dance Tango. There approach is based on learning how to feel the music, dance naturally, and relax in order to improvise effortlessly, as opposed to just learning a set of routine steps. They are teaching you the essence of Tango, to be free and enjoy the dance.They both have a lot of experience and passion for Tango and are well immersed in the Bs As Tango scene. After some classes Gerry and Lucia took us to authentic Milongas where you can practice. It doesn't matter what level you are, they will help you improve. If you want to really learn Tango in an encouraging and warm environment I cannot recommend Lucia and Gerry's classes enough.

Great Teachers. Great Experience.. If you're staying in Buenos Aires I highly recommend you take some Tango lessons from Gerry and Lucia. They have nearly 2 decades of teaching experience, they are immersed in the BA Tango culture and they both happen to be two of the sweetest people you'll ever meet.They offer both group lessons and one-on-one lessons. I recommend you do both. Their approach is very much based around how Tango is danced at the Milongas as opposed to how Tango is danced at Tango shows. Their focus is based around feeling the music as opposed to counting and robotically repeating steps. If you're new to the dance (as I was) they begin very basic and get you moving very simply. A big part of the dance is the relationship and collaboration between the two partners; one is a Lead and one is a Follow. Almost immediately they'll get you focused on your part in that relationship and how it's meant to feel. Both of them teach and advise on both the leading and following parts which is great because of their different perspectives. You'll definitely receive a lot of attention from them. I can't recommend their lessons enough. Even if you don't have any intention to continue on with the dance afterwards, it's worth it. It's all about moving to the music and that's how Gerry and Lucia and approach their teaching. Plus since they're immersed in the Tango community they can keep you up to date on the various Milongas happen in the city. They had the chance to go to two Milongas during our stay. It is such a great opportunity to see the beautiful dynamics of this amazing dance. I highly highly recommend Lucia and Gerry.

An authentic Tango experience. In our four day stay in BsAs my wife and I wanted to take a lesson from experienced dancers and teachers on a one to one basis. Gerry, who was very responsive and helpful to deal with by email suggested a one hour lesson followed by a visit to a neighbourhood milonga. Both of them were patient and helpful in the lesson assisting our limited abilities to carry out basic steps. The lesson started at 9pm and at 10 we walked a few blocks with them both to the milonga. There was an excellent ten piece band playing that night and watching the dancers on the floor expressing their interpretation of the music as the band improvised was fascinating to both listen and watch, we even got out on the floor. Whatever your tango ability, Gerry and Lucia will work very hard to ensure you get the best possible experience and Gerry send us great photos by email the following day for us to remember a very special evening. Highly recommended

Most memorable experience in BsAs!. I took 8 classes with Lucia and Gerry and I can say that taking their class was one of the best experiences i've had so far in BsAs. I took a class just by myself, which actually turned out better than i thought because i got a lot of attention from both instructors and at the end, i think i really started to get it and improved a lot! Loved that they invited me to the milonga after classes and welcomed my other friends who were interested. Even if you want to take a couple classes, I would totally recommend them over going to a milonga and trying out a group class. You will not learn much with so many people at those places! Overall, Lucia and Gerry are extremely talented dancers but even more, they are wonderful people who really want to share their passion with others and I am so lucky to have had this opportunity!

All that and more!!!!. Gerry and Lucia were everything trip adviser and blog affectionados said. Amazing people, excellent teachers, and inspirational dancers. They not only squeezed us in for a lesson on one of our only days in BA, but they also got my fiance flowers. ;-)They are truly gems.Josh and Dana

Learning Tango the right way….and have fun…. My wife and I took lessons from Gerry and Lucia and it was a very rewarding and fun experience. They took time to get us started on a right foot (literally) and exceeded our expectations. I would recommend to anyone who is serious to learn this dance. We plan to visit again in next 12 months after we practice and become expert at what they have taught us; also plan to advertise their services to our friends and family.

AMAZING LESSONS!!!. i met Lucia and Gerry on 2012 and since then i've taken tango lessons with them. they are great instructors, patience and caring!!! They pay attention to each student and always help you to improve at yOur dancing. So if you go to buenos aires, don[t miss the oportunity to meet them and learn some tango with them. they teach all levels!!!!!

Tango Lesson. I recently vacationed in Buenos Aires, Argentina with a group of eight friends. I wanted to take a tango lesson. I have been taking lessons in the US for the past year and wanted to experience a lessons in the home of the tango. Several of my friends, who had not previously taken a tango lesson, also wanted to join me. Our private group lesson was a great success. Lucia & Gerry made everone feel good about themselves and not embarrassed when they made a mistake. We had a great time, and one of the newbies wanted to take another lesson, but our time didn't permit. I did schedule a private lesson for myself and enjoyed it very much. If you are a beginner or someone with some dance experience, and want to take a tango lesson in a friendly, low key, casual, and warm atmosphere , I highly recommend Lucia & Gerry.

tango lessons. if you have an hour or two -DO YOURSELF A FAVOUR and join Gerry and Lucia for a lesson. Best 400Peso's i spent in Beunos Aires. They are amazing in the way they make the danced a life experience. Very good teachers and very entertaining way to learn to dance - HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Tango to Travel For!. Bottom line first: if you are looking for tango instruction in English, Spanish or both, dance, do not walk, to Buenos Aires to study with Lucia and Gerry. We just completed 14 hours (7 private 2 hour lessons each day for a week) and have nothing but rave reviews to offer!My husband is 83 years old and has broken each hip at different times skiing. He and I LOVE to dance but we've had bad experiences with tango teaching. For example, we spent two weeks in Buenos Aires at the Esquela de Tango taking 2 or 3 lessons per day (or more) and learned only that we really wished we could dance tango! The instructors came and went with, in general, no particular interest in their beginning students, focusing on the more advanced ones and offering nothing more than rote instruction. Great food in BA, but no tango success on that trip.So we approached Lucia and Gerry warily, hoping that private lessons might do the trick. And it did! Gerry and Lucia were in the midst of changing locations for teaching but they went out of their way to make sure that we were not inconvenienced in the least by their situation, going so far as to meet us at our hotel to walk us each day to the new place, giving us some relaxed personal time with them.They are great teachers. Their commitment and enthusiasm, coupled with their gentle, non judgmental style of making everything right and then better ("There is no such thing as being on the wrong foot if you are still standing and your partner is, too!") and their lovely, articulate movement style are wonderful encouragers as you approach what could otherwise be a daunting and complicated dance.Even better, they have a very clear idea of what to include and what to exclude from the teaching rubric so that the basics are well articulated and accessible.Then, when we attended a milonga and watched amazing dancers, we realized that we had acquired, quickly, efficiently and painlessly, a basic vocabulary upon which to build a tango movement library. What a delight.I cannot recommend Lucia and Gerry highly enough. In fact, I would like to arrange for them to come to Santiago de Chile, where we live, to teach here. They are too good not to share!Tango? Buenos Aires? Lucia and Gerry!Rima E. Laibow, MD

"It takes two to tango". We emailed Lucia and Gerry well before visiting Buenos Aires, seeking information about lessons. They replied immediately (in perfect English) and invited us to their group lesson and milonga. So we went along. We were 'hooked' and arranged to have 5 private lessons in the 6 days we were in BA.Lucia and Gerry were extremely welcoming and accommodating. They managed to fit us in their busy schedule and we had five private lessons as well as their regular group lessons.Their teaching style was friendly and fun. At no time did we feel embarrassed from our limited ability. Both Lucia and Gerry were extremely patient and encouraging.We would definitely go back when we are next in BA.

Just what a beginner wants!. I was finding it hard to find a class suitable for beginners, English speakers, cheap(AR$40) and with a relaxed style when I came across Lucia and Gerry's tango. Without following a rigorous routine you pick up the basic steps and style needed for tango so after just one class you could go off to a milonga and have fun! The teachers are great and friendly and more experienced students also help you along so you are always learning in this 90 minute class. There is also a chance to take part in the milonga after and food and drink there too. Perfect experience for a tourist wanting to get a feel for the dance in a relaxed atmosphere and also for others who want to reach an advanced level they give personal tuition to everyone during that one class! Loved it!

Lucia and Gerry are wonderful people and skillful instructors. My husband and I have no tango experience, and we booked a private lesson for my birthday. The tripadvisor reviews were very positive, and I was attracted to the idea of instructors who are invested in establishing a reputation, versus the very well-known venues that appear in the tourist guides and can coast on their legacy. The prices are great -- the group lessons are really a bargain, but we thought we'd benefit from the extra attention of a private lesson, which was also very reasonably priced. We were 15-20 minutes late due to poor planning, but Lucia and Gerry were very understanding. I thought the lesson would only last 45 minutes due to our late arrival, but after we left I realized they had instructed us for well over an hour. We both really enjoyed the class, even my husband, who was dubious at first. Their approach is not formulaic, but instead is to teach the feel and intuition of tango dancing. The goal of this approach is to prepare dancers for a traditional milonga, where the style is more improvised. By the end of the class I felt I could tango well enough with an experienced partner. Most importantly, Lucia and Gerry were kind but instructive teachers, and we had a great time.

Fun Experience. Gary and Lucia are excellent dancers and were very patient with a mother and son attempting to learn the tango. They were great teachers and very patient. Would've loved to have attended one of their milanga but we weren't able to attend due to our schedule. For tourists wishing to "learn", or take a lesson, I would highly recommend Gary and Lucia. It was a lot of fun!

Authentic and friendly. I picked out this place because of other good reviews and location. It was just up the road from the hostel I stayed in. I was really pleased to find Lucia and Gerry! The lesson was such fun and we learnt in a 'feel it' way rather than 'put your foot here' way. Gerry is from Ireland so speaks perfect English. Lucia is also a very good English speaker. The class was small (maybe 5 of us of varying levels) and they made sure everybody got the attention they needed. You can do the one group lesson or a set of lessons - individual if you're really serious about learning more than just getting a taster. You know they're good when other dance teachers come to the Milonga they hosted another night. I can't speak more highly of these people!

Such patience!. I had a private lesson with Lucia and Gerry in Buenas Aires last week. I thoroughly enjoyed it and would highly recomend it. I'm not a dancer and I hadn't a clue about tango so my expectations were fairly low for what I would achieve at the end of an hour. Imagine my surprise when they got me to master many of the basic steps in under an hour! Unfortunately it was my last day in BA or I would definitely have gone back for more. Towards the end of the lesson Lucia very kindly recorded a video for me on my phone and what a revelation - I actually danced! My friends have been very impressed! Lucia and Gerry teach in a very straightforward manner, no time wasting, and they made everything very understandable for me, even though my standard must have been well below what they are used to. They are very pleasant people. And such patience!

nice, cool and efficient tango lessons. So relaxing ! a real pleasure to learn basics : steps, positions and body feelings. So nice to be able to communicate even if you don't speak Spanish, English comes to you, and even classes can be organized according to your plans.After only 1 class, being able to take a modest part in a milonga was amazing. Just looking forward for the next time.

Great tango lessons. I had a private lesson and a group lesson with Lucia and Gerry. I had some experience with other dances, but not with tango. They explained everything in a really thorough and relaxed way. I also went to the milonga. They make you feel part of it, I had a great time!

Patient and Instructive. I was a little nervous to take a Tango lesson on my own. I have put it off for years, but decided I could not not take a lesson or two when I was in the Tango capital of the world! I read my reviews and Lucia & Gerry seemed to be the perfect fit. And boy was I was right! I scheduled my first lesson with them and they were quick to respond and very accommodating with days and times. The place where they have their lessons is very easy to find and when you walk through the doors you automatically feel at ease and in safe hands. You can tell Lucia and Gerry have been doing this a while. My first lesson was a whirlwind of steps and form, but I was assured I was doing quite well. This only boosted my confidence! I think that is what I like best about Lucia and Gerry, they make you feel confident in a dance that can be very intimidating! I ended up taking one more private lesson and two group lessons. I even went to the Milonga that they have every Tuesday night after their group lesson, and it's for free! Plus at this Milonga you actually will have people willing to dance with you, even if you don't know the Tango very well! Lucia and Gerry have the patience and skill to teach you this amazing dance. They are the best I found in Buenos Aires, who will actually teach you and not just show off their skill. Please, if you are in Buenos Aires, taking a Tango lesson is a must, and there is no better couple to take it from than Lucia and Gerry!

Wonderful lesson. Although it was supposedly a group lesson, we were lucky enough to have only 1 more person in the class besides me and my partner. So practically a private lesson by accident! Lucia and Gerry were very sweet, professional and made us excited to take more classes in the future. Shame we did the class on our last night in Buenos Aires - we'd definitely be going back for more if we could. Thank you for a wonderful way to end our trip in BA!

relaxed but professional. I went to BsAs with one task in mind - to learn tango. I had one month only so it was very important to find somebody who could make a miracle - transform me (elephant type) into (kind of) milonga dancer...so I found Lucia & Gerry. They not only tought me the steps but they also made me believe I can be good in tango. The classes were always very relaxed but we didn't waste the time. Both Lucia and Gerry tried the steps with me and my partner so we exactly knew what we were supposed to be doing. I took classes with other teachers as well to compare and quickly I realised that in other places they wanted me to have fun but not to teach me much. With Lucia and Gerry it was different. Each class I left with the feeling that I learnt something new. The atmosphere was also great. Lucia and Gerry are very open people and you feel like being tought by your friends. Not to mention that they can speak English so it makes it easier to understand the whole idea. So if you don't want to waste your time/money on watching somebody else showing off but you really want to learn something, take a class with this wonderful couple...once you do...remember to relax;) - you will get the joke after the first class...

Convenient, fun, safe, comfortable!. We decided we wanted a tango experience in Buenos Aires in ealy March so we went to a show and we took a tango class. The tango class was a private lesson from Gerry (an Irishman!) and Lucia (a fun Argentine beauty). It was in a milonga right in the center of town. The location was right around the corner from a busy intersection where we could easily get a taxi back to the hotel. It was a cute little place. Gerry and Lucia worked with us for an hour. They were very patient and we enjoyed the experience. They invited us to come back to the milonga the next evening for a group lesson and practice, and then a late exhibition. We did so. It was a lot of fun. About a dozen couples participated in the group lessons, Then it was open dance floor for a an hour or so and we just practiced (Drinking and snacking between sets). We did not feel uncomfortable at all and Lucia and Gerry walked around and continued to help people who were tying to learn. It was fun to watch the regulars when tey started coming in about 9P. But we danced too ans stil felt comfortable.The single guys were on one side and the single ladies on another, but us couples sat on either end. It was great! i would rrecommend Gerry and Lucia if you want a comfortable, safe, tango experience. You will not feel at all intimidated. It is more like being at the home of friends (or in this case, the milonga!) mThe prices is very reasonable, especially group night. Do it!

Tango Lessons. We had a couple of lessons with Lucia and Gerry, I had done some tango before but my partner hadn't. They accommodated both our levels of tango very well. They were fun teachers, who had lots of patience and experience, would highly reccommend.

Great private tango lesson. My fiance and I took a private tango lesson with Lucia and Gerry on our recent trip to BA for a wedding. The two were very flexible in terms of scheduleing the lession and have a real passion for the Tango which is contagious. Gerry is a native english speaker, so communication is no problem. We had a great time and plan on finding a local instructor in NYC to continue with the lessons. One point of feedback for them is that Gerry and Lucia often demonstrate a series of steps and then ask us to do it. I had a really hard itme replicating the steps just by watching them and found it easier when each of them paired up with me and my fiance to show us the steps individually before we tried it together.
Tango lessons. We have learnt a lot and also had so much fun!! We further recommend the Tango hours by Lucia & Gerry.

Authentic tango with Irish twist. As complete beginners we had a great night starting with the dance lesson and then we were utterly entertained by the wonderful dancing at the milonga afterwards. We were surprised and delighted that Gerry is Irish also! Great authentic way to experience tango in its purest form. Highly recommended for everybody. Great night.

Great Teachers. Gerry and Lucia are simply the best tango instructors I have had. They were able to correct my basic moves and teach me new steps. Very personable. A great local milonga afterwards also.

If you want tango lessons in Buenos Aires look no further!. Don't hesitate to have a few lessons with Lucia and Gerry. They are very friendly, patient, tango teachers who speak English, which is a huge help when learning a new dance! We had not danced the tango before but were determined to step onto the dance floor at a milonga. We had two private lessons with Lucia and Gerry and another one at their milonga at Av Rivadavia. We only wish we had had more time to tango and build our confidence to enjoy further milongas. Thanks to both of you for your patience and encouragement. We highly recommend Lucia and Gerry to anybody wanting to learn tango in BA

Great Teachers and Dancers!. My wife and I had been discussing taking dance lessons for some time now. Naturally, with us travelling to Buenos Aires, it only made sense to take a Tango lesson while in town. It should be noted that neither my wife nor I are experienced dancers and our experience in general is almost nil. That said, we are so happy that our first Tango experience was in the trusted hands of Lucia & Gerry. They were patient with both of us as we were learning our footwork and getting our rhythm. They broke down the steps into easy to understand movements that allowed us to build up our confidence and eventually execute the dance properly to the music. (This after making many mistakes that they continued to let us work through.) My wife and I look forward to continuing to take Tango lessons back in NYC and thanks to Lucia and Gerry we look forward to keeping them updated to our progress. We can't thank them enough!

FANTASTIC TEACHERS AND WONDERFUL FRIENDS. We found Lucia and Gerry on Trip Advisor and they were exactly what we look for in teachers - patient, with an ability to deconstruct the movement to make it easy (-er!) to understand for people who've never danced tango before. Not only that but they are INCREDIBLE dancers - just loved watching them together!!We booked in for one 2hr class to see how we liked it and ended up booking in for another 3. We'd never been to BA before and Lucia and Gerry took us under their wings and showed us some places to eat and visit and brought us along to some milongas. It was the first thing we did in BA and it was a great move for us because it meant that we met some local friends straightaway! We look forward to seeing them when they come to visit in Australia (better be soon guys!!).We would recommend Lucia and Gerry to anyone who's interested in learning tango in BA!

A fantastic way to experience part of Buenos Aires!. We enjoyed a very memorable 1 hour tango lesson with Lucia and Gerry in San Telmo on a Sunday evening while visiting Buenos Aires. What a perfect time -- we could walk through the San Telmo market on the way to the lesson, and for only AR20 pesos per person, it was such a steal. We were complete beginners to tango, and while there were other people in the class who were learning more complex steps, Lucia and Gerry were very helpful to adjust the level to beginner steps for us. Although ours was a group class, it might have also been called semi-private as there were only 6 people in the whole class, so we got plenty of individual attention to teach us along the way. The location (on Defensa in San Telmo) was also fun - it was some sort of African cultural center, so there was a lot of fun rhythmic drumming going on outside as the market was going on.We don't speak much Spanish but both Lucia and Gerry are fluent in English so there was no issue with the language.I've recommended this already to other friends who were in Buenos Aires as a great way to inexpensively experience the tango. That said - one lesson isn't nearly enough to learn very much!

Classes with Lucia & Gerry. Lucia & Gerry have an amazing deep knowledge of tango as it's danced in Buenos Aires. They cut through all the urban myths about the dance, coming to the heart of a movement. If I am not leading a movement correctly, they effortlessly locate the exact place where I'm going wrong & correct it. Most times it is something a simple as I'm letting my weight drift form the ball of my foot to the heel or I'm starting to turn the follow a fraction too late.If you want to dance with the locals at la Nacional or Cachirulo, you can find no better teachers!

knowledgable and fun. We did group,semi-private,and the tuesday milonga. We left with increased knowledge that has improved our dancing already. We attended several different milongas and Gerry and Lucia's was the best, they are warm in their approach. Thankyou for your hospitality and for sharing your love of Tango.

charming & professional. Well, we tried both - the tuesday milonga and a private class with lucía and gerry. we definately will go back :-) the milonga is charming, nice ambience, perfect music-mix and hosted with sensitivity.the private class was full of helpful advice to improve our dance. the two experts could spot immediately our 'weak parts' and had professional advice how to reduce effort and enjoy even more our tango-dancing.we had met other teachers before and felt really comfortable with lucía and gerry. best choice!

Milogna & Lessom. We went to their Tuesday night Milogna and it was great. We have been to several others around town, and this was the first one to make us feel welcome. The dancing was not too crowded which made it easy to relax and dance out limited repertoire. We also had a private lesson which was great. They helped us understand what simple things we were doing wrong that prevented us from connecting, and some simple things we can work on to improve. It was great not to just taught steps, but how to step together.

Great people, great tango!. There was some misunderstanding with the new schedule for lessons, so we were the only couple there for the class. Lucia and Gerry were amazing and gave us a "semi" private lesson, completely adjusting to what we knew and teaching us a bunch of new things. We loved the local feeling with the added advantage that they can teach you in either Spanish or English. Highly recommended!

Great Tango lesson. My wife and I had a great time learning the tango with Lucia and Gerry. They certainly know their stuff and made the lesson very enjoyable. The lesson has encouraged us to consider further lessons at home. A pleasant and memorable experience during our stay in Buenos Aires. We would heartily recommend this to anyone thinking of lessons.

Lucia & Gerry - Great authentic experience !. If you want to try (to learn) Tango with people who are very helpful and at the same time avoid being ripped off by local agents through "amazing tango shows" then go for this. It is very affordable, Gerry & Lucia are more than friendly and you can stay after to watch professionals in local malonga. I believe group classes are Tuesdays and Sundays though you can book private also.

Learn to Tango without tears!. Gerry and Lucia introduced a couple of beginners in a very short time to the Tango.They made it so easy and we had the steps very quickly.So if you are in Buenos Aires and always wanted to learn the Tango Gerry and Lucia are the people to book.Well done!

Tango in a really authentic setting. We had a great time with Lucia & Gerry. Our group, 12 Tango newbies, all enjoyed the workshop a lot. The setting is amazing ... talk about of the beaten trail. After our short introduction, we ended up at a Milonga. Not what most expected, but nevertheless quite a memorable AND authentic Buenos Aires experience. Highly recommended!

Incredible value for your money. It's amazing how much fun my wife and I had in our first class with Gerry and Lucia. They were patient and speak English (Gerry is Irish). The lessons were easy to follow and it was very affordable! The price of the class is even cheaper than a movie ticket and certainly a lot more fun and enriching!

Tango Workshop in Cork, Ireland Sept 2012. Good solid teachers! What I liked best was that they made the effort to dance with workshop participants to give them individual correction and tips!!!! I would take their workshops again!

Brilliant Classes by Gerry & Lucia at Cork Tango in July!. Gerry and Lucia visited us in Cork Tango in July. The workshops were brilliant, we had two wonderful evenings with them. People in the classes liked the personal attention they received. Do seek them out in Buenos Aires if you are there. We look forward to their next visit to Ireland!

Enjoyment guaranteed in tango classes with Gerry and Lucia. Following recommendations prior to my trip to Buenos Aires I managed to join a class taught by Gerry and Lucia in San Telmo and enjoyed it a lot. The instructions were very clear and one of the pair was always ready to make them a felt experience. The milonga that followed will be remembered for a long time for its relaxed and friendly atmosphere, great music and the lovely dances to be had - even as a beginner! I had another taste of their great teaching skills this summer when I joined the Vals workshops offered in Dublin: light-hearted and well thought-out presentation, fun guaranteed, great balance with a focus on principles and on-going individual attention for all couples - and whatever we were up against... Marina

Class with Lucia and Gerry. During the recent visit by Lucia and Gerry to Dublin, I attended their 2 Vals workshops and also took a private class with them. I found their instruction to be extremely clear and their attention perfectly balanced between music, connection and technique. They gave me very useful pointers about my own dance and how to refine it. Like all good teachers, they conveyed this information in a way that has really stayed with me. That gift is rare. Their style of salon tango is subtle, elegant and courteous and reflects how tango is danced in the best milongas in Bs As. I recommend them highly.Bernadette

Tango in Dingle. Lucia and Gerry brought great fun and expertise to our class in Dingle. We have plenty of inspiration from their visit to continue our practise. We would recommend anyone visiting BsAsto join their classes and Milongas.Leslie & Anne

Dancing with Lucia y Gerry. We first encountered Lucia & Gerry at a class in Belfast and enjoyed their teaching style so much that we arranged both a private lesson and attended a workshop in Dublin so that we could consolidate what we learned and extend our practice. In the Dublin, the Stag's Heading provided a perfect environment (though a higher temperature would have been nice!) and complemented the experience. What we've remembered remains in our current dance and what we've forgotten is still on video. ... I've discovered I've enough air miles to get us both to Buenos Aires so a refresher is a possibility!Chris & Hilary

Outstanding tango classes. My Wife and I have recently returned from traveling around South America. While in Buenos Aires we decided to try some Tango. We couldn´t have picked teachers to start us on our way. With patience and fun they got us off to a great start. The classes were a hour long and we really felt we came away with something every class. Both Lucia and Gerry speak English so that really helped. We also went to the Milonga they organise and saw the locals dance, we had a go ourselves and had a great time there. Highly recommended if you are in Buenos Aires.

Great experience in Tango with Lucia and Gerry. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our Tango dance lesson with Lucia and Gerry. They managed to teach our group in both English and Spanish. They taught the basics at our beginner level and they managed to teach more challenging steps for the other students within the same class. I really felt like I had a lot of personal attention!

Professional teaching in a very friendly, casual atmosphere.. Lucia and Gerry understand it to teach people with different levels of tango dancing during the same class. They adapt the level of difficulty easily to every participant and manage to pay careful attention to every student. They create a very friendly, casual but professional atmosphere. Do not miss the class before their Milonga. A good way to start the tango evening and a nice opportunity to meet other tango dancers.

Great tango classes!. We have been in Buenos Aires for 5 months. We've taken tango classes about once a week for 4 months, but just dicovered Lucia & Gerry a month and a half ago. What a wonderful discovery - not only do they speak English, they are really helpful teachers. Very observant and good instruction for beginners as well as middle and advanced students. Our comfort with tango increase expotentially with each session with Lucy and Gerry. I would recommend Lucy and Gerry to everyone from beginners to advanced dancers. All that and they make it fun, fun, fun.

It is a must to experience the friendly atmosphere in Flor de Milonga. Flor de Milonga is located in the heart of San Telmo. On our three -week vacation i Buenos Aires, we visited the place often. The casual and informal atmosphere, the engaged tango-teachers (Lucy & Gerry - and others) - and the friendly people moreover did that we would come again and again.It is a nice local and intimate place. Experience it yourself !

Great tango teachers. My partner and I have been dancing tango for 10 years. Lucia and Gerry are very observant and quickly helped us undo bad habits and learn new steps. They are sweet and easy to work with. Gerry has lived in the states and his English is excellent. We took four private lessons and many group classes from them. Highest recommendations for all levels of dancers.

The highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. The highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires was meeting Lucia and Gerry at their Tango Milonga. Our first night, we sat and watched their students and others dance the sensual Tango with their suggestive dress, shoes and flair. Soon, we enrolled for lessons with the Irish Gerry and the beautiful Lucia. Each shared in our individual lessons and encouragement, plus providing in a treasure of Argentine Tango. The final Milonga included dinner and a 12 piece band which played into the evening. Our Tango needs more work, but the experience filled our search for Argentina's legacy. We were warmly received by and experienced our most Argentinian experience with Gerry and Lucia!!

A great foundation on which to learn to dance tango. I took private classes with Lucia and Gerry and was hugely impressed by their seriousness and dedication. They are not textbook teachers, but have developed a whole method which they review constantly on an individual basis, really thinking about what the issues are with each student and how to resolve them. Very lovely, patient and effective. Their Milonga in San Telmo on Wednesday night is great too, with a group class beforehand.

Beautiful tango dancers, and superb, caring teachers. Gerry and Lucía know and dance the authentic tango -- they are beautiful dancers -- and they know how to teach it to anyone, even those with two left feet! Moreover, they are patient and caring -- they really want you to learn the tango and to dance it as it should be danced. I most highly recommend both their group classes (in their milonga) and their private classes. You need not be nervous about taking a class with them, as they know how to make their students feel relaxed. Moreover they teach in both English and Castellano (he is from Ireland, originally, she from Buenos Aires). I guarantee that you will feel comfortable and that you will not be disappointed.-Shel E.

Very nice classes. In the end of 2011 I went to a very nice milonga called ¨Flor de Milonga¨. Overthere I had a class with Gerry and Lucia. I liked so much that I asked for Gerry if I could have some private classes. I had 5 classes. Of course I have a lot to learn about tango, but these classes was enough to show me the basics. Both, Gerry and Lucia, were very patient with me. They even recorded some videos and took some pics for me to show to my friends.As soon as I come back to BsAs I´ll call them to take some more classes. Thank You very much!Best Regards

I really appreciated their relaxed fun attitude and was made to feel very welcome with them at a local milonga.. Tango was very new to me and I think that a mixture of group and private lessons is very worthwhile. Lucia and Gerry were quite relaxed and made the private lessons fun. They were flexible as to times and wanted me to learn how to dance and enjoy the tango at milongas which is what it is all about. The local milonga which they run had such a lovely feeling of community and was very welcoming that it was one of the highlights of my time in BsAs.Linda from Canada

Interesting place and helpful english speaking tango teachers. Lucia and Gerry teach tango at several places, among them the venue at Avenida Independencia 572 (San Telmo), where they also run a milonga after the lesson. The venue, a real neighborhood place to learn tango, is very pleasant, altho unairconditioned, and several milongas are held there on different days of the week. Each of them is preceded by lessons. The lessons given by Lucia and Gerry are clear , geared to the level of the dancers, and are in both English and Spanish. Both Lucia and Gerry are kind, helpful, and very pleasant to work with.My husband and I spent two months in Buenos Aires studying tango and highly recommend the dance venue at Independencia 572 and the classes of Gerry and Lucia.

Gerry and Lucia Have the Patience of Saints. I never thought I could learn to dance Tango--but Gerry and Lucia have given me more than hope--if I stick to it I will be able to!Which wasn't a foregone conclusion. I first took a class--as part of a group-- and felt foolish. I knew that I was a difficult student--more so than average--and would not have taken another class. I expressed this after the class--that I wasn't coming back. But Gerry had a charming way of not telling the truth--in a way that is really helpful! "You're just used to things coming easily for you--learning to dance Tango takes TIME.While failing to convince me that other students improve as slowly ("you're just average") both Lucia and Gerry convinced me that if I stick to it I WILL eventually be, if not a great dancer, at least good enough to be able to go to any Milonga, not make a fool of myself--and just have fun.And I think I should say at this point that for people who are not natural dancers? Private lessons are best. I have taken lessons--both group an private with both Lucia and Gerry and both are equally patient. (I actually prefer Gerry--as he is Irish, so he communicates in English in a way Lucia, who is Argentine, can't quite manage.. And as Gerry has to dance the woman's part? It isn't clumsy as he and Lucia are about the same size.I am sure that before 2012 is out I'll be dancing at a reasonable level--thanks to Lucia and Gerry. They are pleasant people and good teachers. I recommend them

Lovely couple, so friendly and a great way to get introduced to tango!. Visited Gerry and Lucia as a surprise to my wife on our honeymoon. I knew my wife really wanted to try a tango lesson. The tango shows you can buy tickes for are good and include a brief tango lesson, but that's with 30 other people! With Gerry and Lucia it's 1:1 private lesson with no one else around (so it doesn't matter if yo can't dance like me!). We opted for a 2 hour lesson, which was just the right time. G&L even surprised my wife with a bouquet of flowers, so generous of them. In the lesson itself, they were both so friendly and patient and really worked with us so we could learn the steps to a brief dance with a few neat swanky steps! Thanks to you both for making it a special surprise. Would recommend to anyone wanting some private tuition with a verh friendly and professional couple. Thanks you G&L! :-)

Buenos Aires solo. After my travelling companion was too sick to travel I found myself in Buenos Aires alone. I had been planning this trip all year as I wanted to immerse myself in an authentic tango experience and I was determined to achieve this. Gerry and Lucia were recommended to me by a few friends in Australia so I contacted them as soon as I arrived. I had only been tangoing for 18 months and I wanted to concentrate on technique so i booked 5 private lessons with Gerry and Lucia and 3 of them took place in my apartment in San Telmo.They really took me under their wing and I went to quite a few milongas with Lucia and the Tuesday night milongas they organised in Sam Telmo (actually this was my favorite milonga in a slightly shabby but atmospheric hall with really friendly people and live music). I even had a 'tango moment" at the Nino Bien milonga which I will never forget! I know I was a bit of a challenge but Gerry and Lucia were so patient and kind and I learnt so much from them. They really made my trip so much more enjoyable and it gave me an introduction to the authentic tango experience I had been seeking. I can thoroughly recommend them as caring, experienced, authentic tango teachers who will help you experience the real Buenos Aires tango scene. I will be back!

An amazing tango experience for a beginner. We took a tango class with Gerry and Lucia while I was visiting Buenos Aires with the Finnish female choir I sing in. Although we were many G nad L managed to teach us all the basics and gave us the possibility to understand the basic logic of the tnago. It was an amazing experience! We got the chance to practive with some really experienced tango dance partners and the music was great. Even the vemue was perfect, cerating a perfect ambience for dancing tango. If you want to go to a milonga in Buenos Aires, I really recommend a tango class to be taken beforehand, since you'll be able to grasp at least a little bit of this fascinating dance.

A must in Buenos Aires...seriously. My sister and I stayed 10 days in BA last June and we decided to take tango lessons. We found Lucia & Gerry tango lessons on Tripadvisor and gave it a try. First we went for a Tuesday-night milonga, a 1 hour class with other people, mostly beginners as ourselves. Lucia and Gerry were so nice that we decided to take a 2-hour private lesson the day after and it was simply amazing. They are very patient and funny teachers; we also got a delicious expresso from the building manager while we were waiting for them! In any case I would definitely recommend their class to anybody.

A genuine ( and delightful ) BA tango experience- look no further. We were in BA in September 2011, love tango but still both very much novices despite lessons in Australia. We wanted to have some classes in BA but how to choose? There seemed to be hundreds of teachers advertising lessons in the various tango magazines and on line- the choice was overwhelming- and we wanted something authentic, not just a tourist experience. Lucia and Gerry were recommended by staff in VB shoes, San Telmo and turned out to be the best teachers we could have hoped for. Firstly, they are skilful and experienced dancers -- their dancing is a delight to watch, mesmerising, connected, deceptively simple ( they have the ability to make each step look as though there is plenty of time, no hurry ). Secondly they are excellent teachers. Adults can find it hard to adjust to being beginners again and trying to learn new sets of skills - Lucia and Gerry were very good at guiding, correcting, repeating, showing, trying another way of explaining if we couldn't grasp something, and all with genuine warmth, encouragement and humour. We learnt things about leading , following and connectedness that we'd never grasped before. We loved the venues that they taught in - we went to three different places, all in San Telmo - one was a very beautiful old private residence ( owned by a friend of theirs) with typically BA architecture, high ceilings, parquetry floors, ornate wrought iron stair case railings - it was a wonderful experience seeing the building, let alone having a dance lesson there. They also invited us to one of their group classes, held in a community hall / Arts centre, which was an experience of everyday BA, definitely not touristy. Finally , Lucia and Gerry are genuine and warm people, and talking to them is very interesting - Gerry is happy to tell about his journey from Ireland to eventually settling in BA with Lucia, and is an entertaining and intelligent raconteur. Talking with them you get a feel for what it might be like living in BA, and not just being a visitor / tourist . Gerry is clearly fluent in English, being Irish originally, and Lucia's English is quite good as well.Can't recommend them highly enough - great teachers, great dancers, felt we had a genuine tango experience and slice of life in BA.Happy dancing, Rolf and Iris.

The perfect introduction to Tango in Buenos Aires. I highly recommend Tango lessons with Lucia & Gerry in Buenos Aires, they are the finest teachers in the city, and the classes are definitely worth the price/fees paid! I visited Buenos Aires recently and was very keen to learn tango in the most authentic way, as it is danced socially (milonga style) The touristic tango shows were not was I was looking for and my classes with Lucia & Gerry really opened up the doors to the world of Tango in Buenos Aires! The classes were so warm and friendly, Lucia & Gerry have a great teaching style (it helps that classes are conducted in Spanish and English) and truly demonstrate to the students the ease and flow that is true to the sensual Argentine Tango! After the Sunday class, there was a demonstration by other students and I got to interact with the locals. Totally had a blast! I was so pleased, I also attended another class on Tuesday which was followed by an awesome milonga (Flor de Milonga) hosted by Lucia & Gerry. I thoroughly enjoyed the milonga sessions and watching everyone dance was great while I tried to put my lessons to use as well. They also feature an exhibition/performance by professional tango couples at their milongas, must attend!!

start here before wasting time and money. I have had many tango teachers in BA and elsewhere over the past four years... but Gerry and Lucia are the only ones I work with now. They focus on what is actually important in learning and perfecting tango. After the first class I had that "finally!" feeling, which has continued from the beginning level to the more advanced. I can not remember when I recommended someone other than Gerry and Lucia to people looking for tango professors!

Wonderful couple. Jerry and Lucia had their biggest test ever when I turned up. I took private lessons and within just a few sessions they managed to get me dancing. All of the classes were fun and they consistently demonstrated a level of patience that would make a saint proud. Jerry is Irish, which helped with the language barrier, and Lucia speaks more-than-adequate English. As well as private lessons, they also runs classes and several milongas. They work very hard thats for sure and its clear that they are well-respected amongst the local community.

We found our lessons with Gerry and Lucia the best in Buenos Aires. My husband Rob and I went back to BA after 18 months, and our first telephone call was to Gerry and Lucia to organise some private lessons. We had had lessons during our last visit and found them so helpful we wanted more!! The private lessons were fantastic and we also attended their Milonga in San Telmo. This Milonga is very friendly and full of locals who just love to dance. Gerry and Lucia are such a lovely couple, they have a great way of explaining the dance and the techniques needed to really enjoy it. Often with lessons in BA, language can be a problem, but not with these guys, they speak both Spanish and English fluently. Our experience in some of the larger more well known studios was not so positive, yet here with Gerry and Lucia we felt totally comfortable and improved quickly. All in all I would recommend them to anyone with absolute confidence.

A great way to experience Tango. In August i was in Buenos Aires and wanted to experiment some original Tango. Lots of (expensive) shows are offered but those are purely turistic and i preferred to look for a traditional milonga, a place where the people from Buenos Aires go to dance the tango.Through a recco from a nearby restaurant, we found Jerry and Lucia's place by coincidence and it was great!they are extremely friendly and you can interact with the locals in a pleasant and informal way. I don;t remember what the entrance fee was but it nothing near what the turistic shows ask and we had a blast! We had drinks, watched the locals dance, tried a bit ourselves, chatted with Jerry and in the end of the evening there was also a demonstration from the teachers, really great! If you want to see the real tango, go here (website www.luciaygerrytango.wordpress.com)

Learn to Tango. We both came to Buenos Airies to experience the "way of life" and learn Tango.We were a little apprehensive but were soon put at ease by Gerry and Lucia.We booked for private lessons, met at a studio at San Telmo and we were away.What a great night, lessons followed by a Milonga also run by our teachers.Private lessons are the only way to go and Gerry and Lucia are fantastic in their teaching style, attention to detail and true interest in our development.

Great way to learn Tango. We enjoy attending their friendly atmosphere Tango lession, every year we set foot in Buenos Aires. One can apply their lession immediately into any Milonga environment. They speak fluent English and Spanish. And they also work patiently with each individual, regardless to their level, to make sure they got it. We wholeheartedly recommend it and vouch for your complete satisfaction.
Tango in Buenos Aires. Superb classes, and great teachers in Spanish and English. They are endlessly patient and thorough. Go to the class and stay for the milonga ... no extra charge.Bill.

Super teachers. Spending over two months each year dancing in Buenos Aires, I am keen to access excellent teaching at an accessible price. Lucia and Gerry provide precisely this. They are experienced, very friendly, and pitch instruction at the right level for their students. How refreshing! They teach in both Castillano and English.

If it takes two to tango then they are the perfect couple!. From November 2010 through to the end of January 2011 we took private lessons and participated in a number of the weekly Flor de Milonga evenings. We took these classes as a couple and it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience. It is probably true that 60+ is late in the day to start, and in that sense, we fell on our feet in finding Lucia and Gerry. They are truly skilled teachers, great communicators and quickly became very good friends. What we particularly is their approach to the discipline of Tango. This is authentic and ignores the melodramatic posturing associated with the offerings in many of the "tourist show" venues. Despite the intense concentration required and the physical demands, the classes were also great fun and we left each session really looking forward to the next booking. For us, tango is a five year project and we can't wait to get back to Lucia and Gerry's studio in BA.

wonderful teachers and friendly environment. Lucia and Gerry are wonderful teachers and the environment is very friendly.They are patient and persistent and really take time and encourage their students.I enjoy their Flor de Tango Milonga in historic and cool San Telmo.

Worth the price. Went for the dinner and show. A notch above the Ventana Tango which is in the same building. Stage is at the level of tables which surround it so it gives a more intimate feeling. Dancers and musicians are all outstanding. Left feeling that I wanted to visit all of Argentina. Dinner was delicious and service outstanding. Will remember this one for a long time.

Good show, average meal, poor service. One too many cows gave its life to feed our tour group of 20 - steaks were far bigger than necessary & no one in our group finished theirs. Notwithstanding, the meat was very good quality but a bit on the dry side - more well done than the medium rare I asked for.After 2 unsuccessful attempts to get the waiter to bring me a beer, I had to ask the Spanish speaking tour leader to follow up with my order, even though our evening's activities included unlimited wine and beer. I think they were keen on flogging their undated cheap house wine ahead of anything else.Waiter turned up at our table half way through our appetiser offering ground pepper - a bit late pal - whilst I still hadn't received my beer! He didn't even offer pepper with the main course!Main course plates were slapped on the table with a "Is this what you ordered?" A second plate of warm dinner rolls was thrown on the table half way through main course whether you wanted them or not and of course was taken away at the end of the meal, untouched.BUT, the dancing, musicians, gaucho, etc were excellent so not a total disaster.

Show wonderful, lesson good, food average . The venue is great, fancy and intimate, with lots of character, and super convenient as they picked us up at the hotel. We went on a Tuesday, likely a slow night - so was US $160/person for everything, except tips. The tango lesson for about an hour was good, but as soon as you arrive the lesson starts, with no offer, nor opportunity, for water or wine. Then it somewhat abruptly ended, but after a good period of time. Our teacher was later in the show so I guess he needed to change. The show was really good, with tango dancing, folk music and dancing, and individual singers, all with a live band. The meal was average, a medium rare steak was medium well, appetizers were ok, desert decent, but not gourmet, and no one ever asked us how was food after it was delivered - as I was considering retuning the steak. So if I was to go again I'd go for the show, but would grab dinner elsewhere.

Wow what a show. This was the most amazing entertainment. Dinner was delicious wine and drinks plentiful. This show is pure entertainment and so much more that expected. Truly worth the money and the show finale spectacular. Don't miss it.

Stunning dancers & musicians. Incredible show with v attractive (and talented!) dancers. Food & wine was pretty good - much better actually than I expected given some of the reviews for other places. Stand out though was my tango teacher - he had a rather long name (which I promptly forgot, trying to concentrate on understanding Spanish and following his lead to dance!) but was incredibly patient, good fun, kind and good humoured. Next to the dancers, he was the stand-out of the night for me. Definitely go see the show - and do the tango lesson beforehand if you can!

A tourist trap but a very good one. . Average food, hustled to buy premium drinks, photos etc. but the show was extremely good. I normally run a mile from anything advertised as involving local dancing but this was extremely high quality and entertaining. All the stars are for the show. Could have done without getting hustled for the drinks. On balance definitely recommended as the artists were magnificent and the show well structured

Tango lesson, dinner and show. Excellent lesson, dinner and show - just a bit miffed I'd been mislead on the cost. I was lead to believe for cash it would be $180 or equivalent in Argentinian pesos. Turned out it was only $180 if you had US $ cash - $240 equivalent for pesos!!

Tango lessons, dinner and show. Great night at the Tango, lesson was a real laugh with my two left feet, the teachers were kind and patient. Dinner was pretty good and the show was excellent. Very enjoyable night and should be a must do for all visitors to BA.

A Stylish Show. We arrived right before the tango show started, so did not eat dinner. The waitstaff seated us right next to the stage and brought us a bottle of Malbec. We then enjoyed the two hour show with amazing dancing and interesting musical accompaniment from a musician playing a mandolin like instrument from the Northwest region of Argentina.
