The speed and precision of the dancing is incredible, and the show was very entertaining. Our only complaint was that we were not allowed to linger after the show to finish our wine and the waitstaff pretty much pushed us out of the room.
amazing dancing. forget the lesson. a nice venue but the food was poor. excellent dancing but lacking in warmth. Lesson very dull and lacklustre. The girl teaching us was bored and boring.

Very well done. Been their twice now. Once 7 years ago and then again in Jan 15.The theatre has been renovated so it is easier to walk up steep flights of stairs.Food and wine included with multiple choices. Really good mealDancers and Gaughos were Truly wonderful. About a 3 hr show plus dinner. You are picked up and dropped off at the hotel. A must if you are in Buenos Aires

Happy, Happy, Happy and moving. Appetizer I picked out was the Crappacio, fresh sliced tomatoes w/ fresh buffulo style cheese w/ fresh basil and olive oil of which I sopped up every last bit of it's remaining juices with my bread. I had to slap the wait person's hand to stop him from taking what what must have seemed like an empty plate to him, away. The rest of the dinner was good but nothing I would take up space in this review with. Now the show ! It ran real late for us as by the time we got back to the hotel it was 12:30 AM and we had a pickup ride to the airport for 3:30 AM which gave us no sleep for the next 2 days of traveling back home after a month long cruise vacation in South America of which this show and dinner were part of a post cruise package we bought from Oceania. The Zombie condition accuired was well worth the experience of the Mandola artist who expertly played a concert on an eleven string mandoline type instrument but only smaller and not as deeply bow backed as the traditional mandolines are. His solo concert sounded like a whole orchestra and had me in it's spell from it's very first note. These two items are what made the show a five star experience for me. I just wish I knew who the artist was. All I know is that he has played for the Pope and there is no higher authority on mandolin type instraments than the Pope.

Amaing show worth every penny. There are a lot of Tango shows in Buenos Aires but I would have to rate this one very highly. It included a tango lesson for my husband and I and then a lovely meal with drinks available. The standard of show was exceptional from the dancers to the singers to the Gouchos. There is a VIP area above which we were meant to go to but they admitted their error and we were happy to stay as hard to believe the show could have been any better upstairs. Also bought the DVD of the show as no photos allowed.

Expensive but the BEST!. you will find if you bring CASH in U.S. Dollars, you get an amazing discount, so instead of $240 would be $170. We actually saw the Gala Tango show instead of La Ventana which is in the same building, but paid a discounted amount because of misunderstanding. The food is abundant as well as the wine, the show is fantastic from amazing tango dancers to Gaucho and folkloric as well. They pick you up at your hotel about 6:30 pm and return you about midnight.

The Highlight of our Stay in Buenos Aires. First a beautiful Wine Tasying, Fabulous Dinner and an incomparable Tango and Gaucho Show topped off with a Grand Finale by the cast with their rendition of 'Don't Cry For Me Argentina'. Simply magnificent and a must see. Worth every penny.

Amazing Show. An amazing evening and not just a Tango Show and a meal but a journey through Argentinian Culture and History. Do not visit Buenos Aires with going to this show. Excellent food and service and a show better than anything I have ever seen.

Unforgettable night in Buenos Aires. Such fun! On the recommendation of the hotel, we decided to go with Gala Tango. Not a cheap night out, but certainly an unforgettable one!. You had the choice of a free tango lesson or wine tasting. Hubby and I went for the former. There were about four other couples, and the poor professional tango teacher had a tough job! By the end however, we could muster a few steps. We all had a go of dancing with him, which was great fun. This was then followed by dinner and proper tango dancing. My husband and I had a table right next to the stage (small stage) and the food and free flowing wine was of excellent quality. How do they cook that beef? I should also mention that transfers from and back to the hotel were included. Why did I like it? The show was small and intimate with a small audience. I'm sure there are cheaper tango evenings available, but I preferred the intimate cabaret setting of this one. You must go if in BA!

These dancers can really move!. We were at Gala Tango as part of a tour group so we can't say how much we actually paid for the dinner and dancing but it is not cheap. But it is also a great night out. The food was fine but not gourmet nor would one expect that.Our biggest prior exposure to dance is Dancing with the Stars. We found the female dancers in particular to be amazing. Their movements are unbelievable.Highly recommended.

Delicious food & extraordinary entertainment. I would highly recommend a visit to Gala Tango! The food was delicious, copious amount of drinks and fantastic entertainment! Try the filet mignon - very tender and juicy.We were mesmerised for the entire show- but a warning do not be tempted try these moves at home!

Don't miss this experience!. Words cannot convey what an extraordinary experience our evening was at Gala Tango! We started with a fun tango lesson. This time spent dancing with my 24 year old daughter was priceless. Our tour guide, Pablo, enjoyed dancing with her as well. Then we went downstairs and had a fantastic dinner. The fillet was divine! It melted in your mouth. Nothing could prepare you for the show. The dancers were phenomenal as well as the musicians. The whole setting is so intimate. The dancers are literally inches away from you. I have never seen a better show! It was extremely moving.

Expensive, but worth any cent. A mixed show of tango music, together with other different dance and music styles.
The food was good, the show was extraordinary.
I would go there again.
Strongly recommended!

One of the most impressive shows ever seen. I was there with a friend. Super show with super artists. The tango is a mixture os single couple and group dance, very hight level and acrobatic. There were two singers, a male one and a woman who realy harminized. Beautiful voices. The gaucho art was very good too.The only thing I was disapointed was the DVD one could buy after the show. It shows a different show and the quality is not really good.
Lessons Wine Dinner and Lots of Tango!. Very elegant establishment. Our lesson was minimal but they fit us in. The food was very good and the tango dancers were incredible.

Quality Show, Decent Food, Crazy driver! . The show: As far as tango shows in BsAs go, this is still a tourist trap, but with a more intimate setting. First of all- pay in cash! The rate is 50% cheaper for the whole package. We paid $150 USD cash per person. This includes transfer, pre-show wine tasting or tango class, and dinner, with transfer back to the hotel. We opted for the wine tasting which was very nice. Note: they try to sell you wine after the tasting. We purchased one and later found out all wine was included in the dinner.The dancers were fantastic as was the music. Half of the show is folkloric and beyond wonderful. The performers have a great sense of humor. The singers did a great job, but the "Evita" ending was a bit dramatic for my taste. The food: Dinner includes appetizer, entree and dessert. You have a selection of fish, meats, and chicken and must order all courses at once. The meat we ordered was very good but the portions were huge. None of us finished our meal. Service was good, included wine, water, beer and soda pop. The show begins after you have eaten. Also, the waiters come by and ask for tips again after the whole show is over. Crazy Driver: After the show was done, we walked outside to find a little bit of chaos. There were several vans ready to take patrons back to their hotels, but no clear direction as to which went where. We were told to board a bus across the street where we waited outside for a bit as there was no driver. When he arrived were were quickly loaded on and took off. He was driving rather recklessly and as he dropped off the first group said 'ya los tiré' to someone on a phone. Roughly translated it means ' i threw them out'. Shortly after, he basically threw a drunk man out of the bus about 3 blocks away from his hotel. To make matters worse, he refused to drop a group of people at their hotel claiming that they had boarded the wrong bus and it was their problem to get there. He basically yelled and threw them out as well. This happend with one more passenger before he deposited us 2 blocks away from our hotel. This was definitely not Gala Tango's fault, however the whole transfer process should be better organized.Overall would definitely recommend for the tango experience. It is a great 'VIP' option as other shows have a bigger audience. You will find better food in many other parts of the city.

Amazing show. We saw a number of tango shows during our recent visit to BA and this was our favorite. A good performance!, nice variety of dances, we chose to do the meal as well. Inclusive in the price is wine and pick up from your hotel. The food was fantastic, as were the wines and service,the show was breath-taking.

A must see. Surely a Gringo must see. Excellent intimate show, food was very good ( I had the steak and my wife the filet Mignon ). Staff is attentive and the performance is both entertaining and educational on the roots and variety of the much beloved Argentinian Tango..

Great Tango Show!. I was looking for tango shows in Buenos Aires and preferred a more intimate show, in a small location. This is perfect for having dinner and show with a bottle of wine included in the price (good wine, Argentinian harvest). The price includes the transportation from and back to the hotel, the dinner, the wine and the show. The show is great, it has a great band of Tango musicians with the bandoneon player from the old (and pure) school of traditional tango. The dancers are spectacular and the singers too. If you are into Tango and know the lyrics you have no other choice than singing with them. The service was courteous and attentive. The place is very upscale and very beautiful. Cons: Kind of pricey in Argentinian pesos.Tip: If you bring US dollars to the country, this place accepts payments in cash with huge discounts, of $80.00 per person. This is a general tip for Argentina. If you are traveling from the US, bring cash! I paid one in cash and the difference was enormous. I wished I have known this before.

Food was fine. Show was spectacular!!. Went here with a group of 12. They have an a la carte menu, ie. Pick an app, main, and desert. Unlimited wine, juice and pop. Argentina has spoiled us with amazing food! Food was good, but not the highlight. The show consisted of incredible music, dancing, and very impressive theatrics with many props. The dinner and show is roughly 3 hours. Before they start and when the show is over, they offer free tango lessons which is interesting. If you want an authentic tango experience with great value, this is the place! Highly recommended!

Touristy but very entertaining. Gala Tango appears to be quite the production. A crew of around 20 musicians, singers and tango dancers (plus a team of support and wait staff) explain the higher price of $135USD cash (also includes hotel transfer). The price is higher if paying by card.Because it's such a production, it all feels a bit cheesy and fake - so don't come here expecting an authentic tango experience. That said, the musicians and dancers are extremely talented and it was entertaining from start to finish.I particularly enjoyed the traditional 10-string mandolin-type musician - he was amazing to listen to.Included in the price is a tango lesson or wine tasting. We did the wine tasting - as Argentinian wine is excellent. The staff taking the tasting were friendly and knowledgeable about Argentinian wine.The dinner was much better than expected - delicious steaks and more wine than we could drink.A couple of things that were a shame - they offer a cocktail before dinner, and when you accept they tell you it is an extra $8US each. Later they offer more things like photos with the dancers or extra tango lessons (I assume also at an extra cost). Photos are not allowed with your own camera - so you are forced to use their photographer). I figure this rule is to ensure camera flashes aren't going off throughout the performance, which is fair enough. They were also a bit pushy about tips (we had tipped earlier, then later were approached by another staff member asking where our tip was).If you plan on seeing one of the large tango productions, I would still happily recommend Gala Tango.

Tourist Show done right. Yes this a a show for tourists but it was very well done and we enjoyed the food and the venue is small and intimate. Dinner service starts at 8:00 and we had a very good empanada, filet and dessert and decent Malbec (we were given a bottle for the two of us). It wasn't the best meal in Buenos Aires but for a dinner show, I was pleasantly surprised. The show starts around 10 and is comprised of 4 couples that do some group numbers and individual dance (to live music - loved the older gentleman on the bandoneon). Interspersed are some singers, a gaucho presentation and music to the what I believe was the charango (small andean guitar like instrument) - all excellent. The ending was probably the only disappointment as they did the Evita Peron "Don't' Cry for Me Argentina" finale. Too touristy and brings thoughts of Madonna but overall the we enjoyed the show and would recommend.

Is This Activities, Attractions or Nightlife? How about all three?. Our Buenos Aires travel agent/tour guide, Sandra Gutrejde, gave our two couples three options for a tango show; La Ventana, Gala and Cafe de los Angelitos. Unfortunately they each showed up in different TripAdvisor categories like "activities', "attractions" and "nightlife" making it hard to compare. Given our desire for a reasonably priced, typical tango show with good food, we chose Gala Tango. I can't tell you what the other shows are like but I can tell you we were quite pleased with this venue. First of all, as advertised we were promptly picked up at our hotel by a courtesy van. Secondly, as we were told, it was quite small (in an intimate way). Thirdly, the food brought to us before the show was, in my estimation, excellent. Restaurant quality, not dinner show quality. And the wine never stopped being poured. Finally, the show was amazing. We had a variety of dancers, singers and a gaucho (Argentinian cowboy) doing a traditional dance. More entertaining than I had expected. When we first booked this event I thought this would be a high priced demonstration accompanied by mediocre food. I am happy to say it was an wonderful demonstration of tango accompanied by excellent food in an intimate setting.

What an experience. I researched several Tango shows before we arrived in BA and more once we arrived. The hotel recommended a few, and our tour guide recommended Gala Tango. What an evening ! Beautiful theatre in traditional Art Dec design, not overly large and so created a warm and exciting atmosphere. The staff were excellent and the food was more than plentiful and delicious. The wine flowed all evening. The stars of the show....the dancers, performers and musicians were absolutely outstanding. An evening we will remember for a very long time. Thank you Gala Tango!

Sexy, Sassy and Sophisticated Show. This was a fantastic show and lived up to all our expectations. It is a small venue so most tables have a good view. I did a lot of research before booking and took advice from previous reviews on Trip Advisor which paid off with this show. The food was great, one of the best meals we have had, and we have been cycling around Patagonia prior to this. You will not be disappointed if you go to see Gala Tango.

Brilliant Entertainment. A great entertainment experience, talented dancers and beautiful costumes, the musicians were first class and I particularly enjoyed the Gaucho performer, very dramatic, the venue is lovely with every seat giving a good view, expensive but worth it, wine flowed and I enjoyed the food although my main course steak was tough as old boots, and looking around I was not the only person to abandon the main course, however this did not deter from a great evenings entertainment.

Great tango and folkloric experience at Bs As' better tanguerias.. We enjoyed a thoroughly memorable show at this, probably Bs As' preeminent venue.While it is touristy (it is very pricey and so outside the range of many locals given the state of the currency) the performances are top notch.We were a mix of foreigners and portenos and we all seemed to find the evening quite special.

What a fantastic night we had at Gala Tango !. Going to Buenos Aires for the first time has to include "something " Tango of coarse . After checking out a dozen or so options , Trip advisor and getting some input from our tour guide and our hotel , we chose for the Dinner/ Tango show of Gala Tango . What a great choice ! The evening began being picked up from our hotel (included) , once at the location for the show we were very pleasantly received by our hosts and graciously shown to our table for the evening . We were very pleased that we were seated centre stage at the second table from the stage. ( Because the intimate size of the classy 1930's decorated room I don't think there are many bad seats in the house ) Shortly after a pleasant server showed and explained us the menu and offered the wine which he kept flowing all night long . The meal was great very tasty and the Filet perfectly done . Everything was nicely presented with class as if we were in an exclusive fine dining restaurant .Around 10 pm after we had a chance to be photographed with a tango dancer the show began . The small orchestra sounded fantastic and the tango music filled the room at perfect volume.The show has about 10 dancers 4 singers a fantastic special a guest musician and a goucho dancer . Once the show started the numbers followed one after another without any long talks or speeches , the atmosphere was just fantastic . Also during the show the wait staff kept the glasses filled with a very fine wine . ( their own label ) . The show lasted for almost 2 hours and as far as we were concerned they could have kept on going all night . What an evening and what an experience . Now we knew for sure we were in Argentina ! and we will remember this perfect night for a very long time . Sure it cost a few dollars , make sure when you order this to pay in cash on the night in US dollars , it was worth very penny ! In closing we were shuttled back to our hotel . If you also are looking for a fantastic Tango show I can recommend GALA TANGO without any hesitation !

Don't miss this one!. After spending the past 19 days on a cruise ship and seeing a number of great shows on board, I wasn't expecting this to be anywhere near the same quality. Boy, was I wrong! To be honest, I'd have to rate our visit to GALA TANGO as the high point of the entire vacation. (Sorry, cruise ship performers.)After spending many hours investigating possibilities for a tango show in Buenos Aires, I selected this one primarily on other reviews here on TA. Once again, I'm proud to say, TA members have been "right on" with their reviews and opinions. We booked this tango performance several weeks prior to embarking on our cruise (which ended in Buenos Aires) so we didn't have to frantically try to find one once we were in the city.The actual performance we attended was on the evening of Feb. 19. The cost of the entire event was US$165 PP which, at the time, seemed to be a little expensive. However, as the night progressed, I realized we got exceptional value for the cost...especially considering that it was truly an "all-inclusive" evening.The price of the evening included the following: (a.) Transportation from your BA hotel, no matter where it was located in the city, (b.) an exceptional (2 hr.) meal with a good selection of entrees including all drinks (yes, wine, too.), (c.) a SENSATIONAL tango and folk dance performance by approx. 16-18 multi-talented dancers, singers and musicians, (d.) top notch table service and attention by the wait staff, (e.) a small, intimately beautiful dinner theater setting, and (f.) a return ride back to your hotel. Total time from pick-up to drop-off was approx. 5 hrs.I would love to describe the whole evening in every detail but, to do it justice, it would take another 1000 words or so. Therefore, let me just fully recommend that, should you wish to enjoy/experience a "real" tango show while in BA, quickly book a performance at the GALA TANGO. You have my assurance that you, too, will place it as a top remembrance of your visit to Argentina!

Great show and food!. Dinner show was booked with our tour package so can't comment on cost but food alone was like a 100$ meal. Show was great. I think there were 6 or 8 separate tango pairs with a small orchestra on stage with them. Two professional singers sang solo numbers. Dancers were great and show was very entertaining. Location was in older area of BA so we appreciated the transportation to and return from our hotel. Food was fabulous, steaks were great and the best we had in Argentina.. Ordered the filet and husband got steak like a rib eye. Included wine was great. Venue is small and we were third from the stage. My husband had to turn his chair to watch show which was fine since nobody was in seat fourth from stage. Might have been a little tight if table had been full. Try to get seats next to stage if room is full.

Highly recommended!. We had been strongly recommended to have an evening here as a 'must do' in Buenes Aires and Gala Tango did not disappoint!! The venue is situated in a quaint cobbled street and is deceptively understated at the entrance, but when you enter this opulent room with 1930 's decor, chandeliers, gilding etc, you feel like you are in the hey day of tango IThe staff were very good indeed, friendly and welcoming, as part of the inclusive dinner package , the drinks were poured unsparingly and the meal was very good , the steaks in particular. At 10 pm the show starts and we couldn't believe the 2 hours passed so quickly, great dancing and costumes. Any sort of cabaret evening is not something we would normally go for, yes it is for the tourists and yes to some people it could be a bit cheesy , but if you want to get a feel for the Tango , and you embrace the atmosphere, then its a good night out.

Great small venue. Dancers were great. A musician (apparently famous) plays a 12 string ukelele like a master. We didn't eat before the show but the steaks looked great. Huge portions, I probably couldn't have stayed awake if I had eaten. Very entertaining gaucho with a balls on rope routine that is scary to watch. Room is small enough that there are no bad seats.

Too dark to eat. We booked via a tour company, Exploration Journeys and ended up getting upgraded because the cheaper show that we were supposed to see was sold out. We arrived a little early and were not allowed in the venue, so we waited outside. We were the first ones in and seated at the dining table. The tables were arranged so the table is perpendicular to the stage, so you are looking over the person next to you to see the stage. Not the best experience but you can move the chairs a little after the show starts. This was an amazing show, the dancers were great and they had a great musical act at the end. The space was fairly small, it got very dark and hard to see what you were eating after the show started. The food was ok. Not spectacular. They have a point in the show where you can come up and learn tango. No one in our audience wanted to do it. Then they also let you come up and get photos taken - they have a photographer there that you can purchase the photos from. We were in a big group and told we could not take photos. (For any part once the show started, and it was very dark and hard to do anyway.) I had a nice camera and they rushed us so quickly during the photo op, in fear we would take our own photo, that I was not even smiling in the photo/looking at the camera. Bummer, because it could have been a cool trip memory but the photo was so terrible that we didn't buy it. Their loss. Overall, I felt it could have been a better experience if the food was of better quality (they have to produce in mass to serve everyone at the same time) and if the staff were friendlier and more accommodating to their guests wishes.
Perfect tango show. Great food, good show. Did a lot of research before so this one of the best!Highly recommended. Do special price $90 if you pay in dollars.

Tango shows are mostly touristic, this one has class and great food. The place is expensive . Actually very expensive but it is worth every Penny . We had a much better dinner there then in the highly acclaimed restaurant in our hotel Four Seasons. Steaks cooked to perfection , very very good wines as much as you want or can drink , great artists and performances well above what you would expect from such a small place .

Memorable New Year's Eve Tango Show. Gala Tango's New Year's Eve Tango Show in Buenos Aires was a memorable experience and a great place to celebrate the beginning of a New Year. The show was outstanding, the dinner was exceptional, the drinks plentiful and delicious, and the international group of fellow revelers --except for a family of obnoxious Texans--was congenial. Expensive, and worth it!

Fantastic dancing, average meal. We came to Gala Tango for the New Year and the prices were nearly double the normal rate so I cannot attest to the usual "value" you get when attending a show. The dancing and music were excellent! We loved every minute of it and were completely captivated. The food was lacking, but not terrible. Also, the only wine served was the house Gala Tango wine, which was disappointing given the price tag for the New Years Eve event, but with normal prices this may not be as bad. Come for the dancing!

amazing dancing. The dancing was impressive. A chance before the show to learn some steps from the professionals. The meal was more than would normally be expected for a show like this. 3 courses including a large delicious steak. Wine was enjoyable and plentiful. We were sorry when it all finished as the dancing was so enjoyable.

Very impressive!. There are quite a few tango shows out there and it gets confusing which one to select. We were quite happy to go for gala tango, the dancers were just amazing gliding on the floor , the costumes and the band and the supporting acts and performers were superb! The meal was fairly good I thought. Good value all in all!

"First Tango in Buenos Aires. My wife and I enjoyed a evening show here. Interesting location, but beautifully decor to enjoy the show. Once sited, they will pour all the Malbec you want from their private label. Food is great, steaks are big and good. This was are first tango show and the 2 hours just flew. Great show of dancing, singing, music, and native AR folks and dance. This place was recommended and I'm glad we went to the show (ends at midnight).

Absolutely outstanding!. My wife and I were recommended this tango show by our hotel and we loved every second. At $150 per person, you'd think it was a little on the pricey side but when you consider what you get for that - collection/drop off from your hotel, excellent 3 course meal (with as much wine as you want) and then an amazing 2-3 hour tango show - it turns out to be a bargain. Before dinner, a couple of dancers will show you a few basic steps (a bit cheesy, but fun). Then afterwards the show kicks off. There were four different couples who take it in turns to dance before taking the stage together - they were simply mesmerising. There's some other entertainment in between too, which was also excellent. I can't say enough how captivating the whole experience was.You can't take photos during the actual show, but don't let that put you off. We actually found it let us take it in more without worrying about getting the best shot!Highly recommended. If you're in buenos aires and you want the ultimate tango experience, then go to this show. You won't regret it.

Great entertainment. This must be one of Buenos Aires top entertainment. A fabulous meal is included with the show.The musicians are absolutely brilliant on their own and then the Tango couples come on stage for many different dances and changes of costumes and their dancing is with precision timing and so classy. A delight to watch. As well singers and other musical talents perform. I do not know where they found such wonderful talent for the entire show. I would really recommend having this night out to get a real flavour of Buenos Aires.

Great meal, service & performance. The steak melted in your mouth, the wine was fine, service superior and the performers were incredible. Each tango dancer not only danced divinely but exuded the unique expression of sensuality and joy while thrilling all of us with their athleticism and style. The gaucho performers were top notch as well. Pick up and return via the van gave a night view of the city that presented an unexpected bonus. You are much closer to the performers on stage than at some of the other locations we had inquired about before choosing this recommendation.

Overpriced and no photography. We made the choice to go here after our guide recommended it to us towards the end of a long day of sight seeing, a decision I regretted later on. I will say the food was good but for $135 USD each, boy when I think about I must of been of been on some sort of high to have agreed to this. The show was a lot of glitz and glam and biggest issue for me as a photographer, no photos allowed. I intend to return to Buenos Aires and hope to find the real Tango.
World class dinner & show!. Great show! Sublime dancers, seductive tango music and the most delicious, tender steak ever!! Van only recommend a visit :)

A world class show. This was one of the highlights of buenos aires for our group. Not only was the show top class but the food was excellent. Normally the 2 never go together but at Gala Tango they have it perfect. The accordion player must be 80 odd and I wish I had half his talent and energy. Make the effort to go simply amazing show

Great dinner & show. When researching were to go we came upon this place and decided to book it even if was one the most expensive ones as we were on honeymoon and fancied a special treat.Very glad we did because it was absolutely fabulous, from the moment we walked in till we left we had a great time!We were the first there so our waiter chatted to us for quite a while and very kindly took photos of us.The food was very good and included unlimited wine, the staff were very friendly and the show was very entertaining, even got to practise a few tango steps with the dancer!To top it all off, we paid much less than we expected (quite a big discount was applied when paying cash with US dollars!).
Brilliant. A fun evening of learning to Tango and eating really good food while we watched a very professional Tango show. Absolutely world class

Loved it!. I agree with the previous comments . The ending is super cheesy, the food is not amazing, and it was pretty expensive - but I had THE BEST time! We did dinner and the show, and also a half hour lesson beforehand. The lesson was hilarious and really fun. It's included in the price but most people don't take it up. The teacher was great and very patient even though we were terrible. If you go, you should do it!The venue is super luxe - red velvet, wood floors, crystal chandeliers. The food wasn't bad but wasn't up to the standard of the rest of the meals we've had here in BA. But the dancing and the music... So so good. Props to the accordion player - he was amazing!

OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE. This dinner show is more expensive than others but well worth it! The food was fabulous (perfectly cooked filet that was delicious), unlimited wine (red or white or both) and one of the best shows I've ever seen in a long time. The dancing was amazing, wonderful costume changes, great band. I can't say enough about the entire evening. We booked through the concierge at our hotel. A van picked us up and delivered us back to the hotel. If you're wanting to see tango when in Buenos Aires this is the one to see.

I loved!. It was a new experience. The house is not that big , the music is wonderful, (they play all the classic that I love to hear over and over), the food was nice, the wine, and the atmosphere.The musicians and the dancers with the gauchos a plus!Perfect night.

Tango show with style!. This is a large venue for tango shows, to which we went on a ship's tour for the show and a served lunch. The musicians were very good and the dancers their equal. Very much a fun experience. Perhaps drawn out a bit long when they brought out the gauchos and the Andes pipe players, but some may not have seen these previously.The meal was much better than average, with a thick, perfectly cooked steak being one of the best ever, accompanied by a nice local red wine included.Best if you can get a seat fairly near the front, but not immediately by the stage (which will be marked by a curtain when you arrive). Overall, certainly a bit staged for us tourists, but great fun nonetheless.

Wonderful Show and Dinner. I researched Tango Shows before our trip and booked this one on line. As it turned out our Hotel also recommends Gala. My Husband and I both really enjoyed the Show and the dinner was excellent (as was the Wine). It was our first Tango Show so we really don't have anything to compare it to but the Show had variety, the dancing was wonderful and we really enjoyed it. The Dancers were awesome and loved it when they sang "Don't Cry for me Argentina". We really enjoyed the smaller venue and the atmosphere was elegant and classy. I ordered the Beef Carpaccio as an appetizer and it was by far one of the best that I have ever eaten. My Husband ordered the Filet and I went with the Argentinian Beef. The steaks were tender and very flavorful! They were very generous with the Wine and service was very good!The only negative and we can't fault the Venue for this is with regards to the pick up/drop off. That was a disaster. We waited almost one hour past the time they said to be ready and had to have our Concierge call several times as to where are they. They actually came and picked up two Ladies at our hotel but left without us as they thought they were only picking up two even though we were standing outside of the hotel. They then had to come back to our hotel to get us after the last call by our Concierge. At the end of the Show the transportation was not there and we took a cab back with the Ladies. I would recommend taking your own cab there and back and not getting involved with the transportation shuttle.I highly recommend Gala!

Perfect night. Small and luxury place.. I was looking for a good show and food. My tour guide suggested me that place and it was fantastic. Small, luxury, good food. A little late for my rutine but this is the nighlife in Buenos Aires. Beatiful dancers. I took a tango class before going and I realize that I m not good for that so I really admire all this dancers after the class.

Tango Show at the Top. I came to this Tango Show on the recommendation of the hotel. It was a really good show, including a lesson before dinner, dinner and a long and quality performance.The location is special, elegant, perfect lighting and antique furniture, it makes for a perfect atmophere. Dinner was reallly good quality, good wine and perfect service. I strongly recommend this tango show and dinner, for a romantic evening, a special occasion.

Great dancing and food, if a bit cheezy. The food was excellent, including our steaks, even though we didn't have high expectations. The show was "pretty good." The dancing and music was great, but much of the "story" was in Spanish so we didn't catch a lot of it. Elements of it were ovedone, akin to a Branson show, but it was worth going to see all the amazing tango dancing, different styles, etc.

A wonderful show in a lovely setting. This was one of the excursions available on our cruise and we are glad we didn't miss it. The show was really excellent with a mixture of dancing, singing and musical acts and gave a taste of the authentic music and dance of the country. All of the performers were first class and the show took place in a beautifully furnished room on the first floor. It lasted for over an hour and a half and we thought it good value for money.

Great Tango Show. We really enjoyed our evening here and it was a good finale to holiday in South America.The show is in a lovely venue and the atmosphere was really good.We enjoyed the food we had steaks which were really nice and the wine is free and beers and water.The show was excellent and included a variety of acts with plenty of tango and the live band were excellent.The other act were all of Argentinean influence and really good quality,ending with don't cry for me Argentina which was very fitting.Great Tango venue

Excellent show but....... This show was booked by our travel agent. Lovely venue in an old building. Dance show was excellent and the dancers put a lot of effort into entertaining us. We had a seat by the dance floor which was great. Down side was the food. I had the pork which was very fatty and barely edible. When I complained the head waiter was called and said it was not possible for the food to be bad! Another person on our table had the fish which was very dry and he also could not eat it. I feel that this spoilt what was otherwise a great evening. Unfortunately they have the attitude that you are never going to come there again as this is a one of holiday experience.

Lesson, Dinner, Entertainment.... Excellent!. First we'll talk about how great the dance lesson was. Then we were escorted to the main ballroom where dinner was served. We both started with the prosciutto salad which was fresh and tasty. For our entrees we each had a different cut of beef; me the filet and Hochi the Rib-eye. Both medium rare and cooked to perfection. We finished with chilled marinated pear w/ ice cream. The waiters were absolutely amazing, great service, and very handsome. We did not expect the food nor the service to be at this level and were greatly surprised. We had some wonderful people sitting beside of us that we're all about to go on a cruise. You know we had lovely conversation about cruising and cruise ships. The entertainment was beyond what we expected. The orchestra consist of two violinist a double bass, accordionist, and the musical director was playing the piano. The dancers were absolutely gorgeous, amazingly talented and you can tell they were trained very well. The show also included a couple of specialty acts which included a couple of singers and 1 dancer las pampas; a folklorist dancer that performs a combination of flamenco with with apparatus and a big drum. And then this amazing guitar player playing an instrument I had never seen before. It was like a large ukulele with multiple strings, maybe eight strings. Again all of the entertainers were extremely talented and the audience showed their appreciation after each performance. I would highly recommend this show as an evening event for anybody looking for a full evening of entertainment.

Great Evening....but....... This is an absolutely great night out. The food was surprisingly good and the show excellent, the finale was fabulous and the dancers really put their heart and soul into it. The only minor area where they let themselves down was when we arrived - after having been show to our table they 'offered' us cocktails and after we accepted them they mentioned as an afterthought that they were extra. Considering we had paid $135 each we then said we would stick with the included wine. Consequently we then found ourselves presented with a jug of tap water and left to study the menu. The waiter came back 30 minutes later and took our food order but still nothing else materialized. Eventually we mentioned this to the passing manager and in fairness we were well catered for from that point onwards. We had a great evening but they need to be careful not to spoil the experience in such a minor detail.

Amazing Tango and Dinner. It was a phenomenal show that my teenage daughter is still talking about! The live musicians, the amazing dancers, the variety, the beauty of the show and the place.. The food, wine and champagne was also memorable...just a knockout..Our hotel concierge recommended it as the best in BA ...I believe this is true...On the entryway there are pictures of Madonna, Sting and others enjoying the show. We all loved it!

Touristy - y e s! Entertaining - absolutely!!. We only had 2 nights in Buenos Aires before heading further afield and I had researched and booked 2 enviable restaurants. My bride though not insistent was keen to see some tango dancing and rather than go to a club after dinner (my have needed to wait till 11 or 12) we decided to go to a tango show.Gala Tango was recommended as being intimate with excellent food. The cost was 200USD but 135USD if paid in cash for a 3 course meal and supposed "open bar" - we took the latter option.On arrival you are ushered into an impressive room that seats around 100 people. Having been offered a pre-dinner cocktail and a list of suggestions you are then informed there is an extra charge for these drinks - sorry Gala - very very poor form. The choice of meals was reasonable my Chicken Caesar salad quite nice but my rare Fillet Mignon (excellent choice according to our waiter) though huge was watery with gristle and sinew throughout - average to poor!The house wines I tried - a Mendoza Chardonnay and Malbec were more than acceptable - though none were served understandably during the show.The show itself was very entertaining and such intimate surrounds I don't believe there would have been a bad seat in the house. A mixture of tango dancing by 4 youthful and enthusiastic couples was interspersed with songs, drums and a style of male flamingo! The highlight for me was an electrifying performance by a male performer playing a local strained instrument that looked like a cross between a 10 stringed mandolin and a eukelele - quite outstanding. The finale was somewhat jingoistic and overblown but seemed to appeal to the majority of the demographic.Overall a worthwhile experience - if these types of shows are your "thing"

Small Luxury and Good Food and Dancers. I was with many doubts. Should I go to a tango show for tourists or just to a local ballroom? My tour agency insist and I thought it was for their interests. But she was right. Is nice to go to a tango show in the country of the tango. Eventhough is full of tourist that is a 5 star show with great beatiful dancers. As I was told the difference with others is the food and wine. In this case is free wine and high quality of food so is convenient to go here! Yes, excellent"!

A wonderful show!. Was recommended by our hotel over the other Tango shows, and it did not disappoint! The dancers are fantastic, and the bolo created a nice mix. The dancers come out during dinner to give Tango lessons and take pictures with the crowd. I was very happy with the price (there is a discount if you pay in USD), service, and the show!

Wonderful, don't miss!. This was our first visit to Buenos Aires and we did a lot of research on tango shows. Many were very pricey and this one was recommended by our hotel and we were super pleased with it. The price is very reasonable and the show was intimate and very impressive. We didn't have the dinner, we just went for the show (which I would recommend). You can see well from all seating and you are right up close with the entertainment. The length of the show was just right and the combination of singing, tango and history was perfect. Skip the large touristy tango shows and go for a smaller setting, you will be happy you did!

Impressive dancing + bolo!. We never thought we'd be so taken by tango! it's remarkably sensuous, athletic, exhilarating. Far more enthralling than flamenco dancing. The venue was intimate--it's amazing how so many people can dance around a small stage in such rapid synchronization. The bolo entertainer was fantastic--especially with the tight quarters. You have to see it to get it. OK, the ending was over the top, with Evita impersonation and patriotic flags. But otherwise well worth it. The food and service was sound (though not over the top.)

What a show!. This show far exceeded my expectations. Generally these can be a little corny and touristy, but not this. We were picked up at the hotel exactly at 8, brought to the venue over by the Pink House. We had a very good dinner with a pretty good Malbec (could have been better - a rather hot 2010). The service was very friendly and efficient. The venue is the perfect size. Every seat is good as far as I could tell. The pictures on their website a representative of the room. We had seats right in front of the stage, so that was great. We had a few minutes of tango steps before hand with some of the dancers (you get your picture taken with them and the guy comes around during dinner for US$10 - good picture) The tango was great fun and very well executed. One of the real highlights of the show was the goucho player and the goucho dancer with the bolero. Really well done. It finishes off with Evita at the end which was nicely sung. There was about a fifteen minute wait to get back on the bus to the hotel. The only snag in the evening. Hot tip: bring US dollars instead of paying by credit card. Much different price - 140 instead of 200 (true of everything in BA).

Mediocre food, excellent service and show. If you read many tango show reviews, you'll hear the same refrain: go for the show, not the food. The same holds true for Gala, which, like so many other deluded dinner venues in Argentina/Chile, assumes that an oversized filet mignon is enough to make diners happy. And with triply high prices on Christmas Eve, the Gala chef is certifiably psychotic. On the other hand, Gala offers an intimate venue with excellent service and, above all, a first rate show. A nice evening for sure, though one hopes that some day competent cuisine is asked to the dance.

Outstanding show. This show set in San Telmo. The dancers were very good, the orchestra was wonderful, the food was oustanding and the attentive service kept all our glasses full and where there when needed. I want to see the show again!

Quite impressive. We had several recommendations and didn't want the dinner with the show. Our hotel suggested this one and it was good. The musicians were amazing- especially the 85 year old accordian player. The dancers and singers were amazing. The finale was cheesy but we really liked the 'Evita' part! The gaucho was unbelievable! They give you a bottle of wine which is too much to drink- we left most of it.The pick up service to the hotel was efficient. It's a good one! The only thing I would have liked was a dance by the less glitzy traditional dancers- a playback from the 20's and 30's. Do go! I was worth it.

Table Assignments. Without a doubt, both the food and the show at Gala are well worth the price. HOWEVER, for us, the table assignment was very telling. Our reservation was made and paid for in June for a date in November. With a six month advanced reservation, one would think you would get a good table. Not so! We were placed in the farthest corner and the assistant manager would not budge. Once the room was full, it was obvious that locals gets the good tables and foreigners are put in the peanut gallery. Granted, the room is small and you get to see the show but, for me, it was the principle.

Poor Customer Service. We decided to go ahead with this tango show after it being recommended by our hotel. We were really looking forward to the tango lesson along with the show and dinner and thought the pick up service was a real bonus.Unfortunately, our pick up was 1.5 hours LATE which meant we arrived after the lesson we were promised with not much more than an insincere apology and statement that they couldn't do anything. While the dancing was good, our night was further spoiled by the fact that they expected us to pay full price despite missing out on part of the evening's events, and that they could only provide a discount if we paid in USD which were not prepared for. In retrospect, I think if you want to experience tango in Buenos Aires, go to a milonga and dance with the locals, or take lessons. Our evening here was spoiled by poor customer relations.

Not Just a Tango Show. I could not decide which tango show to book before we left on the trip and was a bit concerned we wouldn't get to see one. However, when we arrived at our hotel, we asked them to recommend one and book it for us. I had seen reviews for Gala so when they suggested it, we asked them to book it. They said it would be $200 per person for the show, meal and unlimited drinks and the bus would be there at 8:00.The bus arrived at 7:30 so we rushed to get ready. I think this was a miscommuncation issue with the hotel and not an issue with the company. We had to go by several other hotels before we made our way to the venue which was already pretty full.We sat almost at the end of the table (farthest from the stage). At first I thought this would be disappointing but it was fine. Sort of a plus because we were closer to the wine which was only one seat away from us.The show is a mixture of tango, singing, gaucho and instrumental. There were pretty long periods of time where there was no dancing at all. If you are looking for straight up tango, non stop for several hours, this is not the show for you. However, the dancing, when we did see it, was pretty amazing. One of the most impressive performers is the accordian player who is probably 85. He killed it!Before the show you can get on stage for a quick 5 minute lesson and learn eight steps. Sort of a fun thing to do for those interested.The food was average but we didn't expect much after reading the reviews. The beef carpacio appetizer was probably the most successful plate on the table that evening. The wine was tasty and we got an entire bottle of sparkling malbec rose to ourselves which was delicious.BIG TIP - We had not pre-paid for the show and dinner and were expecting to pay $200/person. When it came time to settle the bill, we offered American dollars and only paid $130/person! This was a HUGE savings so I would recommend not booking and paying in advance.

Smally. Luxury. Great dancers!. After my tour guide suggestions I decided to enjoy some local fun. I went to this tango show and wow! I found a small place where you can see from everywhere, a luxury place that made me feel in the 40´s, and wonderful dancers that are very young and with such wonderful legs! My God!

Do not miss this !!. This is a very intimate setting. The food is good and the atmosphere draws you in. The concierge recommended this show and I can't compare it to any other but this was a fantastic show. The bus picks you up at the hotel and delivers you back. Our bus came 30 minutes early so it made for a longer nite, but it was still worth it. They bring you up on stage before hand and show you a few moves, you can have your picture made (which we, of course bought). The action is right there, you can touch the dancers. There is live music by a handful of great musicians right there on stage, driving the show. Dinner was good. I think you can have 1 bottle of wine on the house then have to pay for any more. After sitting there for so long we made it thru more than one bottle. We left there wishing to see every Tango show in town !!!

touristy, fab food but what a show!. Our travel agent recommended this show and boy was it outstanding. If you choose to dine here, then seats will be close to the stage and of course you get close viewing of the expressions on the faces of the tango dancers.The meal was plentiful and delicious.usually when it's food and show, one aspect is lacking, either the meal is rubbish or the show is poor, but in this instance both were fantastic. Go......

Amazing!. It's hard to imagine being closer to a Tango show. We went to the VIP Gala Tango show. The food was good and so was the show. No English was spoken during the show so the storyline was a little hard to follow but great dancing and you are so close! Not a bad seat in the house.

Definitely the best Tango Show in BA!. After seeing many tango shows I saw Gala Tango together with several of my colleagues, every year we have a critical look at several shows in order to select only the best ones to add on to our offerings at Class Adventure Travel. From the service, the dances, the singers to the ambiance everything has been given thought and is just perfect! This is one of the few tango shows with an excellent dinner, which includes traditional options such as, Argentine empanadas and excellent meat options. There are as well several gourmet dishes on the menu such as a salmon Carpaccio. Wines accompanied the food perfectly and service was very good. The show started while we were finishing our deserts. Dancers are very talented and gave a very good performance, so did the singers and the orchestra. I also shouldn’t forget to mention the folklore assists, which are amazing! This show has without any doubts the best folklore musicians in house! One of the unique elements of the show is the small venue, the view to the low stage is perfect from all tables. I’d recommend Gala Tango to everyone who is looking for a unique tango experience!

Unbelievable Show!. At first we thought this was a lot to spend on a Tango Show, but having been there I can tell you it is well worth it! The food was delicious, the service great, and there are not enough accolades to describe the dancing! The dancers were amazing! One suggestion though...get your own taxi to get here. The van that picks you up stops at too many hotels on the way...
Must do when in BA. Very nice tango evening with quite a good quality diner and nice service. The place is very elegant. We enjoyed this evening a lot.

Good tango but something felt lacking.. This is my 3rd tanguería here in Buenos Aires. This place gained great notoriety after Madonna and here boy toy were caught leaving here back in December of 2012. The price is on par with the other high end tango shows here in Buenos Aires. As usual we skipped the meal and only went for the show.Beautiful stage but the performers and the wait staff have to use the aisle behind the tables. I found this to be distracting.Dancing was very good but there wasn't an "MC" so to speak so the show felt a big disjointed, unlike other tango shows.The music and the folkloric part of the show...identical to other shows.The orchestra was decent but I like to see more than one bandeleon in a tango orchestra.If you want an entertaining show, I would suggest it but there are other tanguerîas that have a better seating arrangement and a better orchestra.

small, intimate, exciting. We were looking for the right finish to our trip to Argentina, and spending our last night at Gala Tango was the right choice. Yes, it's for tourists, but the dancers are professional and talented. The show includes other folkloric performances, maybe hokey but still very talented and entertaining. The food was ok, acceptable although the wine should have been better. Our waiter, Roderrigo, was charming and helpful. The space is small and intimate, definitely better than a large room. This was fun and a perfect ending to a great trip.

Fun dinner/show in BA. My wife and I were recommended to this show by a travel agent who billed it as the best tango dinner show in town. While the price was a little steep, I'd have to agree. The stage is low and the tables go right up to it. It is a fairly small venue so you are sure to get a good seat. I believe a bottle of wine came included in the dinner. The food was alright. Certainly not the best you can get in the city by any means but you are really there for the show. The show was fantastic! I loved the music and the dancing. The band is playing on stage right behind the dancers. I didn't pick up most of the dialogue/lyrics to some of the songs as everything is in Spanish but trust me, that won't detract from the experience. If you have a free early evening, I'd highly recommend Gala Tango

Enjoyable. This was one of the best shows we have seen. The floor is right next to the tables, the tango routine is quite intensive and even the 'Gaucho' is great fun. While we did'nt expect it, the wine and food was also ouststanding. Highly recommended.

Good show. This is a more luxurious show. Smaller room than most, and people are sitting closer to stage. Heard dinner was supposed to be good (although I don't trust them). Otherwise, it is a typical tourist show. I have seen this many times, and consider this show on par with others. But the service is excellent, and overall more luxurious. So if others can charge $75 for just show, this place might as well charge $120..Also, La ventana show is actually the same building (owner!?). So this is just the more luxury version..

Very special, memorable show!. I had to write a review of Gala Tango because it was such a perfect experience. The venue is gorgeous, service was five-star all the way, food and drink were excellent, and the show itself was unforgettable. I don't see how you could go wrong with this choice, especially since the venue is intimate enough that everyone has a great seat. I was really blown away by the show, though - the tango was of course amazing, and the dancers were so talented. But I hadn't expected there to be other aspects of the show too. The 'gaucho' dancer who performed with the bolos and the guy who played the "charango" (?) were UN-believable. Truly some of the most exciting performances I've ever seen. And the band playing live music was great too - the accordion player is worth the price of admission all by himself. Speaking of, the price of admission is steep, but for a once in a lifetime experience (plus a great meal), we felt it was totally worth it. I HIGHLY recommend Gala for a memorable night!
Five star tango dinner and show. Endless variations of tango by glamourous couples in slick presentation with live music, fabulous Mexican 'ukulele'?? player too.

Should be sold out nightly!. By far the best night of our visit in Buenos Aires! Our concierge arranged for transportation and we were met at the door and escorted to our table at the edge of the stage. Service was first class all the way and although we knew that the star of the show was going to be the music and the dance, the dinner and the wine were a delicious surprise - not your typical dinner theatre meal at all. The dancing was superb - the passion was palpable and the Tango orchestra was superb. There are certainly other less expensive tango shows but this is a small, intimate and professional troupe and should be on everyone's MUST DO list!!

Great way to see Tango. We really enjoyed Gala Tango, which was recommended by front desk of Loi Suites, where we stayed. Very expensive - $180 per person including pickup from hotel and delivery back to hotel - included excellent dinner, wines, champagne and the show - but we also had to pay some tips so about $200 per person overall. We loved the show and dinner, and felt that if we were going to go one night to see a Tango show, this was the way to do it; the place is small, intimate but great dancers and singers and really nice atmosphere.

Outstanding show. My wife and I were only in Buenos Aires for a couple of days, so we wanted to make the most of them. This show was recommended to us by our hotel (Hotel Pulizter) front desk as a very good tango show. They sent a van to the hotel to transport us to and from the venue. The theater, service and show could not have been better! The show was much more than tango dancers. It was approximately 1 1/2 hours long, with a 5 piece band, singers, Goucho dancer, 4 outstanding couples dancing the tango, and a wonderful entertainer playing the "charango", a small guitar like instrument that he played with gusto. The price includes a welcome champaign cocktail, a full bottle of Argentine wine, another glass of champaign at the end of the evening, and even a short tango leason on stage with one of the dance couples. We had a fantastic time! It is well worth the price of admittance.

Great tango show in an intimate setting.... I chose Gala Tango for my first night in Buenos Aires. Due to jet lag, but not wanting to waste an evening, I thought it would be a good idea to do a "planned activity". This tango show was perfect! The venue sent a van to the hotel to pick me up and the driver was very friendly. Even though he didn't speak English and my Spanish is "muy malo", we seemed to communicate with no problem.When I got to the venue I was so pleasantly surprised at the interior. The setting was small, but very elegant with beautiful decorating and beautifully laid out tables. There isn't a bad seat in the house to see the show. The wait staff is very attentive and really friendly. Oswald was our "head waiter" and he could not have been nicer.Once the show started, it was the perfect mix of showmanship and drama!! The singers take their roles very seriously. While it is very beautiful and moving, just the right amount of wine and fatigue can also bring out a little bit of camp with how dramatic the female singer performs. Nevertheless, it added to the authenticity of the show.Dinner and the show was about $160 USD per person including transportation, bottomless wine, really good food and a fantastic show. For me it was well worth it.

Excellent Tango!. I chose this tango show for its price and location. Gala Tango arranged for transportation to and from my hotel. I dined with people from other countries who had been to other tango shows that they said were too ballet-ish or otherwise didn't have any zest. The show at Gala was not disappointing at all - super passionate live music and tremendously talented young dancers. There are two men with "intermission" sort of routines that are very entertaining. There are also a couple of singers, although I did not enjoy as much as the rest of the program. The food was phenomenal - I think probablyl the best meal I had during my trip to BA. The wait staff was "disappointed" that I could not finish the steak, and really, I wish I could have... but it was just too much food. Delicious. The wine flowed endlessly. I highly recommend this show, in the heart of San Telmo.

Fantastic show, great venue. We booked this through BsAs4U, the cost was 150 US dollars each, the same cost as booking it direct with the tango house, but they provided transport and were very helpful with the booking, they also called the hotel the night before to reconfirm our pick up time. What I liked about this place was that it was small, so whereever you sat you had a great view, we were lucky and were seated right at the front. As far as I am aware there is no VIP seating as we did enquire and were told the tickets were all the same cost. We went for dinner and it was lovely, you have a choice of starter, main & dessert, you get a bucks fizz on arrival and unlimited wine throughout the night and a glass of champagne at the end. You also get the chance before the show to have a quick lesson. The show is excellent, a traditional tango show and it incudes 2 speciaIity acts. I have two criticisms, the first being once the show started it was difficult to locate our waiter to get our wine topped up and the second is that whilst the show was going on they tried to sell us a photo, but if they had waited until the end I may have bought it. Once the show finishes if you have transport you leave quite quickly, it would have been nicer to stay a while. Overall I would definatley recommend this for the show, venue & quality of food and drink.

Best Tango. We went to three dinner tango shows, and Gala Tango was by far the best. Get the VIP seating, which is well worth it for the view, the quality of the food, and the endless Champagne (the menu you get varies by the price of your ticket). This show not only had impeccable vocal performances, but also beautiful, athletic tango dancing, and also featured a pampas cowboy doing an act with the bolos that was truly breathtaking.

Authentic, intimate and enjoyable tango show in the heart of San Telmo. In search of a more traditional, authenic and intimate tango experience than the larger tango halls, I elected to try Gala Tango. The elaborate chandeliers, ornate ceiling and classic furnishings immediately met my expectations of a traditional tango experience.Although I only elected to go to the tango show and not the dinner, the couple on the table next to me said that the food had been a better standard than many of the other tango houses. The waiters and waitresses were very attentive and welcoming; leading us to our table and producing a welcome drink as well as keeping our glasses topped up throughout the evening. The show lasts approximately 2hrs and consists of four dancing couples, two singers and a live tango orchestra, plus an Argentine folkloric performance with a Charango (small guitar) and an impressive gaucho show using bolas (hunting tools) to create a rhythm and music. The intimate stage creates a personal tango experience allowing you to follow and pay attention to the dancers footwork.The only downside of the show were the singers whos voices had probably deteriorated throughout the years. A rendition of ''Don't Cry For Me Argentina'' at the end of the show was slightly cringe-worthy however, their rustic, slightly off-key voices added to the traditional, authentic ambience.You can book Gala Tango through their own website, through your accommodation (although many hotels are linked to particular tango houses) or as I did, through a local travel agency (www.bsas4u.com). Overall, the show was extremely enjoyable and met all my expectations for a traditonal and authentic tango experience in San Telmo.

Veronica and Manuel are Awesome !. My boyfriend and i took this cooking class on a Friday morning. They host it in their apartment which is so homey and beautifully decorated. Veronica and Manuel are super friendly and welcoming. They were wonderful hosts !! While cooking you learn a lot about all of the argentine cuisine culture. they were very knowledgeable about where foods come from and how they originated in the Argentine culture. They even have a big map to help orient you of what region they are talking about. I really appreciated that it wasn't just empanadas ! Even though empanadas are delicious. The foods we made were a bit different and extremely yummy. it takes about 3 hours to make and an hour to eat. I would totally recommend this cooking class to everyone. Had such a great time with our hosts and the other guests that were there. Thank you very much Manuel and Veronica !
Great class! . I completely enjoyed the empanadas class! It was fun and educational. The mix of good food and wine was perfect! Highly recommend them.

Fun way to learn basic Argentine cooking. My friends and I participated in Veronica and Manuel's Saturday class and learned a lot about the history of Argentina's food and wine. My Empanadas did not come out perfectly but I think is something I can go home and improve on and teach the family and have fun with. The three wines were delicious and paired well with the food. We had a great time and walked away with life skills to be useful in the kitchen! Hahaha

Highly Recommend ! . Just totally enjoyed an afternoon with Veronica , sommelier - and Chef Manuel - Excellent - Both so knowledgeable and welcoming - I went alone to the 10 Am -1pm (2:00-Bonus Ha ! ) and met wonderful friends with the common interest of food , wine and learning - You will not be disappointed !

What a Great Time. My wife and I recently participated in this class during our BA visit. I would highly recommend this for those travelling alone, in couples, or groups. We stayed in Palermo Soho which was an easy 25 min walk from our apartment. Veronica and Manuel are fabulous. They take you through a 3-4 hour experience of Argentine food and wine. Our group of 6 had lots of time to interact with each other and our hosts. Manuel's knowledge of food and ingredients comes through and truly makes this an enjoyable lesson. Vivian's experience of wines and the different regions of Argentina spoiled us with some amazing pairings. The class is also well balanced with some hands-on time to try your luck at empanadas. Our 2 hosts also work extremely well together and make the entire experience entertaining and enjoyable. The recipes are being emailed to us and we can't wait to prepare these dishes for families back home.

We had an amazing time at with Tierra Negra!. I can't recommend dining with Veronica and Manuel enough! They are patient and amicable people who will do thier best to both inform and entertain you. Me and my wife had a great time. Don't leave without a llama!

Short, simple, friendly class!. Verónica and Manuel were super friendly and attentive while showing us the basics of three different Argentine recipes. Nice setting, definitely your money's worth and of course delicious food. Would highly recommend!

Great food and hosts. I heartily recommend Tierra Negra as an outstanding cooking class. Veronica, the sommelier, taught us about Argentinian wine and Manuel is an excellent cook and explained about the regions of Argentina and street food. They were gracious hosts and they teach the class in their own home. I always try to take cooking classes when I travel and this was one of the best experiences.

What a great way to spend a few hours in BA!. My friends and I took a 3 hour cooking course with Verónica and Manuel today and we had a great time. Manuel brings a passion and knowledge for local cooking techniques and ingredients which is nicely complemented by Verónica's love of Argentinian wines. The atmosphere is very comfortable and relaxed and the hosts are very friendly and eager to answer any questions. I would without a doubt return for another class next time and recommend it to anyone visiting BA that likes to cook with others.

Incredible experience - a must in Buenos Aires. The perfect blend of cooking, drinking, and learning about Argentina's rich history and geography. Would absolutely recommend for anyone visiting Buenos Aires. We had a blast and the food was amazing.

Fabulous!. We had a fantastic time at the empanadas cooking class. Manuel taught us a lot about empanadas in the different regions of Argentina and Veronica gave us three excellent wines to try. It was located down the street from our hotel in the Palermo Hollywood neighbourhood and was easy to find. Our class included another couple and a single female traveller and everyone really enjoyed themselves. They also gave us good tips on finding indigenous products from the region such as herbs and spices. Well worth it! I think teens would also really enjoy the class.

Best BA Cooking Experience. We enjoyed Veronica and Manuel's cooking class immensely! It is a must do if you are interested in local wine and food. They not only taught us how to make empanadas and flan, but they also provided much background about Argentina as well. They were so warm and welcoming as well as knowledgeable. It is a small group setting that allows you to ask questions and interact throughout the class. If we return to the area, we will certainly be back for another class!

Delicious end to our stay in BA. Our last day in BA was a high light. A street food cook school with Manuel and Veronica. So relaxed and informative being in their home made it very special just like they were our friends. The food the wine delicious, thank u so much.

Informative and Delicious!. Have made a recent habit of taking local cooking classes when I travel, and Tierra Negra did not disappoint. Veronica and Manuel are a really friendly, wonderful couple who are very knowledgeable about food and wine. Manuel taught the cooking portion of the empanadas y vino class I took, and Veronia, a somelier, gave us a great lesson about 3 local wines from Argentina. We made 2 different types of empanadas, plus watched Manuel make a flan, and enjoyed all the food paired with 3 different wines. We were emailed the recipes afterward with recommendations of local restaurants and wine shops. I would highly recommend this class to anyone!

If you love to experience a place through its food, this class is perfect. Veronica & Manuel are kind, generous chefs and I highly recommend their classes. I attended the "street food" class with my sister (a trained chef), and we both loved it. This is a great thing to do at the beginning of a "foodie" tour of BA, because they also send you home with tons of recipes and local recommendations. We loved it and would do it again in a heartbeat.

Informative, Fun & Delicious. Three friends and I spent the evening with Veronica and Manuel making empanadas, llauda (salsa for the empanadas), flan, and dulce de leche. Veronica and Manuel's home felt like a home away from home, as if they were inviting us into their kitchen and their lives. We liked the ambiance with cute decor and soft jazz music playing in the background. Veronica and Manuel were both very friendly, kind, and welcoming. The class included the four of us and two others. It is clear that Veronica and Manuel are experienced in running their cooking class, as they were both very professional and were able to describe their cooking methods with ease. Both Veronica and Manuel spoke very good English. Manuel did a great job explaining the reasoning behind his cooking techniques and answering any questions we had. Veronica was well versed in describing the wine pairings and discussing the different regions of Argentina as related to the food we were cooking and the wine we were tasting. We appreciated their flexibility in their menu, as one of our group members is a vegetarian and another is allergic to alcohol. They provided us with two types of vegetarian empanadas (cheese and onion, and broccoli with cream). They also provided us with fresh fruit juice pairings as a substitute to the wine pairings. We also liked that the class was very "hands on" and we liked creating and rolling the empanadas dough and stuffing our empanadas. Veronica and Manuel are both passionate about what they do and it is evident in the way they teach their class. After the class, we were sent an email with the recipes. Aside from the cooking demonstration and class, the food was incredibly delicious. The empanadas we made were by far the best we had in Argentina, and the flan and dulce de leche were amazing as well.As Americans, we would recommend that you do not arrive to the class hungry. Argentinians tend to eat later than we do in America, so although the class was scheduled for 6pm to 9pm, we started a bit late as the other two guests arrived late and did not eat until 8:30 or 8:45pm. All of us enjoyed the cooking demonstration, but we were also starving. We left around 9:30pm.We would recommend this class to anyone who loves food and/or cooking. We really enjoyed our experience and will definitely return if we are ever back in Buenos Aires.

Learned so much. The recipes prepared were really authentic and we got to make everything completely from scratch! The chef clearly had a lot of experience, maybe worked in a restaurant at some point because he taught us so much about knife skills and playing around with recipes to make them your own. While our food was cooking, we got an extensive lesson in the culture around mate and how to prepare it. We also got a great wine tasting - and not malbec purely because she wanted us to learn about other wines popular in Argentina that are not as well known. Totally worth the money! We had an awesome time because these guys are such fun people.

What a team!. We had a lovely time with Veronica and Manuel. It was great to be in their apartment and, especially to experience their warmth and humour as well as preparing and eating good food and drinking some very good wines. Thanks Veronica for introducing us to "Torrentes", the only truly unique Argentinian wine. Being a group activity it was also a nice opportunity to meet other like minded people. We could not recommend this experience enough. Frank & Gillian Swanberg, Auckland, New Zealand.

Friendly way to enjoy argentinian food, wine and culture!. Friendly way to enjoy argentinian food, wine and culture!We've been in Tierra Negra for cooking in 2016 and really had a great time. The class took place at Emanuel and Veronica home. The place is really charming and Emanuel and Veronica hosted the 6 guests from diferent countries. We've learnt how to prepare empanada dough and filling (meat and cheese fillings) and all tricks on how to knead, open, fill and seal close the empanada dough. We have also learnt how to prepare "dulce de leche" and "dulce de leche" flan. The class takes about 3 hours of leisure time, with good wine and explanations about the several argentinian regions and its distinct habits and culture. Really great experience!

Fantastic evening!. We had an absolutely amazing time with Verónica and Manuel during the empanadas and wine class. We were very impressed with their knowledge of each aspect of the food and wine as well as the regions of Argentina and felt like we learned a lot in a very short period of time. The food was delicious - definitely the best empanadas we've had during our entire time in South America - and the wine selections were spot on but also quite varied to give a good overview of Argentinian wines. Vero and Manu were both also so friendly and we had a great time talking about all that Argentina has to offer - we can't wait to come back again and would highly recommend this class if you find yourself in BA!

Fun and delicious!. We had a wonderful evening with Verónica and Manuel. The class was fun and of course, we ate VERY well. Due to time constraints, some of the prep-work was done before we arrived, but we still had hands-on time, especially with the empanadas. No worries there at all. Manuel did the cooking portion of the class and Verónica discussed the wines, which were all very nice. They make a fun and gracious team.
Lots of fun!. We attended this class recently and can't reccomend it enough! We learnt a lot about the cuisine of Argentina and the wines from specific regions. Highly reccomend!

Was looking for something more hands on. We had a lovely evening with Veronica and Manuel, but were really looking for more of a hands on, intensive cooking course for experienced cooks. Tierra Negra had prepared most of the food to assemble which was a bit dissaponting.
