The hosts were friendly and warm though, so it ended up being a fun and enertaining cultural dinner with a little cooking involved.

Great class, lovely people!. Veronica and Manuel are a breath of fresh air! They are passionate about food and wine, and are such lovely people. Tried some yummy food and wine in their class (and helped prepare some of the food). This is one of the best things I did in Argentina. Definitely recommended!

Great cooking class and experience. We have done a number of cooking classes on our travels around the world. They are a great way to meet other like minded travelers and to try your hand at the local food and flavors. They are also a great way to pick up dining and bar tips from the locals. We had a fantastic evening with the empanadas class. We just might try recreating this class with friends at home!

Fantastic evening. We had a fantastic evening – so good, it was only supposed to be from 6pm-9pm but it was 10pm by the time we left as we were all having such a great time!!The actual cooking itself is very basic- an introduction in how to cook empanadas. However the additional conversation on wine and history by the truly engaging hosts made the evening really fun.I also appreciated the information on the organic sourcing of the ingredients. We were also sent the recipes and some tips on restaurants and bars afterwards via email which was a really thoughtful touch.

Fantastic Buenos Aires experience . This is my first time in Buenos Aires and I have to say without a doubt the Tierra Negra cooking class was the highlight of my trip. It was so much more than a cooking class. Veronica and Manuel welcomed us into their home and alongside the informative step by step crafting of iconic Buenos Aires street food we learned about the country and its culture, food and wine. I could have stayed all day! I can't wait to recreate the yummy menu at home. I highly recommend this experience!

Unbeatable. Verónica and Manuel were so so welcoming - the classes are held at their home in Palermo and the setting couldn't be better.The speed and participation of the lesson is perfect, and both Verónica and Manuel are incredibly passionate about what you make and where all the ingredients are sourced. I'd recommend this to anybody at any age for a wonderful introduction to traditional (and delicious!!) Argentinean food.¡Gracias!

A wonderful experience - Do it!. My sister and I had a fantastic time with Veronica and Manuel today making empanadas, flan and dulce de leche. Matching Argentine wines with each course were well chosen, and the information about the various regions of Argentina was fascinating. We all got to make the recipes and lots of local tips were given to great food in Buenos Aires. Thank you so much Veronica for an unforgettable experience.

Eat and drink.....and learn to cook!. My brother organized this class as part of my birthday present and I have to say.....best present ever! Manuel and Veronica were so warm and knowledgeable. We cooked empanadas, flan and dulce de leche and all were extremely tasty and able to be made at home. And the wine pairings with each course were sensational. A wonderful experience I would do again next time I'm in BA.

really nice cooking workshop and experience in Palermo. A must if in BA!. I loved it, small group at the lovely house of Veronica and Manuel. By 1 pm at a Saturday afternoon, only 2 days after I arrived at BA I already knew how to make empanadas and how to drink the best wines of Argentina;-)

A Fun Taste of BA. My husband and I recently enjoyed an excellent Empanadas and Wine class with Manuel and Veronica! We were visiting Buenos Aires from NYC and wanted to learn a bit more about some of our favorite things - namely great wine and the best of BA's local food! Manuel and Veronica invited us into their lovely home, and it was a fun, educational, and smooth experience, from start to finish. They were very well-organized and took the time to help us understand the regional nuances of the food and wine that we were enjoying. Manuel is an experienced chef, and it was clear that Veronica loved sharing her passion for wine. Highly recommended experience in BA - we went home very full and very happy! Now I just need to try to replicate everything we learned at home...

Fantastic food and teachers. My wife Jess and I joined Manuel and Veróinca for our class we made empanadas and flan amongst other things. The wine matches and the information about it were as great as the food. Such a nice classroom too.Can't recommend this enough!!

Fun and tasty! . We went to the street food class - Manuel and Veronica were amazing hosts and it is held in their welcoming and beautiful apartment. We learnt a lot about Argentinean food and culture, and learnt many techniques. One of the best experiences we have paid for, would definitely go again. So much delicious food you get to take home a wee doggy bag too! 100% worth it!

Fun night and good food. Manuel and Veronica make you feel really welcome in a relaxed easy going introduction to argentine cooking. Manuel does the cooking while Veronica does the wine in a fun and informative manner. We had our 17 year old daughter with us and she really enjoyed the class as well learning how to make the empanadas and dulce de leche that she had already enjoyed on our trip.

Delicious and fun. We did this cooking class on our first day in BA and it was a really great introduction to the culture and food here. All the food was delicious and was paired well with three types of wine. It was also fun to get some hands on experience with folding the empanadas. We would highly recommend this experience to anyone traveling to BA.

Great class, delicious food & wine!. Wonderful group experience learning the ropes of cooking authentic Argentine food and tasting delicious wine! We had so much fun at this class & enjoyed both the atmosphere of Veronica & Manuel's home as well as their company! Would recommend this to families, couples, or anyone interested!

Great fun!. I really enjoyed the empanada making class and I would recommend any visitors to BA to spend an evening at Tierra Negra! The whole evening was amazing from the wines, the class, the friendly atmosphere and lastly the delicious empanadas!!

Trip Highlight!! You will not be disappointed !!!. This class is a fantastic way to learn about Argentinian culture and cuisine! Manuel and Veronica are both knowledgeable and fun, and you and your belly will not be disappointed ! They were very accommodating and really made us feel welcome in their home. The class was hands on and the food we prepared was delicious, and we even had leftovers to take home. We also learned about wine and sampled various organic wines with each part of our meal. The whole experience was wonderful and I did not stop smiling or laughing the whole class. It was the highlight of my time in Buenos Aires and I'll cherish the memories, and the recipes we learned whenever I think of Argentina or am craving a delicious comfort food !

Great Class in Buenos Aires. We had a private class with Veronica and Manuel in Buenos Aires. Empanadas and wine and flan - done for four of us. Hands on - we learned how to make one of our Buenos Aires favorites and tasted some great wines. This is a really great way to spend a couple of hours in BA - and you will leave stuffed and happy!

Highly recommend!!. This cooking class was a highlight of my time in Buenos Aires!! And I had a really great time in Buenos Aires.Manuel is a great teacher. He taught us not just how but why, explaining thoroughly the rationale behind different aspects of the cooking process. He really knows a lot and was very professional.Veronica is so bright and friendly and welcoming. We really enjoyed learning about the different kinds of wines which were delicious and perfectly matched with the food.I wish I had done this earlier in my trip so I could do the other 2 cooking classes also!

Such an excellent experience!. I can't say enough great things about this class! Veronica and Manuel are incredibly inviting, fun and interesting. We did the empanadas class, which was not only delicious, but very informative. Manuel has spent many years in various restaurants across the globe and ties in history and heritage with his recipes along with the science behind each ingredient and how they interact with each other.They also have great respect for each ingredient, only using grass fed beef, non-gmo products and organic whenever possible. Veronica did a great job describing each wine, where it was from, what to expect from the terroir, etc. Vivacious and welcoming, and as generous with the wine as you'd like.You will not leave hungry or thirsty, for sure.I'd definitely sign up for another class the next time we're in BA!

Fabulous!. Don't miss the opportunity to take a class. This was one of the highlights of our trip. Verónica & Manuel were fabulous hosts and made us feel at home. The empenadas were amazing and the flan with the dulce de leche was out of this world. This is a must while in BA.

Fabulous cooking class!. This was the perfect cooking class for us! We made the dough for the empanadas and filled them with three different fillings. They were the best empanadas we have had here! Not only was the class informative--who knew that you could grate a tomato?---but it was so much fun. Veronica and Manuel are the perfect team, and they do a wonderful job of creating a relaxing environment. Of course, the three kinds of wine helped! When we return, we are now going to replicate this menu for a dinner party. From the appetizer to the empanadas with salsa to flan with dulche de leche....it was a memorable evening. Muchos gracias to our chef and his wife.

The best experience. Highly recommended! Meeting Manuel and Veronica, who are so welcoming and fun, and getting a cooking and wine education from a trained professional chef and travel expert, in their home, was truly a highlight of our trip. Perfect sized group of other travelers (eight of us), made it intimate and personalized. Can't say enough about our wonderful experience.

Make your own empanadas. We truly enjoyed this evening class. Veronica and Manuel were delightful hosts. However, we have attended many cooking classes before in our homeland, Canada, and we found that this class was more geared to “newbies” to the kitchen and the presented foods were quite simple to prepare. But it was a pleasure to interact and share travel experiences with other people, enhanced with the tasty Argentinian wines that we all shared.

Exceptional evening of cooking and culture. It's hard to describe in words how warm, welcoming and wonderful our evening with Veronica & Manuel was for us. The experience was like a big hug after you've fallen and scraped your knee. We were welcomed into Veronica and Manuel's home with open arms and complete kindness. Their love for their city and country was apparent and genuine. Through delicious food and wine from the region, Veronica and Manuel won our hearts. We walked away with a deep appreciation for the customs and culture of Buenos Aires, as well as multiple recipes to bring home so we can forever keep Argentina in our lives. Manuel is a talented and passionate chef who demonstrated, explained and taught us how to make empanadas and dulce de leche (and more!), and Veronica is an outstanding host and wine connoisseur who attended to all of our needs with a big smile. If (and when) we make it back to Buenos Aires, we will be visiting Veronica and Manuel. Don't miss this!

A 'Must Do' Experience. After spending many several days exploring the beautiful city of Buenos Aires, this was an excellent way to spend a Saturday morning! Veronica & Manuel were wonderful hosts that immediately made us feel welcome in their home. Manuel is a excellent instructor who is clearly passionate about cooking and Veronica is a ray of sunshine with a wealth of knowledge about the wonderful wines they introduced to us. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed this class. I can't wait to make empanadas and flan at home!!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Delicious empanadas. My husband and I loved our evening with Manuel and Veronica. They have the class planned to perfection - from the warm welcome and the instruction to the wine tasting, dough rolling and empanada filling. You don't have to be a seasoned cook to take part, and you'll learn lots of culinary, historical or wine-related facts. Veronica and Manuel are relaxed, entertaining and organized hosts!

Highlight of our trip in Buenos Aires!. We had the most wonderful time with Manuel and Veronica at our cooking class. They welcomed us into their home and we learnt how to make empanadas, flan and dulce de leche the original way. Manuel was a very through and excelled chef who is everything you would want in a teacher. He gave very thorough advice and history about the food that was well catered to all of our questions and food needs. Veronica was an enthusiast of wine, which I loved since I also am a huge fan. She was charismatic, charming and informative about the both the wine and food. An evening well spent and felt like we had an amazing dinner party at their house. We met wonderful people from all over the world and had a great night.

Don't miss this!. You will love this experience. Manuel and Veronica were amazing hosts, the food & wine were delicious & we learned some wonderful recipes and useful tips. I'll be back again next time I'm in BA.

Time well spent. We really enjoyed the market tour and seasonal menu. Verónica and Manuel were wonderful hosts. Verónica's market tour was great and it was nice to see where some of the freshest organic meats and vegetables come from. Manuel's cooking lesson was very informative and we really liked learning about many tips and tricks in the kitchen. The food was absolutely amazing and we are excited to try the recipes at home. It was a wonderful way to enjoy the lovely neighbourhood of Palermo Hollywood and meet two of the nicest hosts in the city. Thank you Verónica and Manuel for a wonderful culinary adventure!

Fun and tasty. I loved this small, hands on class on making empanadas. Veronica's knows her wine and geography, and Manuel knows his food, so they were a great team. Their English and sense of humor is fabulous, so that made the three hours zip by. It was especially fun sharing experiences with the other international travelers.

Empanada Heaven!. My husband and I signed up for the evening empanada cooking class and had an absolute blast. Manuel and Veronica were super welcoming and wonderful hosts. I've been to a lot of cooking classes on our vacations and this one was the perfect blend of instruction & fun. I really appreciated that they took the time to explain the history of the empanada, cultural significance, and differences in ingredients based on regions in Argentina. We were treated to a number of excellent appetizers as we prepared the main course and they were paired beautifully with wines handpicked by Veronica. Folding the empanadas was my favorite part! Manual answered any and all questions related to cooking technique from ingredient selection to kitchenware. They were even kind enough to share some of their favorite restaurants in Buenos Aires and in El Calafate where we were travelling next. It was the BEST start to our vacation!

Amazing Class!. My two girlfriends and I unanimously agree that this was our favorite thing we did in Buenos Aires. The class is small (6 people) and is taught in a cute apartment in a trendy part of town, which gave it a nice, intimate feeling. Veronica and Manuel were amazing hosts. Manuel is a chef and takes you through the cooking class, while Veronica fills in the gaps and downtime by conducting a wine tasting (3 FULL glasses of wine and then some) and teaching about the different regions of Argentina. There was never a dull moment! They were truly sweet people, and were happy to answer all our questions (about cooking and Argentina in general). But of course the best part was eating our delicious cooked meal at the end of the class all together. I couldn't recommend this class more!

Fantastic Empanadas. Veronica and Manuel were awesome. They are very welcoming and informative with a great sense of humour. The food tastes and smells amazing. We all had an excellent day and will use these recipes when we get home.Thanks Veronica And Manuel

Excelente!. Manuel and Veronica are so awesome! They were very gracious hosts and thought of every little detail to make the class a beautiful cultural experience. We learned so much about Argentinian history and little kitchen tips that will be very useful at home.Our two week travels brought us to BA and a cooking class was not always on the agenda. After making/eating empanadas and flan and three "tastings" (full glasses) of wine I'm happy to report this is a must for any BA traveler.

Best cooking class ever. Took the empanada class, and it was just amazing! Manuel and Veronica were so nice and funny, and the place was so cozy. Also the food was unbelievably delicious, had the most delicious empanadas ever! I was sick all the time in Buenos Aires so I hadn't really done much, but this cooking class is one of the best things I've done in Buenos Aires (Just like everyone else here says). If you're planning to do this class I highly recommend to do it at the start of your Buenos Aires journey, because they recommend all the nice restaurants to try out in BA! Manuel and Veronica even recommended me the restaurants in Bariloche since I was planning on visiting there as well. They're just the nicest people! Book the class right now, you will never regret!

We had the most amazing time!. One of the most fun and well run cooking classes I have ever done... And I have done a few.We did the Empanada class and learnt to make 2 Empanadas and a Flan with Dulce De Leche. Yum yum yum.At points the class was not as hands on as I expected, but this was made up for by the amount of information and teaching we received. (And also allowed our full class that was having such a great time, time to relax and socialise).Verónica and Manuel make such a great team. Manuel running you through the food side of things and Verónica the wine. And there was plenty of both!They are very warm hospitable people and make you feel very welcome.We only wish we had time to come back and do their other classes!You will undoubtably love this class.

One of the best things we've done in BA. We wanted to experience the local culture so we decided to book a class to learn how to cook empanadas, flan & dulce the leche. It was absolutely amazing. The food we prepared was delicious and the wines we tried were great! Veronica & Manuel organised a wonderful 3-hour session and we couldn't be happier.

Just Spectacular!. We just finished the 3 hour cooking class that was the best thing we have done in Buenos Aires. Veronica and Manuel were just fantastic. So welcoming. Extremely clean and well organized. They pre-measure everything so that you can visualize what your are doing and remember what you have done. You are able to learn a lot of cooking and appreciate a lot of eating, in the very efficient short time. It was all effortless. Manuel has deep culinary knowledge. He conveys cooking techniques, and a through understanding of ingredients and the cultural origins of the food we/they are preparing. Veronica really conveyed the origin and many varieties of all Argentinian wine including the 4 very well chosen local wines that were served with the class. Their english is outstanding. They gave us restaurant recommendations in Buenos Aires, shopping suggestions, researched where we could locate spices and good Argentinian cutlery; travel advice, shopping and restaurant recommendations for our trip to Bariloche. You couldn't get a better experience than this if you had cousins in Buenos Aires. It would be the first thing i would do if coming to Buenos Aires...especially for the first time.

Cooking great food!. Veronica and Manuel organise a great day - a trip to a local organic market followed by a lot of cooking accompanied by good wines! The very informal setting allows you to ask lots of questions about Argentinian cuisine. A wonderful way to spend a day in this great city!

What a night . On Christmas night, our first night in buenos aires, we took a cooking class here in Manuel and Veronica's lovely home. It was a perfect evening of making empanadas, learning about the wide range of wines argentina has to offer , and discovering the warm and loving hospitality of this talented couple. A great way to prepare us for the culinary discoveries ahead in the next too weeks. I would highly recommend this and look forward to returning again on another visit to Buenos Aires.

Brillo. Great fun and delicious food! Learned lots about the region, strong focus on local organic produce. We were able to ask lots of questions, found out about some good local spots to go to and had a great time with our fellow guests who were also able to share their experiences in BA

Great food, wonderful evening!. We just got back from the 'Finger Food' class and I'm already looking forward to making all the fantastic 'snacks' for our friends when back home. Manu is an excellent chef and Veronica a great host and sommelier. You're invited into their amazing loft home where they have set up a homey cooking studio. Manu does a great job explaining what to do, so you end up with these fantastic 'finger foods' (in between quotes, because it's so much more than just finger food). While preparing the food, Veronica lets you taste a great cocktail and some beautiful wines. Both of them share a lot of background about Argentinian (food)culture as well, which makes this a cultural experience as well. Plus, they're just very nice people to spend some time with. We had a lovely evening! Can recommend to anyone!

Amazing. I tool this class on one of my last days before leaving, and am so glad I was able to squeeze it in. Veronica and Manuel are fantastic and the empanadas were great. If you have the time and were thinking of taking a class, it´s definitely worth it.

Favorite activity in Buenos Aires!. A friend and I took this class a week ago and it was the highlight of our time in Buenos Aires and definitely one of our favorite things after traveling to Chile, Argentina and Brazil. It was a lot of fun being welcomed into someone's home! Veronica and Manuel were both awesome with such enthusiastic personalities. We watched and participated in making empanadas, flan and dulce de leche. We were able to try 3 different kinds of wine which were all delicious! I can't wait to try and make the recipes at home. If I am back in Buenos Aires I'd like to go to another class to learn something new. In addition to sending the recipes from class, Veronica also sends recommendations for places to eat/shop in Buenos Aires which was great as well. Definitely add this to your list!

Great cooking class . My husband and I took this class as part of Buenos Aires visit. It was great. Hosts are very knowledgeable about food , wine and history of Argentina. Small class. Great experience. People who have joined the class were foodies and kind of adventures. We had a great time.

Kudos to Verónica and Manuel. Impressive from beginning to end! Veronica and Manuel are great hosts, the class takes place in a very cozy setting on one of the floors in their house - don't get me wrong, it's all very professional! And upon noticing our interest in Argentinian wine and culture they went the extra mile to educate and entertain us. Apart of course from what the whole class was about, delicious empanadas and dulce de leche. Can't wait to come back for their other courses. Have referred friends and they've all loved it.

AMAZING cooking class!. We had an amazing time with Veronica and Manuel in their cooking class, which they teach out of a lovely loft in Palermo. They teach you much more than just how to put the ingredients together; Manuel demonstrates a lot of technique and explains the chemistry of ingredients. The gaucho sandwich was the best sandwich I've ever had! Veronica's wine pairings were perfect, it really enhanced the enjoyment of the meal. The portions were generous as were the people. Veronica even helped us get a cab as it was stormy outside. We can't recommend this enough! -Brandy & Racquel

Perhaps the highlight of our time in BA!. We had such a wonderful time at TN. Verónica and Manuel were extremely warm, knowledgable, and passionate about Argentinian cooking and culture. Highly recommended!!!

Great hosts, excellent food!. The cooking class with Veronica and Manuel was just great - probably the best experience I had during my trip to Buenos Aires. I took the market and seasonal menu class: First we went to a really nice organic market and Veronica showed us a lot of typical food and the vendors there let us even try some things. After that we went back and prepared a delicious 4-course-menu - with wine pairing of course. For example the main course was home made gnocchi with lamp meat which was really great. I will definitely prepare this dish again at home. Veronica and Manuel are so nice people. They tought us a lot about food, especially about Argentinian food and traditions. And they answered all our questions about country and people. This was maybe the best thing about the course: to have the opportunity to talk - like with friends - with Argentinian locals for several ours and learn so much about the culture of the country. Great experience!

These are the experiences I seek out while traveling.. Really phenomenal. We ended up having a private class and even as experienced 'home chefs' we picked up tons of tips, tricks, recipes and stories about Argentina plus some delicious food to boot.

It was like cooking at a good friend's house. We did the seasonal menu cooking class which included a trip to the local organic market to shop for the ingredients for the meal. Veronica took us to the market and introduced us to the vast array of organic produce available locally. Manuel then took us through a good balance of demonstration and hands on learning as we prepared and ate 4 different courses - all accompanied by matching wines of the region. Manuel and Veronica have created a lovely, calm, welcoming home, the perfect environment to host their guests, and they made us feel relaxed and like old friends as we laughed and cooked together. If you enjoy food and want to get an authentic local experience I would definitely recommend joining one of Manuel and Veronica's cooking classes. It is brilliant way to spend an afternoon and an experience you will not quickly forget.

Must Do for Foodies Visiting Buenos Aires!. My boyfriend and I took the Finger Food and Cocktails class a couple weeks ago with Manuel and Veronica. Since it is the slow season in Buenos Aires, we ended up being the only 2 students for the night! We started out learning how to make 2 kinds of dough from Manuel- one for bread and one for empanadas. As we were working on our dough, Veronica gave us a cocktail to start the evening. We went on to make salsa criolla and chimichurri, before putting the empanadas together (and learning several folding techniques)! We then went on to make andean potatoes, a gaucho sandwich, and choripan. The class was about half participation, half demonstration, but Manuel walked us through each step to make sure we would be confident recreating the dishes at home, all while sipping on the cocktails and wines Veronica gave us (with explanation of the origin). We thoroughly enjoyed the conversation throughout the evening, and were able to ask our hosts questions about the Argentinian culture and Buenos Aires. When the food was ready to eat, Veronica and Manuel went into the kitchen and gave us a little privacy to enjoy our meal. The food was amazing (our favorites were the empanadas and choripan) and we stuffed ourselves. We were not able to finish everything, so Manuel gave us a to go container with our leftovers (which we finished after going to the bar that night). After the class, Veronica and Manuel emailed us the recipes from the class, and also recommendations of their favorite spots in Buenos Aires. Our night with Tierra Negra was one of the highlights from our trip to Buenos Aires! It was such a unique experience that we will treasure for years to come (especially when we make the recipes we learned).Thank you Tierra Negra Cooking!

Learning to cook in Buenos Aires. What a wonderful wrap up to our trip to Buenos Aires. The class was not only informative but Veronica was delightful and helpful with questions about the city and took us to the organic marketplace!! Manuel is an excellent chef with so much knowledge of local food.

Simple yet tasty. Veronica and Manuel were great hosts and very knowledgable about all things food and wine. We received recipes for the empanadas, flan and dulce de leche that we made and had very generous servings of the wines paired with each course. Being low season, it was great to have a personalized evening with them.

Wonderful evening in Buenos Aires. One of my favorite things to do when I travel the US and abroad is to take a cooking class. Tierra Negra provided a great evening. Veronica & Manuel were amazing and not only did I learn to make Empanadas... I learned about the various wines of the region. They also gave me the best tip for ice cream in the city... spot on!!

A definite must when visiting Buenos Aires. I have taken two separate classes and enjoyed both of them. The second class I took was a customized class for myself and two friends. yes, they even customize classes for you! It is a wonderful experience. I love to cook but do not always have the time so this was a relaxing and yummy experience. Chef Manuel is a great teacher and the ingredients he uses are always fresh and healthy. The host and organizer Veronica is very welcoming. Signing up for the class is very simple and you get to learn a lot about Buenos Aires, its people, its culture, and its food and cuisine. You are paying the same price for a meal with a few glasses of wine as well so why not do it with friends and others and learn how to cook at the same time. Thanks to Manuel and Veronica for always giving me an extra special evening in Argentina.

A fantastic experince. The cooking close was my favorite part while visiting Buenos Aires. I truley enjoyed spending all morning learning and listening to Manuel and Veronica and wished it lasted longer.

Best evening in Buenos Aires. Loved my cooking class with Tierra Negra. Very hands on and the owners were super friendly and welcoming to all. I did the empanada making course and wish I´d had time for the others. Next time!

Our friends went, then their friends went, then I went.... A group of friends took this cooking class and raved and raved about how amazing it was. They recommended it, and another couple I know took a private class. The couple also kept telling me how awesome this class was. When I found myself in Argentina a month later, I obviously had to take the class as well.It was fantastic, and worthy of all the glorious recommendations that I heard. I took a private cooking class with a friend since their normal class schedule wasn't convenient for us (I believe it was a $10-15pp surcharge). The couple was great, and we left with the confidence that we could make the empanadas and dulce de leche at home. They also taught us a lot about organic foods and wines in Argentina. Fabulous experience, and highly recommended.

Fun and delicious experience in Buenos Aires!. My husband signed us up for a cooking class with Manuel and Vernoica and it was well worth it! Manuel showed us how to make scrumptious empanadas and Dulce de leche, and Veronica introduced us to delicious cheese and wines. They were both very friendly, professional and knowledgeable. Veronica sent us all the recipes and tips the next day, which I cannot wait to try at home!I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for an activity in Buenos Aires.

Best Family activity in Buenos Aires = Learn to Cook together. Cooking class with Manuel and Veronica was our 9 year old son's favorite thing we did in 12 days in Buenos Aires. Their apartment in Palermo where the class is taught is bright and charming. Manuel is a real, professional chef, well trained and a good teacher. He worked with our son on knife skills and coached him to feeling accomplished and proud. We are grateful for Veronica's tour of El Galpon organic farmers market and the delicious Argentinian gin & tonic cocktail she served with a rosemary branch. If you're considering a cooking class, do this one.

Wonderful experience. We really enjoyed our cooking class with Manuel and Veronica. They made two vegetarian fillings for the empanadas (as well as one meat one) to accommodate our teenage daughter who does not eat meat and Veronica also made this really lovely fruit-infused water for her since she is underage and could not partake in the wine. There was not a lot of hands-on during the class - other than making the dough and stuffing the empanadas - but that suited us just fine and Veronica sent us all the recipes by email after class and we'll be trying them at home. Our fellow guests were really nice and enthusiastic about the experience, we really enjoyed learning about (and tasting) the different wines and Manuel gave us a number of great cooking tips while putting everything together, several of which I'll be incorporating on a regular basis in my cooking. All in all, a great evening with fantastic food and really lovely company. Cannot recommend enough.

Best experience in Buenos Aires!. I took two cooking classes with Veronica and Manuel and it was my favourite experience in Buenos Aires! It had everything I wanted from an Argentinian experience : local food, people and wines! The classes were held in their home which gave it a very comfortable and authentic feel! You are invited into their homes and they are so professional and personable. The food was delicious, fresh and even organic! Veronica always filled up our wine glasses! I definitely recommend this!!!

A super fun hands-on experience!. While in Mendoza I met another solo traveler that recommended this cooking class for my time in BA, and I'm so glad that she did! At first I felt a bit shy when I arrived on my own, but by the time Veronica poured the first glass of wine, everyone started loosening up, interacting with one another and having a lot of fun! Manuel and Veronica's place is very charming, and perfectly set-up to run their classes. Our class was planned out perfectly, it flowed smoothly and easily, and before we knew it, the time was up! I took the empanada class, and those were hands-down the best empanadas I ate on my trip. Veronica paired the wines beautifully with each course, and shared some wine knowledge with us which was interesting. Overall it was a great experience which I would recommend to anyone. Now I just have to try those recipes out at home!(This review is a few months after my class, but better late than never, right?!)

We get more than we bargained for... We had a class that something wasnt expecting this cool, one word explains all : "amazing".Manuel (the master chef) and Veronica make you feel at home and so warm and welcoming.Not only impressed with their teaching skills impress witht their character as well and invited them to Istanbul to show them our traditional cusine :)I can now surprise my guest at home with making empanadas, flan, and dulce de leche from scratch. It was an amazing experience and highly recomended.

More than an amazing cooking class- a wonderful experience!. I had an amazing night with these welcoming and friendly hosts! Thank you Veronica and Manuel for your wealth of knowledge on food and wine and making us feel completely at home! This is something I would not normally had participated in but I am so glad I did! I learnt a lot about the traditional foods and history as well as techniques for cooking it, all while enjoying some local wines and hearing about the regions that they came from! I highly recommend this experience and want to thank Veronica and Manuel for welcoming us into their home and giving us the experience of meeting some true locals in such a beautiful place!

Unforgettable Experience!. This class was absolutely amazing and the people were even better! My friend and I took this class together on a Saturday afternoon and had an amazing experience.The people were so sweet and the food was amazing. It was the exact Argentine food experience I was looking for. I will never forget this day or how special this experience was. I recommend this class to anyone traveling through Buenos Aires, you will not be disappointed! Thank you to the best hosts ever for having us in their cozy home! I look forward to cooking empanadas and flan once I return home to the United States :)

Wonderful Class with Great People!. We had such a great experience with this class, would recommend it to anyone traveling to Buenos Aires! They were very professional and we learned very much in the cooking class, as well as knowledgeable about the local culture and history of the foods we prepared. Best of all they were very friendly and easy to talk to - excellent English- it felt like we had been invited into a friends home. Thank you for a wonderful afternoon!

Loved it!!. I thoroughly enjoyed the class learning how to make empanadas, flan, and dulce de leche. I was immediately impressed when walking into their home as the space is so creative and the set up so professional. They are both from Argentina and so not only do you learn the techniques for making the dishes but also about the culture. Manuel has many years of professional cooking experience and the dishes were so beautifully prepared. The wine pairing was so much fun and educational. As a woman travelling by myself I found this to be a really fun way to connect with other travellers as well. I would highly recommend taking one of their classes, as it was one of the many highlights of my Trip! And...it's also in a very nice area of Buenos Aires that is easily accessible.

AMAZING! HIGHLY RECOMMEND. We unfortunately couldn't make the group cooking classes and opted for a private class instead. We couldn't have been more Pleased with the care and attention that was given to us. The food was amazing as well as the company. We highly recommend this to anyone looking for a great cooking class while drinking great wine and learning more about the different regions of Argentina.

So much fun!. My boyfriend and I had a lovely time at Veronica and Manuel's cookery class. They welcomed us into their beautiful home for 3 hours and we thoroughly enjoyed the wine tasting and making empanadas. I would 100% go to one of their other classes next time I'm in Buenos Aires!

Cooking Class in Buenos Aires. This was a great and relaxing way to spend a fun afternoon with a small group. The hosts,Veronica and Manuel, were lovely - so warm and welcoming. I've never taken a cooking class on vacation - I'll definitely do something like this again. My husband, who has no interest in cooking, agreed to join me and he thoroughly enjoyed it. We had a terrific lunch with the food we helped make and enjoyed some delicious wine pairings. I highly recommend this.

Great day!. This was one of our highlights in BA. We were a group 6 family & friends & from the outset we were made to feel relaxed, welcome & included. Veronica took us (by bus) to an organic food market where she sourced some produce before heading back for our cooking session. Together with Manuel ,a very passionate & knowledgeable chef ,they made an amazing team, a really beautiful couple. They assisted us in making a delicious 3 course lunch with a G & T & wine to go with it. It was so much fun, a day we wont forget in a hurry.

Wonderfull coocking class in Parlermo Hollywood, BA. Veronica and Manuel are very passionate people. He is the chef and she is the 'sommelier'. They both create a very relaxed atmosphere, together with the 8 people that joined the class that night.Lovely wines also (great Torontes, Malbec and desert wines). Not just tasting quantities but full glasses to enjoy during class!You get the recipiues afterwards by mail. I would have preferred to have them in hard copy right at the class so you can make notes. Apart from that everything was perfect! We do coocking classes everywhere we go and this was one of the beter ones

So much fun!. I highly recommend a fun different and yummy night out with Veronica and Miguel! Even if you are an experienced chef or a beginner level admirer, you would enjoy the cooking class. We did the empanadas class and tasted 3 wines which were amazing and very carefully picked! The hosts are super sympathic and fun! Everything we did or watched while Miguel was preparing was delicious! And compared to similar activities in BA, the price is very reasonable. Do it!

empanada love. Fabulous evening of making empanadas, flan, dulce de leche, and oh so much vino ☺Veronica and Manuel were the most gracious hosts and a wealth of knowledge about Buenos Aires and beyond.

La tierra negra cooking class. Wonderful experience...my girlfriend and I learnt how to make empanadas and dulce de leche with Miguel and Veronica, 2 great and gracious hosts who really spend the time to make sure you have a good time. The wine was delicious as well.

Greatest cooking class ever!!!!. My partner had organised a surprise cooking class for me in Argentina. She had found these guys on Trip Advisor to begin with. I'm not the greatest at cooking but they were patient and amazing. They changed the menu for preparation on our request. They were lovely people and also offered us small canapés with matching wines throughout the night. We make beautiful Empanadas and Alfajores which they made seem really easy. I would 100% recommend these guys. After our class we all went down and got a beer from their local bar too. A great and memorable night in Buenos Airies :-)

Great day, brilliant cooking class!. I enjoyed the Market class last Saturday and was blown away by the whole operation - very professionally put together, yet entirely laid back and we were treated as friends in their home the whole time. Would highly recommend to anyone of any cooking experience level.

Best way to spend your last night in Bs.As.. I had booked the weekend markets and lunch class, but it was cancelled due to inclement weather. Veronica and Manuel suggested I do the empanadas class instead and I am so glad I did,Veronica and Manuel made everyone feel warmly welcome and gave us many great culinary as well as cultural tips about their fabulous city. This was my final night after 2 weeks in Buenos Aires and I was so happy to be able to spend it enjoying great food, great wine and great company.This is more a demonstration than actual hands on class. The ingredients are prepared, ready for us to make our own dough. Manuel demonstrates the filling for the empanadas, kindly omitting the olives from my share. Shaping the empanadas is much more difficult than it looks, a skill to be practised.Manuel demonstrates how to make the flan and dulce de leche, which reminded me very much of my mum's caramel sauce.Veronica takes our tastebuds on a tour of 3 wine regions, pairing them with cheese, the empanadas and the flan and dulce de leche.The next day we were sent recipes, so that we can hopefully reproduce everything back home. They also sent me a list of restaurants to try, but unfortunately time got the better of me and I was unable to get to them. Next time!

Such a fun day!!. Great cooking class!! First Veronica took us to an adorable farmers market to buy ingredients for our class, she explained the foods that were sold there and took us into to garden to show us the veggies that were grown there. Then back to their apartment where Manuel showed us how to cook a DELICIOUS meal. He was a great teacher and explained the ins and outs of the processes and why and how it works. The Argentinian gin was amazing!! I don't like gin usually but this was divine!! I need to find where to buy it in Australia! Veronica and Manuel are great, fun people and will be back to do another class when next in Buenos Aries. Thanks again!!

Best experience. Last Easter my boyfriend and I took the Empanadas class and certainly it was the best thing we did in Buenos Aires. Veronica and Manuel really know how to make you feel like a guest, she also gave us some very good tips about the city and about some restaurants!Really recommend it!

an absolute MUST if you are into Argentina & cooking!!. I love Argentina and I love cooking and this class is the perfect combination of both of it! Manuel & Verónica are great, friendly, they make you feel comfortable and welcome, they are flexible to whatever needs you might have and most of all, it can really be seen that they love what they are doing! I'm sure that's why besides their professionalism their classes are being such a success!! We learnt how to cook some of Argentina's most famous dishes and both guys are willing to answer whichever question one might have in a very professional and friendly way! It´s fun to be at their place cooking, learning, enjoying great wine and getting to know new people from different countries! The place is well located and very cozy and you will definitely be fascinated when leaving with more than full stomachs (the DDL is absolutely amazing!!), wanting to come back soon to enjoy another class! THANK YOU GUYS!!

suzanne b. both manuel and veronica are awesome, engaging hosts. they both shared their knowledge of food techniques and the wines we were sipping and sipping with our tasting menus. i am hosting my own empanada party when i return home. a must do on your buenos aires to do list

What? No 6/5 rating? Fine, guess we'll have to settle on 5/5!. If you're at all remotely interested in food, make sure this is on your list! Even if you aren't, take the time to have a visit. A throughly enjoyable morning with amazing food and a ton of new techniques and recipes to take home and try. Empanadas, dolce de leche, flan.... seem hard? Not for us now. Only thing keeping us from running home to experiment is a few more weeks in Argentina!Veronica & Manuel offered a through explanation (in great english) of the preparation techniques down to the types of salt and kinds of oils used (and why) along with relevant backstory of Argentian history. The wine pours weren't just tasting pours (and the glasses got filled up when they were empty!) We left with full stomachs, a ton of knowledge about local food, more recommendations for local restaurants and culinary trips than we have time for (sadly). Looking forward to revisiting this class in what is becoming our inevitable return to BA!

Excellent Class!. I had such a great time with Veronica and Manuel! They were both extremely friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable. The empanadas, flan, and dulce de leche were amazing! I especially loved Manuel's attention to the science behind the cooking and Veronica's wine recommendations based on personal preference. I highly recommend Tierra Negra. My evening with them was a highlight of my trip.

A highlight of my trip to BsAs!. I was lucky enough to take two classes with Manuel and Veronica during my week in Buenos Aires. Totally worth it, a highlight of my stay, and I'd love to come back for more the next time I'm in BsAs! Veronica and Manuel are such great people: helpful, welcoming, friendly yet professional, flexible, knowledgeable -- I just love them! I've now taken four cooking classes in three different countries, and this one is truly set apart by the teacher/hosts. I hope our paths cross again soon! Below I'll describe the two classes I took, in case anyone wants more detail/insight.Class #1) Manuel and Veronica arranged a special class for us since my husband and I were travelling with our 5 year-old. We made empanadas (beef and caprese), flan, and dulce de leche. The adults enjoyed 3 lovely wines and Veronica blended lovely organic juices for my son. I admit, the class was a *little* bit less hands-on than I thought it would be, but the info and demos from Manuel were great. If you're interested in a more hands-on experience, just ask! I'm sure he'll invite you up to his station at the head of the table to do some steps with him. Our favorite part was working/kneading/rolling the empanada dough, filling it, and folding it. They even had a child-sized apron ready to go for my little one. When he needed a break, he just hung out on their couch and played a few games on our tablet, then came back to help us egg-wash the empanadas. We had a bunch of empanadas left even after we ate our fill, so Veronica packed them up to go, along with small jars of dulce de leche for us to take home. Class #2) On the day of the 2nd class, I left my little one to explore the zoo with his dad. Three friends and I had a relaxed and sugar-filled morning making chipa (gluten free cheese rolls, similar to Brazilian pao de queijo), alfajores, and pasta frola (quince pie). We made a ton, so we had lots to take away for snacks over the next couple of days. This class was more interactive, which I appreciated. We made 3 different doughs, all from scratch and with a lot of mixing with our hands. At the end, Veronica gave us a lesson in mate preparation, and we had a nice midday snack of mate plus the treats we'd baked.

Private Cooking Class - Empanadas, Dulce De Leche, Flan. We had a wonderful private cooking class and learned how to make Empanadas, Dulce De Leche, and Flan. Due to our tight travel schedule we were unable to make the group class and Veronica and Manual were flexible and kind enough to have us for a private cooking class. Manuel is a true chef with prior experience at restaurants and therefore we learned so much more than just how to make empanadas. We learned cooking technicalities and the science behind it all which made the cooking class all that much better. I highly recommend taking a cooking class with them. To add to it all they are also wonderful hosts!

Great hosts with insightful info and even better food!. Veronica and Manuel were great hosts. My wife and I felt very welcomed our entire time during the class, learned a lot and ate some great food that we made. A lot of information was shared about not only the food, but the culture as well. I would highly recommend a cooking class from Veronica and Manuel. It made for a great experience!

Out of the Ordinary experience!. Our evening cooking with Veronica and Manuel was a real highlight of our stay! They couldn't have been more charming hosts and teachers and we really enjoyed learning how to make empanadas and sampling Argentinian wines! Making the arrangements was seamless and it's great to have the recipes to try at home. Highly recommend!

One of the highlights of our trip to Buenos Aires. We had a wonderful evening doing the empanada/flan/dulce de leche cooking class with Veronica and Manuel! They were very kind and welcoming and their apartment is perfectly set up for the cooking class. We learned a lot about the food we cooked, Argentinean wines, and Buenos Aires in general. Manuel and Veronica gave us some helpful advice on Buenos Aires restaurants too. I'm looking forward to trying some of the recipes that we learned at home!

Great fun!!. A big thank you to Veronica & Manuel who were excellent hosts and made us feel very comfortable in their home. Fantastic cooking class with good information about the food and wine not only in Buenos Aires but in Argentina as well. I would recommend this to anyone who has an interest in food and socialising!

Terrific and very friendly. We took the Alfajor/Pastaflora class the day we left BA and it was terrific. We learned a lot from Manuel and Veronica, who were both very friendly and informative. Great way to spend a morning.

Great idea for a night in BA. Veronica and Manuel were really fantastic. We did the empanadas cooking class (which also includes dulce de leche and flan) and it was truly great. Manuel and veronica create a great atmosphere and teach well.What was really great for us is the long session with 2 english speaking locals, they explained alot about the Argentinean people and their culture.Of course the empanadas came out very tasty, the only problem is we couldnt find anything better on our trip :)

Don't miss this experience while you are in Buenos Aires!. There are many wonderful tourist attractions in Buenos Aires, but if you would like to have a more authentic experience don't miss the cooking class offered by Veronica and Manuel. We joined them for the Saturday "Market Class" which included a trip to the local farmers market with Veronica followed by a cooking class in their lovely home. Manuel is a professional chef and his menu was superb. The recipes are quite gourmet and very delicious, but still easy enough to replicate at home. Highly recommended!

Fun, relaxed & authentic cooking experience. Veronica and Manuel are the perfect hosts! Our cooking experience started with a trip to the market where we purchased the food we would be using later. Veronica is extremely knowledgable of the area & had lots of stories to share. Once back in their lovely apartment, the cooking started. Wow! Wow! Wow! Manuel showed us how to make 3 amazing courses, while Veronika taught us a new twist on a G&T. The food & company was superb! Would highly recommend.

At home while you travel. We were fortunate enough to get a spot in this class when we were in BA in February. What a perfect evening--such a nice break from eating out in restaurants not to mention the wonderful food, wine and company. This is an absolute yes yes yes for anyone going to BA. Its easy to get to from the city, you learn the history of the dishes and the wines, and most of all it's a warm, fun evening with hosts who are passionate about what they do. Highlight of our trip. Liz and Kate, Minneapolis, MN

A highlight of our trip in Buenos Aires. My wife is a cook - a good one. I'm the cleaner because I just know her cooking is better than mine. So when she asked me to go to a closed cooking class in Buenos Aires, I was a bit reluctant and didn't think I'd enjoy myself. Wow - was I Wrong. Manuel's style of teaching is fantastic. His directions as to what to do were also accompanied with explanations of why - that I even understood. He welcomed questions at any time and engaged us in discussion to ensure we understood the responses. Before long, I was nodding my head up and down and just itching to get started. He is an engaging teaching chef. Then enter Veronica with tasty hors d'oeures and just the right wines from Argentina as we were preparing the food. They made a great team and both made us feel relaxed. They were personable and delightful. It was a very, very enjoyable time. Now for the food. We made empanadas, dulce de leche, and flan. It was scrumptious. We asked for the "leftovers" so we could take them back to the hotel and finish the next day. I highly recommend them - as does my wife.
Awesome Cooking Experience. Great cooking class with very nice explanations, tasty food and wine and excellent atmosphere. We enjoyed it a lot and would recommend doing this to everyone.

Memorable experience in Buenos Aires. We did the cooking class where we learned how to make empanadas, flan, and dulce de leche. It was an amazing experience! There were 7 of us in the class and Manuel teaches in a way that is engaging for everyone, whether you're experienced or a beginner. Veronica was the one who led the wine tasting (paired with appetizers) and was great as well. Both Manuel and Veronica were really knowledgeable and were great hosts. It was truly a pleasure to spend the evening with them and learn how to cook. A great cultural experience for sure! They also e-mail you the recipes to take home which is a nice touch. Thanks so much for a great evening!Brian and Angelina

fun evening. We like to take a cooking class when we travel to get a feel for the culture. Manuel and Veronica were excellent hosts. They paired the making of the food with tasting of the wines. They have you participate in the preparation of the empanadas. The flan and dulce de leche is demonstration. Afterwards they email you the recipes. The only reason I am not giving them 5 stars is that I emailed back with a question and never received a reply. That disappointed me!

Empanadas and wine!. Really easy recipes for tasty empanadas served with a selection of fabulous wines (very generous pours)!! Great hosts who open up their home to you and will even take you out for a beer afterwards... It really was more like an evening with friends! Can't recommend it highly enough!!

Fantabulous evening - you gotta go!. Manu and Veronica opened their trendy Palermo apartment for an evening of fun, cooking, drinking and eating! The night started off with learning the ins and outs of dulce de leche making. While that simmered on the stove we tackled the intricacies if making flan and empanadas. Manu gave us the scientific information about cooking while Veronica showed us the regions the wine/food came from. We were treated to three types of Argentine wine accompanied with tapas and lots of laughs. A great cooking class in an intimate setting. As an expat in Argentina, it was fun to take my visitor and would happily head back to the class with other local friends.

Likely our favorite part of our visit to Buenos Aires. Veronica and Manuel are absolutely wonderful hosts for a great cooking experience. Manuel is such a great chef and he teaches how to make a wide range of delicious dishes. The cooking was very education and then getting to eat it.... oh man! So good. Veronica was an excellent host as well, taking us shopping at a great little organic food market and teaching us about some local drinks. We enjoyed ourselves so much - if you have a chance to take one of their classes, don't miss out.

Great hosts. Done a bunch of cooking classes around the world and this was by far the most educational experience Ive had. The food was really tasty and the wine tasting portion was really fun. Definitely would recommend this to anyone that likes food, wine, learning stuff, and having fun (which I imagine should be just about everyone).Felt like a dinner party hosted by good friends.
Great class. I have done several courses in multiple countries. This course stands out as being one of the most educational. We thoroughly enjoyed the evening.

Awesome food, awesome hosts!. This was my first cooking class ever, so I wasn't sure what to expect. But it couldn't have been a better experience! Manuel and Veronica are top hosts. Really funny, relaxed, knowledgeable couple. We learnt how too name empanades and dulce de leche- recipes were delicious and easy to follow. The food was washed down with generous servings of wine. Thanks for a great night guys! Highly recommend :)

Fun evening with cooking & wine. I went to Manuel and Veronica's Empanada and dulce de leche flan class last night and it was fantastic. I booked very last minute as something to do in BA during the evening since I was traveling alone. It was a great decision! The food was fantastic and the company - both the hosts and the group itself - were great. Manuel and Veronica were such fabulous hosts welcoming the group into their home and sharing their passion for food and travel with us. It felt like I was over at a friend's house and I didn't want to leave! I don't normally go for flan but I'll definitely be trying this recipe at home and trying to recreate the dulce de leche if possible. For the empanadas we made the dough and then both beef and veggie filling. Manuel was very informative about the process, the ingredients, and open to sharing all his culinary knowledge. Veronica poured generous servings of three different wines throughout the course of the evening as well as two little nibbles before we got into the empanadas. It was all delicious and well worth the price! Highly recommended, it will be a top memory from my time in BA. If I was going to be here on Saturday I'd love to book into the market class to learn more and just hang out with Manuel and Veronica!

Best cooking class!. Really, really lovely couple who made us feel very welcome. Delicious food anyone could make when they go home and generous amounts of quality Argentinian wines! Very highly recommended - great to do as soon as you get to BA as they have excellent suggestions of where to eat and drink for the rest of your stay :)

Best night in BA!. Prompted by the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor we decided to book two classes all together and after the first one, we knew we did the right thing. Manuel and Veronica are fantastic hosts whether there are 8 people or just 2. They are attentive and answer any questions on food, cooking or Argentinian history, culture and living. The empanadas Manuel planned for the first class were superb and with the recipe we got in an email and the "training" we got during the class we were able to recreate the taste for our New Year's Eve party. The menu created by Manuel for the second class was imaginative but still rooted in the Argentinian culture and the trip to the local organic market with Veronica to get ingredients was an experience on its own. Manuel's explanations were detailed and interesting with a scientific-bent - he should have his own YouTube channel :) While Manuel took care of the food-side of the class, Veronica gave a mini-lecture on Argentinian wines and we got to taste some of them during the first evening as well. These were great and in fact prompted us to change our trip itinerary and we ended up spending a day in Cafayate to taste some Torrontes wines (Cafayate turned out to be lovely small town with some great wines and amazing scenery - highly recommended). Overall, both classes were great and I think this is a fantastic experience and superb way of meeting new people and making friends, learning how to cook, trying out new recipes and getting to know other cultures. Big kudos to Veronica and Manuel for making this unforgettable!

MBA Students in Buenos Aires. Manuel & Veronica were amazing hosts to my MBA classmates and I. Veronica arranged a special class for us to work with our busy schedules. Although the location is a little out of the high traffic SOHO area we found it easily. Be prepared to pay for the class in cash (this is the way many businesses in Buenos Aires operate). The class was hosted in the couples home and provided a glimpse into real Buenos Aires life (unique from the other events we had organized). M&V accommodated our special vegetarian empanada request with grace and even provided additional flavors - everyone was jealous of the vegetarian fillings. M&V knew their audience well and were very generous with wine tastings. I had some of the best Argentinean white wine (Torrontes) I've ever tasted in this class. Their sweet dog came out at the very end to meet us and nibble on some leftover empanadas :)Only suggestion is making the recipes easier to follow in terms of cups/tbs/etc. The measurements in grams was a little technical for our audience and I have yet to replicate the recipes at home as a result. Would highly recommend this class as an activity in Buenos Aires - highlight of my week!

Wonderful Evening!. We had a fantastic time cooking and eating in Valerie and Manuel's home! The class offers the perfect balance of hands on cooking, chef's demonstration, wine tasting, eating, and socializing. It is limited I believe to 6 people and we loved the two other couples at our course. This is a great option for those traveling with a group. We can't way to try making the empanadas, salsa, and dulce de leche back home!

You'll learn so much about Buenos Aires. I still make empanadas as we learned to make them in the class. Manual and Veronica were such friendly and gracious hosts with the highlight of eating our meal on the roof of their home. We learned so much about the city and the country. The food was good the wine was good and the company was good. What more could you ask for. Manuel even went the extra mile to design a glutton free empanada recipe for our friend Lorraine. If you are visiting Buenos Aires do not miss this cooking class.

Fun Evening. We did the empanada and flan class. The class started with everyone making their own empanada dough and forming the shells. Then Manuel started making the filling both meat and vegetarian while explaining the steps. After it was complete we were given the filling to fill our shells. While the empanadas were cooking, we did some wine tasting and socializing. Then we ate the empanadas we made.We really enjoyed the experience, but would have liked to do more hands on cooking like we've done in other classes.

Marvelous cooking class!. We had wanted to find a wonderful yet affordable cooking class while in Buenos Aires, and luckily an old friend recommended this one – we were able to book the week-of and took a Friday morning postre (dessert) making class. It was marvelous! Veronica and Manuel were such gracious hosts and teachers. The class is right inside their adorable home in the posh neighborhood of Palermo, and one other couple sat opposite the table from us, so a lot of personal attention. There was time for cooking and personal storytelling as well. Also, they explain the origins of the ingredients and provide the recipes after the class. It was a relaxing and fun way to start a morning, and we can’t wait to recreate the desserts for our friends back home. We cooked much more than we could eat, and they packed up the leftovers for us to hold onto and snack on the rest of the day. For English speakers looking for a really lovely Argentinean cooking class at a reasonable price, this is the way to go!

Great evening!. We had a wonderful time at the Tierra Negra cooking class! I have to admit, I have never been a big fan of empenadas or flan, but Manuel makes such wonderful versions of these traditional dishes, that I loved them both! I will definitely cook them at home now =). Both Manuel and Veronica are super nice and welcoming. In addition to learning how to make these dishes (and dulce de leche), they taught us about wine and some Argentine geography too! The wine they paired with the food was fabulous and we had a great time relaxing, cooking, and enjoying Argentine food and culture. A must do for Buenos Aires!!

Brilliant evening! Definitely recommend . I took the empanada class with Manuel and Veronica. There were 8 of us cooking, but the atmosphere was like being at an interactive dinner party with friends, even more so because the class is in their beautiful home. The empanadas were without a doubt the best I have tasted and I have tried quite a few in different parts of Argentina. We learnt the tricks to making a perfect flan, dulce de leche and some delicious tangy salsa to accompany the empanadas. Veronica was in charge of the wines and they didn’t disappoint - a beautiful white and a bold red, both had been so very carefully selected. After the class Veronica emailed with the recipes, which are easy to follow. I feel confident that I could recreate the dishes we learnt. This is one of the best activities I have found in Argentina - thank you both so very much!

Wonderful class. Fabulous cooking class and a must-do activity whilst in Buenos Aires. Veronica and Manuel were very welcoming and friendly and there was a great atmosphere for the class. Food and wine were delicious. We learnt the traditional method of making empanada's, flan, and dulce de leche and received copies of all the recipes. Veronica and Manuel have a passion for food and wine and this is clearly evident throughout the class. They are also very knowledgeable about local tourist information which was useful! Thanks for a great night.

Amazing experience and food!. My husband and I booked the empanada class and enjoyed every minute of it! Veronica and Manuel were so welcoming and easy to chat with - the time flew by. The wine was superb and the food was so easy to make and delicious! We've actually made empanadas since going back home and we were amazed at how well they turned out - so thanks again guys!

Amazing Time with Wonderful Hosts!. We had a terrific time with Veronica and Manuel. They invited us into their home and we really felt like part of the family. Their intimate setting lends itself to a great environment for learning the art of Argentine cooking. Manuel has such a passion for his craft. And Veronica is so animated and has a very caring and informative approach to the wines they serve to accompany the food and the ambience they are creating for their guests. It was definitely the best cooking class we took while in Buenos Aires and I cannot recommend it highly enough! Now that we are back home, and have made the empanadas without fail. Such great flavor and such great memories.

great experience. Wonderful people. I took the class with my sister and daughter. Learned a lot, loved the food we made. Manuel and Veronica were both warm and generous. I had lost the address and we arrived late, they made us feel so welcome and we were able to do the complete class. We had plenty of food to take with us and snack for a couple of days. They taught us not only the cooking, but also about the people of Argentina. Customs and culture that you can't get from a book. Have tried several of the recipes since I have returned home on friends and family. Such fun!

Great argentinean cooking class. A while ago I took an empanada cooking class because I wanted to learn how to bake these delicious snacks when arring back home :-)In the class we learned how to make the empanadas from scratch, even the dough, and how and with what filling to stuff them. The class was very professional yet in a lovely cosy environment. Veronica let us taste some very good argentine wines and shared her passion and knowledge for wines of different regions which was a great plus!Highly recommend the class and was sad I did not have the time to follow one of the other classes they offer.

Highly recommended cooking class. A group of 6 friends and I took this class on the first day of our visit to Argentina. We had a great time, and all of us have sworn that we will try making the recipes at home. We were sent back to the hotel with bags of empanadas as we were stuffed by the end of the class. The food and wine were delicious and we appreciated the explanations behind each.Manuel and Veronica were both excellent hosts (who speak great English!), and were nice enough to escort us to a bar down the street when we expressed interest in trying some craft beers afterwards. It was great going with them as they knew everyone -- we got to feel like locals for a night!Overall, an excellent experience.

Highly recommended market tour and cooking class!!. I did the market tour and cooking class and highly recommend it.Veronica and I took the bus to a great little organic market and picked up the items we would use for our meal while Manuel prepared for cooking. We prepared a nice variety of dishes - all of which I could replicate at home (I've already done the prawns and carrot dip - so yummy!!). Manuel is a professional chef and it was such a treat to hear him talk so enthusiastically about food, guidelines for seasoning blends, and proper food preparation techniques! He is truly a wealth of knowledge and Veronica is the drink master! I was lucky because a group had cancelled so I had them all to myself and was able to ask a lot of questions;). They both have great personalities, a lovely home and a passion for sharing what they know with others - the perfect blend for an awesome experience.

Best Day of Cooking on the Delta. I had the best day of cooking, tasting, and learning with Veronica and Manuel! I signed up for the Cooking Class and Tour of the Delta Tigre. What could be better than a boat tour of the Delta Tigre followed by learning out to cook an amazing asado (grilled steak dinner) on a beautiful day in Argentina? The tour director and I met up with Veronica and Manuel and headed out to the marina to grab a private boat into the Delta. We dropped Manual and Veronica off at the Dutch-inspired lodge where we would later meet up with the for the cooking class. The tour director guided the boat out into the Delta to see the fantastic island cottages, bird life, and secret jungles on the river. We returned after an hour to start the cooking classes with Manuel and Veronica. Manuel guided me through all the steps to make a fantastic caprese empanada. We prepared the fresh salsas and I even got a knife skills lesson! The fire was lit and we cooked everything, steaks, empanadas, chorizo, provolone, and potatoes on the grill. I am excited to try grilling empanadas on the grill back home! With each course, Veronica paired an organic Argentinian wine that I will definitely be loading up to take home with me. We topped off the day by learning how to make dulce de leche filled crepes. I learned so much on my outing and I know it will be one of the highlights of my trip to Argentina. I had so much fun I even signed up for the Mate class later in the week!! Tip: Make sure you wear comfortable and appropriate shoes for the boat. This is a tour best for a smaller group (maybe 3-4) in order to get the full experience. Bring your appetite!

Delicious and fun cooking class. I'm confident I can also speak for my friend who was with me and say that we had a great time cooking with Veronica and Manuel! They are very laid back and friendly while at the same time making sure we enjoyed ourselves and gave us some great cooking tips. I love cooking and Manuels depth knowledge made all questions possible. Veronica supplied some great wine and conversation as well, together with the cooking it made the evening a great memory! We made flan, dulce de leche and empanadas with two different fillings. If this isn't your cup of tea I know there are other classes available with Veronica and Manuel as well, I highly recommend you to take one!

Delicious Empanada Cooking. We had an awesome time learning to cook empanadas, flan and dulce de leche with Veronica and Manuel. They are both super friendly and helpful in their hands on instruction, taking time to answer any questions and refill wine glasses. The empanadas turned out great and we even took some home at the end of the class. Afterward, Veronica and Manuel emailed us recommendations for the rest of our trip through Argentina. If you enjoy empanadas, you should definitely take this class. If you don't enjoy empanadas, you should leave South America.

Awesome cooking class!. We had a wonderful cooking class with Verónica and Manuel. We took the empanadas+flan+dulche de leche class. The food was amazing, as was the wine! We had a great group but mostly enjoyed getting to know Verónica and Manuel. They are lovely people and great cooks. It's always easy to see when someone loves what they do, and Verónica and Manuel love hosting cooking classes. It was a great evening and we highly recommend it to anyone traveling or living in Buenos Aires!

Down to Earth Cooking Class. I loved the cooking class with Manuel and Veronica. I love cooking but I still learned a lot of great tips from Manuel. You can tell he knows what he is talking about and is able to give very detailed and technical responses to questions. Veronica had some fun information about Argentine wine (just enough to be interesting but not too much to distract from the food). They make a great combination for a night of relaxed fun. I loved that it was at their apartment and that there was no smoke and mirrors, just good fun and friendly people.

A great, relaxing, non-traditional way to experience the culture of Buenos Aires. My brother, our wives and I spent five days and four nights in BA during the 2014 World Cup, and this was easily the one part of our visit that I would recommend to anyone planning a trip. Tours, tango lessons, great nightlife and restaurants are all great stops, but for each there are a variety of great options. For a cooking class, Tierra Negra should be the number one option for anyone looking for a relaxing evening with extremely welcoming hosts who provide the true insight into the real BA that you won't get from most tour guides. We had a private class for the four of us, and wine, and a basic description of the different wines and wine regions of Argentina, were provided throughout the class to add to the relaxation and enjoyment of the evening. Both red and white were offered, but Veronica had no problem providing one or the other based on the tastes of the members of our group. Manuel did most of the cooking of the empanada fillings (traditional and vegetarian), so some may be disappointed to not be completely hands on, but this added to the relaxation of the evening - not to mention the taste when the empanadas were done. We did, however, mix the dough, portion it, roll it out, and fill and fold each empanada, which was enough to make us feel involved without any hint of pressure to get it perfect. Manuel and Veronica were great hosts and very open and informative during our class. Veronica helped us out by grabbing the camera and snapping photos while we were elbow deep in dough and filling. The empanadas were delicious, and we were emailed the recipes for use at home. The recipes hold up.One bonus: While in the class we started discussing the beer of Argentina. Don't get me wrong, Quilmes isn't bad, but as fans of craft beers, we were looking for something better. After the class, Manuel and Veronica took us to a bar in the neighborhood that sold only Argentine craft beers, and they were very good. Not only did we get to hang out with Manuel, Veronica and other BA locals, but we got to cap a good night off with some great local beers before heading out of town. Even if Manuel and Veronica can't join you, if you're a craft beer fan, ask them to give you directions to the bar.

True master chefs!. This has the be one if the best experiences I had during my 6 day stay in Buenos Aires! Manuel and Veronica were great hosts making me feel like I was cooking in a friends kitchen rather than attending a class. They share such a great passion for Argentina and it's food which is evident as soon as you walk in the door. You not only get the skills to recreate the food at home but you also get an insight into Argentinian history and culture. After we finished cooking we all sat down together to share a Mate (traditional Argentinian tea) and talk about our plans in Argentina. They gave us great local recommendations for the rest of our stay as well as leaving us with a truckload of the leftover food.The class is designed to suit people of all cooking levels and is one of those experiences that just keeps giving!Thanks again Veronica and Manuel!

One of the Highlights of Our Trip. Hands down this was one of our favorite meals and favorite experiences of our trip to Buenos Aires! We love taking cooking classes wherever we travel and Manuel & Veronica were great hosts, teachers, and ambassadors of Argentine culture and traditions. We have already cooked the meal they taught us at home! We took the Saturday market visit/gnocchi class and we would recommend this experience to anyone.
