An amazing Argentinian education and so very fun!. Manuel and Veronica are the ultimate, generous hosts. They welcomed me to their perfect home for a private cooking and wine class. Their English is excellent and hospitality superb. Manuel gave me so many cooking tips, with explanations based on the chemistry and alchemy of cooking. He not only demonstrated the specific techniques for making empanada dough and 2 delectable fillings, and flan technique with dulce de leche, but he also provided the reasons why these techniques are most effective. I took pages of notes! Veronica presented Argentinian wines in a professional, highly knowledgeable manner. Her expert's palette and passion for wine were very insightful for me. In both cases (cooking and wine appreciation), I had very good prior knowledge, but I came away with much new info and the inspiration to continue to learn and experience more of the Argentinian culture. I would return to Buenos Aires just to take another of their classes!

A taste of local cooking!!. We had the pleasure of attending a cooking class at Tierra Negra. We decided to do the morning pastries and mate class with our 2 teenaged daughters. We had a great time preparing and tasting our creations but we also enjoyed the conversations with Manuel and Verónica. We talked about Argentina and we shared some stories about Canada. It was a very fun and casual atmosphere. It was a highlight of our week in Buenos Aires. It also gave us a chance to walk around in the neighborhood that we had not previously visited. We would definitely highly recommend attending a class at Tierra Negra!

True Buenos Aires food experience. If you are in Buenos Aires, and you like food (and even if you don't), then I would highly recommend a cooking class with Veronica and Manuel. The couple hosted us in their beautiful home and were very attentive. They are very conversational and made us feel so welcome. What a great team!My family and I picked the evening class, cooking assorted empanadas and a flan for dessert. The food was absolutely amazing and Manuel (a trained chef) was there to explain and help every step of the way. Fabulous organic wines were matched with our food. Veronica talked about the wines in depth and explained where each was from. When I return to Buenos Aires I'll definitely be back for seconds!

Great local experience with Veronica and Manuel!. This was such a great idea. Veronica and Manuel opened their home to us and showed us how to make some local cuisine including empanadas from scratch! They also offered wines from two regions of the country which were an added bonus. We really enjoyed our cooking experience and would highly recommend adding aTierra Negra cooking class to your itinerary while in Buenos Aires!

good value for intro class. This was a nice way to learn about a couple of typical dishes and the chef teacher was good at explaining to our small group how to do everything. Do keep in mind that this is a very basic intro and not more of a fun evening than a class.

Highly Recommended!. My friend and I were studying abroad in Argentina for a month and we decided to take this class because she loves to cook. From the culinary perspective, she enjoyed the HECK out of it! There was clear instruction on the recipes, but plenty of creative room to really make the empanadas your own. Since returning, she has used the recipes for her friends and family already!I wouldn't consider myself a "foodie", but I do love eating. I learned a lot in the class and really enjoyed the conversation! There was English and Spanish and I loved every minute of I. This couple was extremely gracious in opening their homes to us and were helpful in offering suggestions for other activities in the city. I highly recommend this for anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Classy, entertaining & relaxing!. Right from the moment vid the warm greeting at the front door of their chic apartment, Veronica sets the scene for a great experience. Manuel engages you with his broad knowledge and skills,and his flair for teaching, while Veronica sees to all the little details... this is a very enjoyable, relaxing and entertaining way to spend an evening in BA. Suitable for serious foodies (Manuel is a chef) or those like me who just like to eat, and sample local foods and wines, and all those in between. This couple are warm and professional, speak excellent English (and maybe other languages too I think?) I will definitely pay them another visit!

Great fun. My partner and I decided to do the cooking class based on the good reviews on tripadvisor - it did not disappoint! We had a great night. I have to admit that I was slightly nervous that it was in someone's home but once I met Veronica I was completely at ease. The setting is informal. We made delicious empanadas and learnt how to roll them directly.The wine we had was carefully chosen and a very high quality. The couple manual and Veronica are very chatty, enthusiastic and passionate about what they do and BA. We also got lots of great tips about BA from them. I would recommend for sure.

Awesome evening - book this in!. This was a great cooking class! It was a little less 'hands on' than I expected, however, this is not as a problem as the rest of the time you are drinking the most delicious wines, chatting and learning/watching how to cook other delicious Argentinian food in a very informative and entertaining evening.Veronica and Manuel are the best hosts. Very friendly, funny, generous and with great English if this is a concern. The class is in their lovely, clean apartment in trendy Palermo. We made and ate delicious empanadas (with different fillings), and learnt how to make Argentinian flan, caramel and best of all, Dulce de Leche. V & M gave us the leftover empanadas (we ate loads!) to take home for the next day, as well as a jar of Dulce de Leche that had been made in the class. We got through several bottles of delicious Salta and Mendoza wines, including a bottle from the host's own collection. It was such a good evening, and time flew, even though the class finished much later than scheduled.Definitely recommend this for a great evening in Buenos Aires, and you'll be making great empanadas yourself when back home! V & M are kind enough to email all the recipes with photos to you afterwards, and give several local tips on great places to go in Palermo.

Great Cooking Class. Very fun and engaging cooking class. Manuel and Veronica were excellent hosts, and the food and wine were great. Manuel helped us learn to make flan, empanadas and dulce de leche... all of which tasted excellent. They were very personable and spoke excellent English. Veronica gave us a detailed background on the different wines we drank through the cooking class, which was very informative. As a cooking novice, the instruction and help were enough to help me make empanadas. It was nice to meet other folks as well in the class.
Best cooking class. I've taken a handful of cooking classes in different cities I've traveled to and this was by far my favorite. Great food, great wine, and great hosts. Highly recommended!

Could be great, but some changes needed. Let me just start off by saying the young couple that ran this were divine and extremely friendly and we wish them the best, but we walked away a little dissapointed in the cooking class experience. They are just starting off, so hopefully this feedback will be helpful to improve. 1) I have attended cooking classes in various destinations: Italy, Napa, Thailand and Japan. If I sign up for a cooking class I expect to learn how to cook several local dishes. The empanadas Manuel showed us how to make were excellent and the best part of the evening. The only other dish we learned about, really just watched, was flan, which is the same as flan in every other Latin America country...We picked up a couple local cookbooks later in the week with great recipes for local dishes like stews, asados, other regional empanadas, and desserts. We would have liked to have learned how to cook additional dishes. 2) The apartment it was held in was fine, but slightly awkward entering a strangers apartment3) The wine we tasted was good, but nothing special. Wine is such a big part of the local culture, that a more extensive tasting would have been appreciated. Like I said, cooking classes are a great niche for Buenos Aires with a bright future, but this school needs to improve to be a 5 star rated activity.
cooking class. we were 4 peoples for the cooking class, it was like a family diner, realy nice experience. i recommend it! nice peoples ;)
Empanadas and flan . Excellent food and instruction. But the real treat was our chef and his wife. Gracious, humble and entertaining. Felt like family by the end of the evening. A must do!!

Fantastic Experience!. My fiance and I had the pleasure of being Veronica and Manuel's firsts guests in their new space. It was our first night in Buenos Aires and was a great way to start the trip. The food we made was amazing and Manuel gave great tips on how to do everything. Veronica is super knowledgable and passionate about all the wine which was evident in the three wines we sampled. On top of that, they gave us great recommendations of places we should eat at during the rest of our stay (which were all great).This is a must do in Buenos Aires!

A must-try experience!. This evening was one of the highlights of our trip. Went as a group of 5 and had the most memorable time! Veronica and Manuel are incredibly friendly and accommodating. The class is hosted in their lovely apartment and it felt like we were having dinner at a friend's place. Manuel is a chef by profession, and he showed us how to make empanadas and flan with dulce de leche. The class is part hands-on (making empanada dough and filling/folding them) and demonstration (ingredients were prepared ahead of time, flan was a demo only). Manuel is very knowledgeable on food and flavours, and he offered a lot of good tips for home cooking and experimentation. Meanwhile, Veronica introduced us to three Argentinian and Chilean wines, each with unique flavours. The resulting meal was delicious! We made a ton of empanadas and only a few were left at the end of the night. The flan was incredible and my friend and I polished off half the bowl of dulce de leche between ourselves! A great evening filled with good food, good people and great conversation. A truly unique experience that is highly recommended.

Fantastic!. We booked a cooking class on a sunday evening in march 2014. As we were not the only couple, we only paid the reduced amount. We had a fantastic evening, Veronica and Manuel are great and cordial people. We were happy to learn how to do flan, dulce de lece and empanadas!We also really loved the wine we were introduced to during the evening (great taste, Veronica!).After this great evening, we had the feeling that we had spent hours with friends from university combined with a cooking class. Great!I recommend this course to everyone who wants to find out how to cook typical meals from Argentina und who wants to learn more about people and culture from this amazing country!

Perfect way to spend an authentic evening in Buenos Aires. Veronica and Manuel were so lovely and welcoming. It was a very authentic experience and a perfect way to spend an evening in BA. We brought our 2 children, ages 8 & 6, and they said it was their favorite activity in Buenos Aires! The food, wine and instruction were fabulous. However, their hospitality and warmth are what made this event truly exceptional. We all loved it! We hope to see Veronica and Manuel again soon.

Amazing cooking class with exceptional hospitality - the best of Buenos Aires!. We spent a Saturday afternoon with Manuel and Veronica in their new home and had a fabulous time cooking two different types of empanadas accompanied by a spicy tomato sauce and flan. The learning experience was terrific but the fact that they made us feel so welcome in their home really made the experience outstanding. We tasted three wines with them and by the end we were sitting around their table conversing as if we were old friends. We learned so much and they shared a ton of history and stories. An all around amazing experience!!!

Amazing Night of Food, Wine and Fun. This cooking class was one of my favorite memories from my trip to Buenos Aires. The ingredients were of the highest quality and Manuel's instruction/explanations were fantastic. The setting is small in their gorgeous flat and it was so much fun rolling the dough, crafting the empanadas, and then eating the INCREDIBLE outcome. We also got to try very generous pours of absolutely delicious wine, which fueled the fun even more. Manuel and Veronica were perfect hosts and I loved getting to know them and the other participants over dinner and dessert. My boyfriend and I both look back on this class as one of the best things we did on our trip. I only wish the class could have been even more hands on in the making of the dessert and fillings, but it was truly a fabulous experience. The class was taught entirely in English but we were also able to practice our Spanish as well.

Great Food, Wine and Hosts. My wife and I arranged a cooking class with Veronica and Manuel for a Sunday night. Their apartment was conveniently located in Palermo near our hotel. Veronica warmly greeted us at the door, and we immediately felt welcomed into their home. We were the only guests because Veronica and Manuel usually don't schedule their classes on Sundays. We thoroughly enjoyed our evening! My wife has much more experience cooking than I, but Manuel was extremely patient with me, although my efforts were the subject of a lot of laughs by all. Manual told me my empanadas had some of the weirdest shapes in the history of his class. In the end, the empanadas were delicious. The food was accompanied by some great wines. Veronica initially served a fantastic Malbec...Finger Print. I hope I can find it in the US. She also introduced us to Torrontes wine , which is a white wine from northern Argentina. It was incredibly good. We ended up buying some Malbec and Torrontes wines before we left Buenos Aires. Both Veronica and Manual were extremely knowledgeable about food and wine. After dinner, we had a very enjoyable discussion with Veronica and Manual about Argentinian life and culture. When I finally looked at my watch, I realized we had been there for several hours, and I was embarrassed we had been there so long. This is a must do in Buenos Aires!

The best thing I did in Buenos Aires. This is a fantastic experience, and Manuel and Veronika are fantastic hosts! I really loved this and it was definitely my highlight for several reasons: (1) Manuel and Veronika made it feel like I was in the home of very good friends. I did The Argentine Experience as well, and while that was fun, it was a far second to this experience. Manuel and Veronica welcome you into their home and give you the real porteno experience. Plus they are a really cute couple with perfect English. (2) I learned a lot! Manuel is an excellent teacher even for the "culinary challenged" like me. And Veronika is pretty smart with the wines of Argentina. She is also a very generous pour!! :-) (3) It was hands on! We got to do it ourselves, which was extremely satisfying and gave me confidence to try the recipes at home. Side note: I'm pretty fussy about hand hygiene and I was really impressed with their attention to hand washing, etc. (4) This is an amazing meal! I was stuffed!!! Lots to eat and lots to drink. All Argentine. A great value for money in my opinion. (5) Highly entertaining. I laughed so much!!! So don't even second-guess doing this. HIGHLY recommended!!! These are just really good people and you are going to love to meet them!!

Delicious & Fun Night!!!. This cooking class was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Manuel and Veronika were fantastic hosts. Manuel was an excellent teacher, you could tell he really loves teaching this class. The empanadas were amazing!!! They were very accommodating to food allergies as well. The empanadas were served with some very nice wines too. I will definitely try to make these now that we're back home. My only regret is that we weren't staying long enough to try their new cooking classes that start in April. I would highly recommend them and I will try to book another class with them again on my next trip.

Best evening in Buenos Aires!. This was one of our best decisions of our very fun two-week trip to Argentina. Veronica and Manuel were such great hosts -- full of warmth, hospitality, and great information about all things Argentine. We had an intimate class of four people: my wife and I are avid cooks, and the other two don't cook at all. Manuel was an excellent teacher, with every demonstration and technique. He encouraged everyone in their empanada skills, and the results were wonderful. Veronica shared great tips about the three Argentine wines, which were generous and delicious. One of the best parts of the class is that the recipes are emailed at the end of it. We have made the dulce de leche and the empanadas so far, and they taste as good in our kitchen as their did at Veronica and Manuel's! If you are looking for a special experience with real porteños, this is worth the money and time.

Fun and delicious evening!. You'll find the best empanadas in Buenos Aires in Manuel's kitchen :) After arriving in Buenos Aires we were skimming trip advisor for activities and came across this one. It was a Tuesday and we were able to get into that Thursday's class.It just so happened that Thursday was my birthday and I could not have planned a better way to celebrate. ( I should disclose that I love cooking). After arriving at Manuel and Veronica's we washed our hands, donned our aprons, and got to work. I learned a ton of great cooking techniques from Manuel in addition to all the basics and nuances of empanadas, flan, and dulche de leche. Veronica supplied wonderful wines from across Argentina educating us on the appellations and grapes. Of course they paired wonderfully with the food.We left happy, full, with tons of new knowledge, and with some new friends.(if you're like me and your spanish is about the level of a 3 year old, don't fear. Manuel and Veronica's english is great and easy to understand)

Great Evening. We had a wonderful evening with Manuel and Veronica. Both were excellent hosts and a wealth of information. Even though we were there for a cooking class, Veronica was also very knowledgable with providing tips for on places to visit and stay for the rest of our trip in Argentina. A very worthwhile night while in BsAs. Thanks for the great time!

Excellent Experience. Manuel and Veronica were the consummate hosts. They invited us into their home, and Manuel showed us how to make empanada and flan, and Veronica offered a selection of Argentinian wines and provided information on the selections. Overall, an fun and educational experience. Highly recommended.
A dinner with friends. Fun night. Quality ingrediants giving best empanadas of trip. Just like being with friends helping get dinner going with great wine and tunes.

Best way to spend an evening. We spent a really fun evening with Veronica and Manuel in their home learning how to make empanadas and flan. Manuel is an entertaining chef and Veronica introduced us to three different kinds of Argentine wine and shared some tips for our upcoming trip to Patagonia. It was definitely a full hands-on experience as we kneaded the dough and rolled it out, while Manuel showed us how to make three different types of fillings (two vegetarian and one meat, because I am a vegetarian). We closed them up with different specific edge decorations so we could tell which was which when it came time to enjoy them and enjoy them we did! I definitely ate too many! The flan was outstanding, too. But best of all, we have two new Argentine friends who we hope will visit us one day in San Diego, CA!

Brilliant evening. What a fantastic evening.Chef Manu and host Veronica provided us an evening that was both informative but more importantly a lot of fun.Manu will teach you how to make a couple of different types of empanadas and a flan for dessert. Whilst the hostess for the evening, Veronica, provides a selection of different Torrontes from Salta and Malbecs from Mendoza. They're both great hosts, full of conversation and make you feel at home. And as the wine flowed freely with the great group we had, we were all full of conversation!The evening is run from their home in Palermo, a great space for everyone to learn and then relax with dinner. It absolutely poured with rain the night so we ate inside, which is certainly no issue - but they did mention it is nice to eat on the balcony. Next time I guess!

Wonderful intimate experience. We had a wonderful time last night learning how to cook traditional Argentinian dishes.The location is in the residence of Manu and Veronica and is very cozy and professional. It was hard to believe that people actually lived there because it was so tidy.We had a special experience because due to the way scheduling worked out we had a small class, 4 people in total, and were able to have a very intimate experience. They mentioned that they have classes up to 8-9 people so we felt lucky.We started off by learning how to make the dough for the outside of empenadas.... and took pride in being told that we were the first ones to ever call our creations 'flour babies.' Since I don't have much experience cooking, this was my first time making dough from scratch. You add water, some oil, and flour, and the knead it for a while, and then add more flour... and then knead some more... I felt like I poured a lot of my life into that sucker. Then you shape it into a round, semi-spheric object and put it in the fridge. I admit, I had to give my 'flour-baby' a kiss before I sent it off.Then he showed us how to make the insides of the empenadas from scratch, 'beef' and some other things I can't quite remember... At this point, the wine tasting portion really got going... and they made sure our glasses were never empty.In the end, we had a blast making empenadas and flan and dulce de leche (I admit that I ate a spoonfull of this stuff by itself...) and getting to know the other guests as well as the wonderful Manu and Veronica. We talked about the current politics in Argentina and all sorts of other things (that are a little fuzzy due to the unending wine). It was great conversation. Things went well beyond the typical end time because everyone was having such a blast.I should also mention that the meat they used in the empenada was so good it made a 5 year vegetarian fall off the wagon despite the fact that they provided delicious vegetarian options.It was everything I looked for when I travel to foreign countries. Learning about the culture, interacting with locals, and doing something interactive to make something.The other awesome thing was that they made sure that all the beef was from organic grass-fed sources and the vegetables were all organic as well. This was something that particularly stood out to us. Manu works officialy as a chef and has a special appreciation for these things.It was a magical night and a wonderful way to start off our trip in Buenos Aires. I wouldy highly recommend this to anyone coming out here.

Highly recommended to add to your itinerary. This evening was definitely the highlight of my vacation to Buenos Aires. Veronica and Manuel were excellent hosts and it was obvious that they love what they do. This class was more than just a class, and truly exceeded my expectations.Manual described the cooking procedures in great detail and Veronica gave us the history and of the wines we were tasting. They were both great at answering all of our questions. It was so much fun making the empanada dough and rolling & filling them and even more fun sitting out on the rooftop patio eating them after they were baked.Many thanks to Manual and Veronica for a wonderful and delicious experience and the best memories!

Lovely hosts in a lovely setting. Veronica and Manuel could not have been better hosts. From the moment we entered, Veronica's cheery attitude and lovely demeanor set the tone for the afternoon. It was brutally hot outside and she immediately served us cold water and started chatting to us about the day and what we'd be learning. Manuel was super cool and taught us so much about different techniques, local produce and markets and about Argentinian cuisine. We tasted three different wines, tried incredible charcuterie, some from Veronica's hometown. Lovely couple and a lovely day. Thank you!
cooking. great pair of people, great experience, delicious food and wine. you get to eat the food you make afterwards. yummm

Highlight of B.A!. We were there on the same night as PJ (from NYC) and his girlfriend and we agree with his post 100%!! You guys were great!I wanted to add that Veronica had mentioned that she and Manuel had lived in Bariloche (our next stop) and said that she would gladly send me information about her favorite spots and places we may enjoy. Sure enough, the next day she sent a full page of restaurants, sights and brew pubs that she said were their favorites. This was a huge help as Bariloche is full of places to eat and we never would have found some of the best spots in town without Veronica's guidance. Thanks for a great night, great wine and new friends!

Incredible. Manuel and Veronica were so friendly and in just one evening, I really felt like more of a local. We made delicious empanadas with Manuel's great guidance and sampled some tasty Argentine wine with Veronica. Not to mention homemade dulce de lechwe and flan to finish! The atmosphere was wonderful and I had one of my best evenings in Buenos Aires in their cooking class. My friend and I even visited The restaurant Manuel works at the following day, which is fantastic, and he even came out to say hi. I cannot speak highly enough of the couple and the class!

Food, wine and friends. One of our goals in traveling to Buenos Aires was to have the opportunity to speak, eat and drink with those local to the city. A cooking class seemed like a great opportunity, so we were very excited to be invited by Manuel and Veronica to their home.The night began with introductions (another couple joined my girlfriend and I) and we learned about the dishes we would prepare. Manuel already had the dulche de leche on the stove, but explained the process in making it as we sipped wine that Veronica selected for the occasion. We also made dough for our empanadas, observed Manuel putting together the ingredients, and of course drank some more. The most hands-on portion of the night was filling and rolling the empanadas, which was way more fun than I had anticipated. At times the class felt a little "hands off", but there's really no point in a group of 4+ chopping, stirring, and bumping into each other while in the kitchen. Manuel does a great job of explaining the thought process of all the preparations and it's honestly quite pleasant to sit back and observe, glass of wine in hand.Once all the food was prepared we ate together, drank more, and had great conversations. That is truly the standout point of the night -- meeting new people, engaging and trading stories. Veronica and Manuel sent out the recipes after the class so we'll have them for reference. A great evening!

Absolutely lovely evening!. I have been delinquent in writing this review because I could not figure out how to put into words how great this experience was! My friends and I were visiting Buenos Aires for about 10 days in October and did the cooking class with Manuel and Veronica on our last night in town - and it turned out to be the best activity of the trip by far!Veronica and Manuel were gracious hosts that made us feel right at home! It was a great balance between watching technique from Manuel and getting to try things out ourselves. He was very helpful in guiding us through the process of making the empanadas. Moreover, I am a vegetarian and the hosts were incredibly accommodating, providing an amazing vegetarian empanada filling (pumpkin, so good!) and sending me other vegetarian filling recipes after the class. The highlight was the wine pairings with the food. I was a bit concerned going in that we would be given one glass of wine with the meal but instead we were served wine throughout the cooking and when we ate the food – my glass was never empty and that is a beautiful thing!All in all it was just a perfect evening with lovely hosts, delicious food, and delightful conversation. We all left happy to have done something new and different and excited to try out cooking the dishes at home.

What a wonderful evening. We attended this class, not knowing what to expect, yet knowing we all wanted to learn how to make empanades. Were we in for a treat! Our hosts Manuel and Veronica were incredibly gracious and we felt so welcome in their home. There were six of us in total, a perfect small group, and there was much laughter to be had that evening. Manuel patiently showed us how to make our empanades - we all succeeded - along with the amazing flan and dulche de leche. His beautiful wife Veronica was such a delight. She provided us with information on our wines, along with their history. We then went to the rooftop balcony to sample all the wonderful Argentian food which was truly amazing. It was a wonderful evening. This was definitely one of the hilights of our trip. I would highly recommend this cooking class to all visitors to Buenos Aires.

Beautiful and delicious evening of cooking, chatting and learning!. This was such a wonderful cooking class. Veronica and Manuel were so warm and welcoming that it didn't even feel like a 'class'; just a great evening with friends, learning how to cook a few delicious dishes and sharing stories over great wine. Manuel is a fantastic chef and helped us prepare the most delicious empanadas (including vegetarian ones and gluten free!!). Veronica was the perfect hostess, sharing information about each wine with us, and somehow managing to refill every empty glass without even being noticed! One of my favorite evenings of my trip. I would definitely recommend this cooking class to anyone coming to buenos aires!

What a great night!. My fiancé found this cooking class online and I was so happy he did. We spent the night making new friends. Veronica and Manuel were so inviting. They do the cooking class from their simple but lovely apartment. We learned to make the empanadas from scratch with the help of Manuel. We are vegetarians and they made sure to have a demonstration of the vegetarian filling. We sampled several lovely wines including some Torrontes. Manuel demonstrated how to make a fabulous desert! So glad he made it because I would have hated to have ruined it. If anyone is looking for a nice, fun, and interesting night out with some delicious Argentinian home cooked food book with them! It's a great value you won't regret!

Authentic Argentinian Food Fun with lovely knowledgeable locals!. This is a brilliant activity to invest in not only for the delicious food and wine prepared and offered but alsoas a great way to chat in a relaxed fashion with Veronica and Manuel about all matters Argentinian. Truly gracious, hard working hosts who you can enjoy a laugh with and come away feeling enriched (& very full!) Great location in Palermo and a lovely outlook from the rooftop balcony if you get a chance! Go!

Great cooking class with a lovely couple. We wanted to get to know more about local cooking, and this class in Veronica and Manuel's home did not disappoint. A charming couple who made the evening a really enjoyable one. Lots of local wine (we tried three) plus making and eating empanadas and seeing how dulce con leche and a traditional flan are made. All delicious and recipes provided by email afterwards.

Great time with cooking and socializing. My dad and I had a great time with Veronica and Manuel! They live in a beautiful home in Buenos Aires. The whole evening was lovely! In addition to learning to cook empanadas, flan, and Dulces du leches, we also had a great time tasting the wines chose by Veronica and socializing with the other guests. I particularly enjoyed being able to ask our hosts questions about argentine culture and foods. Unfortunately, I didn't plan for enough time for the lesson, and my dad and I had to leave early to make it to a late evening tango show. Veronica was Very helpful in booking a taxi for us to get there. In retrospect, I wish I had allotted more time and not planned anything else to follow this cooking class. If you go, definitely allow the entire evening for the class so that you can truly enjoy the whole experience.

Excellent. Veronica and manuel were amazing hosts and very kindly did a private cooking class just for me after another group booked in the same class slot unexpectedly had to change their booking to another day. We cooked delicious vegetarian empanadas and I really enjoyed the friendly and interesting conversation.

Incredible experience, want to go back and do it again!. My mom came to visit me while I was staying in Buenos Aires and she loves cooking, so I looked up some cooking classes and decided to go to this one. One of the best decisions I've ever made! You get to make authentic food in the home of two amazingly fun and friendly native Argentinians.We learned how to make empanadas from scratch, flan, and dulce de leche, and then of course eat it all! We also were given tons of wines to taste with the foods which was great.We wound up staying almost 2 and a half hours longer than we were meant to because we were having such a blast!I cannot recommend taking this cooking class enough, it will be a story my mom and I tell our friends and family for years to come. We could not have had a better experience.

Extraordinary -Do Not Miss. If Veronica and Manuel didn't control group sizes, the bad angel on my shoulder might tell me not to review this to keep the secret from the masses! For our most recent trip to Buenos Aires, I researched several cooking class options. I rejected several as overly touristy but Tierra Negra didn't offer a class on our dates. I emailed to see if there were other dates available and Veronica offered a very reasonably priced private class. My mother and I are so happy that we asked as learning from Manuel and getting to know Veronica and Manuel was the highlight of our trip. Manuel helped us learn how to make a healthy traditional beef empanada, flan and dulce de leche. He also entertained our ideas for fusion empanadas and provided us with vegetarian options. The class includes generous Argentinian wine servings as well as the opportunity to eat what you have cooked. Meeting Veronica and Manuel was a privilege. They are both highly intelligent, educated and well travelled people who enjoy wide ranging discussions on local and global issues. This is more than a cooking class!My only regret is that I don't live in an area that tourists frequent so I am unlikely to have the opportunity to return Manuel and Veronica's hospitality. Highly recommended!

A Great Decision!!. I went to this class with a friend last night somewhat on a whim, and it was such a great decision! We are here for four months, and this cooking class has been an absolute highlight of my trip so far! Veronica and Manuel are incredibly friendly people who welcome you into their apartment, and Manuel is an excellent instructor. Lots of information and instruction, and entertaining too! And of course the food we made was incredible!! The wine was free flowing and our sobremesa (after dinner conversation) went on for hours. Lots of fun getting to know the other couple attending the class as well as one of Veronica and Manuel's friends who stopped by. What a fantastic night!!

Amazing Night!. What a wonderful night with Veronica and Manuel. We brought our two young boys along (ages 3 and 5) and the evening was effortless. Veronica and Manuel kept us entertained and informed all the while keeping the boys engaged in the class too. It was a very memorable evening and one of the highlights of our three months in Argentina.

Loved it - great BA experience!. The class was AMAZING - I did this in October 2012 ( only just writing the review now!) The hosts Manuel and Veronica were so lovely and friendly, felt like you were just over at someone's house. Small group of people, I was with my friend, there was an older couple there, some other young girls. Great mix, fun night. Highly recommend.

Fun evening of cooking and conversation. Veronica and Manual are wonderful hosts and gave us a wonderful evening of cooking, wine and laughter. Manual is a professional chef who is also very gifted at teaching. He did a great job guiding us through the process and was especially patient with those of us who just couldn't get the right consistency with our dough. Veronica provided great information about wines and travel. Our finished products were delicious and we really enjoyed our evening! I highly recommend this as a great way to meet local people, have a more intimate dining experience and learn a few new recipes. Their selection of wine was also wonderful.

What a fun night!. My 20 year old son, my husband and I greatly enjoyed our evening with our gracious and warm hosts Veronica and Manuel. We enjoyed not only making and eating delicious Argentinian dishes, but also learning about life in Buenos Aires and Argentina in general. The time just flew by so quickly and I cannot recommend this experience highly enough. It has been the highlight of our visit thus far. You will be very happy to have chosen this opportunity to know true Argentinians. Well worth it!

Simply superb!. I really enjoyed this cooking class like none other! Veronica and Manuel have a beautiful place in the heart of one of Buenos Aires' posh zones. We learned how to make empanadas, dulce de leche and flan all the while enjoying the amazing wine and warm argentinian hospitality. Our hosts are some of the loveliest people I have met along my travels and have an abundance of information about Argentina and travel in general. This is a must-do if you are in BA!!

We had so much fun!. My 2 daughters aged 7 and 11 and I joined the cooking class at the home of Manuel and Veronica at the suggestion of our hotel. We had a really great evening. My two kids loved making empanadas and were so proud of their results. Manuela and Veronica were charming and gracious. It was the highlight of our stay in B.A. for my kids. I highly recommend the experience.

Great, Local cooking!!. Had the pleasure of spending an amazing night at Manuel's & Veronica's place. It's a sweet experience for those who like cooking local traditional food from LatinAmerican countries. Besides, we even had the chance to enjoy some wine with empanadas, a dessert called Flan & dulce de leche; It was a lovely evening, I will totally recommended & btw the place has an incredible atmosphere. Thanks you guys for all the good tips you gave us !!

fantastic cooking class. I really enjoyed being in the home of the chef, making empanadas, sipping Argentinian wines. It was unique, due also to the very kind couple Manuel, the chef and Veronica, who can also give you all kind of tips about Buenos Aires and other places to visit in Argentina. I highly recommend it to everyone, wanting to know more about the traditional way to cook Argentinian food. Realy great. Saskia from Holland (recommended to me by my daughter Florentine)

Great local experience in many ways. Having done cooking classes in nearly every spot we've visited, this time was unique, due mainly to the personal home style touch. The lesson was held in Veronica and Manuels home. We were welcomed into the local lifestyle. Cooked simple, yet classic Argentinian food and enjoyed local wines. An overall very enjoyable evening. Well done guys susan and bronte

Amazing night!. We were two friends going, everything was perfect! The neighborhood (Palermo) is very safe, the apartment is wonderful, Manuel and Verónica are a very kind and warm couple, they made our night very pleasant and funny! We highly recommend it to everyone, even if you don't know how to cook (like me!) you will still have an amazing night, drinking wine, eating empenadas, tasting flan and dolce de leche and knowing more about the culture in BA.

cooking and drinking. Me and my sister had a great evening with Veronica en Manuel! Manuel is not Gordon Ramsey!! He is very nice en really trying to learn you how to cook!! We are eating the best empenadas in nederland now!!Big Hug!Annelijn en Veerle
Great Fun!. Just a fun evening of making empanadas and drinking wine...meet a local couple and make some new friends!

Best outing in BA. Enjoy a wonderful evening with great conversation, excellent wine and outstanding food at Manuel and Verónica's Tierra Negra Cooking Class and Wine Tasting. Manuel and Verónica are a delightful couple and you will be pleased to have spent an evening with genuine Argentinians who generously open their home and share all of their knowledge of BA, Argentina, wine and cooking with you. Manuel is a professional chef by day and teaches the class at night. Verónica keeps the wine and conversation flowing. Before you arrive, Manuel has done most of the chop and prep work so that you can focus on dough consistency, forming the empanadas, enjoying the conversation and wine. These are, by the way, the best empanadas by far that I ate during my 8 day stay in BA and I sampled them daily at every possible locale. Manuel's Flan and Dulce de Leche were also fantastic. Aprons, wine and all ingredients are provided so all you need to bring is your appetite for good fun, wine and food.A couple of comments...I went alone and there was a young married couple there. Singles are warmly welcomed. This would also be a great family activity for older kids or a good professional team, bonding experience. I think the class description says 7-10 pm, but it was well after midnight when I left their home. Verónica arranged for a reputable taxi service to get me back to my hotel. Try to schedule your cooking class early during your stay in BA because Verónica and Manuel are so knowledgeable they can give you lots of good tips on other things to see, do, places to eat, shop, etc..Thanks for a wonderful evening out.

Empanada cooking lesson. Manuel and Veronica were awesome! What a fun event with people who really enjoy what they do. I highly recommend this activity, you will learn a little and mingle with other travelers over great food and wine.

Brilliant night out.. This couple made just fabulous hosts and the whole experience well exceeded our expectations.Would recommend this to anyone who wanted to learn more about cooking (empanadas, sweet treats) as well as the way of life in Buenos Aires.

A local couple welcomes you into there home to show you a great night with Argentina food, wine and hospitality.. great night, yum food and wine and new friends. thanks to the hosts you are amazing and new you have a beautiful home.

Fun. A fun night with two great people. Learn about cooking and BA from two natives. You wont be full or thirsty by the end that's for sure! Authentic and easy cooking and meeting new people. Why wouldnt you?

Our best night in Argentina. Great food, great hosts!. If you're visiting Buenos Aires, Tierra Negra cooking class is one of the best experiences you will have. Manuel and Veronica are so friendly, treating like you're one of their friends, as they open up their home (and kitchen) to you. This is such a refreshing and delightful evening, learning to cook these traditional Argentinian dishes, and the delicious wines they paired with them. Veronica and Manuel not only shared their home, culture, and cooking skills, they freely shared about their life in BA. We are very excited to make these at home, and very highly recommend this experience!

What a great night!. We had a wonderful night with Manuel & Veronica. It was a special experience to, not just cook, but share their passion for Argentinian culture, food & wine. They are great hosts. And yes we have made empanadas back home in Oz for the family. Give yourselves a treat and go along if you are in BA.

What better way is there to learn how to make an Empanada!. On a last minute whim we decided to attend this cooking class and I'm so glad we did! Not only did we learn how to make empanadas (and eat as many of them as we liked) we enjoyed some beautifully matched wines and met some great people including our hosts Veronica and Manuel who were such a welcoming and warm couple.This was probably one of the most fun experiences of our trip it wasnt touristy and I would recommend these classes to people of all ages!Thank you for such a fabulous night Tierra Negra - we loved you guys :)

Great cooking class and really nice people!. A really fun, dinamic cooking class, both the hosts and the attendants were great and now I can show-off my empanadas and enjoy my homemade dulce de leche!!!!!Great ambience, great food and fantastic argentinian wine!!!Would reccomend to anyone who wants a real taste of Argentina.

Planning a trip to Buenos Aires?. Want to learn Tango the way they dance it in their milongas? Don’t have the twenty or thirty years necessary to do it on your own? Then take lessons from Alejandro and JouJou. It is unlikely you will find more qualified teachers. Whether you’re a complete natural, or struggle with even the simplest movement, they will help you. I have watched them on many occasions patiently take students from stumbling to dancing in a relatively short period of time. Plus, they’re delightful company. If you’re lucky you’ll get to dine with them, too. You absolutely cannot go wrong. Enjoy!

Incredible and authentic . My time with Alejandro and JuJu was incredible. It was a very personal experience. Argentine tango is a parallel for life itself. My gf and I did 2.5 hours of private lessons for 5 days. I left feeling fabulous and empowered. A student is only as good as their teachers and we had the BEST !! Thanks so much u guys. I'll be continuing this for my entire life.

Learn to tango from two masters. I always wanted to visit Argentina and had some time off of work and decided why not go to Buenos Aires and why not learn the tango! i did quite a bit of research when I tried to find a private instructor. some of them never replied, some replied late but when Alejandro replied he did so right away and was very professional in his correspondence. he just seemed very kind and informative and it just seemed right. Once we arrived he was VERY accommodating to our jet lag, to our tourist schedule and even helped out by emailing us places to go and see. I generally found most Argentineans to be hospitable and kind.but let's talk about the tango:I am still in bliss coming back from this trip. why haven't i learnt this before?it is so hard but Alejandro and JouJou work so closely with you. and Alejandro happens to be a clinically trained psychologist and has been able to incorporate therapy into dance. i know this because I felt it!! What better than two highly educated and qualified instructors?I am definitely not a tango pro by any means... we had 10 lessons but i know for certain i learnt all the basics and Alejandro and JouJou helped my friend and I build a strong foundation so that when we take lessons in the near future elsewhere we will have the perfect foundation to go on. I hope i can learn tango from these two again. it was a pleasure and i truly loved it.

For the real tango experience. Buenos Aires can be a bit overwhelming because there are too many things to do but I am so glad I ran into this place.It gave me a real local experience. Alejandro was a fantastic teacher who, in a short period of time, taught me how to feel the beauty of tango. He was kind and patient and explained the basis principles as well as made me comfortable to follow him. Tango comes with a complex philosophy and I am so grateful to Alejandro for explaining it so well. I definitely recommend this place for a warm and eye opening experience.

Great experience!. I´ve been thinking about learning tango for a while, so what better place that in Buenos Aires. Some friends recommended Alejandro, and i am really happy they did. I took a 10 lesson package with accomodation and i have to say it was truely a unique and enriching experience, can´t wait to repeat it sometime soon! Thank you Alejandro and Joujou, the time with you was the highlight of my trip! See you again next year!

Go for tango lessons and feel great!!!. When you get to Buenos Aires it is a must to get some tango lessons. Me and my husband went for a pair of teachers – Jou Jou and Alejandro - and that was by far the greatest idea we could have! They could teach us separately at first, they have a great way to show empathy and to have us learn the steps and posture in a comfortable way – we were totally unfamiliar with tango steps when we got there.In quite a little while (about three- four lessons) we started to feel more comfortable while dancing and I can say – and I’m not choosing a big word – it was therapeutic! It was a boost in my self confidence and at the same time I could experience with my husband a totally new sensation which was the tango! We would definitely repeat the experience and before we do, we hope many more couples or singles would go to learn from Jou Jou and Alejandro!

Psychology of Tango. Alejandro Gee is not only a native Argentine tango dancer/teacher, but also a psychologist with an academic degree earned in the US. In January 2016 in Buenos Aires, he offered a lecture/practica on the psychology of tango to my students from a university in California. Wow! That was amazing. He showed and explained to us how and why the tango embrace plays an important role in psychological connection in tango dancing. It makes sense that he calls his class of tango Tango Therapy.

more than i asked for. i had always like the tango music and dance, i went to the core of the dance; Buenos Aires.Alejandro and JouJou my teachers; they are passionate about tango, they live and breath tango. Even though I'm just a beginner, I could sense how much they want to giveme everything they know about the dance, and really care about that I am learning the right way.I stayed at the tango house, took lessons everyday, at night I have home work assignment. going to the milongas they recommended, sometimes with them, sometimes on my own. in the 12 days I stayed there, I learned what this dance is about, I experienced the rich culture, most of all, how wonderful it is to be truly connected to others.I could not find a better place to stay, I could not find better teachers to learn how to tango!

Great tango teacher. I took another private lesson with Alejandro and later that night attended a very enjoyable tango dance party in his dance studio with some legendary Milongueros. He is very adept at pointing out areas that need improvement and giving concise instructions on how to improve. Excellent tango instructor.

Wonderful expression of Argentinian Tango. For those who are serious about developing their foundational tango elements and fundamentals, Alejandro and Jou Jou are the people to spend time with. They take their craft very seriously and don't dilute your experience with empty patterns. They provide an abundance of substance. I have now become a regular on my annual trips to Buenos Aires. If you are willing, they will connect you to an expression of Tango that will always continue to add to your dance. I am glad to say that we have become friends, and in addition to the accommodations they provide - Casa Tango Alejandro Gee - they are a must visit. Looking forward to my next experience!!!!

Great tango class!. Just finished my first class with Alejandro and Joujou and all I can say I am sorry it is only a few years into my tango journey that i found these two. I finally understood some basic things that nobody explained cleary enough until now and it makes a big difference already. I also took my beginner follower friend to get a proper introduction to tango and she loved it too. I can´t wait to continue my lessons this week and I highly recommend Alejandro´s classes to both beginners and more advanced dancers!

Very much recommended !!!. We took a ten lesson package and we had a wonderful experience. Great teachers with superb teaching skills and lots of patience, beautiful location, what a treat! And they both speak very good English, they are very knowledgeable, nice, educated people. They can also recommend where to attend a good milonga or where to buy tango shoes and clothing! You can find cheaper teachers and also more expensive ones, as we've tried, but these two have have a very particular style of teaching that you don't get with just anyone so we will do it again if we come back to Buenos Aires and will recommend them to all of our friends. Our experience was worth every penny and then some! Thank you Alejandro and Joujou and hope to see you soon again!

Private tango lessons with Alejandro Gee. Me and my husband had six private tango lessons with Alejandro and Joujou. What a wonderful experience! They were insightful and (pleasantly!) demanding teachers really challenging us to catch the true heart, style, movement and musicality of the authentic milonga tango. They are first class teachers and lovely people to learn with, the lessons were a real pleasure, we learnt so much! Alejandro has a deep knowledge of tango from his cultural and family background which he imparts with passion and thoughtfulness. We can't wait to go back and take more lessons as soon as possible!

4 x P = PERFECTION . If you are searching for a good tango instructor in Buenos Aires, search no more. Alejandro's PROFESSIONALISM stands out in all possible areas: communication, pricing, knowledge and execution. His PATIENCE and ability to recognize students' limitations encourage you to learn more. I have never met a tango teacher who is more PRECISE yet tactful and humble. I also need to point out that Elizabeth's presence and her tips for a follower were just PRICELESS. Thank you to both of you!

Tango Alejandro Gée - Living the Tango. What makes a good teacher?He knows his subject.He is good at it. Maybe excels in it. He is authentic. He loves what he is doing. Even more: he lives it.He is committed to the idea that his students understand and internalise what he teaches.He is able to calibrate his teaching method to the individual needs of a student.He communicates well. He can motivate when the learning gets tough.He is strict but respectful, attentive, meticulous and patient.This is Alejandro and his teaching partner Joujou. They specialize in teaching the style of traditional Milonguero Tango (see Alejandro’s helpful website for further info).Besides Alejandro and Joujou are very amiable and interesting people. Professional and reliable from start to finish. Helpful in every possible way far beyond Tango issues. Complementing each other in their role and method of teaching which foremost benefits the understanding of the important principle of masculinity and femininity in Tango. We were two beginners, new to the world of Tango. We had 10 private lessons with Alejandro and Joujou. Now we are infected with curiosity, with the desire to improve and learn more, wanting to come back to get to understand more of the fascinating soul of Tango.If you have the desire to learn or strengthen the fundamentals of traditional Tango and the culture that it is part of Alejandro and Joujou will not disappoint you.

Alejandro - El Maestro de Tango. After researching the type of Tango experience I wanted, I found Alejandro Gee through Tripadvisor. I wanted an authentic Argentine Tango experience that introduced me to the culture, music, the old world, and the dance. After contacting Alejandro, I could not be more pleased. Alejandro and Jou Jou were the consummate hosts. They helped me get to know the city in ways that made my stay wonderful. They designed my Tango experience to give me exactly what i was looking for. This was not a trip simply to satisfy the curiosity of a tourist, I literally felt that I had taken steps into the old world. The lessons met me right where I was in my development and helped me go significantly further. His accommodations were surreal, and the local sites provided much to be explored. Their focus on the fundamentals of Tango give the basis and create the desire to explore their world even further. Needless to say, I will be back!! Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!! I left Buenos Aires with a wonderful Tango experience and a few new friends....

Tango expert in Buenos Aires. We started taking a few tango lessons in Europe before heading to BA. We booked quite late a lessons with Alejandro but he took kindly and patiently his time to explain us the true essence of tango. This is not quicklylearning a few tricks but we felt more confident and happy to return to the dancefloor after, and basically this is all that counts. We definitely recommend visiting Alejandro.

Excellent Tango Teachers. Over a week in mid-December, the two of us took seven lessons with the superb Alejandro Gee, whose tango-teaching partner was the equally superb Jou-Jou. We both wholeheartedly agree with the views of the person who wrote the review below dated Oct. 15, 2015 (and also with the excellent review below by "Crysiel K"). Alejandro and Jou-Jou's patience, attention to detail, determination to ensure that their students are learning proper tango, and their willingness to answer any and all questions, plus just their natural intelligence and nurturing temperaments, and yes, the very lovely space -- all made for a learning experience that exceeded our expectations and that strengthened our love of tango. It also made us realize the value of private lessons with a couple, for the reasons stated in Crysiel K's review below.

Authentic tango, great teacher. I just had my first tango class with Alejandro. I was struck by his careful attention to detail and dedication to maintaining the authentic milonga style Tango. He is quite serious but also patient and lighthearted in his approach. I highly recommend his class to anyone who is serious about investing in a dance education with intent to pursue the 'real' tango traditions. Although less important, I would add that the dance space itself is beautiful and sure to put you in a nostalgic mood. It's true that you can find a class for a small fraction of his price, but like everything in life, you get what you pay for. Alejandro is the real deal.

Great Tango Teachers!. Alejandro and Jou Jou are excellent tango teachers. My dance partner and I had the good fortune recently to have a private lesson with them. I really enjoyed their teaching style. At first they separated us for one on one instruction. Alejandro concentrated on helping my dance partner focus on listening with his body to me and to the music. Jou Jou focused me on elongation, that my movement starts above the waist. About halfway through the lesson, they built on the first half by bringing my dance partner and I together to experience as one what we each had learned separately. From their private lesson, besides learning the essentials, I was also able to understand and internalize the precise body movements through their teachings. Their teaching style went beyond mechanics into the feeling and essence of Tango.I got compliments on the dance floor right after taking their lesson. It's amazing! I will take every future opportunity to take lessons from these great teachers.Crysiel K.G

Alejandro Gee - Profesor de Tango Unico y Psychologo - Excelente!. My experience with Alejandro Gee as a Tango teacher started during my short visit in Buenos Aires 2014. My friends and I anxiously anticipated Alejandro visit in USA - San Francisco, CA as an opportunity to explore his unique approach to teach tango with his clinical knowledge of psychology. I took several group and private lessons - each student enjoyed personal attention to explore more each own ability and avenue for physical and emotional stability in dance and life.This unique approach motivated me to realized my " dream" of bringing "Tango Therapy" to my work place- Hospital - as a tool to help reduce stress on work place.Alejandro and his teaching partner and I with hospital support conducted 3 hours seminar with presentation of history of Argentine Tango, cultural diversity and its benefit in stress management by connection, human embrace, posture, breathing, relaxation.. GREAT APPLAUSE!! my colleges physicians and other coworkers, friends ENJOYED!! I plan to continue these seminars and share this beautiful " TANGO Mission" ! with all gratitude to my teacher Alejandro.

Detox with tango. Stressed out from working in a large Middle East cancer hospital I made a spur of the moment decision to take myself off to Buenos to de-stress and to indulge my passion for dancing!Having taken a few \argentine tango lessons some ten years previously in my home country of New Zealand I had the idea to learn the traditional milonguera style tango danced in the traditional milongas of Buenos Aires.My first lesson with Alejandro Gee, an Argentinean with perfect English and a double degree in psychology from USA was at first thought a little disappointing in that he asked me to forget all previous knowledge I had regarding his beloved art of tango mionguera?! However, putting ego aside I agreed (with myself probably more than with him) to give it my best shot?!During the next ten days I was slowly but methodically introduced to excellent technique, intricacies of musicality, the warmth of the embrace and I was ''worked on" to correct my postureand most interestingly I was made aware of how the stress in my life was manifesting in my dance style, something very obvious to me now when I review video clips of my dance lessons!This gentle, modest but quietly commanding man and his graceful, beautiful tango partner Jouyou prompted, cajoled and even physically prodded me at times in effort to make me aware of the shortcomings in my posture! "Straighten your lead leg, lengthen your torso, hold your head up and numerous other instructions were gently but succinctly and repeatedly drilled into me in effort to allow me to succeed!Milonga etiquette, attire and wonderful, almost secret tales of the Buenos Aires tango scene, it's milonga characters, especially the old milongueros were shared with me.My passion reignited, I almost missed my flight home as I happily got ready to go to a milonga! I ended up stuffing, rather than packing my bag, arriving with very little time to spare at the airport?On return to work my manager commented on my renewed vigor and suggested that we immediately fly Alejandro to the Middle East to use his special style of tango therapy on the rest of the staff here in our multi-national Operating Room Suites!My own suggestion for anybody looking to begin or to improve their tango skills (alongside their mindset) would be to "pack all your troubles in your old kit bag (along with your tango shoes) and head off for a whole bunch of lessons at Alejandro Gee' s beautiful home studio!Go with an open mind and enjoy the experience, who knows, maybe you'll learn way more besides the beautiful tango that he's dedicated himself to teaching?A big thank you Alejandro and Jouyou!I will definitely be back for more!

Tango and the art of commnication. What a great experience for Kim and me during our week in Buenos Aires. We booked two then extended to three lessons with Alejandro and his assistant. Tango is so much more than memorizing dance steps--it's about reading your partner, communicating clearly, holding your body in a proud and healthy way. My chronic back pain improved. I walked straighter. The music is eerily beautiful, I now want to dance more with my (much more accomplished) wife.

Menage a Tango!. We had tried group Tango lessons on prior visits to BA as well as during a cruise, all to no avail as the few steps we tediously learned did not take us far on the dance floor. Having decided we needed a more personal approach we contacted Alejandro thru his website and he responded promptly and we arranged for at least one lesson depending on the results. Alejandro welcomed us warmly into his beautiful studio in a turn of the century building that is very evocative of the Tango. After his beautiful and charming assistant Jou Jou arrived our journey commenced. We soon learned that to dance the Tango both your mind and spirit need to be aligned with your feet before you can take a single step. The process begins with proper posture, breathing and most important balance. Who knew it would be so intense! It is not easy to realign your movements and they were both very patient and gentle as the led us thru the basics in order that the actual dance would flow from our soul and not from just our feet. We soon realized we were in for a transforming experience as the hour flew by. We arranged for another lesson before we left, wishing that we had more time with Alejandro and Jou Jou ... we were hooked! Even after two lessons we still struggle but knowing the basics and understanding the importance of the mind set we are looking forward to many hours of practice at home as well as more lessons on our next visit to BA. Gracias Alejandro y Jou Jou for releasing our inner Tango!PS Alejandro even sent us home with music to practice by

Alejandro Gee - The Real Deal. I booked a tango lesson for myself with Alejandro Gee after seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor and also because his studio was close to my rental apartment. I had mixed feelings because I’m an intermediate level tango dancer wanting to improve my dance, whilst most reviews were from people seeking to experience tango while on holiday. Anyway, I thought I’d give him a go. It didn’t take me long to recognise Alejandro as someone who had been raised and nurtured in an Argentine Tango cultural environment. The dance, the music, the spirit – I felt that all of these were at the heart of the man he is. Alejandro is a milonguero style tango master with an understated elegant style, and is a dream to dance with. He possesses a modest teaching manner but even so, I quickly learned that lessons with him would mean some hard work from me. I booked a lesson a day with him for the rest of my stay in Buenos Aires (about nine lessons). He and his assistant, Jouyou, worked tirelessly to improve my posture and balance, and taught me a greater respect for musicality in my dance. I learned so much from them both.  After each lesson, Alejandro recommended the milongas I might like to attend in the evening. As a result I had a great time dancing the night away at the BA milongas, and meeting local people as well as tourists from all over the world. I did become ill in BA and I will never forget Alejandro’s kindness to me. Before I left, he invited me to join him and his friends for lunch at his stunning dance studio. He was the perfect host and I spent a very happy afternoon enjoying the conversation which mostly centered around the BA tango scene. It was a light-hearted afternoon with lots of laughter and a definite highlight of my time in BA. Thank you Alejandro. Alejandro Gee is the real deal and I can recommend him to tango dancers of any level seeking to improve their technique.

So you think you can dance?. I didn't know the first thing about tango when my wife and I signed up for lessons with Alejandro Gee and his assistant. I'm not sure what I was expecting, but it turned out to be a really neat experience. We didn't learn "how to tango" per se. We learned how to move as a couple - how to feel and anticipate each other's movements. It was a cool learning experience - it was different. The tango takes years and years to learn, but what Alejandro did for us in 90 minutes was introduce us to the subtle nature of what tango is at its core. Notes: If you want to sign up for a lesson, just send him an email. He was quick to respond and set up a session. He only accepts cash - preferably $US. Wear flat shoes - athletic shoes are fine for a guy. I think I wore boat shoes - which were fine. This is a great class for beginners or experienced dancers.

Wonderful lessons. I appreciated Alejandro's patience and professionalism. Great classes and I highly recommend his teaching style. I took lessons on my own and would have liked to stay longer in Buenos Aires to do more dancing.

Lessons with Alejandro Glee. Just returned from an eight night stay in Buenos Aires. My experience with Alejandro Gee (Tango Classes Alejandro Gee) was exceptional. He is a learned professional, fluent in English (which helps, since I do not speak Spanish). His studio is pristine and elegant, like the gentleman he is. I have never had a lesson in Argentine Tango. After six lessons, I was able to feel the fluidity of this uniquely sensuous dance. I highly recommend Alejandro Gee for anyone who wishes to embrace the beauty and joy of dancing.

I am lucky to have met Alejandro Gee. I found Alejandro Gee by googling "Buenos Aires tango teachers". An article described Alejandro as an excellent teacher, fluent in English and having a degree in clinical psychology. "Sounds like an interesting person - I'd like to meet him", I thought. Plus, I was looking for accommodations and Alejandro's website said he rented rooms in his home to students taking tango lessons with him so it was perfect for me.Alejandro replied quickly and comprehensively to my email. I got the prices for lessons and room and his address and house rules. Everything I needed. He sent helpful reminders leading up to my stay with advice on money changing and airport transfers. When we met, I found him polite and very responsible. In Argentina, many things don't work as efficiently as it does in the first world. Alejandro however was always on time and reliable. Quite a breath of fresh air in Argentina. Alejandro takes his teaching and classes seriously. I think his clinical background allows him to tailor his teaching approach a little to what he reads of our personalities. He strives to give us what we need. Besides the technique, he also gave me some insights into aspects of my personality that could be connected to how I dance. It was interesting as it is something I could reflect on and work on (if I wanted to, he doesn't pressure or critique, merely observe and suggest).Alejandro is very busy generally with lessons and admin in between. But, a benefit of staying with him over Christmas and not having plans was that he kindly invited me to a Christmas eve dinner he threw at home for a few of his friends, some of whom I got to know better at milongas. Through the interactions with him and his friends I learned a lot about the world of tango, the drive to perfect the dance, the attraction of the milonga world, and the parallels between tango and life. I would recommend Alejandro to couples who want to learn more about dancing together as a couple, or students on their own who want to learn about more tango and improve their technique. It doesn't matter if you're a beginner like me or at the top of your game and just want some pointers, the lessons are quite enjoyable (there is a lot to pick up during the 75 mins!) and useful. I also recommend staying with Alejandro for students who want an off beaten track accommodation experience. I like AirBnB-ing and "homey" personal interaction with locals, and living among them. So staying with Alejandro was great as he could give me tips on whether to buy an electrical adaptor, get a temporary SIM card, buy wine etc. Of course, he can tell you about milongas and where to buy tango shoes (quoting him as my teacher I got a 15% discount at Neo Tango shoes near his place, for cash payment in AR$). His place is in a quiet residential street near the city centre. It has really old world charm decor. The one thing not so great about the location of Alejandro's casa tango is if you have to go to Palermo a lot. I had to (my friends all stayed there, and my yoga studio is in Palermo) and it was a bit of a hassle having to commute there daily. 25 mins by taxi (AR$55) or bus.

Inspiring teachers. Both Allesandro and Jou Jou are excellent teachers and so patientWe had one lesson ( not enough) in their amazing apartmentWe are now inspired to take lessons at home for when we return to BA Our only regret is we forgot to have our picture taken Thank you both Rae and Tom

Outstanding instructors. Alejandro is one of the best Argentine tango instructors we have encountered. Over the years, we have developed many bad habits, and Alejandro was able to help us correct them and improve our tango. We would highly recommend him to both beginners and more experienced dancers.

Fantastic !. Alejandro is an experience, very patient, detailed and friendly instructor. His studio is nice and big with aircondition. I would recommend him to anyone who wants to start tango in a private lesson or who wants to improve his techniques in tango. I will visit him again next time in Buenos Aires.

Just try - if you don't like it I will give you the money back. This is how Alejandro Gee should advertise his lessons. From the very first moment you feel how much experienced he is (globally). Doesn't matter what country you are from, my impession is that he's got this ability to find way to communicate smoothly with everyone. And the atmosphere he creates - you feel very precious - not because thanks to you he earns money - because he really wants to teach you as much as possible during one lesson. No rush - although you are aware of the fact he is very busy and popular - your lesson is your time - you feel like everything disappears - it's only you, him and tango. You will not get the impression "hurry up! Another person is waiting". Alejandro Gee makes you realise how much you can achieve in your life if you do things with passion. Hope your popularity will not distroy anything and you stay as you are. It's difficult but I wish you all the best!pozdrawiamUrszula

Fantastic teacher, great for technique and generous. . Alejandro and his partner were great teachers. My niece and I booked with only a days notice and were treated to a detailed technique class for beginners. The explanations and guidance were perfectly pitched to our experience level. Highly recommended to anyone who hasn't Tango'd and wants a private lesson to get a handle on the basics.

Fantastic!. After a few months of lessons in Australia, I was still very much a beginner and Alejandro helped enormously by taking me back to basics ... walking, keeping my axis. It was a great experience and I left each lesson on top of the world. Jou Jou also came in to a couple of the classes to give me more advice from a follower's perspective. Great teachers, and very generous. It was a great experience. Highly, highly recommended.
classes with alejandro e juju!. they are great teachers and very exigent! we´ve learnt many dance steps and they were very patiences with our limits. they are the best!

I highly recommend Alejandro as a tango instructor. I highly recommend Alejandro as a tango instructor. I have been dancing Milonguero style tango for six years and knew that I had a problem with my center of balance being too high. Alejandro gave me several tips on how to become more connected with my core. He has extensive knowledge of the mechanics of movement as well as the emotional elements expressed in tango. Alejandro skillfully diagnoses your problems and articulates various methods for improvement in a diplomatic way. If you visit his web site you will see that Alejandro has a Master's degree in clinical psychology. His graduate thesis was on tango therapy. He is in the inner circle of an eccentric, charismatic, well known brotherhood of much older Milongueros that frequent Cachirulo and other traditional Buenos Aires milongas. Unfortunately these older Milongueros won't be around for too much longer. Alejandro is well positioned to be a torchbearer passing on the traditions that he has learned from his 24/7 involvement in the Buenos Aires tango scene.

Great individual lesson. I had read about Alejandro and his lessons in the newspaper in London - and whilst in Buenos Aires for a couple of days thought it would be good to have an individual lesson, with the hope of making the most of the time. It surpassed expectations - and I was able to have two lessons, on consecutive days - the first with Alejandro and the second with Alejandro and Jou Jou. They were both friendly and professional and extremely patient. I highly recommend them and will be looking to book in with them again if I ever get the chance to return !

I learned so much in 1 hour. Yesterday, I visited Alejandro and Jou Jou's tango class. My date and I were complete beginners. When we arrived we realized we were the only two there for the class. Our own private tango class!We began with complete fundamentals, learning how we need to position our bodies and breathe, how to walk, and finally how to use my body to tell my partner where I was going. It was fun, very personal, and the real thing.I have so much respect now for real tango.

The real tango effect.. I have been dancing tango regularly for three years and I was so confident that I can walk. Not until I took my first private lesson with Alejandro! I had to start all the basic movements all over again. Alejandro was professional and patient. He wasn't just teaching the tango but he also shared his knowledge of music and tips for attending the milonga. I have been taking eight lessons and by the end of my tango holiday my dancing had improved so much. I had thumbs up from the local dancers both leaders and followers. I'm so glad to have found Alejandro and learned tango with him. If you are a social dancer, who enjoys dancing the milonguero style I would highly recommend lessons with Alejandro.

Fantastic Teacher. We literally just got home after taking our first tango lesson with Alejandro Gee and Jou Jou. My wife and I have never taken tango lessons before, and due to a foot problem that my wife has just recently recovered from, we haven't done much if any dancing at all in the past couple of years.Since we are only going to be in Buenos Aires for a few days we wanted to try our hand at learning Tango, and it was something we definitely didn't regret.Alejandro and Jou Jou were extremely patient with us, especially since we have all the grace of zombies... or robots... or zombie robots. From this one experience we were introduced to how nuanced, passionate, and intimate tango is, and it's something that we want to explore in the future. Unfortunately we won't be in BA long enough to continue taking classes.I don't know enough about dance to provide the comments that other reviewers with more dance experience can provide... but what i can say is this:- The location is very clean very professional, and oozes the spirit of tango- Alejandro and Jou Jou are extremely patient and understanding- They are also very technical and can correct minor shifts in your posture and movements to ensure you are doing things correctly- Watching them dance together is a thing of beauty and grace- A 90 minute class was not enough!
