It left me wanting more!!!!So please do this if you have any inkling of a desire to learn tango. You won't regret it.

Consider yourself lucky.... If you are in Buenos Aires (or in the US, where Alejandro Gee also regularly teaches workshops), and you have the opportunity to take tango classes with Alejandro, consider yourself extremely lucky. You have found one of the best teachers, no matter whether you are a beginner or an advanced dancer, or if you come as a couple, or alone. Not only is he extremely kind and a fantastic dancer, he has a superb understanding of technique, psychology, and body mechanics. He will be able to pinpoint exactly, gently, and on a fundamental level, how you can improve your dancing; and what's more, your body (and not just your mind) will feel it too. I've never had a teacher (and I've had many) who was able to work on such an intense level of mind/body "awareness," and work on balance, posture, and walking really from the "inside out." His classes are transformative, and not just in terms of the improvement of your dancing.

Alejandro is the best! Lessons with him transformed my trip to Buenos Aires!. Alejandro Gee is the most capable teacher of tango I have learned under! He is patient with beginners and leads gracefully. He is a beautiful communicator, in both life and dance, and I am so thankful that I stumbled upon this page when I was looking for a tango teacher and found him!Many teachers jump straight into steps and movement, but Alejandro exudes a deep appreciation and a fierce integrity for the dance. This means that he takes the time to make adjustments and teach posture, walking and embrace properly so that you have a solid foundation for your dance. He also instilled in me a love of tango milonguero, which I know crave on a daily basis and has been a big heart-opener for me.When I came back to New York and continued taking lessons, my instructors thought I had been dancing for months after only three private lessons with Alejandro. I am still searching for a teacher like him in the US, but I haven't been able to find one yet so I will gladly return to Buenos Aires and learn under him! :)I could not recommend him more highly! Thank you, Alejandro.

Great Experience. My wife and I took two classes with Alejandro and Joujou when we visited BA in August. We are dancing tango for several years and we regularly take private classes in NYC. But these classes were special - very useful, extremely intense. It was a very pleasant surprise that there were two instructors, so each of them could work with us individually.They gave us extra time and every minute was filled with very to-the-point instructions on BA style, like postures, steps, embrace. I think it made us better dancers right away and allowed to brave BA milongas. Back in NYC, we continue practicing and remember Joujou and Alejandro all the time.

very helpful and insightful..... I took a couple of privates in Bozeman, MT. with Alejandro while he was on his recent U.S. tour, and he brought me to a new level of insight and understanding.It was back to the basics: the embrace, the connection, the music, staying on your axis. Concepts I'd heard before, but I gained new insights with Alejandro's tutelage.He told me in precise terms how I could improve my tango. Alejandro is also a very pleasant, warm, open person who is easy to be around!

Our first wedding anniversary trip was completed by tango lesson from Alejandro Gee!. Last week my wife and I went to Buenos Aires for our first wedding anniversary trip. By luck I learned about Alejandro Gee from Wikitravel and decided to give it a try as all my friends who have been to BA told me to try tango lesson. I wrote him an email and he responded to me in less than an hour. Then I found out that Alejandro travels to US from time to time to teach tango so it was quite lucky for us that he was not travelling during the week and he was able to teach us tango. On our first private lesson, My wife and I were quite nervous as we never tried tango before. But Alejandro and Joujou taught both man and woman's role step by step with great patience. And they explained in English everything very well and easy-to-understand. So right after the first lesson, we decided to have another lesson on the next day and we ended up learning tango everyday while we were in BA. It was so much fun! At night time, we also tried a couple of milongas that Alejandro recommended in order to see and experience the atmosphere and culture. And it was an amazing experience we had. Overall, we concluded that Alejandro and Joujou didn't just give us great tango lessons but they really showed Argentinean kindness and warmth. We are now big fans of tango and Buenos Aires thanks to Alejandro and Joujou and their great tango teaching! Now back in New York, my wife and I are planning to continue to tango and looking forward to visiting BA again for another lesson from our great tango maestro.

Gracias Alejandro Gee!. I was lucky enough to take 2 private lessons from Alejandro in his studio in Buenos Aires while I was visiting the city in June. He is a fantastic teacher and I can't wait to go back to BA and work with him again. It was my first time learning Tango and Alejandro was the perfect instructor - he is patient and wonderfully encouraging - and he gave me not only a lesson in dance, but a terrific understanding of the the cultural experience of Tango. My lesson was relaxed and focused - and Alejandro's studio is lovely and welcoming. If you are lucky enough to go to BA, you'll add a wonderful experience to your trip with a lesson from Alejandro. Cathleen M

Argentino Tango Workshop. I attended a workshop and took a private with Alejandro this past Summer in Seattle. He was in town touring the Northwest, with stops in Vancouver (Canada) and Montana. Every tango teacher has something different to offer. And many times, what you get, depends on where you are at. This time around my experience would be mainly technique, and dancing in the context of the music and orchestra.One of the highlights for me was learning drills and technique for keeping the knees straight when walking. Now my movements are more precise and clean. Usually learning technique takes personal feedback. Although I took a private and had just that, Alejandro also did a good job of circulating around the room during the workshop.My favorite class was Alejandro fitting his mindset and movement, to the 4 major orchestras in turn. In a short period of time, he was able to present a framework for how to approach a given tanda.Alejandro is professional, patient, and focused on the feeling of the dance which is oftentimes quite hard to to teach!

Get to the next level in Tango with Maestro Gee. After dancing Tango for nearly three years (mostly salon and some nuevo), I was waiting for an opportunity to learn the authentic milonguero style and was delighted to find out that Alejandro was coming to North America on a teaching tour. I took a group class and three private lessons. He is a serious, committed instructor with a wealth of knowledge which he presents in a methodical and logical way. His teaching style is intense and relaxed (paradoxically) at the same time, his English excellent and he makes you look and feel beautiful on the dance floor! Overall, it was a joyful experience and I feel grateful to the maestro for taking me to the next level. Will definitely look him up when in Buenos Aires!Irene JohnsonSeattle/Los Angeles

Great experience. Alejandro is an excellent dancer with the patience of a saint when he teaches. I took group lessons and a private lesson from him at a small workshop in Bozeman, Montana, and it was worth every penny.

Tango the original way!. Alejandro and jou jou were wonderful teachers. I only had one lesson, however I learnt so much about the history and culture of Tango. They taught me from scratch, learning the posture, the stance and the breathing even before taking a step. it was amazing to feel the tango movement. i didnt think i would be able to accomplish as much as i did, as it didnt come naturally for me, however with the fundamentals being reinforced, amazingly the understanding of the dance began. The experience taught me so much about myself, I'm sure I will continue to tango at home. We also visited a milonga recommended by Alejandro, and this experience gave us a much better understanding of the culture of tango.

Great experience, great way to learn Tango.. My wife and I took five lessons from Alejandro and his partner JouJou. I can say that for both of us these classes exceeded our expectations and we were sad to see Friday, and our last lesson, arrive. Our plan is to return to Buenos Aires to once again enjoy this remarkable experience and, of course, this remarkable city. Alejandro and JouJou teach the traditional Tango, not as a series of memorized steps, but as a process, as a sense of communication, of movement together. They share the history of Tango, the culture and even where to attend a milonga, where they also attended. They both teach with skill, passion and understanding. And, especially for me, the emphasis is on understanding because nothing was natural for me. But they kept on emphasizing the fundamentals, and as a result in my life overall I have more awareness of my posture, my walk and the way I stand. As instructors Alejandro and JouJou wonderfully complement each other, each providing insights and feedback. Plus, each of the two people attending the lesson get individual attention throughout the lesson. I was expecting only one instructor, but was glad for both to be there and for the help we received from both.Most of all, I now have at least some understanding of the beauty of the Tango, how it brings people together for a kind of shared experience that is almost completely lacking in my native culture from the USA, certainly in any kind of dominant form. We are glad from our limited experience, and hope someday to attend a milonga and be dancers ourselves. As you will learn, there is much more here than just a dance!

Fantastic teacher. I came to Buenos Aires on my own and had daily lessons over the period of 6 days with Alejandro. The location was great, very central and his dance studios are beautiful. I had only been learning tango for 8 months before I came and Alejandro started by going through the basics, deconstructing what I thought I knew and then putting it back together in the correct way! Alejandro is very patient, he speaks excellent English and he is extremely perceptive. I found it amazing what a big difference even small adjustments to my posture & embrace could make. By the end of the week I was dancing so much better, I was much more confident and was even going to the local BA milongas on my own - AND getting asked to dance! Back in London I have been complimented on my embrace and following technique several times. I would definitely go back for more lessons next time I visit BA (I am sure he will be just as good for learning more intermediate and advanced techniques) and I would highly recommend him as a teacher.

Great experience!. I took a class with Alejandro in Buenos Aires. We worked on technique and we went over several things that I needed to improve in my dancing. It was really helpful. I highly recommend to take classes with Alejandro.

A classy affair with the best tango in town.... A trip from the UK to Argentina is not exactly a cheap affair so after I paid the ticket money I decided I was going to make my experience a high class one from start to finish. I looked for the buzziest tango places and set out to locate the best tango teacher in town. I must say, the offers are numerous and tempting, but after reading a few reviews and attending one lesson I decided to stick to Alejandro. He has style, passion and patience for both clumsy and advanced students. He is knowledgeable and graciously lets you in the secrets of feeling tango as well as learning the correct steps. I highly recommend Alejandro for a proper understanding of tango and its cultural context.

Quality all the way. Do you really want to spend your money well, choose Alejandro and JouJou. No matter your level, you will get max of your 90 minutes.No waisting of time, they are serious and passionate teachers, with huge knowledge of tango, dance, body and mind. They will do their best to efficiently transfer it to you ... They are nice, kind people who truly love the tango, they are both real milongeros, and they will also help you with other things around tango (milongas, history, kulture...), if you need.Are you beginner, I can promise that you will go out of class smiling and dancing. If already dancing, Ale and Joujou will surely be able to help you to improve your tecnicue ... I could go on and on about the quality of instruction and level of dance technique, but you just must experience it by your self!I stayed in their beutiful house for 3 weeks in February 2013, and took lessions in their wonderful studio. I will never forget that time... I loved the tango from my first encounter with it, but now I enjoy my dancing even more, and there is plenty of tings that ”loosens” now, thanks to these two lovely people.I miss you Ale and JouJou!

The best in Buenos Aires. I decided to take on the challenge of the Tango dance while visiting Buenos Aires. I read many reviews. Alejandro had many good reviews, so I decided to see if he was available during the time I was there. It worked out perfect. He is a very advanced dancer and he had the patience to teach me the concept and the passion of the dance. It is much more than just the steps. He worked on communication while dancing because the woman must follow what the man tells her to do. His English level is proficient . I took 1 weeks lessons and plan to continue in Boca Raton. Alejandro is remarkable!!!

Quality Instruction. Alejandro offers high quality instruction particularly in milonga style tango. I took private lessons daily for over a week and made significant progress working on basic techniques essential for a good foundation in tango and an elegant form. Alejandro teaches about how to follow and lead rather than learning a fixed sequence of dance steps so that his students can dance in a creative improvisational style with different partners. A video of my dancing was made so I could see where I need to make corrections, which was helpful. Many of the tango venues in B.A. are teaching 'tourist tango'. Alejandro is authentic in his style, technique, and backgound. Many tango instructors teach only in Spanish, but Alejandro speaks excellent English which I found helpful in getting the most out of the classes. He has a beautiful studio with a wood floor, air-conditioning, and a real 'tango' ambience. He also taught me a lot about tango culture and gave me lots of good advice about where to dance in the city. You will find Alejandro to be a charming and interesting person to meet in your travels. There are so many tango instructors in Buenos Aires that it is hard to know which to choose. I am very pleased that I connected with this particular instructor and I highly recommend his private classes.

Tango Feeling. I had been dancing tango in my home country for over a year and had decided to stay for a while in Buenos Aires to speed up my learning.When I first heard about Alejandro and saw his ratings on TripAdvisor, I was sceptical, because the ratings appeared too good to be true. However, at the same time I was curious to try out a class, because when I saw him dancing in a video, his style was different from what I was used to. He danced much closer to his partner and did not appear to make complicated moves. I am glad I tried out his class.The first class I took with him and his partner (Erzebet or Joujou) was unlike any other class I had taken before. I was dancing with his partner, who constantly gave feedback about how my lead felt, while Alejandro was observing me from the side and correcting me as well.Alejandro and Erzebet do not teach tango steps, they teach how to step tango. They explained me to be stable on the ground, to make a connection with the chest to feel what the partner is doing, to have a nice embrace and to listen to the music.I have been taking classes once a week ever since my first class, because I keep learning from them. They observe very well what you can improve and explain it very well. Before meeting them, I was not dancing, I was thinking about how to guide (or force) my partner in a sequence of steps without being aware or caring about how my guiding felt. They made me aware about how I should keep my feet, knees, belly, back, chest, shoulders, arms, hands, head and much more so it feels comfortable for the partner you dance with.Alejandro and Erzebet will not learn you how to impress the people who are watching you, but they will learn you how to impress the people you dance with. For me, this is what dancing tango is about, it is not so much about giving a show as it is about having a nice feeling.Moreover, they are very friendly people who like to listen to you and their place is very cosy.I definitely recommend them to anyone, from beginner to advanced who is learning tango!

Brilliant!!. My family and I were in South America from the UK for Christmas and New Year. We spent a couple of days in BA were we had a Tango lesson with Alejandro. It was BRILLIANT. Having been to a tango show the night before we were all very excited about learning some moves. He was not only a great teacher he made it really fun! I would highly recommend him! He would definitely have a giggle at us trying to practice what we learnt while cooking dinner at home in the kitchen.

This is serious Tango. We took a private 90 minutes Tango lesson at Alejandro's Studio with our teenage daughters which we all enjoyed very much. A lot of time was spent on posture, walking and feeling the moves instead of just learning the steps. We all received individual attention. Of course one lesson is not enough to become a proficient Tango dancer. Alejandro followed up with milonga places to watch the professionals dance and he even sent us an address in Switzerland to continue our Tango lessons.

Learn to tango like a local. It's always been a dream of mine to learn tango where it all started. From the moment I walked into Alejandro's beautiful studio, I knew I had chosen the right mentors. I fell in love with the dance, the music and of course the shoes!Alejandro and JouJou were the most wonderfully skilled and patient teachers. It was clear these two have an absolute passion for tango and are eager to share and foster that passion amongst their students. I was fortunate to spend a week under their tutelage. Nevertheless, the time flew by. Without hesitation, I would highly recommend to anyone wanting to learn traditional tango to try a few lessons with Alejandro and JouJou!

Must reach out to Alejandro when in BA !!. My husband and I have two left feet so we were so nervous about taking a tango lesson. We weren't sure if this was for us but decided to give it a go. By the end of Alejandro's 90 minute class, we both were surprised how quickly time had passed. His studio is spacious and bright. He's a great teacher and gives some very helpful tips. He's also very friendly and humble not once did he make us feel uncomfortable or embarassed because we couldn't dance. We really wished we had stayed in Buenos Aires longer. Don't even think about taking other touristly group classes. Because Alejando doesn't combine your session with others, you really get your money's worth out of the 90 minutes as you have his undivided attention. Not only did we learn some basics of Tango but we became aware of our posture.. i.e. how stand and walk so we could fix that. We now are motivated to continue learning locally in Dubai !! Thanks Alejandro :)

simply the best!. the best Tango experience i had in my life. Now im back home and other dances tell me they notice a big difference in my dance! :-) but its not only about tango- i learned so much about myself. And if you like learning fast and intense -Alejandro and JouJou the best that could happen to you- they are "stereo" cool! :-) i am very grateful for this opportunity and lessons i had.Thank you!!! You are the best!

Alejandro and JouJou Rock!. If you're coming to Buenos Aires to study tango you must study with Alejandro and JouJou. Don't even think for a moment about some other tourist classes or something. The house/studio is gorgeous and the prices are reasonable. Alejandro and JouJou teach traditional tango and are very knowledgeable about body mechanics and the mental/emotional side of dancing tango as well as the physical. I can't recommend them enough.

Highly recommended. Buenos Aires was a great experience for me. Especially I will remind the convenient tango atmosphere in the beautiful old studio, where Alejandro and Joujou impart their knowledge of tango. Beside the straining practice of the right way to set my steps, I got a new perspective of my body awareness, that helps so much to dance more relaxed.Therefore and for so many other helpful suggestions where to go to milongas, I want to thank Alejandro and Joujou very much! They open the world of tango in a very professional and kind way! Thank you and best wishes,Ina16. November 2012

Amazing introduction to the world of tango. My tango lesson with Alejandro and his partner Joujou was one of the highlights of my trip to Buenos Aires. From the moment I walked into their beautiful studio in a 100 year old building, hearing tango playing in the background, I knew I was in for a special experience. Alejandro and Joujou are very passionate about the traditional style of tango dancing and are clearly excited to share their wealth of knowledge and expertise. They are meticulous about every little detail, making sure that from your very first step, you are learning properly. As a professional ballet dancer, I really appreciated this attention to detail. It was incredible how much I learned in just two lessons during my brief stay in BA. I wish I could have gone back for more! Alejandro and Joujou opened up the world of authentic tango to us in Argentina, with their recommendations of where to go to experience milonga at its finest. They also sent me some wonderful music to dance to at home, and because of Joujou's encouragement and recommendation of a shop, I am a very proud owner of a beautiful new pair of tango shoes. Alejandro and Joujou are great people and talented dancers and instructors. Highly recommended.

Best Tango Lesson. After having taken group lessons in London for 4 years, during which I made only moderate progress in my opinion, I knew that private lessons are the best way to achieve significant improvements. Alejandro and his partner were very patient with me and I learnt more in 2 days than in 2 years! I was most impressed with the transition and improvement from day 1 to day 2. Next time I'm in Buenos Aires I will certainly go back. Meanwhile, I will invest in private lessons in London and put my re-discovered motivation into practice.

Want to dance beautifully?. I never know what to expect when I take tango lessons and I am always fearful the maestro will teach something beyond my grasp. What a surprise my encounter with Alejandro. What I learned was the fundamental of all future intricate steps. Don't be fooled, even the very basic steps, meaning the walk, can be mesmerizingly beautiful if done properly to music. I never imagine a simple tango walk could be so exquixitely sensuous. Every tango dancer should begin tango lessons with Mr. Gee before bad habits develop!

An Incredible Experience. I had originally planned to try just one private tango lesson whilst in Buenos Aires and ended up doing one class per day for the whole week that I was there.   This was due to the warmth and expertise of two great teachers, Alejandro and his partner Joujou.Alejandro and Joujou are clearly passionate about the traditional milonguero style of tango, as well as being passionate about getting the best out of their students.  Thus, the classes are challenging, fun and authentic (since being back in London, I also realise just what outstanding value the classes were).The time I spent with Alejandro and Joujou hugely enhanced my experience of Buenos Aires and they have successfully managed to inspire me to continue learning the tango now that I'm back at home.  I can't wait for my next trip back to BsAs!

A Rare Teacher in the World of Tango Today. Alejandro Gee is a rare teacher indeed in the world of tango today where teaching steps seems the only way to convey the art of dancing tango. His style is the basis for dancing tango superbly as you can see on Youtube. He obviously loves and respects this art form to teach the heart of the dance to those that come to him to learn. I have danced for over 20 years and rarely take classes anymore because the way it is taught today has nothing to do with the heart of the dance.And since the passing of my favorite teacher who also had the passion to teach as well as perform, I was so happy to come upon Alejandro. He is a gift to anyone who studies with him and his knowledge will stay with you for years. Some people perform and some people teach.It is rare that you find one that can do both superbly. He is an experience not to be missed.

The ultimate (Buenos Aires) experience..... It is rare in life that you get to meet someone who is the very best at what he does and he not only has acceptance and tolerance for a person who is an abject beginner but he genuinely loves to work with you and to communicate to you his understanding and love of his craft. In spiritual circles, this is called grace. And Alejandro has that kind of grace in great abundance and it is symbolized by his other gracefulness, that which he has as a dancer. I was that abject beginner, middle-aged and hampered by a bum knee and a bad back. And I could not have felt more welcomed, more encouraged and more well taught than I did with Alejandro. And all that I have said goes double, because his stunning partner, Zou Zou, is all the same things. You will receive the benefit of two amazing teachers, and at an incredible value. And if you are physically more able than I, or if you have some tango skills, you will be able to get even more out of it.I must also add two more important things. I learned more about Buenos Aires in my first ninety minute lesson with Alejandro and Zou Zou than I did in the rest of the nine days I was in town, unless it was what I learned at the two milongas to which they invited me. Utterly amazing. And as if that were not already more than enough, these two are not only great dancers and teachers, they are wonderful human beings. You will be lucky to meet a handful of persons in your entire life who are brilliant, passionate, caring, entertaining, humorous, and just plain good, all at the same time. And here are two of them, in the same amazing facility, willing to share with you what they love. Wow.And it is a very cool place, where they work. Just look at the floor or the ceiling or the French doors, and you will know what I am talking about. On top of all of that, they both speak impeccable English.

Excellent tango classes in gorgeous vintage space. After dancing salon style tango for five years, I wanted an introduction to the more traditional milonguero style of tango. I was fortunate enough to find Alejandro Gee, a serious milonguero with credentials running back to his grandfather, a tango musician. From my very first class, Alejandro and his assistant ZsuZsu provided a warm and supportive environment, as well as loads of tailored exercises and precise corrections to improve balance and connection. I thoroughly enjoyed myself and saw noticeable improvement in my dancing after just two sessions. I would recommend Alejandro to anyone, from absolute beginners to advanced dancers. Romantics will particularly enjoy his dance studio, a gorgeous vintage space with high ceilings, inlaid floors, and antique stained glass. Plus: Convenient location near Microcentro and two major subte lines; perfect English.

Excellent, thoughtful and. Me and my boyfriend lived for a couple of month in Buenos Aires and decided to learn how to dance tango. We were after the traditioal "milongueran" tango that they dance in Milongas today and therefor contacted Alejandro. To begin with we only planned to take a couple of lessons, to get a feel for the dance and the culture, but as Alejandro and his girlfriend were so talented in the teaching we kept on dancing. First just once per week, but as we fell more and more in love with the dance we in the end took lessons as often as we could and went to Milongas maybe 2-3 times per week. If you are interested in seeing the authentic part of Buenos Aires I would strongly recommend anyone who visits Buenos Aires to take at least on lesson with Alejandro! He will teach you the feeling and the basic steps in just the first lesson. After a two to three hours you'll be able to dance in the milongas. It's also the best coulpes therapy you can imagine. We could go there in the middle of a fight, and leave newly in love. Fantastic. Alejandro and his girlfriend Erzebet are really friendly and invited us along to the Milongas they were visiting. The both speak excellent english and love what they do. They are generous with their time and very patient. It doesnät matter how bad you are, they alwaysd make you feel like you do well and help you learn. Our class was supposed to be one hour but as we all had so much fun we often stayed two!We never planned to learn Tango this well but now, thank's to Alejandro, we are now a coulpe of 27-year olds from sweden who's fallen in love with tango and probably we'll keep on dancing for the rest of our lives. For me A MUST when you vistit BsAs even for a week-end!

great teacher and dancer. This was our first try at couples dancing, and it was not easy, but Alejandro and ZsuZsu were appropriately harsh and explained everything very thoroughly until we got it. Challenging but fun experience with great instructors! Alejandro is clearly very experienced in both dancing and teaching. He also gave us some advice on where to go in town to watch experienced dancers in milonga--you can visit El Beso on Riobamba on Tuesday or Sunday.
The tangolessons with Alejandro were great. I just wish I had found him earlier so I could have taken more lessons.

Highly Recommended!. I saw previous reviews on tripadvisor and decided to book a tango lesson with Alejandro. I e-mailed him and he responded very quickly and set up a time. I enjoyed it so much that I ended up having three lessons in total and they were all worthwhile. Alejandro and his assistant really know how to teach.It was really fun and I learnt a huge amount in a short space of time. Alejandro is really patient, encouraging and understanding. Thank you Alejandro - it was the best part of my stay in Buenos Aires.I definitely want to go back to Buenos Aires to learn more about tango.My next challenge is to find a place to continue back home!

Dance the Perfect Ocho. If tango is one of the reasons you visit Buenos Aires, or you become intrigued with the intensity of the dance after visitng a milonga in the late hours under the dim lights, I would highly recommend you to spend some of your precious hours in town with Alejandro. Having booked a class with him after reading the Tripadvisor reviews, we arrived at his airy crimson red studio situated in a colonial-styled building with little expectation. It didn't take us long to realise it was definitely worthwhile to have a personalised class with instructors (Alejandro and his assistant Zouzou) who had a passion in what they were teaching. Apart from teaching basic steps they focused a lot in getting the fundamentals and postures right. My partner and I were either actively learning separately from Alejandro and Zouzou, or learnt to dance as a couple. After a short few classes we have already built up some confidence to move around the studio with our four left feet in the newly aquired steps. We would love to visit his studio again should we return to Buenos Aires in the future.

Amazing Experience with a Great Teacher!. This is the second time my husband and I went to Argentina and Im sad we did not take Alehandro's class the first time. My husband and I both said that this was one of the best vacation experiences we've had. It really is a very romantic experience and we're still practicing our steps. Alejandro is a great teacher and was very flexible when we changed our lesson size from 4 to 2. He and his partner were very professional yet made the class fun. I was surprised at how nervous I was intitally but both of the teachers made the class fun but were still very serious about the lesson. I will go back for sure on our next visit.

Excellent teacher!. We had taken a few group lessons in various venues in BsAs, and only had time for one lesson with Alejandro on our last day of our vacation. We are so glad we did it! Alejandro and his assistant (unfortunately I don't remember her name but she was also excellent) were great. They got us back to the basics of posture, abrazo, and the walk.We will certainly see them again when we return to BsAs!

Perfect introduction to Tango. I stayed in BsAs for 10 days with my girlfriend in february 2012 and we had time for three lessons. Alejandro made tailored lessons to make the most of our three sessions. Together with his lovely assistent Zouzou we received very good instructions in perfect English and together they made our class one of the highlights of our stay. The classroom is in a beatiful building and very centrally located. Alejandro even sent us an e-mail with information about continuing Tangle lessons in The Netherlands, thanks again my friend Highly recomendable for single or multiple lessons!

Only wish I had time for more lessons!. Like many people, I wanted to take a tango lesson in Buenos Aires, but I didn't want to do one of the touristy big group lessons at a hotel or other such venue. I was very lucky to learn about Alejandro Gee. He responded promptly to my email, and we set up a lesson time. He is an excellent instructor -- very patient and great at breaking down the steps and mentality of the tango. He conducted the lesson in Spanish so I could practice my language skills (although he is perfectly fluent in English). I had actually taken a tango lesson before in London and it didn't go very well, but I felt really comfortable with Alejandro, and I learned a ton in only 90 minutes. It was one of the best things I did in Buenos Aires. I only wish I had time for a few more lessons!

Excellent Tango experience in Buenos Aires. We booked three lessons at Alejandro's Tango house, which is perfectly located three blocks from Congreso, to give a specific "Tango experience" to our 4-days stop in Baires. He taught us how to dance tango in a milonga with other real people like us, not in a theatre or in a tango show. This made a great difference. Posture, attitude, presence: the "upper part of the body" comes first, the legs follow naturally. We humbly aknowledged our poor tanguero level (we have been studying Tango only for 4 months) and tried to absorb every hint and suggestion, which were given with great patience. If you are looking for a convenient place to stay, he also offers confortable private rooms in his charming "Tango House" . Recommended.

Excellent!. I found out about Alejandro through a friend of a friend of a friend, who knew I wanted to take a few tango classes during my visit to Buenos Aires. I was a complete beginner, with no exposure to tango dancing or other types of dance before. I took 6 classes and I totally loved it, Alejandro made me feel very comfortable dancing tango, taught me the right posture and quite a few steps, so that now I can do something that starts to resemble actual tango. :) He made sure that I progressed well and learned quickly. Now I have to find a way to continue the classes when I'm back from my travels.

Much more than tango. Alejandro is a very sensitive teacher. I think everybody gets from his lessons what she needs to learn. For me he made tango a meditation. It's not about steps; I learnt to be present and to be grounded. Moving with him was really moving and his private classes are an experience in Buenos Aires worth trying even within a short time. Just send him an e-mail and he will respond in no time to fit you in his agenda.

The bonus: Alejandro Gee, great host and wonderful tango instructor !. What a wonderful experience to spend time at Casa Tango Alejandro Gee. The place is classy, cozy and wonderfully located. Alejandro Gee is the most friendly and welcoming guy , a gifted milonguero and wonderful tango instructor. I loved his teaching. Everyone in the house enjoy the stay as much as the classes which are inspiring, informative and fun!! The best ambiance and the best teacher to explore the most beautiful dance in the world. Cannot wait to come back...
the best teacher in town. he's skilled, elegant, doesn't rush you, he's also trained in psychology so it's more than a tango teacher

Fantastic introduction to Tango. Having never done the tango or any other dance lesson for that matter my girlfirend and i thought we would give it a crack. Alejandro was a great guy, spoke perfect English and made us feel at ease straight away - we learnt some basic steps and fundamentals all in a lovely private setting for a very reasonable price.One of the best things we did - highly recommend it!

Great Tango Lesson. I travelled to Buenos Aires in November 2011, to improve my tango skills. Taking Alejandro's tango lesson was a wonderful experience. Alejandro is not only a very skillful and talented dancer, but is a great instructor as well! He had many helpful suggestions on how to improve my posture and footwork. He taught me tango connection and tango embrace. His teaching manner is very pleasant. He is very friendly, and makes one feel at ease. Now that I am back to Chicago, I try to keep all his instructions in mind... My tango partners do note that I have become lighter, and that my ballance is better. This makes me feel very good :) Thank you, Alejandro. I hope to take more of you lessons and dance with you when I come back to Buenos Aires next time! :)

A highlight of our trip to BA!. We are newbies to tango and truly enjoyed our experience. Alejandro is wonderful and we enjoyed every minute of our lesson. It helped to make our trip to BA authentic and memorable. Highly recommend.

A very memorable experience. We emailed Alejandro on a Friday and he was able to book my boyfriend and I for the very next day for a 1 hour 15 min lesson. His studio was located only a couple blocks away from our hotel in the congressional district. He greeted us and invited us into his dance studio, which was absolutely beautiful! I was a little nervous at first, as I had never attempted Tango before. Alejandro made us feel very comfortable and at ease, just as I had read in other reviews. His teaching was very thorough and we truly learned a lot, all while having a great time. I highly recommend Alejandro to anyone wanting to learn the basics of Tango, it was a very memorable experience!

Best Tango instructor!. Alejandro,Thank you so much for the wonderful Tango lesson. If we weren't so busy running around to see all the sites on our crazy schedule we would definitely have come back for more.Your lesson was exactly what we were hoping for in your beautiful salon. Thanks also for the great recommendation for the restaurant and milonga. My daughters certainly enjoyed photographing the lesson and had many giggles in the process.Thanks again!Betty Seldin

Excellent instruction - very patient and helpful instructor. My husband and I took some classes during our honeymoon in Argentina, and loved our tango lessons. It's not an easy dance by any means but with the patient coaching from Alejandro, we were able to replicate something that faintly resembled a tango by the end! Thanks for all your help and for even bringing another coach with you to help us learn faster. The room where the tango lessons were held was charming with pattered wooden floors and a wonderful experience all around. Thanks so much!

A WONDERFUL AND SKILLED TEACHER. 'A WONDERFUL AND SKILLED TEACHER'I met Alejandro Gee for the first time in Vancouver in 2010 when he was giving a tango workshop with Vilma Martinez. I took a 2 hour private lesson from him afterward. He's a wonderful and skilled teacher and a great dancer. I was a beginner and was experiencing a lot of challenges and yet he always made me feel like I could dance. And I told myself he must be a great lead to have made me feel that way. He's very patient, very clear and straightforward in his instructions and fluent in English. He never made you feel intimidated when you were not doing things right. What I appreciate the most is that he always made you feel relaxed, eager to learn and enjoy the dance even when you are not good at it. He picked up on my weaknesses after one dance and helped me improve them. He focused a lot on the connection and the embrace which is fundamental in tango. I would highly recommend Alejandro to anyone who is interested to learn and to enjoy dancing tango. Go to Buenos Aires, check out his studio at Tango Angelitos and try some of his classes. It will make your trip to Buenos Aires a memorable one!Alice AuyeungVancouver, Canada--

A gracious and talented teacher. Alejandro Gee imparts his love of dance and Buenos Aires with thoughtful and seemingly effortless style. He is a skilled and observant teacher, whose classes strike the right balance of challenging, encouraging and fun. After a few private classes with Alejandro, I better understand the beauty and essence of tango and am eager to learn more.

He is the real one!. What can I tell about Alejandro? well...it is not necessarily to speck English or Spanish to take his classes.....his body language is the perfect way to lean from him...just watch him...just listen to his movements when you dance with him. He teaches how to emphasize learning in our bodies rather than intellectually. This is because tango is about feeling and sensitivity, otherwise you are just doing gymnastics.I am just planning to visit his milonga in Buenos Aries, but I already put excellent mark. Knowing him I am sure that you will have no regrets.So, go to Buenos Aries,..take classes with him…dance with him….Hi is The Real One!

An amazing experience. We’ve taken many dance classes over the years but we’ve never enjoyed a dance class more than with Alejandro. He makes you feel welcome and relaxed in his wonderful studio space and is able to really convey the essence and spirit of the tango. He speaks English very well and his enthusiasm for the tango is infectious. After just 2 lessons, we felt we had a much better understanding of the dance and the entire experience seemed so authentically Argentinian that we know we’ll never forget it. A definite highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires.Gary & Christine

Fantastic Tango Instruction!. I took Tango lessons from Alejandro Gee during May of 2011. He is extremely knowledgeable about tango - music, history, and dancing. He explained the steps and process in a very understandable way. I am a beginner and he made it a lot of fun and made me feel comfortable learning. Much has been said about the complexities of tango, but his teaching was straightforward and learnable. He's also an amazing dancer and fun to watch. I'm sure he excels at teach more advanced students as well. His english is excellent and he is a fun guy to learn from. He also has a great laugh and sense of humor. I highly recommend him and his studio for Tango. Look him up and have some fun! Si, Si!

You will find it in the Dictionary of Elegance under the word welcome.. When speaking about a particular locale in a city that some 15 million people call home there is perhaps no greater compliment than to say that Alejandro Gee has created an establishment in which you will feel as protected as you are loved – which is doubtlessly the reason why he is such a fine dancer and teacher.

Ale made us feel comfortable instantly and we learned more because of that. This is a great setting for learning Tango, a historic building in B.A. with a large dance floor and balconies overlooking the street. Alejandro is a great teacher and is fluent in English. He is flexible with times and very knowledgeable about the local Tango scene as he grew up in the neighborhood.

Alejandro Gee is the ultimate milongero tango teacher. I had the pleasure of taking several private tango lessons with Alejandro Gee. What a difference it made to my dancing! After only a couple of privates, I was at a new level.Alejandro does not just teach the basics- he teaches the elements that makes tango magical: the connection, the embrace, musicality. After the lessons I heard rhythms and beats in the music I hadn't heard before. Alejandro specializes in the traditional "milongero" style tango and his lead felt authentic, sincere and gave me the confidence to focus on my role as follower. All leaders could benefit by taking lessons with Alejandro! I appreciated that Alejandro could quickly identify what I needed to improve my dancing and he patiently gave me opportunities to keep working on implementing his corrections into the dance in a way that was challenging and satisfying. It didn't take long before I felt confident dancing close embrace at the most established milongas.I would recommend scheduling as many privates as possible with Alejandro if you are in Buenos Aires for a short stay. I hope to take more classes soon. Gracias maestro Alejandro!

Outstanding wine tour with David!. My boyfriend and I came to Argentina for two shows of Guns N Roses. We have limited time while in Buenos Aires so we wanted a great, fun tour to experience the food, wine and culture. Wow we are glad we found David! David is extremely knowledgeable of everything Argentina and he brought us to wonderful local places on the San Telmo tour that we probably never would have tried had he not brought us. We loved it so much we want to head to their Palermo tour on Friday with another couple before we go to the GnR concert! Thank you, Parilla Tours :) See you Friday!
Food tour. Such a wonderful tour!! Food was amazing as well as the company! Rosanna was so sweet and knowledgeable. She made the night! Can't wait to come back!
Amazing/delicious tour! . Our tour guide, German, was amazing! He took us to the greatest places in the Palermo area of Buenos Aires! It's a must do for anyone who enjoys good food and good company!

Great Way to Taste and See Buenos Aires. My husband and I had spent a few days in Buenos Aires before our tour and we're having a tough time finding all the local hidden spots. BA is a huge city and finding the hidden treasures isn't easy! So we were really excited about our food tour - and it didn't disappoint...in fact it's been a major highlight on our trip! We met German (if you have him as your guide, you'll have great company and wonderful conversations) at a local neighborhood bar where we started our tour in San Telmo. The place was unassuming, full of personality and carefully looked over by an elderly women who made sure we were taken care of....our kind of place! The tour continued on to several other places where we tried local dishes from the area and learned a lot about the history in a fun and interactive way. All the restaurants we visited are the best in Buenos Aires and it's been very difficult to find others that even match the style and food we tasted on the tour! The tour was insightful, interesting and full of incredibly delicious and authentic Puerto Rican food! Thank you German for showing us a wonderful time and teaching us about your home.Highly recommend!

Great BA Food Tour in Historical District. This was day 1 of our 6 days in Buenos Aires and what an amazing way to start. We chose the San Telmo tour so we might experience the historic district and try some BA food. Was about a $10 uber ride and 25 mins from our Palermo apartment. We were joined by 1 other couple which made the tour social but still intimate. Tour includes 2 initial stops to enjoy some classic BA appetizers as well as walk through the market. 3rd stop is main course of what else - beef. Being from Alberta Canada we pride ourselves in our beef and I must admit it was pretty good. We finished with some amazing ice cream. Along the way we had some small walks in between stops to take in the historic buildings. And our guide German was amazing! He was knowledgable and of great assistance. Would be nice to have his expertise for our next 5 days in BA. But we got the next best things - some great suggestions. Thanks Parrilla Tour!

Great, but fast-paced food tour of Buenos Aires. We thoroughly enjoyed this tour. We were a small group, of 4 guests total. The food was amazing, and German and his assistant did a great job of explaining everything. One downside was that the tour was a little too fast - for instance, we'd have liked to have spent more time in the San Telmo flee market. Otherwise, all the food stops offered delicious food and commentary, culminating in a complete steak lunch at the last parilla. I'd definitely take more tours with this company, should we ever return to BA.

Great food experience. Our family thoroughly enjoyed our local eating experience yesterday with our charming knowledgable guide German.We would recommend this tour to anyone interested in tasting local food and wine- indeed today we have purchased a bottle of the wine we enjoyed yesterday and ,for lunch, ordered empanadas.We strolled around the district and visited 4 different restaurants- all with a different flavour

Great food, great company, great guide. We headed for Palermo straight from the plane this morning so we were both feeling rather sleepy and irritable (possibly a sleep would have been a good idea). At one point as we rushed round trying to find a cash point I thought, why bother...Well, I'm glad we did bother and this is why:1. German, the guide, was brilliant. Very engaging, very knowledgable and very friendly. And his English was perfect.2. The food. Just thinking of it is making me salivate. We had 4 stops all as good as each other and the steak was to die for (and I'm from Spain so I am fussy when it comes to steak). It was also the right amount of food. Enough that I won't need dinner but not enough to be too much.3. The experience. The tour took me into local restaurants I would never have visited otherwise, it's taught me about the culture and has given me a great starting point for the rest of my holiday.4. The people. I suppose you can never guarantee what the other guests are going to be like, but on this occasion they added to the experience. Would I recommend it: yes. Would I do one of their other tours: yes.Thank you German for a lovely day.

Delicious, fun, informative. I did the San Telmo tour, which was great! It was just myself, one other traveler, and David our guide. I really enjoyed each stop- my favourite thing to eat was the provoleta! Great way to spend an afternoon! I told David I hadn't tried mate yet, and he made sure that I had tried it by the end of the tour which was a really nice touch. Thanks!

A great intro to Argentinean dining. Germán was an excellent host. The tour provided a really simple, yet interesting (and tasty!) overview of the most popular parts of Argentinean parrilla. A great group of people and a really enjoyable afternoon.

Local Parilla experience. We were keen to experience the Argentinian Parilla scene and this was the perfect way! Our enthusiastic and affable guide, German, for the 3 hour tour was excellent and talked us through the history as we tried out the Argentinian food & wine in an authentic locality of Palermo.It was a great introduction for us to the Parilla culture - and for a moment or two - we were locals! Thank you - we loved it.

Delicious and fun. We booked this tour some time ago and had completely forgotten about it after a really busy day sightseeing. We nearly didn't go because we were so tired, but thank goodness we did because we had a simply wonderful evening. The food and wine were delicious. We were fortunate that our tour guide was one of the people who set up the company. He was very enthusiastic and full of information and made sure that everyone in our group had a good time. And it was a treat to be able to buy some of his grandmother's special recipe sauce. Needless to say, this is a very highly recommended tour.

Excellent introduction to Buenos Aires. We had an excellent 3 hours tour with German through Palermo trying out some of the Argentinian classics with a nice bit of history for each.For anyone new to the city/country, this is a must for learning more about the culture.We started in a Parilla (name for a steak house) where we tried chori pan- the Argentinian hotdog, with sauces like chimi churri. This was goooooood!Next stops included parillas for empanadas with famous Torrontes sweet white wine and of course steak (bife de chorizo) with Malbec. We finished at a heladeria for ice cream- they have he best ice cream in the world outside of Italy here.Come hungry- best advice to give!!Or guide was German, a local, who is really passionate about his country and culture, and a really informative, charismatic guide.Highly recommend as a way to get a real flavour of Argentina.

Fantastic way to experience Argentine cuisine and culture!. Yesterday I had the pleasure of enjoying some excellent Argentine food in the lovely neighbourhood of Palermo. A four course dining experience which consisted of incredible staples in Argentine cuisine "Choripan, Empanades, Grilled cuts of steak with sides and some delicious Ice cream for dessert. Each course is had in a different restaurant all within a matter of minutes walking distance from each other. A great way to try the different food and see some of the area. At the start of each restaurant our lovely and knowledgable guide Nina would tell us all about the dish we were about to enjoy along with some some additional info on the food culture and some history of the area and the greater Argentina. Everyone in the group felt welcomed from the very beginning and we were all quick to having a great time which had nothing to do with the famous Argentine wine I'm sure ;)Highly recommend this tour to anyone looking to take in some of the culture and enjoy some great food while in Buenos Aires.

Fun and informative. I will not reiterate what others have said. I will just say that you should book this tour early in your trip, as the insights you gain will be very helpful for the rest of your stay.

Parrilla Tour Buenos Aires. The highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. It was a wonderful way to see a part of the city and still have a wonderful meal visiting various local restaurants. German was an EXCELLENT guide who shared so much more about Argentina besides the food culture. How I would love to import the baked empanades!! And one of our friend's needed gluten free food and German ensured she would still be able to eat. Will recommend this food tour from now on!!!

Great experience!. If I could only choose word to describe my experience with Parrilla Tour Buenos Aires it would be "Fabulous! ." This word would be chosen because the food were delicious including the dessert I like the fact that there were four stops. We went to four different restaurants. German was great. He the food and the culture. He is very knowledgeable and friendly. I felt like I was out with a friend. Thank you, German!Sussi

Great Parrilla tour with German. I did this tour with my wife and our friend and we were very happy with it so I gave the 5-star rating. I'm not a foodie or even someone who has ever done a food tour before, but this one was a lot of fun and very tasty. This tour included the best steak I had in Argentina which is saying something because we were eating steak every day.German Landa was our tour guide and he was warm, informative, and very friendly. He also gave us enriching insights about Argentinians in general and the Palermo neighborhood in particular. Even if you don't do this tour I would recommend seeing Palermo and visiting a lot of restaurants. However, I would highly recommend this tour, and come with an empty stomach!

Cool way to spend an evening. The Parilla tour is a little expensive, but overall I think it is worth it. We got to try out eateries we never would have otherwise gone to, and had a huge meal at the parilla at the end. German was knowledgable and friendly, and gave us lots of tips and history about the food. They email you afterwards with a list of other restaurant recommendations, several of which we have been to and can testify for! Great way to get an introduction to Argentinian cuisine.
Great tour. Our tour with German Landa was fantastic. Small group, great knowledge of the city and of course fantastic food. Thanks

Great fast tour of San Telmo worth the price!. The Parilla Tour was a great way to learn about San Telmo and the cuisine of Buenos Aires! We did the tour within the first two days of our 5 day stay and the experience colored the rest of our eating around town. You get a lot of bang for your buck on this tour as well, compared to others we went on. German was a wonderful tour guide who was willing to help us even beyond the tours end!

Brilliant food / walking tour!. We had a great day out with Santiago on this tour! The food was excellent (tip - don't plan on having dinner after the lunch tour!) as was the wine we tried. As for the final ice cream stop ..... still drooling over that!! Santiago had great knowledge and pointed out lots of interesting facts in the area. It was a great introduction to the Palermo area as we only had a few days in the city. Highly recommended!

An Intimate and Rewarding Dining Experience In Buenos Aires. While in Buenos Aires for a short business trip this past weekend, I signed up for the Parrilla Tour as a last minute lark. How fortuitous because it was hands down one of the best tours of its type I’ve experienced in my many years of travels. Our beautiful, knowledgeable, and utterly charming tour guide, Nina, led our small intimate international group through the Palermo neighborhood from local haunt to local haunt tasting empanadas, choripan, and grilled steak and veggies, as we all sipped local wines and just had a tremendous meaningful afternoon together. The torrential downpour outside could and would have put a serious damper on a lessor tour, yet for our group it actually added to the fun and positive dynamic. What an authentic all-around treat!

PARRILLA TOUR BA. We had a wonderful tour, great food, great people, great tour guide!Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting B.A.Great way to learn and taste some of the culture, and see some sights at the same time.

An inside look at Argentina's cuisine and culture. I always love taking food tours when visiting a new place, as I feel it really gives you an inside look at the local culture. Parrilla tour did a great job of bringing us to the hidden culinary gems in San Telmo. I had been to the area just the day before and walked right by all of the places we visited without a second thought. We got to sample many traditional "Parrilla" dishes and everything was delicious! David was an awesome tour guide and I'd highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Great tour, loved the steak!. My sister and I booked this tour last minute. We only had two days in Buenos Aires and really wanted to taste great steak. We chose this company based on the great reviews although I did read loads of reviews from other companies before making a decision I felt this company would be a good choice. It was!One thing that always swings a food tour for me is the person or people who own or run the company. I've actually found that tours being operated by people who are not necessarily native and/or who have spent time outside of their own country are of a far higher standard and have better organisation and reliability. Communication even at such a late hour was super and booking was easy. We found the meeting point without any issue and David was already there to welcome us.We went on the San Telmo tour as it fitted ours and their schedule. The food and tour is as described. We loved the little empanada place plus my sister said the steak in the last place for the meal was the best she'd ever eaten and I'd agree it was lovely and plentiful. We are not big drinkers but there was wine and beer if you wanted it.We didn't eat again that day. Thanks for a lovely tour!

Flavours tour in Palermo Las Canitas. Yesterday I went on the Flavours tour in Palermo. David (owner) was informative, friendly and extremely knowledgable about both food and wine. There was plenty of opportunities to ask questions about the food we were tasting and generally about BA and Argentina .The food and wine we tasted was amazing and freshly prepared. David also emailed a list of restaurants recommendations and explanations about the cuts of meat. I recommend going on this tour early on in your travels, so you have the opportunity to visit some of the local restaurants.

Mouthwatering...... Fantastic food, a wonderful stroll through parts of the city we hadn't explored, and interesting conversation. We were here in winter so Santiago was able to pace our tour based on only on my husband, me, and a delightful Aussie. We felt truly pampered. The only hope I have is that they will expand the tour to include a cooking demonstration at one of the places we stop....

A relaxed and plesant afternoon. Great tour, I really enjoyed hearing about the history of the restaurants and the tradition of the Parrilla. The food and wine was wonderful, greatly enjoyed the fact that we had a small group and that Santiago was such an engaging guide - highly recommended

A great experience and fantastic food!. Thanks to David for showing us around Palermo and taking us to some fantastic restaurants and cafes that we DEFINITELY would not have tried otherwise.David is a wealth of knowledge on Buenos Aires and was more than happy to answer all of our many questions. It was a huge help for us to do this on our 3rd day in BA - however I just wish that we did it on our first or second day so we could have been up to speed on everything straight away.Highly recommended, especially on your first of second day in BA!

Great afternoon of eating, drinking and chatting Argentina culture. This was a great tour, I would probably recommend for people over 26. We went to 3 different restaurants, tried many different local foods, drunk red wine and champagne and finished with ice cream. Our guide German was super enthusiastic, funny, had lots to talk about and was happy to answer any questions. A must do in BA for sure.

Great foodie experience. Went on this tour on Monday and loved it. David took us to places I would normally have walked past. The food we tried was amazing.....especially the lomo we tried in the steak house he took us to, one of the best I've ever tried. Highly recommend this tour as a great insight to Argentinian food.

Steak experience 2.0: eat like a local!. Of course steak is a must when planning your trip to Argentina. There are plenty of steakhouses all around, some good, some not so good. But Parrilla Tour was an entire different experience. Live like a local and go to off the beaten path cantines for amazing steak and good wine. Even being a local I was surprised by the cool and authentic places we visited and the good quality of the food. Thank you, David! Totally recommend it! Salud!

5 Reasons You Should Go On This Tour.... 1. Price - As a budget-y traveler, I initially hesitated at the $79 price tag on this tour. Well worth it! My friend and I are pretty much on a $58 mas o menos budget per day and we blew it to do this tour. And there are no regrets! (Unlike some of the other times...) Can you go around and try this type of food on your own? Sure. But you won't get this experience. And the experience is worth your money. The conversation, people, information, extra effort from the company, delicious food, etc. is just the beginning. We were fortunate to have gone in "off-season" and got to do our tour with the owner, David. He was able to tell us about his small company and the other guides who do the tour. He puts in the time and thoroughness to make this small business successful and enjoyable for clients. Corners are NOT cut to give a "tourist" experience. 2. Food - I highly doubt we would have considered walking into some of these places on our own! A complete hole-in-the-wall parilla joint with the locals on their lunch break, the huge grill next to your table, the butcher cutting the meat, etc. I've had many a choripan during my time living in Ecuador, but never one like this. Even the wines were our favorites (even after two days of wine tasting in Mendoza! - not surprising because David used to be in the wine export industry.) The portions were not small and your glass of wine kept getting refilled. And finally the ice cream - yum!3. Location - You are not going to the "lonely planet top choice" spots. David has lived in Buenos Aires since he was 15 years old and spent a lot of time choosing the spots on the tour and building personal relationships with the owners. I would also consider choosing a location to see a new neighborhood - we are staying in San Telmo and went to the Palermo tour. You can ask him for recommendations for your neighborhood and try those later :)4. Information - I am not someone who goes on a food tour to learn about how they make the food. I go to eat good food. But you can't underestimate the extra information that David shared and that we learned. While we walked, ate and talked these were just SOME of the things discussed: the wine industry in Mendoza and Argentina in general, the political climate of the country (from our questions) about the current presidential regime and the past, the climate of the country regarding current political protests (a constant in Buenos Aires) and the economy, the food industry and specialties, the history of the buildings and neighborhood that we were eating in, the cultural traditions built around food like on Sundays and the 29th of each month, etc. The list goes on. And that was just ON the tour. There was an email before the tour with an attachment with recommended restaurants in every sector of the city and a guide to ordering meat (what are the different cuts, etc.) And even more - he sent us a follow-up email after the tour with information we had been asking about. We are leaving on a ferry to Uruguay tomorrow and he sent us a link to blog posts about the different company options. He even remembered that we were going to the Evita Museum after the tour! The simple touches that make a memorable experience and caring company.5. Chimichurri - There is an option to get a jar of their homemade Chimichurri recipe for $5. Do it! It is amazing.Book in advance and don't miss it. For backpackers that stray from these types of activities, consider it. Great company, people, food, and experience - what more can you want traveling?

Eat like a Local for a Day!. It was our last day in Buenos Aires before heading further south to Bariloche and El Calafete. Having absolutely loved the first gastronomy tour we did in Lima, we had booked the Parilla Tour weeks in advance. We met on Tuesday July 2nd at Las Canitas at a Parilla at 12pm and lucky for us our host was David, one of the owners. We were joined by 2 Argentinians travel agents experiencing the tour for one of their clients, a Welsh guy and his friend - a total group of 6. After shortly being seated, the we were served Choripan and chimmichurri sauce. David gave us a history of the area which we were in, Palermo, and a brief overview of what our itinerary was. It was a walking tour with 4 stops in total where we get to experience restaurants which you would typically wouldn't visit.Next stop was Empanadas and White Wine. David explained that the Empanada is a typical Argentinian snack that differs from its Mexican and Spanish versions since they're baked instead of fried. Also that you'll find different regions of Argentina fill their empanadas different e.g. In the South they're often filled with Lamb instead of beef. We also tasted a "white" wine from Argentina. Although Argentina is typically renowned for their Malbecs and reds, we tried Torrentes which David explained Argentina was known lesser for however still popular amongst Argentine wine. Our third stop and I guess main stop was a Parilla - A tradition that cannot be missed. We were seated infront of the kitchen where David explained what a Parilla is - in terms of the open coal fired grill and how typical Argentinians cook their meats and prepare their grill. We learnt that Argentinians typically like their meat more on the "done" side and chatted over some tenderloin, side of grilled vegetables and grilled proveleta served with the staple chimmichurri and salsa. The tour ended at 2:30pm with "Helado" - Argentina's Gelato at Veikko which was another about a 5 minute walk. We were each given 2 scoops each and the ice cream although delicious was similar to a typical Italian gelato store. You were able to sample all the different flavors which was great. The tour ended with David giving us a list of recommendations of restaurants and bars in Buenos Aires as well as a short Spanish translation of meats and key menu items which was helpful given my friend and I spoke zero Spanish. I would recommend this tour to anyone short on time in Buenos Aires, first timers in Argentina and also for those who don't speak Spanish. It was a fairly quick food tour that hit all the typical Argentinian Staple "must try" items but I also feel like unless you tried really hard to avoid it, you would probably encounter all items featured in the tour at some point in your trip in Buenos Aires. The tour was well put together and a good way to eat like a local for a day and experience Buenos Aires like a local.

Interesting and unique food and culture activity. Really enjoyed the experience especially the first bar/restaurant where we were introduced to authentic Choripan, and the main course at an amazing Parilla restaurant. Would have liked it to be a little longer at these two places and to skip the empanadas because there is just too much to eat. It was also a great opportunity to talk about Argentina with Nina and to meet other travellers. Would definitely recommend this activity.

Great way to get to know Buenos Aires!. This was the first thing we did in Buenos Aires and even though the weather was cloudy and drizzling a bit, this was a great way to get to know Palermo and the culture of Buenos Aires. Santiago (co-founder) was our guide and he was incredibly welcoming, engaging, and knowledgeable. We ate and learned about everything from choripan and chimichurri, to empanadas and why the Argentines like their water with gas. And of course the meat was awesome. We dined at a cool parrilla (La Colorada) in Palermo, learned about the different cuts of meat and drank wine from the traditional penguino (of which we now have 4). I definitely felt that even though it was a tourist thing to do, we were going to places mosts tourists would pass right by. Santiago even gave us a list of recommendations for restaurants and bars for the rest of our stay in Buenos Aires (and even in Mendoza, which we headed to later). Worth the cost, a definite must if this is your first time in Buenos Aires.

Delicious way to spend a dreary afternoon!. David's Parilla Tour was an excellent way to spend a dreary winter afternoon in Buenos Aires. With only 3 people on the tour, we were able to have a great conversation about Argentina - football, politics, history, and of course food! David is so knowledgeable and flexible. It's a great way to see the San Telmo area. The stops aren't so far apart, so less time walking and more time eating! I highly recommend the tour for friends and family!

Like Having a Friend in Buenos Aires. This was one of our favorite activities while visiting Buenos Aires. Not only was the food excellent and that we were not in touristy restaurants, but it was great to have the chance to talk to someone over great food and wine about the city. We could not recommend this excursion more!

Delicious! . My husband and I just returned from Buenos Aires and had a wonderful experience. We were only there for several days and wanted to eat great food! In BA there are so many restaurant choices which makes it difficult to choose from. We really enjoyed the restaurants selected by Parilla Tour. David was a great guide and was knowledgeable about the local culture and cuisine. The process of booking the tour was a breeze and we were kept well informed of the tour updates. We also agree that doing the tour earlier on in your visit is best because you can get recommendations for other activities and restaurants. Thanks for a great time!

Fun Way to Experience Argentine Food. My niece and I went on both the San Telmo and the Palermo Parrilla Tours and had a great time. You will not be hungry. We visited places where the locals ate. The food was delicious. It was a great way for us to spend our lunches in Buenos Aires. We tasted empanadas, choripan and steak along with having wine at lunch. We were stuffed, but still found room for the yummy ice cream -- great unique flavors. Both Santiago and David were fun and informative about the culture.

Perfect intro to Argentinian Cuisine. I did the Palermo tour and it was awesome! The food was delicious and David was a great tour guide. I would suggest booking this tour in your first days in Buenos Aires so you are introduced to everything you should be eating while you're here! Really happy I did this.

Great introduction to Argentinean cuisine!. I took the tour in Las Cañitas with Santiago through LocalAventura. It was like Argentinean cuisine 101, starting with Choripan and beer, moving on to Salteña empanadas with Torrontes wine for the next starter, steak, grilled provoleta and Malbec for the main course and ending with Helado for dessert. All places were within walking distance and it was quite enjoyable to walk from one place to the other for each course. It was a great way of meeting other travelers too. Santiago is very well informed about the food as well as the neighborhood, and he is very engaging and pleasant. It was a great experience overall.If you're looking to experience the cuisine in one evening, this is the way to go!

Best intro to Argentina we could have asked for. Loved our tour with German of Parrilla Tours. The tour was insightful, well organized, delicious, generous and a wonderful way to better understand Argentina, not just the cuisine, but the culture and traditions. So many times tours are tiring and filled with so many dates and statistics that it all runs together, but this tour was relaxing and a perfect afternoon of dining our way through the city.

Super insight to food and wine in Argentina. We were a little spoilt from the start with having David the owner of the Parilla Tour being our guide for the afternoon for one, and the fact that he put on a tour just for us to accommodate that we couldn't make any of the other days! Fantastic service.Loved our Argentinian version of the humble hotdog - choripan. So much flavour. We all decided NZ needed to adopt the same version. Trendy little empanada restaurant was next on our stop (or not so little as we found out they do over 3000 takeaway empanadas a day) matched with the delicious Argentinian Torrontes wine - yummo. The parilla itself was tender and tasty along with the grilled provolone cheese and served in a restaurant converted from stables. And our final stop at the heladeria was delicious, the ice cream melted into what little gaps we still had left in our tummies. David was easy to talk to and we found out all sorts about life in Argentina as well as food and wine. Great afternoon out. Would definitely recommend a tour with these guys!

Parrilla tour San Telmo. Great start to our time in Buenos Aires. Not only did we learn about the local food and wine but also lots of bits and pieces about Argentina generally , the way of life etc. David was a mine of information and a pleasure to spend time with. Would recommend his tour to anyone coming to this great city.

Fun wander about BA. We had a really good group (of 12), which made the experience even better. Food was good to great and everything was well-conceived. Time allotted was just right, price for what you get (especially if you are a wine drinker) is reasonable and Nina - our guide - kept things interesting. Not the usual touristy fare and probably brought me to places I would never have found on my own.

San Telmo Food Tour was GREAT!. David was a great tour guide. We decided to do the tour before hopping on our plane home, so that we would be in a little food coma and could sleep well on the plane. We were the only ones on the tour (it's off season right now)- only bummer there was that we were looking forward to meeting other people. David did ask beforehand if we would rather do the next day where we would be able to meet people, but unfortunately we were flying out. The tour was really great though. The empanada place that we went to was AMAZING. Seriously, the best empanada that I have ever had! And all the other food was also great. I actually liked the steak at the parillo on this tour as much, if not more, than Don Julio's (which we went to the night before, based on a many recommendations). The ice cream shop at the end was so authentic and delicious. Overall I definitely recommend this tour to anyone that is looking to get some good food from local restaurants. It's not a city tour, but David did make some recommendations for where to visit after our tour. He also sent us a great guide to restaurants around the city that I will use next time I come down!
Amazing food, tour and guide. We had such a great time on this tour! The food was incredible and our guide was very personable and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this tour!

A must-do in BA!. I did the tour in Palermo and it was a lot of fun. It's a great way to meet other travelers and experience food in places you normally wouldn't go to. The food was amazing and is a must-do, especially if you're a foodie like me!

Great tour in San telmo. My boyfriend and I had a great day attending the food walking tour in San Telmo. It was interesting to walk around the neighborhood and try local foods and very local restaurants. Would recommend to anyone who loves food and wants a unique way to explore anew interesting neighborhood.

Good Way to See the City. My husband and I did the San Telmo tour. It was a great way to see a part of the city and experience different food. The highlight of the tour was the the first stop which was a local spot that we would have never stopped in on our own. Our guide, German was knowledgeable and friendly and answered all of our questions.
