Since we were leaving BA the next day German was kind enough to send us a list of restaurant recommendations right after the tour so we could try and take advantage of some of the places. The one thing we were not expecting was sitting down for a full meal at one of the stops so go hungry!

Friendly and informative. Great local eating experience. Nina was a great guide with heaps of tips, not only for dining but experiencing Buenos Aires in general. The best tip I could give is to do this tour early in your BA visit to help with your food choices for the rest of your trip. Highly recommended.

Enjoyable, great food and an insight to BA !. Our guide Hermann was wonderful, full of information, and a great host. We met two other couples which was fun discussing plans and tours taken in BA. The food was yummy, wine tastings with two of the courses and more food than we could possibly eat at the bbq stop. It was nice walking through Palermo chatting and eating. We had visited BA previously so chose this tour as an alternative and would highly recommend it.

Great food tour. We went on this tour with Dave our first night in Buenos Aires and it was a wonderful start to our trip. He gave us a great overview of classic foods and gave us a good franework for what to look for the rest of our trip. I highly recommend the tour.

A great experience!. I did the parilla tour in San Telmo and found it to be a very enjoyable experience. It was a great combination--a choripan, a visit to the San Telmo market, a parilla meal with wine, and and gelato at a final location. The guide was great, the tour was easily paced, and I highly recommend it.

Best way to get to know BA. My family just got back from a 2 week trip to Argentina. We read about the Parrilla Tour in the NY Times as one of most innovative tours of 2016, and it definitely lived up to the expectations. The guide German was excellent. Professional but not overly formal or scripted. The food was all homemade, traditional and great. The empanadas were a highlight, as were the steaks at the main stop. All the restaurants were 100% locals outside of our group adding to the experience. Overall we thought it was a good way to be shown the city and better understand it. We got tons of tips and advice used during out visit.

Good way to start stay in Buenos Aires. We chose to book our Parrillas Tour the day we arrived in Buenos Aires and thought it was an excellent start and introduction to the city. We sampled a wide selection of traditional foods, all delicious and generous portions, and the guide made us feel welcome and was eager to explain local cuisine and culture. We used the restaurant guide he emailed us after the tour throughout our stay and it did not disappoint.

Wonderful Time!. Nina was the best, and I had a wonderful time exploring BA and all of the wonderful food! We started with a traditional sandwich, then on to the empanada, steak and ice cream. A wonderful time!

Parilla Does It Right. Decided to pick a food tour for our last day in Buenos Aires...so glad we chose Parilla. The tour was in a very non-touristy neighborhood of lovely Palermo. We were welcomed by the charming Nina and immediately felt at ease. She was a delight...answered any and all questions, very knowledgeable about food, culture, and history, warm, fun personality. The food was all marvelous, especially the steak. I seriously doubt you will ever taste a perfectly grilled steak like that anywhere else. We highly recommend this excellent experience. Small groups, terrific guide, very personal. It was definitely one of the highlights of our visit to Buenos Aires.

Ate our way through San Telmo. We arrived in Buenos Aires around 10:30 am and hit the ground running by doing this tour. Nina was an upbeat guide who started us off with "appetizers" of a sausage sandwich and an empanada. The sausage was incredibly flavorful!! The empanada was just ok. Then we went to a nice parrilla where we had a full course meal (I was already kinda full from the "appetizers." At Gran Parrilla del Plata, we had a grilled cheese course (super tasty), salad, and various cuts of meat with various sauces. Of course, the meal came with wine. I ate more than I intended because it was all so tasty! Our last stop was for ice cream which was average. It was A LOT of food, so go hungry. Overall, it was a great way to start our trip...but I wish we got to hear more about the history of San Telmo. We spent more time chatting with the other guests and getting tips from them on where to go and what to do. Still worth doing.

Enjoyable Afternoon. We went on the San Telmo Parrilla tour just hours after stepping off our flight to Buenos Aires. Nina was a wonderful guide and the tour was my favorite thing I did in the city. The food is delicious and plentiful and Nina did a great job explaining everything and just being a great host. I found it to be a great introduction to a new city.

Great four tour in Palermo!. We have a group of 4 women who went on the Palermo food tour with Nina today. It was fantastic! She was delightful. Super cute and so helpful and knowledgeable. We first had choripan (chorizo with bread) -- sounds simple, but it was amazing. Then a delicious empanada with Torrontes white wine. Then two kinds of steak with grilled vegetables and Malbec. Water available at all 3 places. We finished at a fourth place for ice cream. Tour lasted about 2 1/2 hours, and we walked several blocks but not too far. It was really well done. Lots of food but spread out enough that you didn't feel completely stuffed when it was over. Later in the day, Nina emailed us some recommendations for restaurants. A delightful tour, good value, wonderful guide -- highly recommended!

A great introduction to Argentine parrilla. I have to admit German is an excellent tour guide. he explains everything in detail and enjoys his profession. I have enjoyed this tour a great deal that is why I have recommended it to friends and backpackers from all over the world. Thanks a lot.

A great way to start a visit in BA....... The tour is easy on the feet and not a rushed endeavor what so ever. You learn a great deal about the food culture in Argentina and the 'why' behind it. My tour guide (German) was super. He answered questions with knowledgeable responses and made the tour informative but more over fun. Bring an appetite and a camera if you care to take pictures but the camera is by all means not essential. Simply summarized, I would as the title states, the tour is great way to kick off a visit BA.
Fantastic parrilla tour. German was a wonderful and enthusiastic tour guide..making sure we enjoyed the food as much as we learned about the neighborhood of San Telmo. Highly recommend!

Great walking food tour!. German was an excellent guide and we had a great group as we visited four local restaurants for four courses. First with choripan (chorizo sausage on fresh bread). Second stop was beef empanadas with vino Blanco. Third up, we enjoyed steak, grilled vegetables and grilled queso. Our final stop was gelato for dessert.
Great lunch experience. Sampled local food at four different locations with great guides. Excellent food and wine. Very enjoyable. Annie
Great tour!. Nice tour, good food and wine and great guide. Many explanations by the guides and nice street to walk by.

San Telmo Lunch. Nina was great. She had a birthday cake for me!! Empanadas were wonderful as well as the steak for lunch. Nice small group of people and easy walking. The chorizo and sausage was great. I would add one more stop for appetizer with a local beer and empanada versus walking through the market eating the empanada. Great day in the BA.

Wonderful experience of 4 courses at 4 different places for a lunch. First time in Buenos Aires, curious about local food. Parrilla Tour brought us to Palermo area, 4 different courses at 4 different restaurants for lunch, comfortable walking within few blocks. Tasted empanadas, choripan, steaks, wine and ice cream. David & Louisa gave us very good explanation about local food, drinks and area, which well covered all our questions in minds. Strongly recommendable to visitors to appreciate local cuisine and lifestyle.

Stuffed!. We took the San Telmo tour, which wasn't what we wanted at first, but so pleased this was booked instead. Our host was German, who was super nice, very informative and allowed answered our many questions. It was a great chance to meet other travelers as well. We started in a local restaurant with choripan, (chorizo in fresh bread with some french fries), then walked through the flea / food market with an empanada, then onto Gran Parilla Del Plata, which started life as a Butchers, so has a fantastic charm to it and just when you could eat anymore a short walk to Nonna Bianco for some fabulous gelato. Great food, great conversation and a very fair price.
Great food, good company . David was very knowledgable and welcoming. The group enjoyed each other's company and we were given plenty of pointers to enable us to explore Buenos Aires on our own.

Great lunch time stroll -- and dining -- in San Telmo with Parrilla Tours. We did the terrific lunch-time paseo in San Telmo with Nina of Parrilla Tours. Traffic was heavy, so we arrived a bit late via taxi, but she (and another couple) were patiently and kindly wait at Pedro Telmo, the first bar. There we had some great sausage in a roll appetizer before strolling a couple blocks to a former butcher shop cum steakhouse. There it was great food and the great wine found everywhere in Argentina. (Even the local whites are good.) Then one again for the traditional desert here — ice cream in multiple flavors you may not have heard of. Nina, a student of architecture, was a great guide — enviably fluent in Los Angeles English, Sao Paulo Portuguese and BA’s unique form of Spanish. (The double L here — as in “parrilla” — is pronounced more like “shussh” than “yah.” Anyway, a great way to spend the afternoon learning the city.

A Great Way to Enjoy the Local Cuisine. This is a very easy walking tour taking in different types of dishes at different restaurants and they all were fantastic and we also tried a couple of local wines which were also good. Would definitely recommend this tour for all ages and many thanks to Luisa and Santiago for sharing these wonderful delights with us and also for being wonderful hosts.

Lunch tour. We are older folks and went on the lunch tour. We really enjoyed it. We walked a total of about 4 blocks stopping to taste and drink at places along the way. What is great about this tour is that you don't get too much to eat........just the right amount. Would highly recommend this food tour.

Great intro to real Argentinian food. Very good host explained all the local delicacies and was knowledgable about the city and all things argentinian. Short distances between eating sites finishing on veranda of ice cream parlour. Very interesting food, Highly recommended for first time visitor

Well worth it. Our guide was great, really informative about the food and culture in BsAs and the food was fantastic. Choripan and empanadas to start then went to a parrilla for our lunch and delicious icecream to finish. Didn't need to eat for the rest of the day.

Excellent Introduction to Authentic Argentinian Food. Because we were staying Palermo, we opted to do the walking tour of San Telmo and enjoyed the eats from several, excellent parrillas. Our guide was German. He was very well versed in the San Telmo area and the local eateries. We found the entire tour to be very-well organised and run and left happy and many kilos heavier. Well worth the trip and an excellent opportunity to so see a nice local neighbourhood.
Good introduction to local food. Our guide was friendly, and we visited local places in Palermo that are off the radar. Would recommend this tour if you want to try local food and wine.

Great experience . Not a tourist area, but a regular working class neighborhood. Your walking tour stops at several local establishments to sample the foods that the "regular" people try. Empanadas, chorizo sandwich, BBQ and Gelato. Will walk about a mile. Nice wines included at two stops.

A well crafted tour of Argentinian cuisine. As part of a tour in Buenos Aires my wife and I had a side trip with this small tour operator for lunch. We walked between four different restaurants/cafes where we sampled different types of meat meals starting with chorizo, moving on to enpanada and then finishing up with a steak house before moving to an ice cream shop. All were small local cafes that I would never have visited on my own. They also provided an interesting explanation of the cultural history behind the shops. It was two hours well spent.

Argentinian Food Explained. I did a Parrilla Tour with David in the Palermo area and it was a great introduction to my 3 weeks in Argentina. A small convivial group enhanced the experience of 4 different , but typical food establishments. It took about 2 1/2 hours and I enjoyed the food, the company and the knowledge of local cuisine and culture that David communicated. One of the other guests was an opera singer and she obliged us with a short performance which was a unique experience. Highly recommended.

Above and beyond culinary experience!!!!. I literally just received my new passport in the mail as my latest passport, which I used to visit Buenos Aires ran out of pages. As I took a moment to reflect on the many places all over the world that I've visited, and the countless culinary experiences I've had, I must say that our tour with Parrilla was by far in the TOP three experiences!! Santiago and David took the time to graciously educate us (and not overly educate, which was much appreciated), about the local community, but about the cultural history, heart and soul of the foods we were eating. We live in New York City and we STILL talk about the epic dishes we ate at the Palermo gems we visited (our mouths still water every time we do, too! :-). Whether you're single or with a partner or even family, Santiago and David managed our diverse group remarkably well. We left Buenos Aires feeling SO glad that we managed to find Parrilla Tours online, and can't wait to visit Buenos Aires and go on a tour again....we feel like we have new friends in such a culturally rich part of town and are incredibly thankful!!!! :-)

Okay but not what we expected. We thought this tour would be a 'walking' tour that would show us several parillas and talk more about the whole cuisine of steakhouses in Buenos Aires. Instead we started at a local bar with a light empanada and sausage sandwich meal with local beer, and then walked through a produce market-flea market. Next we did actually walk to a parilla and had a full lunch! Lots of beef and sausages, bread, salad, grilled cheese, etc. Finally we walked to a great ice cream shop that had 59 different flavors, many which were unique. It was a lot of food, and although the hostess of the tour was pleasant and friendly, she could have provided us with a lot more information and color about the area we were in which would have enhanced the whole experience more. So not a bust, but not what we had hoped for either.

Unexpected gems!. This was a great tour. We were in Palermo with Nina. She took us to some small, local restaurants that we would NEVER have ventured into ourselves. The food was awesome. We had eaten at some of the most famous Parillas in Uraguay and Buenos Aires, but the beef we had with her was the absolute best!What a fun day.......

Good intro to Buenos Aires local food culture. A great way to try authentic local food and get an understanding of local food culture. Our guide Santiago was very easy going but answered all our questions. Like all tours of this type, the more you ask, the more you learn. Don't expect long lectures to the assembled bunch, but you have the opportunity to learn heaps about Palermo and the food culture. There is plenty of beef and Malbec for all!

Fun trip, great food. Nina was a great guide and it was fun to see how she how close she was with the owners of the various spots we visited in San Telmo. She gave us info on the beautiful building and history of San Telmo as we walked along. Food was great - sausage, empanadas, delicious steak with a dynamite Malbec. Nice local ice cream shop. One word of advice - pace yourself. You get a LOT of food.

Very fun and great way to network abroad. Had a great time walking through San Telmo with Maria and her colleague H (sorry I forget his name, but remember it started with H). Very upbeat and friendly. We enjoyed choripan, empanada, a few cuts of meet along with salad, olives and beans and finished with ice cream. I was thoroughly full afterwards! We also walked through the local market. The ice cream was phenomenal and so was the wine we had. H was very knowledgeable and provided many tidbits of info throughout the tour. Unfortunately our group did not receive suggestions or handouts afterwards as other reviewers have noted. Also, sadly, we learned it was Maria's last food tour.

Quick intro to Argentinian food. Due to the great reviews on trip advisor I booked this tour. It was a quick intro to all the argentinian dishes, but we didn't get any historic info about the area, or the food. Just the name of the dish. We basicly just got walked from restaurant to restaurant and served a meal. Don't get me wrong, food was great, but not much involvement from our guide. I did a similar tour 1month later same type of food, but a much better experence.
Fun tour. We enjoyed visiting the small local eateries in the Palermo neighborhood. Great food and knowledgeable, entertaining guide.

Excellent food tour!. David was very knowledgeable on both Buenos Aires and Argentina as a whole. The small group made it personable and great fun. We were able to try many local favourites at local eateries and received lots of advice on other restaurants and bars to hit up as well. Would highly recommend!
Wonderful experience! Highly recommended . Well organized, punctual, with great historical and social history by the guide. The food was absolutely amazing !!! Would highly recommend.

Great introduction to eating out in Buenos Aires. Taking this tour on our first day in BA made the rest of our stay a much richer experience. David was an excellent host, knowledgeable, easy to talk to and well organised. The small group made it personal and friendly. We all enjoyed a variety of delicious, authentic food and wine in traditional restaurants, all located within easy walking distance of each other. The recommendations he gave us on the handout were brilliant

Great food tour. My wife and I went on this food tour with Santiago and Louisa. It was a great opportunity to try the local delicacies and learn about Argentina. We had a really good time, and would definitely recommend the tour. Thanks guys!

Amazing San Telmo walking foodie tour!. Well organised, low key but brilliant! Nina was our escort for the group of 6 plus a local guide from JLA our tour company. We met near the old San Telmo market and had Choripan and Empanadas then a walk around the market. What followed next took us by surprise - an amazing lunch at a local Parrilla with superb Malbec. Then we continued to an ice cream parlour! What a great trip...... Thank you.

Wonderful experience . This tour was perfect for us. Nina was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. We got lots of great tips for the rest of our trip, including an email after the tour with lots of recommendations for restaurants in BA and Mendoza.

Wonderful way to see the Palermo District. My friend and I booked the eating tour. Essentially you walk and see some of the Palermo district and stop at 4 restaurants to try local food and wine. Our guide David was excellent.Unfortunately my friend was not feeling well and we had to leave part way through the tour. Despite the fact that we only had a partial tour, I would still highly recommend it.

Fantastic food walking tour. We had a great day with Santiago, who was so friendly, knowledgeable and passionate! The hidden food gems of Palermo did not disappoint. We left with feelings of a full heart and belly. The food and wine were "secunda de nada". Highly recommended.

Eat all day!!!. We signed up for after a couple we met recommended it. It was so much fun, and delicious too. Maria was awesome guide with plenty of energy as we bounced from place getting an ear and mouthful of fun history.

Delicious Tour!. Maria was a great tour guide. Her English was excellent and we really enjoyed talking to her and learning more about the city and food scene in BA. It was a lot of food for us and we loved every bite :) Thanks again for everything Maria!

Great opportunity to visit and see local Parrilla restaurants and food traditions in BA. . Santiago (our guide) gave us a great introduction to the local history and food culture in Argentina. We tasted the common meals that a typical local inhabitant would eat, and the food was great. The tour took about three hours, without having any rush. Dont eat to much prior to this tour! Highly recommended for everyone visiting Argentina/BA.

Parrilla Tour with Maria. My friends & I went on this tour and were lucky to have Maria whose English and bubbly personality just added more value! We recommend that you skip breakfast to be able to enjoy all the culinary delights! The Parrilla we went too was delicious as was the ice cream parlour. Maria was also very helpful with all questions we asked about other Buenos Aires sites and also pointed out a few good antique shops for us to visit after the tour. During the lunch we were given some very useful typed sheets with other restaurant recommendations and delights to taste during our visit. Three fun loving Maltese ladies:-)

Tasting fun!. This was a great tour! If we could give it 6 stars, we would. We joined 3 others and started with beer and sausage sandwiches along with 2 great sauces. Next we walked to an empanada shop and had a yummy Malbec. Because I'm not big on meat, I enjoyed a spinach cheese variety. We traveled next to a beautiful open air restaurant and had some bbq'd cheese with sweetbreads (sounds crazy but they were good). Next came out a large platter of two types of beef but again, I was given chicken fajitas that were delicious! We waddled out of this restaurant and ended with two types of ice cream. Food tours are a great way to see a new city and enjoy local culture. Our guide was darling and she really made the tour fun. Thanks for a fun day.

Great way to eat your way through BA!. My Husband and I were fortunate enough to have our tour with Maria. We ended up being the only attendees and were treated to a personal tour of the food and history of the San Telmo area. Maria was an absolute delight to be around. Her English is great and her personality is even better. I highly recommend showing up hungry for this tour!

Fantastic food experience. Have a light breakfast before doing this lunchtime tour! A great intro to Argentinian food at local places you wouldn't find on your own as a tourist. David was a great guide, very friendly and knowledgeable.

Good tour if you're new to Buenos Aires. Went on this tour through Palermo - group of 7 were great and food was nice. Maria was a cool tour leader and i enjoyed her musings on politics especially!Only issue was that i did this tour after having been in Buenos Aires for 4 days, and as such had found some awesome places myself, so wasn't as handy as had it been on day 1.I would recommend the tour for anyone who is unfamiliar with the city or doesn't speak spansh as its a good way to get some understanding of the food and the neighbourhood.

Fantastic, friendly, authentic foodie experience! Highly recommend!!. My fiance, Jake and I had a fantastic time on our food tour with Maria! She did an incredible job curating a very local experience with delicious food that we would never have thought to order on our own. She is also hilarious, and we felt like we were spending the afternoon with our Argentine friend instead of a tour guide. We had done a food tour previously in Madrid as a way to get ourselves oriented, and I'm so glad we decided to do the same with Parilla. Highly recommend this experience to anyone who loves food and authentic experiences!

Excellent Introduction to Argentine food culture. Maria, the guide, was a tub, lively person that create the right sort of atmosphere for our mixed age and mixed nationality group. We started with choripan at a local bar with beer, followed by empanadas and Torrentes. At the third place we started with a traditional provolone cheese dish cooked on the barbecue followed by two cuts of steak: skirt and tenderloin. The steak was accompanied by plenty of Malbec. Finally, Maria took us to an ice cream parlour. A great tour and a great host.

Bring Your Appetite!. Maria did a wonderful job of taking a combined group of about 15 people on our lunchtime tour last week; nice people and a fun time. There were supposed to be 4 in my group but my husband got sick and the office refunded his fee (which was prepaid)immediately...great customer service! We expected some "tastings" but left feeling like we wouldn't eat for a long time! Started on the "small side" and ended with a full steak lunch in a white-tablecloth restaurant complete with wine follwed by yummy ice cream! A nice way to see San Telmo and have a lovely tour. Highly recommend.

Best food tour ever. We were on a post cruise tour with a local tour guide Maxi who arranged for us to join up with David's Parrilla tour. Experiencing the neighborhood as we walked from one course to another to sample the different foods and wines was wonderful. And we learned so much. One stop was just for empanadas. We learned of 14 different types; each can be recognized by the exterior design. We only got to sample one as we had so many other stops. In talking with the others on the tour, some had said they found this on trip advisor and pre booked. There were about 10 of us. Most were from USA or Canada. I suggest you do this early in your stay so you learn about the different foods. Then you know what to order as you explore on your own.
Good times!. Great tour, good food and good times! Maria the tour guide was wonderful, made the whole experience memorable. Highly recommend it, go hungry and leave happy.

Eat a bite; walk a bit - Perfection!. Combining two of my favorite pastimes - eating and strolling in quiet metro neighborhoods - this tour was a terrific way to spend a midday in BA. Our guide, David, was charming and well spoken. The food, needless to say, was excellent - including the best empanadas I've ever had! My highlight, however, was the helado - as good as any in Italy and better than most. Dulce de leche/sambayon combo - out of this world!!And the 3-4 block strolls between courses were delightful. (We had great weather.)

Fun Experience in Argentine Eating. My wife and I are frequent visitors to BA. We wanted to try something different and found this on the internet. If you are a 1st or 100th time visitor you should enjoy this. We traveled in the Carnitas barrio and visited 3 Parrillas. We ate a different product at each one and topped it off with a stop at an ice cream store. The ice cream is as good as in Italy (which I always thought was the best). We had a wonderful guide, German Landa, who was gracious and charming. He helped everyone get the most out of the outing. He is wonderful with people.

A MUST WHEN IN BUENOS AIRES. This was my first time in Buenos Aires and so I signed up for a few tours. This was my first one. MARIA was dynamic and fun. She took us to a variety of places starting with beer and appetizers, empanadas, the main course and the gelato. OMG. It was ALL INCREDIBLE. You must sign up for this tour. A MUST when you come to Buenos Aires. I traveled solo and had a blast.

Delicious food made easy. The owners accompanied us on our Palermo tour. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and every thing we ate. They made the process very smooth and you got to try many of the classic dishes. We don't drink.and they kindly offered other beverages overall we felt it was a great value and enjoyable way to spend the afternoon. Many of the spots are at a large table so you are able to get to know your other guests. I made a special trip back to the chorpian restaurant as it was the best I had in buenos Aires.
Great tour. Marina was a great tour guide. She was easy to talk to and very informative. We really enjoyed the food and learning about the San Telmo area of Buenos Aires.

Maria was awesome!. I spent a week in BA over the New Year's holiday. I had many activities planned. However, the Parilla Tour with Maria was one of the best. Not only was the food great, but Maria was very knowledgeable, funny and a wonderful hostess/guide. Highly recommend for folks that are interested in barrios and food of BA.

Fun evening in BA. Our particular tour was in Las Canitas, a lively part of Buenos Aires, and it was a fun way to see the area and get some pointers on good food and drink. The group was small and manageable and we tasted a lot of things - chorizo at the first stop, empanadas and white wine at the second stop, very good cuts of meat at the third stop and it ended with great ice cream. Maria was an excellent guide and hostess. No mundane canned presentations - friendly stories and laughs. An added bonus was trading information with the others in the group regarding where they had been and where they were headed to. Having a progressive meal with a small group like this gave everyone the chance to sample a lot more than having dinner as a couple.

Perfect tour for a foodie!. I love food & travel to different places. So when i read about this tour i just had to book it. And i'm so happy i did! The food was amazing (been to Argentina a lot but had never tried a choripan or the icecream, glad they had it on the tour) and our tourguide, Maria, was so nice. She was upbeat, happy and full of energy and ready to answer all our questions. Not just about food but also about the Argentina way of life. Oh and the icecream place she took us was worth the money alone....icecream heaven!!!!! If you love food, want to have a fun afternoon or evening and eat the best icecream ever, i suggest you book this tour!

Good eats but not worth the price. Our tour guide was very kind and knowledgeable but I didn't find the tour to be worth the price (~$69 usd/pp). The experience isn't much different than getting four recommendations from a local friend and checking out the establishments yourself. I think they could make the tour more unique if they could explain/show more of what happens behind the scenes in the kitchen (i.e. how empanadas are made, the process for picking/grilling meat, etc.). The total cost of the meals is probably ~$20-25 usd/pp with wine so I would have expected this tour to be closer to $40-50 usd/pp. Especially since it's a pretty big group (ours was ~18 people). The upside is that you do meet a lot a great group of people through the tour. The total tour was about 2.5 hours long and you go to four places (1 for a "BA version" hot dog, 1 empanada, 1 for carne, grilled cheese, and grilled vegetables, and 1 gelato shop).

Very nice afternoon for the entire family. 1 - Guides were attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable2 - Food was quite good overall (on such a tour there will be a couple new things you love and a couple things you think are so-so, sampling different things is sort of the point!), restaurants were very quaint and rustic in a cool way and were clearly "local" places3 - Length of tour is perfect for a family with kids (enough to get a good feel for the neighborhood but not so long kids get bored or tired.)4 - Anyone who says it is overpriced needs to get their head examined. It's an experience. You cant just add up the cost of the food items themselves.
Good Tour of BA Parrillas. Maria was an excellent host to give a group a tour of world famous BA parrillas. I would have liked more background on the meats and preparations.

Fantastic Introduction to BA. From the first greeting to the last farewells Maria was passionate about the food and all things Argentinian which was a wonderful introduction to BA. The tour was relaxed and informal, the food delicious and we were fortunate to be part of a great group of people. We would thoroughly recommend the evening tour of Palermo.

Great tour and great eats. Santiago (one of the owners) leads you through empanadas, carne and ice cream while he explains the culture and history of Argentina. Super relaxed and fun. Plenty of wine and cheer as well. Don't miss it.

Good Time. We had our tour with Maria, 2 days before Christmas. It was nice to sit and talk with Maria about Argentina, the food the wine and the local traditions around Christmas. After all was done I wanted to go have dads barbecue with the family. We went from hand food you would eat at a futball match to a nice steak and salad dinner. One suggestion I would offer, at lunch instead of 1 bottle of wine, I would of liked a glass from each of the main wine regions in Argentina. Maria talked of Mendoza, Patagonia and Cafayate wines and how distinctive they are, it would of been nice to have this discussion why we tried them. I would recommend the tour...........

Great to try the staple foods of Argentina.. Did the San Telmo tour. It felt kind of rushed but Maria and her partner were extremely friendly. We tried everything in this order:Choripan and Empanadas at Pedro TelmoWalked around the San Telmo MarketsHad Steak at a Gran Parilla del PlataIce cream at Nonna BiancaNot the best we had in BA, but definitely still good. Definitely do this tour if you are on a time crunch and want to try food that Argentina is famous for. If you have time you can definitely go to specialized places for these foods. As I said the tour felt super rushed but maybe it was an off day.

Maria - great host!. We really enjoyed this tour - great food in Las Canitas - choripan, empanada, steak and ice cream (keep yourself hungry the day you do the tour). The special element is definitely Maria - she's funny, open and charming and I think she may run Argentina one day!

Parrilla Food Tour. Very authentic Argentinian food, we started with a small beef burgner, then onto a chicken Empanada which was delicious and the best one I've had, it's much juicier than you'd get from other places. Of course steaks have to be there, absolutely beautiful and cooked to perfection, finally some yummy ice cream, everything was awesome!

Great way to see the neighborhood while eating delicious food. We had an incredible experience on our parrilla tour with our guide Maria. She told us a lot about the city, neighborhood and local traditions while taking us to DELICIOUS restaurants in the Las Canitas neighborhood. The restaurants we visited are some of my favorites from the entire time in Buenos Aires. Maria was hilarious and offered a great local perspective (and it was only my husband and I on the tour, and she even took us on the city bus with her back to our hotel)! Would highly recommend this tour with Maria to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

Great food and fantastic guide. The food was fantastic and our guide was both entertaining and informative. The steak was so tender it could melt in your mouth and the empanadas were the best I've had in Argentina. I wish we had done the tour as soon as we arrived in Buenos Aires as it would have helped us navigate restaurants and the local food more easily. I highly recommend doing this tour.

Great way to eat the best of Argentinian food in company. This is a great tour, with fab food and I had nice people on my tour. Guide Maria was an absolute hoot (very funny) and very friendly. She is not there to give you the history of Argentinian food but to take you to a selection of great parillas where you will eat chopan, empanada, meat and more meat then delicious ice cream, and to explain what you were eating. This is a great way to eat like a porteno. Recommended.

Great Experiance Being Able to Eat Like a Local. I really enjoyed this tour. We had two guides who were really knowledgeable about the different restaurants we went too. There are so many restaurants in Buenos Aires to choose from and by taking this tour I was able to find some hidden gems that I would of never found if I ventured off on my own. By the end of the tour I was pretty full and satisfied. I really liked the nice touch at the end of the trip when our guide gave us a list of different restaurants worth checking out in the city.

Fun and Delicious Food Tour (Palermo). My dad and I had a wonderful time, exploring, eating and drinking wine around Palermo. The walking was easy, stops were close together, and we got to try a sampling of some of the popular foods and wines from the area from four different establishments. I was surprised the ice cream was so delicious; I halfway expected the beef and wines would be good since Argentina is well known for these. They did not disappoint. We had a nice intimate group and were not only able to learn about the regional food and wine, but also about life in Argentina and Buenos Aires in particular. Culture and culinary art go together so we enjoyed the insider's perspective from our guide.

Disappointed.... It feels inaccurate to describe this as a Parrilla tour as you only go to one. The first place is great for chorizo, and you take an empanada into the market to do a quick lap, then on to the Parrilla for lunch. The food is good but was hoping for more from the guide. Although she admitted to being hung over at the start of the tour it didn't really feel like she wanted to be there. In addition, there was no sign of the mate tasting which we paid extra for. However, the customer service was excellent. We received a prompt reply by email and received a full refund. I think we just visited on an off day.

Authentic, delicious food at multiple venues, with fellow travelers. This was a fun and easy way to try some great local, authentic, delicious food while meeting other travelers. The food was so good I went back to one of the places on my own later.

Delicious afternoon well spent . My sister and I did the San Telmo tour and had a fantastic time. We enjoyed local foods from 2 restaurants, 1 market and 1 ice cream shop. I would definitely recommend this tour to any foodie visiting buenos Aires looking for an authentic experience. The guides spoke English very well and were very knowledgable. An overall wonderful afternoon!

Excellent food, the way the locals eat it.. Great host, knowledgeable and friendly. He went to extra effort to accommodate my last minute booking and I was extremely happy he did. We had a relatively small group and we were taken to a few restaurants, all filled with locals, all with a story and all with amazing food. This is a food tour that won't take you to tourist traps, but will give you a taste of the real Buenos Aires and some of the best steaks I've ever eaten. I absolutely recommend this experience to anyone that wants a great dinner in BA.
Parrilla tour. Excellent tour, wonderful hostess Maria. Prepare to be fed good authentic food and be thoroughly entertained.

Excellent tour - thoroughly enjoyable. Santiago (co-founder of the business) was our tour guide. What a lovely, knowledgeable guy. The tour was in a beautiful part of Buenos Aires. Great authentic restaurants - no tourist traps! We went to 4 different places, sampling argentinian food and wines. It was so much fun and there was plenty of food. If you are wondering whether or not to book this tour, just go for it. You won't regret it!

Highlight of stay in BA. If you like your food/wine then this tour is not to be missed for proper authentic Argie food. Santiago our guide was very knowledgeable and talked about the history of each parilla that we visited which made it more interesting and also knowing that we were visiting the places where the locals go. Highly recommend this tour

best tour in Buenos Aires. Fabulous experience. Met guide Maria at 12 and then for 3 hours we were taken around the elegant area of Palermo visiting local restaurants and cafes to taste the lovely food and wine of Argentina. We thought tasting would mean little snacks but this was not the case. Be warned you will eat and drink lots of wonderful food during this tour. We needed nothing else for the rest of the day. Maria was great. Kept our group together. Encouraged us to taste eat and drink everything and answered all our questions. We met other interesting travellers and have no hesitation in giving Parilla Tours a five star rating.

Wonder time on San Telmo lunchtime tour. First, Maria was charming and a great hostess/guide. Went to 3 stops, plus empandas in the market. Beer and Wine and then Ice Cream at the end... Fun tour and it was more than we should have eaten. Fun. Fun. Fun. Can't wait to go again and try the Polermo tour!
Great Tour!. Delicious food & wine! Loved that it was in local spots, not tourist traps. We had the best empanadas of our trip on this tour. Would definitely recommend!

Great way to lunch like a local. Maria is the perfect host to show you round palermo local restaurants. The food we had was excellent and plentiful, (we couldn't face dinner that night!) And going to the excellent local restaurants, seeing your steak cooked on a traditional bbq was great. We also met lots of like minded people and all shared their top tips on what to do and where to go. Nice way to spend and afternoon!

Maria was great and took us to the best places in Buenos Aires. We had a great time with Maria. We started of with some Choripan and Empanadas and then went to a an amazing Steakhouse which was filled with locals. Maria was really funny and we all had a great time with her. After ice cream, she recommended a lot of other places for us to try out during the rest of our stay in Buenos Aires. We went to 4 places she recommended and they were fantastic. We're going to come back to Buenos Aires just to eat at the rest of the places she told us to check out.

Plenty of food and fun. Our travel agent had arranged for us to go on the Parrilla Tour. We weren't disappointed. Our guide Maria was funny and very informative. We started off in a parrilla attached to San Telmo Market with a choripan, moved on to an empanada and dined in style at another parrilla in San Telmo before finishing at an artisanal ice cream shop. Bring your appetite and prepare to feast.

One of the highlights of our vacation!. My husband and I were in Buenos Aires for the first time for vacation and booked a San Telmo food tour with Parrilla Tours. Maria was our main guide, with David accompanying the group for part of the tour. We started in a small local restuarant, owned and operated by a married couple in their 80s! We had a local beer, and the local chorizo with french fries. Next we stopped next door to see the big market, enjoying handmade empenlladas (which were the best we had on the whole trip!). Next we stopped at another local restaurant which used to be an old butcher market, had delicious wine, lunch, and felt like we were locals! We finished with yummy ice cream from another local shop. We have always had luck with tours like this because they really make your vacation more memorable than you could ever do on your own. Maria and Parrilla Tours didn't let us down! Fantastic job! If you want to get the best experience out of your vacation, do a food tour!

Great Food Tour & more. We (the family of seven) really enjoyed this tour. Not just the food but David's local knowledge also. The places we visited were not touristy, but more like local spots in Palermo. The food was very good with different foods at each stop. We kept peppering David with questions about anything Argentinian and he was great about answering them all.This is an excellent tour that I cannot recommend enough.

Definitely book this tour!. We went on this tour with our family or 7 adults and it was terrific! The food was very good in each of our stops, but just as enjoyable was our tour guide, David and the insight he gave us into the life of a local Porteno. He gave us history on the upcoming elections, the economy, local traditions and great suggestions on places to eat and visit. He was raised in Portland Oregon and moved back to Argentina so he was able to understand the American perspective & translate it to Argentina. The food was of course amazing! Choripon, beef & wine finished off with yummy ice cream! This tour is so much more than a food tour & was a highlight of our trip!

what a great taste of true Argnetian cuisine!. We had a fabulous afternoon with maria on the Palermo food tour! she took us to a range of places- from traditional to more contemporary and the food was exquisite! we especially loved exploring that residential part of Palermo which we wouldn't have done without the Parilla tour- cant recommend it enough!!

Fantastic Afternoon in Buenos Aires!. My fiance and I just returned from a trip to Argentina. We spent the afternoon with Parrilla Tour and had an awesome afternoon. The guide Maria was fun and friendly, very knowledgable about Argentina and the foods we tried.... and the food - was outstanding! We met some lovely couples who were also traveling and all around had a wonderful experience. I would highly recommend as a fun afternoon while in Buenos Aires. Ciao!

Great time!. I had a great time on the tour. Maria was a great tour guide and knew the area really well. The group I was with was fun and interesting. I would highly recommend this if you are looking for an introduction to Argentinian food and culture.

a glimpse of the real Buenos Aires. We loved our time on the Parilla Tour. The food was great (if you like your steak rare, Maria will make sure the chef understands you really mean it!) and Maria is a dynamo. She's lovely and knowledgeable, and truly loves good food and the people who create it. We went on Maria's wine tour the next night and it was a special experience. Maria is training to become a sommelier, and her taste in wine is excellent. Even better, she is warmly received and clearly adored at all of the places that she takes her tour participants to. This was an experience we will remember and treasure.

Amazing experience.. My husband and I enjoyed every second of this tour. during this tour we were able to try "real" Argentinian food. what I meant with this, we went to local markets and restaurants that shows the food that locals eat. this was wonderful.

Atmosphere, Food, VINO and Maria = Excellent!!!!. Maria made our tour very memorable for my wife and I. She was very energetic and explained everything with great detail. We would defiantly take this tour again with her and recommend this tour to others.

A nice way to explore, ask questions and get an overview of eating customs. We enjoyed our time with Maria. She is energetic and fun to be with. She introduced us to the Argentinian eating habits, answered all our questions and explained some customs and beliefs. The food was excellent. We can recommend this tour.

Great intro to San Telmo area!. Really enjoyed Maria's tour of the San Telmo area. Her insight into BA foods and customs were a great intro for first-timers like us. Will definitely come back to BA to continue our education!

Fantastic!. Highly recommended - a great way to see the neighborhood (I did San Telmo) and get a HUGE meal in - do not eat breakfast! Maria was our guide and she was so energetic and fun, knowledgeable and helpful with recommendations. Totally worth the price!

The best walking tour of Palermo!. This tour started with an email reminder with the location of where to meet. The attention to details like that continued the entire tour. Going to 4 different places with great food at all 4 stops. Our guide, Santiago, was friendly and informative. I forgot I was on a tour and just felt like I was hanging out with an old friend. A definite must do in when in Buenos Aires.

Great tour. We went on the tour yesterday. It was more like a very enjoyable lunch with friends than an actual tour. Exactly what we were after. Maria was fun and more than happy to share our experiences. The food was great. I think we had the best empanadas I ever had. Lovely sreak lunch with a nice bottle of Malbec in a beautiful restaurant frequented only by locals. Go, ask questions, enjoy the food!

So much better than we expected!. We took the San Telmo food tour with Maria today. Although we've already eaten empanadas and lots of beef and drank plenty of red wine during the past few days, Maria took us to the places where the locals eat and the food seemed so much better. She blended in history of the food, the streets and the people that made it all special. And Maria's joy for life was infectious! Highly recommend this tour and Maria!

A Must Do. Definitely do this food tour during your stay in BA! The earlier in your visit the better because you will know where to repeat! Hopefully you are lucky enough to get Maria for your tour guide. She is very informative and is not in a rush to get through. We were lucky enough to even get to see a polo practice midtour! So good we decided to do the wine tour with her as well!

Amazing tour with Maria. We had a wonderful time on our tour with Maria. She was very welcoming and friendly with lots of information and knowledgeable about Argentina and wine. On top of that the food was amazing! I would recommend this tour to anyone!

A must do in Buenos Aires. We went on this food tour in the hope of seeing some authentic BA and we got even more than we expected! There were 5 of us on the tour and we enjoyed a relaxed fun afternoon filled with delicious food and drink. Initially it may seem expensive but trust me, considering the excellent food and drink you get (in abundance), it is excellent value for money! We were served amazing food, the only slight problem was steak that was a little on the tough side (only a little) but our wonderful host Maria sent it back immediately and had it replaced with the best cut in the house. We really felt the tour was not about making money but about making sure we had the best possible experience. Maria gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants, wine shops and bars so do this tour at the beginning of your stay. We only wish we had longer in BA to enjoy all the wonderful recommendations! A must do in the wonderful foodie paradise that is Buenos Aires!

Parrilla Tour with Maria. Lots of fun. Maria was a great guide and interesting to get the inside view from a local porteño. I think it would be even better if the local owners/chefs became more involved in talking to the guests. Good idea for early in you trip!

Not just about food. Great insight into the city. More than just a culinary tour. Our tour guide Majo gave us a glimpse into porteno culture from various points of views . It felt like having a friend showing us around. She was very knowledgeable , friendly and the experience enjoyable. would recommend this tour to anyone seeking authenticity.

Authentic Experience and Great Food. My partner and I received a recommendation of the San Telmo food tour in Buenos Aires from friends who had just been. The tour was very personal and small (just the two of us and our wonderful tour guide, Maria) and took place over the course of about 3 hours. We went to places tour books would probably not suggest and were the only tourists there - which is exactly what we wanted. Food was delicious! Empanadas, choripan (sausage sandwich), steak lunch, and helado (ice cream). Beer and wine flowed at each place and we had a blast with Maria!I highly recommend this tour for people who want an authentic food tour and not just the typical tourist places. We ate with the people of Argentina and loved every minute. Maria was an incredible host and very open and knowledgeable about the rich history of Buenos Aires and her experience there.Excellent experience!

Brilliant food. I had a great Saturday morning trying a variety of traditional Argentinian food. The quality of the food was sensational: the beef was the best I had in Burnos Aires. Maria was a great guide and very helpful. Thanks again Maria

Great food, great guides. After a couple of pretty high-end (and pricey!) dinners in Buenos Aires, we were ready to eat where the locals go. We found the Parrilla Tour through our Lonely Planet guidebook and booked a Tuesday evening tour in Palermo. David and Santiago were great tour guides -- very knowledgeable about local food, but also added some great cultural context about the neighborhood and how the locals live. (Empanada delivery!) The tour introduced us to our first (and sadly last) choripan and our first (and definitely NOT last) mascarpone helado. The parrilla we visited was great -- hidden and dripping with local color. If you are looking to get off the beaten food path a bit, I highly recommend this tour, especially if you don't speak Spanish and are a bit reluctant about wandering into a neighborhood joint on your own. David also recommended a great cocktail bar for us at the conclusion of the tour, and offered some insight about Mendoza, where we flew off to the next morning. First rate experience!

Great tour... wonderful guide.. My wife and I went on the San Telmo tour. It was a nice time as the guide (Maria) was full of life, and a wealth of information on everything Argentina - from food and wine, to politics and life. The tour started with handmade empanadas at a quaint old cafe, that also serves home cooked pastas. This was followed by choripan, in yet another local cafe, and then lunch over wine and beef. The tour ended with a nice touch of artesanal ice cream. We loved the food and were really glad we skipped breakfast!! Highly recommend this tour at the beginning of your stay in BA. Your will then have enough time to try out all the other recommended places!

Great food and company. I had a wonderful afternoon on this tour. I could not think of a better way to spend time in Buenos Aires. <i can say to date that I had the best steak that I have eaten to date. The people on the tour were great and Maria is fantastic. We all left happy and full.

Great way to sepnd our last day in BA. This was our last day in BA so I wanted the opportunity to try some great food than the locals eat. Maria was a great tour guide, she was hilarious and lots of fun but also knowledgeable about the history of the foods, wine, etc. We had a blast and I would highly recommend this to others.

Great way to spend a Saturday afternoon. I am traveling in Buenos Aires alone, so half the fun here has been meeting new people on such tours who are also exploring the city (sometimes alone, but often with just one other person) and just as interested in the incredible food and wine as I am. At first I was unable to book this tour when I wanted to due to the fact that the company indicated they required at least 2 people. August is not yet the busy season here, so tourists were not as plentiful as when the weather begins to warm up. The staff were very kind, and of course offered to schedule a different day for me. I finally was able to settle on a Saturday, but on Friday was told that the other attendees had backed out and I was again the only one scheduled for the tour. The said they would honor the reservation if I was comfortable doing it alone (I imagine they felt a bit bad for me, having tried a few different days before finally finding one that worked).While I initially was disappointed I would not have fellow travelers with whom to share the experience, I was quickly reassured by the warm, friendly and quite knowledgeable tour guide, Maria. For almost three hours I had a private, un-rushed, delicious tour. Maria was welcomed as family in each of the stops we made, and by extension (and probably because they too likely felt bad for me being the only attendee) they too treated me like family. At one stop, I was even invited behind the counter to help with the grilling of our steak and the grilled provolone (which you must try if you haven't already)!!We stopped at four places in all: one for choripan (grilled sausage on a roll with various toppings); one for empanadas; one for steak; and the last for helado (ice cream). At each stop (with the exception of the ice cream, there was an opportunity to try new wines. And at each stop Maria provided a rich account of the food, the neighborhood, and the local culture.Could you visit these places on your own for less money (as some of the negative reviews have implied)? Sure you can. But I found the experience to be a great value. At no point did I feel like a tourist. At no point did I feel uninformed. If not for my guide Maria, her great personality and incredible depth of knowledge, and her reputation with the local establishments we visited, the value of this tour would not have been.The few hours I spent on this tour will forever be among the lasting memories I look forward to keeping of this incredible city and its people.
Great food with a bit of unexpected fun. Flying solo was hardly an issue with the company of a warm host, great food, and new friends! A nice introduction to the expansive world of BsAs food culture.

Best part of Buenos Aires!. This was without a doubt our favourite activity in Buenos Aires. Our guide Maria was knowledgable, easy going and fun and a tour group of just 4 gave it a really personal touch. Fantastic steak in a local restaurant we definitely wouldn't have ventured into without her and a delicious gelato to top it all off. Highly recommended!

Great food...Great wine...Great Guide...Great time. Maria was a great tour guide who made my experience very enjoyable. I did the evening tour which is the less popular tour but being in BA for business meetings, it worked out great. Maria knew all about the history of Argentina, BA, the local neighborhood and for sure the wines and food. You will regret taking this tour!!!

Great company for a great night out. Our guide met the group in a small parilla not too far from where I was staying and as a great host shared with us a great time.Her local knowledge of Argentina was just the right thing to provide a quick introduction to the food and how the restaurants came into existence in the area. As a single traveller it was a great night out and I would highly recommend it to anyone in small groups as well.

Lots of great food- shame it only covered a short distance!. My Husband and I did this food tour in July and really enjoyed all of the food that we tried. David was very knowledgeable and professional as our guide, and our group was very small with only one other guest. We got on with the other guest incredibly well and had a fantastic time on our tour with lots of laughs. However we wonder if it may have been a little more arkward if this had not been the case.The tour itself covers a very small distance, and I think it may be worth considering covering a bigger area so that the guests get a 'feel' for more of BA on the tour. We did a similar tour in Rio which covered a much bigger area and gave us a greater insight into the city.However, we enjoyed ourselves a lot on this tour and would recommend it!

Fun experience!. We spent 4 days in BA and decided to do this tour based on the Trip Advisor reviews. Boy, am I glad we did! We got to try some of the neighborhood restaurants that we would not have found otherwise. Not only was the food delicious, but Maria, our guide, made the day super fun!

Memorable and fun!. I wanted to fill a few hours prior to a late day meeting and dinner in Buenos Aires and found Parilla Tour through TripAdvisor. I was not expecting much and thought it was just going to be a regular tour (Not knowing what food tours are all about) until you get to know Maria. Very charming, witty, a wealth of knowledge and a lot of fun. I've been to great restaurants around the world; food and wine always taste better with a good company. Thank you for a very memorable day...

Flowing wine, amazing food, friendly and fun!. It was our first time in South America and this tour made us feel like locals for a few hours. Maria did a great job pulling a group of strangers together so we all felt like old friends. The wine was excellent and the steaks, empanadas, and gelato were just awesome. This was a bargain and one of our best memories of our holiday. Thanks!
Great day. Had an amazing day... the food and wine was great!! Visited restaurants and cafes that you wouldn't know about unless you did this tour.

Eat, Drink, and Be Merry!. Wow! What a fun evening! I have so much to say about this evening, so here's the short version: If you come to Buenos Aires, you must do this tour. I wish we would have been able to do this on the front end of our tour, as our guide David had many great recommendations of places to eat and things to do. Sign up, then eat, drink, and be merry!********************************************************Here's my long version :-)Sign up was very easy on their website. I was able to select the tour and date and then pay online with no issues. We chose the evening Palermo tour. It was an easy cab ride from Puerto Madero to Palermo, and David was waiting at the first restaurant when we arrived early. All of the restaurants were within easy walking distance, and the neighborhood felt very safe, even after dark. Plan for 2-3 hours for the tour plus transport time. The starting restaurant is pretty far north in Palermo, so keep that in mind when planning. Casual dress is appropriate. Cab ride from Puerto Madero was about 130 pesos. Bring your camera and and empty stomach! We were joined by four lovely Californians (Go Stanford!). David is very knowledgeable about the Palermo neighborhood and the local food. He did an excellent job explaining local customs around dining and food choices. All the restaurants we visited were places frequented by the locals, so it truly felt like an evening out with friends. Everything we ate was DELICIOUS. Y'all, SO GOOD. We were able to have a different wine with each course. He was even able to get our steak cooked a lovely medium rare. Do not miss the grilled provolone! There was enough food that we felt like we had a full meal, and the ice cream at the end was creamy and light. Be sure to try the hazelnut and Bailey's! David, thanks for being such a great host and for making us all feel welcome at your table. We had a wonderful evening, and it was a great way to end my trip!

A great way to see the real Buenos Aires.. Maria was a fantastic guide - she was very knowledgeable and great fun too! We enjoyed food and drink at 3 parillas followed by a trip to a heladeria. We had so much beautiful food and drink, especially in the last parilla where we each ate lots of different cuts of steak, beautiful grilled veg and cheese. There was no shortage of food or wine/beer - if u have dinner plans after its probably best to reschedule! Definitely worth taking 3 hours out of your holiday to go - totally worth the money.

Parrillo Food Tour. Maria was a fabulous guide. She is a natural, both outgoing and knowledgeable. There was one other couple on our tour, so we were a small group which allowed for hands-on experiences. Maria made sure that we were entertained and that we learned about Argentine history. It was a great afternoon-highly recommend, and we are quite discerning!

Amazing food and awesome guide. David was our guide and he did a fantastic job of scheduling our tour around our schedule. He was very knowledgeable about the history and customs of Buenos Aires and was also a foodie. He took us to four different restaurants to get a taste of the local cuisine. He even gave us some good suggestions on places to visit and shop while we were in town. We had great food and lots of fun. Thanks, David.

Simply Awesome. The tour was great going to places where as a tourist we would never even consider going but the food and wine was superb. The tour guide was extremely knowledgeable in both food and wine. Also recommended some other restaurants which was a great help would strongly advise this tour.

Amazing Food Tour!. I had such a great afternoon with Maria and our group for this tour. She was nice and funny but also very knowledgable and accommodating. We had 4 stops, all were amazing and not somewhere I would have ever found on my own. This tour is 5 stars without question, totally worth the price!

Best Food tour in Buenos Aires!. Maria was an excellent tour guide, she was very welcoming and accommodating to each individual. She was also very knowledgeable about the food, wine and culture of Buenos Aires. Each Parilla we went to, Maria gave us a susinct background on the history of the food and place, which was very interesting. Each Parilla was noticeably authentic - this was definitely not a tourist trap!!

Food Tour. Excellent food tour. Maria was so knowledgeable. Not to.mention we were 30 minutes late and she waited for us patiently. She gave us great recommendations and an excellent professional service.

Great first experience of the Parrillas!. Our tour guide, Maria, was welcoming, friendly and bubbly. We were delighted to find that there were other traditional foods on the tour such as the empanadas (best ever!) as well as the choripan. However, the parrilla was of course, the highlight. The location itself had a rustic and warm feel to it and the meats were dee-li-cious! Succulent pieces of meat kept appearing on our table and there were more than enough to go round. The paired bottles of red wines went perfectly with the parrillas. We would highly recommend this tour for meat lovers!

Perfect Argentinian Food-sperience!. I signed up for this looking for that 'authentic' experience that's occasionally hard to find just wandering the streets on your own. This was perfect. Our guide Maria was a fountain of joy and excitement about all the different foods (and drink!). We whisked around little establishments in San Telmo with an insider-like experience, tasting whatever meats we wanted and learning about the different wines (did I mention Maria is a budding sommelier???). Two thumbs-up and perfect for anyone looking for a real BBQ experience outside of the famous restaurants.

Fun afternoon in San Telmo. My wife and I went on the San Telmo Parilla Tour and enjoyed a fun afternoon restaurant hopping with Maria. The food was awesome and we returned to one of our stops (Pedro Telmo) later in the week for one of our best (and least expensive) meals in Buenos Aires. Maria is engaging and kept the group entertained and informed. My only comment for improvement is that it would have been nice to actually get into the kitchens and see the cooking, meet the chefs etc. Maybe next time.

Authentic Experience with AMAZING Food, Wine and Company. We planned this tour last minute and they were able to accommodate our group the next morning. Really, where else are you going to be able to find a parilla tour? Only in BAries! Maria was our tour guide and she was beyond wonderful. Full of energy, informative and she was so enthusiastic to share the food and culture of her country. She picked out the most authentic parillas in Buenos Aires including one stop where the owner actually let us play chef ourselves for a bit. All the different kinds of meat we had, empanadas and wine were out of this world. There is no way we will ever find the unique meals we shared on this tour anywhere in the US. If you request Maria, you sure won't regret it. Such a sweetheart and as authentic Argentinean experience!

Delicious and well worth the money! . A group of 5 of us went on the Parilla Lunch Tour on May 22, 2015 with Maria. I was fantastic and well worth the price! Maria was great and kept us entertained the entire time! She always made sure that we had enough to eat and drink! We had choripan at the first stop, empanadas at the second, steak, grilled vegetables and provaleta at the third, and ice cream at the fourth. We were stuffed by the end! All of the places were very local and we would not have stumbled across them otherwise! I highly recommend doing this tour! You will not be disappointed!!

An Absolute Gem of a Culinary Experience!. If you're looking for a culinary experience in an authentic Argentinian/cultural setting, then Parrilla Tour [Palermo] is unquestionably your one and only ticket to the most delicious, satisfying, and delightful dimensions in Buenos Aires. Frankly, I can't say enough wonderful things about this gem of an adventure. María Jose, our host, was an exceptionally good-humored, knowledgeable, and caring guide. The entire time she treated us as if we were honored guests at her own home --- pouring beer/wine, serving food, filling us in on the historical/cultural significance of the Argentinian traditions, and going around to make sure that everyone was having a great time; in short, an absolute joy of a person to be around. And let me tell you about the food; the food was magnificent, too. The sausages, the empanadas, the beer, the wines, and the ice cream were all delicious and satisfying, but the meat dishes at El Bagual Parrilla were simply out of this world---some of the very best cuts of meat that I've had anywhere---and that from a hard-to-please meat/steak lover/connoisseur.Finally, and as if all that was not enough, Parrilla Tour also extends you the opportunity to meet some truly amazing folks from all over the world.Parrilla Tour was by far our most memorable experience in Buenos Aires. Don't miss out on this unique opportunity to taste some of the most delicious Argentinian dishes in truly authentic settings; places where the locals would go to enjoy a meal. HIGHLY RECOMMEDED!

Good choice. Our hotel recommended the Parilla Tour BA and it ended up being a great choice. Maria is a fantastic tour guide with boundless energy. On our 3 hour tour, she introduced us to 4 different local restaurants that we otherwise wouldn't have gone into and all of the meals were tremendous. You will not be disappointed.

Best Food Tour in BA. I went with 6 friends: 5 meat eaters and 1 vegetarian. We all left extremely full of all types of food. We went to three different restaurants that you would never think to go into as a tourist. We had amazing food, wine, and beer and so much STEAK. But even with all the steak the vegetarian in our group was well accommodated with various things. And at the very end we had a really good ice cream. The food was great, the tour was great, and Maria is so much fun (not to mention not too bad on the eyes either). I highly recommend this tour.

Best food exploration!. We loved learning first hand about traditional foods from the best local eating places in Palermo. The foods were delicious and the guide was informative and very entertaining. Would highly recommend it.

Awesome...Fabulous...Highly Recommend!!. This turned out to be a really great evening, and a highlight of my trip to B.A.! What a fabulous concept, and Parrilla Tours delivered big-time. Maria was tops -- she was engaging, fun, and she really went above and beyond to make me feel right at home. It's like having a new friend in B.A. I was traveling solo and was very fortunate to be on the tour with a group of great engaging young people from the U.S. and Canada. Lots and lots of fun, laughs, wine -- and the food was incredible. The parrillas we visited were really authentic...the real deal...just what I imagined them to be. You will not go hungry, and you'll have great memories to take with you as well. Lastly, the value was exceptional. Highly recommend Parrilla Tours.

Parilla Tour. What an excellent tour! Had such a fun time and Maria, our guide, was excellent and lots of fun.We stopped at four locations and ate lots of delicious Argentine food. Would definitely go again! Worth the money.

Perfect lunch time walking tour in Palermo. We really enjoyed our walking food tour which included four restaurants. Our host was delightful. We started with choripan (chorizo sausage on bread) served with a mild salsa or a chimichurri sauce. Next stop was for an empanada picante. I really enjoyed this taste treat. The main entree were two selections of beef - a steak and a skirt steak, served with a chimichurri sauce. The side salad of baby arugula with parmigiana was perfect. We all shared a nice Malbec. The walking tour ended with a choice of ice cream. We also received a list of restaurant suggestions by neighborhood. Some of which were familiar. Some are new, but that means more places to try. I highly recommend taking a tour whether you are a new visitor or a veteran to Buenos Aires. It's a nice way to try the best if what a restaurant offers.

Highly recommended! . We spent a fantastic three hours with Maria visiting three great authentic Argentine restaurants, sampling delicious local food. Brilliant way to try local steak, sausage and empanadas to find what we liked. Best empinadas and sausage ever tasted. Evening finished with delicious ice cream. Maria was a great host, so friendly and informative, explaining lots about local culture in BA. Gave us great recommendations for the rest of our time in the city. Great way to meet other travellers too. Highly recommend and worth the price.

So fun and great food. My boyfriend and I went on the Palermo tour with Maria, who is hilarious. She was a fabulous tour guide who was knowledgable about the food and wine and gave great tips about things to do in the city. The food was great, we were STUFFED by the end and even had leftovers for the next day. The night ended with ice cream, and Maria even bought us a ticket to ride the bus home with her since we were staying near her place. We went back to one of the restaurants the next day to try more of the menu. Highly recommend.

Great experience, host and food. We highly recommend this tour, it was one of the better things we did during our trip to argentina. The guide was very knowledgable and the restaurants and food he chose were a great variety. We went back to two of the restaurants after the tour in order to try different things on the menu. Great way to be introduced to the interesting cuisine and culture of Buenos Aires. We went on the San Telmo tour. Thanks for a great time!

Great Tour!!!. We loved the Parilla Tour and can highly recommend it!!! The food was delicious, Maria was a lot of fun, could tell us a lot about the city and was super helpful even after finishing the tour. If you like great food and wine - you have to do it!!

Great Host + Great Food & Drink = Fantastic Time. We went on this tour as a family (with a five year old) and had a great time. Maria was an excellent host and gave us background to life in Buenos Aires and Argentina that we never woulds have got otherwise. The food is delicious, the beer and wine great and Maria's hospitality fantastic! It was all-in-all it was a very entertaining way to spend an afternoon and certainly recommended. Maria also gave us a recommendation for an excellent wine shop and after the tour we purchased a varied selection of Malbec to savour back home.

Fantastic food tour in Buenos Aires. I went on this food tour with some friends and had a great time. It's a fantastic way to discover secret restaurants we would never have come across and try out delicious traditional food and Argentine wine. Maria was both informative and great fun. I would highly recommend this.

Restaurant hopping with David. Four of us had a great afternoon eating and drinking our way through Palermo with David. Our first stop was La Canita for a choripan sandwich - pretty yummy. We then went to La Zoila for empanadas and on to El Bagual for provoleta, steak and malbec. This was more food than we could possibly eat. Our final stop was Veikko for ice cream. David introduced us to the local cuisine and some off the grid restaurants. Since we love to cook and of course eat, he was a myriad of information. We would certainly do it again.

Muy rica (very tasty)!. Go- eat, chat, be informed and entertained and thank Q thank Q Maria for your enthusiasm and for pointing out that two if our chefs were female!
Viva the Parrilla Tour
Expect a thrilling time and so glad to have met Chimmy Churry.

Wonderful time out!. My husband and I first took the Parrilla Tour. We had a great time with David, who is very personable and has a lot of knowledge about Buenos Aires and the Argentinian food. I personally enjoyed every minute of the walking tour from one to other restaurants and the particular type of food in each one. Hopefully we will have a chance to go back and repeat this wonderful experience in the future.

Best shore excursion on our cruise. When I saw this culinary excursion off of our ship, it was a must. We first did a tour of the city and then met our rep from Parrilla. I wish I could remember her name but she knew her stuff. She had all of the necessary foodie background on the cuisine and then added her expertise on the Argentine wines. We started with sausage sandwiches with twp sauces, one pork and the other a twist on what I'd call German, then on to empanadas with all sorts of fillings, then on the crux of Argentine cuisine, MEAT. We started with grilled provolone cheese with olive oil accompanied by freshly baked bread and chimichurri sauce, then habachi style grilled vegetables and then grilled porterhouse steaks, grilled beef ribs, and my favorite, blood sausage. I had not had blood sausage since I lived on a ranch in south Texas. Our culinary guide said that if the sausage is warm, scoop the sausage out like pate and eat it on bread. It was delicious. Even our Australian and Brit travelers thought it was the best they've ever had. All of these course, of course, were served with wine. We then finished with the helados. I had banana and chocolate chip. What a great way to end a great day...Book this tour. It is well worth the cost.

Great tour with Maria!. My wife and I had a great time hanging out with Maria and getting to know a bunch about Las Canitas and Argentinia in general. We ate DELICIOUS food and had some wonderful conversation. Being at the Bogedon that we went to felt like hanging out with family (even though everyone only spoke Spanish) purely from the ambiance. After capping off the tour with some AMAZING ice cream we weren't sure how to get back to our place (given that a walk would be tough post-belly stuffing and a taxi just didn't seem right). Thankfully Maria did us a solid and brought us on the bus (a bonus experience) which was phenomenally easy. Do YOURSELF a solid and book this tour!

Let there be meat.... We had a BLAST on the San Telmo tour with Maria. She was a charming, engaging, funny and knowledgeable guide who really took the time to help us get the most out of our experience. The food was just fantastic, and it was nice to get our bearings in San Telmo - we ended up coming back to this area several times during our visit. This tour was definitely one of the highlights of our stay in Buenos Aires - highly recommend!
Maria was great fun. Went on this tour with my 17 and 19 year old. We all had a great time. Good food, good wine, good company. Fun extended lunch and learnt a bit about B.A. Thanks Maria
Great Tour. I did the San Telmo lunch tour. Maria was an a great tour guide and we had some delicious food. Highly recommended.
