Great Tour!. We did the Parmelo tour, it was a great way to see some of the more local food options and included a fantastic lunch. There was plenty meat and wine at the main stop. The tour guide was also very helpful and would highly recommend for anyone to do this tour.

You won't be disappointed!. Went on the San Telmo lunch tour. Maria was an excellent guide, food is delicious, and San Telmo is a neighborhood not to be missed. Arrangements could not have been easier including a last minute add on of one adult and two kids. Great group of people and Maria welcomed all of us, kids included, and made the day so enjoyable. Wishing we could have participated in the new wine tour that was being offered, but guess that will have to wait for a return trip.

Non-stop Excitement & Entertainment: Coupled with great food, vino & personality. If you wish to spend a few very entertaining hours samling some of the great foods and wines of Argentina while being entertained & informed, Maia is your #1 guide! While the food & wine is great throughput the city Maria brings the entire experience together. A super non-stop tour for all ages Took two different tours with her & both were welll worth the experienceWould suggest taking a tour with Maria early upon your arrival in BA to help you understand the city & culture.

Absolutely Worthwhile. We had arrived in BA late the night before so we're feeling a bit tired and disorganised (had not had a chance to get Argentinian pesos yet) but I'm so glad we went on this tour- it's unique and a fabulous introduction to the diversity of Argentinian food and wine. David was incredibly knowledgable and helpful and we had a fun group. I would recommend this as something to do when you first arrive in BA, worth every cent! You will eat some seriously good food - so don't have too much breakfast...

Great Introduction to the tastes of Buenos Aires. Santiago Palermo takes a small group through various neighborhood restaurants in the Palermo area. We to four different local establishments and had meals ranging from sausages to empanadas and a full steak dinner that we participated in helping to cook. Then ended with some of the best ice cream I ever tasted. These restaurants were off the beaten paths and not along the usual tourist areas. Santiago explained each dish as we enjoyed the meal. It was well worth the visit.

Great introduction to BA food!. My boyfriend and I booked a private tour with David on a Sunday. We met him at our first stop, a local restaurant for our appetizer. We had a delicious chorizo sausage served on a bun with chimichurri and tried the local alcoholic drink, fernet. I wasn’t wild about fernet but my boyfriend liked it. We then continued on to the next local restaurant all within walking distance and had delicious empanadas. David was very informative. He is from Oregon and his mother is from BA so he is bi-lingual. We continued on to our next stop for the traditional parilla—delicious melt-in-your-mouth beef. I would highly recommend this foodie tour to anyone. David was a delight and what a great way to get introduced to the local food.
Lunch meat feast. Always great to eat the local food. Fantastic lunch tour. Recommend to all. The meat and wine very plentiful. Tour guide was fantastic, very helpful.

Must do tour in BA!!!. We absolutely feel in love with BA and the food culture here after this tour. The tour is very intimate and the guide is fantastic value - lovely and very knowledgable of the BA food scene. Would highly recommend this tour. Food and wine were absolutely delicious - would do the tour again tomorrow if we could.

Excellent food, fine and guide. Our guide Maria was great, explaining various things about Porteño food and drinks. Each of the 3 stops had great food and I felt full and happy at the end. Highly recommended.

Amazing food and wine, and so much more!. The Parrilla tour was fantastic! Not only was all the food (steak and ice cream and empanadas and many other things) and wine delicious, but Maria, our host, was super knowledgeable about all the things to see and do in Buenos Aires and around Argentina and gave everyone great tips on where to go next and what to do. Highly recommended!

Great tour of Buenos Aires food scene. We really enjoyed the Parilla Tour—we were able to get a wide sampling of Buenos Aires food, and hear a lot about the history of the city. The tour is great way to experience restaurants that might seem hard to get into if you're not a local. And our host, Maria Jose Semino, was excellent!

Brilliant way to start our BA experience!. Maria was a brilliant guide for our Parilla tour, very knowledgeable. Each of the four stops were great and different from the last. There was so much food along the way and the ice cream was a delicious way to end the tour. Definitely allow some time after , to firstly quiz Maria on more great tips and then to wander through Palermo afterwards. Very highly recommend!

Delicious food in special restaurants. I did the tour twice, in Palermo and one week later in San Telmo. I like the familiar atmosphere and the discussions with the international guests. And of course the good food. Maria is a wonderful host telling us a lot of the neighbarhood and the selected restaurants. The Palermo Tour is a bit better than San Telmo, the food is more exquisit.Thanks for two wonderful apointments.

Great food, host, and people!. I highly recommend this tour! We did the one in Palermo in the evening. Maria was awesome! She's so friendly and fun and knows her food! The food was some of the best we tasted during our 3 week stay in Argentina. We did it at the end of the trip and very glad we did as it's hard to find the 'right' spots in such a big city. The other people on the tour were a lot of fun too which made the night even more memorable. Maria went above and beyond with tips and information and even arranged a suprise slice of birthday cake with a candle as it was my husbands birthday! You won't be disappointed.

Parrilla Tour: great introduction to BA's authentic food in Palermo - take this tour first!. My wife and I booked the Parrilla Tour for a Friday afternoon via the Internet. The booking was confirmed promptly via e-mail. On Thursday morning we received an e-mail from Julietta advising that we were the only booking for Friday at noon and offering us the choice of a private Friday tour or to join a larger tour on Saturday. We joined the Saturday tour and were glad that we did, since the tour is more fun with a group. The two couples with us were delightful companions from the UK, India and the US. We enjoyed sharing travel and dining tips over the ample servings of food, beer and wine. Our guide, Maria, spoke clear English and was a great social director, helping us all to meet and enjoy our time together. Maria was also very knowledgeable about Argentine food and wine and a friendly and helpful host. Our tour began at a local Parrilla. It was the type of bar-restaurant that only a local would frequent, but the chorizo sandwich and local beer got us off to a great start. We then walked a few blocks to an empanada restaurant. The empanadas were fantastic, baked and flavorful. The empanadas were paired with white wine. Maria even called ahead to arrange for a special empanada for a guest with food allergies. After the empanadas, we walked a few more blocks to an historic restaurant that is noted for its adherence to tradition. We were allowed to stand behind the counter at the grill for photos. We enjoyed sausages, steak, ribs, grilled vegetables and the most amazing grilled provolone cheese rounds. The food was plentiful and more than the group could eat and we enjoyed some great Argentine wines again. After stuffing ourselves, we strolled a few more blocks to a gelato shop. The gelatos were beautifully displayed and there was an amazing choice of flavors and mixtures. At the end of our three hours together, Maria provided a list of restaurant recommendations. A few words of wisdom: (1) Be sure that you book this tour very early in your visit so that you can gain a better understanding of authentic local food and take advantage of the restaurant recommendations. (2) Instruct your taxi driver to drop you exactly at the meeting point. Ours dropped us about four blocks away and pointed us in the wrong direction. We had to ask several times for directions since we had forgotten the map that Parrilla Tours had e-mailed to us. Bring your map, our use Google on your phone. (3) Come hungry: the food and wine is very plentiful!
Best food tour in Buenos Aires. Maria was a fantastic host and really enjoyed this tour. The food was delicious and she took us to some very authentic local spots. Definitely recommend this tour.

Authentic, delicious, and fun!. We really enjoyed our night tour with Maria. It was very relaxed and we felt like we were eating with friends. Every restaurant had delicious items—you will not go hungry on this tour! Maria was a wonderful guide. We would highly recommend the Parilla Tour at night— can't imagine eating that much food at lunch! Thank you for a wonderful time!

Excellent Food Tour!!!. This was one of my favorite tours which was VERY REASONABLY PRICED!!! it was a great way and cool experience to explore and see Buenos Aires, Argentina! Santiago was my tour guide and he was great! Very good English, great personality, very nice and made the group of 6 of us feel comfortable and enhanced the food tour experience. I signed up for the Palermo Dinner tour, we went to several very local and authentic places to eat and the food was delicious! I love hole in the wall places where locals know about and go to eat and this is the perfect tour for me! Highly recommend the tour and I wished I had time for the other location tour which I plan to attend again if or when I visit Argentina again!

Fabulous San Telmo tour! Awesome guide! A must do!. We took this tour a few days into arriving in BA - we signed up last minute and Juliet quickly responded and sent detailed directions to the meeting place. Maria (our guide) was awesome; her English was excellent and she had great energy and was very down to earth - she was also extremely knowledgable so we really felt we learnt a lot (wish we could have had more tours with her!). We went to four different locations - at each the staff were great, and each offered a different type of dining experience which we really appreciated. SO great to have a local who is able and willing to explain every detail of your experience. I emailed her days later with a few general tourist questions and she answered them with great detail and suggestions. We would HIGHLY recommend this tour to those shortly after arriving in BA. Perfect way to start your trip and provide the foray into learning about BA. Thanks Maria!

Excellent chilled out tour, with a brilliant guide, book it now!. I wasn't sure what to expect from this tour, but I shouldn't have hesitated - Maria is amazing! Within minutes I felt like I was having an afternoon hanging out with old friends. She will take you to local restaurants off the tourist trail, where the locals eat. Indeed everyone knows her so you feel part of the community. If you're after a fun way to get to grips with the city this is it. Maria's knowledge of the local area but also the country's politics and recommendations on where to go next make this a great thing to do at the start of your stay. Fantastic, cannot recommend this enough!! Thank you Maria for such a fun tour, great food, wine and company (and I've had a few more fernet & colas since you introduced me to them!!)

Fantastic authentic local food!. We had a great tour with Maria who showed us the local food in local places we would not have found on our own. It was great to sample local food after a week of getting the tourist versions and we recommend people try this tour for a genuine taste of Buenos Aires :)

marian is the best. maria makes it all.she took us to 4 different places,recomanded the food in each of them delicius,got us good wine paring for each.we ended up with yummi ice cream.this is not typical tourist places....we ate with the locals.

Awesome authentic foodie tour. I joined this small group tour of San Telmo on 6 March and I'd have to say it was a real highlight of BA! Maria the tour guide was excellent and I thought for what was included it was great value for money. I'd recommend doing the tour at the beginning of your stay - because Maria has so really good recommendations for restaurants to check out in BA!

Amazing food, company and tour!. The tour really is great. Maria was a fantastic guide, friendly, chatty and enthusiastic. The food is incredible, come prepared for a lot of meat! Really interesting to find out more about Argentinas food culture, and to try it with plenty of wine. I can't recommend this tour enough, thanks Maria!

Maria was the highlight!. Maria was an awesome guide to the San Telmo tour we took. Of the four places we ate, the empanadas were at a wonderful small, family joint was the best, whereas the other three places I may have discovered on my own. The best part was Maria; she was funny, personable, friendly, and shared some history of San Telmo as well as Argentinian culture. Her description about "milongas" (where I went a few nights later) was spot on! I would recommend this if you don't want to do the "homework" yourself but want to learn a little bit about Argentine food and culture.

OK food, but not much of a 'tour'. Because of the great reviews about a tour through food AND culture we decided to do the Parilla-tour (San Telmo one). The food we had was really nice (the empanadas we started with really were one of the best we've had up to now). David was a nice guy and we had a nice group of people, but other than that it wasn't really a 'tour'. It was just walking in a straight line from one place to the next with not much of a talk in between. We really had to do our best to pull some information about the neighbourhood and the food out of David. Also, the 4 places we visited were no more than 1 - 1,5 block apart so we didn't really see much of San Telmo.Maybe the Palermo one is better, but we weren't that impressed unfortunately.

unique experience. Maria who led our tour was truly a joy. She is smart, witty and a great conversational list. The tour had us visiting four local food spots that would not be on a tourist itenarary. So local in flare. We would not go back to the spots on our own - but as a tour they were solid. Nice day outing that can be part of a bigger day.

Great exeprience. Loved the food and the experience! David was not only a great guide, explaining foods and the local culture, but was also very helpful with the other stuff while we were in Buenos Aires. Thanks for an awesome experience David! Would definitely like to try the San Telmo tour, when we return.

Great food in hidden places. I thoroughly enjoyed the food tour in the Palermo area of Buenos Aires. We certainly would never have experienced such wonderfully authentic food at these 4 culinary treasures if it wasn't for this tour. The choripan was out of this world along with the beautifully baked empanadas. The 2 different steak cuts, vegetables, provoleta, salad and some wonderful Malbec rounded out by 'to die for' gelato made this experience one to remember. These guys were not only knowledgeable but so warm and welcoming. A phenomenal addition to my already great stay in Buenos Aires.
Awesome Experience. I "dined" in an amazing array of local restaurants in the Palermo area of Buenos Aires last night; still salivating. Good job!

Delicious and fun tour. I had a great time on the San Telmo tour as we stopped in four different restaurants, each very distinctive and special. The food was very good, including some beef empanadas, hot-off-the-grill choripan, and two cuts of steaks (served medium-rare), plus some hearty Malbec. What's more, I felt full but not too stuffed when it was over.Santiago was the perfect master of ceremonies, keeping it light and fun, with some information mixed in throughout. The six-member group was just the right size and we all got on well from the start. San Telmo was a great backdrop for the experience and at 2.5 hours it went by all too quickly.

Delicious afternoon stroll through San Telmo. I love the San Telmo area and specifically, the Mercado San Telmo. So I was thrilled that our parrilla tour weaved us in and out of family-run establishments in the surrounding area, one of the oldest, most vibrant and most historic in Buenos Aires. Santiago is extremely knowledgeable about his city and shared tidbits of information about food and culture throughout our 2.5 hour tour. At one point, he mentioned that it doesn't even feel like work and you can see that he means it - he enjoys just getting to know the food-loving people who come from all over the world and join this tour.As for the food itself - what a brilliant introduction to the treasured staples of Argentina. We visited four shops or restaurants, all within easy walking distance, and feasted on empanadas and choripan at the first two stops, before moving on to a parrilla where we sat down to sample two cuts of steak along with salad, provoleta and a lovely Malbec. Our small group of six really enjoyed getting to know one another and by the time we came to our final stop for ice cream (definitely get the dulce de leche!) we parted as friends. If possible, take this tour early in your trip as you will also receive a helpful list of restaurants and bars to take with you. Top it off with personalized recommendations from your guide and it's a great way to ensure the rest of your visit to Buenos Aires will be delicious. Buen provecho!

Unbeatable Buenos Aires Experience!. The San Telmo parrilla tour led by Santiago was a major highlight of my visit to Buenos Aires. We visited authentic, local places that I might never have found otherwise and I am so glad to have had the experience! Definitely come hungry, as you will get a chance to sample delicious empanadas, choripan, parrilla-grilled steaks (along with salad, provoleta, and malbec), and finally locally made ice cream! Everything was delicious and Santiago was a fantastic tour guide. You could tell he really enjoys giving the tour and he has a lot of great recommendations for places to eat and drink around the city. You don't want to miss this tour!

Dining and dancing in Palermo. Debbie (my wife) and I were taken on a great dining and dancing tour of part of Palermo by Maria Jose Semino. We took in 4 restaurants for appetizers, mains and sweets and then off to a Milonga dance hall to see how the locals dance tango. Maria did a great job and it was a chance to see the city through the eyes of someone who clearly enjoys living there. The conversation was lively and took in all aspects of cultural and political life and for us was as important a part of the evening as the sights. Maria's command of English is excellent. We started at 8.00 p.m. and back at the hotel for 1:30 am which was great. We were in very good hands and felt safe at all times. Really recommend this tour and this guide!!
San Telmo walking/food tour. Lush ice cream zabaglionedelicious steaklovely sausagecracking empanadasand of course beer and wineand of course Maria

Excellent tour. We had Maria as our tour guide and she did a great job explaining about the food and history of the various places we visited in Palermo. All of the food was excellent and overall the tour was great value for money. The recommendations paper provided at the end of the tour is also very handy and if you do this early in your trip you can then sample all of their recommendations.

Fabulous food walking tour of Palermo, Buenos Aires. Just finished the best tour of my four day stay in Buenos Aires. Maria Jose Semino provided an indepth explanation of the local flavors and Argentinian history in the Palerrmo district of Buenos Aires. The local restaurants provided excellent food and ambiance that could not be found on any tourist list. I highly recommend asking for Maria as your guide, she is utterly delightful. A definte must for those travelers that love to get off the beaten path.

Must visit. Great food and excellent tour guide. Great 2.5-3 hours tour. The 'choripan' was excellent with a great 'chimichurri' sauce and 'provenzal' sauce. The empanadas were very good, with a light crunchy crust and a soft tender and tasty filling. The parrilla (steakhouse), gave us a very good service with a tender beef cooked to perfection. Excellent ice cream for dessert. The highlight of the tour was our guide, Maria. She was friendly, lively and very knowledgeable. I highly recommend this tour.

Can't miss if you are in Buenos Aires!. As many of the other reviews have said, Maria is awesome!! She knows a lot about the city and the food and can answer any questions you have!We went on the San Telmo tour at noon and it was fabulous! Delicious Empanadas to start with beer, then we moved on to enjoy a delicious choripan with chimmichuri, then on to even more delicious meat with more chimmichuri! We ended the tour with Ice cream! What we loved about the San Telmo tour is that is shows you where locals eat and the neighborhood has a lot of beautiful architecture and history!MUST GO IF YOU ARE IN BUENOS AIRES!

Fun, professional & delicious!. My husband and I did the tour on Friday Jan 30, 2015 and it has been one of the highlights of our visit to BA. David and Maria are knowledgeable and selected really excellent places for us to sample some traditional fare. The other visitors also were fun to be around...Highly recommend.

great way for foodies to experience authentic BA food from locals. My husband and I went on this 3 hour tour yesterday and the food, people, and ambiance were great! At the end our guide gave us lots of written tips regarding wine, her favorite restaurants, and some of the best local gelato shops. Very welcoming and met other travelers from around the globe.

Great parilla tour with great service. We just finished the parilla tour in Palermo. It was very nice. The organizers even let us drop off our luggage as we are going to fly out of Buenos Aires the same day.

The Most Important Part. When I visit a city I like to walk around so you see the people and how they live.Maria showed the city is about the people and food. I have never seen a restaurant that has a band saw (to cut meat) beside the grill--- and grilled vegetables!! To top it off sent us off to some community tango hall---just amazing. Thank you so much---The night with new friends (who I met on the tour) was very special.

Really fun. We went on a parilla tour I Palermo with excellent guide Maria. She was really fun and told us many interesting things about Argentina and the food culture. It's a relaxed tour and you get a lot of food.

Delicious Discovery. What a wonderful way to find out about the people of Buenos Aires through their delicious food delicacies. Our guide, Maria was enthusiastic and led us through four distinctly different eating and drinking experiences. It was a very enlightening way to learn about the ways of immigration into Argentina through its food. Highly recommended!

Fantastic Culinary Adventure!. I'm a professional travel writer/videographer, and was lucky enough to join a small tour as part of a story on Educational Tourism. Argentine food is one of the top reasons I return to the country again and again, and learning more about its origins, culture, and preparations was such a great experience. Our guide was exceptional and by the end of the tour I felt as if we were best friends. It's the perfect way to spend an afternoon!

Excellent Parrilla. We loved our time touring the Palermo area with Maria. She is a lively host with lots of great local information. We toured with a group of about 20 and it was great to meet people from all over the world. We tried a range of traditional Argentinian foods which were delicious!

Best part of my trip. I am not a foodie, but I absolutely loved this tour. Maria is fabulous - friendly, vivacious, enthusiastic, and completely knowledgeable in both Argentine cuisine and the delights of the San Telmo neighborhood. In large part due to her personality, our group of four (Maria + three participants) clicked almost immediately, and it felt like eating friends rather than going on a tour. I also deeply appreciate the fact that nobody was trying to sell us unsolicited photos or add-ons of any kind - Maria showed us the market because she wanted us to see/appreciate it. It helps that she knows everyone and the locals love her - as did we. I highly recommend this tour - if I hadn't done anything else in Buenos Aires, this tour would have been more than enough to make the long trip totally worthwhile.

Excellent Cuisine Tour. We went on both the San Telmo and Palermo tours, and they both were excellent. Great food and wine, and very informative guide. A great way to see some of the real Buenos Aires.

**EXCELLENT FOOD TOUR OF BUENOS AIRES**. Thanks to David, we had a nice private food tour of Palermo.From empanadas to perfectly grilled steak (paired with Malbec, of course), we had a great time exploring the neighborhood and trying authentic Argentinian food.David explained and answered all of our questions about culture, food, and yes, even soccer.We ended it with ice cream (I chose dulce de leche) and it was the perfecting ending to our tour.HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Eat meat...and more meat!. Maria led three of us around San Telmo to 4 restaurants we never would've gotten to see otherwise (esp. since our hotel was in the Recoleta neighborhood). Get ready to eat more than god intended...and lots of beef. All good! Though the tour was supposed to last only 2 hours, we were together happily for 3.5 hours for our midday run. Did not have to eat for the rest of the day.Maria's English was spot-on and she answered all questions easily. We also walked through a cool covered food/antiques market. The ice cream at the end was such a treat--2 scoops with more than 50 flavors to choose from (Argentines love their ice cream)...we tried the beer-flavored (with peanuts!) ice cream on a tiny spoon but it tasted way too much like beer...grin!

Great Food, Lively Comentary. Our tour started out with chorizo buns and Argentinian liqueur in a local cafe frequented by friendly locals, The next stop featured empanadas with a light crunchy crust and soft tender filling.But the highlight was the parilla (steakhouse), which at first glance didn't look like anywhere I'd willingly eat, but turned out to be spotlessly clean and atmospheric. Don't listen to people who tell you meat is always cooked well-done in Argentina. Everything we had was cooked to perfection.We were stuffed when we left, but managed to finish with the best ice cream I've ever had at our final destination.Our guide, Maria, was as good as the food. She was friendly, lively and full of knowledge on topics from the Argentinian wine industry to horse racing. And she taught us the proper way to eat empanadas.What a great way to spend a few hours in Buenos Aires!

A great introduction to Argentinian cuisine. Thanks to a last minute cancellation we had the privilege of a private tour with Santiago and David. We enjoyed the variety and authentic nature of the restaurants on the tour. These are hidden gems that we would not have discovered on our own. The guides showed a real passion for Argentinian cuisine and culture and we appreciated the time spent together. It was a great way to spend an evening and a wonderful start to our trip. We highly recommend this to any foodie or those looking for a great intro to the BA food scene. Thank you!

Awesome tour of the Real Buenos Aires with real food. Maria could not have been a better guide, friend or teacher about true Argentinian food. She taught us about how Argentinians eat and what they eat. She also taught us about Palermo,B.A. and Argentina.We were three women who had been touring all day and showed up early at the meeting place. We intended to just wait until the appointed time but Maria saw us, came out and immediately started taking care of our needs-even apologizing that the food was not ready! Within minutes we felt that she was our friend rather than a tour guide.The tour included choripan, a true empanada restaurant with a whole list of different types of empanadas, meat--true Argentina style and ice cream. At each stop our dietary restrictions were honored (gluten free and no pork). The walk between stops allowed us to further learn about the area. Maria is so easy going that we forgot she was a guide and really thought of her as our friend.This was truly one of the top highlights of a trip full of fantastic experiences. Thank you Maria for showing us the real B.A. and its food.
Wonderful time. We booked this one afternoon and were very glad we did. Interesting food and drink and in places we never could have found by ourselves. Highly recommended!

Amazing food!. Great tour, we did have a lot of people but there were 2 guides. I was still able to have great conversation and meet fellow travelers -- I would recommend this to people who are traveling alone.This tour is great because you find some special places that you would not otherwise have gone to. Up until this tour, I have never found Argentina to be my favorite style of empanadas. If you gave me a choice I would choose another country as my fave. However, this tour put me on to empanadas saltenas (place name: La Zoila). The best I've ever had in Argentina. Crisp, not too much dough, and if I'm not mistaken these were still baked like the rest of the country. Also nice, juicy and hot!

Highlight of the vacation. This was just an amazing experience. I don't know how many times people recommended "the best restaurant in Buenos Aires" to us. I'm so glad we didn't go to one of their places and instead spent the evening with Maria on the Parrilla Tour.We had such a great time eating and drinking our way around Palermo. It was no nice to eat where the locals eat and not where the tourists eat. Maria's knowledge of food and Argentina itself was great. She was able to answer all of our questions and provide some great perspective about her city and country.This was a great time and I highly recommend it.

Wonderful!!!. We were a group of 5 young foodies and we were blown away by this tour! Expert guide, hole-in-wall eateries we would have never found ourselves! The food was delicious everywhere we went! Would recommend this to ANYONE!

Delicious and fun way to explore the food of Buenos Aires. We spent a lovely afternoon on the Parilla Tour with Maria as our guide. The food was fantastic and it gave us a very helpful introduction to eating in Argentina. Highly recommended.

A great time eating and drinking. This tour is a great introduction to Argentinian food and drink. Three small restaurants and an ice cream shop left everyone in the group full and satisfied. Our guide was knowledgeable and handled the group of about 15 people nicely. This tour took place in the Palermo area. We are now looking forward to the tour based in San Telmo on Monday.

Great food, great wine, great company, a must do tour!. We went on our tour with Maria and large group of tourists from all over the world. The tour had four unique stops, each one offered a different dish and a bit of history about the Palermo district. Maria is a great time, full of energy with a great sense of humour, she speaks fluent english and made us all feel very welcome. The food was awesome and truly authentic, a must do if visiting Buenos Aires!

Good afternoon tour around Las Cañitas. I done this afternoon eating and drinking tour with Maria. Had a delightful few hours with her and a couple from the USA.She was very warm, friendly and knowledgeable of the local food, drinks and culture etc. As well as speaking fluent English.We started by having one of the national drinks Fernet & Choripán (sausage sandwich) which were delicious. (Fernet has a unique taste!) Worth a try though.Then we went along to eat and learn all about the different Empanandas that are made in a restaurant that only served empanadas and they were delicious! They were made and prepared properly in lovely pastery which made a change from a lot you buy that are horrible. Made properly they are great.Then we went to a local restuarant which you wouldn't even know was a such as it's hidden. Full of the locals daily we had delicious parrilla meat, Itailian cheese, salad and red wine. The last stop was an Italian Ice-Cream for dessert which there was a big selection and equally great. Lovelt afternoon and would thank Maria & David who I booked the tour through.

A fun afternoon in Palermo. My wife and I did this tour with Maria. There were 5 other couples and one single. The other couples came from Australia, Scotland, USA, Canada and Mexico. It was a casual and sociable tour and Maria provided good information along the way. There was heaps of food and wine - particularly at the bbq place and we had ice cream at the end to finish off. I think that food walking tours of this kind are one of the best things to do in a new city and this was a good one. Highly recommended.

A great way to discover BA food. I went on this fantastic tour with Maria and had a great time. She is fun to chat with and we ate wonderful, local food. We had beer, empanadas, wine, steak, veggies, salad, and handmade ice cream. It was better than expected and a highlight of my trip. I highly recommend it.

Fantastic Food Tour. I did the Palermo food tour with Santiago and two fellow guests, which made this a very intimate evening and as a result it did not really feel like a tour but a nice evening out with fellow foodies. I really enjoyed this tour as it gave me the chance to sample restaurants which I would have been much too intimated to frequent on my own. Santiago is really passionate both about food and the Palermo district and it was a really nice way to spend an evening and get to know the neighbourhood. The food we sampled was fantastic all along and we even went to a "secret" restaurant which is behind a closed door - unless someone is in the know, there is no way a stranger to the city would ever manage to step foot in the door. The evening was finished off with some very nice ice cream. All in all I can really hghly recommend this tour and would definitely do this again - maybe the San Telmo tour next time....

Awesome food, awesome vino, awesome Maria. I did the Palermo food tour with a mix of couples and a few fellow single travellers. It was great fun, and met some great people over tasty meat and vino, and a massive thanks to our guide Maria for making it happen.The tour takes you to some great little places, which I'd definitely fancy going back to individually when I'm back in Buenos Aires with more time. We went to 4 places to have choripan, empanada, parrilla and ice cream, with lots of vino en route. Very hard to choose a favourite but the parrilla with lots of tasty, tender steak and amazing red wine probably wins but all were great!I learned a lot about Argentinean food and wine, and even onto wider areas such as history of Buenos Aires and much more. Maria is a very knowledgeable and fun guide, top marks! I think there is another food tour that the same company does in San Telmo, can't wait to try it on my next visit across.Enjoy the tour, you won't regret it!!

Amazing food tour!. Santiago was so fantastic! We learned some history of Palermo and ate amazing food. Parilla was able to accommodate both my and my friend's food allergies. We frequented all the locations from the tour again during our stay. I highly recommend Parilla Tours.

Parilla Tour BA was a blast!. What a great experience. My wife and I joined a group of 7 others on the Parilla Food Tour of Palermo. Maria was our guide and she was fantastic. Very knowledgeable of the country, history, culture and of course the cuisine. She was very friendly and had a great personality keeping the tour fresh and upbeat and making sure everyone was comfortable and enjoying themselves. The tour lasted a little under 4 hours including four stops of delicious local favorites. Starting with choripan and fernet, moving to hand made empanadas, and then a feast of salad, steak, ribs and plenty of red wine, finally ending with gelato, the whole experience was one to remember. If you are looking for a relaxed, enjoyable experience walking the city and tasting the local cuisine, this tour is for you. Highly recommended.

Great food and great guide!. The Parrilla Tour in San Telmo was great! The empanadas, Choripan, Steak, and ice cream along with wine and beer all hit the spot! Most of all, our guide, Maria, was awesome as well. I highly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to see a good part of B.A. and enjoy some great food and company.

Great Food Tour in a Buenos Aires Neighborhood. The Parrilla Tour took us to several local restaurants to try typical Argentinian food including asado (charcoalled beef) and empanadas. The food was really great. The tour guide is Argentinian but grew up in the US. He was very knowledgeable about the food and wine (which is really good in Argentina). I would do this tour again and wish I had done it at the beginning of our visit so I would know more about what to eat.

Great Eating Tour. We had a great time on our food tour of Palermo. We wanted to do the tour on a Sunday, when there is not usually a tour offered. David arranged a private tour for 4 of us, which was great. We went to four locations, and the food was outstanding at all of them. All of the places were great, but our favorite was the steak, which was extremely tasty and tender. Our guide Maria was outstanding, and her English was excellent. We highly recommend the tour.

great introduction to Buesnos Aires. We booked this tour for our first full day in Buenos Aires. It was a great way to taste great local foods and visit special places we would not have found. The "Secret" place for our main course was so full of locals and with no signage outside besides the "closed" sign we would have never found it. We took advantage of their list of favorite places to eat also.

Great food tour to taste the local flavors. There were 4 of use who went on this tour after spending 4 days in Buenos Aires. I highly recommend taking this tour upon the first day you can go on the tour as you will learn the local food and flavors to order and visit other restaurants. We would not have discovered these local restaurants if not for this tour being a tourist.You learn about the history of the local area as well as how the local food was developed and established tradition that continues today. You get to enjoy 4 courses and walk around the neighborhood. Be ready to eat and recommend not to have a big meal before going on this tour. There's plenty of food to taste and eat!David was our tour guide and he lived in the US for sometime before moving back to Buenos Aires. He speaks perfect English and can take you on this amazing food tour journey.Again, I recommend for those to take this tour on your first day after arrival in BA! You will know what to order when visiting other restaurants if you want the local flavors.

BEST TOUR EVER. The best thing we did in BA by far was the Parilla Tour. I went with a group of girls from NYC who love food (I am a chef myself), and this tour really allows you to experience authentic and delicious local cuisine. The tour guide/company owner Santi speaks wonderful English and was a great resource for the rest of our trip. Could not recommend this more highly!!!

Most memorable moment in BA. This was a fantastic activity and the highlight of my time in Buenos Aires. We had a large group of 11 and Maria was our guide. She made the experience. She was fun, informative, and knew exactly how to cater to our group. My favorite aspect of the tour was that it focused on small, out of the way places, not the largest tourist spots. I highly recommend this tour, and I encourage you to ask for Maria by name. You will not be disappointed. I just wish all my lunches as home included empanadas and Malbec!

Buenos Aires Vacay Highlight. The Parrilla Tour was a highlight of my first-time visit to Argentina. The tour was perfectly structured, our guide David was knowledgeable and charming and the food was excellent. Each restaurant we visited - for choripan, an empanada, steak and ice cream - was authentic, off-the-beaten-tourist-path, and felt like a wonderful, organic discovery. It can be challenging to get a glimpse of a city's real culture and restaurants when you're unfamiliar and reliant on guide books, but Parilla Tour solves this challenge (in BA, at least!). We did it at the outset of our trip which I highly recommend - was a great introduction to the city, its traditions and neighborhoods, and the guides will give you scores of tips on where to eat/drink/go for the duration of your visit, no matter how specific of a request you have - it's like having a personal tour guide at your fingertips and makes the tour cost well worth it.

Great tour, great food. This tour was great, wonderful guide and plenty of good food. We did the lunch tour in Palermo which starts with choripan, then empanadas, then the secret parilla with all the meat, and finally ice cream. I really enjoyed all of these, but the empanadas were awesome. Plenty of meat all around, especially in the secret parilla (literally has a sign on the door that says closed). It was great to learn more about the local food and to eat at places that we would have otherwise missed. Overall great tour!

Great BA experience. I've now visited Buenos Aires 3 times, so I've eaten my share of steaks and other delicious Argentine food, but I thought it was great to go on this tour to go to some places I otherwise wouldn't have gone and learn a lot about the food I had been eating (and try some things I wouldn't have known to order!) and get to know the city a bit more in the process. I'm not normally somebody who goes on a lot of tours as part of my travels, but I'm really glad my friend and I decided to go on the Parrilla Tour with David. The group size was ideal, David was fantastic and full of information, and I really enjoyed meeting the other people on our tour as well. David also shared some great recs on other places to eat and visit while in BA and the places he suggested were among our favorite meals on the trip. I think it especially is the perfect experience to do near the beginning of a visit to BA to get the scoop on the food and hear David's recs to make the most of the rest of your trip.He mentioned that they've recently launched a new food tour in Mendoza and I wish we could have gone on that too!

Perfect for foodies and locavores!. We had a fantastic parilla tour of Palermo on October 30th with David! Since the Friday tour was booked for a special group, they went out of their way to schedule a separate tour for us on a Thursday. Great local spots and delicious food. Perfect first day in BA since David provided such great recommendations for eating and drinking during the rest of our time in BA. Wonderful experience - I would highly recommend!

Great Food. This tour was fantastic. Our guide David was very pleasant and helpful. He provided information about the neighborhood and the food culture in Argentina. Finishing the tour with good gelato was the best way to conclude the experience. I thought the booking fee was expensive at first, but now that I have experienced the tour I realize the price is well worth the experience.

A wonderful way to enjoy Argentina. We met David for a delightful tour of local restaurants...and the food was delicious! It was truly a great way to sample local flavor of non touristy neighborhood restaurants. David also provided lots of great recommendations for the rest of our trip. Highly recommend.

Neighborhood Parrilla Buenos Aires. We had a wonderful time with David pf Parrilla Tour Buenos Aires. We went to a small Parrilla on a side street in a residential neighborhood. Although the sign outside said closed,the restaurant was clearly open and filled with families from the neighborhood.. The steaks,sweet breads,salads and malbec wine were all superb and a great bargain. The restaurant was pleasant and the service superb. David was a genial host and guide. This was a great evening. Highly recommended. Bill and Kay

Amazing local food. We did the Palermo day tour with our guide Majo and two others. Majo made the tour so fantastic with her knowledge and love for food. All the food (I won't say what we had as it's better a surprise), was fantastic and there was a good mix of bite size snacks, big meat portions and desserts. Would have done another tour if we had time

Favourite tour in BA!. We had a terrific evening with Majo (Maria), David and Santi along with 6 guests in total. We sampled amazing food at each place and had a plenty of laughs during the night. A lovely night out in Palermo and a great experience!

Great way to learn about parilla and have fun dining with new people!. This is a fun, interesting and tasty tour! My husband and I are in Buenos Aires for a conference and we had some extra time to see the city. I spotted this on Trip Advisor and it was truly a great afternoon. Our tour guide, Maria, took us to an interesting series of small restaurants in the Las Canitas area of Palermo to sample different types of parillas. We might have just been lucky but there were about 10 other people-- all people we enjoyed talking to about traveling in South America. We started with Chorizo, moved on to empanadas, steaks of various types, sweetbreads and ended up with fantastic ice cream. Excellent food tour!

Best introduction to Buenos Aires. After quickly dropping off our bags at our hotel in Palermo, we jumped in a taxi to the start point (only about 5 minutes away) to delve straight into the local food scene. We didn't intentionally plan it, but looking back, we couldn't have asked for a better way to start our trip to Buenos Aires. Our guide was the best, very warm and great at explaining local food, wine and customs, and give us excellent recommendations. The format of the tour was great since it was well organized, but laid back and fun. The food was outstanding, and we even returned to the first stop for another choripan sandwich a few days later!

Great introduction to the cuisine of BA. David, an American ex-pat, Santi, a native of BA, and MaJito, a spunky and well-travelled native of nearby La Pampa, took us to three different restaurants where we sampled meat in a variety of forms. Our tour guides were informative and knowledgeable about both the food and the culture. This was a great introduction to Buenos Aires.

Great time and great eats. We took a tour on a sunny Saturday with Maria as our guide. Had a great time visiting three restaurants and ending up at a fantastic ice cream shop. The food was a good mix (chorizo sandwiches, empanadas, steak), though probably not ideal for vegetarians (we enjoyed when Maria mentioned that past vegetarians on the tour ordered chicken). The steak stop actually was a full meal complete with wine. Walking around the Palermo neighborhood was a nice way to work off the food and to see a bit of a non-touristy neighborhood. Highly recommend this tour and Maria as a guide if you have a few hours.

Not to be missed!. We enjoyed an evening out with Majo for a culinary trip of great places in Palermo. Although Argentine food is not new to us, we learned all kinds of wonderful and interesting new things. interspersed with walks and stops at different restaurants, we tasted amazing food at each place and got to know the group better with each bite. Majo is not only very knowledgeable but she is an absolute delight, super simpatica! An overall great experience for anyone wanting to know more about Argentine food and neighborhoods.

Scenic Free Choice activity "The Culinary Secrets of Argentina". Today (7 October) we were escorted by Maria Jose` Semino on our Culinary Secrets of Argentina. Maria was an excellent guide providing great commentary as we walked the streets of Palermo. The great choices of local cuisine (e.g. choripan, empanada, skirt and sirloin steak and some great barbecued cheese) chosen by Maria was excellent. Luckily the walk between restaurants helped to settle each course so that we could eat some more. Of course we washed all this down with a local Argentine Malbec (red wine) and finished. the experience with some beautiful ice cream (too many choices). Maria was an excellent guide, knowledgable, interesting and certainly enjoyed what she did. Great work Maria. Judy and Wayne StanleyWoodgate, Queensland, Australia
A real local experience. Fantastic food, very friendly guides, I totally recomend this tour in Buenos Aires. Thank you David and Santiago!!!

A truly authentic Buenos Aires food experience and a great guide!. I arrived in Buenos Aires wanting to find a way to get under the skin of how the portenos eat and this is it! Totally local, totally authentic and not a single tourist in sight (apart from us)! Maria was a fabulous host and guide and struck the perfect balance between knowledgable and great fun! We tried everything from empanadas to ice cream with lashings of perfectly cooked steak at a 'secret' parilla where we had to ring a bell at street level to be allowed inside! I can't recommend this tour enough - a sensational Buenos Aires 'find'!

Great night, a must do!. We love food and this food tour was just amazing. Excellent atmosphere a great way to start your visit in Buenos Aires.The argentinian food, wine and gelato was the best of our long trip around South America!!

Fantastic tour. We had a great lunch tour with Maria, she was a funny and knowledgable guide! We not only learned but also laughed a lot. First stop for a yummy choripan, then for a delicious empanada (we didnt know they could taste this good), then a "closed" parilla for the best steak, salad, grilled provolone, and (of course) some Malbec to wash it down, finally a stop at a nice gelado place. Highly recommended, especially with Maria as your guide!

Best way to experience Buenos Aires!. We always try to book a food tour when visiting a new country, since we love to eat and you learn a lot from them. Parrilla Tour was our favorite part of our stay in Buenos Aires. The restaurants we were taken to were incredibly local and we would have never found them without the guide. Our guide Santiago was great, and made sure everyone enjoyed themselves, and was helpful at answering our questions about the food, wine, soccer, shopping and everything in between of Buenos Aires.

Super Yummmmy Food Tour in Buenos Aires!. Even though I booked the tour just the night before, I received a prompt email confirmation. Communication with the Parrilla Food Tour team was always excellent. I took the San Telmo tour with David and it was practically a personal tour with one other guest. David provided a list of recommendations for restaurants and is very knowledgeable about Buenos Aires, wine, food, tango, & places to visit. The four spots we visited were local gems that I probably would not have found on my own & am I glad I had David's help. The empanadas, choripan, parrilla, vino, & homemade ice cream were mouth watering delicious and satisfying. David gave us a sweet gift at the end (I won't reveal what it is...TAKE.THE.TOUR!! It's worth every peso!) I would definitely recommend this tour and will look forward to doing the Palermo tour during my next visit to BsAs.

Eat like a true Porteño! Excellent local food tour. Our guide David took us to carefully selected restaurants/vendors for a local experience of BA specialities. Immediately greeted with Empanadas, David was an extremely knowledgable and friendly guide to the Argentine food scene in BA. Well organized and very well fed we dined on chorizo-pan (local sausage rolls) steak and wine. Each venue had local insight that often included introductions to the owners.

Fantastic Food Tour in BA. I had such a great time on this food tour! Small group, great guide (Santiago) and amazing food! I still dream about the baked empanadas, and the "secret spot" for parrilla was outstanding! Best chimichurri EVER! And topping off the night with gelato is pretty much perfection, si?! Seeing a great neighbourhood while also eating great food with interesting people is not to be missed! Thanks again!

Fun Food Experience in Buenos Aires. Enjoyed visiting places where the locals eat in Buenos Aires. We were absolutely stuffed by the end of this progressive dining/walking tour that started off with a choripan, then an empanada, then a complete steak dinner, and concluded with ice cream--all at four different places. Thanks for this fun food experience!

Awesome tour for insider, porteno eats!. I was on a travel assignment in Buenos Aires this past week and had the pleasure of joining David on the Parilla Tour in San Telmo. He took us around to local restaurants that I would have never found on my own--including a delicious parilla with yummy choripan that I loved so much I managed to find it on my last day in Buenos Aires! David is very friendly, savvy to the Buenos Aires food scene and showed us a great time as we ate our fill of Argentine empanadas, steak, ice cream, choripan and even enjoyed a round of mate. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Buenos Aires who wants a taste of the true, authentic food scene.

Great introduction to authentic Argentine food. This walking tour covered 4 different places all in the Palermo area of Las Canitas, where we ate (and drank) really delicious and varied traditional Argentine food. Our guide was very informative and knowledgeable about the food, wine and the local area. A truly great way to gain an intro to the local cuisine!
Great. Great lunch, good company and all the answers to our questions about Argentina, the culture and of course the food :)

Great first day in Buenos Aires. This is a great tour that every first time visitor to Buenos Aires should do. Fun and informative. Santiago is a great guide with good knowledge of the area. You get to go to a "secret spot" where the steaks are outstanding! Definetly recommended.

Must-do BA activity!. The guides were incredibly easy to communicate with before the tour, and the tour itself was one of our favorite things in BA. The guides were so easy to talk to and spend an evening with, and the food was unreal! We probably would not have had the opportunity to explore the area otherwise without the help of locals. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a an amazing food experience in BA!

Great hosts and Great experience. Myself and my mate, seen Pirrilla tours through the 'Getaway' TV show in Australia and decided to book before we got overWe went on both tours, the first day was in San Telmo and the second in Palermo, we got a wide range of foods and different variations of recipes of these foods at different restaurants.I don't mind Red wine, but if you haven't had Malbec it is honestly worth a try If I had one tip it would be definitely be try everything you get given but try in smaller portions then you would usually have, because you don't want to miss out on what is coming nextThanks David and Santiago for your experience in Buenos AiresThanks,Ben Bishop, Australia

Food Adventure. This tour was a lot of fun because it brought us to truly local eateries that we would have never found or entered on our own. The food and wine was all delicious, especially the steak, which was the best we tried in Buenos Aires. Another part of the tour that really made the tour a wonderful experience was the guide. The advice for Buenos Aires and Mendoza we received was all spot on and made our trip that much better!
Great intro. Great intro to food and interesting areas of BA- helpful recommendations on where else to explore . My favorite was the choripan and Fermat coke - breakfast of kings .

Fun afternoon, good intro to authentic food. We really enjoyed this tour! David, Santiago, and Victor were knowledgeable, friendly hosts, and we ate really good food at four different places (appetizers first -- including one of the best empanadas I've ever tasted -- then on to a large steak lunch and ice cream for dessert). They also gave us a ton of tips on where to eat during our week-long stay, as well as site-seeing suggestions. My husband and I had a great time, and we wholeheartedly recommend it!! Thanks, guys!!

Fantastic. This tour was the best so far in Buenos Aires. The two guys David and Santiago were very informative and friendly. Excellent english and took us to the most amazing restaurants. The food was fantastic and the other people we met who were also on the tour were good fun. This is a must do tour. Highly recommend it.

This tour is a must if you are spending time in Buenos Aires!. So where do I start? Me and my sister arrived about 3 minutes late, thankfully it was no problem. We were greeted outside, by Santiago and Rocio, who are extremely kind and personable people, they showed us to our table and gave us history of the city, shared some wine, and were extremely helpful with any questions that we had. They took us to three different locations, two spots for appetizers, leading up to an amazing parilla, all of which was incredible and delicious. The tour includes walking from place to place, which is perfect because as you walk your appetite grows, and you get a history lesson on the food, people, wines, locations. With this tour you will be able to go to a closed door restaurant,which if you were not local, and in the know, you would have no idea it even existed. The outside was a gate with "closed" on the outside. This terrific experience finishes off with to die for gelato, which is a perfect ending to the already amazing night. Book this tour! The hosts are very personable, helpful, fun people! There is really no reason you shouldn't book this tour, as we enjoyed every second of this outing!

Recommended for Day 1. We really enjoyed this tour because it was an excellent introduction to Argentina and its food and culture. We got so much out of the few hours: tips for the city, an education about the food and drink of Argentina, recommendations for where to eat and go out and the coolest part was feeling like a true local.
Fantastic food tour!. Great eating tour in Palermo! The food was delicious, highlight was definitely being taken to a secret Parrilla!! Loved the sweetbread too!

Family Approved. We booked this tour because we thought it would be an activity that our entire family would enjoy, which is sometimes difficult traveling with teenage children. Our tour hosts made sure that everyone had a great time, and their talk about the cuisine, culture and traditions of Argentina interested all ages. The food was excellent, and we all loved the authenticity of the restaurants we were brought to. Thanks again for the tour and all your Buenos Aires city tips. Hope you can come visit us! The Muller Family.

Great tour!. My friend and I took the Parrilla Tour in San Telmo with David, who was very knowledgeable and laid-back. The food at all the stops was delicious---the best empanadas and helado we had while in BA. David gave us lots of useful information about where to go while in the city and also recommended a place to stay in Mendoza. (Tupungato Divino, where I later stayed.) I highly recommend this tour. If I had one complaint it's that I thought we would be walking more between stops. Thanks, David!

More cities should have this!. What a brilliant way to see the city and eat with the locals. My husband and I are foodies and booked this after seeing all the great reviews and news reports from around the world. David and Santiago were exactly as billed. Great guys who know great spots for dinner. They're knowledgeable about the food and culture and spoke English! David is from Oregon. If only more cities had such a great way like this to get closer to the food and culture and get off the beaten path and chain restaurants! Definitely recommend!

Good food tour, friendly guide. We did the parrilla tour with David, who was a friendly and knowledgeable guide when it came to food and culture in Buenos Aires. The highlight of the tour for us was at the secret parrilla, which to our delight, was actually a secret parrilla which is off limits to most people, even locals without a booking. Food was explained properly and we were stuffed by the end of it. Only comment would be that the tour is probably a tad bit pricey for what you get.

If you're a foodie, you'll want to do this!. If you're a foodie, you'll want to do this! Overall, it's the best investment we made in Buenos Aires. We all want to get off the beaten path and eat like the locals. Parilla Tours takes you there. We did the lunch and dinner tour separately and discovered local food and restaurants we never would have found. David, Santiago, and Rocio take you to the places they go to - ones in neighborhoods away from the hustle of tour buses and lines of vacationers. No chain establishments here. The Parilla Tours staff is informative. Best part is they give you a list of recommended restaurants in different parts of the city. We used that list for a week and we're not disappointed! Highly recommended!

The only way to enjoy a real Parrilla in Buenos Aires!. We meet our guide in a local restaurant in the old part of Buenos Aires, in San Telmo. Enjoying a fresh empanada, we learnt that it was made by a lovely 84 year old local woman who makes them fresh every morning, it was easily the best empanada I had in SA. This was shortly followed by a quick stop at a shop attached the local fresh food market to experience a local favourite in the Choripán, also thanks to a local retired man. The next part of the tour took us to Don Ernesto's restaurant, a favourite for locals as well as tourists, were we enjoyed some perfectly cooked beef.All in all this tour was fantastic, the food was exceptional and the guide was very informative on all things BA, having lived there for quite sometime. A must do for anyone wanting to experience a traditional Sunday Parrilla in Argentina!

A feast for all the senses!. One of the best tours I've ever done and a GREAT and easy way to spend a few hours in Buenos Aires!! LOTS of delicious food in local restaurants full of character - places I could never have found on my own. It was also a chance to hear lots of interesting snippets about the history, culture and habits from David, a charming and enthusiastic guide who was very willing to share his in depth knowledge. He gave me a sheet with varied ideas on where to eat in each district of the city so I wish I'd done it on my first day in town! Worth every peso!!! Kay

Explore Buenos Aires through its food. Great food is a passion of mine, and I want to dive into local cuisine when I travel. Parrilla Tour caught my eye because they bring its groups to local restaurants and introduce introduce the country through the perspective of its great food and drink. I loved the authenticity of the places we visited, and the food was excellent quality. Our guides were so friendly and helpful. The thing that really stood out to me though, was that they went beyond the call of duty and emailed me after the tour with some restaurant info that I asked about during the tour.

Great traditional local food. Done the food tour on my last day in Buenos Aires. Informative well structured introduction to local cuisine ,Wish I had done it on my first day here and I would have been better informed about great local restaurants .our guide had great knowledge about the history of of the area.Great steak and a wonderful bottle of Malbec,now what more could an Irishman want.Keep up the good work guys Gerry

Delicious Food Tour. You're not a group tour person? Neither are we, but we did this tour and loved it. It's structured to be relaxed but highly informative and fun. Our guide, a local Porteña girl, was friendly from the get go and made us feel welcome and like locals for a few hours. During the tour we visited 4 spots for great food and wine, learned all about Buenos Aires culture and walked away with a few new friends. Highly recommend Parrilla Tour.

Our best meal in Argentina. During 5 days in Buenos Aires we ate at just about every highly rated restaurant on Trip Advisor, but our favorite meal we had was on our tour with Parilla Tour. It is a food tour of traditional local restaurants (places you're not going to find reviewed on Trip Advisor). We walked between 3 restaurants and finished at an ice cream shop. The food was outstanding, especially the meat at the steakhouse and the wine we tried. I'd recommend doing this at the start of your stay in the city since they really are local dining experts.

Something different!. This tour was one of the highlights of our trip. It was a chance to really experience the local food culture of B/A. David, our guide was a charming and very knowledgeable host. We visited four different venues to experience local parrillas, including the "Secret Parrilla" which is not open to the public. We also had the opportunity to see the area on foot as we went from one location to the other. The last visit to an ice cream parlor where the the home-made ice cream was to die for topped off a very pleasant couple of hours. Don't miss this tour.

Great Tour. My wife and I did this tour on June 25 with Santiago and Rocio. Both our hosts were very warm and gracious. The premise of the tour is exposure to the various stages of an Argentine barbecue - starting with choripan (sausage on bread with chimichurri), then empanadas, steak, concluding with ice cream. All four stages are at a different restaurants. There is a short walk between each phase of the tour which allows for conversation and working up an appetite for the next part of the tour. These restaurants seem to be off the beaten tourist track and cater to mostly portenas. We did the tour on the last day of a five day visit to Buenos Aries, so we had been thoroughly exposed to the food of the city before the tour. I think each type of food on the tour was the best we experienced during out entire trip. Lastly, the opportunity to interact with Santiago and Rocio added a depth of understanding of the city and culture that we would not have had otherwise.

A taste of Buenos Aires. My fiancee and I did this tour on Tuesday and really enjoyed ourselves. We went on a food tour in Rome last year and learned and tasted so much that we wouldn't have otherwise, that we made sure to find a food tour in Buenos Aires to do. The concept of visiting authentic restaurants where the locals go and taste the typical dishes is exactly what we wanted. Our guides were wonderful at explaining everything and making sure the entire group had a good time.

Get off the tourist trail. Our family did a private tour with Parrilla Tours a couple months ago, and still remember the delicious food and wine, incredible restaurants, and most of all our welcoming and informative guides. The tour lasted around 3 hours and we visited 4 spots to taste food. If you prefer to dine at chain restaurants that lack in local culture this tour is NOT for you. The places we went to were the opposite of trendy, but were so real that the experience was beautiful and we would have definitely never found them or gone on our own. Buenos Aires has some incredible modern and international restaurants that we ate at, but we really wanted to delve into local culture as well, which this tour did very well. This was not a "tasting" tour, so come hungry and be prepared to ask any questions you want about food or anything else Argentina related. The value in this tour is the guides expertise in where to dine and explaining local customs.

Do this tour!!. My husband and I spent five days in Argentina and this was the best experience of our trip. Not only was the food great, the company of Santiago and Rocio was very enjoyable. They are very knowledgeable about the history and culture of the area. I loved that this was a walking tour as we got the "feel" of the neighborhood we were in. I recommend you do this tour at the beginning of your trip. We waited till the end and I believe we would have benefited from the knowledge we gained on the tour if we had done it earlier. Perfect ending to a perfect trip!!

Tasty Tour!. My husband and I really enjoyed our tour with Parrilla Tour Buenos Aires. The restaurants we went to in the Palermo Soho neighborhood were really great and we sampled a great variety of food. They introduced choripan to us and my husband was on a constant hunt for it the rest of the trip! Then on to empinadas, which were delicious followed by a Parrilla that was a bit of a secret local hangout. We felt very privileged to be able to eat here as the place is hard to find and when you do find it, it says it's closed! All this in an effort to keep the patrons limited to locals. We had a multi-course meal there and left STUFFED. Then we headed over to get some of the best gelato I've ever had. The guides were really friendly and knowledgeable and even sent us on our way with a little chimichurri mix to take home. I would definitely recommend this tour. The fact that it was a walking tour was also a plus.

Highlight of Argentina. We did this tour on our first day in Buenos Aires and had a blast. The guide told us all about Argentine cuisine and culture, brought us to amazing hole in the wall spots, and helped us plan our entire trip. Do this day 1.

Amazing Food and Invaluable Knowledge. I signed up for the Parrilla Tour in Buenos Aires as a way to introduce me to the dining culture of Argentina. What I got was so much more!The food was incredible and I loved the "closed" restaurant experience. However, one of the best insights was from our guide. The guide (not Argentine) truly knew and understood the way of life of Argentina and was a wealth of knowledge of Dos and Don'ts. The guide proved us with many "must-dos" and additional restaurants to try.This company clearly specializes in Argentina ' s neighborhood's culinary delights, but also provided us with an itinerary for the remainder of our stay. I highly recommend this trip for any and all visitors to this beautiful country!

parrilla tour of san telmo. please, take this tour! at about 2 - 2.5 hours (un-rushed), it is localized (i did san telmo, they offer Palermo as well) and conducted by an incredibly knowledgeable person (david did ours). its cool because we hit 4 low key but special little restaurants. the locations had relevance, and werent just randomly selected. they are all located within a few blocks of eachother too. we got a full meal by the end of it (including bread, salad, and dessert). it was a lovely afternoon out. if you are staying in the area you tour, then the info will be very practical as well. there is plenty of time for questions, and the guide is a wealth of knowledge. this tour is totally worth it because its not just about taking a tour, its about putting a small investment into making the most out of your trip to Buenos aires!
Best walking food tour. A great experience of dining where the locals dine. Wonderful combination of food and history/culture.

Local Argentinian cuisine experience. Food was great and a good way to learn about Argentinian cuisine in an informal setting. As an added bonus, we were provided with some great restaurant recommendations for the rest of our stay. Highly recommended! Great job guys.

Don't miss this BA experience!. BA is a great food destination.. and starting off our stay with Santiago's parrilla food tour was absolutely amazing! A great introduction to the culture, food and wine scene of Argentina and BA in particular. The places we visited and the food we ate were incredible and the whole evening felt like an authentic local experience - not a set-up, standard touristy guide. The wine, steak, chorizo and empanadas were truly outstanding and would be appreciated by those who love and care about good food! Santiago our guide was so warm and generous in his recommendations of what to see and where go in his city. He even gives you a great list of his favourite places in each area... the ones we tried were fantastic! Don't miss this BA experience! Honestly couldn't recommend it highly enough!

Food Highlight. If you love local food, lots of great meat, great wine and wonderful conversation about all things Buenos Aires--you should book this tour! Santiago was our guide as we were immersed into the BA food culture.We ate at amazing, off the beaten track locations..no tourists in sight-very local...and at the end of our tour we were full of delicious food and had made a lovely new friend as well!

Argentina Cuisine 101. A fellow guest at our hotel recommended this food tour to us one morning at breakfast, and after seeing it being highly rated we signed up. During the tour we went to 4 different local spots for traditional foods. The guide told us all about their history and preparation, as well as the food and wine of Argentina, which served us well during the rest of the week. The small group size was nice since we're not big tour people.

If you want to experience culture through food, go on this tour!. My boyfriend and I really love eating as many new things as we can in every country we visit to try to get a better understanding of the local culture. Good thing for us, the food in Buenos Aires is amazing and David and his team from Parrilla Food tours helped guide us to the best choices. (We did the night tour in the Palermo area). Come hungry, we started with chorizopan, moved on to empanadas (amazing!) and to an exclusive parrilla to try a selection of bbq meats. This was accompanied by great wine and a trip to a gelato shop to cap off the night. We wouldn't have found any of these places on our own and we had a wonderful lasting experience. Definitely worth the price you pay - even if you are a local it will be a fun night for you!

Unique experience in Buenos Aires. I went on a tour a few days ago, David was an excellent guide and the food was top quality. Interesting to learn about local food culture, and to try various places for one meal. There are two different tour routes, I´d like to try the other as well. Recommendable to anyone looking for a great way to enjoy local cuisine and get information about the city, traditions, and local tips.

That´s it.... since a couple of years i´m coming here to BsAs and definitely had a lot of food in this city!This Parrilla Tour shows you the perfect traditional food you wanna experience when you are in Argentina. Meat was fantastic quality, perfectly cooked and the wine also was very good.The tour guide was great!!!

Still Full. Buenos Aires is an incredible city, filled with incredible food, but I had a fear about being sucked into a vortex of touristy restaurants and americanized menus. Thankfully, my girlfriend and I decided to give Parilla Tour BA a try. I feel like this tour gave us an authentic look into Argentine cuisine and a better feel for Argentine culture. The tour guide was knowledgable about food (of course) and also about BA as a whole. The food was absolutely delicious and the restaurants we visited were not ones that we would have been able to find on our own. I highly recommend spending an afternoon in BA engorging yourself under the guidance of the fine folks at Parilla Tour!

Taste of the true Buenos Aires. We were attracted to this tour because they emphasized the authenticity of the restaurants visited. On the tour they did just that. The tour had 4 stops, the first for a great beef empanada, the next a hole in the wall stand for chorizo, the main parrilla stop for great steak, provoleta and wine, and finally a wonderful little ice cream shop.The guides did a great job explaining everything since we weren't going to places that would have english menus. We learned everything from what were the typical dishes, how to order and dining customs. The general city tips were also appreciated and good.

A nice concept, but below average food. I would really like to be more positive and upbeat about this tour as the guides are very nice people, but I hope they will read this and consider using different restaurants. The first stop was for a tasty chorizo snack, the second stop was for Empanadas.....mine was full of gristle and was very awkward to extract politely from my month! The next stop at a "hidden" restaurant ( for locals only ) was a major disappointment. We were really looking forward to some nice meat. There were 3 different types of meat served...one was so tough I couldn't cut it with the knife supplied...I ate NONE of it, the second cut was 80% fat and the third was of unknown origin (maybe cheek) but was at least tender. The salad and wine were nice, but I don't know how this restaurant is still in business serving that quality meat! I would have complained to the waitress had this been a personal dining experience. Our guides ate here too....but they made no comment.The final stop for icecream was sadly the best food of the day. Like I said, great concept, informative walk, but food served was well below average.

A delicious way to discover BA . I had a great time at the Parrilla tour with Santiago the other night, despite the terrible weather. He was friendly, extremely easy to deal with, and shared lots of interesting facts about Argentinien food & culture. The food & wine we sampled was extremely tasty, and there was plenty of it. Highly recommended.

Great food experience!. After spending 3 days in BA we decided to do this tour to make sure we hadn't missed out on anything special and thankfully we did!!! The first stop was in one of the oldest buildings in the area where we had one of the tastiest chorizos we have had!!!Next off to try some great empanadas made the local way and then off to the "secret parrilla". This to me was a highlight! Hearing how they keep the closed sign on the door all the time only to be surprised after ringing the door bell that they in fact were open and serving ;) After some yummy steaks, salads and Malbec we were off to sample some delicious ice cream! Santiago our guide was also really lovely! He grew up in the area and gave a good insight to this area and the food in Argentina! I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone wanting to try things they wouldn't find on their own!!

An unforgettable experience. And we thought we were just booking a meal with an opportunity to sample a few local Argentinean dishes. Our food guides totally exceeded our expectation with their hospitality and the venues they selected for our dining experience. We were so impressed with the secret Parrilla that we went to that we had to asked our guide to arranged for for a revisit.

Delicious and Entertaining!. What a fantastic day! We had Santiago as our guide and he took us to some of the best (and most hidden) restaurants in town. We got the real Buenos Aires food experience and it was delicious. Santiago also gave us heaps of tips for other things to do around town. Highly recommended!

Highlight of Buenos Aires. The past few trips we have taken my husband and I have made sure to do a food tour. After doing a little research on google and Trip Advisor we decided Parilla Tour looked like the best choice for Buenos Aires.
