Don't miss this!. The best thing we've done in BA, without a doubt. David and Santiago were wonderful hosts as we wandered Palermo enjoying superb local food and wine in places tourists never see. It was like having a supper with family. The small group was perfect, and the arrangements impeccable. If you're a foodie...or just looking for something special in BA...don't miss it.Pat and Donna

An amazing cultural and culinary experience.. This was such an amazing experience and I wish more of a group got to enjoy getting to eat where the locals eat. Our guide Santiago was very knowledgable and fun and we had an absolute blast! I would definitely recommend this tour if you are a food lover and keen to learn a little more about the culture of Buenos Aires and Argentina.

Good orientation activity. We felt this was an excellent way to start our 2 week trip through Argentina. Food is such a vital part of cultures that we wanted to make sure to go to traditional restaurants, know how to properly order dishes and learn what is typical in the country. So after quickly dropping off our bags at our hotel we headed to San Telmo for our food adventure. The meeting point was in a pizza and empanada spot a few blocks from the main street for some tasty empanadas. Next we took a look at the San Telmo market, followed by a chorizo sandwich, which was my favorite part of the tour. Next we walked a few more blocks to a "parrilla" steakhouse for two types of steak, grilled provolone cheese and a nice malbec wine. We finished up at the cutest ice cream shop.

Culinary Highlight Buenos Aires. The tour was very well organized.You were given the opportunity to experience 3 different restaurants in one evening. The food and wine was very good at all places. During the dinner we had pleasant conversation and learnt about about the customs and food of Argentina.

Best night in Argentina!. We were on a contiki tour and this was an optional extra. The five of us that went all thought it was one of the highlights of Argentina. Santiago was an excellent guide and had great knowledge not only about the food but about the culture and history also. Would definitely recommend this tour to anyone traveling to Argentina, such a great night!

Food heaven. Our tour group was not sold this activity very well so only a few of us decided to do it; we were so glad that we did it!! Greeted by a friendly guide, given a quick tour on the way to the old market side of town and then straight into the food. First was one of the oldest and best empanadas in Buenos Aires; delicious! Next was a restaurant just a short walk down the road where we were treated to a feast of bread, chimichurri, chorizo, delicious vegetables and, of course, amazing steak! Such good food, very filling and complemented by bulk delicious wine and the chance to write on the restaurant's walls as all good tourists. We had a vegetarian with us who even enjoyed his vegetarian option, but he definitely missed the best steak I'd had before. Lastly, we topped off the night with a couple scoops of awesome ice cream just down the road. I had cerveza (beer) flavour and lost my mind.It was definitely food heaven and the English speaking guide was friendly, knowledgeable and definitely made sure we had a great night. If you're lucky and a small group, you may even be taken to some local bars afterwards to continue the party... Strongly recommend!

Must do lunch when you are in BA!!. We went on the Parilla tour during our honeymoon in Argentina and really enjoyed ourselves. We much prefer to eat at small hole-in-the-wall spots that you only know of if you live in a city, so this was right up our alley. The food was excellent, the group was great and very social and our guides helped us a lot by explaining so much about Argentinian culture.Thank you!

Cultural gastronomy. We were fortunate to have a private tour with David since no one else booked at the time we did. I suspect that the tour might feel different--I don't know if it would be better or worse--if it was larger. Other reviewers have described the various stops, so I won't repeat that. David is knowledgable and passionate about BA cuisine. It would have been more helpful at the beginning of our trip than at the end, but we had good food and wine, and we learned something as well--which is not a bad way to spend the afternoon. I also feel it is a good value. I would definitely recommend it to first time visitors to BA.

Great experience; a must while in BA. The tour was efficient and full of interesting facts. We first tried the choripan, followed by an empenada, and then a closed door parilla not generally open to gringos. The whole experience was great and ended with classic gelato. Definitely worth doing while in BA!

An enjoyable introduction to eating in Buenos Aires. This tour was an interesting and enjoyable introduction to eating out in BA. We were in a small international group and tried food in four different locations around Palermo. Santiago and David were very helpful and informative, overall this was a most enjoyable evening which we are happy to recommend.

Best way to experience Buenos Aires. My husband and I spent our fourth wedding anniversary in Buenos Aires, and our Parilla Tour was definitely the highlight of an incredible weekend in BA. Sabrina was very personable and friendly, the group was the perfect size to get to know everyone without feeling like you had to make conversation all the time, and the restaurants selected served great food. Eating an empanada on the street outside a delivery shop was just one memorable moment. The "pop up" restaurant for our main course will be remembered forever - how unique and just plain fantastic!I am a big believer in understanding the food to understand the culture, and this tour definitely fulfilled that expectation! And great value too!

Cultural dining. This tour was a great way to learn about Argentina while also enjoying good food and wine. We were a group of 10 people and all shared a big table at each stop. The empanadas were the best we tried during 3 weeks in Argentina and the steak was outstanding.

Great way to start your trip to Buenos Aires. Did the San Telmo tour. There were about 10 other travelers from various parts of the world. Everyone was very friendly and was a nice way to enjoy great food in a laid back atmosphere. On our tour we started visited 3 restaurants and one ice cream shop at the end. The food and wine was great and David and his team were very knowledgeable about the area's food and wine. I concur with other reviewers who gave this tour 5* and I would recommend it to anyone, especially on your 1st day in BA since it gives you a good overview of local food so you can try other restaurants later that have the things you liked best from the tour.I noticed a couple of recent reviews had criticism for the tour which I'd like to address (check my profile, I travel quite a bit...). Regarding price of tour relative to cost of food...of course you didn't eat $69 of food of the tour...but there was more than enough for a good lunch and you're paying for a professional tour...given the caliber of David and his staff along with the great food $69 is a very fair price to pay. The 2nd criticism that I saw from another poster was the the restaurants weren't really "secret" since we now know where they are...that is totally not the point. The places you visit on the tour are out in the open but there is no way I (or 99% of anyone else reading these would even find, let alone walk in and try one of these places without an expert recommendation). So again, you're paying for the expertise that David and his team did a super job providing.

Real Buenos Aires. The tour was a highlight since it took us to local favorites. The food was outstanding, but our favorite part of the tour was the awesome people watching and learning about the customs and food of Argentina. To us, this made the slight splurge well worth the cost.

Best way to start our trip in Buenos Aires!. We booked in advance to ensure our place and we will definitely recommend it. Argentineans love beef, in fact in Buenos Aires many locals eat beef a dozen times a week. Incredible great is their respect for this noble beef and parilas that no Argentinean would ever dream of marinating it or of seasoning it with anything other than salt (we saw the parrilero cooking it!!). We also tried two condiments that are commonly served with grilled meats: a gusty parsley-garlic sauce called chimichury and a robust relish called salsa criolla that combines tomatoes, oregano, onions and peppers.We really loved it!

Very nice and jummy tour. The tour was very well organized and the food was amazing! Just the correct food one needs to try in Argentina! We eat and had a very nice time with the organizers and the other people on the trip! Everybody was so friendly! Our 7 monyh old baby had a great time, and we would recomend it to others with small tolders!

Best "jugoso" beef and ice cream!!. We had never done a food tour before, but really enjoyed ourselves on this progressive food and wine adventure. The spots we ate at were all places I would probably be slightly uncomfortable going on my own since they were so local and not targeting tourists. The food was incredible though and our guide was super friendly and knowledgable of the food and culture of Argentina.

The best food of our trip. We wanted to see what real Argentine steakhouses looked and tasted like so booked this tour. The food was unreal. The choripan was outstanding. Homemade sausage and sauces to go along. Next we walked to a small corner empanada restaurant for a quick stop of a just baked empanada. Afterwards to a parrilla where we tried skirt and sirloin steak, provoleta, and a nice malbec. The final stop was to a local ice cream shop for dulce de leche ice cream. Learned a lot about how Italian and Spanish immigrants have shaped local cuisine and how the foods are prepared.

Must have been an "off day". After reading all the prior reviews, my husband and I decided that this tour was a MUST DO while visiting Buenos Aires. We were so disappointed not only in the food but also in the fact that our guide, who was very sweet and a pleasure to spend time with was originally from Massachusetts and had only been in Buenos Aires for a year. Not exactly what one would expect when you book a tour to get a "genuine taste of Argentina." Our first stop was a small restaurant where we met and waited for one other guest to arrive. We were the only customers there and we were served pan con chorizo. It was very good and our guide explained that this was to Argentinians what the hot dog is to Americans. This was swerved with seltzer water and our guide explained how the wine in Argentina was not very good in the past and how they would mix it with high pressured seltzer water to make it more palatable. Interesting tidbit of information as now the Argentinian wines are very good. After 15 minutes, we were off to walk a few blocks in the Palermo district to a second location where we waited outside on the street and our guide entered to get a few empanadas that, while good, were very hot and we were standing on the street corner eating them with a napkin. This to me is not really what I would consider a great way of enjoying this food even though I understand that this is considered a street food. Gobbled that down and we were on our way to the next destination which was very interesting. We walk a few blocks and come upon a store front that with metal railings that appears to be closed and actually has a closed sign on the outside. Our guide rang the bell, the door opened and we were welcomed in. The name of this Parrilla is "Secret Parrilla." We were told that nobody knows about it (except EVERY tourist taking this tour) and they wanted to keep it that way as only a place for locals. Hummmm....sounded a bit strange to me. Either way, it was busy with what appeared to be locals and of course the tourists on the Parrilla Tour. Not quite buying this one. Our table had been set with a fresh salad and bread and we were served grilled cheese which was delicious accompanied by a Malbec wine. We were then served a steak which my husband said was very tough and solomillo (pork) which was inedible as we could barely cut it. I did request chicken since I don't eat red meat and that was good. The sausages were apparently pretty tasty as well. I did notice that our guide only ate salad and a small serving of cheese but I'll just assume that if she does this several times a week, this type of eating could get pretty old, especially from a very thin girl from Massachusetts. Next stop was an ice cream shop for gelato. We arrived and their computers were not working so we went a few more blocks to another shop of the same chain and were given our choice of 2 flavors of gelato. This I didn't understand AT ALL because gelato can be found ANYWHERE, especially if it's coming from a chain of shops. With all the wonderful pastries and desserts and the abundance of dulce de leche that is found in almost every dessert in Argentina, why would you choose to have ice cream as a dessert instead of a traditional Argentinian dessert?Realizing that there is absolutely NO overhead for this tour, I found it extremely overpriced for the quality of the food and the fact that you are taken to a "secret parrilla" that is for the tourists does not exactly give me the feeling of very authentic Argentinian experience. We found it a waste of an afternoon and a waste of an opportunity to have a great meal in Argentina where there are so many amazing restaurants. Would definitely skip this one, use the money for a great meal in ONE nice restaurant!

NZ Group. The biggest decision for the Parrilla Tour was whether to go for San Telmo or Palermo, both had been recommended by our friends who had been in Buenos Aires the previous year.We went for San Telmo but were wishing we had had time to do both!!Definitely a highlight of our stay in BA, Santi & the gorgeous Sophia were so much fun & our group from NZ said they had the best food of our entire trip to Sth America which included 5 countries!!We already have people wanting to sign up when they are on their forthcoming trips!!

Great Experience. Myself and 6 other co-workers booked a private tour with Parrilla Tour last week when we were in town for a business trip and had a wonderful evening. So many times you don't get to really see the authentic side of a city during a work trip, so this was great since they took care of the legwork. We were the only foreigners in all of the restaurants which was quite cool, but we also had the guide to explain the foods and order for us. The steak was some of the best I've ever had without a doubt.

As authentic as it gets. This tour was a highlight of my two week trip through Argentina. It is not your typical organized tour. It was great because it takes you to local spots, you don't find published in guides, and for a few hours you're immersed in local culture and cuisine and feel like a Porteño yourself. We visited 4 stops:Restaurant 1 - 200 year old neighborhood spot filled with locals that have obviously been going there for quite a while! We ate a delicious sausage sandwich paired with homemade sauces. Restaurant 2 - Another street food, the empanada. Hot out of the oven. Restaurant 3 - The highlight! Locals only steakhouse. We tried 2 cuts of meat, grilled cheese and an awesome malbec wine. Learned all about the cooking process used. Restaurant 4 - Gelato!

Fun afternoon. Fun food tour in Buenos Aires. Our guide was very helpful and great at explaining all the dishes and cuisine of Argentina. We did the Palermo route, but they also have one in San Telmo. Great area that was pretty and tranquil. All the restaurants very authentic and not ones listed in guidebooks.

Wouldn't miss it for anything. Could not believe our luck .Sophie and Santiago were the perfect hosts. Superb food, loved the SanTelmo history, ambiance of restaurants, and would recommend to anyone for a fun night out with great food and wine . Kiwi

Really interesting, delicious, and awesome :). We had a small group with David and 2 others. The trip was totally worth it. He took us to totally "secret" places with amazing food. Went to 4 different places, and even got to try blood sausage for he first time. Phone was amazing also and the ice cream/gelato place was to die for. David was very knowledgeable and we highly reccommend the tour if you want to have a sample of different local foods, with a knowledgeable guide.
The best food and wine we have had on our trip in South America.. Our hosts made us feel very relaxed. We ate delicious food in places we would never have found. Highly recommended.

From choripan to helado a wonderful experiance. I did this tour last week and quite simply it was delicious. A great way to delve into Argentine food and discover a part of the city less trodden by the tourists. you make some great stops and with the information your given at the start you really start to understand the love of meat in this country. Also to get to go to this restaurant behind a closed gate was such a great experience and something you might not get wandering around solo. Thanks to Sophie and David for a great tour :)

Recommended for day 1. The value for us in this tour was everything we learned. Like previous reviewers mention, the food was excellent and more than enough, but our guide Sophie made the entire rest of our stay in Argentina more enjoyable. We learned all about the food culture in Argentina, the best restaurants and bars, how to use the transport in BA, how to properly order dishes, where to get the best prices on leather, among many other tips. Basically we saved ourselves from having to learn things through lots of trial and error. This tour most likely isn´t for the backpacker type based on the price, but keep in mind there is value far beyond the actual food tasted.

Great perspective inside gastronomic Buenos Aires. A great way to spend the afternoon, visiting classic parrilla restaurants in tucked away neighborhoods off the beaten track. All of the parrillas were authentic while unpresuming neighborhood joints that most tourists would almost never find, including one secret parrilla that was packed with locals at lunch hour- it is always a good sign when you are eating where the locals eat! All of the food was incredible and the ambiance of each place had a true porteño charm. The tour was well planned out and David and Sofia provided great insights into not just the culinary side of Buenos Aires, but also tied in the local culture and history into the tour. The tour included classics such as the choripan, empenadas, and bife de chorizo and also some more interesting foods such as matambre de cerdo and provoleta (barbecued cheese!). The tour even included plenty of malbec and some of Argentina's best ice cream. I would highly recommend the parrilla tour!

Pleasant afternoon in Palermo. We really enjoyed this tour. Sometimes as a traveler exploring a new city can be exhausting. Going from attraction, to museum, to new hotel etc, all while trying to figure out how to get around and not fully understanding the local culture. Parrilla Tour Buenos Aires was especially great because it was informative, but at the same time relaxed and not rushed. The guide made us feel welcome and made sure everyone enjoyed the tour and got their questions answered. At the end of the tour we were full of wonderful local cuisine and wine, as well as had made some new friends.

Good, but expensive. I've been in BsAs for 2 months now, and when my parents came to visit we took this tour. There was quite a bit of confusion at the beginning as the owner of the first location seemed as if she wasn't expecting us or a tour and our tour guide was not yet there.We began with a stop for empanadas, then walked a few blocks to a local parrilla where we had choripan as well as provoleta and steak accompanied by malbec. Our last stop was an absolutely fantastic artesanal ice cream shop - by far the best part of the tour... it was absolutely delicious! I was anticipating a bit more of a selection or at least smaller portions with more things to try. To me this seemed more like a progressive lunch than a parrilla tour per se, as we only actually visited one parrilla.Our tour guide, Sabrina, was so friendly and helpful! I think that the best part of this tour was being introduced to restaurants that I would absolutely not go into otherwise, simply from the outside appearance. The food was delicious, but we could have done with more info about parrillas and/or more stops. I think that this could be good for people who have not yet been exposed to BsAs parrilla culture and want a good introduction.Overall, an excellent concept but ultimately an expensive lunch for what you get (you could get a similar lunch for $15US or less if you went on your own). May be a different experience with more people (there were only 4 of us)!

We are not tour people. My fiancee and I are not your typical tourists. When we visit a city we make a point to avoid tourist traps and opt to delve into local life. This also usually means we don't take tours aimed at foreigners. We were surprised by how many of the restaurants and bars in Buenos Aires were underground and resistant to allowing tourists in without being accompanied by a local. When we mentioned this to our concierge she recommended this tour. The main draw was that it went to highly traditional neighborhood spots as well as their tours were small groups, maximum 12. All of the restaurants we visited were outstanding and places we would have never found on our own. We're two anti-tour people endorsing Parilla Tour.

Great introduction to the BsAs parrilla culture!!. Having recently moved to BsAs I couldn't wait to jump right into the asado offerings. When I arrived, however, I was absolutely overwhelmed by the sheer number of parrillas in the city. I had no idea where to start, or what defined good asado. This tour was absolutely clutch in the fact that it showed me what high quality argentine food is all about. I now have a benchmark to relate to, as this selection was clearly top-notch. Choripan, empanadas, provoleta, morcilla, bife de lomo and entraña were all washed down with copious amount of high quality Malbec. A plethora of gelato flavors to choose from topped it all off! All in all, an incredible meal and a truly educational experience. Whether you are just passing through BsAs or living here for an extended period of time, you won't be disappointed with Parrilla Tour Buenos Aires!

Authentic, personal and delicious. Had a great time on this tour. We went to a few traditional restaurants where there were no other tourists. Learned a ton about Argentina from our guide that helped during the rest of my stay. Food was outstanding. Well run outfit that had obviously done their homework on choosing the restaurants and organizing everything for us.

Lovely evening in Buenos Aires. Last week my family and I went on a tour with Parila Tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. They offered both midday and dinnertime tours and we chose dinner since it worked better with our schedule. We met at the first restaurant where our guide for the evening, a young woman originally from the United States, was waiting for us and the other guests with a glass of malbec and a kind of local sausage sandwich. Next we walked to a "casa di empanadas" where we ate one of these local street treats. The main stop was a parilla restaurant which was very old-school was a temple to meat! We had a couple cuts of steak and pork, salad, grilled cheese and more malbec. Finally we finished up at an artisanal ice cream shop for some dulce de leche ice cream. Overall it was a delicious and entertaining night. All ages enjoyed it and are already planning on a doing a food tour on our next family trip.

Not exactly what I envisioned... We recently did the Parilla Tour and while the guides were friendly, the overall experience was not what I expected. It turned out to be an extremely rushed walking tour where you get to "sample" a few different things. I was expecting more of a "dining experience" and wine tasting. The main meal consisted of a rushed 15 minute meal at a local restaurant. I thought this was way too rushed and hectic. Overall this was not what I expected and I think it was overpriced for what it was. You might be better off exploring on your own.

Delightful experience. We signed up for the Parilla Tour for August 27th and much to our delight had the guide all to ourselves. Apparently this is an unusual occurrence and I am grateful the tour wasn't canceled for that day.Our guide Sophia was personable and responsive to all our questions and the variety of Argentinian food sampled was perfect. I would do it again in a heart beat and would certainly recommend it to anyone who wanted to get a feel for how true porteños dine.

A great way to explore BA / Parrilla Tour. My wife and I kicked off our trip to BA with the Parrilla Tour and it was a great introduction to eating in a great city. If you enjoy food, and are interested in getting a first class introduction to how to eat like a local, this tour is a must. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable, and we were placed on sound footing as we explored on our own. I can't say enough good thing about Parrilla Tour.

Great time for a first time visitor. Date of tour: Aug 24This was my first time to B.A. on business and was told about this tour through a colleague who lives there. This tour did not disappoint. They were great!!!The guides were extremely friendly and informative. They knew everyone we met along the way. The way they conducted the tour made me feel like a longtime friend enjoying the day together. I learned about the neighborhoods and some history but not too much where it felt like class but just enough to be engaging. The food? O...M....G!!!! We ate with and like locals. The empanadas, the sausage sandwiches, steaks, pork, blood sausage, wine and more. And to top it all off....ICE CREAM and espresso. The best ever, no lie. I will be back in B.A. hopefully in the spring and will do the tour again. Parrilla...you guys are the best! Thanks for helping me discover a different part of Buenos AiresAndre C.

Best culinary tour in Buenos Aires. My family and I recently moved to Buenos Aires for work and have been doing different tours and activities to discover our new city. This was our fourth food or wine related activity and so far has been our favorite. We obviously can find the La Cabreras etc of the city without a guide, but this took us to neighborhood spots that portenos dine at. We learned so much in just a couple hours about the country that has already proven useful. Our guide went above and beyond by answering our every question and even offering to help us out in the future if we have more questions. We're already planning on doing the other tour route for my birthday, and whenever family or friends are in town we'll recommend it without hesitation.

Eat at restaurants you would never enter on your own. We are avid food and wine lovers and have found that food tours are a great way to know a city. This Parilla Tour was no exception and gave us a nice introduction to Argentinian culture, foods and traditions. The restaurants we stopped at were all small and local and places we most likely would have never felt comfortable going to on our own since they were not geared toward tourism or neccesarly the most beautiful of restaurants, but like they promissed, the food was outstanding and our guide made us feel welcome and like locals for a few hours.

Thoughtful Tour. Date of Tour: Saturday Aug 24, Palermo. My boyfriend and I booked the tour based on the reviews here and were not disappointed. I also recommend to do this on Day 1 to ease into the culinary culture of the city, and there really is no better way to start knowing the city with great food! I especially appreciate the small gift of the spice mix that was part of the tour, as I had been saying to my boyfriend earlier in the tour that I want to get that mix in stores at some point! Parrilla Tour read my mind! Thanks. - Jean

Delicious Food and Wonderful Tour Guides. The Parrilla Tour was a great way to experience Buenos Aires with fellow foodies and tourists. I was excited to try new foods that I'd never had before. The wonderful tour guides gave us great explanations of the local food, culture, architecture, and even made suggestions on things to do in the city during your trip. Definitely recommending this to friends!

Buenos Aires Culinary Tour. Both my wife and I are big foodies and love to explore cultures through food so after finding this tour on google we signed up. They were great at responding to our reservation quickly and were happy to answer some pre-trip questions about the city. The tour was one of our favorite parts of the trip since we visited tiny restaurants we would never find without living in Buenos Aires. They also explained all about the history and culture of the country and cuisine, which we would have never gotten if we just went to a restaurant on our own.

Funnest activity we did in Buenos Aires. Our guide Sabrina prepared a great afternoon of food for us. During our tour we visited a few small restaurants in the Palermo neighborhood. We liked that each had been selected for being authentic as well as having excellent food. It was fun and relaxing because everything was organized and we shared the table with the other tour participants as well as the guide. The "tour" felt more like a lunch with friends from around the world!
Good fun and food. This was a good way to quickly learn about the food and wine of Argentina. The guide was helpful and knowledgable of the city. Well worth the slightly high cost.

Discover BsAs through Food. This tour is an intersting concept, which is going to multiple local restaurants and trying foods at each and learning about what they are. A nice introduction to the classic foods of Argentina. Our group consisted of a total of 14 people from Argentina, US, UK, Denmark and Brazil. I enjoyed talking with the other participants about the foods of their country and how they compared to Argentina. Our guides were great at giving suggestions for dining in the city and explaining how to order dishes correctly.

great way to kick off our trip. This review is a little late since we went in April, but the Parrilla Tour Buenos Aires was a great way to start our Argentine adventure. Our local guides went above the call of duty to help us plan our entire stay in Buenos Aires and were great at answering questions ranging from the cuisine to politics to the economy to shopping to where to go out at night. The tour itself was a great initial plunge into local culture. All of the parillas we visited were filled with locals allowing us to better understand porteno life. This is a 5 star tour. My tip is to do it at the start of your stay in Argentina since you learn a lot and can ask questions to make the most of your stay in the country.

A really enjoyable way to enjoy multiple 'authentically local' eating spots. My husband and I did both the Palermo and San Telmo Parrilla Tours and thoroughly enjoyed both tours. The Palermo tour was our favorite for a couple of reasons being: you visit 4 places (rather than 3 on the San Telmo tour); we had a larger group on our Palermo tour so the atmosphere was more enjoyable; and the ‘Secret’ Parrilla place in Palermo has amazing meat! The pork in particular was amazing! The ‘Secret’ Parrilla place is for neighbourhood locals only; they can only bring tours here because (as I recall) one of the Parilla Tour business partners is from the neighbourhood, and even then it took a lot of negotiation. They even change their name every couple of weeks as they don’t want to be known on Trip Advisor. Why? Because they are packed everyday just from patronage from the neighbourhood locals! On both days our guide was David. We appreciated all of the tips he gave us in respect to bars etc. Thanks to David we discovered the Buenos Aires Time Out Magazine – great resource for planning your stay. We would definitely recommend doing one of the Parrilla Tours during your stay in Buenos Aires.

SIMPLY AMAZING!. The Parilla tour was one of the BEST things that we did while in Buenos Aires This is something that every visitor (or local for that matter) should do while in Buenos Aires in order to sample some of the best cuisine from the region and truly get a taste of BA. My family of 6 (my wife and I, plus my parents and two twenty-something brothers) met up with David our tour guide and the rest of our group, which I was pleasantly surprised to find out were residents of BA who had taken off during the middle of their work day to endulge in the tour. This made for some great conversation to complement the truly tasteful choice of eateries we visited during the tour, which included an old-school amazing Parilla (classic BA steak restaurant), a phenomenal hole-in-the wall empanada joint (some of the best we had during our entire trip), a sit-down lunch at a "closed door" Parilla where locals-only dined beside us at reserved tables (yes reserved for lunch - they take their steak seriously people!) in a charming Parilla which you would never find nor be able to gain entry in without this tour (literally there is a sign saying closed outside the unassuming unmarked door), just amazing! David even went out of his way to accommodate my wife who is a vegetarian by ordering for her at the restaurants, as well as providing us with amazing restaurant, bar and shopping recommendations for the rest of our BA tour. Cap the tour off with a dulce de leche and there you have it. We can't say enough about this tour and havent stopped talking about it since we've returned home. Do yourself a favor and make sure to put this on your must-do list while in Buenos Aires, you can thank me later ;)

Perfect afternoon of food and wine. We signed up for this tour on a whim after another guest at our hotel told us about it. We are not tour people but had a marvelous time on this small group tour. We visited a few typical restaurants and tried food at each. They were very generous with their portions as it was pretty much all you wanted to eat and drink. They have 2 routes, but we did the tour in the Las Canitas area of the city, which was very pretty and calm. Our guide Sophie was great at answering our questions and recommending other restaurants to try in the city.

highlight of buenos aires. My entire family which included my wife, 2 teenage children, and myself particpated in the parrilla tour in Palermo. It was a great choice since it was good for all ages and was fairly relaxed and not stressful. The food we tried was excellent and we learned so much about argentinian culture.

Do it day 1. This food tour was an excellent way to get our dining all organized for our stay in Buenos Aires. We learned all about the local food and drink, how we should order the food, as well as an extremely helpful list of restaurants that we used throughout the stay. Our guide went as far as to help us make reservations at the closed door restaurant, I Latina which is a hard booking to get! Do the tour your first full day so you don´t waste time eating bad food in Buenos Aires!

Authentic Buenos Aires Experience. This was one of our best experiences during our month visit in Buenos Aires. The guides, David and Santiago, were extraordinary hosts. They provided excellent background information about the authentic food and the venues. We especially loved the neighborhood that we explored- a part of Palermo that was new to us. The Parilla Tour is not to be missed if you are visiting Buenos Aires!

A lot of fun!. I don't do tours, but I signed up for this because I love to eat. And this offered a fun activity that included eating lots of great food. It was fun to sample different things in three different restaurants, including a parrilla that won't even let people in that they don't know (they even have the door gated with a "closed" sign on it to discourage tourists). I was so stuffed by the end of it that I couldn't eat nearly as much as I had hoped to. But I was still able to eat at least half of the delicious sorbet at the fourth stop. Overall, this was a very fun and social experience - I highly recommend it, especially if you are traveling solo or with one other person and want to meet some new people.

Great Way to Spend an Afternoon!. I am a 32 year old, pregnant-for-the-first-time Canadian girl, who doesn't often do the 'guided tour' thing but signed up for the Parilla Tour in Palermo Chico and had a great time! Met some nice people including our knowledgeable guide, and part-owner of Parilla Tours, David. The parillas on the tour were restaurants that you would never normally stumble into as a tourist. The highlight being the 'secret parilla' which was fantastically odd and delicious. The tour ended with ice cream. Big thumbs up for steak and ice cream from the pregnant lady!

Interactive and Social. As a solo traveler I am always on the lookout for activities where you can meet others like on this tour. It is also sometimes a little intimidating to dine solo, so this is a great tour if you are interested in eating well. The groups participants varied from about 20-70 years old and was made up of people from all over the world. At the start our guides Sofi and Sabrina explained the plan for the afternoon and what we would be eating. In total we visited 4 restaurants. They all had great typical food and were very local feeling. The tour lasted about 2.5 hours and was very enjoyable.

Small group food tour. Had a very nice time on this tour in Buenos Aires. Our group was 6 people plus our guide Sophie. The good:Great food and wineOur guide was very passionate about the city and its cuisineGreat tips from a localVisited places you would never find without a localSocial atmosphereThe bad:Didn´t have time to also do the San Telmo route!Will be telling all of our friends visiting the city about Parrilla Tour!

Greatest Authentic Memory of Buenos Aires. Parilla Tour Buenos Aires is an absolute must do. In fact, I would suggest it as one of the first things you that you schedule as a visitor to the city. We were not only given a DELICIOUS variety of authentic Argentine cuisine, we were also given a history behind the food. David and Santiago are so knowledgeable and were kind and patient with all of my questions. I truly had the greatest experience hopping from stop to stop and will for sure do the Parrilla Tour again when I'm next in B.A. For those of you who are reading this and plan to sign up, I am very jealous! Enjoy!

San Telmo Food Tour. Very highly recommended. Great food in a beautiful part of the city - historic, spirited, artistic, very European and very charming. We started in an old café with THE BEST fresh empanadas hand made by an 82 year local old woman. Next we moved to a classic parrilla restaurant with full cuts of meat, more sides and plenty of wine. And to top it off, homemade ice cream at a nearby shop - very quaint, very delicious. David, our guide, was extremely knowledgeable in regards to the cuisine, to the culture, and to all aspects of the Buenos Aires community - he was by all means accommodating and full of helpful information. The tour is very well-paced. I felt extremely comfortable with the flow of food and information. Nothing is rushed and the utmost careful attention is paid in order for a complete enjoyment of the dining experience. I would VERY HIGHLY RECOMMEND this tour to anyone who is interested in good food and wine. I believe, and I suspect many people as well, that the best way to visit a city is to inform and enjoy yourself to the local food scene. This is tour is especially excellent for anyone traveling a few weeks or even a few days because they can recommend a host of other great recommendations outside of the food tour. Essentially it is a perfect way to meet good company and orient yourself to the quality food scene in Buenos Aires. Also I researched their competition - Buenos Aires food tours - and was underwhelmed by the comments/recommendations and experiences they had to offer. Parrilla Tour is the way to go. David is friendly, knowledgeable, laid-back, and understands exactly what it means to provide a quality dining experience.

Can't Miss Tour of the BA Culinary Scene. David and Santiago's parrilla through Palermo Soho and Las Canitas was an unforgetable experience and absolutely a highlight of my two weeks in Buenos Aires. The first stop introduced us to choripan, my (now) favorite Argentine snack. The empanadas at our next stop were the tastiest and freshest empanadas of the trip, and I ate empanadas just about every day, if that says anything....The secret parrilla was probably the coolest aspect of the tour because we were dining cosily among locals on an enclosed patio on the roof of a quaint brick building and were served so much delicious traditional Argentine cuisine (marinated eggplant, beef de chorizo, arugula salad with parmesan) and wine. In addition to the delicious food, I learned so much from David about the history of the country and culture and about the local traditions. Wouldn't trade this culinary experience for any other restaurant or tour in BA! Absolutely a can't miss!

Wonderful evening of food and wine. This was our favorite meal of our Argentinian trip. We arranged a private dinner tour in Palermo. Our guide, a young woman named Sophia, had organized everything perfectly so that there was a table waiting for us at the packed restaurants we visited. During our evening we stopped at 4 separate small neighborhood spots, none of which you would ever find in a guidebook. The food and wine we got were outstanding, but probably our favorite part was getting to meet somone that lived in Buenos Aires and could answer our endless questions and give us insider tips for everything from restraunts, tango, city tours, to even where to get the best deals on leather goods. 5 star activity without a question!

A lunch with friends. We are not big tour people but quite enjoyed this food tour. The main draw was that their website emphasized that they brought you to local spots. They did exactly that and we had a wonderful afternoon. Our tour was a total of 6 people, but our guide told us that they limited groups to 12, which made the tour an enjoyable and intimate afternoon.

Best Food Tour in Buenos Aires!. David showed us such a great time touring local favorite parillas in Palermo (BA). The food was amazing, authentic, and we would have never found these places on our own! We keep dreaming of the choripan we had at the first stop, and the "secret parrilla" was such an unexpected treat. The tour was not only fun and delicious, but educational and cultural. Last stop was delicious heladeria (ice cream). Don't miss this tour! Check out my blog post on the Parrilla Tour here: http://thetraveluster.com/2013/07/parrilla-tour-buenos-aires

Great food, history, and fun!. My husband, 9 year old son, and I were just in Buenos Aires and this tour was one of the highlights of the trip! We were in the city during the slow season, so we had David and Santiago all to ourselves, which made it more like a fun afternoon of eating with friends in San Telmo than a tour. We started with empanadas, moved on to a parrilla that was so good we went back later in the week, and ended with ice cream that our son is still talking about. All along the way David and Santiago gave us a history of the city and an understanding of the food and wine we were enjoying. This is such a unique way to experience a city I am surprised that no one has done it before now! David then went above and beyond the call of duty. We had casually mentioned during lunch that we had dinner reservations at Il Latino, a top restaurant in B.A. When we arrived that evening the owners of the restaurant informed us that David has called ahead to let them know we were coming and had asked them to take special care of us (which they did). Service like that cannot be beat. If you love food, or you just want to experience the city in a new way, we highly recommend Parrilla Tour Buenos Aires. You will not be disappointed!!!

Local Experience. I work for a travel company and have tried out many different kinds of tour experiences. This was unique, authentic and very well organized. It was executed smoothly which is not always an easy feat in Argentina, definitely recommend it for those that want to experience something local and delicious.

San Telmo dining highlights. Over the weekend my girlfriend and I participated in the Parrilla Tour of San Telmo. On the tour we learned all about the culture and history of the city, but most importantly shared some great foods with a nice group of people from all around the world. The amount of food given on the tour was just right. This tour has a great thing going and I wish we would have been in town long enough to do their other route in the north of the city.

Culinary gems of Buenos Aires. Loved this tour of small restaurants of Buenos Aires. The foods that were picked out for us were great and each was unique and special. Nice activity to do early during your stay since you learn a lot about the country that is useful during the entire stay in Argentina .

Social Food Adventure in Buenos Aires. The Parrilla Tour was a fun afternoon. We met up with our guide and a few other travelers at a tiny neighborhood steakhouse where we were warmly greeted. The adventure started by trying a couple of typical streetfoods, but artisanal versions. The main stop was a parrilla that was hidden and for locals only. That was a highlight of our stay in the city. Finally we finished up at an ice cream shop where we ate the best ice cream I have ever had.

Wonderful food, guide and experience!. I have never done a review on this website before, only read other people´s, but we had such an enjoyable experience on the Parrilla Tour that I felt motivated to do a review! Our guide, Aylen, made the afternoon a uniquely local experience. All of the restaurants she had chosen for us had excellent food, but more than that the ambiance was incredible, filled with people from the neighborhood. We learned more about the city and country in just a couple hours than we ever could have from guidebooks.

Explore hidden BA restaurants. Our concierge at the Sofitel told us about this tour and that it was in his opinion the best way to try the food of Buenos Aires and that the steakhouses were places he went with his friends, and not tourist traps. We booked a private dinner tour in San Telmo that lasted about 3 hours. Our guides were Santiago and Lucia, both locals. The restaurants were not in the least bit fancy, but the ambiance felt so authentic and traditional! Food was all outstanding, and the bife de chorizo steak was far better than the high end parrilla we visted the following night.

Great Afternoon Eating in Buenos Aires!. My family and I did the San Telmo route of the Parilla Tour. Everyone (ages 32-70) really enjoyed this tour! It takes you off the beaten path of the more popular touristy restaurants to where the locals go. Everything was delicious! David did a great job describing the food, customs, and neighborhood. The atmosphere was light, relaxing, and fun!

Excellent Foodie Tour of Buenos Aires!. The Parilla Tour BA was an excellent foodie tour. David was very knowledgeable about the neighborhoods and food. The tour goes through the the local streets of BA that you would never know where there are fantastic restaurants, not even known by some locals. Highly recommend trying to the tour at the beginning of your trip to get a full understanding of the food scene in BA. David also does a great a job of recommending restaurants and bars even after the tour concludes.Highly recommend.

great time. Good way to meet other travelers from all around the world. The young woman that led our group was from Buenos Aires so knew lots about the culture and food and gave us good recommendations for dining in the city. The steak was so tender and the ice cream shop was great.

A progressive meal!. This was a fun afternoon in Buenos Aires. It was great because we got to eat at multiple restaurants during the tour and learned a lot about Argentine cuisine. 1) Stop 1 was where we met. It was a 200 year old building where they made amazing chorizo sandwiches and sauces to go with them. 2) Next we walked a few blocks to a small corner restaurant for a piping hot empanada straight from the oven. It was the best empanada we had in Argentina. 3) After that we walked a couple more blocks to another steakhouse where we sat down and had several foods including provolata cheese, 2 cuts of meat, a really nice malbec wine and salad. Very authentic restaurant filled with all locals besides us. 4) Finally we finished up at a wonderful ice cream shop. Flavors changed daily and made on site. All in all a very good food tour. Would recommend it if you are coming to Buenos Aires!

We went back for seconds!. When we were in Buenos Aires in January, we went on the Palermo parrilla tour and had a fantastic time. We just went back and took the San Telmo tour. It was as fabulous as the first time! These two sections of the city are so different and it is fascinating to compare the neighborhood places. Again, they have found wonderful stops with the best food and service. The portions of everything are generous. You really feel like you're having a family dinner with this group of people you've just met. Everyone lingers and talks nonstop over the lovely hospitality. I cannot say enough good things.If you are new to BsAs, David is especially willing to give out suggestions for restaurants and entertainment. He has lived there quite some time and he obviously loves the city. I recommend taking your tour early in your trip!

relaxed afternoon of excellent food and wine. After a busy few days of exploring Buenos Aires my wife and I did the parrilla tour and had a nice time. We really enjoyed it because we learned a lot and got to see a new part of the city, but it was also well paced and we did not feel at all rushed. All of the restaurants were delicious and the wine our guide Aylen had chosen for us was the best we had during the whole trip.

Be ready to eat!!. Loved this tour - David is full of knowledge about food and portenos and the relationship between the two! - plus he takes you places you will never find on your own. I did the Palermo tour and David was very accomodating and quick to respond to emails given I was very late in booking - but it all went smoothly and we had a great time. A nice touch is the list of restaurants to eat at around town and also the chimmichurri bag. Amazing food and insight - do it! Highly recommend.

We did both tour routes!. We initially signed up for the San Telmo route on a Saturday afternoon. After we had such a good time we decided to also do the tour in Palermo as well a few days later. The guides on both routes we great and could answer all of our questions and were very enthusiastic about food and wine. The food was wonderful in both neighborhoods and all of the places visited were highly unique.

Napa Valley foodies explore Buenos Aires!. We are from the Napa Valley area in Northern California and we love great food, wine and conversation! David and Santiago were very gracious and knowledgeable! David was especially versed in Argentinian wines and the history of wine making here. We loved trying authentic Argentinian food with the locals! The empanadas were the best we have had so far and the charming 80 year old owner and chef added to the experience. We highly recommend the tour!

Best steak in BA. We had a great time on this food tour that focused on small neighborhood spots. The steak we had at the main stop was one of the best things I have ever eaten in my life, and the ice cream shop was unreal!

One of the best things to do in South America. My family just finished a 3 week trip around Argentina, Uruguay, and Brazil and went on the Parrilla Tour during our time in Buenos Aires. We were attracted to this tour because their website said they took their groups to small local restaurants you do not read about in guidebooks. When we travel we try to blend in with the locals and eating where they do is a good bet for finding great food! We showed up at first restaurant and were warmly greeted by the co-founders David and Santiago. In total we visited 4 restaurants, including 2 separate steakhouses. All of the food was outstanding, we drank wonderful wine, met some great people, and learned so much about Argentine cuisine and culture. The tour was without question one of the highlights of our trip, and we've already recommended it to some friends heading to Argentina later this year.

well run tour. Awesome tour. They have obviously taken the time to organize it well and form relationships with all of the restaurants visited. Everything went flawlessly which made it easy to relax and enjoy the great food, wine, and new friends. Parrilla tour has a great thing going.

A great "foodie" tour in Buenos Aires!. Signed up for the Parrilla Tour on a whim since I was traveling solo in Buenos Aires and figured this would be a good way to try some delicious food and meet some new people – And I did both on this tour! David and Santiago ran an interesting tour which took us to a few very good restaurants with great food. We enjoyed a choripan (chorizo sandwich) to start, then an empanada, then a stop at a parrilla to enjoy a few appetizers and salad, as well as delicious steak and red wine. The final stop was for gelato, which was a delight. Our tour of ten was a mixed international group of friendly and gregarious people. A really nice way to spend an afternoon experiencing Buenos Aires in a unique way. The hosts were also knowledgable about dining in Buenos Aires and the Argentine food scene in general. They also had some great and useful recommendations for other things to see and do in town. Highly recommended.

buenos aires food highlights. Great food tour highlighting all the regional cuisine. This was less like a tour and more like a gathering with friends. David is passionate about food, wine, and Buenos Aires. This is a great activity for teens. My thirteen year old said it was the best activity of our two week trip. David takes the group to some food locations that only a local could access. Well worth it!

taste of buenos aires. We thourougly enjoyed this food tour. We chose the route in Palermo. The tour consisted of a small group of 8 people from The US, Canada, and South Africa. The empanada we had was the best I tried in Argentina! It was also interesting to be able to see so many locals since the places we went were all non-touristy.

More than you expect!. Thanks to David for showing us around BA and showing us a great time! So informative and we really got to see some nice spots! The food and wine you showed us was really fantastic and the secret Parilla was really lovely! Muchos Gracias!!! And your name will be the first I drop to all my friends coming over! Xx Ryan and Tania - Baby Mammoth

Explore and eat well. This tour was one of our favorite things we did while in Buenos Aires. At its base it is a food tour, but in practice it is much more. The food portion of the parrilla tour was outstanding. Very local restaurants and delicious food. The places visited were not in the least bit trendy or fancy, but places that people from the neighborhood ate. The real value for us though was the guide and their extensive knowledge of the city. Outside of learning about their food, they answered everything from questions about politics to the economy, to cultural traditions. It did not feel at all like a traditional organized tour, more like a wonderful lunch with new friends. Best of luck Parrilla Tour!

Delicious and Informative!. This was an amazing day in Buenos Aires. I am traveling alone and it was so nice to meet some Americans while tasting some of the best food BsAs has to offer. David was a fantastic tour guide and knew so much about the food and the city. I highly recommend this for anyone in Buenos Aires. It is a must do!

Fun. This was a great tour. We had a small group of five ranging in age from 29 to 76 plus another couple and the 2 guides. We had already taken a general tour thru BA on our first day and I was skeptical about how much this tour would offer. We love to travel for food experiences so we decided to go ahead it and I am very happy we did. We had a lot of fun.These guys are very knowledgeable about Argentine food, culture, and history. They give you a great overview of the different dining experiences as well as focus on what you are looking for while in Argentina. We really enjoyed visiting one local spot we could not have visited as regular tourists.They also offer other services like assistance with money exchange, private event planning, special transportation, etc.When I emailed them with random questions long after the tour was over I got quick responses that were extremely helpful.They made our trip to Argentina better. We will be back soon.Ben HAtlanta Ga.

A+ Tour. Outstanding tour. Well organized, tasty food, and excellent people! More than an organized tour the parilla tour felt like a group of good friends dining together. Our guide made us all feel welcome and was happy to share all of their Buenos Aires secrets and tips.

Great overview of Argentina. I was down in Buenos Aires on a quick business trip last month and had one afternoon free. Being a food and wine lover I signed up for the Parrilla Tour of Buenos Aires since I loved the idea of visiting smaller and local restaurants. We ended up being a group of 6 people plus our guide. I learned a lot about the country and its cuisine in just a couple hours. All of the places were great and felt ultra local. A great tour for people that hate traditional organized tours!

A must if you are a foodie.. I took a solo trip to Buenos Aires and wanted to try the local food while there. I didn't have a lot of time or a companion during my trip to seek out the local restaurants so the Parilla Food Tour was the perfect solution. I took the San Telmo tour that's held on Saturdays. We visited three restaurants. They were all delicious. Not only were they helpful with learning about the local food, they were a great source for booking other activities. They suggested other restaurants for dinner and helped me make reservations. I felt as though I had a travel concierge. They really seemed to care that the guests had a great time in Buenos Aires. I would definitely try their second tour the next time I visit.

Fun, Delicious, and Informative Tour. My friends and I only had a few days in BA and weren't sure what to do. We stumbled upon this tour and were really happy that we did. David was great and enthusiastic in explaining everything. The choice of restaurants was perfect and we definitely felt we got our money's worth. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to get a good taste of Argentinian cuisine and have a fun time doing it.

Awesome experience. We arrived in BA without doing any real research on what we wanted to see and do. All we knew was that we had limited time and wanted to eat as much as possible, especially getting a flavor for local cuisine. After a few searches online for where to eat, we came across a review of the Tour. Liking what we read, we reached out to the tour guides on Saturday morning and were quickly booked for the San Telmo tour that afternoon! Our group of 5 had a great time trying empanadas, grilled meats and ice cream with David and the team...we had such a great time, that when we met up with our group in Santiago we advised them to take the tour when it was their turn to visit BA. David and the team have done a great job creating an authentic, local experience, clearly building relationships with longtime BA residents and restaurant owners in order to create a truly fun and unique offering. And not only did we enjoy the food tour, but the guides gave us really great recs on other things to do and see in the city...highly invaluable.

Delicious tour. A big reason we came to Argentina was to try the famous food, especially the meat and wine. We did this tour on our first day in the city. All of the parrillas we visited were great and were places we would have never found without our guide Belen. She gave us a booklet of restaurant recommendations that never failed us during our stay in Buenos Aires. The company was well run and had clearly organized everything, something that we discovered is not so common in the country!

Worth the time and investment.. I had read about the Buenos Aires food scene prior to my arrival but I was not sure where and what to eat. The tour gave a complete sense of the food culture and it did not feel like a tourist trap. I am usually skeptical of tours, but this one was different. The tour with David and Santiago felt more like hanging out with friends living in BA that wanted to show their friend, me, around the neighborhood. In the days following the tour I ate at several highly-acclaimed restaurants, and they were absolutely tourist traps and nothing but good marketing (e.g., La Cabrera). This made me appreciate the tour even more. With that in mind, the price of the tour seems even cheaper.The tour affords you the opportunity to have have a churipan, empanada, proveleta, steak, and gelato. All in a few hours and in the company of friends. What more could someone want out of a food tour.

Worth the time and investment. I had read about the Buenos Aires food scene prior to my arrival but I was not sure where and what to eat. The tour gave a complete sense of the food culture and it did not feel like a tourist trap. I am usually skeptical of tours, but this one was different. The tour with David and Santiago felt more like hanging out with friends living in BA that wanted to show their friend, me, around the neighborhood. In the days following the tour I ate at several highly-acclaimed restaurants, and they were absolutely tourist traps and nothing but good marketing (e.g., La Cabrera). This made me appreciate the tour even more. With that in mind, the price of the tour seems even cheaper.The tour affords you the opportunity to have have a churipan, empanada, proveleta, steak, and gelato. All in a few hours and in the company of friends. What more could someone want out of a food tour.

The San Telmo Tour was so good, we did the Palermo Tour. We enjoyed the food tour in San Telmo district so much, that after our Antarctica Expedition, we signed up for the Palermo Tour. Both were exceptional in terms of food tasting, explanation of food culture and history, and above all, David, the tour guide who made the latter aspects possible. He is one exceptionally friendly customer focused guide and company co-owner. The parilla in San Telmo was unique. We actually returned to eat there before leaving BA. The empanadas in San Telmo were hand made by two ladies gifted in the art of making empanadas. The secret "hidden" parilla in Palermo was a joy to visit and experience. No way could simple tourists ever be invited into a 'hidden' parilla. David made it happen! Wow! the foods were fantastic I need say no more except to advise you to take one of the food tours when going to Buenos Aires!

A must when visiting Buenos Aires!. I highly recommend the Parilla Tour to anyone visiting Buenos Aires who is looking for great restaurants that locals eat at! The tour surpassed my expectations because of the the combination of great food and the outstanding service provided by both Santiago and David. Santiago and David took us to 3 restaurants in Palermo where we the tastiest empenadas at one restaurant , delicious steak at another, and some incredible ice cream at the third. They then went out of there way to take us to a fun local bar that offers craft beer and they recommended other restaurants for us to try.The trip would not have been the same without Santiago and David so thank you both!

Must-do in Buenos Aires!. I had heard about this tour from a friend and I have to say, it was worth every penny! Our guides, David and Santiago, were friendly, knowledgeable, and extremely helpful. Even before getting to Buenos Aires, David gave me some hotel recommendations over email, and my friend I loved the hotel that we went with. Onto the tour itself: we visited 4 restaurants that weren't in the guide books, but were fantastic and filled with locals. In fact, we spent the rest of the trip trying to find a Parrilla as good as the "Secret Parrilla" we visited on our tour (thankfully, we came close on our last night). This tour actually made me join Trip Advisor, just so I could rave about it!

Excellent way to spend an afternoon in BA!. Was visiting BA only for about a day and a half on our way to Chile to trek in the Atacama Deser and wanted to make sure we made the most of our trip. We saw this tour and it was right up our alley as we wanted to experience the local culture, food, and explore some of the neighborhoods outside of our hotel area. David and Santiago were fantastic guides- explaining the dishes, some of the history of the food and the neighborhood, and even providing us with suggestions for places to go after the tour and the local nightlife. We enjoyed the food and company so much, that we are recommending it to a number of our friends/classmates who will be spending some time in BA after our time in Chile! Can't wait to experience some of their other tours next time I'm in Argentina!

Outstanding tour of local restaurants. We always try to go on a food tour when visiting a new city since it is a great way to find out about local dishes and culture. The Parrilla Tour went to 4 little restaurants to try food and drink. The places selected were great and we learned so much about Argentina. Our guide, David, was obviously passionate about his job and the food and wine of Argentina, which made a big difference in our enjoyment.

Lots of fun. It was a great tour for the first time visitors to BA like my wife and I were. Excellent introduction not only to local food specialties (from empanadas and steaks to ice-cream) but also to the life in BA in general. We got answers to pretty much everything we asked about. Dave and his friendly crew did an excellent job. Steaks at Don Ernesto have become one of the best meals of the whole trip.Thank you guys!

Must Do Culinary Tour!. I traveled alone for a business trip and found this company online. They had great reviews and I love eating so I gave it a try. This was my third trip to Buenos Aires in one year and before this dining experience I was not impressed with the local food. After the Parrilla Tour, I definitely changed my mind. The best empanada, steak, vegetable dish, cheese, and ice cream I ate in Buenos Aires were all on this tour. The two guides were knowledgeable and friendly. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone that loves to enjoy high quality, local food when they travel. Without the tour guides, one wouldn't even be allowed access to one of the private restaurants we visited. Also, the guides were happy to offer plenty of opinions on other restaurants we should visit during our trip. Wonderful experience.

real buenos aires restaurants. Great food tour. Best part is that they take you to local restaurants where the locals go. The places visted do not normally get tourists and so you get an authentic local experience. Good food and guide as well.

fantastic steak experience. We read a review of the parrilla tour on the BBC on Saturday morning and decided to call them at the last minute to see if they could accomodate us for that afternoon. Luckily they had some spaces left on their Palermo route that started near the polo field. We arrived at the first little restaurant where we met the 7 other participants for that day, a group of friendly people. In total we went to 4 stops. Each had been selected for being traditional. The steak we had at the 3rd stop was one of the best things I have ever eaten and the ambiance made me feel like a local. Great food, people, and wine! Thanks for all the tips guys!

Great experience. This is a great authentic eating experience in Buenos Aires. We really enjoyed all aspects of the Parilla tour in San Telmo. That is meeting a few like minded travellers, tasting great local food and wine in a non tourist environment with great guides who explain the food and culture in a friendly way. Definitely a must do for food lovers and tour haters.

Great food and guide. Had a great time on this food tour in Buenos Aires. Our guide, a young woman named Belen, took us to 4 different stops where we tried foods traditional in Argentina. All of the tour stops were where local porteno people frequent. Not places that put focus on trying to be trendy, but food family run restaurants. A huge bonus of our tour was the guide. She was prepared and was so friendly and welcoming. At the end she was happy to get a cab for us as well as call and make a dinner reservation for the next night a restaurant in San Telmo that was our favorite meal of the trip.

bbq tour. Being from BBQ country in the US I have quite high standards for grilled meat! I saw this tour written up on a food blog and decided I had to try it out when we passed through Buenos Aires. The food we tried was excellent and defintely lived up to the hype. My favorite foods on the tour were the chorizo sandwich with chimichurri sauce and the ice cream at the final stop. Besides the food, a huge value of the tour was everything we learned from our guides. They were happy to answer our endless questions about Argentina.

authentic dining tour. I´m someone that hates organized tours, but booked a tour with Parrilla Tour after a friend recommended it, not knowing quite what I was getting myself into. I was happily surprised and had a great afternoon with the two founders of the company, Dave and Santi. In total we were 8 people, a nice sized group since I got to meet some interesting people, but not so large that you felt like you were on one of those obnoxious tour groups. I was told 8 was the average group size. We visited 4 different little restaurants and tried a food at each and an outstanding malbec wine at the main stop. All of the places we visted were ultra local and you could tell the owners of each were passionate about making their foods. At the end of the day I walked away knowing all about Argentine food and culture as well as had a nice relaxing afternoon. I don´t like tours, but I recommend this tour!

Must Do In Buenos Aires!. This parrilla tour is a must for all foodies traveling to BA! We are a family of three and were lucky enough to have the guide, David, to ourselves. We chose the Palermo option, and the tour was very informative, relaxed, and most of all delicious! We loved every item served on the tour, and dining at authentic local restaurants was a great experience. Most of all, David was really knowledgable about local cuisine and culture. He answered all of our questions (we had a lot), and even gave us many recommendations of things to do and where to go while staying in BA. The tour and David went above and beyond our expectations. Can't say enough great things about this tour!

wonderful food. This tour was one of the highlights of our trip through South America. Our guides were friendly and helpful throughout the tour and taught us so much about the culture of Argentina. The restaurants we visted were outstanding and we would have never found them on our own. If you love food, you will love this tour!

A nice evening out. We were lucky enough to have both David and Santiago turn up and, as I and my wife were the only guests that night, have them to ourselves to boot, so we felt more like having new friends show us around the neighbourhood than being on a tour. We met up at a place that serves brilliant choripan, went to another for wonderful empanadas, then had provoleta, sirloin and pork flank at a place where apparently you had to be known to be admitted. David and Santiago had brought a very nice Malbec especially to accompany the meat. We finished with ice cream at a fourth place. The food and wine were excellent, the places were ones you probably wouldn't find on your own, and our hosts were informative and good company. We recommend checking it out, but bear in mind that the tour is also relatively expensive and, depending on what you're looking for, you might not find it good value for money.

Outstanding tour. As a 22 year veteran in the travel industry I have been on countless tours in many cities and countries, but the Parrilla Tour was one of the best I have ever participated in. It was professionally run yet relaxed and fun, truly authentic, well organized, and a cultural learning experience. The guide knew the answer to every question we had and was outstanding at making sure everyone had as good a time as I did. Bravo!

Excellent way to understand local culture. This food tour was a great introduction to Argentine cuisine and culture. We visted several little local restaurants and got to try foods at each. The guide, Belen, told us all about the food of the country and the background of each item sampled. All of the spots we went to were off the beaten track and had interesting stories. We went on the tour on our final day in the country, but wish we would have found out about it earlier since it would have explained a lot of questions we had.

Best meal in Argentina. My husband and I did the parrilla tour last Saturday afternoon with a group of 7 people in San Telmo and had a wonderful time. The tour started outside of the marketplace at a little empanada restaurant where they handmade the empanadas to order. Next to by far the best steakhouse of our trip where we tried several foods, including a perfectly cooked piece of bife de chorizo steak. To finish up the afternoon we went to an ice cream shop where we had outstanding ice cream. The guides were extremely friendly and willing to give recommendations and tips for our trip.

A "Can't Miss" for a non-touristy/typical outing!. I am a traveler who hates tourist attractions, and the Parilla Tour was the PERFECT activity. The enchanting guides/owners, David and Santiago, use their local connections to tour typical restaurants -including restaurants that otherwise do not allow foreigners. At each restaurant, local and culinary history and traditions are explained. I would HIGHLY recommend this activity for anyone/everyone who is visiting Buenos Aires.

Great way to learn about local food and culture, excellent guides.. The Parilla Tour is enjoyable, interesting, informative, and provides a unique insight into local cuisine. Each stop along the tour provided a distinct experience to learn about Argentina, try delicious foods, and learn from the very knowledgeable guides. Santiago and David, were very engaging guides, ensuring every detail was closely attended to. The food was top notch. Highly recommended for any visitor looking for a unique dining experience while in Buenos Aires.

Meatilicous!. My wife and I did the San Telmo parrilla tour on April 6th 2013 and it was fantastic! The guides, David and Santiago, were extremely knowledgeable about the Buenos Aires food scene and all the locations the tour visited were delicious. It was a great way to get some local insight into the culture and cuisine of this incredible city. Highly recommend for anyone who is looking to get off the beaten path and see where and how the locals eat.

Great thing to do in BA. I would definitely recommend this tour to anybody visiting BA. It was an interesting introduction into the way the Portenos eat. Our tour guide David was professional and extremely knowledgable about everything.....the food, the wine, the people and the city. It's a friendly, insightful tour, run by guides who are generous, courteous and full of inside information about this fascinating place.

Dining Concierge for Buenos Aires!. My husband and I learned an incredible amount about Buenos Aires and Argentina on this food tour. The guides, David and Sabrina, were a fountain of information that proved helpful during our entire stay in the country. Besides doing a great tour, these guys offer excellent customer service in a land where it is not the norm. Making the booking was fast and easy, the tour started promptly, and they even were happy to help us the day after the tour make a reservation at a restaurant where reservations are hard to get. Do this tour day 1 in BA to maximize your time in the city!

Meat 101. Definitely recommend a Parrilla Tour to anybody interested in a thorough introduction to Argentine meat culture. We booked a private tour for two people. Our guides Santiago and Sabrina were both extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and they organized an unforgettable tasting experience for us at a variety of local venues. We got to sample some adventurous cuts of meat (salty blood sausages, beef intestines, etc) and some delicious wine. Tidbits of history as well as everything you want to know about the food. Great way for complete newcomers to get their feet wet and learn their way around a parrilla menu.

Eat where the locals eat. This was a wonderful way to get to visit local buenos aires restaurants. Our guide Sabrina took us to hidden restaurants that had delicious food as well as amazing people watching! In just a few hours we learned all about Argentine cuisine and traditions. They are very generous with the food and wine, so don´t worry about that. For the amount got out of the experience that was useful during the rest of our trip in Argentina this tour was an excellent value.

Excellent tour!. Well worth taking this tour which lasts just a few hours. You get real feel for how the locals eat and the places you visit are world class, local, quaint eateries. We met some great people on our tour and our guide David was spot on with recommendations for other restaurants. Would really recommend this to anyone interested in dining out in BA

Solid tour!. I found the Parrilla Tour via Google Search a few hours before I flew to Buenos Aires so I didn't have a chance to check out the reviews prior to the trip. Even still, I found the experience enjoyable! I must admit, I thought it would either consist of more locations with smaller portions of native Argentinean courses. We basically went to one place for empanadas, another for what I'll call the "dinner" which featured 3 courses we tried, and then an ice cream place for dessert (Try the cerveza ice cream! I know it sounds scary and possibly gross but it's really good! haha). Our guide, Sabrina, did a great job and she was attentive for our diverse group. Given the layout of the tour, I only wish we had had a chance for more dishes, perhaps even pastries specific to the area or more styles of meat (i.e. flank steak, tenderloin, etc.). But I still definitely recommend if you get a chance to visit San Telmo. The neighborhood is just perfect for this type of tour!

go places you would never have gone using a guidebook. great company, great guides, great tour.
