You are brought to several places around the city that you would not find on a website or city guidebook. they were extremely considerate and followed up with us before and after our tour to make sure our stay in BA was the best it could be. worth every penny.

Off the beaten path. We were lucky enough to have Sabrina, a beautiful and charming Argentine speaking excellent english, as our tour guide. We arrived 10 minutes early but she was already waiting at the meeting point, a small neighborhood cafe where we had delicious choripan. The best part of it was the chimichurri sauce. We then proceeded down the road to have some hot home made empanadas while walking to our main meal. The restaurant was closed, with a big Cerrado sign across the door, but the doors miraculously opened just for Sabrina- and us. They don't much like tourists there. The Provoleta - grilled whole provolone cheese - was rich and flavorful. The arugula salad with parmigian was nice too. The Malbec was good, and so was the bife de chorizo, even though they don't do rare in Argentina and the meat was ok but a bit tough. Excellent gelato to finish and all in all a very nice tour though not great value for the money.

Authentic and refreshing. The restaurants we visited on this tour were the highlights of my visit to Argentina. They were not trendy or touristy, but places that actual people from Buenos Aires go to eat. The food was outstanding, and the food was wonderful. Great job guys!
Great Guides, Great Experience. David and Santiago were great hosts- we were able to see a side of BA food and entertainment that we otherwise would have missed out on. Highly recommended!

Professional and Fun. Davis and Santiago were able to accommodate our group last minute and pulled off an amazing experience. They are pro's at what they do but maintain a fun exciting pitch throughout the tour. It's fascinating to hear their knowledge of Buenos Aires and you leave the tour feeling full and cultured. The gelato at the end was off the chaaaaaaiiiiiin! Highly recommend :)

Best thing to do In Buenos Aires!. This is a fabulous, must do tour. I work in travel so have done lots of 'food tours' and this is up there as one of the best. There were 8 of us and another couple on their honeymoon were also booked. David is totally professional, takes you to all the little places you would never find on your own. The food is seriously the best in town, and they also give you a list of their favourite places to dine if you have a few days in BA. We did the Palermo/Las Canitas trip, but would have also done the San Telmo one if we got a chance. Do this on day 1 if you can so you know what to order and where to eat when you are there!!!! Loved it. Congratulations David on a great little bsuiness.
Amazing tour. What an awesome tour!! Would have never found these delicious spots on our own. The guides were very knowledgeable and fun! 5 star.

Food tour in Buenos Aires. I´m a very independent traveler, so I rarely go on organized tours, but after my hotel recommended the Parrilla tour to me and reading about it in the NY Times I signed up still a little doubtful. The tour ended up being one of the best parts of my Argentinian adventure. The atmosphere of the tour is very laid back and social. I learned so much, but it was obvious the guide was passionate about the cuisine, and not repeating a script. The group was 7 people from around the world and we shared a table at each stop, all hidden local places, and were friends by the end.

Wonderful experience in an authentic province.. We contacted the Tour for a private tour, as we were a in a group of 13. Our tour was the San Telmo tour. At first, we were a bit apprehensive when the taxi driver dropped us off at the meeting location, for it was a hole in the wall restaurant, that I would not have tried if it was not part of the tour. But once inside, we met the owners of the restaurant and we fell in love with not only the food, but the atmosphere. (We went back after the tour for a beer, and the owners insisted on feeding us again!)The next stop was an authentic restaurant, popular with the locals. Again the food and atmosphere was wonderful. We enjoyed dinner as we received an explanation of the area and origins of the food, wine and the local neighborhood. The experience was capped off at a local ice cream store. Again, great tasting and great atmosphere. I would thoroughly recommend the Parrilla Tour to those who really want to experience authentic Argentina, not just the tourist traps! (oh and for those who are not used to the local accent, it is actually pronounced par-ri-sha, not par-ril-la nor par-ri-ya. That way the locals don't give you weird looks when you ask about it)

Great overview of Argentinian cuisine. We went to this tour at the start of our 2 weeks in Buenos Aires. It was a small group of 5 ( myself, my wife, one other tourist and 2 guides). All the food was delicious and was nice to find out more about Argentinian food and culture. We went around the area of las canitas which was really nice to se. David and Santiago were really helpful and answered the million questions we asked. They gave us great tips on places to visit and were really helpful with trying to organise other activities. We are both backpackers so the tour was quite expensive for us. If your not travelling on a right budget it is a great way to try an array of foods and meet some other people.

Perfecto Parrilla Experience. What a fun afternoon we had eating delicious traditional Buenos Aires food! Our guide David was very knowledgable and friendly and took us to four outstanding eateries in the wonderful Los Carnitas neighborhood to experience choripan, empanadas, steak, fried provolone, wine and to end -ice cream! The cost for all of this was very reasonable. David definitely knows the history and background of BAs most famous foods and put together one of our most memorable afternoons during our 10 day stay. I would recommend this tour to anyone with one warning: be sure to have a hearty appetite when you arrive!!

Social food tour. The Parrilla Tour was a great way to meet people from all over the world and share an afternoon over some wonderful food and malbec. The tour is set up so it´s more like a lunch with a group of friends than a formal tour. We learned a lot about Argentina, but also had plenty of time to socialize and share travel stories with the other participants.

Different and delightfull. This is not a typical tour. It is laid back, all local places you wouldn't find, small groups, good wine, real not touristy food etc. Highly recommend. We took the Palermo tour and visited 3 locations plus an ice cream shop. The personal attention was outstanding and went beyond the tour. David provided lists of other restaurants and even definitions of terms we would encounter while in Argentina. He was happy to provide recommendations relative to any question. The food, while not 5 star, was really good. More like what you would get at a local mom and pop establishment which in reality was the entire point of doing this excursion. I would suggest eating a only a light breakfast when you go as there is a LOT of food available. Just can't say enough nice things here, highly recommend.

Great tour. Sure, you can come to Buenos Aires and find your way to a parilla or an empanada shop or an ice cream shop. But you won't know the full story behind what you're ordering and you won't go to the places the locals go and you won't order like a local. This tour tells the story behind the food.I'd recommend going on this tour towards the beginning of your stay in Buenos Aires. David gives a list of detailed restaurants he recommends and helps with tips on ordering the best food. We have gone to several of the recommendations on David's list and they've been great. None were in our guide book and they all seemed like locals-only places. Really helpful.We had a great time on this tour and would recommend it to anyone who wants to know more about traditional Buenos Aires cuisine.

Exceeded expectations. Definitely a non-tour kind of tour. David and Santiago are as down to earth as they are knowledgeable about food in the city, and between them they had answers to everything.The food was phenomenal and you will try restaurants you would never find otherwise (one of the parrillas changes its name weekly to keep tourists away!)Would definitely do again, and have already recommended to my friends that are coming to BA soon.
Good Food. Although the food was great, this tour was overpriced. It lasted two hours tops and the guy running it didn't seem like a foody or the type of person that should be running tours.

Eat like a local, learn like a tourist!. If you like learning about traditional foods and you're keen to dine like the locals then this tour is for you! David was absolutely great, happy to answer all sorts of questions, about the food, the stories behind it and the city in general... Make sure you come hungry! The added bonus was the amazing advice about other places to visit, good restaurants and bars. He is only too happy help! The other great thing is that they don't take more than 12 to a group so you get to know your fellow food explorers.

Parrilla Tour: Don't Miss this One. We enjoyed our afternoon of food tasting with David, originally from Portland,Oregon. Not only did he take us to some of his favorite lunch spots in Telmo, he gave us a list of various fine eateries in other neighborhoods in Buenos Aires. We learned so much about the culture and places to visit during our brief stay. Don't miss this great opportunity to get connected to this beautiful area and eat like a king! The ice cream was some of the best I've ever tasted, and it left us with a sweet flavor after a memorable tour.

Amazing tour and Amazing Resource. I'm not a fan of tours-but I am a fan of eating-and drinking so I really enjoyed this informal tour! It was well worth the money and tour guides were awesome. But in my opinion the real value was David and Sabrina and their vast knowledge and "hook ups" in Buenos Aires! I was hell bent on finding my 5 year old an authentic polo outfit and hours after the tour I had an email from David with a list of reccomended places! I mentioned I wanted to go to Fashion Week-he had a friend in the business who could help me get tickets! The food was amazing at the restaurants-in fact two days later we ran into him conducting another tour as we re-visited one of the previous stops! I highly recommend it!

The best way to start Argentina and meet people. The parrilla tour was an awesome way to start my trip around Argentina since the guides tell you all about the country´s food and culture. Also, I met several other travelers that I ended up going out with during my stay in the city.

Would definitely do it again!. On our first day in Buenos Aires after a 20 hour flight we went on the parila tour in the old San Telmo area of the city. The chorizopan sandwich was outstanding, steak was cooked perfectly and so flavorful, and the ice cream was hands down the best either of us had eaten in our lives (and my wife is Italian!). So good that we came back another night since we had to have the ice cream again! The guides Santiago and David were fantastic and prepared us for the rest of our Argentina trip. Thanks for recommending Salon Canning to us!

Great intro to Argentine cuisine. My partner and I did the San Telmo tour a few weeks ago and really enjoyed the great food and all the useful information we were given. It set us up for our month-long stay in Argentina - giving us the confidence to order food in any restaurant and a good understanding of Argentine cuisine. David is a fountain of knowledge and also gave us a list of restaurants to try, which all proved spot-on. We would definitely recommend this tour for people who really want to get the most out of their Argentine food experience.

Very nice guide. The tour guide was very nice, ready to answer all our questions. We were taken to very typical eating establishments, the tour provided a good introduction into the yummy basics of argentine cuisine!

Excellent Tour and great food experience!. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour that included good wine, food, and the guides knowledge of Buenos Aires. The empanads were hot and eaten outside the bakery. The choripan sandwich - was eaten in a traditional cafe that had once been a dairy. Buenos Aires is quirky in that many restaurants are only for the locals. The guide took us to one of the "private restaurants", the parrilla where we indulged ourselves with meat and Malbec wine. The meat was so tender and the fried cheese was also good. To complete our meal we walked to an ice cream parlor and enjoyed great ice cream.

A must for foodies. We chose to vacation in Argentina in part because of the good food and wine. And our trip would not have been complete without this insider's tour. It was an excellent tour led by a knowledgeable and passionate duo of foodies.
Great experience!. A must-do in Buenos Aires! Amazing food, amazing staff and great value for your money (a ton of food). Especially loved the empanadas, the provoletta and the ice cream!!!!

Great food, great people, great experience!. What a wonderful way to be introduced to (as I'm slowly discovering) one of the more remarkable cities I've visited. David's very comfortable way of easing you into the BA culture and lifestyle makes you feel you almost belong. I'm one to usually travel solo, so this gave me a great opportunity to connect with the place, and meet like-minded travelers as well. Kudos, David!

do this tour first. We had a most enjoyable and informative - San Telmo - tour. A great introduction to Buenos Aires and it's food. Our guide - David - was a mine of information and introduced us to some great restaurants. All his recommendations were spot on and it being a small and sociable group made the whole experience very special

Great Local Buenos Aires Experience!. One of my favorite tours i did while i was in Buenos Aires. Santiago and David took us around local restaurants to taste all the local food as the locals do it. The food was amazing and our guides were extremely knowledgable about the local cusine. Loved the tour ... a must do if you plan to travel to Buenos Aires!

Excellent People AND Food. Our guides Santiago and David made our trip to Argentina better than we ever imagined it would be. Luckily they had space on our first day in BA. Besides taking us to delicious neighborhood restaurants where local porteno people eat they had endless tips about the city and country for us. When we get back to Buenos Aries from pinemar we are going to go on a private tour with them. See you soon Santiago and David!

Great intro to BA. I participated in the Palermo tour on my first day in Buenos Aires. The tour guide did a great job selecting unique places with local flare (and of course, good food). He was also able to recommend great places to visit outside of the tour. Aside from the great food and guide, it was nice spending time with other English-speaking Gringos who were able to share their experiences in Buenos Aires. I highly recommend this tour during your stay in BA.

Refreshing and Fun Way To Be Introduced To One Of The Great Culinary Destinations of the World!. We took the San Telmo tour the day we arrived in Buenos Aires after a 2-week cruise. The list of restuarants in the city was somewhat daunting and we wanted to have a feel for what we were in for by someone who lived there. David, an ex-pat from Oregon, and one of the individuals who runs Parilla Tours, was our guide, and we could not have been happier with our choice. He was freindly, polite, outgoing and eager to please, as was his young associate, wanting to ensure that everyone had a great time and enjoyed the wonderful food that his tour and Buenos Aires offers. We made three stops - first, in a little hole in the wall-type place for some incredible empanadas. Then, in a parilla for some great choripan (something I'm now addicted to) and some first rate steak and nice Malbec to accompany it. The final stop was an old-fashioned gelato place where we had the creamiest ice cream on the planet. I had some questions about where to go for dinner during my stay and David gave me some great tips about a parilla, which I went to twice before I left. I encourage anyone going to Buenos Aires to take this tour (on an empty stomach) and be prepared for a relaxed, funfilled and hearty time!

Great Foodie experience with a history lesson. Parilla Tour was a great way to jump in to Argentine food, wine and culture.The tour took us to great spots to sample a lot of different foods and see interesting parts of the city.David and Santiago were wonderful hosts who shred their love for great food and for Buenos Aires with us. We learned about all the varieties of meat as theey are prepared Parrilla style.I absolutlely loved the experience and the great treatment and information that the guides gave us.

Excellent Tour!. We took the San Telmo tour on the first full day of our vacation and so glad we did. First, it was a great intro to Argentine food...excellent empanadas, chorizipan, steak, wine. Most important, David and Santiago are excellent guides. They gave us so much information that proved invaluable throughout out 3 weeks in Argentina.

Well worth it! ...plus you get to eat AND see a new city!. David was kind enough to not cancel the tour even though it was just me.As others have mentioned, he is very prepared with suggestions and hand outs that were really helpful for the rest of my stay. He is also very prompt with responses and the website is very easy to navigate.David has obviously built up a great rapport with the local residents of BA which really benefits the people doing the tours!As for the food on the tour, the photos on here are very indicative....AND you don't leave empty handed either! Thanks David!

A must-do!. Argentine food is very simple, so the quality of the ingredients and the skill of the preparation are totally on display. The spots that David picked for the tour were flawless! The walk was through a lovely area with lots to see. My husband, one of his coworkers, and I took the Palermo tour. David is very comfortable to be around, and his attitude made our group of strangers instantly warm dining companions. He was extremely knowledgable about Argentina, ready to hand out recommendations, and very open about life as an expat. It was a fantastic experience! I really wish we had been able to do the San Telmo tour on the same trip. We will definitely check that one out when we're in Buenos Aires again!

Fab tour, great host & delicious food at historic local gems!. When my local expat friend from NYC told me about David's tour, I was already excited just imagining piles of good meat. I probably had my best cut of meat of my whole trip on this tour and most definitely at interesting, old school, off-the-beaten-path restaurants that I would NEVER find on my own. Lucky for me, David took care of everything - empanadas to start and all sorts of Argentine staples to follow. We had fresh bread, spreads, hot cheese, arugula salad, choripans, steaks, sauces and dessert too. I even had 2-3 glasses of malbec with my lunch and just wanted to roll home. Great deal for the price. Plus, truly local vibe at the different spots and a mixed crew of fellow carnivores rounded it all out. Definitely recommend!

Most enjoyable and satisfying. My wife and I went on this parrilla tour yesterday and enjoyed it. This is a quirky but most effective idea for gastro/culture tourism. Learning about Buenos Aires, Palermo, and the almost holy grail of the local foods (choripan, asado {parrilla}, and local ice cream flavors) was entertaining, informative, and enjoyable. A great bonus was the very good Malbec that our guide David provided. The places we visited were all obviously local joints. The Palermo area, where the tour was conducted, was easy on the eye and very pleasant. This tour is definitely worth the $$. Booking it was also easy, straightforward, and painlessly simple, directly on-line. The only other couple on tour with us was from our home town, a most pleasant coincidence.

Delicious food and entertainment with marvellous people!!!!!!!. I booked Parrilla tour for me & my boyfriend last week, because i would like to surprised him with the local food.It was one of our best meal experience in BA, wonderful tour guides,and perfect culture mix sharing the same table. At the end we received a tipical sauce call " Chimichurri" , that taste great with beef.Thank you so much Santiago & David for the tips you sent me by email

Well worth it. If you are new to Argentina or Buenos Aires, START your local foodie experience with this tour. Not only does David give you tips (while you're stuffing your face at family-owned haunts of San Telmo deliciousness) on all things parrilla, empanada and helado, but by living in BA for several years (and with a background in Argentine vino), he can also give you "of-the-moment" wine and restaurant picks that will insure your meal planning for the rest of your stay will be worth every peso.

Great Tour. My husband and I went on the Pattilla tour last went when we were in Buenos Aires. David took us to four different places. First we had choripan with different sauces. Next delicious empanadas at a take out place. Then a secret restaurant where we had salad, grilled cheese, steak and wine. Lastly we had great ice cream. David did a great job telling us about the neighborhood and the different foods. I would definitely recommend this tour. Also, we met some other interesting tourists.

Great food and fun!. We went on the Palermo tour and really enjoyed it. David provided good tips about dining in BA and interesting information about the area. The food was delicious, but make sure you are hungry as the quantities are generous and too good to leave any uneaten! This is a great introduction to BA.

Amazing food in Buenos Aries, Argentina. My girlfriend and I went on the tour this past Saturday. Going to several restaurants in Buenos Aries prior and tasting several Choripan, shore enough this tour I tasted the best Choripan, the best empanadas, and the best chorizo beef that Buenos Aries has to offer. Then they saved the best for last, as we had some of the world’s best ice cream. And when I am back home I drive far for good homemade ice cream. Nothing compared to the ice cream that Parrilla Tours showed me. I loved this tour so much that My Girlfriend and I have asked to do a private dinner with Parrilla Tours this upcoming Thursday. I am currently in Mendoza thinking of what Parilla Tours can offer me for Dinner. Very excited and can’t wait!!!

Was okay. Was okay. Wish there was a better selection of more met eating places. The places and things we ate we had already done them..so wasn't anything new if you've already eaten bife de chorizo/ just steak/or ice cream/empanadas

Fun Experience. My husband and I did this and thoroughly enjoyed all the stops. It is definitely a TON of food. I almost wish there was one more stop where we could just chill for a minute and get a drink before gorging ourselves again!! We did the San Telmo tour, and the highlights for me were the empanada stop and the second stop at Federal. The ice-cream was also amazing. David is very knowledgable, you can ask him anything. He also let us in on the closed door restaurant secret, which was such a highlight of our trip. I would recommend going early on during your stay in BA, as you will learn how to order different things, as well as get a handy list of some really great restaurants.

Enjoyable experience. This is a wonderful way to get to the tastier versions of the foods one should try. We went on the San Telmo and Palermo tours and this gives one a glimpse of the different neighborhoods. David knows his way around and describes the places and some of the history. The food is very tasty, but way too much, one has to pace your self....on both days the basic selection of food is the same, but it is not boring because of the different settings.

Amazing! Must do when in Buenos Aires!. This was such an incredible experience! Everything from booking to meeting up with the group was so easy. The Palermo tour was so amazing, we want to book the San Telmo tour before we leave! We learned exactly what to order, and can't wait to use our newfound knowledge for the rest of our trip. Thanks Santiago and David for all of the tips you gave us and answering our endless questions. Can't recommend this enough!

Cultural Dining. The real value in this food tour was the knowledge that the guide we had. Besides just knowing the best places to go we learned a lot about the history, culture, and customs of Argentina. This was super helpful during the rest of our trip around the country. A delicious learning experience.

Sort of a Progressive Dinner. We took the Parrilla Tour today and had a great time. My wife, 2 adult daughters and my son-in-law all participated. Both of the hosts made the tour very enjoyable. One Camilla is a native Porteno and Liz is a native of New Orleans. We had close to 20 that participated but that just meant we were able to interact with young people from other countries. The choripan was a sausage on fresh bread. Slightly spicy with Chimmichurri sauce used for grilled meat The 2nd course was a meat empanada that was the best I have had since I arrived. The 3rd course was Bife de Chorizo with a salad plus bread but was started with Melted provolone cheese, topped with oregano. Steak was juicy and tender. The finale a visit to Heladeria for the best ice cream I have had since we landed. My selection was a scoop of banana split plus mango flavored which was even better.

Great thing to do on your first day in BA. Tour overall was good, but could be better.. Tour consisted of 4 stops. 1 for choripan, 2 for empanadas, 3 for steak, wine, salad, cheese, and 4 ice cream. We were stuffed at the end of it. Value: $65/person buys a very nice dinner in BA, so this isn't a great bargain. That being said, we felt we got a good amount of food for the money. Tour guy David was interesting and knowledgable, but wasn't as outgoing and charismatic as other tour guides. Had the price been ~$40-$50 and David been brimming with interesting stories and facts, tour would have gotten 5 stars. If you have a decent budget and want to learn about the best stuff to order at the parillas for the rest of your stay, take this tour.

Delicious tour. The Parrilla Tour was by far the best dining experience on my recent trip to Argentina. Perfectly cooked steak, provaleta cheese dish, choripan sandwich, outstanding empanadas, and a wonderful wine. Besides the food the guides we had taught us all about the country and it's culture. We left the tour with filled bellies and new friends!

Great Tour!. My wife and I are NYC foodies who have traveled to 11 countries in 2012 (combination of business and pleasure trips).. We purchased David's walking tour of San Telmo blindly through Viator.... Wow! What a fabulous find. David and his co-owner Santiago are gracious, knowledgeable and great hosts. The food was outstanding....the tour started in a land marked cafe with an artisnal empanada, our 2nd stop a world-class parilla complete with chorizo sandwiches, salad, perfectly slow cooked beef and great Argentine wine. For desert we walked to an incredible ice cream shop where we tasted some ofthe best helado ever created!Most importantly, we would have never ventured into these restaurants on our own. David then went above and beyond...he was able to secure a restaurant reservation for us in a closed door restaurant that had not returned our emails! Excellente!!

Great food, friendly guides. The guides took the time to explain about the history of San Telmo and interesting facts about the cuisine. The food was delicious and is perfect to do in the first couple days in BA as you get a good sense of what to eat for the duration of the trip.

Great Experience. This is a must if you visit BA. We never would have experienced these places if it weren't for this tour. It was a very intimate, since there was only one other person on the tour besides my husband and I. Both David and his assistant were extremely knowledgable about the food and the area. We had the BEST ice cream I have ever tasted in my life. Thank you David for the great food and local insider tips! - Sonia and Robert.

Don't eat before the tour!. Do you want to know where the locals eat - where the neighborhood residents gather? This tour takes you there but come hungry and save room for the ice cream at the end. Along the way, you will not only taste the food, but you will learn about the history of the parillas (steakhouses) and the culture behind them.

Fun local food tour. We had a great time with David despite the ( unusual) pouring rain which lasted all day. He did a private tour for 4 of us in Palermo as Thursday was the only afternoon we had. We enjoyed seeing a bit of Palermo district and the local food was excellent. David is a knowledge guide and the ability to communicate easily with a native USA speaker was a plus.

Informative and delicious. The Parilla Tour was a great way to spend an afternoon in Buenos Aires. We ate some amazing food and gained a lot of knowledge on the city and places to go during the remainder of our trip. The guides were very knowledgeable and extremely friendly. Additionally, it was a great way to meet fellow travelers.

..A BsAs MUST... Whether this is your 1st time in Buenos Aires or not (as it was mine), and you travel for food, this tour is for you! David and Santiago are onto something that the travel and food industry craves, and what better place to start than in BsAs. Their tour can be a big group event or even an smaller intimate group. Lucky for me, I was the only traveler who showed up and had their attention all to myself. On top of that it was a Saturday, so they took me to places that were only available on that day or weekend - it was quite a treat not having to share my food time but with the tour hosts. I did the San Telmo Parrilla tour, which they also showed me around the neighborhood - saved me from another day tour. They also stated that the places you go to may not look like the best, but they will definitely serve you the best. Gotta love those mom & pop shops. Thanks David & Santiago for your time & expertise. May you prosper in all your endeavors & Happy Holidays..

Local food off the beaten track!. Palermo Tour : We started our tour at a small parrilla for Choripan, we hadn't heard of Choripan before and we loved it and the local atmosphere of the cafe. Our next stop involved eating the best empanadas we tried in Buenos Aires. Lunch was eaten at a great secret parrilla. The steak was amazing and lunch also included a local red wine complimenting the meal. David was very knowledgable about Buenos Aires and in particular the local food and wine. We appreciated his tips on how to order meat in Spanish. Our last stop was for gelato/ ice cream which was also amazing. If you are interested in trying local food then you won't be disappointed with this tour.

Great way to spend an afternoon in BA!!!. We had an amazing time with David on the San Telmo tour. He was very informative and fun, and the food was some of the best we had BA. Do this tour! It feels both authentic and off-the-beaten track but it's super well organized also. So fun!!

Excellent food tour. Our guide David from Parrilla Tour offered an excellent progressive dining experience of Argentinian food with a different course at each restaurant in Buenos Aires. All restaurants were within easy walking distance and, while we had plenty of great food, we did not end the tour uncomfortably stuffed--a worry we had at the start of the tour. The highlight of the tour was a family parilla that only serves locals or friends of locals--it's not a place you'll get to try unless you take the tour. David generously shared his deep knowledge of Argentinian food and wine culture and left us with a list of other recommended restaurants to try in Buenos Aires. I would highly recommend this tour anyone interested in Argentinian food culture.

A great afternoon out. I booked in for the Parrilla Tour on my recent holiday to Buenos Aires - and it was the best value of all the "things" that I did while in BA. Great guide (David), wonderful food, and such a nice difference to have a course at each stop, which also gave us the chance to walk and see the district we were in. Oh, and to actually get IN to the Secret Parrilla was a real highlight! I did also swipe a menu of flavours from the ice-cream store, in the hope that my 'local' ice-cream store might make some Dulce de Letche for me. I would give these lads a big thumbs up and well done, and would suggest that anyone considering this tour has a very light breakfast, as you will be very well taken care of at lunch time.

Awesome insider food tour. I went on the Palermo food tour with David and three other travelers. We spent our time in an area of Palermo I would not have gone if not for the tour. David took us to places we would not have know about otherwise as travelers. Each place we went to was top notch. The Empanadas we had were the best I ate during my whole trip. I highly recommend doing this tour. It's just a few hours and was so worth it.

Excellent tour. We took the Parrilla Tour during our recent trip to Buenos Aires. Our tour guide David was excellent. We went to a few places in the San Telmo area and tried empanadas, gelato, steak and much more. The food was excellent and we met some amazing people along the way. Thank you David!

Food & Fun. My husband and I took the Palermo tour in early November. David was a nice guy and really did a good job including local histories and stories related to the places we visited, the food we ate and the neighborhood we walked through. I would recommend going hungry because the food on the tour is plentiful and delicious. The first stop (and meeting place) almost looks like a hole in the wall, but don't let that stop you. Here you have a choripan sandwich accompanied with local sauces, including chimichurri. The sandwich and sauces both were very good. The second stop is a local empanada shop. Again the restaurant isn't large and focuses mostly on take out, but the quality of the food was quite good. One of the best empanadas I had on my trip.The third stop is a secret parrilla - secret because without this tour, you would never know about it, much less find it. Here we were served salad, provoleta, steak (of course), pork loin and wine. All of the food again was quite tasty. After all that food, there is still one more stop - and you want to make sure you save room for it - the Ice cream shop! Here you receive a cup with 2 scoops of any ice cream you want - and there are lots to chose from. My husband and I each got 2 different flavors, giving us the opportunity to try 4 different ones - all were excellent! The tour lasts between 2 or 3 hours. There is walking involved, maybe 3 or 4 blocks between each restaurant, so wear comfortable shoes and clothes. I would definitely recommend the tour for anyone wanting a well rounded view of the Buenos Aires food scene.

Great tour, authentic restaurants!. We went on the tour in San Telmo and would definitely recommend it. The tour goes to a selection of very authentic restaurants, if you want to eat where the locals eat, this is the perfect tour. Also the tour group is small enough that you don't have to worry about overwhelming the restaurant or sticking out. The amount of food you get also definitely makes the price of the tour worth it.

The perfect introduction to Argentinian food.. I did the Las Canitas tour and this was one of the highlights of my trip to BA. Great food and very informative. I only regret not having time to do the San Telmo one as well, but this would be at the top of my list of things to do on my next trip to BA. Highly recommended.

Great way to discover local food. We met David and Santiago for the Parrilla Tour in Palermo. It is a great way to discover local places that offer great food, with an opportunity to meet and experience the locals. We ate a delicious choripan (the best), an empanada and a parrilla, at places that without them, would have been impossible to find. In addition, they are very knowledgeable about the history and culture, which enhances the experience.In addition, we reserved for the Asados Buenos Aires, which is an experience worth trying!

Delicious Afternoon. Thank you David & Santiago for an excellent introduction to the best of Argentinian food in Palermo. Cant wait to go explore more. And the kids (2 girls, 7 & 11) had a great time as well. A very memorable and fun way to experience the city & its culture

Eat like the Porteños!. When in Buenos Aires, if you want to sample the real food of the Porteños then get hold of David and Santi and take one of their tours. They will take you to places that tourists would never find and you will eat the food the locals eat. You will feel the real heart beat of Buenos Aires and sample some fabulous food and wine along the way.Santi arranged a tour for our group of 16 friends and we all loved it. I will do it again the very next time I'm back in BA.Thank you Santi and David - we had a great night.

Palermo Tasty Tour. This tour exceeded our expectations. Dave and Santiago delivered a well organized, yet laid back tour through the heart of Palermo. The three locations we visited all had their own unique feel and delivered fresh Argentine food. My family and I are here for ~ 4 years and this offered a peek of Argentina that we would not have seen had we not booked this tour. Our kids loved it... my wife loved it... our friends loved it! Cannot wait to do the San Telmo route!

Great Buenos Aires tour!. If you like food and want a relaxed and unconventional tour of Buenos Aires, I highly recommend the Parilla Tour. David was our guide in the Las Canitas neighborhood, sharing his knowledge of the local cuisine and culture in a way that made us feel more like we were having lunch with a friend familiar with the city than being lectured by a tour guide. We started off eating a delicious choripan sandwich (pork and beef sausage), followed by regional empanadas, then a typical Argentinian steak dinner, and finally delicious ice cream. The tour lives up to its promise of delivering an authentic experience - the restaurants are all off the beaten tourist path. David's list of best restaurants in Buenos Aires that he gave us at the end of the tour was a bonus - our best dinner in BA was at one of his recommendations.

Great intro to Buenos Aires meat!. This is a great introductory tour of some great places with some great food. If you're looking to get a little under the surface of how Porteños eat meat then this will set you off on very much the right foot: empanadas, matambres, pork, provoleta and - of course! - beef in some friendly and authentic local eateries. David is clearly a big fan of Buenos Aires and its food and culture, and he enjoys sharing great tips, including an excellent list of recommended venues, drawn from the exploring he's already done. A great springboard for enjoying BA's parrillas and street food, and David's an enthusiastic and genuine guide. Oh and the fantastic helado (ice cream) to round off the tour is essential!

excellent taste of Buenos Aires parilla. I had a great time on the Parilla tour in Palermo. It was more than enough food, and all of it was great! From the choripan to the empanadas, the main course (pork and steak) to the ice cream, David did a great job finding unique places to visit that are off-guidebook, so to speak. Very glad I did this tour, and highly recommend that you try it.

Splendid introduction to this wonderful city.. I must say, for the first second I was skeptical, but than we had the best time. We were introduced to the city, the food, variation of the language and the people. We now know how to pick a restaurant, shop , and most of all EAT!. Our guides, or can I say, hosts, or may I now say "Friends", Santiago and David sprang our trip to life, erased our jet lag and now made us ready for the rest of the week. I hope we get to see them again. And just wait until they visit us in Miami!!! Thanks guys!!!

Food lovers: this is a must!!!. If you love food like I do, this tour is a great way to spend the afternoon! We devoured a selection of great traditional Argentine meals throughout the tour; Matambre, empanadas, choripan, ice-cream all washed down with a couple of glasses of wine. We went to some wonderful local restaurants off the beaten tourist path, that I would have never found without the help of our gracious tour guide David, who gave fascinating tid-bits of information about each plate. I highly reccommend it to all you foodie types visiting BUenos Aires!!

Eat like a local. Parilla tour was a wonderful way to see local restaurants and steakhouses that actual local people go to. They were all hole in the wall places that had incredible food and great ambiance filled with porteno families. The guides were extremely knowledgable about the local food scene and had great recommendations for us.

Brilliant parilla tour!. This is the best way to sample the local fare, with the locals. You won't be disappointed. We tried Choripan in a local corner restaurant, then onto a little takeaway corner place for empanadas, followed by a well hidden secret parilla, topped off with the best Argentinian ice cream!

You'll never have a better meal in Buenos Aires. Santiago and David are the best - after 5 minutes, we felt like we had known them forever! They took us to places we never would have found on our own, the real gems of Buenos Aires. They know exactly what to order, how to have it prepared and, most importantly, what wine to pair it with! We left with full bellies, lots of great memories and laughs, and two new friends in one of the most delicious cities in the world. I would recommend to anyone - young or old, big group or small. These guys know the ins and outs of the BA parilla scene!

Great way to sample the local food and learn about Buenos Aires. Had a great eating tour of Buenos Aires today -- a parilla tour. Two guys, David, an American, and the other, Santiago, an Argentine, run the tour, We met at a little hole in the wall parilla in Canitas neighborhood, near Palermo, where the best chorizopan (sausage sandwich) I have had to date was to be found, with all sorts of great sauces, my favorite being a sort of vinaigrette with all sorts of spices. Next stop, several blocks away, was for meat empanadas, in yet another little shop that only locals would notice. Then the main course was at TitoSecret, a very small place where it's reservations only and the sign on the door says "closed" to the general public. The slow grilled steak was so tender one could cut it with a dull knife. Salt the only flavoring. Oh YUM! (Only certain chocolate has given me a similar gastronomic high.) Finally we ended the tour at a gourmet heladeria (ice cream shop). Oh my, the ice cream beats anything I have had in the U.S. Both guys were amiable, and we had great conversations along the way,and I learn a bit about life in Buenos Aires. They even got me on the correct bus back to San Telmo where I'm staying. I highly recommend this ~3 hour tour as something different, esp. if one is a carnivore (Vegetarians need not apply). David and Santiago have scouted the neighborhood for the best typical local food. They have a parallel tour in San Telmo. I wish David and Santiago success in their venture.

Spend an afternoon to find out the where and how locals eat their parrilla. If you love meat, interested in digging deeper in where locals eat, how they eat, and what they eat- book this tour and spend an afternoon discovering how Argentine loves to eat their meat and finish off with awesome ice cream. The only tour in BA that offers great insights about local parrillas, pizzerias that sell perfectly cooked empanadas, and all the time- deliciously eating away and meeting new people.

An Afternoon Well Spent. The Parrilla Tour is great - I highly recommend it! The tour guides were a wealth of information about Buenos Aires (and Argentina in general), the food was delicious (the best empanada I’ve ever had), and the locations were off the beaten path. We never would have discovered these places on our own (one even had a “closed” sign out front). I went with my spouse and there were a few others attending (from Rio), so the conversation was spirited. Moreover, I don’t speak a lot of Spanish, so it was helpful to have the tour available in English. The Parrilla Tour is a casual afternoon with great meat dishes and good company - an afternoon well spent.

Great way to learn about Argentine food. A couple weeks ago I was in Buenos Aires for the first time. I wanted to get eat at local places and try different Argentine food, but I don't speak Spanish and only had a short time in BA. So I googled food tours, and I liked Parrilla Tour's website. I signed up for a tour on Saturday afternoon and then got an e-mail from one of the owners saying that I was the only person signed up that day (since it was the slow season), but he was still more than willing to do the tour if I wanted. I said yes and he told me the parilla to meet at noon. We went to three places, eating a different dish at each. At the first place we had Choripan, which was amazing. The second place was empanadas and the third was steak. Then we went for ice cream. I learned a lot about Argentine food, it was delicious, and the tour guide was excellent. It was very reasonably priced and enjoyable tour. I highly recommend this tour.

fun & delicious afternoon. Parrilla Tour was such a great way to learn about Argentine culinary culture. The tour went to 4 different locations starting with choripan (pork sausage aka chorizo & bread) which is the classic way to start an asado. From there we ate local empanadas and explore the different preparations according to region. The third stop was a 'secret parrilla' which I thought was closed once we walked up. Once the doors opened we were surrounded with locals chowing down on their lunch break. Between the group we had wine, salad, two cuts of beef, pork, chimichurri, and water. More than the table could handle. The tour concluded at a small ice cream shop where coffee or ice cream was offered. Clearly I opted for the ice cream. Considering the amount you pay it's totally worth it just from the amount of food. An added bonus was walking to and from the locations, learning about the neighborhood as well as the local culinary traditions. The guide was informative, relaxed and had great suggestions for other things to do in the city.

The Argentinean Polo experience -- at its best. Buenos Aires is the Polo's Mecca. In October the Polo season is at its peak. It would be a pity to make it to this amazing city and miss the opportunity to play with wonderful horses, ride on the Argentinean fields, and trying to hit the wooden white ball. Fernando (Polo Elite) is the person in town you should get in touch with confidence. Not only he is a great Polo player. He is also a talented and patient teacher, who will work with you even if you are an absolute beginner -- just like me.

Wonderful experience . I had an amazing day with Fernando! I was very interested to play polo and most of the other companies provide mostly full day tour with BBQ and wine and and and.. for me it's waste of time, Fernando focused only on training! It was very efficient day! Because of him I am planning to go back for 2 weeks! He is a humble professional polo master player! And speak many languages.. very knowledgeable person! I totally recommend dealing with him!

Sunshine Sunday at the polo. My first introduction to the sport of kings on a beautiful sunny day involved standing on the sidelines, glass of champagne in hand, feeling the ground shake beneath my heels as eight ponies and riders thundered past. Our sincere gratitude to our charming host Fernando of Polo Elite who entertained us with the facts of the polo game and the historical contributions of Indian tea planters, the British cavalry and Argentine gauchos to this exciting international sport. The three of us were picked up by Fernando from our accommodation in Buenos Aires and driven to the huge green tree-lined polo fields in the countryside. The games we watched were fast, skilful and aggressive with good sportsmanship and the bond between horse and rider evident. Definitely an experience not to be missed!!!

Fernandoooooo!!!. Simply put...the funnest and most hilarious experience of our trip to Argentina. There was a group of 8 of us and barely any of us had ever ridden horses before. The instructor/owner of Polo Elite's name is Fernando and he is one of the top 300 polo players in the world. He picked us up at our Airbnb in Buenos Aires, provided us empanadas for lunch and drove us out to the polo grounds. When we got there, Fernando hopped on one of the horses and just ran around the field doing sick polo moves. Then he gave us 15 minutes of instructions and let us have at it. We rode around like idiots then played a hilarious scrimmage. We had no idea what we were doing but still had a blast and couldn't stop laughing the whole time. After we finished, Fernando met up with us later in the night and drank with us all over town for a very memorable yet "hazy" night. Fernando is the MAN.This is a must do if you are with a group in Buenos Aires!
Bachelor Party . Perfect day out of the city. Fernando is the MAN! We all had a blast. Amazing way to break up the trip!! If you go to BA and don't do this you are missing out!!!!!! -Guthrie

Perfect Group Outing. We were a group of 8 guys visiting Buenos Aires and could not have picked a better place. Most of the group had barely ridden a horse and Fernando did an excellent job of making sure everyone was comfortable and knowledgeable about the basics before getting into Polo. He's an excellent teacher and a great person all around, would highly recommend this to anyone who is interested in Polo.

Great Time - Most fun we had in Buenos Aires. I am not sure how many places will let you play Polo on your first day of classes but they allow you here and it is a great deal of fun. Everyone can move at their own pace and the overall experience is very fun and easy going. Fenando was a great teacher.

A day to remember. Fernando came and picked us up at the hotel and drove us to the estate c.30 min from downtown BA. Fernando is very professional and was able to tailor the event based on our previous Polo skills (which ranged from good to...not so good).It was a great memory and I can highly recommend Polo Elite and Fernando to anyone who is going to BA and want to play Polo.

Great active day out. We had the most fantastic time learning to play Polo! It was super easy to arrive and very well organized- the staff were exceptional and very calm and patient. We are not completely unfamiliar with horses but are certainly not regular riders. However, it did not matter! We were riding around belting those polo balls about! Ok so occasionally my horse just decided to do its own thing... And you will do better if you can ride well, but we were taught all the basic skills we needed. I have ridden a trail ride since and used some of the tips to get my horse to cooperate. I recommend it to anyone able to get on a horse. We were a couple joined with others but it would also be fun for a larger group. A real highlight of the trip to Argentina.

Great lesson with Fernando. I've never had the opportunity to play polo - and I've barely ridden a horse - so this was an experience I definitely wanted to try. Fernando was fantastic. To start, he picked us up from a convenient location and drove us to the ranch ~45 outside the city. The lesson lasted a few hours and we go the basics down about how to ride a horse and steer it in different directions. He was a good instructor and we got plenty of practice. The horses also were pretty used to having guests ride them, so they were perfectly tame and responsive to my inexperienced directions. After basic lessons we learned the rules of the game and got to play a short match. It was a lot of fun and an experience I felt that was well worth the money. After the lesson/match he drove us back into the city and dropped us off. Very convenient. Overall, would definitely recommend!

Amazing time!. My girlfriend and I had an amazing time learning how to ride and play Polo! Fernando was incredibly helpful! His horses are very well trained and it's fun just to travel outside of the city and see the countryside of Buenos Aires too. Go learn polo with Fernando, you will remember it forever! Thanks Fernando!
Justin

Fernando is your guy!. My father and I had a polo lesson with Fernando Nieto and it was exceptional. Fernando was incredibly patient with us and overall a great teacher! Even if you have zero experience playing, you leave feeling like you have accomplished something. Fernando was hospitable, picking us up personally as well as dropping us off. We even got snacks during half time! It was a truly unique and unforgettable experience. Thank you Fernando!

Fun day with Polo Elite. My boyfriend and I spent a great afternoon learning to play polo. Fernando was a fantastic teacher (and a really great guy!) and as I was a novice rider, we covered all the basics before having a little game. I couldn't recommend Polo Elite enough, we loved it!!

Polo Lesson, Polo elite, Buenos Aires. My instructor was Fernando. He was very pleasant, created a very friendly, fun atmosphere for learning to play polo. It was my first time riding a horse. Fernando taught me how to ride a horse and the basics of playing polo. I had a really great time. My horse was a lovely lady that likes to ride fast. Both Fernando and his father were really amazing and pleasant people.

True Argentinian experience - highlight of our trip. An absolutely amazing private half-day polo lesson for 2 with Fernando. Extremely patient, fun, energetic and genuine guy, Fernando taught us to ride as well as play polo, with the highlight game of Argentina vs. Australia. Recommend to all for an unforgettable experience. Even drop off / pick up included! Fernando even assisted us with details of a trustworthy and reliable private driver for our airport transfer the following day :)

This was our highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires!! Fernando is the best!!. I was looking for a Polo Day near Buenos Aires and I came across Polo Elite in Tripadvisor. The reviews were excellent and everybody says amazing things about Fernando so we decided to try this place and meet the famous Fernando. Fernando picked us up from a central location in Buenos Aires near our hotel and we have a really nice chat with him on the way to the stables that are around 40 mins away from Buenos Aires. He gave us really good recommendations for restaurants and places to visit in Buenos Aires that we followed and loved. I went with my husband. I love horses, I do horse riding sometimes and attend to any Polo event that I can in the UK and my husband didn’t have any experience playing Polo neither. We didn’t know what to expect. We arrived to the stables and started riding the Polo ponies. Fernando is a great trainer and will find the perfect pony for you. The ponies are really sweet and perfectly trained so you will feel really safe. Once we felt comfortable riding the ponies Fernando taught us the basic techniques and rules of the Polo and we started to use the mallet and try to hit the balls. After a while practicing we took a break and we played 2 games: Spain (I) + Greece (my husband) VS Argentina (Fernando) and it was really Funnnnnn. This activity exceeded of our expectations and I highly recommend it to anyone looking to try to play some Polo near Buenos Aires. I wish I would be closer to be able to go often! It was my first time playing Polo and I enjoyed so much that I’m already looking for clubs near London to play again. Thanks Fernando for a great day! You are a star!!

An exhilarating afternoon of polo!. I spent a wonderful afternoon (1pm-6pm) learning to play polo with Fernando and his trusty polo ponies! Fernando quickly made me feel comfortable riding "polo style" with clear instruction and enthusiastic encouragement! We met at an easily accessible point in the city and enjoyed a comfortable transfer to the polo grounds, around 45 minutes outside of Buenos Ares. Whilst I have riding experience, the person with me did not, and Fernando was able to easily accommodate both of us. I highly recommend this experience. Great fun had by all!
Great time. We had a great time playing polo for the first time - great for beginners or experienced players. Fernando is very professional!

Great fun intro to Polo!. Fernando clearly passionate about polo and his enthusiasm and skill shines through during the session. Horses in great condition and really well trained. Would recommend for anyone interested in having a go and a wonderful way to spend the afternoon and see a bit further out of Buenos. I met Fernando at a meeting point in town at 1pm and travelled maybe 45mins to field then returned back to BA about 6pm. Would highly recommend!

A great day trip from BA. We (group of 5 - two middle aged parents, 3 kids in their 20s - all from Toronto) spent an afternoon at a polo match near Pilar - 45 minutes from BA. It was a great day trip. Relaxed pastoral setting, and a terrific way to get a glimpse of the countryside and the way of life. Fernando Nieto is a superb host, a wonderful guy, and has an encyclopedic knowledge of Argentine history and politics (as well as being an internationally ranked polo player). This was one of the highlights of our trip, and we would highly recommend it.
Great fund - would highly recommend. Fernando was a super pleasant and helpful - the lessons were good fun and overall it a great activity to do once in Buenos Aires. Definitely recommend!

Fantastic morning learning to play polo. I have always wanted to learn the basics of polo and even better, to do this in Argentina. Fernando was fantastic - he picked a group of 5 of and drove us to the stables which are about 45 mins out of the city. Fortunately the weather was kind and stayed dry for the few hours we were there - can understand why heavy rain would make it very difficult to run the session. He made every effort to make our session great and was very patient. I haven't ridden for 5 years but it was easy to get into the swing of things. The ponies were fantastic too - they are well cared for and knew what to do (including kicking a few balls for us in the right direction!). We learnt the basics and had time for a game which was great fun - the other people on the trip were great too. Overall I loved every minute of this and would recommend it highly. A big thank you to Fernando, the team at the stables and the wonderful polo ponies!

Fernando is the BEST. On our final day in Argentina, we wanted to do something special. After reading so many great reviews about Polo Elite, we decided to give it a shot. My boyfriend and I had very little experience riding horses, but the other couple we were traveling with were advanced riders. Fernando gave us horses that accommodated our level of experience and gave us great instruction. We spent hours practicing and playing-- even watching some locals play a game nearby. It was such a wonderful, memorable day.

Polo Elite - great day!. We were picked up from our hotel in Buenos Aires with about a 1 hour transfer to a farm with stables and polo pitches. Fernando was an excellent instructor who provided an in-depth tutorial on swings and tactics; then put us into two teams for a match and finally drove us to a first class lunch to top things off! Highly recommended for anyone interested in polo.

Back again to Polo Elite. My last visit to BA was four years ago. It was then that a colleague and I had the chance to meet Fernando Nieto, the owner, chief instructor and rated Argentine polo player. (Oh, he’s also an economist and former professor, but that’s another story.) I was really looking forward to spending time with Fernando again, because not only is he an interesting guy to talk with, but he’s a great instructor. He is articulate and very patient. I have played polo before, but at 72 it had been a while. (Turns out eye-hand coordination may be the second thing to go.) We were joined by a young couple who had never ridden. It was great to watch Fernando get them comfortable on horseback and then introduce them to the basics of the game. After a break we even wrapped up with a little two-on-two competition. Polo Elite probably isn’t unique in Argentina, but I can’t think of many places in the world where you can get such a great introduction to the sport, on such good horses, for an affordable price. Recommended for all ages, even mine.

Fantastic experience - so impressed, we went back again 3 days later!. Air-conditioned, comfortable 45 minute return transfer from BA city to a farm near Canuelas with Fernando who was welcoming, friendly and chatty throughout.Lesson was great - professionally delivered, with enough freedom to practice new skills and support provided to improve. My boyfriend and I were beginners so received a helpful riding lesson first, as well as later learning about the game of polo and the skills needed to play. After the polo lessons we played a game, which was pretty exhilarating for beginners! Was also a great way to put to practice the skills you learn during the day.Fernando is a patient instructor, who also helps to make the day really fun. As mentioned above, we were so impressed, we asked Fernando the next morning for another booking just 3 days later. Although the day seems quite expensive, the experience is definitely worth the money and you won't find better value elsewhere - we would recommend this for anyone at any level. Particularly as polo is the number one sport in Argentina -- and, when in Rome!

Excellence . Fernando isn't just the boss of polo ! He is #1 of everything in buenos Aires , he gave us the best tour in town and shared the best dining experience with us thumbs up for this guy . Spoke Multiple languages Italian English and more , thanks Fernando for a great time in your home town ...

Worth a return trip!! . I met Fernando outside my hotel, after a friend of a friend referred his services as a city-tour guide. I found him to be kind, polite, and generous. He was very understanding of our time limits and was able to show us the absolute best and most beautiful parts of the city. There are areas of the City that need to been seen. As an outsider, with a time limit, I would have never been able to find these places on my own. Funny enough, throughout the course of the day and our conversations, my friends and I discovered that he also ran a polo school about 45 mins outside of the city. The thought excited us, as we have never played polo before (most of us had never even ridden a horse). Moreover, the big guy I was with probably never able to find a horse he could ride. The adventure enticed us, and we signed up. The experience was amazing. One of the best of my life. Fernando was not only accommodating in picking us up from our hotel, but was a fantastic teacher as well. We played polo in Argentina! Not many people can say that. Even the big guy got to ride!Cheers and a 5 star rating for a special company and all around nice guy.

Buenos Aires and polo. I highly recommend Fernando for your ultimate Buenos Aires experience! He was more than a fantastic tour guide and polo instructor: he was a pleasure to get to know -- an amigo. On day one he showed my friends and I the essentials of BA and we had plenty of time to take pics. He was very knowledgeable of the history of the sites and his English was perfect. On day two he drove us to the polo ranch and gave us a top-notch lesson on polo and horse riding. What a great time.My only regret was that I was only in BA for three days. I will be retruning and, rest assured, Fernando will be who I shall call upon.

Great value and friendly attitude!. Fernando took a group of us from Buenos Aires to Polo Elite for an awesome day of riding horses and learning how to play Argentina's famous polo. We were provided with great transportation and plenty of time on horseback in addition to snacks and beverages. Fernando was an extremely friendly guy who I would trust again in a heartbeat. Thanks!

Such an amazing experience in Buenos Aires! Definitely a must!. Fernando was incredible - so patient yet pushed us to learn quickly and have fun. They take care of everything and really know what they're doing. I recommend learning polo if you're in BA, and make sure you do it with Fernando at Polo Elite.
What a unique and enjoyable experience!

Great Experience. Fernando was fantastic and we had an incredible time. Our group had little riding experience, but he was really patient and got all of us up to speed quickly. I would highly recommend.

Unbelievable time. My review will not do justice of how much fun and unique of an experience playing polo was. I am SO happy that I did this, Fernando was effective at managing all different levels of riders. This was definitely an experience I would recommend for anyone visiting Buenos Aires. Fernando was absolutely awesome.

Experiencing this is a must when visiting Buenos Aires!!. After we booked our polo lesson, my cousin and I met our guide at a coffee shop in the city. On our drive out to the property we enjoyed pleasant conversation about the history of Buenos Aires and some of the interesting attractions that not all tourists get to encounter. The lesson was fabulous! My cousin and I were not experienced riders but our guide was especially patient with us as we learned how to sit, got comfortable with controlling our horses and finally began using the mallets and the rules of Polo. The guide was very knowledgeable and can obviously easily teach novices or experts about the details of the game or the history of its origins.I would absolutely recommend learning to play polo. It is an exhilarating and exciting game for all ages.

Will return! Highlight of BA trip!. Our polo day with Fernando was the highlight of our full South America trip (including New Year's on Copacabana!). Fernando couldn't have been more incredible. A huge thank you to him and the other guys on the ranch! I miss "my" pony Tango already.We got picked up in the city and driven out to the Polo Elite club (and driven back in the evening). They have about 70 professional polo ponies which are so well behaved even the most inexperienced rider will have a great time. There was only three of us riding that day so we got loads of one on one training with Fernando. I had never even sat on a horse before and after three hours I played my first mini-chukka. It was an amazing experience and I felt very safe for the full day. I can not recommend this enough. THANK YOU so much for the amazing memories.

Great Experience for Riders of All Levels. We had a great time with Fernando, who was able to tailor our experience to our different riding levels. He was friendly and easy to work with. We recommend this to anyone looking for a polo experience while they are staying in Argentina.

Awesome time. Really enjoyed it. Fernando was very helpful and answering all our basic questions on polo.I asked for "a horse like Diego Maradonna" and I got more than I bargained for - things got quite exciting after a gentle tap with the whip!Everybody was beginners but we felt safe and really enjoyed it.Final score for the game at the end: England 5 - Argentina 4My wife scored the winning goal!

Great Experience Playing Polo. Three friends and myself booked a private polo lesson with Fernando. It was truly a great experience. Fernando was easy to work with setting up the lesson and he promptly picked us up at the agreed meeting point. I had zero experience on a horse and Fernando did a greta job of teaching the basics to our group to playing a polo match at the end of the day. It was also a great way to see the country side outside of the busy city. I would recommend to anyone.

An awesome taste of Argentina!. Being in Argentina is amazing and playing polo with Fernando in Argentina is the icing on the cake. There was a good mix of talking and playing (the weighting very much towards playing) so we learnt a lot and had fun. Its not an easy sport by any means but the ponies and Fernando's tips made it possible to have a game and a great day out. The meal afterwards went down very well and it was perfect to be dropped back at the hotel door. Thanks Polo Elite!

Memorable afternoon. My girlfriend and I had an amazing afternoon on my birthday, learning how to ride a polo pony and the basic elements of how to play polo! Fernando was incredibly patient and a good instructor. What made it for us was the whole setting... Rural Argentina at its best and there were many surreal moments whilst on horseback! Can thoroughly recommend.

Polo Day for Group of 15 Friends. I cannot recommend this enough! Incredible fun. Fernando took a group of 15 of us to learn to play polo. He picked us up in a minivan in the morning an took us to a nice place about 45 minutes of out town. After a theory lesson and a couple of practice sessions, we organised a few games against each other. One of the best things i have done in Argentina, hands down. Fernando is a great guy and a great teacher. Gives you all the advice and support you need, without overdoing it and lets you get on with it if you are confident. Stopped for a great asado on the way back to wrap things up. Definitely on my list of things to do again next time I am in Buenos Aires!

Great experience, great fun, amazing package. Had a Polo morning lesson with Fernando, He was a great teacher, took his time with us but also making sure we had as much fun as possible. We had a wide array of riding levels and Fernando adapted himself to each rider brilliantly. Needless to say we learned a lot. The lunch afterwards was amazing as well, i could not have had one more bite even if I tried. Thanks again for the great lesson Fernando

A full package of Superb service!. This was my third visit to Buenos Aires with Elite Polo and Fernando. We asked Elite Polo to mange our entire trip to play polo and watch the Argentine Palermo Open. He delivered well! He picked us up from the airport and after a full week of fun and practice dropped us off at the airport!! He got us excellent seats and good tickets for the finals. Played and practiced in nice fields in Canuals (closer to the city than Pilar, the polo mecca outside BA). Greta experience; will do it again next December!

Good fun & great experience. My wife and I booked this when visiting Buenos Aires in November and loved it. Fernando was a good teacher and although we had major traffic issues getting to the ranch, it was still worth it. You learn to ride the horses first, learn to turn etc then move on to actually playing whilst riding before ending with a match. Very enjoyable and thoroughly recommended if you've never tried polo before! Thank you again Fernando!

Real polo class!. Excelent lessons by Fernando with a lot of patience to teach many details of polo playing. The local is very ample with a nice view of the surrouing pasture where there were some horses grassing. The horses are good with appropriate polo training (they love to race after that ball). Overall it was an amazing experience that really shows how it feels to play the sport with a top level player giving the instructions, details and with a deep knowledge of the sport and horses. Also Fernando is very friendly which helps learning.

Do not hesitate, Polo Elite is some of the most fun you can have in Argentina!. We still can't believe the amazing experience we had with Fernando and how much fun it was. We had never played polo before and he made the experience fun, easy (while still courteous and professional) and so very worth it. If you stumbled onto this page, consider yourself lucky and book an excursion with him. You'll have an amazing time. We know we did. If we had more time we would have gone twice in one trip!

One of the best excursions I've ever done!. From the booking, to the coordinating pick up to the actual polo match, lunch and lessons everything was PERFECT! I think it was worth every dollar. Everyone there was so happy to help and friendly. Can't wait to go back.

Excellent experience. Absolutely recommended. I had an individual class with Fernando and it was excellent. While I've ridden horses most of my life, I had absolutely no clue about how polo is supposed to be played. Fernando explained things very clearly and gave me a chance to get used to the different techniques for swings at a slow pace to later move on to a faster (and more fun) pace. He paired me with two very solid mares that knew their job very well so I felt very comfortable at all times, allowing me to focus on trying to hit the ball.If you like horseback riding you will definitely have a blast.

The most fun you can have in Argentina. We had a great time learning polo with Fernando. I would highly recommend this adventure for anybody visiting the area. I was amazed how much we learned in such a short period time. This is definitely something that every able-bodied person should experience at least once in their life.

Do not miss this unforgettable experience. I can't say enough about this experience. We had not planned to experience polo on our family trip to Buenos Aires but what a shame it would have been to miss this! Fernando is absolutely wonderful. We were pressed for time on our last day in BA. I emailed Fernando the night before and asked if it would be possible to arrange a modified polo experience. He went above and beyond the call of duty to make it happen. He picked us up...with ALL of our luggage...at our apartment and dropped us off for our 9pm departure at EZE. We had very little experience with horses but he made certain that we were matched with appropriate ponies. His instruction was very precise. We got to play a game and watch one by the professionals. It was my teenage sons favorite part of our trip. He wants to go back for a polo camp with Fernando (don't even know if he has one). I would highly recommend a day with Fernando!

Great day at polo. My friend and I were studying in Buenos Aires, and when her mom came to visit we decided it would be a great addition to her trip to take a polo trip. I personally have polo and riding experience, however neither my friend nor her mom had any riding experience at all. Fernando was great, and made it extremely fun for all of us despite the range in experience. Would recommend this for anyone visiting Buenos Aires and wanting to spend some time outside of the city to enjoy a great time and sport !

A day at the polo. I have taken Polo Elite tours with Fernando more than once on different trips to Buenos Aires. each time different, each time great fun! First time I had a polo lesson, next visit went to watch Fernando play in a local game, and the third time I took a picnic and some international guests and Fernando took us to a high level match at magnificent polo fields complete with fairy tale castle club house. Fernando is an excellent host and super reliable and knowledgeable about his subject.. polo... and his country.

amazing must do experience in Buenos Aires. My husband and daughter spent the day here and had an amazing time.the price was reasonable about $100 each.the coach was wonderful and they had a unique and highly memorable experience. Fantastic! Fernando is the best!
Great experience. It was a great experience. I really enjoy the day, meet really increrible people, and ride a horse while playing its something you will never forget.

Must Do when in Buenos Aires. I wanted to try something I could really only try in Buenos Aires. I highly recommend going out for the day with Fernando. He is a great guy and speaks very good English which is a hard thing to find in Buenos Aires. He will answer any questions you have either Polo related or places to eat in Buenos Aires. He is very patient and teaches everything you need to know about Polo and then you go have fun. While Polo isn't easy I had a blast trying it out and I even wanted to do again.. so next time I'm in Buenos Aires I may just go do Polo again with Fernando.. Its a must do in Buenos Aires. Go Do it. He is great and you will have a blast.

Best day in BA!. We had the best day with Fernando last November. He was on time picking us up from our hotel and taking us to the Polo match for the day. He was so friendly and told us everything we needed to know about Polo. I would very highly recommend spending the day with Fernando!

Polo Lessons at Polo Elite. A fantastic time! Fernando is a kind, patient, enthusiastic, and fun instructor. My wife is a stronger rider than I, but I am used to stick-and-ball games, so between us we had a great lesson. The equipment is excellent, the horses are matched to your ability. They even handle transport to and from BA! Highly recommended.

An Amazing day!. I found Fernando from a good friend at home who had taken lessons from him in BA before, and then had hosted him when he came for Polo in Canada. We were not disappointed. Both my friend I was traveling with and myself had riding experience, and Fernando was so patient and great at explaining everything! The horses were great and we had a ton of fun! I would absolutely recommend Fernando for any Polo needs that you have while in BA!

A must in Buenos Aires!. So hard and so fun!! My husband and I did our lessons with Fernando, and I was sore for almost 4 days! It was such a great and unique experience to get to do this with a professional.The ranch is cute with a lot of local charm. The horses are very patient and sweet- which is a must with beginners.Fernando is an amazing person. I didn't know what to expect from a professional of a sport so posh, but he is very humble, relaxed and kind. He cares deeply for the sport and his horses.I highly recommend anyone coming to Buenos Aires to play polo with Fernando!

Extra!. yesterday, we, my son (10), my (daughter), my husband and myself took a lesson at Polo elite with Fernando.It was the greatest experience for us. My son went galloping for his first time. My daughter thanked me all evening for the day. It all went very smoothly with Fernando's advices. It was very safe as well, the horses are very nice. I was amazed we could play a game at the End! It was great fun and France won vs Argentina..yes Fernando is that nice.It was beyond my expectations, I highly recommend to go with Polo elite.

Best Polo Experience in Buenos Aires!!. Wonderful way to spend time outside the city and experience some of what makes Argentina the polo capital of the world. Beautiful drive out to the polo field and excellent instruction from Polo Elite's founder Fernando. His love of his horse and the game is infectious. His company is so enjoyable and his instruction lets you walk away feeling accomplished no matter what your level of horse experience is. It's hard to find words good enough to describe.
