What a treat! So glad we had this unique experience!. Fernando was our guide for an afternoon of polo. It was nice to get out of Buenos Aires and head for the country and Fernando was a terrific host. He was friendly, helpful, very knowledgable about polo and horses, spoke excellent English and was a careful driver. He patiently explained the game to us (we had never experienced polo) and answered our many questions about the ponies and polo culture worldwide. The game we watched was fascinating and super exciting, especially when the horses and riders thundered past us! It was an unforgettable day and I highly recommend Fernando and Polo Elite.

The Only Unique Experience Left in Argentina. I have lived in BA for almost 7 years and I finally decided to go for polo lessons when my brother came to visit this year. I had heard great things about Fernando and Polo Elite from several of my friends who had lived here for a few years so I figured this would be a great chance to try it out. I cannot express how surprised I was by my experience. After 7 years this ranks among the best things I have ever done in this country, certainly in the Buenos Aires area. Fernando was so great during the entire arrangement. He picked us up in the city and drove us out to the range.Along the way he was pleasant and friendly with his conversation and helped explain a great deal about the game and the history in Argentina. None of us were very experienced with riding horses, with one of us having absolutely no experience whatsoever. But Fernando was excellent in his manner of teaching us how to ride and then teaching us the basics of the game. He was very kind and patient and explained things very clearly. We rode his personal horses and was trained using his equipment. After a few hours on the horses and riding lessons we started learning the polo-specific skills. After practicing those for a while we then played a real game with Fernando.After finishing he drove us back to the city and sent us on our way. The entire time we were there I was having fun. From riding the horses together with my family, to learning how to ride better, and then learning the super fun game of polo. All the while he was there to help us be safe and to keep us having fun. The best was actually playing the polo match and running up next to the other players and pushing them out of the way using my horse and stealing the ball. The excitement of feeling the horses push against each other and then fighting for the ball against my brother was one of the coolest and most refreshing things I have ever done. If anyone comes to BA for ever a weekend trip, I can say with all of my experience here as both a tourist and a local, (not some lazy expat living in bars and thinking they know the culture) that this is a MUST DO activity.

So much fun, can definitely recommend doing this!. I've barely been a horse before but this sounded too much fun to skip. After 1-2 hours of instructions from Fernando I felt comfortable with the horse and could focus on playing the game. Fernando is very professional and is keen on making sure you learn the game properly. The horses were very well behaved! If you're thinking about doing this you can stop thinking about it and just do it!Svenska: Om ni är i Buenos Aires och har en eftermiddag till övers så kan jag verkligen rekommendera det här, det var skitkul! Man behövde inte ha någon hästvana men man bör vara en smula atletisk för att verkligen tycka det är roligt.

A great adventure for those looking to get "off the beaten path". This was our second trip to Buenos Aires and although we love all the beautiful architecture, delicious food and interesting tours, we were ready for something new. Why not Polo? We didn't know anything about the polo, and Fernando educated us on this fascinating sport. We had a great time learning how to ride while swinging the mallet - Fernando is a very good instructor and he's also very patient. Additionally, he took us to a local parrilla for lunch (delicious) and then to watch a polo match. A very good day and highly recommended.

The BA Polo Experience-add this to your bucket list. Great way to experience the Polo capitol of the world. Had no previous experience with polo, but realized a trip to Argentina would be incomplete without taking advantage of this unique opportunity. Fernando impeccably plans out your day, gives great instruction, and takes amazing care of the whole family (5 in our group; ages 13-45). All you need to do is focus on riding and hitting the ball. All the while, you'll receive facts about Argentina polo culture, history, global aspects, & the interesting polo lifestyle. Choose your level of comfort, involvement, speed, action and adrenaline. Very well worth-it and ranks as one of our top action vacations. Bucket list checked.
polo school. Had a great time learning the game of polo with Fernando. He is an excellent instructor felt very comfortable on the horse. He really had passion for the game.

Fernandooo. Great guy, great experience! We were picked up from the airport and got straight to the polo as our free time in BA was limited. My friend and I had no prior horseback riding or polo experience yet still had a phenomenal time. Fernando taught us how to ride the horse and control its pace before getting to the rules and strategy of the game. We broke for lunch at a rustic spot and had blood sausage and steaks before returning to play. Very happy I did this and highly recommend!
Amazing experience. Unique experience to learn the game from a professional. Great reliable person and makes the training and learning fun!

Amazing!. This was one of the most fun experiences I had in Argentina. Fernando was a great teacher and easily accommodated our large group, giving us all a great first experience with the sport of polo.

Amazing experience. Can't say enough good things about Fernando and Polo Elite.We were picked up on time in a new model van with AC. Fernando's English was excellent and he spent the drive out to the farm explaining about polo's history and rules. My wife and I were the only guests that day so we had a private lesson. She rode extensively when she was younger and I have some experience on horses so after Fernando explained the differences in controlling a polo pony, we were able to quickly bypass the riding instruction and get right to the polo.Since there were only the three of us, the actual "game" was a little silly, but we took turns taking pictures and videos of the other playing against Fernando so we got some great shots.A great day all around.

One of the highlights in Argentina, highly recommended!. Great personalized polo experience! Definitely on top of the list of things to do in Argentina. I'd say like in any other sports lessons the experience depends on the instructor, and Fernando was a superb instructor. He was very adaptive and responsive in tailoring his instructions throughout the lesson to push for more learning and more fun. Having started without any prior horseback riding or polo experience, I was able to play and have fun by end of the day. Definitely on top of the list of must do fun things in Argentina!

Polo, horse power on display. I have never experienced a Polo game and being in Argentina, the heart of Polo, I sort the opportunity. The experience was reasonably priced, a personalised service, offers a beautiful day in the countryside and the opportunity to gain an understanding of the nuances of Polo from Fernando, a passionate Polo player himself. Fernando picked us up from our Apartment in BA and we drove an 1hr into the BA countryside to Pilar. Fernando drove around some of the surrounding stables and shared his wealth of knowledge about some of the history and colour of Polo. Being from Australia, of particular interest was the stables of Ellerstina, with the Packer connection. We came to a driveway of crunchy white gravel lined with pointing polar trees and shady oaks and there before us stood a fairytale castle nestled back from lines of polo fields. This was the Argentina Polo Association and I had arrived at the very heart of the Polo World. I had a wonderful afternoon learning from Fernando about the game, the rules and how its played and watching magnificent horses thunder up and down the perfect Polo fields, snorting loudly from pure exhaustion, it was really quite exhilarating. I was fortunate to have timed my visit to coincide with the Hurlingham Open and we watched Ellerstina defeat Chapaleufu. Four of the top ranked Polo players in the world were playing in this match. I loved my day at the Polo and I was thrilled by the power of the horses and the love of the sport that was all around you. Fernando made the day. He is wonderful and generously shares his extensive knowledge of the sport. I don't think a trip to Argentina would be complete without a trip to Polo with Fernando.

Highly Recommended!. Great experience, I never rode a horse before but it was very simple and we learned in just 10 minutes, the horses are very well trained. I highly recommend this place, they will pick you up in the city, and drop you back off when done. If you never tried polo before, beware because it can be addictive. One of the most fun experiences in Buenos Aires.

One of the top 3 most fun things I've ever done. I came with 6 friends from business school and I cannot recommend playing polo with Fernando enough. Not only is Polo extremely fun as a sport but Fernando is an excellent teacher. To the reviews that say there is not enough instruction I could not disagree more. Fernando helped me hold the reins, speed up my horse, use a mallet, and eventually use proper defensive technique. Also, remember this is one man teaching 8 people to play a completely foreign sport, riding on the backs of half ton animals, in a 3 acre field. It makes what Fernando does in teaching and managing the group that much more impressive. The rest of the staff at the ranch were very friendly and the horses (some of which are actual polo competitors) had good temperaments dealing with a bunch of amateurs. Super smart animals. Our match was a blast and I'm considering going a second time on my stay just to play more. It's worth every cent. As an irrelevant aside, I also enjoyed playing with the many dogs on the ranch.

Highlight of our trip to Argentina!. My wife and I had an awesome time riding horses and learning how to play Polo with Fernando. We had never ridden a horse before, but by the end of the day, we were getting the hang of it and we were able to hit the ball on our horse. This was probably the most fun activity that we did in Buenos Aires and well worth the fairly inexpensive cost. We highly recommend it!

Superb day out. We spent a fantastic day with Fernando and learning the basics of polo. The ponies and location, outside of BA, were great and it was wonderful to be picked and dropped off in town and see the outskirts of the capital. We spent the first half of the session getting familiar with the horse, polo riding technique and basic ball hitting. After a break we put our skills into action with some games. Fernando was a great teacher and host and got us into the spirit of the game as well as explaining rules and tips to us. It was a wonderful and unforgettable day - I would do it again if I could!

Excellent time at Polo Elite. I had a fantastic day learning the basics of polo with Fernando of Polo Elite this past December. I've never ridden a horse before, but I was assured prior to coming that this was not a prerequisite. He was right! By the end of the day I felt quite comfortable on my horse,Tango, and I could hit the ball. I am even considering taking up horse riding as a hobby now. I highly recommend this as a "must do" attraction when visiting Buenos Aires. Cheers

Most Fun You Can Have In Argentina. This was one of the most exciting things I have ever done. I live a pretty interesting life but I knew almost nothing about Polo. Now I'm hooked. Very good choice for adventurist people.

Very Unique BA Experience. My fiancée and I spent an afternoon learning to play Polo with Fernando. It was a fun and highly memorable experience. It's typically the first thing I list now when people ask me what I did in BA.How it works:The size of the group depends on how many people sign up for the day. On our day it happened to be just the two of us so we got extra attention. The lesson starts with Fernando picking you up in downtown BA and then driving you ~30-40 minutes outside the city to the polo fields. We were beginners, so at the fields we just spent some time just practicing riding, then added in practice using the clubs and hitting the balls, and eventually got up to playing something close to a 2:1 game. Fernando is a very patient and encouraging instructor. Overall, it was a fun, highly unique experience, and a great value. Five stars.

Polo whoehoeeee. We heard about Fernando´s polo lessons in la Paz. A friend told us that in Buenos Aires polo is a must do, so we booked two days. Fernando picked us up by car in the middle of the city and we drove to the ranch just outside of BA. There the horses were already saddled and ready to ride. At first it was difficult to keep the right position on the horse, only using one hand and keeping your arm streched out, but Fernando gave us tips (in fluent English) and did some excercises with us to get comfortable. After a while he gave us the mallets, so we actually had to hit the ball. Practise is everything and it´s a great feeling to hit the ball so that it flies away! The horses are well trained and you feel that they get excited by game and the sound of the mallet hitting the ball. My friend and I really wanted to see a polo match, but the season just ended when we arrived in BA. We told Fernando this and then he invited us to come and see one of his training matches. It was a great experience and we really appreciated the extra effort he made (picking us up and dropping off us in BA again). We really loved playing polo and a big part of this is thanks to Fernando!

Fantastic day with Fernando. If you’re looking for something different to do, then this is it. Not only will Fernando teach you to ride a horse (galloping even as a beginner), but will also teach you to play polo, finishing with a match, where we played England vs. Argentina – nothing like a bit of competition. We also got to go to a local polo club and watch Fernando compete in actual matches over some sunshine beers. Brilliant day out in the Buenos Aires suburbs, with a top guide!

Great fun!. Booked last minute, luckily Fernando had room! Picked up from BA and brought to the stables where all the wonderful, well trained, well taken care of horses are kept. We were a group of 4. My husband had never ridden before and was cantering in about a half an hour! With close supervision from Fernando who is a great teacher and plays polo regularly. He was able to work equally with people who had ridden before and those who had not. Great experience and good to see how it all goes down behind the scenes! Thanks Fernando.

Great introduction in the sport of Polo. During a stay in Buenos Aires I had the pleasure of taking two separate days of Polo lessons under the guidance of Fernando Nieto of Polo Elite. Fernando picked out little group up in the city and took us to a homestead where he kept his own private polo horses. This homestead was equipped with a polo field. As some in our little group were, like myself, not experienced riders Fernando started explaining and showing us the basics of horse riding. Quickly after that Fernando familiarized us with the tools of playing polo, mallet and ball. At the end of the day Fernando had us playing our first polo match. Hilarious!We had a really good time. And I must say that Fernando is a good and patient instructor. If you want to learn about playing polo, I recommend to book a day with Fernando.

Great Experience!!!. My handicapped husband and myself were visiting in Buenos Aires at the time of the Argentinian Polo Championship. Fernando was able to get us tickets to see the semi-final match, picked us up at our hotel, and explained the game to us. We had a wonderful time on a bright sunny afternoon and enjoyed seeing a sport that was new to us which is seldom played in the US.Thanks FernandoJane & Herb

Excellent guide to polo. We wanted to see a polo match while in Buenos Aires but knew nothing about the game. Going with Fernando was the perfect solution for us. He picked us up at our hotel exactly when he said he would, took us to the match and showed us around beforehand. We spent a little time at the champagne bar before the main match and then met up with him again at our seats. He patiently and thoroughly explained the rules of the game and what was happening on the field, gave us great insight into what the game requires from the players and the horses, and answered all our questions. He is a very nice, patient, friendly person and we had a great afternoon with him. We'd highly recommend going to a match with Fernando - it was a great experience and a lot of fun!

Unforgettable polo experience. Our afternoon of polo was an educational, cultural journey that was fun and entertaining. Fernando organized transportation and tickets and patiently explained the rules of the game, the history of the players and breeding of the horses - one was worth $1 million! Understanding the game and having a knowledgeable guide the entire time made it a thrilling experience. Nowhere else in the world can you see polo the way it's played in Argentina. We were lucky to watch the best of the best play each other. I highly recommend anyone traveling to Argentina to take the time to explore polo. I learned about a new sport and its cultural roots in one afternoon. Thanks Fernando for the amazing experience! Can't wait to go back to Argentina for another polo match!
Polo introduction. Fernando introduced us to the world of polo. His enthousiastic way of teaching was wonderfull. Second time on a horse and allready playing a polo game was amazing!Thanks Fernando!

Best afternoon in Argentina. We loved getting out of Buenos Aires for a few hours and really seeing the countryside. Our guide was excellent and was good at teaching beginners how to correctly ride horses and play polo. The asado they provided us was great afterwards, and a nice way to wind down the afternoon.

An Excellent Introduction to Polo. I would highly recommend learning to play polo while in BA, and Polo Elite is a great way to do this. We appreciated the no-nonsense, time efficient format, and the fact that it was a lot cheaper than other options out there. It is a half-day excursion in which most of your time is spent on horseback, learning to play polo.We were picked up from central BA, and drove with Fernando out to a farm in a semi-rural area. We were well equipped with ponies, helmets, mallets, and plenty of balls to hit around the training field. We started with a few laps of the field to warm the ponies up, then gradually learned new skills, with time to practice each before moving on to the next. Fernando expained each skill thoroughly, and was patient and encouraging as he helped us practice. After a break we were ready to play a mock game of polo, Australia vs. Argentina, which Fernando graciously allowed us to win. He took plenty of action shots, which he sent to us later.As an aside, we enjoyed the antics of the animals on the farm: the tiny pony which escaped its paddock and defied efforts to recapture it, and the numerous dogs, who leapt all over Fernando when we arrived, and who seem to spend most of their day chasing a cheeky plover.

Fernando is an excellent teacher,the horses are well trained and I would do it again.. Fernando is very patient and even to an experienced rider gives several valuable insights to become a good rider.The playing and training field is very large and well maintained.I plan to go again to become better at polo.
Thank you , Fernando

Awesome Polo lessons. Something that we wouldn't have thought to do, but it was really great craic! Can't believe how good Fernando's horses are, they can sense if someone's really nervous and they'll take it really easy. Try to go as part of a group of 6 or more so that you can have a bit of a match at the end of the lesson, I scored a hat-trick!

AMAZING addition to our BA trip. I would highly reccommend doing this while in BA. It was just myself and my boyfriend so we had very personalized attention. Fernando made the day very fun and I liked that it was a ~3-4 hour activity versus the other options in BA that take up your entire day. STRONGLY RECCOMMEND

Amazing Experience with a Great Teacher. Our friends told us about Polo Elite and we were not disappointed. It was forecast to rain on our scheduled date, so Fernando emailed me several days ahead of time to change the date. Communication was very clear all the way through, and we had an amazing time when we got out to the farm. Fernando picked the four of us up at the meeting spot, and we drove about an hour into the country. Since we had very little experience riding horses, Fernando spent about an hour teaching us the basics of horseback riding before he gave us the mallets. We did a couple drills to get used to hitting the balls, and then we took a much needed break before we played a game of Polo. Great experience, great coaching, serious bang for the buck. Do it!

Polo Elite and Fernando. This is a day trip from Buenos Aires, you will not regret. Polo and Elite provide a custom Polo introduction and experience tailored to your level and comfort. I learned about the sport and was able to watch a Polo Match as a guest. Fernando is a great ambassador and teach of the sport.

First class service, and a lot of fun.. We decided to try polo for my brothers bucks party. As a bunch of unorganised, hungover Australians, I imagine we would have been frustrating to deal with! Fernando was the ultimate host. Heavy rain had meant we could not play on the regular field, but Fernando ensured we had a place to play, despite the ominous weather conditions. Everyone had a blast, and more importantly, we all returned safely and there were no broken limbs for the wedding photos. I'd encourage everyone to try this whilst in BA. It was great to see some of the countryside, and try a sport that's not very accessible here in Sydney. A few of the guys have since returned to spend more time playing polo with Fernando.It ended up being one of the highlights of the whole South American trip, highly recommended!!

What a great experience!. We had the best day with Fernando and learning how to Polo. We were a little intimidated by the horses as we had not rode since we were kids 20 years ago, but Fernando was so patient and a great teacher. Once we started playing the game, I totally forgot about how nervous I was on the horse and let my competitive spirit take over. Fernando is also really great with his horses and provides great care for them. They all look very happy and healthy. I would absolutely do this again.

A Must-Do when in Buenos Aires. If you are visiting Buenos Aires, I highly recommend learning to play polo with Polo Elite.Our group of four had no prior riding experience, but when I suggested we learn to play polo, everyone was game. It was one of the best decisions we made all trip; we all had a fantastic time.We arrived at the polo field in the late morning, and the horses were already saddled and ready to go. After we got the hang of riding, the rules of the game were explained to us, and we attempted a match. It wasn't very pretty, but we all laughed a lot, and it was a very hands-on way to learn about a sport we were previously unfamiliar with. I'm pretty sure I had a perma-grin the entire time. We went at the end of polo season, which was a benefit as weather wasn't as hot as I'm sure it is in the summer. Luckily we didn't get rained out.Definitely try this adventure, you won't be disappointed.

Escape the city for the day.... We had an awesome time learning the basics of polo and then having a game at the end of the day. The horses are very experienced which makes learning to hit the ball properly so much easier and the guide, Fernando, was easy going and one of the nicest people we've met in South America. Only about 40 minutes drive from downtown, makes the day well worth the money as you spend so much time actually doing what your paying for. People who had never ridden before were playing polo and enjoying themselves after a few hours. Would definitely recommend this for a day in Argentina.

Great Day in Buenos Aires. We had a small group of four people and had so much fun learning to play polo with Fernando. We spent the morning getting used to riding the horses with our mallets and learning how to hit the balls while moving (very slowly at first). Then we attempted our own polo match. Fernando was a great teacher and explained the rules of polo, which was helpful for the afternoon.We went on a Saturday, and Fernando was playing in a tournament, so we spent the afternoon watching real polo matches. The whole day cost us around $100, but it was a wonderful experience and definitely one of our favorite days in Buenos Aires.

A Fun Polo Adventure. This was a wonderful way to spend a day in Argentina. I went with a large group, and we all enjoyed ourselves immensely. We were all beginners (i.e., none of us had ever played polo, and most of us had little to no experience in riding a horse). For a beginner, this is a perfect experience that exposes you to calm horses that are very easy to handle. For those that just want a picture on a horse, and the ability to ride around for a half hour, you can do that here. For those that want to play a game of polo with a faster pace, such game occurs after the initial calm instruction and walk around with the horses, so that is available as well. The instructors are nice, fun, and easy to talk to. Fernando is a phenomenally nice guy with a lot of positive energy to add to the day.I would highly recommend this event, especially for beginners and groups.

Fun & Exciting Day. I hadn't rode a horse in years but it was so easy and fun. Fernando was a great teacher. We had a small group of just four people. We started the day just riding around for a bit getting used to our horse and then you start learning how to hit the balls with the mallet. We ended the day having our own little polo match. It was great. The horses were all pretty tame and easy to get along with as well. Fernando also teaches you all the rules to polo so if you don't know anything, like me, you'll be fine. We went on a Saturday and afterwards we were actually able to go watch Fernando play in a match. It was so much fun! The price is around $100 but it's a full day thing and such a great thing to try out.

Great fun way to spend the day.. One of the best things we did in Buenos Aires. Fernando somehow managed to teach us to ride and play Polo in one day!Fernando is a pro player but is also a great guy with the perfect temperament for teaching. Everyone had a great time and we met a bunch of fun and interesting people.

An amazing day away from the city. An absolutely awesome day in the fresh air, an hour out of Buenos Aires, picked up in the city by our very capable guide Fernando who chatted with us along the way about various aspects of Argentine life. We were lucky as the Polo experience started for us at the stables where we watched the horses being prepared for transport to the game. After arriving at the field, the horses were saddled up and then the true excitement started. To hear the thunder of hooves, the knock of the mallet on the ball and to cheer for our team...together created an amazing atmosphere.

A unique and enjoyable experience. My wife and I were looking for activities to do in Buenos Aires and were glad we chose to play polo with Polo Elite. I have never played polo and have limited experience on horseback, my wife has practically no experience with horses. Yet we both thoroughly enjoyed the experience; the horses were fantastic and Fernando was friendly and professional. I have recommended this to my friends as one of the great activities to do in Buenos Aires.

A relaxing, fun, and educational experience.. Fernando was a great! His enthusiasm for polo made the day a treat. As beginners, we were not sure what to expect, but the horses were great, the sport is fun, and it was altogether a great day.

What Fun! Exceeded all my Expectations!. I cannot say enough good things about our day with Polo Elite. Fernando picked us up at our front door on time and drove us out to the polo farm. His English is great and we had wonderful conversations about Argentina and polo. We have three boys ages 11, 9 and 9 with very little horse riding experience. Fernando's horses were extremely gentle and calm. In fact very smart. They could sense if you were nervous or uncomfortable and would not go faster than a slow trot. After we got more comfortable and relaxed they began to run for us. Frankly, I never thought I could control a horse with one hand and swing a mallet with the other. By the end of the afternoon we played a match. My horse was amazing! He reacts to shifts in body weight and was very easy to control. Our 11 year old was a natural and was off galloping around the field. Our 9 year olds...not so much. Fernando and his helper split us up and spent extra time with the twins and they were playing polo (unassisted) by the end of the day. It was such fun! We always felt very safe and helmets are provided. After the polo match, the kids took turns galloping around the field without the mallet. Fernando was very accommodating and patient. The kids did not want it to end.For lunch Fernando drove us 5 minutes away to an amazing mansion built in 1919 for a 3 course meal. We ate on the porch and enjoyed the beautiful scenery. It was excellent! Fernando drove us back to Buenos Aires and dropped us off at our door. We had asked him about things to do including Tango lessons and attending a futbol game. He drove us by a place near us that gave Tango lessons. The next day he emailed me links to lessons and where to get futbol tickets. He also sent me all the other suggestions he gave us throughout the day. On top of that, he sent me 28 pictures that he had taken of the family during our day of polo. Fernando goes above and beyond. What a great host and a wonderful day! Contact Fernando, you will not be disappointed!

Great way to spend an afternoon. Timely pickup to the lesson 30 minutes outside of the city. Very relaxing day starting off with getting acquainted with the horses, which were calm and well trained. Learned the rules of the game and played a few "games" amongst ourselves. Fernando was a very patient and good teacher. Highly recommended.

Awesome. The Polo Elite experience has been awesome!! Besides that I had never ridden before, the horses are so well trained that myself and my friends had such a great time. We even made it to play a real polo game. On top of that, Fernando and his crew are really nice and welcoming people, other than being great teachers. I definitively suggest everybody to try the Polo Elite, it's definitively worth it. One of the greatest experience in my life.

What better thing to do in Argentina?. Our group had a great time with Fernando at Polo Elite. Having only ridden on a trail ride, Fernando was easily able to provide instructions on how to make the horse Go, Stop, turn, etc... We learned the basic rules of Polo, practiced our skills and then got on to a match! Argentina won this time...but we'll be back for a rematch! Also - he's a great host and even managed to find a bar to watch the NCAA Championship game. Excellent time.

so much fun... best part of my trip to BA!. My girlfriend and I did the one day polo trip, learning the basic skills in the morning, and then playing some chukkas in the afternoon. Playing polo is so much fun, even if you aren't great at riding a horse like me. Argentina is definitely the place to learn, because not only is it the home of polo, but its also a lot cheaper than doing it back home in Australia. Here the same thing would cost $400 to $500 USD for a whole day including lunch. Plus, the food was terrific and the ranch where they hold the training is this beautiful country homestead. Thanks to Fernando and the team for a wonderful day!

Required Stop for Anyone Visiting Argentina. Argentina has a long tradition of Polo, in part due to the gaucho's riding skills and the quality of the horses. In short, no visit to Argentina is complete without first experiencing one of its deep-rooted pastimes. Polo Elite and Fernando will teach the basics of horse-riding and polo playing in a manner that's fun and engaging regardless of your skill level. More importantly, you are learning from someone that also plays the sport professionally and can share interesting anecdotes beyond just the rules of how the game is played. Best part of my trip to Buenos Aires and one that I will look to repeat my next time in the country.

Best part of the trip!. Fernando was amazing! If anyone can teach you how to ride a horse AND play polo in one day it's him! We had a fantastic time and would recommend this to anyone travelling to BA!! A must!

Great Experience. This was an awesome event for anyone heading down to BA. Fernando is incredibly attentive and loves the sport of polo. Whether you are a first time rider or a seasoned vet, this will definitely be the highlight of your trip.

Great time in Buenos Aires. This is a bit late for a posting but we went to Polo Elite to experience Polo first hand. Fernando was very patient with us since none of us had any real experience on horses. To say the least it was pretty comical watching us I am sure, but it was definitely the highlight of the trip. I have kept in contact with Fernando over these past yrs and he actually came to visit while exploring the US playing polo. Looking forward to trying it again the next time I am in Buenos Aires.

A Buenos Aires Must!. I spent a week in Buenos Aires, and learning/playing the game of Polo was,without a doubt, the most fun thing I did. Although I have only been on a horse a few times in my life, Fernando and his team taught me how to ride property to the point where I was galloping and hitting a ball in only an hour. I was with a large group of friends so everyone took turns riding and hitting in the morning. After breaking for a delicious asado lunch, we went back to the field and played a few actual polo games. I had such a great time that I will be picking up this activity in back in New York City. I can't speak highly enough of Polo Elite and hope you decide to take part.

My Favorite Day in Argentina. Our day with Fernando was definitely my favorite day that my friends and I had during our week in Argentina. He was incredibly patient with our group -- we had about 30 people with us, which he said was the biggest group he'd worked with so far. They picked us up from Palermo in a large van and a bus and took us to the polo field. We were split in 3 groups and each group was given 15 minutes or so to learn the basics of riding and warm up on the horses, and then given mallets to play around for another 20-30 minutes or so. I had done a bit of riding before so I was comfortable on the very tame horses they have. Fernando and the other coaches were super watchful and helpful with everyone. After, they provided a huge lunch for us all, and were helpful with some of our friends dietary needs, including vegetarian, which didn't seem super common everywhere we went in Argentina. After lunch, we were given the choice between going back out and playing a real "match" of polo, or going back home. About two thirds of the group went home, while those of us that stayed got to see Fernando and his mates play a real match for a bit, and then let us play a match against each other, which was much less intense (but still really fun)! They took our group home after we all played, even after taking an initial group back the hour-long journey. It was a wonderful time and we even had Fernando and another coach, Maxi, over to our house that evening for an asado and then a night out on the town. It was a wonderful experience and I'm so glad that I had this opportunity to learn polo from Fer!**I am VERY glad I brought bug spray - I definitely recommend you remember to bring lots of bug spray and water.**

A terrific day with Fernando!. Fernando provided a wonderful day out for us, a really wonderful polo experience that we all enjoyed very much. Hard to believe that after only a coupe of hours we were cantering along and hitting the ball! Fernando is very patient, his horses are great and the lunch was excellent. If you are visiting BA and looking for something to do then this should be Number 1!

Best Money Spent. Easily the best money spent while on our 5 country trip from the states. Here's why:1. Only $110!2. Fernando picks you up from downtown and takes you to and from3. We were the only people getting lessons - this may not be the case most days but it was only 3 of us. We were there for about 6 hours.4. We got to watch a polo friendly that Fernando played in5. We got great instruction, friendly service, and played a significant amount of poloEven if you haven't ridden a horse, you can still do this. Even if you're a more experienced rider, you will certainly learn new techniques.

Our best day in Argentina. Being a novice horse rider, I was a bit nervous about learning to play polo while atop a horse, so I ended up just riding the horse (with assistance from a groom) for a bit, sans the mallet. That said, I stayed on my horse 15 minutes longer than my friend, who only stayed on one minute. Funny really, because the horses are incredibly tame and well behaved. I think it was just more work than sitting on the grass and playing with all of Fernando's lovely dogs, while he taught the others to play. No complaints here. The countryside is lovely and the company was superb. After the lesson, Fernando took us to a watch him and some other professional polo players play a few matches at a private polo club down the road. There, we drank wine and picnic'd (it is encouraged to bring a picnic basket for your dinner) while handsome Argentinean men raced across the field, playing the very fast paced and exciting sport. We also played with more local dogs, my favorite being Lila, the polo club owners gorgeous and sweet baby girl. After that, Fernando offered to take us back to his estancia to try our hand at riding one more time. Our new Swiss friend (who is a fantastic rider) opted to do that, but we decided to stay at the polo club for wine and conversation with the owner and some of the polo players. An hour or so later, Fernando came to pick us up and took us back to the city. The sky out there in the country was the bluest I'd ever seen. The weather was perfect (which I imagine it usually is in Argentina, compared to rainy Oregon where we are from). The polo club was beautiful. All in all, it was the best day we had in Argentina and I would highly recommend this for anyone who loves animals or wants to get out of the city for an afternoon and see the lovely countryside.

MUST DO!. It had been years since I was on a horse, so I was not sure how I would learn how to ride and play polo at the same time. Fernando picked us up from Buenos Aires and took us to the farm. He taught us everything we needed to know about riding the horse and playing the game. It was an amazing experience and the most memorable part from our trip to Argentina. To this day, the pictures of us playing polo are the most commented on by my friends and family, and I insist they have to play, and if they are in Buenos AIres they have to call Fernando. Highly recommend, totally worth it, you won't regret it, do it!

A Fantastic Experience. Fernando created the best part of my trip to Buenos Aries! The trip to play polo was fun and great adventure. (Since Fernando picked us up in the city it was a very easy adventure to have.) I had had several previous polo lessons and this was far and away my best one. If you have the time while you are in Argentina, this is a must!

Unforgettable!. We spent an afternoon with Fernando and had a great time! We were a group of four - all unexperienced riders. Within a course of a few hours we learnt to ride/steer a horse, hit the ball and finally play a mock game. We couldn't have had a better experience, and of all the activities we did in Buenos Aires( bike riding , tango. bomba de tiempo, fuerza beata, tour of colon theatre) this was by far the highlight of our trip!

Best part of our trip to Argentina!. My wife scheduled an afternoon playing polo with Fernando during our stay in Buenos Aires. I never thought I would learn to play polo, but, it turned out to be the highlight of our trip. Fernando met us in Buenos Aires and drove us to the polo farm. There, we were given helmets and mallets and the ponies were tacked and ready to go. I had never ridden a horse before but Fernando was extremely patient, skilled and taught us the basics of polo. After an hour or so of instruction, we played chukkars with Fernando and another couple that we met in BA. We had a great time and, for better or worse, playing polo in BA started my wife's obsession with polo and now she plays in our area. I did not make the arrangements but Fernando was punctual, professional and a lot of fun. I highly recommend Elite Polo to anyone looking for something adventurous to do outside of the city. We would certainly return if we are ever in BA again.

An authentic and memorable polo experience in Buenos Aires!. My husband and I joined Fernando for a polo lesson and a tour to the Argentine open polo finals, and we had such a wonderful time! It was the first time my husband and I had played polo, and Fernando was so patient with us. He was thorough in explaining the rules of the game and techniques. The next day, he picked us up from our apartment and took us to the polo finals and secured great seats for us. He even had handouts for us to use as cheat sheets for rules of the game. We had a blast with Fernando and highly recommend taking a lesson and taking a tour to a polo game with him while you are in Buenos Aires!

"One of the highlights of our trip!". Our afternoon with Fernando of Polo Elite was so much more than we expected. We love horses and always look for a riding activity - but we had never experienced polo. Even though the 3 of us were at different riding levels (beginner, novice, and advanced), we all had a wonderful time. Fernando is not only a very accomplished polo player...but a very good teacher as well. Patient, engaging, and fun - we learned so much - and never would have thought we would end our afternoon by actually trying to "play", a very abbreviated and slow, but awesomely fun game.The horses were wonderful - actual competitive polo ponies...and when we watched Fernando ride - amazing! Don't miss it! Thank you Fernando ....the photos were great - we are still smiling!

Fantastic Afternoon - Highly Recommended!. If you have any interest in polo or riding this is a definite must!Fernando, owner of Polo Elite, is a brilliant international polo player and a patient and full-of-fun teacher. Outside of Buesnos Aires and away from the hustle and bustle of the city this makes for a perfectly peaceful escape; the polo fields set in beautiful surroundings.The instruction was made fun but at the same time second to none - we were taught how to properly communicate and control the polo ponies, to swing the mallets in both forward and back-hand strokes, block a strike and to nudge a rider away from the ball... Once we'd practised and (to some degree!) mastered all of these things, and were given the basic rules and it was our turn to play a game... at a simple walk and trot at best, a slow paced beginners plod, it was enormous fun and a real buzz! Highly recommended!

The best day of my trip!. Along with 3 friends, I spent the afternoon at Polo Elite last week, learning to play polo. I own my own horse but my friends do not ride, Fernando was endlessly patient and ensured we each rode ponies suitable to our experience levels. We had a fantastic time, Fernando is a great teacher and very patient, his ponies are lovely. Would highly recommend this to everyone, riders and non riders alike, we all loved every minute of our afternoon and will certainly return if ever in Buenos Aires again. Thank you Fernando for a great day!
Great polo experience. Fernando is a very nice person and an excellent teacher. We had a great time and we enjoyed playing and the horses.

Best day in BA. As a bunch of 3 young guys traveling on a budget we were at first hesitant about splurging on a polo experience. We knew it was something that we couldn't do again so based on the reviews on TA we put our faith in polo elite and weren't disappointed. Fernando was amazing at teaching us to be capable enough riders and players, so at the end of our session we were able to play a mock polo game. The game itself is techniqual yet with Fernando's guidance we were all able to understand the rules and talent that it involves. If you don't have a fear of being on a horse and have a general interest in all sports, this is a must do!Anthony, 22 Melbourne Australia

Experience the sport of kings. After hearing about polo lessons at our hostel we decided that it would a fun and new experience as it is impossible to play at homeBefore booking however we did some research and came upon polo elite after reading raving reviews The reviews were not wrong Fernando was fantastic taking photos and teaching us how to ride the horses within minutes, the horses were perfectly trained and his expert advice helped make it an experience of a life timeI highly reccomend Polo elite and Fernando!!

So much more than just a casual ride on a horse. After originally hearing about the potential of having polo lessons through our hostel (which were endorsing another company due to kick backs) we were keen to check out the other options and were immediately drawn to this one due to the overwhelmingly positive reviews it had received on TA. We couldn't be happier with our decision to go with Fernando and Polo Elite.Being three beginner riders from suburban Australia who had maybe ridden ponies once or twice as kids, Fernando actually got the three of us up to the standard required to play a pretty competitive mock game of polo by the end of the sessions.As backpackers on a budget, an attraction like this is obviously a pretty expensive thing to partake in. But I can undoubtably claim amongst the incredible things we've seen and done, this experience was the highlight of our trip so far and absolutely worth every penny.When/ where else are we ever going to get an opportunity to get on a horse and play polo?! On top of that, Fernando was more than patient with any questions and difficulties we had with our lack of experience on horseback- and the the seasoned polo horses he has trained are unbelievable at coping with the pressure of dealing with inexperienced riders. Fernando was happy to take pictures of us on our cameras as well as his own throughout the session, and sent them on to us free of charge afterwards. We thought this was another added bonus we hadn't bargained on, as photos atop horseback playing polo really are priceless.If what you're looking for is a one of a kind experience at actually playing polo and getting great guidance from an awesome guide and teacher, this activity is for you.

Awesome day out - well organised, great tuition & a lot of fun!. I absolutely loved our day out with Fernando. I can ride horses but have never played polo. What better place to learn than in Argentina, the home of the best players in the world!? Fernando speaks excellent English & is a fantastic teacher, so by the end of lesson we felt very comfortable hitting the ball and had a lot of fun playing the game. It certainly helped that the polo ponies knew exactly what they were doing & were of very good temperament.The private transfer from Central BA out to the stables and back gave us the opportunity to learn more about Argentina too, which was a big bonus.Overall, it was a very well organised, personable & fun experience and was one of the highlights of our whole trip. I would highly recommend a day out with Polo Elite to anyone visiting Buenos Aires, regardless of riding ability. Fernando's great guidance coupled with the wonderful polo ponies will provide you with an amazing experience that you will never forget!

Great fun, outstanding value and brilliant service. I can't speak highly enough of our experiences with Fernando and Polo Elite. Collection from central Buenos Aires, driven out to the ranch (about an hour outside of BA) and then an afternoon of coaching on well trained polo ponies and then a game at the end.Fernando is a great teacher, speaks excellent English and is passionate about both the sport of polo and Argentina itself - really enjoyed our journey back to BA with him and learning a little of his political views!Having played a little polo in England, this really is outstanding value for money, and a brilliant way to experience a sport that Argentina dominates on a world level. It's a great break away from Buenos Aires, and a 'must do' if you have the opportunity.Thanks a million to Fernando for one of the highlights of our trip.

Such a fun and different way to experience a new culture. My friend and I went to Buenos Aires for vacation in 2012 and we had so much fun trying polo for the first time. Before we began, Fernando set us up with his horses based on our experience levels. My friend has a horse, so she had no problems figuring out the game and her horse, but I am not very experienced in riding or with polo so I took time to ask questions and stroll around with my horse. We spent the first half hour getting use to riding and using the polo gear before beginning practice drills with the ball. By the end of our time, we had learned the basics of the game and played against each other (there were 8 people there) in a scrimmage. The experience is something I will always remember because it is so unique. I would say that if you have never ridden before, it might not be the best idea to start because you're trying to multi-task on a horse. But if you are looking for something different to do in Buenos Aires and want to get out into the country, go see Fe

An amazing day, one of the best ever!. Polo Elite, I can say, was one of the best days of my life. Private pickup in central Buenos Aires, a full day of lessons, and ending it all with a scrimmage against the others in your group. It was so much fun to take my first polo lesson, and with the prices being very reasonable, I will be sure to do so again next time I am in the city!

Polo in Argentina = a dream that became true!. When we arrived in Buenos Aires we had no clue what we were going to experience: POLO TRAINING AND GAME!! But fortunately we saw the add the very first day in our hostel and decided immediately to take part to that fun! We got a ride to the polo field, got introduced to the game and the horses and Fernando put us immediately on the horses and the show begun! :D The 2 Aussie boys of our group hadn't ever ridden a horse but the polo horses knew what to do and the boys just had to relax and have fun. ;) We were practising first how to ride polo horses (=galloping as fast as you can imagine!!), how to hit the ball, what are the rules of the game and in the end we started playing 4 tourist vs 4 tourists. The game was not that furious as the real games since we were not that talented yet.. ;) But it was great fun!!! In the end we got a ride back. That was ABSOLUTELY the BEST THING we experienced in Argentina!! :D Thaks to Fernando and his father!!! :) Hopefully we'll get a new chance to "play" some polo soon again!

Polo with the Elite. If you're in Argentina, playing polo with Fernando is a must! Polo is a huge part of the Argentine culture and I personally believe it's one of the best ways to connect with the people. Not to mention it's a nice break from the electrifying city of Buenos Aires. Play polo with Fer and you know you're taken care of from pick up to drop off. He's really patient and makes it an experience instead of just a lesson. You'll get to meet some other people and players on the ranch and even play a mini match to finish the lesson! If you're lucky enough you'll even get to see him play with his team! When you play polo with Fer, you've made a friend for life... not just an instructor. If you come to Argentina and don't give it a shot you're really missing out!

Great fun playing polo!. Fernando patiently taught our whole group how to play polo and we had a blast! He picked us up right at our hotel, answered all our crazy questions during the whole van ride there and back, gave us a fantastic experience on well trained horses, and delivered us safely back to our hotel.

Excellent polo experience. Polo Elite took great care of us, 5 passionate international polo players based in the US and Peru. Fernando is a dedicated manager, polo player and now friend. He went the extra mile to offer us the best experience, despite a busy time of year (Argentine Open). He provided great horses, great players to compete against, great polo fields and wonderful seats at the Palermo Open.We will certainly all come back and work and play with Fernando at Polo Elite.Best,Steve

Who Knew I could play polo too!. Fernando was very patient with us, explaining the game, describing how to "drive" the horses so that even novices to horse riding had fun. I loved galloping the horse and managed to actually strike the ball once while at a run. What a treat. Excellent way to spend a day and get out of the city.

Enjoyable and memorable polo outing. We spent a very enjoyable afternoon on Christmas day with Fernando of Polo Elite. He picked us up in Buenos Aires in a comfortable van and we drove about an hour outside the city to a picturesque ranch. It was nice to get out of the city during the extreme heat wave that was happening at the time. The overall experience was a lot of fun and very memorable - a unique way to experience something first hand that Argentina is known for. None of us had played polo before and we came away with some good basic skills and enthusiasm for the sport. Fernando is friendly, informative and an excellent instructor. During the drive to and from the city, he also provided interesting background information on Argentina and was able to answer our questions about the country and the sport. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Argentina. Great experience.

I keep going back. I have visited Buenos Aires four years in a row and each year I have attended a polo game with Fernando of Polo Elite. Fernando is not only knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the game (which he plays), he is also a charming and friendly host. He takes small groups to games and ensures that he spends time chatting with each of his guests. He speaks fluent english and patiently answers everyone's questions about the game. I have been to games in palermo and games in the country. Both experiences were wonderful. The games in Palermo featured the highest level of skill and the games were fast and furious. The games in the country were still skilled and allowed a more intimate glimpse into the world of the "polo elite". I would recommend taking advantage of both experiences if you have the opportunity.Fernando also teaches and coaches polo from beginner to advanced. I have taken a lesson and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Meeting other people who are on the trip was part of the positive experience. Fernando creates a warm and welcoming environment that encourages conversation. Go check out a game or take a lesson with Polo Elite. It's a true Argentinian experience and much more cost affordable than other places where you might go to a game.You won't regret it.

Real Good Polo lessons. Yesterday we had our half day Polo lessons @Polo Elite which is one hour drive from Buenos Aires. Tour was arranged by Cécilia Tours, Buenos Aires. Picked up at 8.30 am. First we got a short explanation and demonstration. After that you can excercise yourself on one the well-trained polo horses. At The end we had a real Polo match which was really tremendous! If you visit Buenos Aires, contact Cécilia Tours and let them book Polo lessons for you!

Excellent horeses and field, superb service, friendly staff and reasonable prices!. I highly recommend Polo Elite and Fernando. I have been playing polo and involved with the Polo community for some years. Fernando is the most professional polo instructor/organizer and player I met in Argentina and Elite Polo is the most reliable one-stop-shop organization to cater for all of your Polo, entertainment and logistics needs. We went with a group pf Polo Player during the Palermo Open, when the horses and he fields are in high demand. Fernando managed to arrange excellent fields and horses for us. We enjoyed our stay and will do it again, certainly.

Excellent experience. Fernando and his team were great. We were 5 players and he arranged practices in four different places for us. Good horses for several levels. And he was willing to change a horse if the rider asked. He also provided us with transportation, driving us around safely in his van.Good prices, for sure.

Polo lessons in Argentina. Our trip to Argentina would not have been complete without playing some Polo! Fernando was fantastic. His love of the game is very clear and he was so excited for the opportunity to share that with us. His lesson was great, instructions were clear and was keen to push you along once you had grasped the concept. We were also fortunate enough to have the opportunity of being able to go to the Argentine Polo Open with Fernando. It was a great day and Fernando was able to explain the rules to us as we went along. He even made up a basic rules sheet for us so that we could follow the game. We would highly recommend getting polo lessons with Polo Elite if you are in BA.

VIP Polo Experience. My husband and I are new to polo and knew a trip to BA wouldn't be complete without seeing a match. Fernando was an excellent host/guide. He picked us up on time and had great seats for us for the Argentine Polo Open. Throughout the match, he explained the game and took the time to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. After the event, Fernando had tickets for us to attend one of the exclusive after-hours polo parties. It was a great time! I highly recommend checking out polo while in Argentina with Fernando. This is a must do!

Perfect introduction to Argentine Polo!. A trip to Argentina is not complete without a day of Polo. Fernando was the perfect host and provided a great introduction to the sport of polo. We had fantastic seats at the Palermo Stadium and Fernando made the entire day seamless, from pick up to drop off at our hotel. It one of our best memories in Buenos Aires. A must do!

More fun than tango. What an out of the box experience. Fernando was great, very patient and explained everything really well. We were not experienced horse riders but were able to get the correct response from the horses with minimal movement of weight or light rein pressure. The game at the end was so much fun. Never realised Polo could be such a rough and tumble game. Fernando had a great sense of humour, we highly recommend this adventure.Alun & Lesley

Novice to Polo Argentine Adventure Not A Problem. I just want to tell you about a great experience with Polo Elite. I was a total amateur but with a interest in Polo. Fernando put my nervousness at ease as he explained the game, horsemanship and the skills to play polo. I recommend anyone with a interest in polo and the culture of Argentina and are looking for a adventure to contact Polo Elite.

This is the real thing- a total polo experience.. The day was all about Fernando and the fun experience and being exposed to a brand new sport. I want to try to hit some highlights.1. You learn so much within a short period of time that you almost feel like you are equipped to actually play.2. There is not a lot of time wasting fluff. You get right down to business and learn about Fernando's experience and how to play.3. the balancing act on a horse, holding a mallet and aiming at the ball takes a bit of skill but it is so much fun4. You come away with such a great appreciation for the sportOur group was great and when we played our match we had a great time full of laughs and memories.I have already told my brother that he has to go to Polo Elite when he visits BA in January. This is a nice ride into the country on a ranch with lovely horses. I agree with the comment- take a water bottle and a snack, you work out there and will need it. Class act.

Exciting Argentine adventure. First, I must say that Fernando was fantastic during the organizational stage of this day.... I was taking a small group to BA and really appreciated his prompt replies to my emails, and also during dealing with wet weather postponements and so juggling our packed itinerary around his availability. I wanted to experience polo in its birthplace!!Our polo lesson day started when picked us up in the City of BA at 9 am. Fernando was entertaining and informative for the whole journey....on arrival his ponies were ready for us, helmets to hand, and his instruction for our polo lesson was clear and delivered with patience and good humour. We spent 2 to 3 hours working hard in the saddle!We shared mate with one of the stable hands before Fernando delivered us back to the City... weary, dusty and a little sore but very happy after our day in the countryside.This is not your super slick '100 tourists a day' operation.... Fernando makes it a personalized experience, and he does a fantastic job.....but expect to take your own water and snacks, and facilities are well cared for but rustic. I have no hesitation in recommending Fernando for small or larger groups of people of all ages, you dont need to be a super rider but some level of fitness is required. It's not a cheap activity but it is great value when you consider the level of instruction and quality of horseflesh, and inclusion of transfers. I will certainly be taking my guests to visit Polo Elite on my next tour.

Playing Polo in Argentina ...... as you do. Wow! Playing polo in Argentina!!Yes we did! Last week I had the opportunity to play polo in BA. With no experience in playing polo, we donned our jeans and boots and headed to the pick-up point to meet Fernando. During the drive to the stables we chatted about our riding experience and our lives in general. On arrival Fernando matched us with one of his beautiful polo ponies. The first session was a lesson on how to play and develop our mallet skills (or for the pony to work out where to put us so we could hit the ball!). After a short break, we were keen for our first polo game – what an awesome experience!Fernando is an excellent polo instructor and is able to help and encourage all riders at every skill level. Thank you Fernando and La Cumparsita (my pony) for a fantastic experience and one I will always remember. I hope to return to Argentina and do it again soon.

Playing polo near Buenos Aires. My goal was to, once in my life, play polo or at least learn to know how this game works..Fernando is very flexible and will do everything to give you a good time...when you're a good rider he'll push you to do more and for those who cannot ride he is very patient. Fernando's instructions are very clear and this is just the best way to enjoy a sportive day just outside Buenos Aires! I would say: " ¡just do it!" I know for sure that whenever i am in Buenos Aires, I will be playing polo with Fernando again!!

Authentic Argentine Experience. If you're looking for a unique authentic Argentine experience - this is it! Fernando (owner & operator) is an experienced Polo player and an excellent teacher, who is extremely considerate of all levels of skill ... or non-skill! :) We thoroughly enjoyed our day in the beautiful Argentine countryside learning about and actually playing the 'sport of kings'. Thanks Fernando for an unforgettable afternoon!

A must do while in Argentina. You can't go to AR without at least watching a polo match. Even better--play one for yourself! Fernando picked us up in BA and brought us out to the country where we were given all the tools needed to play--including an amazing, well trained and friendly horse. We learned the basics, practiced some and played a match at the end. Great fun! No riding experience needed. Definitely a high highlight of our Argentina trip!

amazing all day sports activity. I can highly recommend this service for who ever wants to take some polo lessons. Fernando really takes the time to explain how to ride and play. The best part is the polo "game" we got to play at the end. He dropped us off at the airport afterwards as it was our last day. Very convenient as the range is close to EZEIZA aeropuerto.

Brilliant host, perfect atmosphere, great sport!. During my 10 day trip in Buenos Aires I absolutely wanted to watch a polo match - luckily for me I managed to find Polo Elite. Fernando did a great job from start to finish, discussing different aspects of the sport, looking at the 10 horses he uses for polo, meeting the over-excited stable dogs, and giving some commentary after his own match when we were watching the tournament final. Overall a great experience and a great day out where we even got to socialise a bit after the day's matches to truly take in the polo atmosphere. Fernando's passion for the sport is clear and he's a great person to get in touch with for almost anything polo-related!

One of the highlights of our time in South America!!!. We had a great time on our polo excursion!!! Even though we had relatively little experience with horses, we were quickly able to ride and even hit the ball consistently thanks to Fernando's guidance and training. The hours flew by and we were sad that the afternoon came to an end. I highly suggest you sign up for this if you are considering it...don't worry about the weather or your skill on a horse...just do it!

Fernando is great. Great way to spend an afternoon away from the city and learn about Polo. Although it was my first time on a horse Fernando really helps people of all skill levels learn. Just remember to bring bug spray the mosquitoes can be bad if you don't.

Great time at polo match. Even with the rain coming down, we had a great time at our first polo match. Fernando is very knowledgeable and can answer questions on both polo and Argentina. If it's the first match you've attended, you won't regret joining this tour.

Best way to start!. After moving to Buenos Aires and as a horse lover, I just had to try polo! Polo Elite was the only option I could find that offered lessons in English, with little commitment required...it's not a touristy estancia experience, but a great "crash course" if you only have a day and cant learn polo over a week! The instruction was simple and clear, the horses great and you meet wonderful other travelers! Since my first day with Polo Elite, I've ridden with Fernando numerous times after that day, and can now boast that I play polo! I'm still a novice, but polo is in my blood and Polo Elite put it there!!

Polo fun. We had a blast learning to play polo with Fernando. The day was organized well and Fernando and the other instructors did a fantastic job in teaching us. They had a lot of patience! HIghly recommended and would totally do this again if I ever get back to Buenos Aires.

A great Polo 101 session. Fernando was a great instructor. Patient teacher and genuinely passionate about the sport. I simply wanted a sneak preview into the sport and this is a great way to do it. I would recommend this to anyone.

A great and truly unique experience...even in winter!. Fernando was an excellent host and instructor. He genuinely wants you to learn how to ride a horse and play polo! He took care of the whole day for us. Best thing we did in Argentina.

Amazing experience. Best day of the trip so far! Such a good experience. Fernando is a great instructor who made the day really fun. Now thinking of taking up polo back at home. Definitely recommend it to anyone.

Highlight of the trip. While doing some research for a trip to BA and knowing that Argentina was known for its Polo, I was curious if any places around the city offered lessons. In all honesty I didn't really expect to find anything or if I did it would be on the expensive side. I was very pleased to come across Fernando and Polo Elite and couldn't have made a better choice. Not only was it extremely affordable, Fernando offers an unbelievable experience for someone like myself with basic horse riding experience and for my girlfriend who had never been on one before. Not only was the actual playing experience great, everything about being out at the ranch and seeing a different side of Argentina was perfect after spending the previous 4 days in the city. While BA was great, the best part of the trip for me was meeting Fernando and getting to learn more about Polo. As soon as I got back to NJ I started looking for local Polo clubs to take more lessons. If anyone is considering booking some time with Polo Elite I couldn't recommend it more, you will not be disappointed.

You HAVE to try it!. This was one of my favorite activities from our trip to Buenos Aires! None of us were expert riders and we all felt safe and had fun. We learned a lot too. Definitely would recommend it to any one going- and would do it again !

Awesome experience!. This was a great experience! I was in a group of 4, 2 with riding experience and 2 beginners. I have riding experience and Fernando did a great job of explaining the game and getting everyone comfortable with the horses. We started the day going through the techniques of playing polo then played a few games. We even watched a amateur match after. Fernando was very professional and explained everything, it was a safe way to experience polo and a ton of fun!

Once in a lifetime experience!!!!. My friends and I spent a day with Fernando and Polo Elite while studying in Buenos Aires. Fernando was very professional and spent time showing us everything about riding horses and the sport of Polo.I spent 6 weeks in South America and this was by far the most fun I had! I recommend Fernando and his team without any reservations. Viva Polo!

Best day ever. My sister, who lives in Buenos Aires, decided to bring us there for a day of polo learning. As complete beginners, we were very excited but scared at the same time. Thanks to Fernando, however, we were instantly familiarized with the techniques and therefore the safety of polo playing. It was a really fun experience and I would strongly recommend it to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!
A very good experience!. It was a pleasant day, a lot of action and a lot of laugth. The trainer was very nice with us despite our skills.

Best Possible Experience. Our group of 5 had very minimal riding experience and had the best time. We warmed up on the horses, had the game explained to us, practiced using the mallets and techniques before ejoying a lovely picnic and a real Match. Fernando and his crew could not have been any nicer or helpful and we all had an absolutely terrific time! Hope this helps and happy riding!
Learn polo from scratch by a great staff. This is a small outfit that is able to give excellent one on one attention. We learned the fundamentals and left with an appreciation of the sport.

Great Polo Experience. This is a "must do" experience in Buenos Aires. Even though Fernando was out of the country, his father picked us up at our hotel, and his friend, Andres', was our instructor. He, too, is an experienced rider and polo player and was very patient with us getting used to the horses and trying to learn to play. We got lucky and were the only two taking a lesson at that time so we basically got private lesson. At our request, Andres' showed us how polo is played by the experts and he's awesome! This is truly a real, working ranch (I'm a native Texan) and not a touristy place. The gauchos were all friendly and very welcoming even though we knew very little Spanish. We also had a great time sharing mate' and cookies with Victor, our gaucho. When in Buenos Aires, this is something everyone must try once!

besides eating a steak, there is nothing else you should do than play polo. Fernando is great. We loved, loved, loved our time playing polo. He was accomadating and fun to work with. Polite and a real small business upstart. I would recommend him to anyone and everyone. Even people who had not riden a horse, felt comfortable after a little bit. Well done!

An Amazing Experience Horsing Around!. For anyone thinking about planning a lesson with Polo Elite and Fernando, our recommendation would be to go ahead and book it. After reading many favorable reviews on Trip Advisor, my friends and I on a recent visit to Buenos Aires decided to book a lesson with Polo Elite. We sent an enquiry via their website and immediately received a prompt and courteous reply. All in all, the whole booking process was handled professionally and efficiently, including the arrangements for our pick up and transportation to the ranch.The actual day learning to play polo was, simply put, great fun and a wonderful experience. We found Fernando to be a friendly, patient and encouraging instructor who went out of his way to make sure that we had a fantastic day. Polo Elite’s horses are also well mannered and a real pleasure to ride. In case you are wondering, the horses are suitable for both experienced riders and beginners. As such, we would like to extend a big thank you to Fernando and Polo Elite for an exceptional day. On a side note, it was also great to get out of the city and to see a different side of Buenos Aires and the surrounding area. Needless to say, we would have no hesitation in recommending Polo Elite to anyone who is contemplating booking a polo lesson in Buenos Aires. You will not be disappointed!

A fantastic day out near Buenos Aires. I had an absolutely awesome time here on the last day of my trip to South America in Feb 2013. Right from the first email Fernando was friendly, responsive and helpful, and this continued when we were picked up from the centre of BA and driven out to the countryside. Most of us had only minimal experience of horse riding but Fernando explained everything very clearly (in excellent English) and by the end of the day we were able to play a game of polo together. It was a pleasure to see how well the horses are bred and looked after - they're used for polo tournaments (in which Fernando plays with his team) throughout the summer. While Fernando's skill is clear, he's also a great teacher who divides his time between everyone but recognises when someone needs a bit more attention, whilst always keeping it fun and lighthearted. I had an absolutely brilliant time, this is a definite "must do" while in Buenos Aires!

Unforgettable and memorable. My boyfriend and I were in BA at the end of April 2013, and spent a day with Fernando. It was one of the best days of our trip. We made the appointment via emails, Fernando was very responsive throughout. He picked us up from a designated meeting point and drove out to the polo club. It was really enjoyable watching Fernando pick out the horses we were going to play with, and he let me brush them and get to know them before we played. My partner has never ridden a horse before but he was riding and hitting the ball by the end of the day. Fernando was a very patient and positive teacher, and very knowledgeable and passionate about polo. He kindly dropped us off at a famous parilla restaurant in San Telmo at the end of the day, and recommended some traditional dishes to order (that provoleta was yummy!). Our polo day with Fernando was a very genuine experience, we had a wonderful time.

A must do!!!. We had an awesome time and were able to play a match of polo by the end of the day. We had a friend in our group who had never ridden a horse before and she was playing in the match with the rest of us, by the end. Everyone was incredibly nice and it was an absolute blast.

A must do while in Buenos Aires. We had a fantastic day with Fernando. I would certainly recomend anyone travelling to Buenos Airies booking this trip. I am no horse rider but with Fernandos horses and his paitence I certainly got to experience the game of polo

Excellence. One of the best holiday experiences ever!! :)Fernando was an excellent teacher to my friend and I. His beautiful and agile horses were a dream to ride. And after we were clearly shown the rules of Polo we enjoyed an action packed thrilling game of Polo!!It was the best fun ever!!Anyone who visits BA should have Polo Elite number one on their list. The memory will stay with you forever, beautiful horses, excellent facilities, superb teacher and the best fun!! :)

Polo Elite - Watch or Play Polo in Buenos Aires. My wife and I had our first polo experience with Fernando in February 2012. He drove us out to the polo facility where we had a lesson, did some drills and played a quick match. I'm a beginner when it comes to horses, but I still had a great time. My wife is an experienced rider, and Fernando did a great job to accommodate the variety of skill levels, making it fun for everyone. Fernando's english is excellent and his teaching style is encouraging and positive. Everyone learned a lot about the game and basic horsemanship! The next time we were in BA in February/March 2013 Fernando took us and our friends to see a match in Palermo. We were able to see an insiders view of the polo scene - arriving before the game to see players and ponies warming up and staying after the game to enjoy a beer with some of the players! Lots of great action to see and Fernando was able to answer all our questions as none of us really knew the rules ...Thanks Polo Elite for some fantastic memories in BA!

Fantastic fun!!. My friends and I, had the most amazing polo experience with Fernando earlier this year. We were picked up from our hotel and driven firstly to watch a practice match. What a skillful game! Then it was our turn. Our skills were nil, but with Fernando and his beautifully trained horses, we had fun and laughs and scored a goal or 2. You trully forgot that you were on a horse, and genuinlly got into trying to hitting that ball. No experience needed. Fernando teaches you the basics of the sport and the game tactics. All in all the day was exciting, fun and a good laugh. A perfect activity in Buenos Aires.

Unique fun experience in BA. I spent the day playing polo with Fernando and four of my friends. It was an awesome day and highlight of our trip! We had watched polo on tv but never payed and Fernando made it easy and a lot of fun! Those of us who have only rode horses a bit and those who have rode a lot all had a blast. I highly recommend this to everyone!

An ABSOLUTE MUST while in Buenos Aires!!!. Playing a polo match was hands down the best part of our time in Buenos Aires and cannot recommend it enough! Even though we ran late, Fernando was more than accommodating and our time with him was a pleasure.
