After the beautiful drive to the fields, we received a brief, but thorough riding lesson, got mounted up and headed out to the fields. The first part of the day is dedicated to learning how to use the mallet and hit the ball both forehand and reverse. Its a blast being out in the fields atop an incredible horse riding up and down the field learning how to play such an incredible sport. After a break for lunch, its time to play an actual match against the other riders, which was the true highlight. Fernando teaches you the rules and how to defend (TOTALLY different than you'd expect) and then you're off. You could never have such freedom to throw someone on a horse and go at it in the US, but it's totally safe, well run and an experience not to be missed. We had 4 days in BA so plenty of time, but if I only had one day in BA, I would skip the city, the tango lessons, etc. and go out with Polo Elite!!!

Wow!. My husband and I LOVED our polo experience last month in Buenos Aires -- Fernando was a great host -- met us promptly at the convenient central location and we were off to the beautiful countryside. The polo club grounds were immaculate; we helped prep our horses and learned a bit about the history of the game and then headed out to the field to give it our own try -- we did not have a lot of previous experience but Fernando was patient and helpful -- and I think the horses knew how to help us too :) -- It was a blast! This is a perfect break from the hectic BsAs city hustle -- quiet countryside, horses and some activity outdoors was the perfect compliment to our city bustling.

Excellent polo lesson + fun game!. My friends and I (6 total) took a polo lesson with Fernando at Polo Elite a few weeks ago, and it is one of the most fun, interesting, and distinctive activities I have done in Buenos Aires.. and I've been in Buenos Aires for ~2 months at that point!Fernando was a patient and solid coach, explaining the basics of horseriding, polo rules, and game tactics. Obviously none of us mastered the game in a day (duhhh!) but it was an incredibly rewarding and fun time for all of us!Highly recommend Fernando and Polo Elite for anyone considering taking some lessons!

An experience not to be missed!. My friend, my daughter and I were visiting Argentina from Hong Kong for a riding holiday in the Andes and had contacted Polo Elite as we had read excellent reviews on Trip Advisor - we were not disappointed. From the start, Fernando was prompt, informative and very helpful and friendly when replying to our questions since even though we are regular riders this was our first polo experience. The day before our lesson Fernando contacted us to let us know that as it had been raining heavily the day before he could not guarantee that the lesson would go ahead as the ground might not be suitable – Fernando’s priority at all times is for the safety of the rider and the ponies. At the same time however he was conscious of the fact that we had only one day in BA and no time to reschedule and it was clear that he was doing his best to make sure everything worked out for us and that we didn’t miss out on this experience as we had travelled so far.The following day we decided that we would drive to the ranch and Fernando would check the pitch first to see if it was safe. He picked us up promptly in the city and we had an enjoyable drive out to the ranch which is about an hour outside of BA. It was obvious that Fernando is very knowledgeable about the polo world and polo ponies and very entertaining at the same time. After an interesting tour of the stables, we luckily managed to fit in a 45 minute lesson before it started to rain heavily again. Even in the short space of time Fernando gave us an excellent feel of polo. He was patient and very clear in his instructions and took particular care of my 11 year old daughter to make sure that she was safe but still having fun. The ponies were responsive, very well trained and cared for and equally as patient – even when I kept accidently hitting the back of my pony’s legs (and her nose once) with the mallet she didn’t flinch or get annoyed once!Despite not having chance to play a match due to the rain, we still had an excellent afternoon and can highly recommend Polo Elite and Fernando as an experience not to be missed whatever your level of riding ability. It is definitely something we would do again if we are ever in BA.
Awesome polo experience!. I had an awesome time taking polo lessons with Fernando! He was a great instructor for all levels, I ended up taking three lessons because I liked it so much!

Best part of my trip to BA!. My husband and I visited BA in February. I decided to reserve a day so we could learn to play polo. My husband had never been on a horse before. I communicated with Fernando a couple of months before our trip. He was very helpful and responsive. We met Fernando outside a bar in BA with another couple from the states. He drove us to the farm wherein we tried on helmets and tried out polo clubs, then, it was time to play polo! The horses were saddled and ready to go. We did an hour or so of instruction, ate lunch at the clubhouse then got down to playing some matches. Hands down, one of the best times we've ever had! Fernando was an excellent instructor and so much fun. He is very knowledgeable, courteous and funny. My husband loved it! After playing, he drove us back to the city. I wish I had reserved another day of polo before we left BA. Truly a memorable experience and I would do it again in a heartbeat!

Playing Polo!. I contacted Fernando (from Polo Elite) through his website, which I found by Googling "polo lessons in Buenos Aires". My boyfriend and I were down in Argentina for vacation, and both of us wanted to play a little polo while down there. Fernando gave me a quick and informative response to my query about private lessons, and from that point on, was very helpful and very, very nice. I put a deposit down for the lessons via Xoom, and secured a spot for both my boyfriend and I. The day before our lessons were scheduled, Fernando contacted me and let me know that due to rain, the polo lessons would be limited, and if I'd like to change dates to get the full lesson on a dry polo field? I said yes, since I used to ride hunter/jumpers professionally and really wanted to be able to gallop, run and do all that on my polo pony. He was very VERY helpful in rearranging his schedule to accommodate us, and even though it was his birthday he STILL took the time to teach us, since we were leaving soon and didn't have another day to wait!The lessons were amazing, the horses were high quality, and so was the tack. The ponies were fell fed, in good condition, and cared for with an obviously loving hand. Fernando was a great instructor, his English was very good, and provided us with water and transport to and from our rental apartment in the city. In addition, he also gave some great recommendations for local tack stores and even offered to go get the items we needed for us! All in all, a great experience and I would DEFINITELY do it again! As someone who rode horses professionally for many years, I was very pleased with Fernando's professionalism and his care of his tack and polo ponies. I'm rather picky when it comes to riding and I don't want to be stuck on a beginner's "old nag" that is old and not energetic, and I don't like having instructors treat me like I am a beginner. Fernando didn't do this at all, and was very accommodating and let me run around and chase balls on a very fit and energetic, well trained horse. My boyfriend, who is a beginner, was also accommodate to his skill level, so it's nice to know that Fernando can accommodate everyone, from every skill level, with ease and professionalism.He also took photos of us while riding, and sent them very quickly to us after the polo lesson! :) That was so helpful, because my boyfriend and I didn't get many shots of each other since we were having so much fun playing polo! If you are looking for a polo instructor, no matter what your skill level with riding, please pick Polo Elite and Fernando--great guy, great stables, great lessons!!

One of the highlights of Buenos Aires. This program is amazing for so many reasons - the polo grounds are immaculately kept, the horses are super responsive and well trained and of course Fernando is a fun, friendly, patient and passionate teacher of the craft. On top of all that, Fernando goes above and beyond the call of duty to make sure you enjoy not only your day with him, but also the rest of your time in Buenos Aires by giving helpful advice on things to do and see in the city. Moreover, by answering any and all questions you may have about the sport, the city, the country and his life in general, Fernando gives you a deeper and more genuine understanding of the psyche of the Argentinian people which you just won't get from reading the guidebooks.

A ton of fun!. Fernando goes out of his way to make sure you enjoy yourself. This was one of the best events we did in B.A. Probably going to cost me much more though now that the wife has discovered polo. Thanks for that Fernando.

Awesome Experience!. Being raised on horses, I always get suckered into some trail ride or round up on my trips. This was by far the best horse experience and in my top five for excursions. Fernando is an excellent trainer who showed that he was able to work with each rider's abilities. It was a ton of fun and I highly recommend it for the trained riders as well as the novices!

Unique and Fun!. This program is awesome because of Fernando. He is really friendly and funny and is a great, very patient teacher. The day first started with a very prompt pick-up at a meeting point very close to our hotel. After an hour drive, we got our equipment and Fernando then showed us how to control the horses - all his and all very well trained. He gave our group of 4 very clear instructions and demonstrated the techniques. We were given time to try things out on our own, though he always kept an eye on us and provided tips whenever one of us struggled. One member of our group had prior riding experience so he tailored his instructions so she would also enjoy and learn from the outing. We then learned how to hit the ball and, once we mastered that, we learned a few defensive moves. After we were comfortable with the basic skills, he taught us the rules of the polo and we played a match! It may have only vaguely resembled the professional match that we watched afterwards, but it was still so much fun! After the program, Fernando was kind enough to arrange for us to be driven directly to the airport as we had a flight to catch. It was a wonderful privilege to learn how to play polo from Fernando, especially since my husband and I have only ridden a horse once before. You can tell he's had plenty of experience teaching beginners and his passion for the game is infectious. This is the ideal way to spend a day away from the city!

One of the BEST experiences in Argentina. I was traveling with my family and friends in Argentina for about a month and Polo Elite was absolutely one of my favourite days! Fernando, a professional polo player, was a generous and amazing host for the day who spoke perfect English. Fernando was able to cater to everyone's very different riding abilities. I love horse riding and ride weekly at home in Australia. As an experienced rider, I really appreciated how Fernando got into the polo lesson straight away and allowed me to go at a faster pace than others (like my dad) who had not had much riding experience. Fernando uses his own professional polo horses for the lessons and they are all amazingly well trained. I felt very privileged to be allowed to ride them! It was a really fun day and my whole family really enjoyed it. I made some great friends from this experience too. I highly recommend Polo Elite as a must-do in Argentina. Thanks so much, Fer! :)

Polo Elite. this was one of the most fantastic experiences of Argentinathe afternoon learning polo with a professional player with his own array of horsescongratulations Fer on a fantastic programit was real value for money

Afternoon with Fernando. The whole Polo experience was fantastic! The pick-up by Fernando went smoothly and the drive to the Polo farm went by in no time! Fernando was very friendly and happily answered all our burning questions regarding Polo. Once we got to the farm Fernando gave us a short lesson on how to ride a horse one-handed and how to control it. We then hopped onto one of his horses and rode to the Polo pitch. There we practised what we have just been taught. His horses were extremely well-behaved and easy to ride, which was great! We then learnt how to hold a mallet and how to hit the ball without hitting the horses ;-) It was all very enjoyable and Fernando was very patient with us. After a nice break with a refreshing, cold drink, Fernando explained to us the rules of Polo, after which we played a proper game! It was a lot of fun :-) Polo Elite is definitely recommendable!

A great day, the highlight of my Buenos Aires trip. I had a great day learning to play polo with Fernando. He has a good selection of horses available for riders of all levels. I was surprised to find myself able to play a proper chucca by the end of the day.I'm now looking forward to visiting again on my next trip to BA.Highly recommended, great value and a truly memorable day.

A wonderful day - an incredible experience. Learning playing Polo with Fernando was a great experience and a super trip in Buenos Aires!He picked me and the others up in Buenos Aires and he was from the beginning like a friend - a really good atmosphere to get introduced to Polo.After getting some hints to ride the polohorses and how to hit the Ball and a lot of time to train these things we also played polo.And that was really stunning!Playing polo is so much fun!And when do you have the oportunity to witness such an experience?

The highlight of our trip!. Fernando is the supreme host. He is thoughtful, organised and incredibly efficient as well as being a top class instructor of polo, even for intrepid horse shy guests who end up loving horses and the game of polo! This has got to be the best money spent on family entertainment we have ever experienced. We would recommend Fernando's polo sessions to any one nterested in experiencing a unique part of Argentinia 's sporting tradition and the beautiful countryside.Annette Fontana, Australia

Such a great experience, a day to remember!!. One of the best things we did in south america! It was all organised through our hostel millhouse. All of us were inexperienced riders, but Fernando's instructions make you feel very confident and reassured. The horses are all really calm and there are great photo opportunities! Drop off and pick up are all in a convenient place in the city. All in all had a great day!

Escape from BA. Everything went smoothly with the day, with a prompt pickup and very organised lessons. Definitely a great experience to be on a horse (even with zero experience) and great country surroundings. We even managed to catch a game of polo in the next field by locals and professionals! Fernando went above the call of duty and dropped us off in a different location in the city for an appointment. Be prepared to buy/bring plenty of drink and food however as it isn't provided.

Fun and interesting experience!. Excellent day out, we really enjoyed the polo session - Fernando is a great teacher and ambassador for the sport (apart from also being single and very eligible of course!) - even though he'd injured his hand (and only found out the next day that there was a fracture!) he still did his best with us. I highly recommend this experience.

Wonderful experience at polo elite!. Fernando was an exceptional teacher...My wife and I had only been on a horse once, so we were pretty apprehensive about taking a polo lesson...Fernando did a great job of making us feel comfortable and confident with the horses...The grounds were beautiful and the overall experience was one that we will never forget!

Polo Elite. After reading the fabulous reviews on Trip Advisor, I decided to book a polo excursion with Polo Elite. I hadn't ridden a horse since high school and my 22 year old son has never ridden. As it was our first trip to Argentina, I found it only fitting to try polo out. Fernando is a classy, sweet, polite, patient and professional guy and our day with him was FANTASTIC! He picked us up with his modern, spacious van and dropped us back off at the end of our day, to a convenient location in the city of Buenos Aires. (He is a very safe driver!) He taught us how to ride/control a horse and made us feel very comfortable. Then, he taught us how to properly hold a polo mallet and how to hit the ball. What fun we had, trying!! Fernando rode along with us and kept a close eye on everyone in our group, giving us individual and group tips all along the way. It's very exciting to (once in a while) get it right and when you do, you can "feel" it, after a little bit of practice. :) When we played a game with Fernando and the others that were in our group, we had SO MUCH FUN!! I didn't want the day on that BEAUTIFUL horse farm, to ever end. If you get the chance to spend the day with Fernando and his horses, I promise that it will be a most memorable experience.

Great all day fun. Had a wonderful day with Fernando and my friends learning about Polo. It was great to get out of the city of Buenos Aires and see the countryside. The ranch was beautiful. Fernando has a warm and inviting personality and is fun to be around. He is passionate about the sport of Polo and wants you to learn how to play but very patient with those who have not much experience on horseback. I would definitely recommend the experience.

Highlight of our time in Buenos Aires. Our group had a great day with Fernando and Polo Elite--truly the highlight of our time in Buenos Aires and one of our favorite events of a month-long trip throughout Argentina and Uruguay. None of our group had much experience on horseback going in, yet Fernando had us playing a full game by the end of the day! He follows a logical progression of teaching participants how to control the horses (how to speed up, stop and turn in different directions), how to strike the ball, and later, goes through team formations and game dynamics when the group is ready. Couldn't recommend the experience more highly. Thanks Fernando!

Must do while in Buenos Aires!. This was a highlight during our trip. Fernando is a great instructer and very helpful. He was very patient and very much strove to ensure that we were all enjoying ourselves. The ranch itself is gorgeous and it was nice to see the countryside outside of the city. I had never ridden a horse before so I was quite curious to see how that would go with polo lessons but the horses were great and very obedient. They are professional polo horses so they are comfortable with people and with the game itself. We even got to play a match at the end of the day and I can now say that I've beat my boyfriend in a game of polo:)

Highlight of our trip!. Playing polo with Fernando in the beautiful suburbs of Buenos Aires was the highlight of our 3-week trip in Argentina and Uruguay! I highly recommend it to any beginner. Ferdinand's effective teaching style enables aspiring polo players to go from never having ridden a horse to playing in a small-sided polo match. Each exercise builds upon the previous one, and he encourages each player to improve over the course of the lesson.

Our Best Day in BA. Had such a great day with Polo Elite. Fernando was a brilliant instructor. He had such patience and made it so much fun. Most of had barely been on a horse, let alone played polo, yet by the end we were playing a match! It was one of the best things we did in Buenos Aires and I couldn't recommend it more highly.

A great learning experience!. My husband & I had the pleasure of setting up a lovely afternoon lesson of polo with Fernando. We are both inexperienced riders & knew little about the sport. Not only is Fernando's passion for the sport contagious, but he ensures that he matches you up with one of his horses that match your temperament & skill. I road Cumparsita, who is named after one of the most famous tango songs, she made it easy for me. The drive out to the farm was about 45min & we learned so much from Fernando including all about polo & the Argentinean culture. The farm is beautiful & the lesson a lot of fun. We would highly recommend Polo Elite to anyone going to BsAs. Thank you Fernando for such a great experience.

Amazing once-in-a-lifetime experience. If you're ever in Buenos Aires, make sure this is at the top of your list of "must dos." It was one of the highlights of our trip and everyone (including three tween/teens) thoroughly enjoyed every moment. Fernando is the consummate professional, exhibiting keen organizational and communication skills from initial booking through confirmations and transportation. There was never any doubt that he would make sure we were safe and well taken care of, from pickup to drop off. Playing polo in Argentina is something you'll never forget so take the opportunity to get on your horse, listen carefully to his detailed instructions and then enjoy the rest of the day. Exciting, fun, memorable, amazing... All of those and more.

One of the highlights of our BA trip. * Fernando is an excellent teacher and he is really engaged, he will try to really teach you* Great event for a group of friends; we spent 5 days in Buenos Aires and this was one of our highlights* Activity fits well within schedule i.e. you can sleep in and then you will be back in time for dinner* Horses are very calm, so this can be done even if you are a total beginner and you have never been on a horse before* Beautiful setting of the range

Best Activity in Argentina. My friends and I were spending 5 days in BA and were trying to figure out what to do with our time there. A colleague recommended Polo Elite, and we instantly became excited about the opportunity. Fernando made it very easy to book our visit, and the transportation was great getting out to the farm. Once we got there, we were in awe of the beauty of the farm. Fernando was an incredible instructor, and taught our group all aspects of polo (how to ride the horse, how to hit the ball, the rules of the game, etc.) Some of the individuals in our group had never even been on a horse before, but Fernando's ability to provide both general advice to the group, as well as specific feedback for individuals, was incredible. In the end, we played some "matches" as the sun was setting. It was incredible experience never to be forgotten.

Once in a lifetime opportunity. Well taught, and an incredibly fun game that I previously knew nothing about. When else in your life will you have the opportunity to play Polo? Fernando is a passionate teacher and he has great, well trained and responsive horses. Stop wasting your time here and just do it already!

Great and unique experience in Buenos Aires. Polo lessons is not something you find everyday. So when my co-workers recommended it to me, my wife and I jumped at the chance to try something different while in Buenos Aires. I never would have thought I would ever play polo, but I was able to come home for Buenos Aires saying that I did. We had a great time with Fernando learning the details of the game and he also educated us about Argentina and Buenos Aires. I had never ridden a horse before, but that didn't make a difference and had a blast doing it for the first time. My wife and I had been in Buenos Aires for a few days and enjoyed getting out of the city for a while. The farm and country where the lessons take place is a gorgeous transition from the big city. We would definitely recommend taking an afternoon to learn polo and by the time you return to the city around 8pm, the night is still very young.

Great day, highlight of the trip so far in Argentina. Superb, we met up with Fernando at a planned location and he drove us out to the Estancia, my wife and 2 daughters took the lessons, he was very patient and explained at made sure they were all safe. Fernando explained all aspects of the game , from the horses (80% + mares) to the team and sponsors, the breeding and auctions. All together it was a very interesting and exciting day and Fernando was excellent, highly recommend.

Ready to go pro. Had a blast learning the rules and technique of polo - a game I knew virtually nothing about except what I saw in movies. Had a blast with my buddies, and Fernando is a relaxed and helpful teacher. The match against my friends at the end was the best part. My wrist and lower back were pretty dang sore after the day of playing, but I completely recommend this activity as something fun and different to do if visiting Buenos Aires.

In polo position.... Even with the amazing reviews we'd seen and heard, our expectations were exceeded completely. Fernando is an engaging and professional instructor who clearly has a passion for polo. Despite my limited experience with horses, he was great in giving a clear introduction to the sport, and very patiently provided tips and advice on techniques so we could make the most of the experience.A fantastic afternoon, and a must for anyone visiting Buenos Aires - I can't wait to go back.

Highlight of our holiday!. This really was one of the highlights of our trip to Argentina! The afternoon was great fun, very professionally organised, and Fernando was a patient and encouraging instructor, answering all our many questions in flawless English. It was fantastic to get out of the city and see a real polo farm first hand, and it gave a brilliant taster for what polo is all about. Couldn't have asked for more, and I will definitely be returning...Imogen Harvey, UK

Great teacher & Fun experience. Never played polo before and had very little horse experience, Fernando was very helpful, sets you up with well trained horses, and teaches you in a slow enough manner to understand what your trying to do and still have a fun time. Nice way to get out of the city for an afternoon. Would defintely do it again.

Great escape from Buenos Aires!. Spent a Sunday afternoon with Fernando and a couple other guys from the US/Australia learning to play polo. Was a great way to get out of the city and into the country and learn something new. Was definitely a challenge learning to play but Fernando did a good job explaining and was very personable (and he's fluent in English). I highly recommend if you're looking to do something different than the norm and away from the city. Who else can say they learned to play polo in Argentina?!

Perfect!. Loved everything about this adventure. The horses were appropriate for everyone's riding ability (or lack thereof!) and it moved at a good pace. Good to get out of the city and Fernando was both funny and encouraging - and happy to take pictures. Met a fun group of people. Highly recommended!

Great host & great polo experience. I was looking for a taste of this amazing sport and that's just what I got. Fernando (the pro polo player and guide for the day) picked the group up at the corner of Lima and chile and took us to the hacienda an hour away. His english is great, he's genuinely interested in getting to know his 'pupils', tries to accommodate where possible, with one to one tuition if necessary. Safety is priority but he also wants you to have fun. First we got shown around the hacienda, met the horses, given tips and then we were on the horse and having a go. Be warned, don't expect to be galloping everywhere, not only does it make it harder to hit the ball but unless all the horses are galloping they are all likely to just walk. If you are a beginner rider its ideal but if you are a bit more advanced they simply won't budge more than a trot because their pals aren't doing the effort so why should they! The weather was great, we finished the couple of hours on horses with a few 'matches', 2 against 2 which was entertaining. Then we went to watch Fernando play with his team a full match against a rival team. This was fascinating, especially as during the breaks he would come over and explain things/have a chat. Makes it special and more personal than just watching a polo match from the stands. The day started at 10:30, and got back by 8pm ish. Food is not provided so bring a sandwich + water or you could get it from the village on route. Hope this helps, have fun. Fred

Highly recommend. I would really recommend this as something different to do in Buenos Aires. It's great to get out of the city and see a more rural area. I also learnt so much about polo. There was a group of us (3 girls) and all different levels of riding ability (or not!!) and the class was very tailored to suit us. We laughed all day and am really glad we did this as a different option

Great intro to a fun sport!. Fernando at Polo Elite gave us a patient and humorous first exposure to playing polo.He was on time at the meeting spot, his van was clean and well maintained, and he spoke excellent English.At the estancia, we got a good introduction to the horses and the fundamentals of polo. Luckily, the horses were as patient as Fernando. We ran through the basics for an hour or so. Took a 30 minute break to rehydrate and snack, then we played a little scrimmage and truly got a sense of the game. Throughout, Fernando was encouraging and funny.We loved every minute of it!Highly recommend pairing this with attending a polo match, just to see how easy those players make this very difficult sport look!Recommendations: Bring some food, bring extra water bottles and bring some bug spray!

Can't believe we're the first people to give this a dud review!. This was by far the worst experience we had on our South American holiday. Admittedly, the weather was conspiring against the activity. On the way out to polo, our host Fernando did not talk to us and when we arrived nothing was prepared, so we had to wait about half an hour while they got the horses set up. Sure enough, the ominous clouds opened up after about an hour of actual polo, calling an end to the day. Fernando would not drop us back at the hotel even though we were the only 2 on the day, instead dropping us in the city, leaving us to get a cab. We had to pay full price for only an hour of polo, which was not cheap. Was really looking forward to the day after all the great reviews on trip advisor, extremely disappointed.

Amazing experience and great customer service!. I visited poloelite earlier this year with a friend of mine. Throughout the booking process Fernando was extremely helpful and accommodating, showing flexibility when our plans changed. Having never ridden a horse before he quickly went over the basics and was really helpful. It was also fantastic to have a non tourist/gimmicky trip to an Estancia. Thoroughly enjoyed the day and would recommend as a must to anyone visiting BA!

Best activity you can do in Argentina or anywhere!. First of all Fernando is such a fun, nice, and professional person. He spoke English so well too, I think he was the best in Argentina. I had such a great time learning and playing Polo that I am looking into learning more in the US. Fernando was able to teach us the game, how to ride a horse, and play a game all within a few hours. He has some serious skills!

How many people can say they've played polo?. We can! There were four of us who spent the day with Fernando at Polo Elite. Fernando obviously loves his sport, but equally loves showing neophytes how to play. We had to remind ourselves to slow down and not get ahead of ourselves; a common American problem. But after "mastering" control of the horse, our mini polo game was just like the World Polo Championship--only 20 times slower. It was great fun and I would recommend it to anyone visiting the area. We felt like we were saying goodbye to an old friend when Fernando dropped us off.

Fantastic. What a day! Nice break to get out of the city, breath some fresh air, and have a unique experience. There were 4 of us and none of us had been on a horse. Fernando was great. While our game may have been the slowest game in the history of the sport for us, thankfully, we had a great time. What I got out of the day was a true understanding and appreciation of the sport. Thank you Fernando for your patience and professionalism.
Very Argentinian. Worth the cost to experience the sport of the rich and famous. Easy drive and and enjoyable to be away from the craziness of the city and in a more relaxing environment.

Best Afternoon Ever! Polo Elite!. We had an amazing experience with Fernando at Polo Elite right outside of Buenos Aires Labor Day WE 2012. He picked us up right from the hotel, drove us outside of the city, and spent a generous amount of the day with us in a perfect setting! The farm was huge, the facilities were very clean and safe we got to play polo! Super affordable and the memory of getting a private polo lesson in Argentina is worth every single penny! This was by far the highlight of our trip and I would highly highly recommend this to anyone that's headed that way

wonderful experience!. My sister and her friend visited me since I have been living in Argentina for the past 6 months. I have heard from several people that the typical Estancia can be a complete tourist trip. I chose to go a different route and take them to Polo Elite- for a day filled of fun horseback riding, and learning how to play polo. The experience exceeded all expectations. Fernando was wonderful, patient, fun and excited to share his knowledge with us. Even though none of us had ever played polo before he made it very comfortable for all of us. If I have any other future visitors, I will be sure to share this experience with them.

#1 thing to do in Agrentina!!!. We absolutely loved the Polo Lessons by Polo Elite! Fernando was amazing! The farm is located 1 hour away from Buenos Aires, the ride was in a comfortable van with nice Polo International magazines. It was raining a day before, but the field was still in a good condition.This sport is a bit pricey, but definately worth it!Highly recommended! A+++

Fantastic Experience in Buenos Aires!. I am so happy that I signed up for polo with Polo Elite! It was one of the best days I have had in Buenos Aires. Because I was traveling by myself, Fernando needed to work me in with another group. He invited me out to join two other Americans on one of the most beautiful days I have had since being in Argentina. The weather was fantastic and we enjoyed the drive talking and sharing stories. Once we arrived at the place, it was not long before we were on the horses taking instruction from Fernando. He is an excellent coach - very knowledgeable, encouraging, and an excellent rider. His horses are top-notch, as well - very well-mannered, beautiful, and athletic horses. After riding for awhile, we took a lunch break and watched Fernando school two of his other horses. It was so relaxing to sit under the trees on such a beautiful day. After lunch we played a match (boys vs. girls) and had a great time! One of the grooms was nice enough to take pictures of me while riding with my camera. I am so happy to have these pictures to remember such a wonderful day! I was sad to leave when the day was over. If I ever make it back to Argentina, I will definitely make another trip to Polo Elite! Make sure to book with Fernando if you want first-hand experience with a true Argentinian sport! You will have an amazing time!

Polo Paradise. They say a honeymoon is supposed to be filled with unforgettable experiences, and Polo Elite was without a doubt the highlight of our honeymoon. Not only was it a blast learning how to play polo for a day and then playing a match at the end, but the whole day was incredible, including a tour of the gorgeous estate and watching Fernando and the pros play a match during our break.  Both my husband and I are experienced riders but previous riding experience is not necessary (and it could even work against you at first as polo is very different from other equestrian sports). One could not ask for a better instructor for learning polo than Fernando - he is patient, funny, kind, encouraging and has a true passion for and knowledge of the sport. He also took photos and videos of us so you can always look back on the day with smiles, laughter and fond memories. This is a must-do activity while you're in Argentina; it is a truly authentic experience and it will be the most fun you'll have while you're there. You'll also be to appreciate this thrilling sport that much more once you've had first hand experience. We hope to return to Argentina and when we do, we plan on making it more a polo-focused trip and will without a doubt be returning to Polo Elite. Thanks Fernando for everything!

The Real Polo Experience!!!. We visited Buenos Aires for the first time last November and had an absolute amazing time out there, from checking out all of the little towns to different museums and gardens. We experienced the incredible nightlife and even went to a hostile, local futbol match! By far, however, the best thing we did there was take this Polo lesson at Polo Elite with Fernando. It was a laid back agenda where we first got to watch some advanced players play a match, then we got on our own horses to get comfortable with them. Then, we were given the polo sticks and taken through a crash course on the rules and strategies of the game. We practiced a few basic polo drills and then even played a small-sided match! It was so much fun. Fernando was very patient with all of us yet still encouraging. And for the ladies, he's extremely on the eyes. I had a difficult time getting my girlfriend to concentrate on the actual game! Anyway, I will lastly mention that its one thing to watch a professional polo match live. For someone who has never played the sport, it was a completely different experience to watch that match AFTER taking this lesson and developing much more of an appreciation for the amazing talent that these Polo players are. The place offers half a day and full day lessons. We did the Half day and it was plenty. I had so much fun, however, I could easily have done the full.

Lived up to the hype!. This was so fun, highlight of our trip! The horses are so well trained that my husband, who may never have ridden a horse before, was playing polo by the end of the lesson! Great fun.

A lasting memory. I love riding horses, but I must admit to being a little nervous about giving this sport a go. Nonetheless to Polo Elite I went for a half day, with Fernando taking the reins as our excellent instructor. I can honestly say it was one of the best experiences I've ever had in my life. To have control over your horse while smashing that little ball around the field is exhilarating, and a wonderful feeling when you start to get the hang of it. Fernando has an infectious passion for the game, highly skilled and with an envious horsemanship that I will one day maybe emulate. My only disappointment was just booking a half day. You need to do this. Your life depends on it. Get in that saddle.
This was a great time!!!. My wife and I had a blast learning about and playing polo with Fernando. This was one of the best experiences I have had on any vacation.

An Authentic Argentine Polo Experience. Taking a polo lesson with Polo Elite was an amazing experience. It's a great opportunity to do something that is authentically Argentine outside the Buenos Aires, perfect for Sundays when there isn't much going on in the city anyway. Four of us got picked up in the city by Fernando, who was very patient with us despite our lack of skill on a horse and knowledge of the sport. You can tell he is very passionate about the sport he makes his living from. He'll take you out in the morning to teach you technique, you break for lunch, then he teaches you the rules of the game before you play a match. A great day overall, and you truly learn an appreciation for the sport and why Argentina is so proud of their polo culture.

Don't miss this!. Yesterday my family of five adults spent the day in the countryside learning about polo. We knew nothing about horses and less about polo. This adventure was listed as the #1 thing to do while visiting Buenos Aires and after reading the rave reviews we decided to jump in. The reviews are accurate, this is the #1 thing to do in BA. Despite two of us being almost 60 without any horse experience Fernando had all of us on horseback, with helmets and mallets in hand. Fernando is a very, very good teacher, we could not have achieved this otherwise. This will be a lifetime memory that I will smile about for a longtime. Don't be reluctant to give Polo Elite a try as the drive in the country is worth the price alone. Many thanks, Fernando.

Recommended day. A fantastic day. Fernando provided a unique opportunity for people of ANY level of horsemanship to really play a game of polo. The horses were fantastic at their jobs and well cared for. I would definitely recommend this as a day out in BA.

Fernando is Awesome. Fernando is very professional and a wonderful instructor. We had several people in our group with little to no horse experience at all and we played an entire polo game without incident. From the time Fernando picked us up in the city, through the drive into the country, to getting us onto horses with instructions, polo rules, lunch, coffee and the drive back - it ended up being one of the best days we've spent here in Buenos Aires.

Fantastic Day with Fernando!. From the beginning, this was a great experience in Buenos Aires. Fernando was immediate in his response to my email with information on the excursion. He picked us up in Buenos Aires and we went out to the ranch. It's interesting to get out of the city, see some of the countryside, and a smaller town in Argentina as you head out to the ranch. The ranch is down a beautiful tree lined path. Lunch is up to you, you must plan, but Fernando stopped for us to pick up some food before we went to the ranch, so that is an option. We had both rode horses so we did not need that instruction so we got right to the lesson. Fernando was patient, answered all of our questions, and worked with us to make sure it was as fun of an experience as possible. When you get to play a game and the horses have to move faster and you jostle each other, that's when the real fun happens. I've never ridden such a quick agile horse and it's a fun challenge to try to run and hit the ball.We had a great time with Fernando and would highly recommend to anyone! Also if you go in the South American winter, make sure you bring warm enough layers because the winds across the fields can be chilly.

A must do in Argentina!. This is a wonderful excursion if you are staying in Buenos Aires! Fernando is amazing and explains everything very well. You can bring a picnic and have a day in the countryside. Just remember to wear warm clothes if you go in the winter. Highly recommended!!!!

excellent. from the moment Fernando picked us up from the center of BA to when he dropped us at our hotel everything went perfectly and could not have been better. fernando is a great instructor and he has a really brilliant selection of well trained horses suitable for all sorts of levels of rider. the location is beautiful and the experience is a once in a lifetime opportunity if you are a horse lover. this was without doubt the best day i had in argentina and continues to be an inspiring memory! thank you, fernando!

Great fun. Didn't know what to expect as I have only ridden a horse a couple of times but had a great day trying to get the hang of polo. Fernando is knowledgable, patient and good fun - would definitely recommend for a nice day out of the city.

Back in the saddle again. It has been nearly 25 years since I've been on a good polo pony with mallet in hand, so it was wonderful to discover Polo Elite on a recent trip to Buenos Aires. Fernando Nieto, the owner and instructor, is a great guy. Although he is relatively young to the game -- it's not unusual for Argentine kids to start swinging a mallet on horseback at age 6 -- Fernando is a knowledgeable and patient teacher who speaks English quite well, should that be a concern. He made it especially easy by picking us up in downtown BA for the 55km trip out to the estancia and back. All in all, it was a wonderful afternoon at exactly the level I was looking for after such a long lay-off. I hope to get back to BA in 2013 and will definitely book a couple more sessions at Polo Elite.
EXCELLENT EXPERIENCE. We had a great time with Fernando and learned a lot. HIGHLY recommended. It was so much fun we created a video here http://svfieldtrip.blogspot.com/2011/11/markopolo.html

Polo Elite. II was visiting BsAs doing some Argentine Tango and since I am a good horse rider and having play polo some time ago I made an appointment with Fernando it turns out that I had a great experience...Fernando knows the rules of POLO and was very helpful, in fact he spent extra time and was quite patience in explaining the intricacies of the Polo game. We had a lot of fun and took quite a few pictures.I highly recommend Fernando to anyone looking to learn POLO weather the person is a beginner or advance Thanks Fernando for a job well done!don Ricardo

a must do in buenos aires!. Fernando, the friendly and talented guy who provides polo lessons, has a great knowledge of polo and makes the process of learning how to play polo fun and interesting -- he provides useful tips, guidance, and demonstrations to facilitate teaching you how to play.this was definitely one of the top things I did in buenos aires -- the horses are in good condition, Fernando patiently teaches the essentials of Polo, and the setting is lovely (about an hour and a half outside of Rio). And its really fun!you learn the basics, and then get to try playing a real game of Polo. Really a great experience. Do it!

Amazing Experience. I had been to BA before, but I had never even thought of playing polo. However, after a few emails with Fernando, we were booked for a day of polo. I had never ridden a horse before, but that wasn't an issue at all. Within 15 min. of training, we were up on the horses and learning how to play polo. The scenery at the farm is beautiful and Fernando is a great instructor. If I am ever in BA again, I will be sure to go back to Polo Elite. If you are visitng BA, Polo elite is a must.

Best Day in Buenos Aires. I had come to Polo Elite for lessons in February and absolutely loved it. Fernando was a great instructor and very helpful with everything. It was one of my best experiences and because of that, when my parents came to visit me in June, I decided to take them to Polo Elite. I was a little worried because Fernando had switched locations, but this estancia was even more beautiful! The lesson was just as great this time and I learned a lot more even though I had already had one lesson before. I would recommend this for anyone, whether you are a horse rider or not, because not only is it nice to escape the busy city of Buenos Aires for a day, it was wonderful learning such an interesting sport from such a great teacher!

Highlight of Argentina. I had not ridden a horse in about 20 years, and did not know the rules of the game. After spending an afternoon with Fernando, I have a new love for this sport. Taking polo lessons was definitely one of the highlights of my trip to Buenos Aires! Fernando is incredibly patient, funny and an amazing instructor! I wish I could have gone back the next day to play some more! This is definitely an experience NOT to miss! It was truly fantastic and left me on a high! Thank you Fernando for providing such a memorable experience and wonderful afternoon! I look forward to playing again when I return! :)

Amazing experience!!!. Had no experience riding a horse, no idea of the rules of the game, but neither was required to have an amazing experience. Fernando provided the perfect balance of professionalism with just being a very genuine and nice guy. Whether you are just looking to do something fun and different or if you are looking to learn more about the sport, I would recommend this day out to anyone.

Unforgettable Experience. My husband and I returned a few days ago from 11 wonderful days in Buenos Aires, and we both agree that a day at Polo Elite was the highlight of our trip. Fernando was a great teacher who showed true passion for what he did. We couldn't believe that we were actually playing polo after about 2 hours! Fernando was a few minutes early in picking us up(defying the Argentine-time rule) from the center of BA and drove us about 45 minutes into the serine countryside village of Maximo Paz where the camp was located. Entering the camp, a long row of Eucalyptus trees lined a pretty gravel road and three friendly dogs and a tiny orange kitten welcomed us onto their territory. Within about 15 minutes of arriving, we were given our horses and the lesson began sitting atop these magnificent beauties. Fernando was very professional and humorous at the same time, graceful and patient with us answering all our questions and easily packing in the basic rules and lessons of Polo in fluent English. After lunch, we got back on our horses and actually played a match! There was another couple from England there and my husband being British, the teams were split England vs. The Rest of the World. And guess who won?! Yep, the rest of the world! Perhaps thanks to the comical goal my husband made in the wrong side! It was a lot of fun and we didn't want to stop playing if it wasn't for the breathtaking sunset that signaled the end of our day.  At this point, we couldn’t have asked for anything more. Then, Fernando brought out the cold beer and the British couple whipped out a large bag of crisps! Contented, we sat in the silo and chatted and toasted and munched as the lights grew dim around us. In sum, we highly recommend Polo Elite, and Fernando made our trip to Buenos Aires unforgettable!

A brilliant day out. I would recommend polo elite as a great way of escaping the hustle and bustle of buenas aries. We were all pretty inexperienced horseriders, but Fernando Took us through everything, from the basics of riding the horses to hitting the ball with our polo mallets. At the end of the day, we had a fantastic polo match - unfortunately the final score was England 3 Rest of the world 4.

Get in a fun filled day and experience the sport of Polo from the passionate Fernando.. Fernando gave us quick tips on horse riding, made sure we felt comfortable and safe, and off we go... For Polo lessons.This was a very interactive experience and you get to see what the sport is like. This was my first time playing the sport and I found it very fun even though we were playing at a Basic level.You should enjoy this activity if you're looking for fun things to do in Buenos Aires.

A Great Day Out. If you are in Buenos Aires, you definitely need to give Polo Elite a call. Myself and my fiancée had never sat on a horse before let alone play polo. Fernando at Polo Elite was fantastic, he got us on the horse straight away and his lovely, patient horses were happy to let us confuse them for a while until we got settled. Once we had mastered it, we were out galloping around and learning the rules to Polo, before playing an actual polo match in the afternoon.It was a small group with just three of us which made it all the more personal. Fernando is a great host and it felt like we were meeting a friend. Just remember to take lunch with you as there is nowhere to get any food/drink when you're out there.

AMAZING! An exciting, memorable experience. If you're in Argentina don't miss this opportunity.. I had watched polo and thought it would be impossible to do that myself. Wrong! Fernando Nieto makes magic.I signed up for a day with Polo Elite. Fernando picked us up in Buenos Aires and took us to "el campo" where we learned how to ride and control a polo horse. Before the morning ended we were riding up and down a polo field, practicing our swing.After lunch we progressed to the unimaginable - we actually played a beginners match. The team of German beginners beat the team of American beginners 6 to 5 in an exciting game. Even our well trained horses shared our thrills and happiness.During a celebratory dinner we all marveled at how Fernando was able to turn a group of beginners into actual players, albeit still at beginner level.But I actually played polo, and scored. Next time I'm in Buenos Aires I'm going back for more.

MADE OUR TRIP!!!!. I never expected to play polo with my adult children; a game that I had loved and played with my father, so many years ago. Not only that, but I played alongside a professional, Argentine Polo player, some of the best players in the world. In retrospect, I am certain that he let me get that shot passed him! Fernando treated us like his family, picking us up at our hotel, touring the beautiful, brand-new facility, giving my children a crash course in the game and how to get the most out of their horses, and scrimmaging with us for several hours, until it became too dark to play anymore, before driving us back to our hotel. He was an essential part of what became one of the most memorable trips taken by my wife and our children; trips that have included walking The Great Wall, experiencing Hiroshima, kayaking through the rainforest of Panama, and narrowly escaping a car-bombing in Belfast. He brought an experience to my family that no one else ever could have, in a way that could not have been better. Thank you, Fernando, thank you!

Highly recommended! Lots of fun. No previous experience required.. Buenos Aires is a large, bustling city. After spending a couple days walking around and exploring the city, my wife and I and our 20 year old daughter spent an afternoon with Fernando and his horses at Polo Elite. We had seen that almost everyone gave Polo Elite excellent reviews, and after going, I totally agree with the reviews that I had read. Like everyone else said, Fernando is an excellent teacher, speaks English well and is a really nice person. His horses are the best! My wife and I have only been on a horse a few times in our lives, and we wondered if we would even be able to hold the reins in one hand, and the polo stick in the other, but by the end of a couple hours, we were riding around and playing a very fun game of polo.In addition to learning and playing polo (which is a big sport in Argentina), Polo Elite is a great opportunity to get out of the city and into the country. I am back home now, and looking back on my week in Argentina, Polo Elite was one of my favorite experiences. Get out of the city and spend an afternoon with Fernando and his horses!

Great insight and starter lesson to polo.. One of my favourite activities throughout south america. Instructor is lovely, so are the horses. Also great value for money. Polo is much harder than you think though!

Excellent day. Something you must try. Two of us complete beginners went for the day to ride the horses and play some basic polo. After playing we got to watch the instructor Fernando play a match which was great fun.I really recommend doing this no matter what age or ability, it was a great fun day.Toby and Lou

Polo Elite is a Great Experience!. We traveled with our two grown children to wedding in Buenos Aires and were looking for something to do that we could all enjoy. Polo Elite was the ideal activity. We all laughed and had a great time. Fernando is awesome as are his horses. We had never played before but the horses are so well trained and responsive that we were very comfortable riding them. Go play Polo if you are in Buenos AIres!

A Dream Come True. My husband and I have always loved polo from afar and we were thrilled to hear you could take a lesson and learn all about running a polo estate. Our experience with Fernando was fabulous - he was so patient and yet he shared so much information. It was amazing how much you could learn from a few lessons. We rode Fernando's own horses which were gorgeous and so well trained. It was a joy just to watch them move.We spent the whole day and Fernando even arranged for us to see two professional teams in a practice match. This was the highlight of our whole trip, an experience we will never forget. Don't visit Buenos Aires without having this experience.

A truely unique experience. A must do!!. Fernando and his assistants at Polo Elite delivered a once and a lifetime experience. The polo grounds and horses were top notch. Fernando was an outstanding teacher and a great host to our group. When you visit Buenos Aires take the time to visit Polo Elite. You will never forget it.

Super fun. It was just excellent. Highly recommended. Fernando is a great instructor (he is also a professional player). In our small group of 4 there were people with varying degrees of riding experience but Fernando was somehow able to teach us all the basics of polo over the course of the day - we even managed a mini match in the afternoon. We rode Fernando's own horses and they were beautiful - beautifully groomed, responsive, and well-behaved. PS take some lunch with you.
Polo at polo Elite. Had a great time and Fernando is a great teacher and patient . I recommmend everyone to try playing polo!!Steve Z.
Polo lessons and match. An incredible experience that I will never forget! A full day of fun and excitement. Fernando and his help are great. Would do it again.

Best Experience in South America. I spent 6 weeks in South America, much of it in BA and had the opportunity to take 3 lessons with Fernando. I had an awesome experience each time, in fact I'd play at home if there was anywhere to play. Fernando is a great instructor and very patient. I would just recommend eating beforehand or taking food with you as there's not a lot of accomodations out at the farm. Speaking of the farm, it's beautiful, very lush and rustic, a nice escape from the urban landscapes of BA.

A perfect day! Don´t miss it!. What a experience! Fernando was an excellent coach, and made the beginners feel comfortable with the horses and the experienced ones had the opportunity for trying the horses out. This is something for the whole family/group, independent of earlier experience with horse! During my three week vacation in Brazil and Argentina, this was absolute the best day! We all agree in that :D The area is beautiful and peaceful, the people are very friendly, and the horses was really good! Compared to other attraction with horses the quality on the horses here was superior! These horses were top trained, healthy, and very obedient. I loved just loved it, and I would like to spend many days there just to feel the atmosphere and enjoy the polo riding! :D

A gem, not to be missed. We had so much fun! Fernando is fantastic and does a great job teaching everyone the basics of riding and polo play. I did not believe that he would be able to have us playing a mini match in one day, but he did. The area is beautiful, the horses are kind, and Fernando is a great teacher. If you like horses, or polo, or just want an authentic Argentinian experience I would HIGHLY recommend this. Definitely a highlight of our trip and a great value. The customer service is top notch, and you can tell that Fernando really loves polo and his horses - I can't imagine a better experience.

Never Thought I Would Ever do This!. What a fun experience. It was nice to take about an hour drive out of the city to see the country side. Fernando, the polo instructor, picked us up at the hotel and spent the day with us. We had a group of 10 guys who had never played polo. Fernando showed us the basics of how to deal with the horses and the basics of polo. After a few laps of practice we had lunch and then polo matches. We all enjoyed it. We struck a relationship up with Fernando and he met up with us the next night for drinks in the Palermo district. One of the highlights of our trip.

Amazing Experience. Polo with Fernando is the one thing we still talk about from our trip to Buenos Aires. What an experience to be able to ride real polo ponies! Fernando guided us through learning how to play and worked us up to feeling really comfortable hitting the ball and controlling our horses. For me, the experience of my horse instinctively running towards the ball (and then my big swings and misses) was the most incredible part, my horse liked to play polo and knew what to do - more than I can say for myself. We also really appreciate it that we were sent photos of our day, since it was impossible to get pictures ourselves. From easy reservations, a great experience, to photo memories we were well taken care of every step of the way.

tremendous experience. Fernando was a welcoming host. He gathered us from BA and drove us to the countryside. My friends and I had not ridden horses before and were curious how we were to play polo if we had never ridden before. He and the horses were v patient with us. Even just riding the horses was great fun, he had us cantering comfortably a few minutes after getting on the horse. We made a spoof of the old spice advertisement "i'm on a horse". our slow-paced attempt at polo may not have been exhilarating to spectators (in fact it may have been hilarious) but to all of us playing it was so much fun.I'm so glad we did this, if i ever start a family i will bring them to do this, and i recommend it to any visitor of BA.
A great Polo day!. My polo instructor was Fernando Nieto. He was patient and polite even though I was nervous. He did a great job of pairing me with the right horse.....which Lulu absolutely was!

Wonderful experience, Wonderful instructor!. On our last day in Buenos Aires, we were treated to a wonderful, relaxing day of polo with our new hero Fernando! This is NOT a trail ride, it is an amazing sport that none of my family had any experience with beforehand. We were taught how to control the ponies while holding four reins in one hand and a polo stick in the other....not easy but so much fun! After a few hours of practice, we had our lunch, enjoyed the beautiful grounds and watched the "Real Players" practice. The sound of the horses running full speed was awesome! Then, it was back on our horses for more practice and then our own game. Fernando even dropped us off at the airport for our flight out that night. A day we will never forget!

So much FUN !!!. My husband and I ventured out to try polo for a day - and are SO glad we did! This polo experience was one of the highlights of our South America trip, no question. Fernando is an amazing instructor and he runs a top notch event. We had never even picked up a polo mallet before and are novices in horse riding. No matter -- Fernando is a patient instructor and did a fabulous job making sure everyone knew what to do in a safe manner. We HIGHLY recommend Polo Elite - you will be so glad you experienced polo playing with Fernando and his team.

Unbelievably Fun. This was such a fantastic experience. Fernando was an excellent host from the very first e-mail all the way through the entire experience. He picked us up in a clean, comfortable van and drove us out to the countryside where we got to spend all day learning how to play polo. He taught us basic horsemanship as well as the basics of the game. We even got to play a match at the end. Fernando clearly loves the game of polo and it comes through in every aspect of the day, even the beers we had at the end. I can't recommend this highly enough. It's definitely a must do for any visit to Buenos Aires!

Fantastic experience. This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Argentina. Despite having a group of mixed riding ability from absolute beginner (me) to advanced, Fernando taught the non-riders to ride and had everyone playing a game of polo together within a couple of hours. He picked my wife and I along with the rest of the group up from central BA, drove us to a beautiful ranch on the outskirts of town and then dropped us back later.Having never even sat on a horse previously, to be able to not only canter but also ride with one hand and be able to score a couple of goals in Polo within one afternoon, was absolutely amazing for me.Fernando is so welcoming, patient and friendly as well as being exceptionally knowledgeable about horses and the game of Polo. If you get the opportunity to spend a day in his company learning to play Polo, you will have an absolute blast. Do it.

Must-do in Buenos Aires!. We were a group of 6 guys with no horseriding experience whatsoever who were a bit sceptic about playing polo the first day of riding. After 2 minutes on the horse, however, we felt otherwise. The horses were easily controlled. After some polo and horseriding basics we were ready to play a match with each other, which was really fun. Fernando, the instructor, is a great guy with lots of experience.

A must do activity if you're in Buenos Aires. If you've ever been intrigued with the idea of playing polo, then spending a day with Fernando and Polo Elite is the perfect opportunity to turn that dream into reality. In my group the horse riding skills of the participants ranged from zero to advanced, however Fernando skillfully managed to share his knowledge of horse riding in a way that was relevant and useful for everyone.I initially had some reservations as I have only been on a horse once or twice in my life. However with Fernando's calm demeanor and excellent riding instructions I quickly became quite comfortable with my horse and even managed to score a few goals in the friendly Nations match!Fernando is passionate about polo and his love of the sport is infectious. He is a great ambassador for the sport and, even though most of us will never ever pick up a polo mallet again, this is an experience that I'm sure all of us will always look back on with fond memories and big smiles.

Great experience and very friendly instructors. We had a lovely day with Fernando. He was very patient with a group of all beginners, the horses were very calm and it was great to see real polo players hitting the field later as well. I would highly recommend a day with Polo Elite.

Unique experience & Can be done by all skill-levels and ages. We booked our reservation about two weeks in advance. Fernando picked us up at 11am on the corner of Lima & Chile (about 10min cab from our hotel in the Recoleta area). He has a very comfortable, nice van to transport participants. Total cost for the day was $110 USD per person. Arrived home around 7:30pm and he dropped us off at our hotel which was really nice. Be sure to bring a picnic lunch. We also brought wine too which added to the fun! Five of us total were in the group which made the experience nice and personal. We got plenty of time on the horses and never felt rushed. We really enjoyed the lesson and would highly recommend Fernando as he is friendly, knowledgeable, and makes the day a lot of fun.

Best fun I've had in years. Had a wonderful day with my husband and 5 others in our group.I was the only one who could ride at all but Fernando made it easy for all . By early afternoon , not only were we all riding, we were playing a game of polo. I had a smile from ear to ear all day- it was the best thing we did in a month of travelling around South America.

Great fun. Five of us were collected at our hotel to head out of town to Polo Elite. It was a great experience. The group were mixed, expereinced and novice riders and no riding experience at all. This does not matter. We watched a polo warm up game then got on with the lessons and finished with a match. Fernando is great, he was very patient with us all and made everyone feel at ease. The game itself is very hard to play! As a rider it was frustrating as I was having to slow down to a walk to hit the ball. However by the end was gettting a few hits in at a canter. It was great fun and great excercise too!
Was on a horse and hitting balls right away. Fernando is great teacher who loves polo and is a patient and helpful instructor. This was the best part of my visit to Beunos Aires!

Polo!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. I had pretty much not ridden before, but Polo Elite incredibly taught me how to ride and by the end I was actually playing polo! I wouldn not say that I was as good as the players in the match we saw later! But I was good enough that I could play and we had tons of fun. In fact, I think that this was one of the funnest things I have ever done with my family. P.S. you get to play with the horses and it is very beautiful at the farm. Make sure to bring a packed lunch as you will be hungry.

Most amazing thing I did in BA! You don't need experience with horses. This was such an experience - you get to know a very interesting sport of Argentina. Fernando, the teacher, is a great calm guy who teaches you everything you need to know to manage to play a polo game. You start with getting to know the horses and the riding techniques, then you get the "stick" and practice with balls until you all feel ready, then you play!!! That much fun, and it doesn't go too fast. La estancia (the ranch) is a beautiful place an hour or so outside BA, but you get picked up in the center. (Remember to bring lunch) So if you want an experience to remember, send Polo Elite an email and have fun!

Polo lesson in polo paradise!. This was my first lesson in playing polo. I am a reasonable rider and found the whole experience one of the best things I have done. LOVED IT. Horses were so well trained, instructors fabulous. This is a must do activity for any level of rider. Thank you so much Fernando!

Fun, Fun, Fun. My husband made the request of seeing a polo match about six months prior to our trip to BA. I found Polo Elite on Trip Advisor. I am glad that I did. Fernando was wonderful. He picked us up at our hotel and took us to a polo match in the city. I was relieved that it was in Palermo which was not far from our hotel. Fernando did a great job of explaining the game and we stayed for the after-party. Free ice cream and champagne is always welcomed. I would highly recommend this experience.

A great way to learn a new and challenging sport!. My experience with Polo Elite was one of the best parts of my trip to Buenos Aires. The staff at Polo Elite, especially our primary instructor Fernando, and assistant Ruben, were excellent. They made the day very informative and fun. The horses were well-behaved and the entire day was run well. They can accomodate participants with a range of riding experience, even no experience. I would highly recommend this activity to anyone visiting BA. We even got an excellent parilla recommendation from our driver (Fernando's dad).

Without a doubt, this is best fun you can have with your clothes on!. "Actually, I've just been playing polo in Argentina." That says it all, doesn't it? It tells you absolutely everything that you could ever possibly need to know about me - suave, sophisticated, virile, sporty, probably on first name terms with half the royal families in the world and, of course, very VERY rich. The great thing is that the reality is nothing like that at all - just some amazing ponies that are like no other horses you have ever ridden before, a couple of great guys who are fantastic horsemen and excellent polo players, with all the patience and humour in the world and not a trace of arrogance, a polo pitch like a 10 acre billiard table (and another in the next field!), and a bunch of similarly motivated people to play with. It is now two weeks ago and I still can't keep the smile off my face when I think back to that day.If you are anywhere in South America, and you are not afraid of horses (and don't take yourself too seriously), go to Polo Elite or regret it for a lifetime. Ten stars out of five is not enough to do this place, and its founder Fernando, justice. Absolutely outstanding fun! And the price is ridiculously low (you need to look into that Fernando). What a club! What a game! and what a country!

Great. I really enjoyed it... went 4 times in 4 weeks! Amazing horses, adequate for any level, worth the price: transportation, ~3hours on the horse, drinks.... Fernando (the polo teacher) is very nice and speak fluent english (it can help :-). He start with some riding tips, then you have some time to get use to your horse, afterward is the "technical" part: catch the ball!!! Break und finally game with rules explanation. It feels good to be once in the nature when staying at B.A. city.A recomander!!! :-)

Wonderful time and a great addition to our Argetina "experience". We had five in our group, all with different levels of comfort on a horse ranging from extremely nervous to trained horseback rider (I was not nervous, but had only been on horseback one other time in my life). With Fernando's excellent teaching and guidance we were all comfortable on the horses and playing a rousing game of polo full of laughter by the end of the afternoon. I highly recommend adding polo to your itinerary (no matter your skill level)!

I have ridden horses all over the world and this was my absolutely favorite experience.. I found Polo Elite on Trip Advisor and am thrilled that I did. Fernando made the day so special and so memorable. The horses were actual polo ponies and were fun horses to ride and on which to learn. The ranch was beautiful and the polo facilities were spectacular. I spent the day with a friend, two ladies from Australia, and a gentleman from England--and it was a perfect day. I strongly recommend Polo Elite as an opportunity to have an unforgettable equestrian experience. A memory worth repeating.

great experience - worth trying. I went with a buddy of mine on our last day in Argentina. While it wasn't on the top of our to do list, we figured why not... this is probably the only opportunity to try polo in our lives so we decided to do this over going to visit Tigre. Fernando met us in downtown BA and was very accommodating. He answered all of our questions about the sport and was also very interested in learning about us. When we got there we strapped up and learned the basics (polo is pretty hard esp if you haven't ridden a horse before). After about an hour we took a break to hang by the pool. Afterwards we played a small game w just the 3 of us... we were concerned about going by ourselves because we wanted to play a full match however due to the difficulty of the actual sport I don't think it would have been much of a match... I'd recommend trying this out if you are spending a few days in BA and looking to fill some time.

Fulfilling a lifetime ambition. A day learning polo with Fernando and his amazing string of polo ponies just outside of BA is an experience that I will never forget. To say that this was a highlight of my trip to Argentina would be an understatement. It is something that I had always dreamed of doing. Fernando is the ultimate professional - from a warm welcome, to clear explanations, beautifully trained ponies and expert tuition throughout the day...Everyone in the group left having had a wonderful time - and having learnt to confidently stick & ball. Rather than being all about the theory - Fernando's approach is to get you on the horse and learning by experience which is so much more fun and production. BOOK IN WITH POLO ELITE! You won't regret it!

Highlight of our trip!. Fernando and the entire staff at Polo Elite were incredibly friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. The grounds are beautiful and the sport is a blast. It’s a perfect excursion from BA; I would recommend it to anyone. If we had more time, we would have gone back. If you are even considering it, go; you will not be sorry.

A pleasant way to spend an afternoon .... I had played polo before ... but not for a while. But it is every polo players dream to hit balls on the hallowed ground of an Argentine polo field (campo de polo). Polo Elite was a good choice. I didn't have a week (nor was I in good enough physical shape) to go to a week long polo estancia clinic. So pleasant day spent in the country side near BA was a fitting choice.Fernando (the pro) is an engaging fellow and besides talking horses and polo is a reservoir of information about BA, Argentine history, things peculiar to Argentina and BA.Plus we had a nice ride on his Argentine ponies ... hit a few polo balls and had a totally relaxing afternoon. A couple of girls from Germany were also there to have a lesson and get their first swing at a ball from the back of a horse.All in all a great way to experience a slice of the real Argentina ... for those who would rather see the a country through it's people .. rather than prescribed in a tourist brochure.Enjoy your trip to Argentina and look up Fernando if you get a chance.

Fun for ANYONE no matter what age or level of experience. I had never sat on a horse before and it still turned out a great experience. There were only 5 of us and Fernando. His instructions were calm and clear, so everyone could understand. While preparing to get onto the horses for the first time, he carefully picked the right horse for each person. All horses used to play polo competitively, so they naturally know what you are trying to do. The horses are really well trained, so even a beginner like me felt safe.Overall, great activity! Fernando really makes it what it is. He's the best!

Awesome day!. What a great way to spend a Saturday! We signed up for Polo lessons Prior to arriving to ARG. Fernando was very responsive to all of our emails which is a nice surprise. We met at the designated place and were able to have a cafe con leche and sandwich de miga at Bar Lima prior to departing. Our group consisted of 3 others in addition to us and Fernando. The drive took us out of the city near Estancia Villa Maria, where Micheal Buble got married. The field was freshly manicured and there were multiple fields to play in. Fernando's horses were neatly standing underneath the trees waiting to play Polo. It was a beautiful site. We began by learning standard riding techniques followed by Polo rules and tricks. He didn't waste much time getting us on the horses. We first just worked on basic horsemaship as some in the group had little experience. The horses provided sew well-mannered and perfect for beginners at polo and horses. Once we were comfortable with the horses we learned about some of the basic rules of polo. We learned the basics of the polo sticks, how to hold, how to position our bodies and how to control the ball. We concluded the first part of the lesson and had a picnic lunch in a small meeting area consisting of the sandwiches de miga we had ordered from Lima Bar before leaving B.A. After lunch we had the opportunity to watch theo club teams play a practice match. Wow, it was amazing to see them play at such a high speed. Finally, after the practice match ended we had the chance to play our own practice match on a much shorter field. We had a lot of fun learning how to put what we had practiced nd learned together into a match. After the match we relaxed at the estancia for a couple of beers before returning to BA.
