Great fun and good value. Highly recommended!. This really is great fun and very good value; on reflection I would say that it was one of the most enjoyable days that I spent in Buenos Aires. The facilities are great and the trip organiser (Fernando) very friendly and knowledgable - an experience not to be missed!

The MOST Fun in Buenos Aires!. I would HIGHLY recommend Polo Elite. My husband, sister, brother-in-law and I spent a week in Buenos Aires. We had some truly fun adventures but the one we still talk about the most is our day with Fernando at Polo Elite! Fernando picked us up at the arranged meeting place and brought us out to a beautiful ranch. The horses are beautiful, very well trained and extrememly responsive (in spite of our overall lack of natural ability!). Fernando was a patient instructor and in no time we were playing a match. The girls (with help from Raul) beat the boys! We laughed the entire time. To end the afternoon, we had a snack and a cold beer. It was perfect!After we returned home, Fernando emailed pictures to us (another nice surprise!) and we got to relive the experience.Thanks for a great time Fernando!!

Surely one of the few places in the world where you can try Polo for a day. I generally echo the positive sentiments of the previous reviews.I've riden horses on a few occasions but have never had any formal training so don't let being a 'non-rider' put you off, the game can still be learnt at walking pace if necessary, although I have little doubt you'll soon be going faster than that.Fernamdo was a real pleasure to deal with from the initial booking emails, pick-up & drop-off in BA andn of course the lessons and mini game we played at the end.It's worth mentioning that this is as real as the experience gets and you can take it to whatever level you are comfortable with as you are using the horses Fernando competes with and his equipment.For those who do ride, apparently these horses are very different to what you are used to and incredibly willing to work hard for you.I'd say that for anyone with say 3+ days in BA it's worth taking a day or half day to do this, it stands out as a highlight of our trip.No special equipment or clothing is required, lunch was included in the price.

Highlight of our time in Argentina. Playing polo was an absolute blast. After three weeks in Argentina, we talk about this experience more than any other. It is good for groups of 4-8 people. You do not need riding experience or polo experience; Fernando will teach you everything you need to know. He is an extremely patient instructor and gives excellent advice on how to to play. Most importantly, he makes sure that everyone has a good time. He took a lot of photos while we were riding and then sent them to us afterwards. This was particularly helpful, as it is tough for novice riders to take a photo on the go. Absolutely worth the money.

The Best day in Argentina. Fernando picked us up at our hotel and drove us to the most unbelievable experience in Argentina. We thought we would get a little horse back riding in and a few tips on the game but we spent the entire day on some amazing horses and Fernando patiently helped us learn the fineries of the game of polo. We even had a few polo matches after hours of lessons. Seriously a must do during your trip and don't worry, we are not horse experts and we are in our fifties and had no trouble thanks to Fernando and his professional polo ponies.

HIghlight of our Buenos Aires visit (and THAT in itself speaks volumes). Buenos Aires is a beautiful place with much to do adn see....but I dont believe ANY visit would be complete without the experience of Fernando and Polo Elite. My boyfirend and I knew NOTHING about riding horses (the only horse I had ever been on was for a photo opp and they gave me steps to get onto the saddle ) and other than appreciating how cool Polo looked had no idea of rules, physicial requirements- NOTHING...but that didnt matter..by the end of the day thanks to Fernando's coaching and guidance we were riding and hitting balls - even played in matches !!!I must admit my boyfriend proved to be much better than I as he scored an awesome winning goal! There are very word that express how awesome Fernando is patient, accomodating, encouraging, talented, cool..the list goes on and on ..HE really made the experience even more awesome than it already was ..I would recommend you make this excursion a priority ..hopefully your group will be as awesome as the group we were in ..as that too makes the experience richer..but Fernando and Polo Elite will alway be (for us ) one of our best vacation memories ever!!THANK YOU FERNANDO!!!

A Must Do in Buenos Aires!!!. This is a MUST DO for anyone spending anytime in Buenos Aires. Fernandon picked us up from the city center and took us to his beautiful club outside of BA. Not having any experience playing polo let alone ever even riding a horse I was anxious to see how good the day would be.Fer completely blew me out of the water with the day's activities. Not only did he teach us the game of polo and the finer points of how to excell at it, he also taught me how to ride a horse. After teaching us how to control the horses, he taught us the rules of the game, how to control the stick and hit the ball and how to play defense and then we put it all together in a real game. The entire time Fer was patient with us and gave helpful tips on how to better enjoy the game and our time on the horses.No review could do justice for how great the experience was and that it made the trip to BA better than we could have expected.Forget the usual tourist activities, go off the beaten path a bit and enjoy a day with Polo Elite in the beautiful Argetine countryside. I know we are glad we did and expect to be back in the future to sharpen our skills with Fer again. Thanks for the memories!Darcy and Ed

Will be the highlight of your trip. Fernando and his team provided us a very special experience that was one of the highlights of our month-long trip. It is amazing how you can learn the basics of an entire sport (and one which is usually very inaccessable) in just a few hours. Fernando has a great sense of humour (very witty and dry) and is the quintessential Argentinian. The game at the end was fantastic (and very close) - we wanted to keep playing well into the night. Also, if our experience is anything to go by, this experience attracts a great group of people (our group got along like a house on fire and went out for dinner together afterwards).

A must in BA. My polo lesson with Fernando was by far the best part of my trip to Buenos Aires. I should start off by saying I am a rider so I was more comfortable in the saddle than most people but I have never played polo before. Our group was made up of mostly beginners and even some who had never been on a horse. Fernando took time with each student to make them comfortable and match them with the right horse. We practiced for a while, took a break, and then played a game. Fernando coached, played and took photographs of the game for us. If you are at all interested in the sport of polo I highly recommend you take the time out of you trip to spend a day with Fernando. He is an excellent teacher and makes the sport very accessible.

Make Time to Do This!. We had a great day with Fernando! We were a group of five and he picked us up and took us to the estancia. He taught us some basics and then gave us some time to become comfortable with our horses. We learned some polo basis and played a "match." It was really hysterical and we had a fantastic time. I absolutely suggest carving out time in your trip to do this. It's is so worthwhile!
Best fun ever!!. We had the most fun and were actually able to play a game of polo by the end!! Highly recommended.Cheers Fernando

Awesome experience all-around - it's a must-do in BA if you're sporty!. Learning to play polo was one of the best things we did in all of Argentina. Both my husband and I had very little experience riding horses, and Fernando, our instructor, immediately made us feel comfortable with his expert coaching. After a good amount of practice (riding and simply trying to make contact between mallet and ball), we played a really fun game of two on two. It's amazing how much progress we made in just a few hours! After the "match" Fernando treated us to a bottle of Quilmes and snacks! The whole experience was great. We were picked up and dropped off at a convenient location in SF, and the fields where we played were beautiful. Fernando was friendly, patient, and highly skilled! I highly recommend the experience - truly one of a kind!

Hard as hell, but made accessible by the instructor. We were picked up about 15 minutes later than the 2:30 pick up time, not that we were bothered but the driver, Fernando, apologized and promptly loaded us up in the extended mini van. I was there alone, there was also a solo Aussie guy, and 4 Americans, one of which was a petite-lady-rider, all MBA students at Columbia in NYC. RIde was just less than 40 KM out. During the ride we discovered that our commonwealth representative had a friend go on the training but a few days before us and had fallen off the horse. He was fine less some surface injuries but an important thing came up: don't wear hiking boots, it's possible you can get them stuck. Better to wear riding boots if you actually have them or light trainers that allow you to still feel your foot's surroundings. After taking some dirt roads inward of the trip, we arrived to the ranch without issue. Waivers were signed on a picnic bench cluster, cold water was distributed, and as we chatted among us, the instructor, Fernando our driver, went to pull helmets and the remaining requisite equipment: a horse whip and the necessary mallet. Some sizing, a few questions and answers and we sauntered over to the mares. It was all very relaxed nothing rushed. None of us, with the exception of the Aussie, had any riding experience to speak of, so Fernando demonstrated technique and methodology from how to use the reins to how to sit properly and avoid annoying the horses. This went on a little while longer than if we had any idea what we were doing on a horse, but it was certainly necessary. We graduated up to being able to practice hitting balls with the mallets, doing our best to move the ball up the field and and back down it. We had a break at that point and during the break there was theory discussion: what is legal, what triggers a foul, how to work as a team to move the ball up, how to play defense with hooking, etc. Then it was on to the second riding term which included us splitting up into teams. Surprisingly there was a lot of scoring and Fernando was pretty generous about setting it up so we could realize a few goals. All in all, it's really tough for beginners with no riding experience to get into something like Polo in a matter of a couple hours. However, the instructor, Fernando, does an excellent job of helping instructees make it happen. Our smallest and only female teammate even ended up playing some mean defense at one point, that from two hours before when the whole group was wondering out loud how we were ever going to get this tiny person on those tall horses. When it was all finished, horses stored to the stables and equipment put away, all I could think of was that a cold beer would be life changing. Like mana from heaven, my prayers were answered when Fernando turned the corner with two big bottles of cold Quilme beer. In summary, polo is a difficult and potentially precarious undertaking. If you are even slightly afraid of horses or the idea of controlling the beast while also needing to manage a mallet and a whip, then you'll need to be a little more brave, but the instructor really does a great job of dumbing things down so that you can get into it while also giving you a chance to push it if you'd like, if you're comfortable. Most importantly, after this experience, I am keen to improve my riding skill so that I can play again because especially when we got into the match at the end it was some of the best fun I've had in a field, ever.

Exceeded our expectations--most fun in BA!!!!. We visited BA over Christmas 2011. I emailed Fernando of Polo Elite a year in advance hoping that he would be open the day after Christmas. He said that he was and my boyfriend and I made reservations to learn to play polo with him. This may have been slightly farther in advance than needed as other people playing that day actually made reservations the day before. But, this was something that my boyfriend and I really wanted to try! We had the BEST time. Fernando is PERFECT for his job. His English is great and he gave wonderful instructions. He did a good job teaching us the basics of riding before teaching us the basics of polo. The horses are very well broke. I felt safe the entire time. My boyfriend had never ridden before but he was cantering up and down the field in no time. Fernando provided everyone in the group with a snack and a rest after we had practiced for quite some time. We were lucky enough to see him and his friends play a "real" match while we were resting. It provided a great time to take pictures of real polo horses and to see how the game should really be played. We enjoyed it! Then after our rest we got to play our own match. It was the most fun we've had on a vacation!! We were laughing so hard (and still are). We played boys against girls and the boys won (barely!). My bf and I each scored a couple of goals so we were quite proud of ourselves! We enjoyed a beer after playing and then Fernando drove us all back to BA. We were a bit late getting back into town (around 9pm or so--I guess that is still very early in Argentina) so Fernando was kind enough to drop all 8 of his guests off at their respective hotels. We left with the BEST impression. I can't think of anything that Polo Elite could do different to make this a better experience. My bf and I both said that this experience is worth so much more than we paid! We did tango shows and other BA attractions while we were there that cost much more but were not nearly half the fun! We just can't stop talking about how much fun we had. Fernando also emailed a few pictures to us after we returned home that are wonderful souvenirs. We'll recommend this experience to everyone visiting BA!!!

A MUST DO.... Polo Elite is a FANTASTIC opportunity that EVERYONE who visits Argentina should do! Fernando is an excellent teacher and provides exceptional service to his guests! My husband and I had so much fun playing Polo...Fernando's service is above and beyond...he does everything to make your experience PERFECT! We highly recommend that you learn how to play polo with Polo Elite..it's a unforgettable experience and memory to cherish forever!!!

Fantastic!. Our day with Fernando at Polo Elite was the highlight of our visit to BA! Both my husband and I are experienced riders but had never played polo before - we were not disappointed! Fernando was a fabulous coach and a great guy who made us feel really welcome, and the horses we professionally schooled and well mannered. All in all a really fun, action packed horsey day in gorgeous surroundings!

In my experience somewhat of a disappointment. Having read the excellent reviews on here I was looking forward to the day but unfortunately my experience wasn’t quite so impressive. Fernando was very organised and responsive in dealing with my initial inquiry but on the day we got off to a rather delayed start. We set off from the pick up point 30minutes later than planned at 2.30pm, followed by a bit of a detour en route, it turns out that Fernando needed a gas station to fill up the minibus. We were very relieved and excited to reach the estancia but by this point it was 4pm so it seemed a bit of a rush to make up for lost time. As most of us had limited riding experience Fernando gave us a run through on how to control the horse and then we got started. We met our horses but didn’t learn their names which some of us were curious to know as we wanted to connect with them. Unfortunately, mine along with a couple of others didn’t seem to want to move off despite using the techniques we had been given. In the few previous times I have ridden (to a fair standard) this has never been a problem so I was confused and wanted to understand what I needed to be doing more/less of. I asked Fernando but he whipped my horse himself and said ‘there she moves’ which she did to be fair but it didn’t help me to gain control or greater understanding. I am aware that in a group activity there is little time to cater to individual needs but when it came to hitting the balls and playing the match those of us who were having problems moving on our horses, like myself, were at a disadvantage. Fernando did change my horse for me but there wasn’t a great amount of difference which made me want to learn even more how to improve my technique and most importantly move at a pace which enabled me to fully participate. Of course I had come full of enthusiasm to enjoy and succeed in playing polo but could only describe my experience very loosely in terms of playing polo. Some of the group seemed to be happy with their achievements as they felt that had succeeded in being a polo player for a couple of hours and have photos to prove this. I think that the experience sets itself an ambitious task in teaching how to learn to ride a horse and play polo within 4 hours and the results will always be to varying degrees of success. Fernando is clearly an instructor who is very passionate about playing polo and I guess we achieved what the day says, we rode horses, learnt how to hit balls and played a mini tournament. If however you are interested in developing lasting skill and understanding technique and control then you may not find it to be the best or most rewarding option for you.

Beautiful afternoon. Highly recommended.My girlfriend and I had a great experience with Polo Elite on Dec 27. 5 hours on horses learning to ride, play polo, and even playing one competitive game. Our instructor Fernando was excellent, giving us the basic lessons but also allowing enough freedom to experiment and learn through practice. The ranch was beautiful, and the horses were well trained. Very inexpensive compared to prices in US.We played at a polo field 45 minutes away from Buenos Aires, and Fernando picked us up and dropped back off in the center of the city. I hear they switched fields now, so maybe it's closer.

Polo with Fernando was a highlight of our trip!!. We had no idea what to expect but learning to play polo was SO much fun!! Fernando is amazing - very instructive, patient and entertaining as well! If we are lucky enough to get back to Buenos Aires we will definitely do it again. The fields were gorgeous and the horses were wonderful. No one should go to BA and miss this experience!!

The best two days between Patagonia and Salta !. We traveled to Argentina (Calafate, Chalten, Cafayate, Salta, Cordoba and BA) with two kids aged 11 & 12 who are both (beginners) horseback riders. The parents had never sat on a horse, but we wanted to experience polo (seeing it live would have been enough). At the end we not only got to view a game but also got lessons from Fernando (the owner) as well as a good country-style lunch in the shade at an adjacent hotel/restaurant that belonged to the Polo Club...which also included a refreshing swim in the pool overlooking the polo fields. Our kids absolutely loved the horses, polo, tour and above all Fernando's patient teaching/coaching that was meticulous, professional and level-relevant. Despite the fact that our muscles hurt for a few days after, we decided to wrap up our trip two weeks later with another visit to the Club with Fernando. Although it was 1/1/12 (not ideal day for a visit), Fernando was extremely flexible and again picked us up at our hotel and organized another unforgettable day with him and his 8 (!) horses (there are hundreds of horses at the Club). Fernando took the time (and seemed to enjoy) to teach us more theory about polo and horses in general (care, health, psychology, cost) which both parents and kids enjoyed. For our son in particular, this could become a pivotal moment in his life as he is now determined to start playing polo ;-) ! We all had a lot of fun.Overall, this was a very stress-free day full of enjoyment and learning that our family will not forget and it was largely thanks to the professionalism and pleasant style of Fernando. I would strongly recommend spending a full day (he also does half day tours) with Polo Elite if you have two days or more to spend in Buenos Aires.

Great experience. Spend very interesting day with Fernando ,firstly watcvhing him play polo then having a go ourselves . Dont be put off if you have very little horse experience you will be fine and well looked after.

What a fun day in BA!. We had a great day with Fernando out at a ranch ~45 min from BA. The polo fields are beautiful. We got to see a club match (which was breathtaking) as well as get hours on their amazing horses. Our kids, 8 and 9, have taken a few riding camps but none of us are "good" riders. The other family that we were with was in the same boat. Fernando explained the basics of riding these horses and let us practice riding before embarking on adding the polo sticks. He explained the basics of hitting and we practiced that as well. Half the group actually opted out of playing after the practice as it was hard or hot or they were thirsty, and Fernando was very accommodating of the various group needs. his skills and horses were amazing. We got to rude for hours and had a fabulous day. Such a fun experience!

Fernando is great--this was one of the top 3 memories of my South America trip!!!. Fernando is an excellent teacher--he remembers everyone's names and is personalized in his approach. He is encouraging, but also expects progress--a great combination. This was one of my top 3 memories of my entire South America trip, largely in part because of Fernando. The farm is gorgeous--huge expanses of land. You get to try riding your horse at all speeds in open field. Fernando also facilitates an actual polo game. He also takes pictures of the day and sends them to you! I would not miss out on this experience.

Amazing experience, for a complete novice!. Having never been on a horse, to 'play' polo at the end of the session was a thrill! And I use the term 'play' very loosely, especially in my case. Absolutely brilliant -- Fernando!

I learned to play polo!. Fernando was a great instructor and very patient. I was not a fan of horseback rising but I left being more confident and learning a new sport. Great way to get out of the city and enjoy the countryside. Highly recommended!

Amazing First Polo Experienxe. We were all inexperienced riders, let alone polo players but had an amazing time learning from Fernando. He taught us the basics of riding and playing polo. The horses were great and very responsive and friendly. We leaned the basic rules and gameplay and though it wasn't the prettiest match in the world, got the chance to play each other. This is a great experience for anybody who is a beginner or never played before. Just riding the horses themselves were worth it, the polo was an added bonus. Plus Fernando was kind enough to take pictures while we were playing and send them to us later. A must do experience in Buenos Aires

Once in a lifetime experience!. We decided to give this a try given all the rave reviews on tripadvisor and it did not disappoint! Fernado is super patient and a great encouraging teacher. My friend was actually scared to ride and went reluctantly with my persuasion and he made sure she was comfortable and we had great time. Polo is actually much harder to play then it looks but we learned the rules of the game and also got to watch professional polo players' practice games. The estancia is beautiful and it's definitely a memorable and fun experience. Thanks Fernando!!

Best experience in BA. We arranged this trip near the end of our stay in BA. Fernando proved to be an excellent teacher. Furthermore, the facilities and quality of horses are far superior to other equine related tourist activities elsewhere. If I plan another trip to BA, I will certainly place this at the top of my itinerary.

Absolutely Unforgettable. I had a lesson at Polo Elite with a friend during our short stay in BA. The only day we had free, there were no lessons in the morning and the afternoon was fully booked. After a brief chat on the phone with Tristan we were told that they would come and pick us up at 9am and open early so that we wouldn't miss out.After the first part of our lesson we stopped for drinks and snacks whilst we learnt about the match rules, followed by a very eventful game. Throughout the whole lesson Tristan was taking pictures and a few days later, he emailed them to us both.It was an amazing experience and I would recommend it to anyone planning on going to Buenos Aires. They really do make the effort to make sure you have an unforgettable time. I would definitely go again.

Something to try in Buenos Aires. Fancy some fun on horseback then try this is Buenos Aires. Transport is provided to and from the city and you need to set aside most of the day. Fernando provides clear instructions although putting them into practice can be difficult.. This is not an easy game to play even if you are quite a good rider. However you will have lots of fun while trying and the horses are fantastic. Beautifully turned out and highly trained they must wonder what these idiots on their backs are doing! However like Fernando they are patient and a joy to ride. So gives this a try if you you have some time and an adventurous spirit.

Bucket List Adventure. I joined friends in Buenos Aires for a for several days and were loking for an outing outisde of the city before heading home to the states.This was a spur of the moment outing and after being quoted a ridiculous price (over $1000 for three people) by another operator, this was by far the best price and most reputable company. I spoke with Fernando, whose primary concern (due to heavy rains on the previous day) was not money -- but the condition of the field for the safety of horse and rider. That spoke volumes. As it turned out: we paid $145 pp -- the full day price -- plus 100 pesos for pickup at our apartment (free if you are in the city center) for lessons, polo play, lunch and drop off at the airport at the end of the day. And an additional surprise waited for us in the ranch house at end: a coffee service complete with pastries and homemade breads before heading out.This estanchia stretched out over 150 acres and housed nearly as many horses. With two large houses on the property for corporate events, the ranch featured numerous polo fields, plus a small hotel for overnight guests and (the original) ranch house. where we dined.The three of us had some (minimal recent) riding experience but no polo experiece. Fernando, a handsome, affable polo player seved as our translator, driver, patient instrucutor and charming host. Easy going and friendly, nothing rattled him (not even our lack of skills). He was easy to work with and flexible, as evidenced even when our flights were delayed -- he went out of his way to accomodate us.Ater being fitted with horses and gear, we started out with a lesson on managing the horses, then we rode over to one of the polo fields where we performed drills, and played a bit before breaking for lunch. We dined alfresco under the shade of a pergola and nearby trees at the ranch house on an incredible spread of salads, grilled meats (chorizo, blood sausage, chicken and beef), accompanied by soda, water and wine. Fruit was served for dessert. After our fabulous lunch we rested (and were invited to swim in the pool) and watched as other guests and ranch hands played polo on the field in front of us. We again saddled up and played for another hour or so until sunset, before showering and heading back to the ranch house for coffee/dessert. Fernando drove us to the aiport and we all agreed that we would love to come back to Argentina and when we did -- this outing was definitely worth re-visiting.

Beautiful place-unique experience!. This was an amazingly interesting day for my daughter and I,while my husband went dove hunting. The meeting point was a little strange for us, as we arrived way too early and we were the only guests there waiting on a Sunday morning.We had a beautiful day, and we enjoyed our time there very much. I was recovering from surgery, and my daughter is 8 so we are not going to quit our day jobs to be polo players, but we had fun. My daughter became friends with the owner's daughter, and I met some really neat people from Switzerland and Germany during lunch. We enjoyed watching the tournament going on while we were there. After a little misunderstanding, Fernando quickly made up for the issue, and delivered us to our apartment. Soon after, I received some great pictures from him. I would suggest you try this experience if you are in the area!

Greatest experience ever!. Although we never did horde back riding, we had the guts to do this clinic. No regrets!Fernando is great!! He was so relaxed and a great teacher with humor. The first 30 minutes I was a bit scared, galoping with no hands... The end of the day we even played a match! Lots of fun! The next day lots of pains in the muscles! Anyway, Fernando and his polo clinic is great. Do yourself a favour and experience this!!

Great, Unique Experience!. I visited Buenos Aires with a friend and found Polo Elite on TripAdvisor. Neither of us had played polo before, or even been on a horse, but it was a great activity. Fernando, our instructor met us in the city and drove us out to the polo field. For people with no polo experience, Fernando did a great job of explaining the rules and teaching riding basics.I would definitely recommend Polo Elite to anyone interested in an "off the beaten path," activity when in Bueno Aires.

Highly Recommended. My girlfriend and I spent yesterday on this tour and I would highly recommend it.Fernando is a really nice guy, the setting is really beautiful, our group were great fun....and the polo was great too. We were all pretty much absolute beginners (hardly any had been on a horse before) and we had our horse riding lesson, our polo basics lesson and we played the practice match. It is really gratifying to feel quite up for horse riding again. I would have thought it would have taken many lessons to get even the basics, but Fernando made it all quite easy for us.The day felt "familiar" due to the reviews, but all in a good way. All of the other reviews are right.Price wise it is not cheap, but Buenos Aires is not a cheap city for tourists. I thought about it for a while before booking, but am very glad that I did. Give it a try!

The best thing I did in BA. Polo with Fernando was truly amazing. At first I wasn't sure how fun it would be because I went on my own and there was only one other person with us but it didn't matter. I had a great time and we even got to play on the official playing field. Fernando was a great teacher and he even took pictures of the day and emailed them to me. This is a must do activity.

Fantastic!. We had a great time here! Our tour agency Inspiring Argentina had suggested it and we are so glad we went there. It was a great experience, especially for my wife who always wanted to try some polo herself, and there is no place better than in Argentina!! We loved our trip.

The best experience I had in Argentina!. Fernando is a professional polo player that provides this amazing experience at Polo Elite. He had a small group of us out to his training grounds and he taught us all about polo and how to ride horses competitively. I never realized how much I loved horses! (riding the well-trained horse from a professional polo player was completely different than any horse I've ever ridden, this is coming from a guy from Texas).Go with friends or family, this is truly a must! Very memorable and also surprisingly safe - Fernando and his team are very professional and prepared. They also include a nice snack and time to get to know each other after a practice game of polo. Sooo fun!

Great fun - An absolute must in BA!!!. Having booked horse riding activities in many different places around the world, each time we have been left disappointed. After reading the reviews of PoloElite on TA, we thought we had to give this a go, and we weren't disappointed. Fernando was a great tutor and the horses were so well behaved, and the activities catered for every standard of rider.One of the group we were with actually was quite scared of horses, and hadn't ridden previously, but by the end he was really enjoying himself.I would recommend this activity to anyone visiting to Buenos Aires, and would book again if returning. Thanks Fernando!!!!

Not, the wines nor the steaks but the polo lessons! A must do in Buenos Aires!!!. Since the first contact with Polo Elite until our drop in Buenos Aires the attention, care and warmth were always present.Truly the best time of the entire trip.Fernando is the nicest person ever and a remarkable teacher and also the place itself is amazing, a completely different side of Buenos Aires...we had a blast there!!!I strongly recommend this attraction!

The Most Fun I've Had on a Horse Since I was a Kid!!!!. I am the aforementioned colleague the previous reviewer mentioned. I am both a trainer Hunter Jumper and Dressage rider but have never played polo. This experience brought me back to younger times when I could just ride for the sheer joy of it. Fernando is an outstanding educator and has the patience of a saint. I am often nervous about riding "lesson horses" or "rental horses" as an experienced equestrian and equine advocate. Fernando earned my deep respect and trust when he spoke extensively about communicating with the horse in a friendly way. He demonstrated ways to ride that enhanced the communication and partnership with the horse, clearly a key aspect of any good polo partnership. I've been on a lot of trail rides in my life, on a lot of horses that had many many different unskilled riders on them, and Fernando's philosophy and direction offered us horses that had life and spirit but were not dangerous or dull. I could have stayed on that polo field for hours, days and weeks. I would love to return and spend a couple days at the facility and just practice. The facility in itself added to the experience and was breathtakingly beautiful. The added bonus of watching experienced players practice on the same field was both humbling and inspirational. The result of my day with my group and Fernando is that I am completely and totally hooked and am seeking polo lessons here in the states, so that when I return to Buenos Aires I can hold my own against the 10 year old. Thank you so much Fernando!!!!!

A Bucket List Experience -- Play the sport of kings!. Truthfully one of my best travel experiences ever. I didn't know what to expect because 1. I've never ridden horses. 2. I didn't understand polo. Fernando changed all that.For me, Fernando's style is perfect. He is patient with beginners and brings a good sense of humor to experience. My colleague, who owns 3 horses and rides dressage, was particularly impressed with Fernando's attitude towards being friendly to the horses.Plan for a full day. You will have to share horses in the beginning but the day ends with everyone on horseback playing a polo match.

Argentine Countryside, Polo Horses, and Friendly Learning Atmosphere - Best Experience. My girlfriends and I booked the trip to Argentina and wanted to experience the country in its true form. Being a huge fan of Polo I wanted see real Argentine Polo in action. We knew that we couldn't leave Argentina without trying our hand at the sport. When we found Polo Elite lessons online we knew that we were in for an action packed day. Accommodating Staff: We were picked up in Buenos Aires by our instructor Fernando. He even dropped us off at the airport after the lesson since we had a flight to catch afterwards. They allowed us to bring our luggage to the site with safe storage. Environment: Polo Elite offered the perfect environment to learn the basics and even play a match between the other students. The horses are kept in safe areas and are treated in the most humane ways. They are also well trained to work with novice riders so even if you have never been on a horse you are able to quickly pick up the game. What stood out: - We were given a brief riding class and taught the basics of the sport. - Friendly environment with well kept horses and clean facility.- Patient and - Polo Elite picks out the right horse for its rider... i.e. I had 3 horses before I got Pepa... and she was awesome. With Pepa I scored 2 of our team's goals!! This was the highlight of our trip to Argentina and I know my friends and I left bragging about our new "skills." Even if Polo isn't for you - this is a great way to see the Argentine countryside and watch the prettiest sunset in the country. I highly recommend Polo Elite to anyone looking for a fun-filled day!

The most unique experience we had in Buenos Aires!. On a recent trip to BA, we thought what better experience to have in Argentina than playing polo! Luckily, we happened upon Fernando at Polo Elite and could not have been happier with our lesson.We opted for a private lesson (due to my severe lack of riding and horse skills), but if you're at all comfortable with horses...we recommend a group lesson. Fernando is the absolute best! Patient, informative, friendly and knowledgeable. We plan to visit Fernando again on our next visit to Argentina! P.S. Give him a hard time about creating some Polo Elite shirts! We still want some!

A Must-DO activity in B.A.. I just wanted to write and confirm what is being widely said by others who have been lucky enough to experience the fabulous tuition given by Fernando.I had never been on the back of a Polo horse before, but Fernando was quick to give assurances and clear instructions so that this novice could begin enjoying the horse. With care, Fernando then enabled me to grow at my own pace and get as much out of the experience as was possible.I enjoyed my day so much that I was keen to progress my skills in my new-found hobby, and signed-up for another day (and another). In the end, I enjoyed five full days on the ranch and I can definitely confirm that my riding and Polo skills improved!The ranch has fantastic facilities for both the horses and the players. As well as being treated to fabulous Argentine cuisine each day, at the on-site hotel, there is also a great pool which helps ease those muscles after a days workout on the horse.Finally, Fernando is a special tutor. He has a passion for horses and Polo which is tangible. As a former lecturer he is also a great communicator (and can take lessons in both Spanish and English). Over and above that, he cares deeply about the experience of his clients and is always thinking of ways in which they can be given an improved service. I cannot praise Fernando, and Polo Elite, highly enough. I now have a new passion for horses, and Polo, and its thanks to Fernando.

Amazing first time polo experience. Highly recommend. Fernando is great.. Staying in Buenos Aires and decided to take polo lessons with Fernando at Puesto Viejo which was recommended by a friend. Absolutely amazing experience. The polo club and surrounding land is stunningly beautiful and Fernando was a great teacher for us first time polo players. We watched two polo matches afterwards and met the owner of Puesto Viejo who was very welcoming and a nice guy to talk with. Would highly recommend this to anybody looking to experience polo for the first time

Watch your friends faces when you say you played polo in Argentina!. If you want to see beautiful countryside, learn about a beloved Argentine pastime, ride amazing horses, AND learn to play a sport you'll never learn anywhere else, go with Polo Elite! Fernando is a patient and enthusiastic teacher. Even though three of us had only been on horseback 3 times, everyone had a blast. The most fun was at the end when we actually played a match against each other. It was one of the main highlights of our 2 week trip.

Polo is amazing!!. Had so much fun learning to play polo with Fernando, he is a great teacher. We learnt the basics and then ended up playing a small game which was great. I've definitely caught the polo bug and want to play again when I get back to England if not sooner. Thank you Fernando!!

Fernando was great!. If anyone is visiting the Buenos Aries area, this is a must do. Fernando and Polo Elite exceeded expectations. He was prompt, patient, and very accommodating. The lunch provided was also very good. It is well worth the cost and drive out of the City.

a must do activity. A must do activity! On your own (as I was) or in a group, don’t hesitate about it. Go for it and you will have a blast. Fernando goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable. Plus, his English is great and he’s a great instructor. I would do it again.

So much fun - a real insight into this Argentinian sport!. I can't ride a horse and I am not gifted at ball sports .... but I still had one of the most fun days of my life! It was brilliant. Just go do it. (Be warned there is a bus journey that takes 45 minutes, and the initial introduction may seem slow, but once you get riding and playing it is brilliant). Fernando is such a sweet guy, and really makes the day so enjoyable.

Highlight of our trip - totally worth it!. This was easily the highlight of our trip. Fernando is great - he's super nice and friendly and knew how to make our experience enjoyable.Recap:Fernando picked us (my girlfriend and another couple) up at around 1pm. The drive is about an hour, depending on traffic. When we got there, the first hour or so was spent learning to ride the horse. The next hour was spent learning to hit the ball. We then took a short break and drank water and ate cookies. We spent the next 1+ hours playing a match. Finally, we took the horses back to their stable area, and Fernando had some nice cold beer waiting for us (a very nice touch). Overall, we had the best time and are so glad we did this.

FANTASTIC - Even if you are not a "horse" person!. Polo Elite offers a fantastic experience - even if you are not a "lover of horses." Neither my husband nor I have much experience with horses, and quite frankly, I had to cajole him into going. We have been to B.A. 5 times, and wanted to branch out. We both LOVED this experience! Fer was an EXCELLENT teacher. We only had 3 people in our group (the 3rd being an experienced rider from the U.K.). We all had a great experience. By the end of the day when we played our polo "match", we felt like we were professional polo players! Highly recommend it!

Just OK. I decided to take a polo lesson at Polo Elite after reading the great reviews, but I have to say it did not quite live up to my expectations. It started off with Fernando being late picking us up at the pick up point. After that we had to wait for another couple that arrived almost half an hour after the agreed pick up time. When we finally left, the drive to the polo club (70 km outside of BA) took about 1hour and 15 minutes. When we arrived there, Fernando sort of showed us around the place for a bit. Before the lesson got started Fernando told us to leave our bags outside on a table. We asked him if we could put them in the car and if he could lock that for safety. He basically refused to do that and we had no choice but to leave the bags outside without anyone watching them. To be honest I don’t find this good service. After this, we put on the helmets and received a very short general introduction as to how to ride a horse. We mounted the horses and rode to a field to practise. Fernando basically told us to practise riding without paying much attention to what everyone was doing or giving personal instruction. There were beginners in the group who were also left on their own.Then he explained to the group how to hold the mallet and hit the ball and we practised. Since I have never played polo before and I read a lot about Fernando being a great teacher, I expected some individual attention and tips on how to improve. However, I received none. We practiced hitting the ball up and down the field for a while on our own. We were most of the time walking and some of us tried hitting the ball trotting or cantering (this was our decision, we were not encouraged to do so). Fernando would just ride behind us and hit the balls forward when we missed them, but he did not offer any guidance. It would have been so much better if during this part of the lesson we would have received some instruction on how to hit the ball better and with more direction, or just some encouragement or confirmation if we were indeed hitting the ball in the right way. After practising for some time we took a break. Fernando put some water, a soft drink and some cookies on the table and left. He came back a little later to join us again. We got back on the horses and practised some more. At that time Fernano was in the field practising by himself.We ended the day playing a match, which was fun and for me basically saved the day. Fernando explained the basic rules of the game and how to defend and this time he did give some helpful tips and advice while we were playing. After we finished the match, he put a bottle of beer on the table and some time later he drove us back to the city.For me, if you offer a lesson, you have to teach people. I felt like I received an absolute minimum of instruction, which was dissappointing. Obviously you cannot expect to learn how to play real polo in a couple of hours, but I feel it could have been better than this.

Great Bucket List Activity. Really enjoyed the Polo with Fernando..... It is such a 'bucket list' activity and one that is not usually accessible at a small cost. My Girlfriend and I had a ball!! The best part of the day was the actual Polo Game we played. My only advice would be to try and go when it is fully booked because I think that would make the game you play at the end even better....

A unique and memorable experience. This was an excellent day trip !! Riding the horses was awesome and the horses are so well trained that even my friend who had never really ridden a horse had no problem!! We palyed a mini game of polo with one of the team members and gained a high respect for the difficulty of the game - this sport makes golf feel like pinball in an arcade !!! Very highly recommended and guaranteed to be memorable!!!!

Awesome afternoon - give it a go. We spent the afternoon with Fer and had a ball, not sure we stopped laughing. He took really good care of us, had a teaching style which was easy to follow - slowly building up the skills required for polo - even if it was just at a walk or trot, the horses were well looked after and easy to ride. Would totally recommend giving it a go.

This was one of my most memorable days in South America!. This was so much fun! The horses were fantastic and Fernando was a great teacher. The group was mixed abilities including people who had never ridden before but it didn't matter at all, we all had lots of fun. I highly recomment doing this trip. I was back-packing at the time so did think twice about going as I needed to make my money last for several months, but am so glad that I did.Fernando speaks impeccable English but is also patient if you want to practise your spanish.If I go back to Buenos Aires I'll go again!

Best thing to do in Buenos Aires :). This is a great day to spend the day especially if you want to do something different! It was our last day of an 8 month trip and we wanted to end it all with something memorable. I feel sorry for the horses having to put up with us on them (none of us were experienced riders) but they were very patient and Fernando was especially patient with our pace,which really never went above a slow walk and even then we didn't always hit the ball!!!! Don't forget to bring a packed lunch...we forgot and Fernando was offering us his (so even off the pitch you are well taken care of). For the last part of the day you play a small game with the other people in the class which is so much fun. I'm not a Polo player (even now) but that was great fun and if I am ever back in Buenos Aires I'll book in to perfect my new talent :) Thanks a million to Fernando and the horses!

Best part of our trip to Buenos Aires!!!. I can't say enough about our day at Polo Elite. I had never so much as sat on horse, but after an hour, I was playing a game of polo!!! Fernando is a patient and a wonderful teacher. This is a not to be missed unique experience that I plan to do every time I am back in Buenos Aires.

Amazing Experience!. We chose Polo Elite because of all of the amazing reviews on Trip Advisor, and they were all right. Fernando is amazing and the experience was unforgettable. My wife has riden horses for years and taken a few polo lessons, but I had zero polo experience and only some riding experience. Fernando is a clear and patient teacher, and the polo ponies are fabulous. They know what to do! It was a great opportunity to get out of the city and into the Pampas for the day, and definitely great value for the money. It was also fun to meet other travelers and chat with them. Thanks Fernando!

Wow. I've had very little experience riding horses, and I have no natural coordination or athletic ability. So I was nervous about my ability to play polo, but Fernando, our teacher, made it very comfortable and took care of us, so that I could relax. It was also a good pace of learning so that I had time to get used to being on the horse, but then also time to actually participate in a game. It didn't matter that wasn't very good at polo; it was an unforgettable experience and so fun. Besides, it was nice to be out of the city, in the countryside on a pretty day.

A brilliant, worthwhile, fun day out. Don't miss out!. I would highly recommend Polo Elite. I had an afternoon with Fernando and it was a great day. He picked us up in Buenos Aires and drove us to the polo club. We were then shown around and allowed to relax before being given equipment and our ponies. I've had some tuition in the UK and I actually found the things I learned in these few hours more memorable, personally tailored and helpful. The first half of the session was stick and ball, then we had a break with refreshments and then chukkas. Fernando took photos of us while we were playing which was great. We had drinks after the session and we then driven back to Buenos Aires. I thought it was excellent value for money from a great teacher and I fully endorse this as a great day out.

One of the most unique and enjoyable experiences of my life.. You instantly feel comfortable upon meeting Fernando your polo instructor. He Understands the enjoyment of the polo while at the same time, he understands how to properly teach the sport. This is one memory you will soon not forget. No experience necessary dawgzzzzz!!!!!

A very special experience - muy divertido!. Going to play Polo while staying in Buenos Aires was on of our best decisions. We came as a group of three and everything was perfect!Fernando met us at the appointed place and time and we went of to the campo to meet his horses. After a lesson of polo for about an hour or more we took a break to eat lunch and afterwards had a little match which was so much fun! Fernando is a good teacher and his horses are very calm and easy to ride.If you have one free day at your hands you should definitely think about enjoying yourself out in the country this way!

Favorite part of my trip!. You must sign up for a polo lesson with Polo Elite! I am not super sporty and had not been on a horse in years, but Fernando took the time to go over basics and got everyone acclimated to their horse and the whacking of the ball from the horse! The horses are very well-trained and made up for some of their riders' deficiencies. The match we played with the other members of the group was too much fun. This truly was my favorite part of a trip with girlfriends to Buenos Aires and I cannot recommend it to you enough!

Great fun - two hours as a polo player!. A very memorable event at a polo club outside Buenos Aires. We - a Swedish family with three children 14, 12 and 7 years old - really enjoyed this afternoon. You will be provided with all necessary equipment. Just bring boots, camera and some snacks if you become hungry.Try it, you'll like it!Family Lundin from Stockholm

highlight of my South American trip!!. Can´t recommend this enough!! Everything was carried out very professionally and it left me with a huge smile on my face for days. You start with getting used to the horse and the polo saddle and then you practice with the ball and the day wraps up with a scrimmage. I´ve been traveling around South America for two months and enjoying the food, the people, and all the great activities in the cities and rural areas. This one certainly stands out!!

totally recommended -even your teens will enjoy it!. We were a family of 5 with three young adult kids, 14, 17 and 20. We are city slickers, and totally inexperienced with horses. I was a bit apprehensive at the thought of playing polo because of this. I couldn't even imagine riding a horse and controlling the direction and turning the horse whilst holding the reins in one hand and a polo stick in the other. Yet it was something we had never done before so we felt it was worth a try. Even now I am amazed that after just a couple of hours we could all ride a horse, trot and canter, at times even gallop, hold a polo stick AND hit a polo ball at the same time! We even had a little polo "match". We had a great time and it was so much fun!. It was never boring, but very interesting as we were always learning something new. A great learning experience for the kids and adults alike. Fernando our host was very patient, a very good teacher and explained in easy to understand terms how to handle and control the horses. We were picked up at our apartments and dropped back at the end of the day. After the polo session, Fernando also introduced us to all his other horses. Such beautiful animals. The horses were so smart, responsive and well trained. Word of warning....if you are new to horse riding, parts of your body will be sore at the end of the day. Yet... it is worth it. Totally recommended. Everyone will enjoy it.

This was completely excellent - great fun, great instruction and I have a new love of polo!. I would 100% recommend this activity with Fernando. I was a complete horse-riding novice, let alone polo novice, and was keen to get out and get a feel of the famous Argentinian pampas on horse-back. I didn't expect to have so much fun and excitment playing my first polo match within a few hours. Great activity. Not so cheap, but you do get fed and watered, picked up and dropped up really conveniently to your accommodation, get out to the countryside and Fernando is a chilled and ernest host and does have many horses to maintain! A sound investment of time and money and mucho fun!

super fun way to spend an afternoon!. Fernando is a great and patient teacher--we actually learned how to ride horses AND how to play polo in just a few hours! This was definitely the most memorable and best-value activity we did in Buenos Aires. Word to the wise, though--if you don't already ride horses regularly, be prepared for DAYS of soreness afterward.

Best Experience. My husband and I went to Polo Elite while on our honeymoon. Neither of us are experienced riders and yet we had a blast. The instructor Fernando was very clear and explicit. The horses are well taken care of and with a little instrcution we were even able to gallop. That says a lot about the instructor; no real riding experience and yet my husband looked liek an experienced rider by day two. We spent some time going over the basics, practicing and then played a friendly game. We loved it so much that we went back the next day. The following day was even more amazing, as we had already covered the basics we were able to learn new techniques and play a more aggresive game. This is well worth the money and time. It was an experince I will never forget.

Learning to play polo with a pro!. My girlfriend and I went to Elite Polo during our stay in Buenos Aires to try something new (neither of us had ridden a horse before, or played polo for that matter!). Fernando (our teacher) picked us up from the city and took us out to the farm about 20mins out of the city.Given our inexperience, he was very patient with us, and did a thorough job of making sure we felt safe and comfortable on the horses throughout our time on them (which equated to roughly two hour-long sessions). He also provided us with a little snack and drinks afterwards which was great!Overall a massively fun day and one that I will remember for some time - never realised how breathtaking riding a horse at full speed could be!I would definitely recommend this to friends.

Epic. I have never ridden a horse, let alone play polo. I made a spontaneous decision to do so; and I am grateful I did.First, I have profound gratitude to the polo instructor Fernando. Fernando is a professional polo player and an extremely patient teacher. I had no idea what I was doing, I had many questions, and at points I was a bit frustrated. But, through Fernandos guidance, I was able to gallop in less than an hour. The horses are top class. Well maintained, well trained, and well fead. Beautiful horses.After a few hours of ridding the horses and getting the basic understanding of polo; there is a polo match between the students. It was epic. This class is awesome. A must do in Argentina. Edit spelling and grammar. Review was done on iPhone :)

Brilliant, exiting and a good laugh. My friend and I had very basic knowledge of how to ride a horse, so the idea of trying to hit a ball with a polo stick AND riding seemed challenging.However, it was great. Our coach (Fernando) showed us everything we needed to know on his own horse, before letting us get on our own horses. We all had lots of individual time with Fer, and we felt very confident in his teaching. By the end of the day my friend and I were both hitting the ball on a trot, we played a polo match, and won 5-4! A brilliant day out, seeing a different side of the Buenos Aires province, with a good lunch of classic empenadas and jugo. I recommend this to anyone wanting to have a go at this amazing sport.

Brilliant day out with Fernando!. I came across Fernando and Polo Elite when looking on TripAdvisor for things to do in Buenos Aires, and booked onto a day learning to play polo. Fernando picked us up from the center of BA (I had mentioned it to some girls I'd met in Iguazu and they came along too) and drove us out to where he keeps his horses.The horses were amazing and during the demonstration Fernando made it look very easy. Needless to say it proved much harder when we got on the horses ourselves, but was a lot of fun. I also ended up going to a polo match the following Saturday with Fernando and a bunch of other people. If you're there during the season and get the chance to do this, it was an awesome evening . The group of people I met were just fantastic and poor Fernando had to drag us away from the party after the tournament to get us back to Buenos Aires!A brilliant experience that I would definitely recommend.

Just do this, it's a great fun day out. Like so many others that have joined Fernando for a day of polo, my husband and I have no horse riding experience and know nothing about polo. But how quickly that changes! Fernando's horses are beautifully trained and Fernando himself is a wonderful instructor that quickly shows you all you need to know to have a great day of polo. Learning about the game is terrific, it is so much more complex than expected but, after lessons in the basis and time on the horses to practice, you'll then have a fun game and will thoroughly enjoy yourself.We came away from our day, as did our fellow polo players, so excited after our game and keen to watch and play more polo.Our day started at 1.00pm and we were back in town by 7.00pm and we'd enjoyed a light snack and celebratory drinks.For more details see our blog at;http://anexperimentalyear.wordpress.com/2011/06/28/polo-single-seater-open-top-motoring-while-trying-to-hit-a-ball/

Polo: An Argentian Experience!!. Playing polo is probably the highlight of my 3 week trip to South America. Polo Elite is owned and operated by Fernando, who runs his business during the day and plays matches at night. Fernando will pick you up for the center of the city and transport you back to his ranch near the international airport. The event is setup into three stages: horse riding lessons (if you're a beginner), polo lesson, and a finally a match. Fernando will guide you through each portion of the lesson and by the end of the day you'll be craving more time on your trusty steed. The horses are well trained and will respond to your commands on a dime. Fernando himself is a extremely friendly and a blast to be around. He even kind enough to send us pictures of us during our match. I strongly recommend Polo Elite for anyone traveling to Buenos Aires. Please note that the minimum class size is 3 and is obviously weather restrictive. -Mike from Atlanta, GA USA

Great !!!!. My girlfriend had polo lessons before and I never did it, No problem at all, They will fit you right in... It was a great half day spent in Argentina, much better than the regular "tourist" stuff"... I highly recommend for everybody, including those who NEVER rode horses... Thanks for the pictures Fernando.

Awesome experience - not to be missed!. What a fantastic experience! We traveled in a group of 4 people with varying levels of horse riding experience. Fernando our gracious host was so professional and clear in providing instructions to the group and also found time to work with each of us individually. Many thanks to Fernando for being such an excellent and patient teacher :o)Everything about the experience was perfect from the very first email communication to the last where Fernando sent us pictures of us in 'action'. The day itself was seamless - pick up and drop off from down town, lunch provided, 3 separate opportunities to ride the beautifully responsive horses - each time learning more skills, and we were even lucky enough to be able to spectate a practice match on the field (to see what a game should really look like!). We felt a million miles away at this peaceful farm and we were always in good company of the resident dogs and puppies. This is certainly one of my all time favorite experiences

Fun Fun Fun! A fun-filled adventure right outside of Buenos Aires. I had never played Polo before and was unsure of whether to sign up BUT I am SO happy that I did. It was such a fun adventure and Fernando was a great teacher! He was so patient and explained how to ride the horse and give direction. After we were comfortable riding the horses then he introduced the game of Polo and explained how to hit and the strategies of the game. The horses were beautiful and they are his own professional horses! It was clear that Fernando not only loves the game of Polo but loves to teach others the game as well! If I travel back to Buenos Aires I am definitely taking another polo lesson with Fernando !

Great way to try playing Polo. Very well organised and very friendly service. Haven't had any horse riding experience before and could play a short game at the end of the day. The horses are well looked after and are ready for competition. During the breaks we had little snacks and drinks were provided. Transport to and from the farm was also good. Strongly recommended.

A Must for Buenos Aires. Spending the day learning how to play polo was one of the best experiences we've had so far in South America. Riding experience is absolutely not a requirement. Fernando gives you the right instructions so you can let the horse know what you want it to do and feel safe doing it. The horses themselves are well trained and calm but you can tell that if you were a better polo player they would be right there with you. To our utter amazement, we were actually playing a game by the end of the day. There are a lot of small touches, personal touches that make this experience stand out as well. Not only does Fernando drive you to and from the center of Buenos Aires to the farm on the outskirts, but he provides small snacks and drinks. He was a delightful instructor and host, and not a bad photographer (he sent over a treasure trove of digital pics after our outing). This experience is well worth the time and money.

Once in a lifetime experience!. In a word...incredible. The day spent with Fernando and his horses leaves one feeling both satisfied and lucky, and that is because this experience is so much more than simply a polo lesson. The semantics of the day are described well below - $100 usd, easy pickup/dropoff in downtown BA, a glimpse of the countryside, light lunch and drinks provided - which all equate to terrific value. However, the true gift of the day lies within Fernando himself. Fernando is a professional polo player, which means his livelihood depends on his horses. To entrust his prized possessions to complete strangers is a risky proposition, therefore, to start the day, Fernando will teach you how to ride a horse properly. Then you pick up a mallet and learn to hit a polo ball. After that, you learn the rules of the game. And finally, you will play the game. All of this under the guidance of Fernando, who is both a patient teacher and a gentleman. It is evident throughout the day how much he loves both his horses and polo, and it is out of this affection that you form a real connection with Fernando. At the end of the day as you walk off the field, you want nothing more than to get back on a horse and keep playing. Ultimately, you feel fortunate - afterall, you did just get a polo lesson from a professional polo player - and would gladly have paid double for it. This is simply a day that cannot be missed.

Fantastic Polo lessons just outside Buenos Aires. Had such a great lesson with fernando and Polo Elite, from the intitial organisation right down to delivering us to the correct subway station, Polo Elite were very professional and organised. We were collected in a comfortable mini van and transported just out side the city to a very tranquil farm with horses tied in the shade, it was idyllic. We had a super polo lesson with fernando giving each one of us personal tuition. I can ride and he taught me different shots and got me to practise 'ride offs' and stick hooking... for the beginners he spent time reassuring them and they were whacking the ball in no time. The ponies were super well trained... they were responsive for experienced riders and very quiet for the beginners, all very well cared for and in good condition. We finished with a very slow chukka which ended our session. I thoroughly enjoyed my polo experience and would highly recommend this to anyone beginner or experienced rider alike.

Polo? Yes!. We have little riding experience and were intimidated by the idea of learning polo. But after a day at the ranch, with the well trained and beautiful horses we can honestly say it is worth every penny! Fernando is patient and even if your horse just walks it is really fun to try to hit the little ball. And yes at the end of the day we played a match and our team won which of course was also great. We also lucked out because some people played a fun match in the next field. So we could see and admire how it is really done.

A really fun day out.. As an experienced horse person I often cringe when I turn up at touristy horse riding things and find horses that are not well cared for. However that is not the case here. Fernando's horses are well cared for and well trained, they are in fact his own personal polo competition ponies and he lets total beginners ride them... and more amazingly the horses let total beginners ride them. My travelling companion had never ridden a horse before (had in fact point blank refused to ride a horse up to this point) and by the end of the day was walking around hitting balls like a pro (I think all the golf practice paid off in unexpected ways). Fernando's passion for polo is obvious and while the rules of the sport remain totally mysterious to me the polo game at the end was a lot of fun. My only suggestion would be for some improvements to the bathroom facilities and make sure you take suncreen and mosquito repellant.

Great polo lesson and trip to tournament. Polo Elite was one of my highlights in BA. The full day lesson with Fernando was great fun and he was very patient with our poor skills!! He also took us to a tournament a few days later which was absolutely amazing. Fernando was a great host and always made sure we had fun.

Fernando Nieto - An amazing Instructor. This polo class is as good as the ratings suggest it is! This is probably the best value in Argentina. Where else can you get a full day of polo in the countryside for a very reasonable fee!I cannot say enough about how wonderful Fernando Nieto is as a person and a teacher. He represents a true gentleman - he really impressed the entire group. He is a great young teacher, very patient, and very easy to like. Several days after our group played he emailed me six photos he took himself of our group. We didn't even ask him to do this!We had never played before, and had only ridden a horse twice before, but by the end of our day we were all playing on horseback.He picked us up from downtown BA, drove us about 45 mins to the ranch, and had everything all ready for us when we arrived (horses, trainers, etc). His instruction was excellent and was easy for us to follow (he spoke in perfect English). The horses were extremely well trained and cared-for. We had a break - Fernando brought a bit of snacks and beer (!) - and then continued to play. It was a really full day, and we were dropped off back downtown at 8:30 pm. If there is one thing to do in BA this would be it.

A `must do` experiance, worth every penny.. Great day out. The horses are good and Fernando makes sure you get the correct level of teaching from beginner to experianced rider. We had a full, fun day out. You will get hooked! Try to wear jeans or trousers and boots or trainers. Enjoy.
Great trip idea!. Polo was one of the highlights of our trip to Buenos Aires, Polo Elite is a great company who gives incredible value for the money, do not think twice about playing polo!

FABULoUSLY entertaining, WoNDERFULLY priced and most importantly, UNFoRGETTABLE!. I can’t tell you how much my family and I enjoyed Fernando & Polo Elite! We met at a central meeting point in BA, where Fernando picked the small group of us up in a large, comfortable van to make the 40 minute drive to the farm. My dad was injured and unable to play, so for a small fee, he and my mom were able to tag along and at least enjoy the farm with us. I’m totally clumsy and have only been on a horse a few times, so I was nervous, but Fer was extremely patient, encouraging and informative, so my jitters went away. He walked us through the basics of controlling our horses, then gave us time to just ride around and practice stopping, starting, and turning. We slowly worked in riding with mallets and hitting the ball, then took a break and had a few snacks that Fer provided. He explained how polo is played and some of the strategies, then we played our 1st match!Fernando let my sister and I know that a huge polo tournament was taking place over the weekend. He brought a group of us that took lessons that week out to a beautiful estate with gorgeously groomed fields. We got to see 2 professional matches played and even joined in the celebration afterward! It was so entertaining, perfectly priced (US $100pp) and definitely an experience I’ll never forget!! My experiences with Polo Elite were absolutely my favorite activities in Buenos Aires, and some of the best things I’ve ever done on vacation! :)

Made our holiday!. We had a fabulous time on our polo lesson - we wanted to do something different, yet authentic on our holiday and really felt we hit it with Elite Polo. Fernando was fantastic and accomodating, and we felt quite safe - my partner having never ridden a horse on his own, and myself having not ridden a horse for a good ten years. I came out of this with a couple of hours of good fun and a great appreciation for how technical and athletic the game of polo is. We were lucky enough to watch a training session and can vouch that Fernando is a good a player as an instructor! Many thanks - love Kate and Dan

Best thing I'll take away from Buenos Aires. This activity was so much fun and well worth it. I definitely had my reservations as I had absolutely no prior experience in riding a horse but Fernando was so encouraging and patient that he made the experience really enjoyable. The horses are well trained and easy to ride, even a rookie. For $100US (which is ridiculously cheap), we were taken to and from a farm out side of Buenos Aires, given instructions on how to ride a horse and taught the basics of polo mechanics. Fernando even helped explain the game of polo to us including play strategies, which was very interesting. We played a slow-paced polo match at the end of the day which was entertaining to say the least. Fernando took pictures of us playing our match and sent us the pictures he took afterwards. He definitely runs an amazing operation at Polo Elite. In the end, I have so much respect for polo players and the athleticism it takes to play the game.

BEST ACTIVITY IN BA!! 6 STARS!. I can't say enough about Polo Elite. We had a group of 4 with a wide range of riding experience and Fernando was able to match us with perfect horses. One friend only wanted to plod along and she had a blast and still hit the ball well! I wanted to learn more about polo while enjoying being back in the saddle and it was amazing. Great responsive horses and Fernando is an amazing and patient teacher. So easy because he picks you up right in town, drives you to the ranch, gives some quick basic instruction and then puts you right on the horse. After some easy riding you get a mallet and go from there! After a short break we played a match and it was one of the most fun things I've ever done. So glad we booked it, DON'T MISS THIS IN BA!!

So fun, so worth it!. My sister and I are so, so glad we did this! It was worth it even before we got on the horses. The ranch is an excellent break from the city. There were citrus trees, flocks of parrots and cute puppies to play with, which was a treat. Then we got on the horses and it went from excellent to one of our best stories from South America!We had no horse back riding experience and were a little sore the next day, but it was so awesome. We wished the rest of our family had been there, it was probably the only BA activity that everyone would enjoy. I would do it again in a heart beat!

A unique, rewarding, amazing experience. You must do this when in BsAs! It does not matter if you have no experience on a horse, you will learn and you will enjoy yourself immensely. Fernando is a great instructor-very informative, patient and encouraging. He also does a great job explaining the rules and strategies of polo. In my opinion, the best part is the scrimmage game of polo played in the latter half of the day. It was great-the players get into it, the horses get into it and it was a rewarding experience. Due to our positive experience, my husband and I are intent on watching polo matches this summer in our area.

Extremely fun to try Polo and a nice way to see the country side of Argentine. Had a fantastic time. My best experience during my two months stay in Argentina. Felt scary at first but really everybody can do it and you get good instructions and get better quickly. Even if of course one is lightyears away from being a real player.

Must do in Buenos Aires!. Our afternoon of polo began with Fernando (who was very accommodating in scheduling our lesson) picking us up in the city and driving out to the training field. After a short, but well explained, tutorial on horse riding (we are beginners), we're on a horse practicing commanding and galloping. A short snack break while Fer gave us the basics on polo, and we're back on the horse with our polo gear to practice hitting balls with the mallet. A simulated match capped off our incredibly fun and exhilarating day.This was easily one of the best activities we did while vacationing in Argentina. Fernando was great, a very patient instructor and overall nice guy. Highly recommended!

Great fun!. You have to do 1 thing in BA: Tango or Polo. Since i'm not the dancing guy but love animals i choose Polo. And it is a blast. Even without any experience its possible to have fun. I've rode horses only twice but ended up making 2 goals in the final match!

Strongly recommended.... We should have done this earlier in our Argentina tour...Being a competative field sport, polo can be exilarating and fun. The hard part, like anything, is getting over the initial frustrations ..and hitting a ball with a long stick whilst riding a horse can be more difficult than it sounds! With Fernando, the learning curve is steep and he puts his students on horses as soon as possible - this can be a little daunting but it does mean that the frustrating process of learning to control a polo pony whilst attempting to hit the ball is beaten through very quickly. Fernando doesn't mess around and he is a strong and efficient teacher, and it seemed like no time before we were playing a game - charging our amazing polo ponies around with great enthusiasm.The key is good horses, and Fernando's are so responsive and well trained it's almost unbelievable to the unitiated. Fernando pushes his students into playing their first game using all the hooking, pushing and other tactics - a whole lot to learn in a short time, but the sheer competativeness of it all makes the experience great fun.Fernando speaks good English (having lived in the UK) and he explains and demonstrates everything very thoroughly. He is also a great player - inspiring his students as to what is possilbe on a polo pony.

Great Polo outing. What a surprise to ride a horse and learn to play polo and enjoy myself. Fernando made my visit to Buenos Aires very memorable as he was very patient teaching me the skills necessary to actually play a polo match. I was one who did not much like horses but by the end of the day I had a blast and would highly recommend spending a day with Polo Elite.

We now understand why polo can be so addictive. This was great fun. We had both ridden horses only a couple of times before, but Fernando was patient teaching us how to ride, which took about an hour, and the horses were well behaved and did (most of) what we asked of them. Learning the rules of polo, how to hit the ball and the tackling / blocking manoeuvres were very interesting and after an hour's practise we got the hang of it.
