You then have a match at the end, and we discovered what an exhilirating feeling it is to chase after a ball on a horse. After this experience, we understood why polo can be so addictive! Fernando is a patient teacher and he is very keen to share his love of polo with others. The estancia is located in a beautiful location outside of BA and the horses are very well trained. You should not be nervous about participating even if you only have limited experience riding horses. We would both highly recommend this activity.Jan and ZoëCayman Islands

Terrific time !. I don't normally take the time to write reviews but this experience deserved to be the exception. I read about this prior to arriving in Argentina but thought it would not be worth the effort. I have to thank Jan and Zoe from the Caymen Island who had nothing but great things to say when we discussed it on our wine tour in mendoza.Fernando is a very good teacher and the horses are fantastic. So glad i went and is one of the highlights of my trip.

Do Not Miss This !!. Polo ? On horses ? Yes !! What a great afternoon. Highlight of my trip to B.A.Both my friend and I had bad experiences with horses in the past but previous reviewers comments and the desire to try something new led us to sign up. We couldn't have been happier with the experience. Fernando takes you step by step through controlling the horse to the use of the mallet to the rules and strategy of the game so by the end of the afternoon you are playing a polo match. It was a total hoot !Thanks Fernando for a fantastic afternoon of fun in the country.Hint - When you sign up ask Fernando about his "Small World" dinners. If there is one while you are in BA you must go.

One of the most entertaining experience we had in Argentina!!! Highly Recomended.. Having never ridden a horse before I was not sure of what to expect from the day but it was one of the best experience we had in Argentina. A great day out!!!Our trainer Fernando was great,, the horses were incredible to work with, and playing the game was such an exhillarating and fun experience (even for us amatures!). Highly Recommended!!!Mike (Australia)

One of the highlights of our stay in BA. We had so much fun learning to play polo with Fernando. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Argentina, and possibly our favourite activity that we did. There were 6 people in the group on the day we went, and while we'd all been on horses, mostly it was just one or two rides over the course of our lifetimes. Nobody was really confident in their abilities. So at first I wasn't sure that Fernando be able to get us up to a point where we could have a "match" but by the end of the day we were all chasing the ball around the field. None of us could do it at more than walking speed of course, but it was still lots of fun and I felt like I'd achieved something by the end of the day. So don't worry if you're not experienced on horses, just go for it. You'll have a blast for sure. Believe the reviews!
The best attraction of BA. It is a unique opportunity! Do not go to Buenos Aires without doing this tour.

Once in a lifetime chance.... Argentina produces some of the best polo horses and players in the world. Where else can you get such a great introduction to a unique sport. Real polo ponies and an instructor and guide who plays the sport. Fernando is great, he picks you up, gives you great instruction and he is patient. He really wants you to get a great introduction to this game. We had a great time and gained a great appreciation for the people who play this game.

Just do this!!!. There's not much I can say about this experience that hasn't already been said. As of right now, if you search on Trip Advisor for the best activity in South America (not just Buenos Aires), Polo Elite comes up as #1 . It's amazing. The group that went was a lot of fun. Fernando was a patient teacher and very hospitable. He even emailed the group photos of our game a couple days later. You get the impression that he is a guy that loves polo and just loves what he does and wants to expose as many people to his passion as possible. Personally, I didn't have an opinion of polo one way or the other before this experience but I am a fan for life now and will look to play again. It doesn't matter what your riding experience is. There were people in our group who were scared of horses in the beginning but were having a blast at the end. If you are a more experienced rider they have horses to suit you as well. Just do this.

The one thing you MUST do in Argentina. The day with Fernando at Polo Elite was absolutely incredible. I have no experience of horses and was rather terrified on the morning however Fernando was a great teacher - very patient and talked us through everything we needed to know. The horses were very responsive and by the time we got to the match at the end we were concentrating so much on the ball that we'd forgotten that we actually didn't know how to ride at all. Its a shame to write a review as in actual fact this was so good I'd like to keep it a secret..................ENJOY

A great, interesting and fun experience.. Polo Elite is a wonderful, fun, experience. A must to do when you visit Buenos Aires. Fernando is a great instructor and made everyone feel relaxed and eager to ride. You do not have to know how to ride to have a good time. After receiving our first instruction, we practiced riding and hitting the ball with the mallet. Then we had a delightful break with delicious empanadas for lunch. After reviewing the rules of the game, we remounted our polo ponies and played some polo. After "match" , we relaxed over a few beers and reflected over our new learned skill. On the way back to the city, we passed by a local polo club that was playing a game called "Pato" or Duck. Fernando stopped the van and walked us over to the match and explained the game to us, what a nice gesture. When I come back to the city with my family, I am definitely taking them to Polo Elite. Bottom line, even if you have never been on a horse, you can handle this.

Awesome way to spend your day. An absolute must to do in BA. Fernando is a very kind, knowledgable, and fun teacher and host. Two-thirds of our group hadn't even ridden a horse before and we all had a blast. This activity is a great mix of learning something new about a cool sport, getting to get out and try it yourself, and meeting others who have also come out to check it out. Fernando was also great about making sure he found spots for us on the day that worked for our tight schedule. Do it!
Great experience, fun, outdoors, unique, very argentinian. We had a great time and learned a lot about polo and fernando is a great teacher. Far exceeded expectations

The best $100 I spent in Argentina!. Fernando is a former economics professor driven by his passion for polo to start this business. He is an excellent teacher of both horsemanship and the game of polo. I recommend spending a day in the countryside playing polo for all skill levels, ages over 12 and both sexes. Fernando is also a warm and gracious host who will pick you up in a new, clean and comfortable van for your ride to the stables. Fernando's horses are very healthy vibrant yet unbelievably well behaved. After spending the first part of the day practicing your riding the focus turns to polo culminating in a match. Between the warmth of Fernando and the excitement of trying something new, this will be the highlight of your trip. For $100 who could ask for more?Thanks again Fernando!

From "never sat on a horse" to "playing a Polo match" all in an afternoon!!. A fantastic day, out in the countryside near BA. Fernando is a great host and an even better teacher. Having never sat on a horse I was sceptic at first being able to ride at all. Little did I know, I had clearly underestimated Fernando's qualities as a teacher. He explains step by step how to handle the horse and after you are comfortable, he brings in the Polo aspect. Highlight for sure is playing a match with your fellow students at the end of the afternoon! Besides organising polo classes, Fernando also enjoys bringing visitors and friends together at night to enjoy a good Argentinian meal! A fantastic day and evening, recommend to everybody, I would be surprised if you do not get addicted to Polo. Worth mentioning as well is the fact that pictures of all the action are e-mailed afterwards, free of charge. Can't go wrong with this outing!

Who knew you could learn polo in afternoon.... OK - so it's not like I'm an expert but I learnt a lot in one afternoon!! The day was very well organised - a slight mix up with emails nearly meant we missed the day which would have been a huge shame. Make sure you get a confirmation of where you will be collected and don't hesitate to call if you don't! Luckily Fernando and the other guests were kind enough to come back to BsAs a second time to collect us.The 30 mins drive took us out to a polo field just outside of BsAs where 5 of the most patient and accommodating horses I have ever seen were waiting for us. It's not that they were riding schol horses who shuffle along, but they were very good natured in having either non-experienced riders or non-experienced polo mallet wielders on their backs. We had a couple of hours or so getting used to the horses (a different style to english or western saddle riding) and then the mallets. We had a break in the middle of the day for a brief introduction to the rules and then got to play our own little match. Considering some people had never sat on a horse before, all nerves went out of the window when match fever took over and we had a fantastic time!I highly recommend this as a day trip - after all if you are going to try polo once in your life then it has to be in BsAs!!Many thanks to Fernando and the horses - a wonderful day

Most unique South American Experience I have had yet. My sister had told me about Fernando's polo lessons and she set my expectations high - The actual experience managed to surpass them. Fernando's teaching style brought everybody up to speed in surprisingly short order and allowed us to finish the day with a highly enjoyable match. If nothing else, the several hours in which you are able to ride horses makes the trip worthwhile. Further, unlike horseback riding in the states, you are allowed to ride at any pace that you are comfortable. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone.

Fernando Rocks. Learning to ride a horse and play polo with Fernando was probably my favorite event in Buenos Aires. It was my first time on a horse and he got me going. The horses are also amazing. They're not your old retired polo horses but straight up competition horses. Seriously, do this!

Highlight of our South America trip so far. And another excellent well deserved review for Fernando. We had so much fun on our polo day and I can highly recommend this to anyone. Both for experienced- and non experienced riders. Even people with no prior experience were galloping and playing a match at the end of the day. After the match we joined Fernando and his friends at a parilla restaurant in Bs.As. which was also great fun. If I am back around I would definitely go again! Worth every peso!

What a fun day!. A really unique experience in Buenos Aires! We had a great time. Plan on a full afternoon, we didn´t get back until 8:30 pm that night. We all met up for dinner afterwards which was nice.

The best day of ´my year off´. It hard to write how amazing this experience was and truely was the best day i have had during my year of travelling. Fernando´s hospitality, knowledge and horses make this the best polo experience. I have been riding all my life although had no polo experience.....this was something i have always wanted to do. Fernando put everything so simply, explaining everything to ensure we all managed to get to grips with the basics. The day ended with an entertaining mini polo match followed by some refreshing beers...... I returned to BA on a total high!!!! I have already found somewhere to continue lessons back in the UK and am totally hooked on polo - a testoment to Fernando´s enthusiasm and fantastic teaching skills. I 100% recommend this to anyone in BA - with your without much riding experience.

Fun and unique experience, definitely the highlight of my stay in BA. Fernando is a great teacher and very informative in terms of both polo and Argentine culture in general. Five hours of polo for that price is a remarkable bargain; ill definitely be visiting again next time im in Buenos Aires.

Great day of polo - event for beginners!. Company picked our group up from Buenos Aires and drove us to an amazing ranch to play polo. Instructor and facilities were top notch - we even got pictures sent to us by email after our game, which was free of charge! Worth every penny.

A Unique and Outstanding Experience. I was looking for something unique to do in Buenos Aires with a couple of co-workers and learning polo definitely fit the bill. After some research and finding the previous write-ups for Polo Elite we set up a private lesson with Fernando. We communicated solely via e-mail until the afternoon we met. Everything was exactly as he had stated. I personally hadn't been on a horse in over 20 years but Fernando's instruction was impecable. His dedication and passion for polo shines through and we walked away with a great appreciation for the sport, some sore legs, and a huge smile.

Amazing experience in Buenos Aires!. While I was living in Buenos Aires for two months, I started playing polo with Polo Elite. Not only was this the best experience I had in Argentina, but it has inspired me to continue with the sport, and I now play back in England.Fernando is a good guy, and very professional. The transport to and from the club is great, and drinks and snacks are kindly provided while there. The club itself is a nice place and the horses are all very well looked after, with a good polo community there, so you get the chance to watch some very good players play.Now, the important thing: The polo. The horses are incredibly trained and are great for beginners with no or little riding experience, but were equally as good for someone with quite a bit of riding experience, as they are Fernando's playing ponies and as a result are great! The lessons are good fun, with Fernando teaching you all the basics of the game, from the main swings to the rules of the game. Topped off by a mini beginners' chukka, this is as good as it gets for an introduction to polo.The trips to see the games are also highly recommended, and there is nothing better than lounging in the Argentine sun with a Fernet - Cola watching a game of polo on the weekend. Again, Fernando deals with transportation, so everything is covered. All you have to do is enjoy!For value, the lessons and the games are great. Everything is provided for you, and transport and snacks are included. For the same price in the UK, you would be lucky to get much time on horseback, and would learn nowhere near what Fernando shows you.A great trip.

Fantastic way to spend a day learning to play polo in Buenos Aires. Probably the funnest afternoon I had in Buenos Aires. This is more or less an all-day event (We were picked up at 3 pm and got back around 9:30).Fernando will pick you up somewhere in Buenos Aires, and you'll drive about 40 km out to the Polo Elite ranch. Never ridden a horse before? No problem. You'll spend the first part of the day learning to handle the horse. The horses are either remarkably well-trained, or Fernando is great teacher (or most likely, both), and you'll quickly have the horses responding to your slightest movements. Following your initial practice on the horse (which I imagine is very short if you're an experienced rider. I am not), you'll take the mallet in your hand and practice hitting and controlling the ball. If you're like me, the first time you try to direct the ball down the field will seem a bit daunting, but everyone seems to get the hang of it after a few passes up and down the field.Next up is a break (for you and the horses) with an explanation of the rules of the game. Then it's time to hop on the horses so that Fernando can demonstrate the basic rules and maneuvers of polo in practice. Then, time to play a match. If you're like my group, who generally had little experience with horses, the match is more entertainment than competition. Fernando plays the ref and continues to comment on rule violations and strategy throughout the match. Finally, once the sun starts to go down, it's time to give the horses a rest and toast a few beers before being driven back to wherever you need to go.The experience was a lot of fun, and I learned a great deal about horsemanship and polo in just a few hours. Fernando is very knowledgeable and entertaining and caters the class to everyone's experience and desires. He can also teach the class in Spanish, English, or both if you'd like. Go do it!

Polo Elite - highlight of the trip to BA!. I can't say enough about Fernando and Polo Elite. What a great experience! The club itself is a lovely drive outside of town and a nice respite from the noise and traffic in BA. Fernando responded promptly to my emails and the day was very organized. He is a great and patient teacher, which is great because polo is a LOT harder than it looks. There was a mix of experience in the group with respect to riding, and Fernando managed it all really well. The horses are super mellow - so no worries there. Added bonus - you will be enthusiastically met by a great group of dogs when you arrive (but they'll leave you alone if you ignore them) - as a dog lover, I was in heaven! I would highly recommend attending a polo match with Polo Elite. We weren't able to, but others in our group were and said it was fantastic.

There's a reason why this is consistently rated #1.... ... it's an absolutely fantastic way to spend a day out of the city!This was the highlight of my trip to Buenos Aires. The polo club is actually very close to the airport (EZE), so Fernando drove us directly there afterward (as we had a red-eye flight to catch). He's a great instructor, with a lot passion for the sport, and patience for inexperienced players like us!The horses are all impeccably trained, so do not be concerned if you have no previous riding experience. Polo Elite is worth every penny!

Fernando & Polo: A Perfect Combo for an Unforgettable B.A. Adventure!. Who knew that learning to ride a polo pony and getting enough rudimentary skills in the sport to actually play a “match” could be one of the most exhilarating activities of my life? Apparently, all of the folks who left comments on Trip Advisor about excursions with Polo Elite, and I’m so glad I took their recommendations to heart. My husband and I booked a day with Fernando a few weeks before arriving in Buenos Aires. Out of all of the activities we had planned, I was most looking forward to polo; I am a horse lover from way back, and the idea of actually learning about and attempting a sport few tourists have access to was very compelling – a unique opportunity for something different.The day did not disappoint – in any way! Fernando met us and our three fellow adventurers at the appointed time and destination. Within moments of meeting Fernando, we were all at ease and talking about our travels and our excitement for the day’s events.On our way out of the city, we had an introduction to another unique event in Buenos Aires: protests that closed a major highway down. Taking it in stride, Fernando explained this interesting cultural phenomenon as he found another route to the stables. When we arrived, Fernando started our polo education by introducing us, sans horses, to what we should and should not do once we were astride. Next he demonstrated on horseback the skills he would later ask us to practice. Then, we were introduced to our “assigned” horses and were given plenty of time to get comfortable riding and handling the reins. Some of us had ridden before, and some of us had not. Fernando was a great teacher with us all, and his horses are so well-trained that even the first timers were having fun in no time, practicing the skills that Fernando had demonstrated. Next we were given the mallet and shown how to properly strike the ball; Fernando then gave us time to practice moving the ball up and down the field in an attempt to make a goal. It wasn’t long before I had fallen in love with the action of the sport; it was a challenge to maneuver the horse, coordinate that with use of equipment and keep physical and mental balance. But more than anything, it was just purely exhilarating! My husband, who had only ridden twice before, was thoroughly enjoying it too.After quite a bit of practice time, we all took a break, then we were back on board to learn the rules of the game and try our newly acquired skills in an actual match. I have never had so much fun! As the only female rider that day, and a competitor at heart, I was determined to put in a good show, and Tango (my horse) and I certainly found our rhythm that day. Through it all, Fernando was an excellent teacher and coach. He made sure that horse and human alike were well cared for during the activities of the day.I can’t write enough about what a great time my husband and I had spending the day with Fernando, our fellow travelers, and the polo ponies. It is an experience I will never forget and one that I would recommend to anyone with a hankering to try something different, yet so quintessentially Argentinian. Thank you Fernando! Stephanie and Arne (Kansas City)

An exciting and completely unique experience in BA. My sister and I had a fabulous time learning polo with Fernando! We were a little worried because neither of us has any real experience with horses, but Fernando was very patient with us, and we were totally fine.. The horses are very gentle but extremely responsive, and they are actually competitive polo horses which made the whole experience that much better.. It was a totally unique experience for us and its not something we could do at home. We both had a great time and would definately recommend doing this for anyone who is in BA! Thank you Fernando!

Best Polo value going. Great horses, staff, and club.. Polo Elite is the best way to experience Polo in Argentina. Fernando is a great teacher and you really can't beat the value and the introduction to the game. Having played a lot of Polo in the states, I find myself wanting to go back to Polo Elite for the truly authentic experience. It's a great way to experience the culture and learn all the polo basics in one fell swoop.

Awesome, fun, an excellent time and a great way to spend a day in BA. We spent two memorable days with Fernando in Buenos Aires. He arranged the tickets and accompanied us on a beauftiful Sunday afternoon to the Argentine Open quarter finals at Palermo. What a terrifc time we had, soaking up the sunshine and mingling with the polo set. The atmosphere and setting was superb. The polo was exciting to watch. The following Wednesday, Fernando transported us to his polo club's practice fields, about 45 minutes outside BA. We thoroughly enjoyed a polo lesson, lunch and a couple of chuckers. Fernando's instruction was great and his ponies extremely well behaved. Overall it was great fun and both days were among the highlights of our trip to Argentina. You definitely don't have to have ridden a horse before but after a polo lesson with Fernando you will become hooked on polo and will want more.

Best part of our Trip to Buenos Aires. A little odd to meet a stranger at a designated location in a foreign country for a car ride to his polo ranch, but we meet a bunch of people who where waiting with us and my wife and I had a great time. We both have ridden before, but there were complete beginners in our group as well. It was so much fun, especially the mini-match at the end of the lessons. Our team won, ha... By far the best experience in Buenos Aires!

Absolute must do experience in BA. Getting the basics of Polo and even do a little match if you are up to it is THE best experience in BA I think. You are outside the city on a ranch, seeing the guys taking care of the horses. It's a different BA. And you know you are in Argentina and Polo = Argentina right?  I could ride a horse at all, but due to Fernando's instructions I managed quite good. Playing or trying to play the game :) afterwards was excellent fun. If we return to BA I would definitely do this again.

A highlight of my trip. A fabulous, affordable, excursion from the big city of Buenos Aires. My friends and I accompanied Fernando to a polo match. It was a superb day and a highlight for all of us. We are sailors and I describe it this way: think Royal Yacht Club but with expansive lawns and ponies instead of an ocean and boats. The match was exciting - you don't have to be into horses to enjoy the sportsmanship and excitement of the match. Fernando, a polo player himself, was a great host/guide and was able to explain all the rules to us. It didn't hurt that the champagne and single malt scotch was flowing after the match! I recommend this to everyone who visits Buenos Aires.

Absolutely amazing trip!. The trip was more than we could ask for! Everything was completely in order and Fernando was so nice and very organized. I was in Argentina for a month and I can honestly say the trip I took with Fernando to the polo game was one of the best days I had in Argentina!

Fun and unique experience!. My husband and I visited Buenos Aires this past December 2010. The day at the ranch, playing polo with Fernando, was one of the highlights of our trip. It was a truly fun and relaxing day. Fernando is a brilliant teacher, has a lot of knowledge on the subject of Polo and is very patient with beginnners. For anyone visiting Buenos Aires, this is a must do!!!

An amazing experience that shouldn't be missed.. My wife and I had an incredible time learning polo. Fernando is a really nice guy and an excellent instructor. When we booked the lesson we were nervous since we did not have much experience riding. But there is no reason to have reservations. It was a great day. Safe and fun no matter what your level of riding is.

Fantastic! Brilliant fun this was the best thing I did in argentina. Really good fun, you learn theory in practice rather than having to waste half the day sat in a classroom. I have always wanted to play in England but Polo tutoring over here costs 4x the price, not to mention in Argentina you are getting tuition in the country that is indisputably the best in the world, the best players, the best horses and so it goes without saying the best tuition! If I ever go back to Argentina I will definitely have some more lessons it was one of the best things I have ever done and you should not miss it from your trip.

Best part of our Buenos Aires trip!. Our beginner's polo lesson began by coordinating with Fernando (the instructor) via email about two weeks prior to our arrival. About a day before our lesson I received another email with details on where to meet in Buenos Aires (near the center of town). My two sons (both 13) and I met at the designated place at 2:30 pm where Fernando and about four other people who signed up were waiting for us. We boarded a nice van and drove to a club about 45 minutes outside of town.When we arrived Fernando provided us with all the needed gear and rules for play. Given the number of people, he broke the group into two to give enough personal attention. Later, we played a game.We even took a break midway and Fernando had cookie snacks, juice and water ready for us.Fernando is a great instructor and even if you have never been on a horse you will find it to be very easy.A trip to Buenos Aires is not complete unless you sign up for this!This is a must do.We finished the day with a toast to Fernando's great teaching skills and Buenos Aires.We all boarded the van and were back in downtown Buenos Aires by 900pm.The cost was $100 per person.

Most fun on horseback. Playing and learning polo with Fernando was great fun. My partner was not originally booked on the lesson, but when we asked if he could join the day of the lesson, Fernando was more than helpful in accomodating for him. They originally had no spare horses but Fernando went to the trouble to find and borrow an extra horse for us from a polo friend. My partner had never ridden before and although he was originally frustrated with the difficulty of trying to steer, hit the ball and learn to trot/canter all at the same time, he had great fun and really enjoyed playing the match at the end. Everyone got really into it and made a great ending to a great day. Apart from being eaten by misquitoes at dusk!!!Highly highly recommended!!!

Quintessentially Argentinian - Polo playing. Where else would you be given a top class polo pony, and a mallet and be permitted to whack your way up and down the pitch?Fernando gives instruction in horse handling and hitting the ball, then the match begins. We'd been very carefully and calmly learning the basics and getting the feel for it. But when the competition was on he was encouraging us to barge, hook sticks and really up the ante, it was so much fun. I wouldn't say that we ever got fast and furious, with players of limited riding experience the pace remained in our comfort zone, but we did get the thrill of the sport.Well worth adding to your list of uniquely Buenos Aires experiences.

Amazing trip for all experience levels. In one word, wow! Fernando was one of the most patient, polite, and hospitable people I have ever met. From the moment he picked us up to the moment we were dropped off for the night, the group was all smiles. We arrived to the place to practice polo and it was an amazingly peaceful place removed from the hustle of the city. The horses were very calm and even the three people with no riding experience had no problem with them. Fernando taught us all how to ride the horses, the basics of how to hold our polo mallet, everything we needed to know to have a great time. The horses all belong to Fernando and he has really raised them well. They are well taken care of and he taught us how to ride without making the horses nervous or uncomfortable.After our practice time and a little rest and refreshments, we played a match between all of the participants. Fernando helped one team, but didn't overpower anyone, the experience was all about us. Everyone had a chance to score a point for their team and we ended the evening with a cold beer.The trip back was tricky since there were strikes going on in the area, but Fernando made sure we got back to Buenos Aires without any problems. The whole experience was top notch and I would most definitely recommend this trip for those who want to experience a part of Argentina, away from the tourist traps of the city.

Even I learned to play. I could not ride before attending the Polo Elite lessons, much less use a mallet. However, Fernando is a great teacher and the horses are well trained. Polo is such a part of the culture in Argentina. This is truly a cultural, fun and unique experience. I recommend it.Emily from Los Angeles

Relaxing Day Trip to Watch Polo. I highly recommend hiring Fernando for anyone that would like to watch a (nearly private) polo match, eat excellent steak, and drink Argentinean wines. It is a great chance to do something “different” outside of Buenos Aires. Fernando was a great guide-- he is friendly, speaks fluent English, and even allowed us to ride his horses after the match. Alex New York, NY

great fun. Fernando is a very good instructor, and that makes you feel confident, which is very important since we only rode a horse once. He is dedicated and makes the most of it, even on a very warm day (38 degrees C). The horses are very reliable and the match gave us great fun. There were cold drinks and cookies and the sun set was in orange colors. The end of a very special afternoon! Thanks Fernando, from the dutch couple.

Great afternoon playing polo in Bs.As. Countryside. We had a great afternoon playing POLO in Bs.As. countryside with Polo Elite. There was a basic introduction about horse riding, it´s adequate for those who have and who haven´t ridden a horse before.

Awesome day!. We had a fantastic afternoon learning how to play polo with Fernando. As a horseriding novice, I expected to struggle but after only a little instruction, I was cruising around hitting balls with no problems. A couple of cold beers out at the field put the icing on the cake to a brilliant day!

Best fun on four legs. Polo Elite is a fantastic, unique day out. The instructor, Fernando is an excellent teacher who explains the technical aspects of riding, and the tactics of polo very clearly. After a brief instruction, I was riding and hitting a ball with no previous riding experience!It's a half day activity, a short drive outside BA. After learning the basics, the horses get a rest before you put your skills together in a game. Highly recommended!

Never thought I would be playing polo. This is a great day out - an absolute highlight of a 3 month trip in South America.Where else in the world can you play polo as an absolute novice?Fernando was fantastic, picking us up, giving us a quick lesson and then letting us loose on his horses. He loves his polo and has set up a fantastic operation.Tthe horses are very good. Previously I have only ridden stubborn trail horses. These horses go where you want them to, and go quickly. Amazingly they chase the ball. It was a thrill just to ride these horses around the polo field - even before the ball was introduced.I'd highly recommend this. A truely great experience.

Polo Elite was a highlight. Cannot believe that just yesterday we were having a great time with Fernando. He is a wonderful teacher and will make sure that even novice riders (me) are comfortable and have fun and more experienced riders (my husband) also enjoy the activity. My husband said that it was one of the highlights of the two trips we have made to Argentina in the last 18 months. You will not be disappointed.

An absolute must!. I have been to Argentina and Buenos Aires 3 times. I rarely repeat going to the same place so I hold Argentina in high regard. With that said, the day I spent with Polo Elite was not only amongst, if not the best while in Argentina, but one of best in all my travels in the past several years. It will be something I will remember for a lifetime. Fernando is a friendly person with great knowledge of the game and I had a wonderfully trained horse that knew it had a novice on its back. Do yourself a favor and check this one out.....its a blast!

Great day out - not to be missed!. This is by far the best thing I did in Buenos Aires - absolutely worthwhile. Great fun, lovely part of the country and a great Polo experience. No riding experience necessary and although I do have some the horses are so unbelievably well trained it made it a fantastic day out. The instructor, Fernando, was an expert in guiding beginners and very patient and also a great conversationalist to learn more about Buenos Aires and Argentina! Don't miss this experience if in BA...

Fabulous day in the countryside at a polo match with polo elite. A group of four of us had a wonderful day with Fernando at a Polo match in the country. Not only was Fernando an excellent host but many of the people at the club made a point of introducing themselves and asking where we were from. The horses were beautiful, the players skilled and the match fast and exciting. The ever present asada was available as were beer, wine and champagne. Lots of time before and after the game for mingling and enjoying the vibe! Thanks, Fernando.

One of the best days out in BA. Whether you know anything about polo, or can or cannot ride, you should do this trip! Fernando is an excellent coach, he splits the group up so that there is more 1 to 1 tuition. He gives good instruction as to how to get the best out of the horses and shows you the different types of swing and how and when to use them. The first part of the afternoon is getting used to the horses and practising your swing. The second part is Match Time!Fernando gives a basic run down of the rules and will blow the whistle on you if you foul (especially if you cross the line - never cross the line!!) The match is so much fun! People who were nervous at the start are scoring goals, and people who were tentatively hitting the ball are now chasing after it!All this is followed my snacks and beer - what more could you want?The horses are in excellent condition and are very responsive, so for those with a little more experience can go a little faster. And the club is beautiful so if you are not riding there are a myriad of horses and dogs to talk to.I went twice, and would have gone many more times if I didnt have to leave BA. If you do one thing while in BA, play polo. It is the best place in the world to do it!Fernando also takes groupos to see polo matches. Argentine polo is the best abd fastest in the world so well worth seeing. He explains the rules and answers any questions you have about the game. A very knowledgeable guide!

Great experience. I had a great day trying out polo. My friend and I where picked up in town with 5 other people. The group was a mix of experienced and beginner horseriders. We learned the basic about riding polo and got to play a match against each other. I would strongly recomend this tour. Our guide Fernando was great. A few days after we also went to see a real polomatch with him and a bunch of others.Pia, Denmark

Polo for everbody. It was an amazing experience. The guide picked us up in Buenos Aires and we drove to this beautiful ranch with a lot of horses. After a short introduction to the sport, we got our horses. I've never seen such good trained horses - they do what you instruct them. First, we just ride the horse to learn to know each other. In a second phase Fernando learned us how to handle with the racquet. In a third phase he let us know the rules of this interesting game. Finally we made a game and all the learned knowledge could be used. All in all we were about 6 hours on the ranch and had a nice finish with a cool beer.Definitly on of the best eperience in Argentina!

A super experience which was extremly enjoyable. Having very little experience of horse riding I must admit that I was a little apprehensive when we arrived at the ranch and saw the collection of very well maintained horses. However Fernando gave a brief introduction to riding and explained things clearly. We then were split into 2 groups of 3s and waited as the first group were shown the tricks. This was useful as it gave the second group a chance of looking on. My only reservation was that it would have been nice for all of us to get on the horses together as we were a small group. Nevertheless I was given a beautiful horse and had a great afternoon riding and learning how to play polo. I may not have picked up half of the rules/ skills but really enjoyed it and would love to do it again. After a short rest we played a game which whatever it lacked in skill on our behalfs was made up for in fun. We were treated to a beer afterwards which was a nice touch and then were dropped off at our hostal. Fernando clearly loves the sport and his enthusiasm was infectious! We then joined Fernando on a trip to a private polo match which was another highlight of my trip.

Awesome!. Friend and I did a Polo lesson through Polo Elite. Was pretty good. Got picked up at 11am and dropped off around 5pm that night, lunch of empinadas was included as well as soft drink and water. There was only the two of us and one other guy so the lesson was quite one on one. I had zero to none experience riding horses... but Fernando gave a very detailed lesson on how to ride and it worked out ok!The horses themselves were very good and quite easy to ride. The Polo Lesson was great fun, definately no expert and came off it all pretty sore, but it was definately an experience!

what a wonderful day. We spent a wonderful day outside of Buenos Aires. Beside of good shoes and jeans you do not need anything (even riding skills is not necessary). Who can believe, that after a couple of hours, you are able to play polo (more or less :-))I would definitely go once again, if I had the opportunity. The instructor is very well organized and transport from/to the city is arranged.

Do like the Argentinians do - play Polo!. We had a great day playing Polo with Fernando. At first, my 14 year old daughter was quite reluctant to go, however she did admit that it was one of her favourite days we spent in Buenos Aires. Thanks Fernando for a great experience and the wonderful photos!

Best chance to access real polo. Polo Elite gives a great chance to be able to access real polo. I have visited Buenos Aires twice and done a session with Fernando on both occasions. He´s a great host and talented at coaching and encouraging you through the unfamiliar practice of swinging and hitting a ball whilst on horseback.Inexperienced riders can go at their own pace and the horses are lovely to ride. More experienced riders (me) can progress to hitting the ball while the horse is moving faster . . . I wasn´t allowed to this in a more ´snobby´ polo lesson that I tried in England.When I am in Buenos Aires again, I will be back to Polo Elite.

Great fun outside the city. We had a fantastic day learning to play Polo with Fernando. The horses were very understanding for beginners to the sport (and indeed beginners to horse riding itself - we had some in our group but it did not matter at all), although they did at times require a little persuasion to pick up speed. The 8 of us split into two groups for the lessons and then played a game at the end. Manchester were thrashing the 'Rest of the World' team until Fernando helped them out! It was a great day and other than being bitten by mosquitos later on in the afternoon I cannot fault it! Fernando is a fantastic teacher and very friendly.Fernando also arranged for me to go and watch a proper Polo match a couple of days later so that I could see how it SHOULD be done - much faster and more skilful than any of our efforts!

A fun and memorable afternoon for all experience levels. I came to Buenos Aires with no intention to play polo, but several fellow travelers recommended Polo Elite as a great experience, so I decided to give it a try. I had no prior riding experience, and I certainly wasn't a natural talent at the sport, but it was a wonderful afternoon nonetheless - certainly one of the best things that I did in Buenos Aires. Those with riding experience progressed the fastest, but Fernando was a great instructor for all of us. Plus, it was a great get-away from the city! I'd certainly recommend Polo Elite.

Super Fun!!. We booked this for the last day of our honeymoon and had an amazing time.Fernando collected us in his really nice car and drove us to the ranch where he provided a basic picnic lunch and quick pep talk before meeting our ponies.Then we were slowly mounted on our horses and instructed on how to hold the reigns and crop before heading out to the field. First we learnt to co-ordinate body, arms and leg movements for effective turning - which is very important when you miss the ball as many times as I did. After getting to grips with this we tried walking and trotting around without falling off!!! Fernando was great and didn't take offence at our comedic efforts. He then introduced the mallets and we practised hitting the ball up and down the field without hitting ourselves or the horses!Little break - when the impressions of John Wayne appear - and then match time.As my husband and I had paid for a private lesson it was Husband V Wife. Studpidly I expected my husband to be nice as we'd only been married two weeks, but once we reached 4-0 to him Fernando came to my rescue and we ganged up on hubby. I still lost as Fernando mearly helped and encourged me but the final 6-4 wasn't too shabby. ;)He then drove us back to town were we nipped on the subway to the hotel, showered and changed and then meet Fernando close to our hotel in the afternoon to go and watch the professionals play a match. This was a fantastic afternoon out hobnobbing... and we even got to watch the highlights that evening in bed on ESPN!All in all the day was amazing... I cannot fault a single moment. Although - I do wish I had warmed up a little as it's now 4 days later and I'm still aching.

Great afternoon riding horses and swinging a polo stick at a ranch.. What better place to learn polo than Argentina? It was great to get out of the city for the afternoon, head into the countryside and canter around on a polo field trying our hand at hitting a polo ball. Fernando picked us up in his van along with an English couple. The four of us watched Fernando as he gave us the basics of the polo swing, then mounted our horses and went up and down the field hitting the ball. Fernando was a good teacher, showing us bit by bit how to twist in the saddle, hit the ball with either side of the stick etc as the afternoon went on. After a short break we were ready for a match - Australia versus England. We played on one end of the field and scored 10 goals between us so lots of fun was had by all. Fernando joined in too. He drove us back to our hotel by 7.30pm. We were on a high from being out in the fresh air on horses and learning something new.

AWESOME TIME!. My husband absolutely LOVED playing polo with Fernando of Polo Elite. This was definitely the most fun day tour we did in BA! I have several years of riding experience, my husband not so much...yet we both had a fantastic time. Fernando is the best of hosts and we could not have enjoyed him more! The sport is much harder than I expected it to be, but we were still able to learn the basics and have a lot of fun in our afternoon of polo. Definitely a MUST DO!!! Plus, the people we met from all over the world were also truly awesome!

A great experince for riders and non/riders alike. This was a grat day trip from Buenos Aires, it was a good all round combination. Fernando was a great host and the group of people on th day were all thre to have some fun. The horses were safe and well trained and both those who had ridden before and those who hadn't all had a great time. Definately a must do activity.

Polo is great. My girlfriend and I spent two weeks in Buenos Aires. The highlight of our trip was certainly the Polo game. My girlfriend has years of riding experience and I have none. Yet, the game provided equal entertainment, enjoyment and fun for the both of us. Despite having no riding experience what so ever, I was still able to contribute to the game. The instructor, Fernando, provided great information about horse riding and the actual game of Polo. As well, Fernando could always be counted on to go above and beyond when helping. This experience is a must for Everyone. And the Price is more than a fair deal.

Polo with Fernando - Can't Be Missed in Buenos Aires. On my recent trip to Buenos Aires, we carved one day out of our 4 day stay to spend learning polo with Fernando - it was such a wise choice. Despite never having ridden a horse before, we had such a fun day learning to ride and the fundamentals of polo. Fernando was a great instructor (though he made things look too easy!) and there was never a dull moment. The highlights:- Getting to see a little of the Argentina country side (not just the city) without a long drive- Feeling comfortable and safe throughout the day, despite little to no previous experience- Laughing all day long with my friends as we try to play a polo match at a walking paceBest of all, the experience was well worth the cost. Unlike the tours we did in Rio that cost $60 USD for an hour on a boat, we spent the entire day with Fernando at a very reasonable price, including lunch and snacks.

Polo Elite...actually polo for the people. I am in the fortunate position of working in Argentina on a 28/28 rotation and therefore can take my time sampling the various attractions on offer here in BsAs. I am really interested in taking up polo when I am back to the UK (we live a few miles away from Taunton Vale Polo Club, 2nd oldest in the UK), so I started looking round TripAdvisor for ideas.I wanted something that was a fun introduction to the sport, not too serious or elitist. So I was really happy when I found the current Number 2 of all BsAs attractions here on TA is Fernando Nieto of Polo Elite, with a lot of reviews suggesting he would be ideal. A quick email and a phone call and we were all set up for a private lesson.Fernando arrived at my hotel in Microcentro in his new Hyundai people carrier exactly on time (he is always punctual.....BsAs traffic allowing). We headed to the Tristan Suarez Polo Club out past the international airport (a journey that takes around 45-60 minutes). When I arrived, other club members were having a few practise chukkas and it was immediately clear that this isn't a glossy showcase operation, but a true slice of Argentinian life. I immediately knew I had come to the right place. Everyone is really friendly and welcoming and are happy to show you their great sport. I have had a few lessons now and have got to know some of the regular players and the head grooms Andreis and Umberto. Fernando got into polo 3 years ago and is currently a 2 goal player (although I suspect he could be higher). This, plus his excellent english, easy going patient nature and the fact that he has also until recently been teaching graduate and post grad business students, makes him a very good ambassador for polo. As others have said here, the school ponies are incredibly patient, they are very tolerant of a beginners faults, yet they can also show as much speed as you can safely handle and are ideal mounts. To the reviewer who was a bit uncomplimentary, I have used one of Fernandos personal ponies and its like passing your driving test and being given the keys to your Dads Porsche...amazing acceleration and incredibly responsive....but also not a place to be making mistakes (you wouldn't want to fly home in a plaster cast with a big medical bill would you?)You will have a great day out that is relaxed and a lot of fun. After some empanadas and a Quilmes you will get dropped back to your hotel having had a great day out of the city, a bit tired, happy and probably in need of a soak in the bath, having woken up muscles you didn't know you had.I can thoroughly recommend Fernando and Polo Elite; he is a great ambassador for polo and Argentina and he deserves a 5+star rating. I wish him every success in developing his business.

The most fun you can have with a pony and a stick!. I did a lot of activities in BA and this was the best one! The Instructor speaks excellent english and is very friendly. The ponies may look a little shaggy in their winter coats but they are so well trained and fun to ride that the two non-riders in our group had a great time, they even scored the goals! Polo is especially easy if you play golf or hockey (or anything involving a long stick and ball), and the more experienced riders will love the challenge and darting around the pitch on the ponies. One tip - bring insect repellant and apply it towards the end of the afternoon as I got bitten to death by Mosquitoes (non malarial) in the early evening!

Fantastic experience - A Must do for all !. Had a fantastic day playing polo in Buenos Aires.It was very well organised. The afternoon was broken up into learning the moves on horseback, which was great fun,a break for refreshments and then a polo match, all in all a great day of activities. Fernando was a very talented instructor,very patient and really made the day fun for everybody both beginners who had never sat on a horse before, to those more experienced riders. Would highly recommend this has a must do activity for all.The trip didn't end on the polo field, it was back in the van to BA for apres match celebrations! A fun packed afternoon was enjoyed by all!

Great time for beginner Polo Players. My husband and I had a great time playing Polo for the 1st time ever! Fernando was so patient with us and we laughed a lot. This is probably best for beginners because we were all new to the game and went at a good pace. By the end of the day, we played a match which was the best part. The transfer out to the ranch and back were very easy and in a comfortable van.

Well recommended. My boyfriend and I played polo the same day as Jane2703 below and we agree with everything she said! Fernando was very well organised and the horses were excellent with beginners (it can't be easy having an inexperienced rider on your back swinging a polo stick near your feet and head!! But they didn't bat an eyelid at anything and seemed very relaxed). Just go and enjoy a great afternoon!

Best experience of our BA trip. As always, fellow reviewers of Trip Advisor did not fail me. I booked polo with Fernando prior to traveling to Buenos Aires based on high ratings on TA. Our trip to BA included my sister, two nieces, and my daughter. My brother-in-law grew up in BA so my sister and nieces have traveled there many times. Although they were my tour guides, they had never heard of Polo Elite. We all had a fabulous day with Fernando playing polo. He was professional and responsive to my multiple e-mails prior to the lesson. He picked us up at my sister's apartment in BA in his new van. After picking up 4 more passengers (lovely British college graduates traveling for a gap year), we drove 45 minutes out to the polo farm. We were all impressed with Fernando's efficiency and certainly his patience with us. Of the 7 people taking the lesson, one had never been on a horse before. The rest of us had various ranges of riding experience. Fernando separated us into two groups and efficiently explained the basics of riding and polo, then we were off to the field for some practice. After our lesson, Fernando whipped out beverages and snacks, then we all mounted again for our brief game of polo. The game was the most fun for our group. Even the first-time-rider, who took a couple of spills during the lesson, relaxed on his horse and got into the spirit of the game. The horses are a bit tired (but why would they use young spirited horses for masses of tourists and beginning riders). Fernando was such a wonderful teacher and professional. He followed up via e-mail the day after our experience with a kind note and pictures he took of us during the game. The cost was very reasonable for all included (transportation, lesson, game, beverages....). I would recommend Polo Elite to any and all traveling to BA.

Fantastic Buenos Aires experience. I cannot recommend Polo Elite highly enough!! Fernando is absolutely fantastic! We were picked up from downtown Buenos Aires and driven about an hour out of the city to a beautiful Estancia. Having never ridden a horse before, I was a little aprehensive and didn´t expect to play much polo. After a short demostration by Fernando, I was on horse back and 15 minutes later, I had a polo stick in hand. We spent a lot of the afternoon riding up and down the polo field hitting the ball along as we went. After a lovely afternoon tea of coffee and biscuits we split into teams and played a game of polo. Just when I thought it couldn´t get any better, Fernando cracked open a bottle of Quilmes (the local beer) to celebrate our game.The whole day was incredibly fun! Such a fantastic experience...in fact, I plan to do another lesson when I come back to Buenos Aires at the end of the year.In my opinion, this is a compulsory Bs.As experience...Tango & Polo!

Never laughed so hard in our lives. Despite the name of this company, you probably will not be an elite polo player by the end of your day of polo. You will have had an incredible time, however. In the course of 5 hours we got the basics of horsemanship, the techniques of polo, the rules of the game, and then had a brilliantly fun match. Fernando is a patient, knowledgeable instructor and a great host. Highly recommended to anyone travelling to BsAs.

Awesome- best part of our trip to BA. Myself and 3 friends booked a day with Polo Elite based on Trip Advisor reviews. We were not sure what to expect, and some of us had never been on a horse before, but our worries soon went away after Fernando got us on the horses and started the lesson. He was very patient and extremely nice. I can't say we were the best polo players for sure, my horse even got annoyed with me for being too slow and decided to plop down for a rest, but it was just so much fun learning to play and then having an actual match. My friends and I are a pretty competitive bunch and noone likes to lose- we were hooking, nudging, and whacking that ball as best we could. At the end of our trip we all thought it was the best experience we had during the trip, largely in part to Fernando and his patience and general amazing-ness. He even took pictures during the match and sent them to us after. We heart Fernando and Polo Elite!

Fantastic day out! A very special experience.. Based on Tripadvisor reviews, we booked this activity before arriving in Buenos Aires. Fernando was very helpful keeping us updated on the timings and options, in the end we had a private lesson and day out. Fernando arrived spot on time at our hotel and navigated the challenges of BA traffic to take us to the polo terrain (approx 45 mins). There are 2 polo fields and during the day there were experts practising polo. There is plenty to observe with people working on the farm.Unlike lessons in England where you spend the first hour standing on a crate learning to swing the mallet, you get kitted up and on a pony in the first 10 mins. You familiarise yourself with the horse, then try to balance use the reins and whip with your left hand before graduating to the holding and swinging the mallet. Fernando is very patient and you can go at your own speed. After practising there is a lunch of empanadas followed by a mini 'match'. Fernando explained the rules and we battled it out with lots of hooked sticks and being ridden off the ball. In our case, it was not the sport of kings, but we had great fun. We had a great day out. Fernando was a wonderful host. Recommend to all looking for an active day in BA!

Met great people and had a fabulous time!. I arranged this outing on a whim and Fernando of Polo Elite did everything to make it a great experience.I wanted to see a polo match, but it wasn't the season. I was convinced to try a polo lesson along with two other novices and we had the greatest time. The horses were perfectly suited to teaching us, and we got to play the slowest-paced match in the history of the sport after our lesson. Give this a try, see a little of the country around BA and warm up your mallet arm!

Absolutely fun!!!. Just came back to the states from Argentina. Took polo lessons from Polo Elite. Had so much fun on the lesson especially during the game. While we were practicing and going over handling the horse there was a polo player who was training his horse. So amazing. You get an appreciation of how difficult it is to play the game. Fernando, our instructor, was fantastic. Spoke perfect English and the rates were affordable. I would highly recommend taking a lesson if you will be traveling to Buenos Aires.

One of the BEST experiences during our BA adventure. Usually when my fiance, Ted and I travel, we keep an open ended itinerary allowing us to explore on a whim as we feel....Polo Elite was the only activity we absolutely wanted to lock into prior to the trip and our experience far exceeded any expectations we had.Fernando from start to finish was extremely professional, patient and knowledgeable- it would not have been the same experience without his presence.Ted and I have both gone trail ridding many times, but add a whip, mallet and open field, definitely game on! The experience was well divided to familiarize us all w/ each of the components we'd need to know to play an actual game- we first spent time on our horses in the field riding around, getting familiar with them and them us. Next part was introducing the mallet and the proper technique and rhythm to hitting the ball. We practiced this up and down the field with Fernando constantly encouraging us and engaging every one in the game. After a short break, we put it all together and actually got to play a game. First team to score 6 wins....sounds easier then you think, especially after Fernando showed us the defensive moves of the game- hooking, blocking, etc. and remembering there are also rules! Ted and I have already discussed our next visit to BA in the summer and talked about returning for another opportunity to have some fun with polo.It was definitely an experience I would hope everyone could have, one that you do not want to miss:)

What a fabulous day--don't miss it!. Seven of us decided that a trip to Argentina would not be complete without polo lessons. We had a blast! Fernando wanted a deposit and that made me a bit leery, but I had nothing to fear. He and his father picked us up at our hotel and we drove a looong way to the farm. He gave us a quick overview of the game (his English is very good!) and we were outfitted with helmets, polo mallets, whips and ponies (although I do use that term loosely). We were divided into two teams and he patiently helped us learn a few basic techniques. After a break with some really good empanadas, we actually played a match. We laughed and laughed but also worked hard. Fernando took photos of us playing and e-mailed them to us afterward. After the match, he had some beverages (including beer), before the ride back to Buenos Aires. It was great to get out in the fresh air, learn something new and make a new friend. The price is fair for the day of riding and polo and I would to it again. Don't miss it!

A brilliant day out in BA. Our day at Polo Elite was up there as one of the most enjoyable excursions during our whole 3 month South American trip.Fernando was brilliant - very professional, very prompt with all communication (flawless english) and the whole day ran very smoothly.My husband and I had ridden horses several times but I would still say that we were complete amateurs, but this wasn't a problem at all. The horses are amazing (I'm not sure how I wasn't bucked off after hitting my horse in the head on many occassions with the polo stick, but the horse didn't even flinch!). Fernando is an excellent teacher / coach and the highlight was putting our 'training' into practice with a game at the end of the day. Lots of fun!!!A great day out and we highly recommend it!

A True Argentine Activity that One Should Not Miss. The Polo Elite members work hard to organize a relaxing and exciting day for anyone who is interested in learning how to play polo. From horseback riding instructions, to one on one polo lessons, travelers are guaranteed a special experience. After a fun day in the saddle, lunch and beer are provided for those who wish to sit down enjoy the refreshing countryside surroundings. Once recharged, the students have the opportunity to TRY to play an actual polo match. Needless to say, it is as hard as it looks, but absolutely invigorating. Please don't miss out!

Polo Elite Es Lo Mejor!. As a Texan who has had some time on a horse I wasn't sure what I was getting into with a Polo Lesson. Fernando was great! He gave us thorough instructions on how to handle the horse, the polo stick and the rules of polo. He was calm and patient with us. I highly recomend this. It was great to get outside the city and spend time with horse and country!

AMAZING EXPERIENCE!!. This was one of the best things that I've ever done!! They pick you up in Buenos Aires and drive you to the Polo Field so you don't have to worry about getting there. Plus, they speak English, so for those of us who are novice spanish speakers it creates a more hospitable environment where you don't have to worry about the language - and they are extremely friendly!!! Once you get there, you first practice riding the horse so you feel comfortable and then they teach you the proper way to hit the ball. I've gone horseback riding before but never played polo so it was alittle intimidating trying to lean over to hit the ball but after five or six times you get the hang of it. Once you do, all you do is get better and better and by the end of the experience you feel like you could play in a match. But, if you're lucky, like I was, you'll get to see a real polo practice/match afterwards and realize that you've just scratched the surface - those guys are incredible!!! It's amazing to me - after trying it myself - how fast they're able to go and still be able to hit the ball without falling off. Once again, this was one of the best things that I've ever done and I would highly recommend it to anyone who was interested.

Experience I will remember my entire life!. Fernando was a very gracious, patient teacher. From the greeting at our hotel to the final drink at the bar, he was the best host money could buy. He was very patient with our group of seven, giving tips and encouragement the whole way through. The empanadas we had for lunch were the best I've had so far in South America. At the end of the day after our match he had beer for us; awesome! I would recommend this trip to anyone wanting to experience the fun and excitement of polo. Fernando was great, I couldn't have asked for a better day.

A perfect day. Our day at Polo Elite was definitely one of our favorites on our trip to Argentina. Fernando was a wonderful, patient, teacher. We had an absolute blast and I could not recommend this adventure any more. This is a great experience for non-horse folks as well as experienced riders and a fantastic way to be exposed to a true Argentine sport. Do not miss this one!

Great time in Buenos Aires. We were in Buenos Aires for several days and wanted to get out of the city for a few hours. Reading that polo is most popular in Argentina, we decided to give it a try. Polo Elite was a great experience, made us comfortable and we got to play a match- with virtually no horse-riding experience. This is a feal find in Buenos Aires, recommend it highly.

A fantastic way to experience Polo in Buenos Aires. You will want to visit them more than once!. We were in B.A for two weeks, and had a lot of fun using 'Polo Elite'. We actually visited them two times during our stay. The instructors are very professional, the horses and the gear are very good and the prices are not bad. It is a small company, which means that you get personal service and the feeling of playing Polo with the locals.The Polo Club is sorounded by endless fields and beautiful scenery.As we stayed in B.A for two weeks, we got to see a lot, and the polo playing with 'Polo Elite' is one of the activities I will reccomend the most. Polo is a sport with a lot of tradition in B.A and a great activity for every turist. You can look at pictures of graveyards in recoletta on Google when you get home, but Polo has to be experienced. Be carefull. You will want to visit them more than once!

A BA Highlight!. I´d had a few Polo lessons a couple of years back, but after my day with Polo Elite I felt compulsed to take it up again and this time seriously...a great day away from the busy city of Buenos Aires and ultimate cure for the hangover...Fernando structures the 4 hour lesson, with breaks, perfectly - a bit of one to one tuition, good drills and a fantastic game at the end between the players to cap off a great afternoon. Great thing to do with mates, my arms were dead at the end of the day, you don´t waste time hanging around! Only thing preventing it from being excellent is a lack of high calibre ponies, you need to show alot of whip!

The Best Day Ever!. My friends and I were in Buenos Aires for a week in May and after reading all of the wonderful comments on TripAdvisor about Polo Elite, I contacted Fernando and set up a day of polo. Fernando and his dad picked the 5 of us up at our hotel in Recoleta and drove us out to the country for what was by far the best day of our entire trip! We had all been on a horse before but were by no means experts. Fernando was great about making us comfortable on our horses before our actual lesson began. We spent the morning learning the basic techniques of how to play and by lunchtime we were having so much fun. Fernando was so patient, which I think helped us all pick it up faster.We went on a Wednesday so after lunch we were able to watch the local teams play a few matches which was so exciting. We sat right on the side of the field and after 2 matches Fernando had us get back on our horses so we could play our own game. We had so much fun and really got into it. Nothing beats playing your first polo match with the sun setting in the background!My only regret is that we didn't have more days to go back and play again. I highly recommend Polo Elite to anyone looking for something different to do while visiting Buenos Aires. If I ever make it back to Buenos Aires I will definitely be contacting Fernando for another amazing day of polo!

Fernando was fabulous! So much fun!. Playing polo with Fernado was fantastic. We had so much fun. He picked all 9 of us up at our hotel in downtown Buenos Aires and drove us out to the farm. First, we took an hour lesson in two smaller groups. The horses were fantastic and Fernando did a great job of accommodating our differing skill levels. It all culminated in a short game. Fernando's English is fantastic and the ride through the country was beautiful. He even sent pictures the next day. I highly recommend Polo Elite.

Amazing fun-even for total beginners. If you´re in Argentina you should totally try the quintessential Argentinian sport. We all had so much fun and everyone was really friendly . I´d recommend it to everyone-even if you´re terrible you´ll still have great fun.

Great fun, reviews are accurate!. Bring strong mosquito repellant if you have some (Fernando had some but i think the mossy's loved my blood abit too much and ate me up even through the repellant)However it was still a absolute blast! Fernando was very patient, the horses were great, although as we were all absolute beginners, we ended up having very slow game (i think my horse knew it couldn't go fast as when it started it must have felt me falling off so it stopped).but yeh learning to ride the horse was great fun, then learning to have your hands full with everything whip and reigns in one hand, polo stick in the other.. learning the swings from half to full swings.. amazing experience we wouldn't have even thought of doing without the reviews. and a thorough and FULL respect to all the polo players making it look so easy!.. its a hard game and Fernando gave us a great intro!.
Great day out. Great fun even for people with Zero riding experience - bring repellent as there were quite a few mosquitos when we were there

Highly Recommend for a Fun Day Outside the City!. 3 friends and I were down in BA and were lucky to discover Polo Elite through other traveler reviews on Trip Advisor. Our day with Fernando at Polo Elite was the highlight of our trip. We were picked up at our hotel and driven to the farm, where we had our lessons and then our own Polo Match ! We were lucky to be there on the day when there was an actual match, which was great to see. Fernando is incredibly patient and excellent teacher. My friends and I were total beginners and we had a great day. I highly recommend this to anyone vacationing in BA. It is a wonderful day!!

Polo in one day. I joined the ranch last January and had a very nice day out. The atmosphere in the countryside is so relaxing! The pololessons weren't too hard and at the end of the day we played a real polomatch and beat the instructor!! Real fun, lovely horses, woul do it again when I visit BA!

Best idea EVER!. We found Polo Elite through Trip Advisor, and thank GOD we did! They had only been listed for a week, but Fernando and his team of perfectly trained horses showed our small group the best day of our entire trip. It was very affordable, and amazingly fun! I had ridden a horse maaaybe twice in my life, but the horses knew exactly what to do, and the experience will never be forgotten! Thank you Polo Elite!

It's really a nice experience. Polo is not a common game in Brazil, so in Buenos Aires I could try it once. There's a big place with some polo fields and a lot of horses for playing. The lesson started with horse riding tips and practice: how to guide them, how to make them run and slow down. Them we practice with the Polo sticks, hiting the ball all over the field - not so easy as it seems!! And we finished with the game. Really funny! I had a great time learning and trying to play Polo! You just need to wear confortable clothes, take the camera if you want to take nice pictures, and have fun!

A must do when in BA. A group of us wanted to get out of the city and do something different--playing polo sounded like the perfect fit. Fernando was amazing. He picked us up at the hotel, got us set up on a horse, and then spent just the right amount of time teaching so that we could play a match. Don't worry if you haven't ridden much. If you are reasonably athletic, have a sense of adventure, and willing to laugh at yourself when you mess up, you will have a great time.

Best place to experience Polo in BA!. I am just about to complete my fifth and final lesson at Polo Elite and I am thoroughily looking forward to it! Polo Elite caters for all levels and most of the people who go have never played polo before and some never riden before, but Fernando is a great teacher and everyone who I've ever met there has had an amazing time and are soon riding around and hitting balls like naturals. Its a very fun and laid back atmosphere making it a perfect afternoon activity to experience whilst in Argentina-the mecca of polo! I would highly rate this!! It is a very affordable way to try out the sport, and the club has an excellent atmosphere, great facilities and lovely horses! I'll be very sad to be leaving!

Best part of Argentina. On a recent trip to Argentina, a small group of us wanted to learn to play Polo. With a little homework we found Fernando Nieto's Polo School. The experience was far above my expectation and his accommodating nature made it very easy. I have never ridden a horse so I was obviously very uneasy about the whole thing. but, Mr. Nieto was not only a great coach but a good teacher. My uneasiness was quickly settled by his practical teaching methods. Aside from the learning of Polo, Mr. Nieto's fun loving countenance made the experience a blast. I would highly recommend a day of learning Polo at Mr. Nieto's School of Polo.

A taste for Argentinian polo. I had the pleasure of experiencing what it is like to play polo in Argentina with Fernando and Polo Elite. I am an experienced rider and was impressed with the amount of time in the saddle and the horses. There were two beginner riders with us and the horses were great "school-masters".The highlight for me was the game we played at the end. I was so stiff the next day, but it was totally worth it and it remains one of my best memories from my month long holiday in Argentina.
great experience and a lot of fun!. fernando is great and so patient with new polo players.

First Polo lesson GREAT experience. We got picked up in BA right on time and taken to the polo field. The horses were nice our instructor Fernando was a great instructor and extremely pleasant. We received one hour of lesson then a break then another hour in which we played a bit of a match. The experience was so fun I would love to do it again and again.

Great day out. Had a polo lesson with three friends with Fernando of Polo Elite in May. Two of us (the guys) had never ridden a horse before, but we managed to have an awesome day. Fernando speaks pretty good English and was able to get two absolute no-hopers moving about on horseback with relative ease. The girls enjoyed themselves too (mainly because they were laughing at us). It's decent enough value for money, and a great day out if you fancy something different and a bit of fresh air. We'd all recommend it.

Awesome experience!. I must confess I was a little afraid of the whole Polo thing since I am not much experienced with horses (every now and then I try to fall down from one) so imagine handling the stick and the wipe and the horse and keep the eye on the ball, all at the same time.Well, my training was so good that in the end I wasn't even worried about being on top of the horse - they are super nice and if you do the commands the way the trainer teaches you, it is super easy.And the game itself is fun! I really had a great time learning and trying to play. Never thought I would do such thing - I am happy I did and def would do again.

So far my best Sunday of the year!!. Perfectly organized, in a lovely places with nice horses, playing polo with Poloelite is the perfect way to spend a Sunday in Buenos Aires.No need to have experience in riding horse, the Polo Elite guys are great teachers!Have fun :-)

FANTASTIC!!. Could not rate my polo lesson with Fernando highly enough. He is an excellent instructor and the ponies and facility were top notch. I'm an experienced rider and I wanted a proper lesson as opposed to something touristy. It was everything I hoped for and I'm continuing with my interest in polo now that I'm back home.
Jodi, New Zealand

Best day I had in BBAA. Once you are in Argentina you simply gotta try the national sport! I loved this experience which I could not have found anywhere else! I spent a whole afternoon trying to learn the basics of this fun sport and enjoying the horsebackriding at the same time with a great instructor. After my lectures I also got the opportunity to watch the local pros in a training game - gosh it is such an impressive and energetic game! Furthermore as the ranch is a bit outside of BBAA you get to see some of the very nice landscape surrounding the city! Muchssimas gracias Fernando!

A brilliant and 'value for money' experience. Our day of polo was absolutely brilliant, quickly being taugt the basics and moving on to have a little game. However, it was Fernando who made the day and i can't speak highly enough about him. It was so good we had another lesson and went to a match with him. He was truly professional but most importantly he was friendly and helpful. Would do it again and again and again. Cheers Fernando!

Great experience, Fernando was a great teacher would definetely recommend it!. Great day out. Polo lessons were great fun, Fernando was a really good teacher and we even managed to watch part of a polo match as well.

once in your life time experience!!!. This was an incredible experience for someone that never had a prior horse riding experience. Fernando is very thorough and detailed. It's a great way to start appreciate the sport of polo. Escaping from the city for one afternoon is great.

Once in Your Lifetime!. An absolute must in BsAs!! My husband and I trekked Big Ice at the glacier, stood near thousands of penguins, and rode across the pampas with gauchos on our trip to other parts of Argentina BUT NOTHING compared to our polo lesson with Fernando!!
