When we returned from vacation, THIS is what everyone wants to hear about!Fernando provided a pleasant ride from our hotel, pointing out the sights and answering all our questions in very good English. He varied the lesson based on our ability to ride and was an excellent, patient teacher who was always very encouraging. He thoughtfully provided much needed cold drinks and cookies midway though and even took a video of us with our camera, complete with insightful commentary and encouraging cheers!The horses were very well trained and an absolute joy to ride! So smooth and they knew what to do even before we asked! The polo club was quiet and beautiful - we could have sat there for hours, just basking in the sun, peacefulness, and many hawk-like birds flying around.This REALLY is a MUST DO!! A once in your lifetime experience- full of laughter, a sense of accomplishment, and plain old fun- that you will always remember and treasure!

Fantastic experience. We visited Fernando 1 year ago and had a great polo experience on an estanca not far from BsAs. Everything was perfectly arranged, we had a pick-up and return service by car from the hotel and drinks and food were plenty available! Fernando is such a nice and helpful guy, even back in the Netherlands, we still keep in touch! I can defenitely recommend Polo Elite if your looking for an authentic non-commercial polo experience!! It's part of a great culture, so go there and enjoy!

So Much Fun! Fernando was Great!. My friends and I got a polo lesson from Fernando and it was a total blast! He picked us up at our hotel (was right on time) and drove us to the polo field. Then he gave us a basic lesson on how to ride before we mounted the horses. Some of my friends had no experience on a horse, but I own one (although I've never played polo) so he matched us to a horse that fit our skill level. He had us practice walking and cantering the horses until we felt comfortable. Then he gave us a lesson on how use the polo sticks and we practiced hitting balls while mounted on the horse (usually at a walk or trot because we were just getting the hang of it). Then, he taught us the basics of the game and we played a game. It was the most fun I've had in a long time! Fernando was a great teacher and so patient with us. Really a generous guy with his time and knowledge. I highly recommend it. So much better than a boring day of sitting on a tour bus. Have fun!!

Made my dreams come true. I have ridden for many years and only discovered polo as a sport in the last couple of years. I had wanted to learn but it was prohibitively expensive. So I was surprised to find that we could learn, on a backpackers budget, in the home of the sport in Argentina. Fernando was incredibly helpful, picking us up from downtown BA, and taking us to his club. It was incredibly enjoyable watching his team practice first (as it was Sunday) - giving us a taste of what we should be doing. Then we were on the horses and started our lessons. It didn't matter that my partner was a non-experienced and nervous rider. We started our lessons at a walk, and pretty soon, my partner and I were concentrating on the ball rather than the horse. This means the horse just goes to where you want - including chasing after the ball when they see it. They are also so bomb-proof - they don't care about getting hit by the ball, or a stray mallet or charging into each other. Our NZ versus Argentina matches were also fun - and a really good way to learn the rules of the game, even if it was at a walk most of the time (don't worry you can go as fast as you like). Would definitely recommend Fernando, and his team at polo elite for a great day or few days in BA.

This was a lot of fun, and a great way to spend a day in Buenos Aires. After five days of stuffing our faces and throwing down drink after drink in the Buenos Aires' restaurants and bars, we were looking for some fun outdoor activities. A private Polo lesson was recommended to us by one of the local bartenders. This turned out to be a perfect way to spend the afternoon. Half of our group had only been on a horse once or twice before, so the name Polo Elite was a bit intimidating at first. Our teacher did a great job of walking us through the basics though, and by the end of the lesson we all felt very comfortable. At the end, we were divided into teams, and played a game. After our game, we got to see some of the semi-pros who belong to the club play. They were amazing!! It gives you a whole new perspective on how good these guys are.I looked up prices for a Polo lesson in San Diego to see how the price compared. The lesson at Polo Elite in Buenos Aires was about $100 cheaper, so it is definitely a good price.

Definitely Take Lessons from Polo Elite. I was in Buenos Aires in December to visit a buddy from New York, who now lives down there. We wanted to experience as much of the culture as possible. We saw an ad for Polo Elite in one of the hostels and just had to do it. This couldn't have been a better idea. Fernando picked us up at the hostel and drove us to La Tuna ranch, so we didn't even have to find transportation. We had never tried polo before, but Fernando is a great teacher and was very patient with us. We spent the whole day at the ranch. When we weren't on the horses knocking the ball around, we got to watch some pick up games that Fernando and his friends played in. That was cool, to see how the game is actually played, close up. All the guys were very friendly and willing to help out some Americans. All in all, for this price, you can't beat this experience. Luckily, while I was in town, it was the week of the largest polo tournament in the world and Fernando invited us and others to the game. This was amazing! Fernando provided us with, not only a ride again, but knowledge of the game so we could follow it. The game was incredible and we even got to meet some of the winning players after the game. I am now a fan of Polo thanks to Fernando and Polo Elite. I highly recommend it. I still keep in touch with Fernando.

Great Experience. Polo lessons was a great experience in Argentina. Fernando is a patient instructer who teaches the ins and outs of polo. The staff is very friendly and very accomodating. Lot of fun and definitely worth it.

Fun & Challenging Polo Lessons Done Right!. First and most importantly Fernando is a great guy. He speaks great English and he is very knowledgeable about Polo as well as Argentina. We didn't waste anytime sitting around. Fernando gets you right up on the horse and teaches as you go. The ranch, gear, horses and field are all top notch. If it's your first time up on a horse it is definitely a challenge, but so much fun! I had a new found respect for Fernando and other elite polo players after my afternoon of lessons.I will be back!

Favorite experience in Buenos Aires. Fernando was an excellent teacher. The only thing better than his English was his abililty to teach all levels of riders and Polo players. I would highly recommend this to anyone. Definitely worth the price.

Best afternoon in BA. Playing polo in Buenos Aires was absolutely the best thing I did there! It was made very easy for us tourists: we booked the whole thing from our hostel and the Fernando came to pick us up, took us to the polo club, held the lessons and in the evening took us back to the hostel. First we learned how to hit the ball and then we played a little match. Our teacher Fernando was very good advicing us. This took the whole afternoon and evening so I didn´t consider the price (300 pesos) expencive. The horses were in a good condition, some of them a bit fisty ;) I really want to go back there some day to learn some more polo!!!

Polo Elite: best Polo crash-course in metro Buenos Aires area. Fernando Nieto of Polo Elite organizes a very friendly and thorough polo clinic 30 minutes outside of Buenos Aires. Transportation provided from and back to midtown Buenos Aires. Perfect for beginners looking to learn polo fundamentals and basic theory. Classes held at picturesque 'La Tuna' farm which is host to the Tristan Suarez Polo Club. La Tuna's staff are highly-accomodative and will pick the horse best-suited for your level of riding. Typical estancias in the Buenos Aires charge over $2000 a week to learn/practice polo; Fernando's classes are truly amazing value for those looking to focus on polo and enjoy a day out in the countryside.

A fantastic experience at a reasonable price. This was one of the best days i had whilst travelling around the world. Fernando who runs the polo course was fantastic; very helpful, a great teacher and will tailor your day to what you want to do. I had never played polo before and was confident by the end of the day. Towards the end we played a match which was great fun. The horses were magnificent and really well looked after too. I would reccomend this experience to everyone i know (and have to many)-even if you arent confident on a horse or have never ridden because Fernando will teach you in no time. And the price is extreemly reasonable too-compared to playing in England or even having a basic horse riding lesson in England, this is far cheaper. So, yeah, get involved, you will love it!

An absolutely incredible time. The guide / coach was a gentleman, who was genuinely helpful with any query at all. I had two both fun and informative lessons, followed by a day at a professional polo match at a beautiful country club.I'd definitely recommend this as an experience, definitely don't miss out on polo in BA, and Polo Elite is an efficient, honest, friendly, family run affair, I'd go with them again.
